title: Cinzano Extra Dry Vermouth
description: Fresh, dry, fabric-like and yeasty scents emerge from the glass. The palate entry is fresh, sinewy, lean and mineral-like; the flavor becomes even more dry and minerally at midpalate. Squeaky dry and utterly refreshing.

title: Monarch Vodka Extra Dry/Double Charcoal Filtered
description: Nosing finds solid grainy aromas with a touch of charcoal. The palate entry is smoky sweet and pleasant. Good for the price.

title: Campari Bitter
description: The nosing passes find earthy/woodsy scents of brambles/vines, moss, forest floor and stones. The palate entry owns a unique tree bark-like taste that's oddly attractive; the midpalate stage features pungent flavors of ashes, roots, quinine, honey, citrus peels and earth.

title: Mount Gay Barbados Sugar Cane Rum
description: The pleasant bouquet is sweet and candied with delicate touches of oil and mild spice in the last nosing pass. The palate entry is sweet and milky feeling; the tongue is coated at midpalate with sugary, chocolaty flavors; a nice milky quality in the mouth. The finish is long, sweet and honeyed.

title: Mount Gay Eclipse Barbados Rum
description: The nosing passes find soft sugary/molasses smells and aromas of marshmallow, almond paste and light toffee. The palate entry is slightly smoky and properly sweet; tastes of honey and vanilla extract are found at midpalate. The finish is smooth, soft and very drinkable. A well-made molasses-based rum.

title: Kirkland Vodka
description: The anemic bouquet offers only a fiber-like scent with some feeble notes of cardboard/parchment. The palate  offers substantial flavors of semisweet grain, fructose, spice in a silky, medium-bodied texture. Finishes assertively.

title: Bocchino 15 Year Old Grappa Riserva della Cantina Privata
description: The bouquet features bakery-like scents, apple butter and fiber. The palate entry is focused on soy sauce, ginger, lanolin and nut butter. At midpalate the tastes turns resiny, heavily baked and a little bit citrusy. Concludes astringent, yet sweet and sour.

title: Blackwood's Vintage Dry Gin
description: The lackluster bouquet offers minor spicy, vegetal and biscuity notes. The palate entry improves with creamy tastes of grain mash, heather, stone and green vegetable; the midpalate is semisweet, clean, slightly minerally and gently junipery. Finish is textured with harmonious flavors of juniper, angelica and honey. Hendrick's Gin admirers will like it.

title: Monarch Gin London Dry
description: The nosing passes find grassy/root-like botanical notes with juniper a mere distant echo. The palate entry is intensely grainy and almost bitter; an oily sturdiness in the midpalate improves the taste phase. Finishes tight, chalky, mildly floral, and a bit too heated. Needs more juniper and some angelica added.

title: Old Forester 2006 Birthday Bourbon Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey Distilled Spring 1993/Bottled 2006
description: The bouquet features a delightful corn aroma with additional scents of sweet oak, charcoal and palm oil. The palate entry offers graceful tastes of honeysuckle, light honey and hard candy; at midpalate there are succulent waves of bacon fat, bacon rind and caramel corn tastes. The finish is succulent and semisweet.

title: Maker's Mark Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whisky
description: The base aroma is buttered corn-on-the-cob with aeration bringing additional scents of vanilla and cinnamon. The palate entry showcases sweet breakfast cereal grain; at midpalate the corn dominates so thoroughly that you know that this could only be one of the best straight bourbons from Kentucky. Ends spirity and heated. One of America's benchmark spirits.

title: William Larue Weller Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey 2006 Antique Collection
description: The somewhat indecisive bouquet emits wonderfully odd, even incongruous, fragrances of parchment, allspice, hemp and bitter green leaf vegetable. The palate entry is incredibly luxurious, deeply honeyed and nutty; by midpalate the taste is succulently toffee-like without being oversweet or gummy. Finishes deep, very full-bodied, chocolaty and cake frosting-like. Add mineral water before tasting.

title: Canadian Club Classic 12 Year Old Blended Canadian Whisky
description: The bouquet features deep notes of butterscotch, nougat, almond paste and light vanilla. The palate entry offers succulent flavors of almond paste, candy and oaky vanilla; the midpalate is woody, caramel-like, with hints of dried yellow fruit, white pepper and spice. Finishes balanced, sweet and oaky.

title: George T. Stagg Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey 2006 Antique Collection
description: The nosing passes find dry, cardboard/parchment-like and biscuity/grainy smells. The palate entry is heavy, honey sweet and moderately oaky; midpalate features flavors of pork rind, bacon fat, nougat, walnut paste and chocolate-covered cherries. Finishes with huge waves of sweet oak, sweet corn, and dark fudge tastes. Add mineral water before tasting.

title: Michter's US 1 Small Batch Bourbon Batch No. 6G-1
description: The bouquet has a dry, grainy aroma which is accented by peppery/spicy scents. The palate entry is surprisingly sweet and corny, considering how dry the aroma is; the midpalate point is deep, corny sweet, sap-like and a bit syrupy. Ends up well and balanced, with a backnote of dried red fruit (raisins, prunes).

title: Lichido Liqueur Blended Vodka & Cognac with Lichee, Guava & White Peach Juices
description: The delightful bouquet features an enticing blend of tropical fruit and lichee, with the white peach emerging following aeration time. The palate entry is softly fruity, tart and clean; the midpalate is fruit-fleshy in texture, rounded in taste, and has just the right amount of alcohol, acidity and fruitiness. Ends peachy, guava-like and delicious. Racy, stylish and fun.

title: Limoncello di Puglia Lemon Liqueur
description: The pleasant aroma offers a tart, lemon zest scent in the opening sniffings and then turns waxy after aeration. The palate entry is bitter, citric acidy, and extremely tart but then turns richly lemony and hard candy-like at midpalate, providing a good balance between the lemon, the acid and the alcohol. Ends up supremely lemony and astringent.

title: Luxardo Il Maraschino Originale Cherry Liqueur
description: The bouquet is lovely, balanced, properly astringent, ripe and juicy with scents of cherry stone and cherry juice. The palate entry is decadently sweet and textured with vibrant tastes of cherry compote and cherry preserves at midpalate. The finish is svelte, moderately syrupy and downright delicious. An outstanding liqueur: use it in an Aviation Cocktail.

title: Monarch Canadian Blended Whisky
description: Nosing detects aromas of cooked corn, charcoal, palm oil, butterscotch and light toffee. The palate entry is sappy, honeyed, and pleasantly sweet; the midpalate showcases maple, honey and caramel. Ends up clean, focused and maple-sugar sweet.

title: Dr. McGillicuddy's Cherry Schnapps Original Formula Liqueur
description: The nosing passes detect animated and bitter scents of cherry stone and cherry fruit with the fruit emerging more after aeration. The palate entry is ripe, sweet, moderately stony/mineral-like and deeply cherry-flavored; by midpalate the taste profile has gone over completely to the ripe cherry juice sweetness. Finishes gently sweet and concentrated.

title: Wild Turkey American Honey Liqueur
description: The nosing passes find distant scents of honey, baked bread, and corn meal. The palate entry is pleasingly balanced and not the least cloying; at midpalate the flavor profile features integrated tastes of honey, spice and lemon zest. Finishes clean, balanced and very enjoyable. The citrus element nicely counters the honey and the bourbon.

title: George Dickel No. 8 Tennessee Sour Mash Whiskey
description: The nosing passes find scents of lanolin, textile fiber and fireplace soot following early smells of wax. The palate entry displays toasty flavors that wrap around core tastes of dried fruit and nuts; the midpalate stage reveals the waxy quality first detected in the opening bouquet.

title: Finian's Five Provinces Blended Irish Whiskey
description: The nosing passes find scents of dry breakfast cereal with subtle scents of black pepper and soy sauce. The palate entry is stone dry, intensely grainy and focused; at midpalate there are lean tastes of minerals, barley, snack crackers, with a delicate touch of honey. Finishes clean, dry and lean.

title: Thomas H. Handy Sazerac Straight Rye Whiskey 2006 Antique Collection
description: A curious bouquet that offers gamey, quinine-resembling, botanical-driven notes. The palate entry is sweet with tastes of marzipan, nougat and caramel; by the midpalate the candied sweetness tones down as the taste profile once again turns spicy. Finishes elegantly, semisweet and bacon fat-like. Add mineral water before tasting.

title: Girl By Necker Framboise, Litchi, Vodka & Cognac
description: Fragrant litchi dominates the opening aroma in the first couple of passes, then the ripe raspberry framboise bolts to the lead following further aeration. The palate entry is light, fruity (berry), and floral; at midpalate the taste profile turns off-dry and very floral. Finishes mildly sweet and engagingly fruity. Nice job here.

title: Zen Green Tea Liqueur
description: The bouquet is delicately herbal, honey sweet and properly tea-like. The palate entry is sweet, syrupy and vaguely green tea-like, but then in the midpalate phase the green tea flavor emerges with greater authority, making for pleasing quaffing. Concludes softly herbal and sweet.

title: Canadian Club Reserve 10 Year Old Blended Canadian Whisky
description: The bouquet is oddly chalky with a dullish parchment note. The palate entry is lean and metallic; the midpalate shows a little more flair and grainy taste (breakfast cereal). Drinkable, but lackluster.

title: Jura Twenty-One 21-Year-Old Isle of Jura Single Malt Whisky
description: The wonderful bouquet is grainy dry, lightly nutty with additional vibrant scents of buttered honeywheat toast, sautéed almonds, cigar tobacco and buttermilk. The palate entry is sap- and maple-like; by midpalate the flavors run from chocolate milk to nougat to oatmeal-with-honey. Finishes gracefully and with late taste thrust. The new benchmark for Jura.

title: Puriste No. 1 Premium Vodka
description: The austere bouquet is not terribly expressive but is nonetheless compelling with soft grainy notes and dry scents of beeswax. The palate entry is clean, sleek and wonderfully smooth; at midpalate the purity of the spirit woos the taste buds in soft waves of intensely grainy flavor.

title: Herb's Dill Leaf Herb Infused Vodka
description: The bouquet is an aromatic trip that includes waves of pickle brine, fresh dill cuttings, pepper and herbal scents. The palate fresh and full of dill. By midpalate the taste is delicately sweet and ethereally earthy.

title: Suntory The Hakashu Japanese Whisky Aged 12 Years
description: Fans of smoky Islay Scotches will enjoy this smoky single malt that's made at Suntory's Hakashu Distillery, which is “surrounded by forest at the foot of the Southern Japan Alps.” Despite the delicate aromas of tropical fruit and light peat, the smoke note is considerably amplified on the palate, especially on the resonant finish, where it pushes those dainty fruit tones completely off the map.

title: Black Velvet Toasted Caramel
description: Bridging territory between whisky and liqueur, this caramel-flavored Canadian whisky was launched in the U.S. in September 2012. Viscous and sweet, it mixes flavors of milky caramel, toasted oak and a sprinkle of cinnamon on the finish. Expect this bottling to inspire warming fireside cocktails—perhaps mixed with apple cider or ginger ale—or sweet dessert drinks.

title: Ardbeg Day
description: This limited-edition whisky—just over 12,000 bottles were produced—has more subtlety than the standard smoky brute Ardbeg. Honeyed and floral aromas dominate the nose, with just a whiff of peat following. On the palate, a note of smoke and alcohol heat become evident. Yet—especially with water added—the finish shows graceful notes of espresso, menthol and buttery vanilla. This was made and named for the Ardbeg Day event.

title: Fuzzy's Ultra Premium Vodka
description: Need a gift for a golf lover? This corn-based vodka named for golf pro Fuzzy Zoeller may fit the bill. It has a neutral, faintly fruity aroma, with a bit of lemongrass on the crisp finish. Bottled by Bendistillery in Bend, Oregon.

title: Cooranbong Australian Vodka
description: Presented in a tall wine-bottle-like vessel, this clear, bright vodka made from Barossa Valley grapes mixes mild but distinctly sweet notes of marshmallow and vanilla.

title: Legend of Kremlin Russian Vodka De Luxe
description: Clear and star bright in appearance, this is a neutral, faintly citrusy vodka, which claims to have production roots dating back to a 15th century monk. Brisk alcohol.

title: Troy & Sons Oak Reserve Whiskey
description: Made from Crooked Creek Corn, an non-GMO heirloom corn variety, this barrel-aged moonshine has a light gold color and a mild vanilla flavor, mixed with notes of oak and faint tropical fruit. Recommended for mixing, this would do well lightened with ginger ale and lime.

title: Lucky Dog Vodka
description: Dog-lovers especially will love the playful label design, which features a leaping red dog and paw prints. This is “made from Idaho winter wheat and clear Rocky Mountain water,” and it bears a marshmallow sweetness on the palate.

title: Delord X.O.
description: Enticing and complex, this velvety XO is one to savor. The countryside perfume of this 15-year-old brandy evokes notes of fresh flower, hay, fig and vanilla, with a crème brûlée flavor that fades away ever so gently. Hard wax cap.

title: Delord 25 Ans d'Age
description: Aged for a minimum of 25 years, this has patisserie aromas of caramel and orange peel, with a soft feel and perky ginger and citrus notes on the finish. This light and lovely Armagnac would pair particularly well with fruit desserts. Hard wax cap.

title: Darroze Les Grand Assemblages 50 Years Old
description: Five centuries of barrel aging yields a topaz hue and notes of dried orange peel, caramel and black tea, with an extraordinarily long finish that gently blankets the mouthwatering palate.

title: Artez VSOP 100% Folle Blanche
description: This honey-colored brandy features a vanilla and toasted oak scent, with sweet, bold fresh peach and honey flavors, and a refreshing finish that bears flavors of citrus-cream.

title: Darroze Les Grand Assemblages 40 Years Old
description: Pour a glass of this complex, luxurious brandy and watch how the flavors evolve. At first, its reads fleetingly sweet, thanks to its notes of vanilla, orange peel and juicy clementine. Ultimately, it finishes dry, with a toffee flavor that unfurls to reveal touches of vanilla, spice, dark chocolate, sandalwood and black tea.

title: Chateau du Tariquet VSOP
description: Vibrant -yellow-gold in color, this full-bodied blend of Ugni Blanc and Baco Blanc resounds with a rich butterscotch note and a long finish that would be dynamite paired with pecan pie. The cap to the rounded cylindrical bottle is frustratingly hard to open.

title: Marie Duffau Hors d'Age
description: Although Hors d'âge translates as the subtle phrase “beyond age,” the contrary label trumpets that this brandy is aged 12 years. This seems apt as there's little subtlety about what's in the bottle either: rich, bulldozer-bold flavors ranging from buttery brioche to sweet caramel and toffee, braced up with notes of allspice and espresso on the surprisingly creamy and rich finish.

title: Armagnac Reserve de la Famille Aged 20 years Castarède
description: Delicate and soft, this has aromatics of vanilla and spice, with a rounded caramel flavor that's accented with mouthwatering cardamom, clove and dried orange-peel notes.

title: Dartigalongue XO
description: From “the oldest House in Armagnac” comes a well-balanced sipper that's reminiscent of Bourbon with its deep amber color; its rich, sweet caramel note; and bold finish that tastes of maple-butter sprinkled with clove and cinnamon.

title: Darroze Les Grand Assemblages 20 Years Old
description: Bearing a resemblance to fine Cognac, this dark amber brandy offers rich caramel, raisin and dried fig notes, along with gentle touches of baking spices on the long, velvety finish.

title: Laubade 1982
description: Give this vintage Armagnac time to aerate; the boozy nose dissipates, and the aromas and flavors deepen noticeably, turning from vanilla to toasty caramel and honey, with finessed tropical fruit and orange-peel notes.

title: Darroze Les Grand Assemblages 8 Years Old
description: This golden Armagnac is light and delicate, with aromatics of honey, fresh pears and peaches, and a light, creamy honey flavor that's mixed with faintly perfumed white flower and pear notes. Although it almost seems a shame to mix, it would be lovely in an effervescent drink with ginger ale or sparkling wine.

title: Château de Laubade Intemporel No. 5
description: Look for a dark amber hue and a deep caramel aroma from this brandy. On the palate, fleeting sweetness gives way to a long finish, offering flavors of oak, cocoa, caramel, clove and cinnamon. Some might compare this Armagnac- to good Bourbon.

title: Chateau du Tariquet Famille Grassa VSOP
description: This copper-penny-colored Armagnac is named for the Grassa family, which settled in the Château du Tariquet in 1912. This has a sweet scent of maple syrup, figs and hazelnuts, with round, mouth-filling flavors of sarsaparilla, marzipan, peach and a spicy cinnamon kicker. The alcohol feels fairly strong, so allow it plenty of time to aerate.

title: Armagnac de Montal XO
description: Within the curvy, regal-looking bottle with the royal crest—more Cognac style than modest Armagnac—is a silky, vanilla--forward brandy that resonates into a powerful finish with bold notes of clove, cocoa, espresso and cigar tobacco. Savor alongside dark chocolate.

title: Chateau du Tariquet Famille Grassa Le Legendaire XO
description: Light and delicate, this blend of Folle Blanche, Ugni Blanc and Baco yields mild pear, vanilla and citrus tones and finishes with a zesty fillip of ginger, lemon peel and smoky black pepper. Serve with duck for a daring pairing.

title: Chateau du Tariquet VS Classique
description: Light, nuanced and soft, this dark gold brandy breathes a bright, fresh aroma of fresh apple. The flavors are more rounded, showing notes of cola, vanilla, allspice and a delicate ribbon of milky caramel winding throughout. In addition to sipping, consider using this brandy for cocktails, too—sub it anywhere a lighter whiskey might go. Made from Ugni Blanc and Baco Blanc.

title: Dartigalongue Hors D'Age
description: This shows a rich amber-brown hue, offering warm aromas and flavors of prunes, dark chocolate, espresso and baking spices. Dry rather than sweet, with a soft feel and brisk alcohol, this would be a good complement to savory as well as sweet dishes.

title: XO Chateau de Laubade
description: The rich topaz color nods to the smooth fruit-and-honey character of this Armagnac. A blend of Baco, Folle Blanche, Ugni Blanc and Colombard grapes yields aromas of butterscotch and fresh apricots, with ethereally light, fruity notes on the palate that are reminiscent of some honeyed Speyside Scotches.

title: Laubade 1974
description: Bold and full bodied, this has flavors that tend toward sarsaparilla, caramel and allspice, with still more spice on the buttery finish. Hard wax cap.

title: Artez VSOP 100% Baco
description: This tawny brandy, with orange highlights, benefits from some time in the glass. Silky and elegant, this has mild apricot, vanilla and nut flavors that stretch into the long, long finish. Pair with a rich dessert like bread pudding.

title: Darroze Les Grand Assemblages 30 Years Old
description: Maple syrup in color, this has a toffee aroma and flavor, along with notes of dry cocoa, espresso, spice and dried orange peel on the finish. The tannins get a bit brusque after having spent three decades in the barrel, but overall it's a well-balanced brandy.

title: Ungava Canadian Premium Gin
description: A surprising bright daffodil yellow, this arctic-inspired gin has a light feel and a relatively neutral aroma and flavor. The palate shows some juniper, plus slight black pepper heat on finish.

title: Candy Manor Gin
description: This light, silky gin offers a mild anise scent, which shows as bolder anise on the palate, chased by fleeting sweetness and a flicker of alcohol heat on the finish. Named for “Candy Manor” in Delaware, where, the producer says, “during Prohibition the local candy store doubled as a brothel.”

title: Genius Gin Navy Strength
description: This overproof gin has a sweet, slightly floral fragrance. That white-flower note is echoed on the palate, where it mingles with spicy and a slightly resin-like note. The resiny flavor lingers and accelerates into the finish. Feels quite hot, which is to be expected from a Navy-strength gin.

title: Genius Gin Navy Strength
description: This overproof gin has a sweet, slightly floral fragrance. That white-flower note is echoed on the palate, where it mingles with spicy and a slightly resin-like note. The resiny flavor lingers and accelerates into the finish. Feels quite hot, which is to be expected from a Navy-strength gin.

title: Black Button Distilling Citrus Forward Gin
description: Distilled from local wheat and infused with Cascade hops and citrus peel, among other botanicals, this gin surprises with a warm banana scent spiked with anise. It has a light feel on the palate, showing anise up front, then weaving in citrus and finishing very long and earthy, with a roar of licorice and anise.

title: Few American Gin
description: Almost reminiscent of genever, this robust, earthy gin has a lick of licorice on the aroma, plus fruity notes that evoke banana and red vines. The banana note is echoed on the palate, plus juniper and a very spicy finish that highlights cinnamon and cayenne.

title: South River (White) Gin
description: Part of the craft distiller's “avant garde collection,” this straw-yellow gin has a mild floral aroma. On the palate, that white-flower note reads as soapy, overwhelming a pleasant vanilla note, finishing with a burst of alcohol heat. Rested for five months in a former white wine barrel.

title: Few Barrel Gin
description: Aged in a mix of used Few Bourbon and rye barrels and new oak barrels, this honey-colored gin is redolent of honey, agave and cedar. On the palate, tea and cedar notes mix with a resin-like flavor; an unusual deep blackberry compote note emerges midpalate. Finishes hot.

title: A Midwinter Night's Dram
description: This limited-edition blend of straight rye whiskeys finished in French oak and former port barrels offers huge, rounded notes of rich toffee, dark fruit, orange peel and mulling spices. It's almost like a wintry whiskey punch in a bottle. The language on the label winks at Shakespeare, making this a special gift for a theater lover as well as a whiskey lover.

title: Hillrock Single Malt Whiskey
description: This bold and flavorful sipping whiskey is made from New York State-grown malt smoked for eight hours over Scottish peat (an 18-hour version is in the works too). Bold smoky-sweet campfire notes lead into toffee, chocolate and espresso before drying to a gentle exhale of smoke.

title: Elijah Craig 23-Year-Old Single Barrel
description: This limited-edition bottling of rare extra-aged Bourbons becomes more concentrated and rich when allowed to open up in the glass: look for coconut, vanilla, oak and a dry finish accented with cocoa and leather. Just a splash of branchwater, and this is a sipper to savor.

title: Charbay Hop Flavored Whiskey Release IV Barrel No. 19
description: Distilled from Pilsner beer and aged for 13 years, this deep amber whiskey has a concentrated cocoa-hazelnut-caramel aroma, with an undercurrent of hops. The same flavors are echoed on the palate, although the hops are even more pronounced. It finishes long, complex and fiery, with pops of cinnamon, sarsaparilla, orange peel and clove, and a slight beer-like effervescence. Single barrel.

title: Swift Distillery Single Malt Texas Whiskey
description: Light gold in the glass, this single malt made in Texas from Scottish malted barley is scented with apples, pears and vanilla. On the palate, these notes are echoed along with a lightly charred, smoky note and a touch of cocoa mixed with the vanilla. It has a silky, oily feel.

title: Wild Turkey Forgiven
description: A hybrid of six-year-old Bourbon (78%) and four-year-old rye (22%), this whiskey offers plenty of bold vanilla, with a cookie dough-like sweetness drying to a gentle spicy fade. A splash of branchwater balances the alcohol heat and coaxes out more robust pops of spice.

title: Westland Sherry Wood American Single Malt Whiskey
description: Made from 100% malted barley and aged in former sherry casks, this amber whiskey has a dry, bracing scent brushed with dried apricot and brown sugar. Just a splash of water brings out custard-like notes, alongside vanilla, chamomile tea and stone fruit, finishing with a wisp of smoke.

title: Hillrock Double Cask Rye Whiskey
description: This 100% rye whiskey is named Double Cask because  it's aged in two different barrels, the last the  most heavily charred. The end result is a deep, rich  rye that shows off espresso, toffee, sarsaparilla and  caramel. The finish reverberates with long echoes of  clove, dried orange peel, nutmeg and baker's chocolate

title: Angel's Envy Finished in Port Wine Barrels
description: Luxe and velvety, this port-finished Bourbon shows bold caramel and toffee up front, morphing into notes of sherry, honey and rounded red fruit. Plush and very soft, it needs little more than an ice cube.

title: Jim Beam Signature Craft Harvest Bourbon Collection Soft Red Wheat
description: This small-batch Bourbon is made with whiskeys aged 11 years and older. Made with soft red wheat—a key ingredient in Maker's Mark, also a Beam product—in addition to corn, this dark-amber spirit has rich, concentrated aromas of caramel and toffee. On the palate, fleeting sweetness is chased by fiery clove spice. Adding water teases out more creamy caramel and a cookie dough-like note.

title: Old Forester 1870
description: Made using barrels from three different warehouses, a throwback to a pre-1870 blending technique intended to ensure consistency, this is a surprisingly light and delicate Bourbon. The aroma evokes coconut, plus a surprising floral note. The palate also shows coconut, spice, dried apricot and vanilla. Sip or mix.

title: Old Grand-Dad Bonded Bourbon
description: This high-rye, 100-proof Bourbon features a brown-sugar aroma and bold, mouthwatering notes of cocoa, hazelnut and toffee, finishing long. Smoother than a high-proof whiskey might be expected to be, it holds up to dilution, still showing lots of flavor even with branchwater added. Launched with new orange-and-green label in January 2015.

title: Westland American Single Malt
description: Westland's flagship single malt is aged for two years and bottled at 92 proof. It has a topaz hue and rich caramel aroma. On the palate, it's a bit oaky at first, but soon opens up to echo that bold caramel, plus a smoky touch of burnt orange peel on the slightly hot finish. Adding water brings out a faint almond note too.

title: Basil Hayden's Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Complex and balanced, this go-to Bourbon features vanilla aromatics with a touch of fresh apple. On the palate, it's light at first, showing vanilla and honey, and winds into deeper, rounded notes of cocoa and hazelnut. Splash in ginger ale for a highball and sip all night long.

title: Colonel E.H. Taylor Jr. Single Barrel Bourbon
description: Relatively smooth for 100 proof, this light, silky Bourbon shows bold vanilla and toffee, plus a mouthwatering baking spice finish. It's a good sipper with an ice cube, or mix into a top-flight old fashioned.

title: Woodford Reserve Rye
description: The latest addition to the Woodford line has a sweet aroma, evoking allspice, root beer and caramel. The palate shows plenty of vanilla and caramel but finishes bracingly dry and spicy, with bitter chocolate, clove and a tongue-numbing touch of cayenne.

title: Jim Beam Bonded
description: Smoother than expected for a 100-proof product, this four-year-old Bourbon has a bold vanilla-caramel aroma. Slightly drying on the palate, it offers bright butterscotch and apricot melting into caramel. Brisk and well structured, this Bourbon holds up well to dilution and would work well in mixed drinks.

title: Jim Beam Signature Craft Quarter Cask Bourbon
description: This small-batch Bourbon is finished in casks that are one-quarter the size of regular barrels, hence the name. That extra four to five years in small casks (on top of five to six years in regular barrels) creates layers of caramel, crème brûlée and dried fruit, which finish with clove and allspice sparks.

title: Michter's US *1 Toasted Barrel Finish Bourbon
description: So named because after full maturation in a charred oak barrel, it's finished in a new barrel that has been toasted (not charred). The end result is light but complex, featuring vanilla, buttery brioche and hints of rich butterscotch, settling with fleeting baking spice and sarsaparilla, and a noticeably buttery and oily feel.

title: St. George Single Malt Whiskey Lot 14
description: St. George releases its single malts annually. The 2014 edition has a golden hue and morphs from tropical notes of pineapple, lemon peel, coconut and vanilla to lightly smoky to hoppy and beer-like on the finish, plus a flick of ginger. It's clean, bold and worth seeking out. If it's already gone, don't worry; Lot 15 will be released in late summer/early fall 2015.

title: Black Button Distilling Apple Pie Moonshine
description: This gentle bottling mixes Black Button's unaged whiskey with New York state apple cider, cinnamon and local spices. Amber and slightly cloudy, like unfiltered apple juice, it has a cider-like sweet-tart quality, with a touch of warming vanilla on the finish. It's addictive, and would be great in fall drinks or warmed up for a mulled cider-style drink.

title: Russell's Reserve Rye Small Batch 6 Year Old
description: The warm and fruity scent is reminiscent of fresh apples drizzled with caramel. On the palate, spicy cinnamon leads, softening to caramel midpalate and finishing with sizzling cinnamon, clove and cayenne pepper. Adjusted with water, a saline note emerges, creating a pleasing salted caramel-like sipper.

title: Averna Sambuca
description: The nosing passes find aromas of black licorice and aniseed  with an alluring oily scent appearing after aeration time. Palate entry is pleasingly licorice-like at first, then it turns a touch metallic; midpalate recovers the licorice focus and is pleasantly waxy. Finish is rich, intense, and creamy.

title: G. Bertagnolli Lemon & Liqueur
description: The first round of sniffings find a beguilingly clean, tart and snappy lemon zest aroma; following aeration the lemon perfume becomes more juicy and less acidic. Palate entry is intensely lemony, juicy and tart; midpalate offers the mildest hint of sweetness but is dominated by the tartness and the bitter acidity through the aftertaste.

title: Lillet Rouge Apéritif de France
description: Initial whiffs detect ripe yet tart aromas of red grapes, raspberries and blackberries; time in the glass rounds off the bouquet, adding delicate hints of cinnamon and grape vines. Palate entry is clean, tart and properly fruity; midpalate is intensely grapy, juicy and savory. Finishes elegantly in a grape preserves-like manner.

title: Kubler Swiss Absinthe Superieure
description: Aromas of popcorn, vinyl, wet cement and chalk; aeration introduces a medicinal yet earthy odor. Palate entry features unfolding flavors of anise, metal, legumes and vegetable broth; at midpalate the alcohol intensity abates as tastes of mushrooms, black peppercorn, aniseed and chalk accelerate. Finish is extended, mossy and not too sweet.

title: Licores Baztan Ordoki Manzana Verde Green Apple Liqueur
description: Smells engagingly of tart green apple and, strangely, aluminum foil; the foil fades following aeration, leaving behind beeswax and apple peel. Palate entry is pleasingly tart, acidic and apple-like; midpalate is long, more astringent than sweet. Concludes apple-like and not too sweet.

title: Ardmore Traditional Cask Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The nosing passes find aromas of malted barley, Ritz crackers, bacon fat, butterscotch, black pepper and lumber. Palate entry offers pleasant tastes of breakfast cereal, new honey and light toffee; at midpalate flavors of light fudge, caramel, banana nut bread and traces of tobacco leaf are added. Finish is medium sweet, sturdy and lightly smoked.

title: Mi Abuela Coquito Coconut Cream Liqueur
description: Nosing passes find aromas of spiced coconut and coconut milk. Palate entry is thick, creamy, and coconut meat-like; midpalate offers pleasing flavors of sweetened coconut meat, eggs and background spices, such as cinnamon and vanilla. Ends up delightfully creamy and appropriately sweet.

title: Los Arango Reposado 100% Agave Tequila
description: Displays pleasant green vegetable (asparagus, kale) aromas right upfront along with a background agave brininess; further air contact stimulates a creaminess that's oily and sinewy. Palate entry is long, satiny, with vibrant tastes of chili pepper, salt and steamed asparagus; midpalate is full-weighted, juicy, sweet, toffee-like and oily.

title: Cape North Vodka
description: First whiffs detect warm, toasty notes of baked bread and even a dash of spice; later sniffs find aromatic traces of nutmeat, kernels and charcoal. Remarkably smooth and seamless at palate entry; midpalate is creamy, beany dry, bread-like and extended. Finishes with a dose of bittersweet graininess. Stylish, world-class.

title: Rehorst Premium Milwaukee Vodka
description: Initial inhalations pick up pleasing aromas of distant dried fruits, shrubbery and light spice; the aroma stays the fruit/floral course and is inviting in its delicacy. Palate entry is slightly sweet and grainy, almost flowery, and has a moment when there's a hint of pear or nectarine; the midpalate is long, kernel-bittersweet, cocoa-like and velvety. Concludes bittersweet.

title: Don Q Grand Añejo Conmemorativo Rum
description: Mellow notes of brown butter and crackling bacon rind waft up from the sampling glass; aeration stimulates molasses rum depth, with cigar tobacco, dried cherry fruit and dark caramel notes. Palate entry is lush, smooth, peppery and spicy; midpalate displays an authentic Puerto Rican-style grace that highlights integrated flavors of cinnamon, vanilla, brown sugar, honey, egg cream and dark fudge.

title: Zubrowka Bison Grass Vodka
description: Smells nicely of sweet grass, paraffin, acetate and wheat crackers; aeration bolsters the aromatic impressions of the first round and adds a subtle spiciness (nutmeg?) that complements the grassy quality. Palate entry teems with zesty, spicy, medicinal and grassy flavors; midpalate flavors come off chocolaty and milky, with disparate background tastes of egg cream and green pepper.

title: Jose Cuervo Tradicional Reposado 100% Agave Tequila
description: Opening inhalations encounter notes of green olive, brine and sea salt; following another seven minutes of air contact, a distinct spiciness emerges, mostly black peppercorn, as well as a none-too-subtle thrust of dill pickle. Palate entry offers low-grade agave juice sweetness and pepperiness; midpalate features jalapeño pepper, green pepper, dill, and a touch of vanilla.

title: Whitley Neill London Dry Gin
description: Opening smell reminds me of new leather luggage and toasted bread; aeration brings about more fruit and spice and juniper. Palate entry is medium-bodied, silky and buttery, but clearly junipery, citrusy and fresh; midpalate is more juniper-driven than the entry yet displays other botanicals, including orris and angelica.

title: Mount Gay Rum Eclipse Silver
description: Initial aroma is caney, grassy and fruity. Palate entry is crisp, moderately sweet and properly bittersweet in bearing; midpalate displays excellent balance, sweetness level, medium-bodied texture, and even some background cinnamon spiciness. Finishes long, crisp, nicely sweet and caney, and delicious.

title: Double Cross Luxury Vodka
description: Upfront, the nose is grainy, dry and delicate. Palate entry is peppery and sweeter than I thought it would be, but not cloying; midpalate displays vibrant, spicy fragrances of snack crackers laced with pepper, black peppercorn, lemon zest and mustard seed; the texture is creamy and full. Concludes on a silky, citrusy note. Substantial and well-made.

title: Cuca Fresca Pura Gold Cachaça
description:
Slight brine and egg yolk smells emanate from the sampling glass in the first whiffs; swirling and additional air contact bring about timid and wholly uninteresting aromas, including green pepper, beeswax and lead pencil. Palate entry makes an attempt at richness but falls short as moderately pleasing tastes of wood resin, light toffee and brown sugar vie for dominance. Finishes clean, with plenty of acidity, 
and a certain low-level, indefinable charm.

title: Saaga 1763 Vodka
description: Smells of concrete and pre-dawn bakery when the dough is rising and the yeast and flour are rampant. Palate entry is satiny smooth and intensely bean-like; the midpalate offers rounder tastes of baked bread, old honey and nougat. Ends on a sweet note.

title: Beija Cachaça
description: First sniffings detect intensely sugarcane and vegetal notes; aroma turns a bit diesel-like after extra aeration time, losing some of the original grassiness. Palate entry is pleasingly bittersweet and astringent; midpalate flavor profile features cooked broccoli, sugarcane and a moderate sweetness that kicks the bittersweet quality of the entry off the table.

title: Cuca Fresca Premium Cachaça
description: Smells acutely rubbery and industrial right from the get-go; further air contact brings about a wide array of scents, including model airplane glue, wax paper, dill, saltine cracker and pickling brine. Palate entry is satiny, green veggie-like, grassy; midpalate offers an oily texture (which I like) and off-dry tastes of margarine/ oleo, green olive and brine. Concludes medium-weighted, more bittersweet now than off-dry, and zesty.

title: Bombora Vodka
description: Smells nicely of toasted bread and lanolin after the pour; turns more seed-like and viny following further air contact. Palate entry is unabashedly sweet, oily, and grapy; midpalate carries on with the intense sweetness that turns more spirity in the oily, viscous finish.

title: Stiletto Mint Flavor Vodka
description: Notable aromatically for its delicate traces of mint leaves in the opening nosings; further air contact brings out pleasing scents of hyssop, fresh mint leaves, peppermint and brambles. Palate entry is minty and crisp; midpalate sustains the solid core mintiness, creating the stage for a clean, refreshing aftertaste.

title: Boulard Millésimé Vintage 1981 Calvados Pays d'Auge
description: The nosing passes find mature aromas of buttered toast, nougat, baked apple pastry and oak. Palate entry features beautifully spiced and fruity tastes of cinnamon, apple strudel and brown butter; at midpalate tastes of egg cream, dark toffee and treacle are added. Ends gracefully, warm in the throat, lightly smoky and oaky.

title: Joseph Cartron Crème de Cerise de Bourgogne
description: The wonderful bouquet emanates aromas of ripe black cherries. Ripe and gently sweet tastes of perfect cherry crème flavor mingle harmoniously with the natural acids and tannins at palate entry; the midpalate is genuinely not in the least cloying; ripe, but not overly sweet. Delicious.

title: Joseph Cartron Pomegranate Grenade Liqueur
description: Piquant aromas of black pepper, marmalade and crushed pomegranate buds greet the olfactory sense. Palate entry is juicy, tart, yet lusciously ripe and berry sweet; the fruit, texture, sweetness and crisp acidity are perfectly balanced at midpalate. Finish is concentrated and scrumptious.

title: Joseph Cartron Cherry Brandy Liqueur
description: The wonderful cherry bouquet offers aromas of dried cherries, cherry pit, cherry skin, brambles, wet leaves and vines. Palate entry is bitter and seed-like as the cherry pit taste comes to the fore; midpalate is seedy/pod-like in its bitterness with a dried cherry fruit taste balancing the astringency. Finishes clean, pit-like and mildly bitter.

title: Vanille Royale Original French Vanilla Cream and Cognac Liqueur
description: The nosing passes find very pleasant fruity, almost pear- or apple-like aromas, with touches of nutmeg and cinnamon. Palate entry is white chocolate-like with traces of almond, apple and cinnamon; midpalate is long, coating, intensely creamy and luscious. Finishes rich, creamy and nicely spicy.

title: Villa Marzia Limoncello Lemon Liqueur
description: The engagingly tart, acutely lemony and citric bouquet features keen smells of lemon zest and fresh lemon juice. Palate entry is sour yet ripe and lemony; the lemon juice astringency accelerates at midpalate, leaving the tongue fresh and clean. Finishes tart, juicy and intensely lemony. An excellent limoncello.

title: Leopold Gourmel Quintessence Fins Bois Cognac
description: The initial aroma features near succulent scents of oak, baked apple and raisins but following aeration time the bouquet vanishes. Palate entry features medium-rich tastes of grape jam, plum preserves, prunes, black raisins, and treacle; at midpalate the old, dried fruit elements reach their apex right before the finish.

title: G. Bertagnolli Acquavitae d'Uva
description: The bouquet features wonderful floral aromas (honeysuckle/jasmine/orange blossom) and scents of tangerines, grapes, pears and strawberries. Palate entry is engagingly light, flowery and fruity; at midpalate the top layer taste exudes tastes of grapes and pomace underpinned by well-made, ultra-clean distillate. Finish is a little too metallic and coin-like but an excellent product nonetheless.

title: Glen Moray Elgin Classic Port Cask Finish Speyside Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Aged in former Bourbon casks, then finished for eight months in Port pipes, this rose-gold spirit is scented with apple and faint berry. The palate has a dusty, cocoa like feel and a vanilla-forward flavor profile that complements the peat smoke on the exit.

title: Glencadam Aged 21 Years
description: Deep gold in the glass, this Highland single-malt Scotch offers scents of fresh pear, vanilla and a touch of peat. It's quite soft on the palate, leading with an iodine note, then layers of vanilla, honey, baked apple and pear before winding down into a long and lightly smoky exit. Alcohol heat provides a drying feel on the finish.

title: anCnoc Highland Single Malt Distilled 1975
description: Bottled in 2014, this complex amber-colored sipper has a dark honey aroma and a dry, tannic, slightly savory palate that mixes toasty oak, iodine, strong tea and molasses flavors with a bitter herb note that's reminiscent of an amaro. It finishes lean and very dry, with allspice and clove.

title: Glencadam Aged 10 Years
description: This Highland single-malt Scotch is light gold in the glass, with aromas of vanilla, white flowers and orchard and tropical fruit. The palate is brisk and has bright acidity, showing flavors of tart lemon peel, white flowers and vanilla, plus a faint puff of smoke on the dry finish.

title: Ransom The Emerald 1865 Straight American Whiskey
description: Innovative craft distiller Ransom made this whiskey from an old mash bill sourced by cocktail historian David Wondrich and re-created by Ransom founder Tad Seestedt. It's meant as “a modern interpretation of a mid-1800s Irish whiskey.” That seems to translate as a relatively lean, herbaceous whiskey, different from the vanilla-forward selections usually seen now. An amber color in the glass, it shows plenty of oak, eucalyptus, nutmeg and clove character, with a bracing, slightly warm finish.

title: Vicomte Single Malt Whisky Aged 8 Years
description: Aged eight years in former Cognac barrels, this silky, French single malt has gentle pear, vanilla and almond extract aromas and flavors. It finishes with a faint puff of smoke on the dry, surprisingly hot finish.

title: Laphroaig Quarter Cask
description: Bold and overwhelmingly smoky, this golden single malt was matured twice, first in large casks and then transferred to smaller “quarter casks,” for more contact with the barrel wood. Look for plenty of peat smoke on the nose and palate, with undercurrents of honey and fleeting red fruit, plus an astringent iodine note. It's tannic, drying and full flavored.

title: Oban Little Bay Small Cask Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: This new offering is made with whiskies “married in our smallest casks” to entice more fruitiness. The end result mixes vanilla and fresh apple aromas, though neither carries forward to the palate. Instead, flavors of resin and menthol dominate, though there's a pleasing peachy note on the dry, relatively hot finish. Adding water coaxes out a mellow vanilla note.

title: Balblair 2003
description: The year on the bottle—2003—is not an age statement, but instead was the year this single-malt Scotch was laid down. A light-straw color, it has a bright, fresh aroma, with breezy notes of vanilla, hay, honey and pear. On the palate, it's astringent and overwhelmingly peppery, smoothed by a bit of honey on the finish. A splash of water tones down the peppery heat and brings more vanilla and honey sweetness forward.

title: Glenglassaugh Evolution
description: This golden single-malt Scotch was matured in former Tennessee-whisky barrels. Vanilla and almond aromas are echoed on the palate, alongside a strong resin note and a gentler wave of smoke. At 100 proof, there's a predictable wallop of alcohol heat on the close.

title: Armorik Breton Single Malt Double Maturation
description: Matured in French oak as well as former oloroso Sherry casks (hence its name), this whisky has pleasant honey and fresh pear aromas. The flavor profile is drier than the aromas suggest, with a forward resiny note that's followed by hints of cedar, tea, oak and vanilla, plus a modest amount of smoke.

title: Cognac Park Borderies
description: This silky single-vineyard Cognac hits all the right notes, layering rounded vanilla, sherry and butterscotch with the freshness of apricots and white flowers. Just a touch of baking spice rounds out the mouthwatering finish. Aged 15 years.

title: Majesté Le Roi VSOP
description: Rich, sweet and luscious overall, this delicious, dessert-worthy sipper leads with bold, buttery caramel and milk chocolate, before drying out to a darker toffee, espresso, cocoa and clove finish that fades gently. Packaged in an unusual rectangular bottle.

title: Lheraud Cognac Cuvée 10
description: Despite the sweet vanilla-bean fragrance, this is a relatively light and complex sipper. Look for notes of espresso, toasted coconut and cocoa winding into a crème brûlée finish that gently echoes the sweet aromatics.

title: Merlet Selection Saint-Sauvant
description: This limited-edition XO Cognac has a maple hue and honey-almond scent. The palate shows more almond plus vanilla, leading into a slightly drying finish of dusty cocoa. Only 800 bottles are available in the U.S.

title: Delamain Cognac Vesper XO
description: Made with a blend of brandies aged 30–35 years, this shows dark amber in the glass yet is remarkably soft, balanced and easy to enjoy. The bouquet entices, with scents of caramel, vanilla and orange peel that are mirrored on the palate along with a slight saline twang that reads as salted caramel, braced by clove and cinnamon.

title: Lheraud Cognac Cuvée 20
description: This Cognac is dark, mysterious and very drying from the very first sip. The aroma shows sweet vanilla and caramel, yet the palate tells a different story, showing oak, dark chocolate, leather and espresso, softened by creamy vanilla notes on the finish. All together, it's a complex and intriguing pour.

title: Gilles Brisson Cognac VSOP
description: Almost like dessert in a glass, this deep topaz-hued Cognac has a scent that evokes baked apple and dried orange peel. On the palate, more caramel and mocha emerges, flecked with baking spice and orange peel on the finish.

title: Paul Giraud Napoleon
description: Light and delicate, this burnished-gold brandy offers notes of dried apricot, pineapple and toasted coconut, finishing slightly perfumy, with hints of white flowers, nutmeg and clove.

title: Distillerie Du Peyrat Organic Selection Cognac
description: Silky and light bodied, this USDA certified-organic Cognac offers warm notes of honey, baked pear and vanilla sweetness, drying to a delicately spiced finish.

title: Gilles Brisson Cognac Napoleon
description: Mixing luscious caramel and spice in the aroma, this amber Cognac is surprisingly light and delicate on the palate, showing elegant caramel, oak, tea, vanilla, sarsaparilla and clove. Give it a swirl in the glass; exposure to air yields butterscotch-like notes too.

title: Cognac Park XO Traditional Reserve
description: Made with a blend of brandies aged 20 to 25 years, this is a pleasant sipper, with complex flavors that unfold slowly. The deep ruddy hue and bold caramel aroma hint at the richness in the glass. At first sip, it shows dry, dusty cocoa, soon leading into richer caramel before evolving into lighter orange peel and orange blossom notes and a spicy finish.

title: Courvoisier VSOP
description: Deep amber and bright in the glass, look for cedar, vanilla bean and coconut accented by peach and a light violet note. It's light and silky, with a bracing flicker of alcohol heat.

title: Normandin-Mercier Cognac Prestige
description: Maple-hued in the glass, the nose and palate are reminiscent of apricot jam layered with shortbread and buttered brioche. It starts bold and juicy, fading into lighter notes of dried apricot and ginger on the drying finish.

title: Hennessy X.O.
description: The deep fig and raisin aromas hint that the palate will be equally deep and dark. Bold toffee, cocoa, fig and gingerbread round into a spiced, brisk finish. Consider as a dessert pairing.

title: Marnier Cognac XO
description: This dark amber brandy in a hefty, heart-shaped bottle has a rich bouquet, thick with caramel and cocoa. That luxe nose contrasts with a dry flavor profile, leading with espresso and bitter chocolate before smoothing into pecan pie, hazelnut and apricot on the elongated finish.

title: Gilles Brisson Cognac VS
description: Scented with baked apple and vanilla, this amber-hued brandy—aged three to four years—shows oak, cedar and chamomile tea up front. The finish is long and luxe, with lots of baking spice smoothed by elegant strokes of vanilla and almond.

title: Merlet Brothers Blend Cognac
description: A VSOP Cognac made from a blend of brandies aged four to 12 years, this easy sipper has a honey hue, with warm maple and dried apricot aromas. Light and smooth on the palate, look for more bold maple, honey and vanilla, building to a warm, clove-accented finish. Sip or mix.

title: Cognac Park Chai No. 8 Single Barrel Petite Champagne 21 year old
description: Single barrel offerings are rare in Cognac; a mere 412 bottles were produced from this particular barrel of 21-year-old brandy. The liquid is dark amber, with a warm, concentrated caramel aroma. The palate echoes that caramel along with darker toffee, drying to oaky tea-like notes midpalate, then finishing spicy and warm, with lingering vanilla. Chai No. 8 means “Cellar No. 8,” where the barrel was stored.

title: D'Usse Cognac XO
description: Deep amber in the glass, this light and silky spirit has a distinctive violet note up front, melding into bold, sweet vanilla, caramel and clove.

title: Rhum J.M VSOP
description: For those who like rum with a bit of sweetness to it, this honey-hued sipper offers vanilla bean and brown sugar on the nose and palate, drying to a hot cinnamon finish smoothed by decadent hints of cocoa, espresso and hazelnut.

title: The Arcane Extraroma Grand Amber Rum
description: The bold, offers smacks of banana taffy and circus peanuts. That taffy-like note is echoed on the palate, which finishes long and sweet, with waves of -coconut, banana, almond and marshmallow, -winding into a lip-smacking, spiced finish. Sip or mix into tropical cocktails. Launching in the U.S. in late 2018.

title: The Arcane Delicatissime Grand Gold Rum
description: Palate-coating vanilla and coconut set the stage for layers of orange peel, coffee, and spice. This rum lands lightly, with a smooth hint of dark chocolate. Ideal as a dessert pairing. Launching in the U.S. in late 2018.

title: Clément XO
description: Honey and orange peel aromas lead the nose. The drying palate shows vanilla, leather and chamomile tea, finishing with a burst of spice and orange peel, plus a hint of banana on the final exhale. Aged a minimum of six years, in virgin oak and ex-Bourbon barrels.

title: HSE Rhum Agricole Extra Vieux Sauternes Cask Finish
description: This unusual rum is matured for nine years in oak barrels, plus another eight months in former Château La Tour Blanche Sauternes casks. The effect is harmonious and subtle. A thick layer of vanilla coats the palate, accented by lighter hints of oak, orange peel, baking spice and golden raisin, finishing with a fiery cayenne sizzle.

title: Damoiseau VSOP
description: Burnished gold in the glass, this rhum offers a vanilla-forward aroma and light, smooth palate, with concentrated creamy honey and a long baking spice finish accented by a whiff of Scotch-like smoke and lemon peel. Barrel-aged for a minimum of four years.

title: Lowcountry Agricole
description: This complex, intriguing rum is made 100% from South Carolina sugarcane, then barrel rested for 10 months. The end result is a golden-yellow hue and pungent aroma of banana bread. A long swath of palate-coating waxy honey leads the way, finishing long on touches of agave nectar, banana, nutmeg and cardamom.

title: Rhum J.M X.O
description: This tawny orange rhum offers a mild, slightly oaky aroma.   The palate opens with distinct sweetness, blossoming into brown butter and banana, then drying to clove and cinnamon  sparks to close out the sip. Aged six years.

title: HSE Rhum Agricole VSOP Reserve Speciale
description: This amber liquid has a luxuriously rich, concentrated brown sugar scent. Meanwhile, the palate shows dark layers of toffee, espresso and vanilla, finishing with a flicker of orange peel and clove. According to the producer, this rhum undergoes a “very long aging process in Bourbon oak casks.” Unsurprisingly, it drinks like a long-aged Bourbon.

title: Rhum J.M Gold Rum
description: Sip or mix this honey-hued rum. The palate opens with vanilla sweetness, then dries to dusty cocoa and clove and finishes with honey, cedar, ripe banana and black pepper.

title: HSE Rhum Agricole Extra Vieux Grand Reserve
description: Deep vanilla, toffee and espresso aromas lead the nose. The drying palate evokes chocolate-covered oranges, melding dark chocolate with a rounded finish that has pops of vanilla, orange and spice.

title: Casa Magdalena Ron Blanco
description: Clear in the glass, this offers gentle wafts of coconut and marshmallow on nose and a plush palate that finishes with the faintest hint of lime. Ready for daiquiris and other rum cocktails. Distilled in Guatemala, then aged and bottled in Portland, Oregon; barrel aged for six to 12 months.

title: HSE Rhum Blanc Agricole
description: Clear in the glass, look for a grassy, slightly funky scent and a silky palate that echoes that grassy, almost floral note. The finish is gentle but long, exiting with ginger and cinnamon sparks and a mouthwatering hint of banana.

title: Clément Rhum 10 Year
description: A mellow caramel aroma entices on the nose. The palate sets up with oak, vanilla bean and maple sweetness, drying to lemon peel acidity and a flicker of ginger heat on the finish.

title: Damoiseau XO
description: Concentrated brown sugar dominates the nose and palate on this tawny rhum, edged by echoes of maple sugar, vanilla and clove. Aged a minimum of six years.

title: HSE Rhum Vieux Agricole Black Sheriff
description: This rhum, aged for three to four years in ex-Bourbon barrels, was engineered to drink like American whiskey. The end result is a bright topaz hue and mild vanilla bean aroma, with a pleasing flavor profile that frames espresso, campfire smoke and caramel. The slightly drying exit shows clove, black pepper and a hint of orange peel.

title: Rhum J.M 2003
description: The oak-vanilla-spice trinity of this 10-year-old rum will be familiar to lovers of American whiskey. Rich brown sugar and vanilla aromas lead the way, followed by oak and vanilla on the palate enlivened by a juicy hint of lemon peel and an echo of bananas Foster. Clove and cinnamon tingle round out the finish.

title: The Real McCoy Aged 10 Years
description: This limited-edition blends rum aged for 12 years in Bourbon barrels with rum aged 10 years in virgin oak. The end result is a burnished gold liquid redolent of maple and brown sugar on the nose and palate. Sweet vanilla and hazelnut wraps around a warming core, finishing with a cinnamon tingle. Micro batch of 3,000 bottles.

title: Rhum J.M V.O
description: The honey hue and sweet vanilla-spice aromas lead on this agricole rhum. The palate opens with vanilla and honey, carrying to an earthy, rubbery midpalate and spicy finish, laced with black pepper, clove and cayenne. Aged three years.

title: Birra Antoniana Pasubio Pilsner
description: Named for the highest mountain (Monte Pasubio) in Pasubio Group of the Piccole Dolomiti, this is made with a combination of Pilsner and Vienna malts as well as five different hop varieties, making for quite an herbaceous and even slightly resinous experience. It's bright and earthy, with upfront scents of both fresh and pressed hop flowers, sweet grass, citrus blossoms and supremes. The mouthfeel is clean and refreshing, with a light body and medium-plus carbonation that carries through to the crisp, lightly astringent close. Slow Brewing Certified. MHW, Ltd.

title: Rhum J.M. 100 Blanc
description: As expected from a 100-proof spirit, alcohol heat overwhelms from the first sip to the peppery finish. Get beyond that, and the reward is a bright, honeyed scent and bold palate that shows lychee and rosewater, with bouncy bubblegum and rubber.

title: Don Q Double Aged Rum Vermouth Cask -Finish Rum
description: This is a blend of rums aged from 5–8 years, finished for a few weeks in barrels that previously held Italian sweet vermouth. The spirit has a mild scent and light, honeyed palate accented by savory cedar, sarsaparilla and curry. The vermouth finish shows up on the close, which is laced with sweet spices and a hint of red fruit.

title: HSE Rhum Agricole Extra Vieux Highland-Finish
description: This rhum received six years of typical oak barrel aging, followed by another 12 months maturing in barrels that held single malt whisky from Scotland's Highland region. The end result resembles a rum-Bourbon hybrid, though not so much Scotch. The mild aroma mingles sweet vanilla and brown sugar, while the palate shows coffee, vanilla, cocoa and a hint of orange peel. The finish is very drying and spiced with clove and black pepper. As with a good Bourbon, consider adding a splash of water to temper the persistent alcohol heat.

title: Paranubes Rum
description: An agricole rhum from Oaxaca, the region better known for mezcal, this is an exciting proposition. The liquid is clear in the glass, with a pungent, funky scent and bold notes of banana and cinnamon on the palate, finishing fiery, though with a pleasing, fleeting grassy exhale. Labeled as aguardiente de caña—cane firewater—this unaged bottling is a bit punishing as is, but the prospect of a mellower barrel-aged version down the line is enticing.

title: Oro de Lidia Reposado Tequila
description: This golden Tequila puts the agave front and center, without burying it under wood. Pleasantly savory honey, pineapple and jalapeño aromas lead the nose and palate. A wash of vanilla smooths the exit, accented by gingery spice. Sip or mix. Aged six to nine months in a mix of American and French oak.

title: Siete Leguas Reposado Tequila
description: This is very pale in the glass, but with a zesty, savory aroma that suggests fresh oregano and basil. The palate melds that herbaceousness with hints of almond and lemon cream, plus cinnamon and white pepper on the elongated finish. Sip or mix.

title: G4 Reposado Tequila
description: The zesty jalapeño aroma and sweet tomato undercurrent suggests what is to come. The savory palate delivers fresh mint, basil, jalapeño and green pepper, finishing with a hint of black pepper smoothed by vanilla-mint sweetness. Sip or mix.

title: Tres Agaves Reposado Tequila
description: The light but zesty aroma evokes tomato water, bell pepper freshness and agave nectar. Meanwhile, the palate leads with honey and jalapeño, finishing with hints of vanilla and sweet cinnamon. Aged in Tennessee and Kentucky whiskey barrels for a minimum of six months.

title: Blue Nectar Reposado Extra Blend Tequila
description: This is a reposado Tequila blended with extra añejo. The aroma mixes tropical fruit and jalapeño. The silky, delicate palate opens with vanilla and almond elegance, almost reminiscent of a blended Scotch infused with jalapeño peppers, finishing with peppery edge. Recommended as a sipping Tequila.

title: Corralejo Reposado Tequila
description: Look for a pale rose-gold hue and a mild, herbaceous aroma that hints at basil and slate. The palate is light and silky, echoing that slate-like minerality alongside hints of cedar, coconut and honey, finishing with a flurry of white pepper and brush of raspberry. Aged four months.

title: Vermont Spirits No. 14 Bourbon Whiskey
description: A bridge between straight-up whiskey and liqueur, this Vermont-made Bourbon laced with Vermont maple syrup is approachable and not too sweet. The maple shows up in the aroma and just a flash of sweetness on the palate. Otherwise, it's light-bodied and silky, with a surprising cherry-vanilla note on the mid-palate and a creamy, citrusy fade. Would be a delight mixed with ginger and lime.

title: Belle Meade Sour Mash Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: This addictive high-rye Bourbon, the first offering from the reincarnated Nelson's Green Brier Distillery, offers a pleasing caramel scent and dark, spicy flavors that evoke toffee and gingerbread, plus a citrusy tartness around the edges that leads into a mellower vanilla note.

title: Breaker Bourbon Whiskey
description: This small-batch whiskey is made from a mix of corn, rye and malted barley. It has an orange-amber hue and notably sweet aroma. On the palate, it's soft with corn sweetness on the entry, which quickly gives over to a fruity flavor profile, showing lots of cherry and peach on the finish.

title: Jim Beam Single Barrel
description: This new offering from Jim Beam has rich, intense maple and caramel aromas and flavors, plus oak and cinnamon on the brisk finish. At 95 proof, adding water helps tame the alcohol heat and lets the bold flavors lead from sip to sip.

title: Knob Creek Single Barrel Reserve
description: Though complex and flavorful, the extremely high proof of this nine-year-old small-batch Bourbon means it won't be for everyone. Dose it with plenty of water (or your mixer of choice) to enjoy the dry character with notes of vanilla, leather, orange peel, clove, red-hot cinnamon and a long caramel finish.

title: William Wolf Pecan Bourbon Whiskey
description: Golden and full of sweet, nutty-maple flavor, this reads like a Bourbon-based liqueur. Consider this viscous, easy-drinking flavored whiskey for sweetening cocktails, sipping alongside dessert, or even splashed into baked goods. Produced using American-made Bourbon but bottled in the Netherlands.

title: Tin Cup American Whiskey
description: This high-rye Bourbon (which oddly, doesn't say “Bourbon” on the label though it meets the basic criteria) is bold and spicy, and plays well in cocktail combinations. A big oak and vanilla mix finishes with clove, dried cherry, and a surprising, bright touch of lemon peel. It's not distilled in Colorado, but is cut with Rocky Mountain water.

title: West of Kentucky Bourbon Whiskey No. 1
description: A Bourbon from wine country? Yes! This is one in a series of yearly small-batch releases celebrating “California Bourbon.” Made from corn, rye and cherry-smoked malted barley, look for a toasty brioche aroma and herbaceous accents. On the palate, it's dry and pleasantly light, suggesting cedar, tea, honey, baking spice and oak. A subtly smoky note emerges after the whiskey sits for a while. Consider mixing a boulevardier, with sweet vermouth and Campari.

title: Old Forester Signature
description: At 100 proof, this is a bold and flavorful Bourbon, though also drying and quite hot, so add plenty of branchwater. It's richly aromatic, evoking caramel with some fruity notes. On the palate, the whiskey shows a drier, darker side, with lots of Baker's chocolate, espresso, leather and oak.

title: Orphan Barrel Rhetoric
description: One of a series of old and rare limited-edition whiskies released by Diageo from their Stitzel-Weller warehouses. Aged for 20 years (relatively long for Bourbon) and bottled in Tullahoma, TN, oak seems to dominate the nose and palate. Look for a rich toffee scent with a whiff of oak and a drying feel. High proof but flavorful, this Bourbon offers lots of vanilla and baking spice flavor, with touches of smoke and red fruit around the edges, finishing long and powerful.

title: Mystic Bourbon Liqueur
description: Herbaceous and lightly sweet, this spiced Bourbon liqueur seems custom-made for cocktails—it would blend seamlessly into a whiskey- or amaro-based drink. Look for flashes of birch beer and cardamom that are layered with rich maple and honey.

title: Watershed Distillery Bourbon
description: This small-batch Bourbon is made from a combination of corn, wheat, rye and spelt, aged for two and a half years. The end result is a brisk, tasty Bourbon, with a deep topaz hue and unique scents of oak and baked apple. Oak dominates the drying palate, but it finishes long, with plenty of creamy caramel flavor.

title: Red Stag Hardcore Cider
description: The latest addition to the popular Red Stag line infuses Kentucky Bourbon with natural apple cider and other flavors. It's golden orange and bright, and light on the tongue. Expect a honey-sweet fragrance and rounded red-apple flavor at the back of the palate. Chill well and mix with ginger ale, or use it to sweeten whiskey drinks.

title: Rebellion Bourbon
description: Look for bold, beautiful caramel aromatics, with a hint of dried apricot. At 94 proof, this small-batch Bourbon, aged six years, is quite hot, so expect to add water or a mixer to cool it down a bit. It feels soft on the palate and has a resiny flavor, finishing with vanilla, brown sugar, clove and cinnamon heat.

title: Red Handed Bourbon Whiskey
description: Credit is due for taking a creative approach: made with a blend of whiskeys “from across the country” (Indiana, Tennessee, Kentucky), the whiskey is re-barreled in new American oak casks with seasoned staves, then “aged in the hot Texas sun.” A sweet cinnamon-bun aroma belies a drier profile on the palate. It's on the oaky side, with cinnamon and vanilla notes, finishing brisk and dry. It feels relatively hot, but add water with care, since the flavor washes out a little too easily.

title: Appleton Estate 21 Year Old
description: This gorgeous copper-hued rum seems to shift flavors with every sip, encouraging contemplation. It starts with dry notes of espresso and bittersweet chocolate, then morphs into dark, mouthwatering brown sugar, toffee and clove, before easing into a spiced finish reminiscent of chai tea with a hint of white peach.

title: Facundo Paraíso XA Rum
description: Nut-brown in the glass, this conveys deep toffee, espresso and fudge notes, plus a heady sprinkling of baking spice. The finish is dry and spiced, flaunting dried orange peel and a light sherried note. The hefty, decorative bottle features images of the original Bacardi distillery and the Edificio Bacardi in Cuba. Part of a special-edition rum line intended to honor the founder of Bacardi and 150 years of rum-making.

title: Cockspur Old Gold
description: Bold and flavorful, this amber sipping rum offers sweet allspice, birch beer, brown sugar and caramel, plus darker notes of espresso and fudge. Finishes long, with a delicately spicy fade.

title: Facundo Eximo Rum
description: A blend of rums aged 10 years, this dark-amber beauty delivers big, sweet notes of brown sugar, Nutella and toffee finishing with allspice and clove. The notably silky, luxe feel makes for easy sipping. Part of Bacardi's special-edition rum line.

title: Smith & Cross Traditional Jamaica Rum
description: A top pick for tiki and tropical drinks, this practically begs for lime juice. Scented with warm honey notes, the palate shows lots of brown sugar and spice, plus an enticingly untamed, funky finish (the fabled *hogo*). Since it's “navy strength,” you might not want to sip it straight up—the producer wisely recommends exploring the profile first in a daiquiri—though it's smooth and interesting enough if you want to try.

title: Angostura No. 1
description: From the company best known for aromatic bitters, this limited-edition bottling (only 9,600 bottles released, starting in January 2014), is rich, velvety and dessert-like. Look for bold, relatively sweet flavors: brown sugar, vanilla and caramel, finishing long and smooth, with warming notes of hazelnut, fudge, allspice and dry cocoa. Delicious as an after-meal sipper or dessert pairing.

title: Facundo Exquisito
description: This bottling is made with a “blend of rare and exquisite rums aged from 7 to 23 years.” The flavor shows brown sugar and caramel sweetness at first but dries pleasingly on the finish, conveying dark chocolate, espresso, and spice cake. Consider as a dessert pairing or post-prandial sipper. Part of Bacardi's special-edition rum line.

title: Mount Gay Black Barrel
description: Finished in “deeply toasted and charred” Bourbon casks, this mouthwatering small-batch rum skews to the sweeter side, offering bold notes of cola, allspice and vanilla, finishing brisk and spicy. Sip straight or mix for the ultimate rum & Coke.

title: Plantation Rum 2001 Old Reserve Jamaica
description: This honey-hued rum is richly aromatic, suggesting creamy caramel and baking spice, with just a hint of banana in the background. On the palate, look for lots of spicy fireworks upfront—black pepper, hot cinnamon, clove—followed by a gentle fade of brown sugar and butterscotch. Mix for a mind-blowing mai tai.

title: Brinley Gold Shipwreck Vanilla Rum
description: Blended with Madagascar vanilla extract, this flavored rum has a mild, oaky aroma, a rounded, robust vanilla-bean flavor touched with coffee and a cinnamon zing.

title: Plantation Rum 2001 Old Reserve Barbados
description: Tawny and bright in the glass, it shows rich caramel, brown sugar and hazelnut. The experience concludes with allspice and clove, plus a flicker of alcohol heat.

title: South Bay Rum
description: If you can't get your hands on Cuban rum, this may be the next best thing. It's a small-batch rum “produced by Cuban hands in the Dominican Republic.” It's markedly sweet and vanilla-forward on the palate, hinting at cola and sarsaparilla, with touches of allspice, orange peel and clove on the finish.  Sip or mix.

title: Appleton Estate V/X
description: Consider this smooth and pleasing rum for dessert pairings. It has a slightly sweet, distinctively nutty flavor that suggests almond and hazelnut, plus touches of baked apple and spice and a buttery finish.

title: Cannes Brulées Classic Dark Rum
description: This pouring rum is light gold in the glass, with a mild, maple-like aroma. On the palate, it's darker and warmer than you might expect, redolent of oak and vanilla plus dark chocolate and baking spice on the warm, inviting finish.

title: Mount Gay Eclipse
description: Golden and mild. Look for notes of brown sugar, oak and warming baking spice throughout, ending on a crisp, bright finish.

title: Denaka Black Cherry Vodka
description: The scent of this clear vodka is intensely sugary, to the point where it might be mistaken for rum. The flavor is sweet as well with an intensely almond cherry-pit finish. Best served very, very cold.

title: Little Black Dress Vodka Black Cherry Vanilla
description: This clear spirit has a lovely, delicate cherry blossom scent with a hint of vanilla. But there's none of the delicacy on the tongue—it's a wallop of sweetness. Diluted with grapefruit juice or a bitter liqueur to temper the sweetness, it might regain its equilibrium.

title: Stoli Razberi
description: Clear, with a mild raspberry scent. At first it has a great true-berry taste, but unfortunately it gets crowded out by a lingering bitterness. Best served tall, with lots of ice and a splash of juice.

title: Stoli Blueberi
description: Warm, intense aroma, somewhere between ripe plums and candy. When sipped straight, this vodka has an overwhelming, medicinal bitterness. Yet with lots of lime and sugar, such as in a blueberry-flavored caipiroska, that fades away completely and the aromatics take center stage.

title: Eristoff Black Wild Berry
description: Sinister inky black, this spirit's claim to fame is that it stains your tongue black. It has a sweet but ersatz blackberry-blueberry aroma and flavor, like an energy drink. At 40 proof, it's not overly alcoholic, but even diluted it's still a scary, murky black—which might be an asset for Halloween party punches.

title: Firelit Coffee Liqueur Yirg
description: Coffee geeks will go bananas for this liqueur made with single-origin cold-brewed beans roasted by cult favorite Blue Bottle Coffee. Looks and smells like brewed espresso in the glass. It's not too sweet, has a bracingly bitter edge and a lingering true-coffee finish that clings tenaciously to the palate. Oddly, it's better without milk—it just doesn't need it.

title: Qi White Exotic Oranges & White Tea Liqueur
description: Look out, triple sec, you may have competition. Bold, sweet and complex, this spirit has a golden orange glow and a bright, juicy citrus and honeysuckle aroma. Front-loaded honey, orange blossom and lemon zest flavors ease into a subtle, pleasantly lingering, floral finish. This liqueur would lend itself to a fizzy, spritz-like drink with ease, and blends dreamily with gin. Lovely.

title: Kahlua
description: This rum-based liqueur is a classic for mixing with coffee. The dominant flavors are a familiar dark chocolate-vanilla hybrid, bold and sweet, only nodding at roasted coffee on the lingering finish. Sippable straight up, perhaps because of its relatively low alcohol content.

title: Firelit Coffee Liqueur Mocha Java
description: Here's another single-origin coffee liqueur, this one made with aged mocha Java beans roasted by Weaver's Coffee. This light-textured brew has a nutty, roasted coffee bean scent and a light sweetness, with most of the espresso on the finish. Ice brightens the flavor and draws out more pungent coffee notes. With a splash of milk, it mimics iced coffee with a hint of alcohol buzz. Would make a very fine White Russian.

title: Galliano Ristretto
description: From the makers of golden Galliano liqueur, this dark-brown spirit arrives in the same striking pyramid-shaped bottle. This thick, velvety liqueur has a sweet, dark-roast coffee flavor and aroma, and winds into a rich finish with a light anise note. Claims to be the only espresso liqueur made from both Arabica and Robusta coffee beans. This may not be a selling point; most coffee experts frown on Robusta's strong, bitter notes. Still, this should shine in an espresso martini.

title: Qi Black Smoked Black Tea Liqueur
description: Smoky and sultry. The scent is intriguing, a blend of black tea, vanilla, leather, cigar smoke and a deep, musky dried fig note. This nut-brown spirit is very dry, finishing with licorice, spicy nutmeg and black pepper. Mixologists will love this one for unusual cocktails, but for most, it might be perceived as too challenging a flavor for everyday use. It would benefit from a little more sweetness. A natural match for whiskey—try this blended with Bourbon and a hit of simple syrup.

title: Dolce Nero Espresso Liqueur
description: This medium-brown, light-bodied spirit has a pungent, bright espresso aroma and a sweet, intense coffee flavor. Although it's a little much straight up, a splash of milk helps mellow the flavor. Recommended for a blended coffee cocktail.

title: Patron XO Café
description: Deep brown and syrupy with sweet, subtle coffee aroma. This Tequila-based liqueur should meld especially nicely with Tequila-based cocktails, or with hot coffee as a digestif. Best with ice and a hit of milk or cream.

title: Molinari Sambuca -Caffé Liquore
description: A blend of Sambuca and coffee yields a rich, full-flavored anisette spirit with just a faint whiff of coffee on the finish. Billing this as a coffee liqueur does it a disservice, although it would be awfully nice mixed with coffee as an after-dinner quaff.

title: Heering Coffee Liqueur
description: From the makers of Cherry Heering. This rich, dark brown spirit was the most chocolaty of all the coffee liqueurs sampled, more mocha than flat-out coffee. Although it's a little cloying straight up, ice mellows out the alcohol a bit, and milk softens the flavor.

title: Chivas Regal 25 Year Old
description: Complex and flavorful, with raisin and fresh apple aromas in a supersoft, silky texture. Add a splash of water to coax out intense clove, burnt orange, caramel and crème brûlée notes.The smoky finish is the long-lingering type that whisky aficionados exclaim over for 10 minutes as the flavors continue to kaleidoscope. For maximum enjoyment, sip without any whisky aficionados around.

title: Johnnie Walker Blue Label
description: A honey-colored whisky with a spicy, smoky fragrance. The first sip is surprisingly sweet and honeyed, then the smoke gently creeps in like fog at dawn, softly surrounding the edges of the tongue.

title: Johnnie Walker Green Label
description: This maple syrup-toned spirit is a blend of Islay and Speyside malts, with no grain whisky added. The result is an effortless mix of lightly smoky and oaky caramel notes, and a smooth, velvety feel. A splash of branchwater amps up the peat quotient.

title: Compass Box Asyla
description: A top choice for those who prefer a lighter whisky style. The pale straw color and gentle vanilla and fresh pear aromas hint at what's to come. On the palate, expect a flash of sweetness, finishing with caramel and a faint veil of smoke. Mouthwatering.
