title: Johnnie Walker Gold Label
description: This amber blend of 15 whiskies, each aged at least 18 years, yields a mellow, balanced mix of sweet caramel, raisin and smoky notes, all lingering and pleasing. Serve chilled, possibly as a dessert pairing.

title: Black Bull 12-year-old
description: At first, this whisky reads as sweet, with loads of vanilla, but finishes dry with sparks of ginger and cloves and lingering notes of dark chocolate and burnt toffee. Surprisingly balanced for a cask-strength spirit.

title: Dewar's 12 Years Old
description: At first, the scent is mild and sweet, but with time opens up to a distinct caramel aroma with a tinge of orange peel. Although fairly boozy on the palate at first sip, eventually this viscous, honey-colored spirit emerges as mellow and fruity, and faintly peated. A splash of water coaxes out more vanilla tones. Good value.

title: Grant's Family Reserve
description: A suave and smooth mix of Dufftown and Speyside Scotches. The burnished copper spirit has lively orange peel, butterscotch and baking spice notes and a buttery finish. Good value.

title: The Talisman
description: In a word: light. From the pale amber color to the mild vanilla scent, this spirit is gentle, soft and breezy all around. Look for a flash of caramel sweetness and a light smoky finish. Pair with a Scottish smoked salmon appetizer. Good value.

title: The Black Grouse
description: Lightly smoky, lightly fruity aroma, this spirit shows a little more caramel the more you dip into the glass. The primary flavor is a lingering peaty note, but also has some nice undercurrents of caramel and honey.

title: Dewar's 18 Years Old
description: Give this soft, smooth whisky a little time to open up. At first, it reads as fruity, oaky and a little floral, but after a while deeper caramel and almond aromas open up. Dried fruit, vanilla, and caramel flavors segue into a lingering smoky finish, which accelerates with repeated sips.

title: Johnnie Walker Black Label
description: This deep amber spirit, a blend of over 40 whiskies, has a sweet, deeply caramel scent, with a tinge of dried fruit. The flavor is oaky, smoky and dry; a little ice water mellows it nicely and coaxes out some burnt-caramel and raisiny notes. Lingering, moderately smoky finish.

title: Black Bull 40-year-old
description: Light amber. Smells like juicy apples, with a hint of vanilla. Expect lingering notes of smoke and caramel, with a brisk, mouthwatering finish. Best with a splash of water.

title: Wemyss Malts Smooth Gentleman
description: As the name suggests, this whisky is smooth indeed. Honeyed, light peat, and faint clove aromas, and flavors of burnt orange peel, dark honey and a wisp of smoke on the finish. The fruity notes suggest this would play well with vermouth in a Bobby Burns or Manhattan-style cocktail.

title: Chivas Regal 18 Years
description: Sweet, honeyed, caramel notes. The flavor is sweet, with an astringent, citrusy note, and light smokiness drifting on the finish. Mellow, viscous feel.

title: Blue Ice American Vodka
description: Neutral, faintly juniper-like scent. Smooth, mellow, earthy/malty flavor. Made from Idaho russet potatoes.

title: Prairie Organic
description: In a world where distillers routinely announce their vodka is distilled X number of times, it's refreshing to see that Prairie says “each batch is distilled as many times as necessary,” usually four to six times. The resulting spirit is equally refreshing: smooth, lightly sweet, with a creamy feel andclean finish. Distilled from corn, the vodka also is certified organic and kosher.

title: Peabody Jones Vodka
description: Brisk and warming, this Washington State vodka has a honeyed, almond-like scent and an agave-like, slightly vegetal character with a little burn in the back of the throat. Great for a savory drink, like a vodka-based Bloody Mary. Certified organic.

title: Charbay Vodka All-American Grain
description: This soft, gin-like vodka has juniper and coriander notes and a brisk, lightly sweet finish. Serve on the rocks, or shaken into a well-chilled martini.

title: Mark One Vodka
description: Look for a faint sweetness, chased by grapefruit peel, vanilla and pink peppercorn notes. Smooth, light feel. Excellent value.

title: Telluride Vodka
description: From Colorado comes this corn-based vodka, packaged in a broad-shouldered bottle printed with a rugged mountain range. Despite the rough exterior, the spirit inside is gentle and sweet, with a warm, light melon scent and a touch of vanilla on the finish.

title: Watershed Distillery Vodka
description: This small-batch spirit has a faintly floral aroma and a sweet taste with distinctly citrusy notes and a clean, dry finish. However, ice changes the character, drawing out sweeter vanilla tones. Vodka tonic material. Distilled from corn.

title: Crop Organic Artisanal Vodka
description: Mellow and restrained, with a smooth feel and a sweet flavor with a light vanilla finish. Distilled from certified organic grain and bottled in Princeton, Minnesota.

title: Burnett's Vodka
description: A clean, neutral, smooth vodka through and through, and a good value to boot. Note: Burnett's also makes a delicious lime-flavored vodka.

title: Square One Organic Vodka
description: A sweet and smooth spirit with rich marshmallow notes. Certified organic, this spirit is made with rye. Great for a vodka tonic.

title: Ice Glen Vodka
description: Those who value neutrality in vodka will appreciate this small-batch offering, with its neutral scent and mellow, warm, vaguely sweet flavor. Ice coaxes out additional sweet vanilla tones.

title: Grays Peak Small Batch Vodka
description: Distilled from American grain and charcoal filtered, this vodka has a faint vanilla scent and a subtle sweetness, with a faint gingery twang on the finish.

title: Death's Door Vodka
description: Distilled from hard red winter wheat, this vodka ranges toward the sweeter side, with a marshmallow-like scent, a light, lingering vanilla flavor and creamy mouthfeel.

title: Star Vodka by Charles Ferri
description: Made from corn, this limited-edition vodka flashes a brisk, clean scent and sweet marshmallow and citrus notes, chased by a faintly bitter aftertaste. Gluten free.

title: Penn 1681 Vodka
description: Light, citrusy aroma, soft feel, and a sweet, cookie dough-like flavor. This vodka is distilled from rye, which explains the pleasant bite on the finish. Striking bottle with a graphic of grain fields visible through the bottle.

title: NadaRed
description: This vodka alternates sweet and spice. The aroma is sweet, with light floral and vanilla notes. On the tongue, it starts sweet, but finishes with zesty ginger and clove. 100% of the net profits benefit charity—that's certainly sweet.

title: Americana Luxury Vodka
description: Neutral flavor, vanilla aftertaste, thick feel. Best chilled, which perks up the spirit. Distilled from a mix of corn, wheat, rye and barley. The jazzy red, white, and blue bottle would make a fine centerpiece for holiday gatherings.

title: Rain Organics
description: The vodka inside the pretty rainbow-shaped bottle reads almost like a light rum. It has a sweet, marshmallow-like fragrance as well as a sweet vanilla flavor, unmitigated by ice. Very smooth. Made from organic white corn and distilled seven times.

title: Tacama Pisco Puro Quebranta
description: An aromatic pisco, with a luscious cherry-almond fragrance. At first, the spirit is sweet and lightly fruity, then clove, ginger and black pepper notes spark up in the middle, and it finishes lightly floral and spicy. Expect a touch of alcohol burn, since this is distilled to 88 proof, but overall a beautiful, balanced and complex spirit.

title: Tacama Pisco Albilla
description: Look for floral, vanilla, and ripe apple notes in the fragrance. The flavor is reminiscent of banana cream pie, with some coconut and faint floral notes on the finish. Very smooth and warm.

title: Sagatiba Pura
description: Though it smells like vanilla-mint Lifesavers, the flavor of this cachaça is bright and lightly sweet, with some spicy notes on the finish. Soft feel. Good value.

title: Tacama Pisco Quebranta
description: Another aromatic pisco from Vina Tacama, with a pretty fragrance reminiscent of pears, bananas, and lily-of-the-valley. This is a full-flavored pisco with banana and creamy vanilla notes. Recommended for straight-up sipping.

title: Pisco Capel Reservado
description: The scent reads as fruity and a touch smoky; on the tongue, it's surprisingly sweet, finishing long and fruity, with some herbaceous and vanilla notes on the finish. A smooth and sophisticated pisco, and an excellent value.

title: Sagatiba Velha
description: Two years of barrel aging create a soft amber color and an oaky, light caramel scent. This spirit benefits from a little time in the glass to open up, but results in a rich, brown-sugar flavor with a nutty, oaky finish.

title: Cabana Cachaça
description: Distinctive vanilla scent with a light floral note. This cachaça has strong, sweet flavor, a thick mouth-coating texture and a custardy finish. Adding ice and soda lightens this spirit, so it almost reads like gin & tonic. Excellent for caipirinhas.

title: Ypioca Cachaça Prata
description: This estate-produced cachaça has a candied-fruit scent and a mellow, earthy flavor with a lingering sweet vanilla note. Soft, smooth feel. Although it's aged two years, it's still crystal clear.

title: Gran Sierpe Pisco
description: “Gran sierpe” means “great snake.” Though some might expect a raw, pungent spirit inside to match the punchy serpent-design bottle, instead the liquid inside is delicate, with subtle rosewater and violet notes in the aroma and flavor. A faint black pepper and anise tingle on the finish provides some backbone. Good value.

title: Vinas de Oro Mosto Verde Quebranta
description: This brazen hussy comes off as sweet and delicate at first, with its fresh apple and sweet, oaky aroma. But at heart, this spirit is earthy, fruity and bold, finishing relatively dry, with teasing Sherry-like notes. Try this one in a pisco sour.

title: Novo Fogo Gold Organic Cachaça
description: Certified organic and matured in repurposed Bourbon casks for at least two years, this aged cachaça has a tawny color and thick butterscotch aroma. Crème brûlée and coconut flavors are chased by a lingering caramel and oak finish.

title: Ypioca Cachaça Ouro
description: Golden color from two years of barrel aging. The mildly smoky scent opens up to deeper caramel notes. This is a luscious aged cachaça, sweet and smooth, with a lingering interplay of smoky and burnt toffee notes on the finish.

title: Angels Envy Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: A beautiful, mouthwatering newcomer to the whiskey scene. Named for the “angel's share,” the portion that evaporates from the barrel during the aging process, this golden amber spirit is finished in Port barrels, which explains those juicy red-fruit notes that slide into the long finish. Look for orange peel, vanilla and roasted nut flavors, too.

title: Woodford Reserve Masters Collection: Rare Rye Release New Cask Rye
description: Part of a 2-bottle (375 ml) set that also includes Aged Cask Rye, the New Cask version benefits from extra color and flavor soaked up from the barrel, and results in a truly outstanding rye specimen. Maple syrup color and heady caramel aroma with a faint whiff of burnt orange peel and brewed tea. The flavor profile veers toward the dry side, showing caramel interwoven with cocoa, leather and espresso notes, with just the right amount of spicy bite at the end.

title: Old Forester Birthday Bourbon
description: This is a complex, rich Bourbon, with notes of brown sugar and toffee, Sherry, dried figs, and hazelnut, lightened with a soft hint of fresh apples. It's a little boozy on the nose, as might be expected at nearly 100 proof, but stands up to ice or branch water for mellow, flavorful sipping.

title: Smooth Ambler Old Scout Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: This amber-hued, six-year-old Bourbon has a bright, honeyed, slightly peachy scent. On the palate, it has a sweet creaminess, very smooth and light, finishing dry and lovely with just a bit of spicy rye-like sparkle. A fine choice for Manhattans and other Bourbon-based cocktails.

title: Colonel E.H. Taylor, Jr., Single Barrel Bourbon
description: No shrinking violet here; this is a big, powerful Bourbon with a finish that just won't quit. The honey-colored spirit has a sweet, heavy caramel aroma with some deep, somber espresso notes. Look for rounded burnt-orange flavor and lots of cinnamon and nutmeg on the dry, elongated finish. Temper the alcohol sting with ice water—it's 100 proof, after all. History buffs will love the old-school style of the bottle and label.

title: Michter's US*1 Unblended American Whiskey
description: This small-batch whiskey is a treat, butter-soft and loaded with sweet toffee and hazelnut aromas and flavors. The long finish rolls toward dry espresso and mocha flavors, pepped up with clove and cinnamon.

title: Woodford Reserve Double Oaked Bourbon
description: For a warm and comforting sipper on a chilly evening, this is a fine way to go. This honey-hued Bourbon has a big, powerful, sweet caramel aroma, and a rich mix of buttery, oaky and toasty flavors. Consider it as a dessert pairing.

title: Corsair Nashville Bourbon
description: From a small distillery that is leading the Alt Whiskey movement comes this crazy-good, complex whiskey made from corn, smoked barley, rye and wheat. This spirit is front-loaded with big, sweet caramel, but without missing a beat it segues into dark chocolate, espresso, clove, cigar tobacco and every dry flavor under the sun. Plop in the biggest ice cube you can find and enjoy.

title: Clyde May's Conecuh Ridge Whiskey
description: A spry chameleon of a whiskey. At first, this dark amber spirit reads as light and sweet, from its distinct ripe apple and hazelnut notes to the light-bodied feel. But just when you think it's going to be a lightweight, there's surprising oomph on the finish, dry leather and clove notes that balance it out. This sippable whiskey would be great for whiskey sours and other cocktails.

title: High West Whiskey Son of Bourye
description: It's no exaggeration to say this well-balanced mix of bourbon and rye provides the best of both worlds, combining the sweetness of bourbon with the light spiciness of rye. Fruitcake and dried fig on the finish add complexity.

title: Jefferson's Straight Rye Whiskey
description: Produced in Canada but bottled in Louisville, this 100% rye whiskey is aged 10 years. Deep gold color, vanilla and peach aroma, soft and full-bodied, this rye has a pleasing citric brightness, lingering peachy and caramel notes with a smattering of cinnamon and clove. Would be great savored with a chunk of ice, or mixed into a rye Manhattan.

title: Breaking & Entering Bourbon
description: The antithesis of single-barrel Bourbon, this whiskey is made from 80 barrels of Kentucky Bourbon, individually selected and then blended in California. The end result is bright and pretty, a golden Bourbon with a light, fruity fragrance and touches of vanilla and honeysuckle, packaged in a tall wine bottle with an edgy label.

title: Woodford Reserve Masters Collection: Rare Rye Release Aged Cask Rye
description: Part of a two-bottle (375 ml) set that also includes New Cask Rye, the aged cask yields a soft, light rye variation, with a golden color and mild aroma. Expect creamy vanilla, a touch of lemon, and a clean finish, braced by a bit of brisk alcohol at the end. This is made for classic cocktails.

title: Corsair Ryemageddon
description: The name says it all: it's bright and energetic, leaning toward riotous. The complex aroma includes apricots and lemon peel mingled with sarsaparilla, honey, and vanilla. On the palate, vanilla dominates, sparked with baking spices, black pepper and a creamy, citrusy note. It's a little hot straight up, but would be dynamite in a Sazerac or other cocktail.

title: Bowman Brothers Virginia Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Though it needs a little coaxing, this small-batch Bourbon is a fitting tribute to the four Bowman brothers, Virginia militia officers in the Revolutionary War. Give it some time and a splash of ice water, and the aromas and flavors open up. Look for sweet notes of almond, cocoa and caramel, plus the clove and nutmeg notes that build on the finish.

title: Bulleit Rye Whiskey
description: This amber whiskey is made with 95% rye, which puts it on the very high-rye side of the spectrum, and gives it a spicy zip. In some ways, this evokes an ultradry version of an orange liqueur, with juicy orange notes dusted with black pepper, clove, nutmeg and a faint hoppy note.

title: Paddleford Creek Bourbon Whiskey
description: This bright golden small-batch Bourbon would make for a top-notch whiskey sour, with its surprisingly delicate fragrance. Its touches of lemon peel and creamy vanilla, and smooth character make it one worth noting.

title: Corsair Small Batch Triple Smoke American Malt Whiskey
description: A good local alternative for peaty Scotch-lovers, made with a unique blend of three batches of whiskeys smoked with cherry wood, beech wood and peat. Given some time to open up, a waft of smoke mingles with the fruity, malty scent. On the palate, the smoke really builds, but manages to hit the brakes before it overwhelms everything, fading into a burnt-orange, caramel finish. Pair with aged cheeses.

title: Smooth Ambler Yearling Bourbon
description: Aged 6 months, this small-batch wheated Bourbon is a good choice for cocktails. Although a resiny note in the aroma overwhelms the ribbon of caramel, otherwise this bright amber spirit is warm and inviting.

title: Watkins Select Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: This Bourbon has mellow finesse, from its warm, inviting honey and peaches aroma to elegant flavors that start toffee-like, then fade to leather and black tea notes.

title: Wild Turkey 81 Kentucky Bourbon
description: Aged 6–8 years in “alligator charred” oak barrels, this Bourbon has a sweet crème brûlée aroma, with a bit of fruity freshness behind it. Despite the sweet scent, it's dry and bracing on the palate. This is a great light Bourbon, perfect for mixing, and it would do well topped up with ginger ale and a squeeze of fresh lime.

title: Hancock's President's Reserve Single Barrel Bourbon Whiskey
description: Despite the mild apple and chamomile tea scent, the flavor of this Kentucky small-batch Bourbon is surprisingly big. The honey notes really linger, and even amp up through the finish into a crescendo of cinnamon and clove.

title: St. George Single Malt Whiskey Lot 11
description: This sunny gold single malt feels so beautifully light and smooth, it threatens to float right off the tongue. The fresh aroma mixes honeysuckle, lychee, pineapple and vanilla. On the palate, a beer-like hoppy note plays against a bit of vanilla and hazelnut. Well balanced.

title: High West Whiskey Double Rye
description: This light and perky rye has a warm, soft baked-apple scent. On the palate, look for citrus layered with lingering vanilla, cinnamon and nutmeg.

title: Black Eagle Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Golden and bright, this aromatic Bourbon has an exceptionally fresh fragrance mixing apples and lily of the valley with just a delicate touch of vanilla and a faint minty tinge. Soft, creamy and light on the palate.

title: Balcones True Blue Cask Strength Corn Whisky
description: This unique artisan whiskey from Texas is made with roasted Hopi blue corn, then matured in lightly charred new American oak barrels. The result is bold vanilla, cream soda and brown sugar aromas, and a sweet profile with lots of toffee and orange peel. It's delicious, but a bit hot and rough, and some will find this too strong altogether, even with significant dilution.

title: Balcones 1 Texas Single Malt Whisky Special Release
description: Finished in ex-Bourbon casks, this dark amber Texas single malt has a thick, syrupy scent, evoking caramel and root beer. Although the alcohol level is palate-numbingly boozy, the flavors are interestingly complex and dry, showing cocoa, leather and espresso.

title: Charbay Whiskey Hop Flavored Whiskey, Lot R-5.
description: A whiskey for beer-lovers: Distilled from Racer 5 Beer, and aged in French Oak barrels. The spirit has a peppy scent of fresh apple and pear, plus touches of honey, pepper and smoke. On the palate, it's hot and astringent, though it mellows with plenty of water to show a beer-like note, a wash of honey and a sprinkle of black pepper and cinnamon on the finish.

title: Kansas Clean Distilled Spirit Whiskey
description: Despite its odious hipsters-only ad campaign, there's some merit to marketing this as an alternative for whiskey-haters. Drink this blindfolded, and you might swear it's a coconut-flavored vodka. It's nearly transparent, with just the faintest golden tinge, it smells like coconut and marshmallow, and it has a pronounced coconut cream flavor with a hint of vanilla and a smooth finish. It's not that this product is bad—it's not—but it's not really whiskey, either.

title: John B. Stetson Bourbon Whiskey
description: Honey-colored with vibrant orange highlights, this Bourbon is aged at least four years. Give this spirit some time and space to breathe. The aroma has an almost gamy, meaty quality, laid over with vanilla, almond and caramel. On the palate, almond flavors give way to a rather hot and brawny but long caramel finish that dries to a pleasingly leathery tone.

title: Anestasia Vodka
description: It's really all about the striking glacier-shaped bottle, although some will find the pointy-capped, angular vessel challenging to open and pour. The liquid inside is relatively neutral on the nose and palate, marked by hints of grapefruit peel and black pepper sizzle and a light, silky finish. Distilled from corn.

title: Jules Theuriet Crème de Cassis de Dijon
description: Expect an inky hue and mild dark-berry aroma plus a gentle hint of violet. The palate leads with dark fruit and moderate sweetness, suggesting blackberry jam and Concord grape, finishing long, sweet and a little sticky, with a brush of raspberry. Dessert-worthy.

title: Metcalfe's Blueberry Liqueur
description: This is deep and dark in the glass and showing a bit of garnet glow around the edges. Look for moderate sweetness, with Concord grape on the nose and palate lightened by a whiff of rosemary freshness. Sip or mix. This is a corn-based spirit, made in small batches using wild Maine blueberries.

title: Villa de Varda Blueberry Liqueur
description: This grappa-based liqueur has a warm ruby hue and herbaceous scent featuring a perky, vegetal spearmint edge. The palate mixes dark fruit and mint, finishing on an anise twang. This relatively dry spirit almost drinks like a light amaro. It won't be for someone seeking a sweet dessert sip, but would add complexity to cocktails.

title: Jahiot Crème de Cassis
description: This blackcurrant liqueur has a concentrated, inky hue and a mildly herbaceous scent, with not much fruit at all. The palate, however, is laden with sticky-sweet raspberry and stewed blackberry, leading into a moderate finish.

title: Merlet Crème de Cassis
description: The fruit-forward aroma leads with luscious dark berry, freshened with a whiff of pine needle. The same powerful flavors are echoed on the bold palate: Lots of sweet-tart fruit, with that hint of pine returning on the finish. Some will find the thick, viscous blackcurrant liqueur a bit much to sip straight up; a little will go a long way in a whiskey cocktail.

title: Jules Theuriet Crème de Framboise
description: This raspberry liqueur has a vibrant garnet hue and muted scent. The palate is light, with an oxidized fruit note reminiscent of port and a moderately long exit with a pleasing black cherry accent.

title: Germain-Robin Alembic Brandy One-Time Blend No. 25
description: Snap up this limited edition bottling: Given a few minutes to open in the glass, this brandy entices with fresh fig, golden raisin and baked pear aromas. The soft palate intertwines crème brûlée, fruit and baking spice, finishing long with subtle dark chocolate, leather and dried orange peel accents. Some will say it's reminiscent of excellent Armagnac, but really it's the gold standard of what American-made brandy can be. A blend of 1993 Pinot Noir, 1997 old vine Sémillon and a younger Colombard married in French oak.

title: Arkansas Black 21 Year Old Straight Applejack
description: This limited-edition apple brandy offers big, rounded stone fruit and fresh apple integrated with palate-coating vanilla, almond and honey, finishing long with zingy ginger, cinnamon and clove. Overall, a good balance of fruit and oak, suited for sipping or mixing. Aged in French ex-Chardonnay barrels, the producer bills this as the “longest-aged domestic apple brandy available anywhere.” Only 20 barrels made.

title: Germain-Robin Single Barrel Riesling
description: This golden brandy is redolent with dried apricot, waxy honey and a hint of banana funk. The nuanced palate leads with butterscotch richness, but then leads to sherry, apricot and vanilla, with hints of gingery heat and chamomile on the warming finish. Made from 100% Riesling, distilled in 1998 and aged 16 years on French oak.

title: Millard Fillmore Brandy
description: A budget-minded option from a maker of some of the finest American brandies around. Look for a honey hue and mild vanilla aroma. The palate feels light, as fleetingly sweet vanilla and almond winds into a cinnamon and nutmeg finish. Sip or mix this versatile California grape brandy.

title: Angela & Gene A&G; Reserve Michigan Brandy
description: While made with Michigan grapes, this brandy is reminiscent of Calvados, Normandy's apple brandy. The aroma suggests orchard fruit and oak, while the drying palate offers dark honey and baked apple, finishing crisp with hints of vanilla, tea, oak and clove. Made from a base of Riesling, Pinot Gris and Chardonnay grapes.

title: Frísco Brandy
description: This pisco-inspired immature brandy is made from California grapes. It's clear in the glass, with a sweet, distinctly fruity scent. The palate echoes that sweetness, warming all the way down and finishing with an echo of tropical fruit. Mix into cocktails and you just might fool your favorite pisco-lover.

title: Blue Sky Mining Brandy
description: Honey-hued in the glass, look for jazzy, bright orchard fruit on the nose and palate, plus an herbaceous chamomile note and a hoppy effervescence on the tongue reminiscent of beer. The long finish hints at pear. Made from seven-year-old Muscat brandy finished for 30 days in a Kentucky hogshead. It's 100 proof, so be sure to add dilution to taste.

title: Arkansas Black Straight Applejack
description: Named in homage to the producer's great grandfather, who made cider and favored Arkansas Black Apples, this 100% apple brandy was “rested outdoors” for two years in ex-Cognac casks (most barrels are aged indoors), then one year in new American oak. The end result is an inviting butterscotch-tinged aroma and drying, relatively hot palate showing vanilla, oak, and bitter chocolate, with just a hint of fruit on the finish.

title: Dogfish Head Esprit Malade
description: Think of this as a spirit-cider hybrid, made with a blend of barrel-aged apple brandy, hard apple cider and sweet, non-alcoholic cider. It's juicy and relatively light on the alcohol content, though it still packs plenty of punch. Look for an amber hue, bright apricot and vanilla scents and a distinctly sweet palate enlivened by citrusy tang and mouthwatering acidity. It's similar to French beverages like Pommeau or Pineau de Charentes, which also combine juice and brandy.

title: 3 Marlenas Apple Brandy
description: This unusual apple brandy is aged five years, with two of those in used tequila barrels. It has a bright golden hue and light aromas of vanilla, oak and fresh apple. The zingy palate starts soft but accelerates into cayenne, oak and vanilla on the midpalate, and edges into a long, spicy fade. Adding water coaxes out tropical fruit notes, but the flavor doesn't hold up with too much dilution, so go easy.

title: Spirit of St. Supery
description: Distilled from a base of Moscato made from estate, this straw-hued brandy is light and reminiscent of honey and white flowers on the nose and palate, finishing rounded and floral with a faint ginger flicker.

title: Christian Brothers Sacred Bond Bottled-in-Bond Brandy
description: This California grape brandy is aged four years in former bourbon barrels, then bottled at 100 proof. Expect a dark amber hue and Bourbon-like nose and palate suggesting vanilla, cocoa, oak and a hint of dried fig. Adding water tames the fire a bit and brings more vanilla forward. Recommended for mixing into sidecars.

title: Velvet Night Brandy
description: A small-batch brandy made from California wine grapes, the producer says that each batch is different; this one is made with Chardonnay grapes, aged for at least two years in American and European oak barrels and bottled at cask strength. The end result is pleasing vanilla sweetness on the nose that suggests cookie dough. The palate opens with a flicker of orange peel, drying to an astringent midpalate, and finishes quite fiery, with clove, vanilla and black pepper.

title: Copper & Kings Floodwall Apple Brandy
description: The dark copper hue and succulent toffee and vanilla aroma entice. The palate is quite fiery from the first sip, leading with spicy cinnamon and cayenne and fading to a baked apple finish. Adding water tames some of the alcohol heat and brings more oak forward. Aged a minimum of four years in ex-Kentucky Bourbon barrels and oloroso sherry casks.

title: 1889 Royal Brandy VS
description: Amber in the glass, this grape brandy has honey and oak aromas, and a surprisingly sweet flavor that coats the palate with honey, vanilla and maple, finishing oaky on hints of orange peel and fiery cayenne and clove. Natural flavor and caramel color added.

title: Malvados Wicked Vermont Apple Brandy
description: The producer says this brandy is a Vermont version of France's Calvados brandy, but there is a muskiness that is more akin to the fermented funk of some Spanish ciders. Look for a honey hue, a funky scent almost like aged cheese, and a dry, tannic palate that favors oak over fruit, finishing long with hints of walnut, oak and hops. A splash of water coaxes out a clove note. Aged less than four years.

title: Harvest Apple
description: This is 100% Virginia apple brandy aged in Virginia wine casks. The amber hue and rich, nutty, sweet aroma almost suggests a pecan liqueur with a hit of booze on the nose. The palate doesn't match that promise of sweetness and richness. This is oak-forward and bone dry, with a whisper of nutty sweetness on the exit.

title: Charles Street Apple Brandy Eau de Vie
description: Brace yourself: the producer says this apple eau de vie (unaged brandy) is “distilled in the style of traditional mezcal.” What does that mean, exactly? From a technical standpoint: smoked apple pomace is part of the distillation process. From a tasting point of view: it's clear in the glass, potent (nearly 100 proof) and it does drink a little like a mezcal, with a musky floral scent and green apple flavor punctuated by white pepper and cayenne sizzle.

title: Don Amado Reposado
description: You don't see too many barrel-aged mezcals, and this one is a beauty. Four months in used brandy casks gives this espadín mezcal a straw hue and enticing, well-integrated layers of dried apricot, honey, Sherry, gingery spice and Scotch-like smoke.

title: Don Amado Anejo
description: Aged 18–24 months in used brandy casks, this unusual anejo bottling has a vibrant honey hue and bold, dessert-like flavors that suggest vanilla and custardy flan layered over a smoky core, finishing long with fig and raisin richness. A flicker of smoke around the edges reminds that this is mezcal, not Cognac.

title: Mezcal Real Minero Pechuga
description: The scent is rich and almost chicken-soup savory, while the rounded palate shows subtle honey-like sweetness at first, drying midpalate to leaner notes of menthol, rosemary and rubber. The long, lip-smacking finish brings back honey, this time mingled with light smoke and cayenne sparks.

title: Mezcales de Leyenda Puebla Mezcal
description: Showing a faint straw tinge in the glass, this is a mild but complex mezcal. It opens with a waft of mesquite-like savory smoke, plus hints of cumin, black pepper and coriander. The finish is clean and brisk, with citrus, white pepper and a touch of vanilla.

title: Rey Campero Mezcal
description: Brash and complex, look for bright bell pepper and fresh basil aromas. The mouthwatering palate also shows plenty of bold vegetal notes, drying to rubber, a moderate amount of smoke and a spicy flicker of cayenne on the finish.

title: Alessio Vermouth Bianco
description: Sip or mix this fresh, breezy bianco. Light straw in the glass, the aromas suggest ripe pears, white flowers, and freshly mown grass. The smooth, medium-bodied palate echoes that delicate freshness, but adds more rounded fruit on the finish.

title: Linie Aquavit
description: Stored in former Sherry casks, this aquavit famously takes a sea voyage across the world, sailing to Australia and back, crossing the equator or “linie” twice. The end result is a bright buttercup hue and mellow vanilla, spearmint, clove and oak tones, plus a silky butterscotch finish.

title: Cinzano 1757 Vermouth Rosso
description: Pleasing enough to drink straight, this deep plum-hued vermouth features an oxidized scent that suggests raisins and dried figs. Rich and fruit-forward on the palate, the dried fruit flavor gives over to a relatively dry finish with bitter hints of grapefruit peel, gentian and dried herbs.

title: Aalborg Jubilaeums Akvavit
description: This barrel-aged bottling tracks back to a 1946 launch, when it celebrated Aalborg's 100-year jubilee, hence the name. The barrel time adds a bright gold hue and mild vanilla sweetness, but it's still lively, with bracing mint and savory caraway layered on coriander and anise for a warming finish.

title: Atxa Red Vermouth
description: Dried dates and figs lead the nose on this bold, complex vermouth. The succulent dried fruit character also shows up on the palate, as a flash of sweetness dries to a tannic, mouthwatering finish accented with cocoa, orange peel and spice.

title: Boissiere Extra Dry Vermouth
description: The producer jokingly calls it “Bone White Boissiere,” but it's indeed bracingly dry, with mouthwatering acidity. The aroma has a faint earthiness but no sweetness to it, while the palate adds mild pear and elderflower, finishing with just a squeak of citrus. Sip with a curl of lemon peel, or substitute it for dry Sherry in food pairings or cocktails.

title: Brennivin Anniversary Edition Cask Aged
description: This barrel-aged aquavit is pale straw in the glass and shows just the barest whiff of vanilla. On the palate, look for toasty oak, pear and light honey sweetness, finishing gently spiced.

title: Krogstad Festlig Aquavit
description: This is big and bold, with plenty of anise, licorice and caraway on the nose and palate, plus hints of fennel, black pepper and cinnamon zing on the spicy, mouthwatering finish. Producer recommends for a “Norwegian Bloody Mary,” with tomato juice, lemon and spices.

title: Cinzano Extra Dry
description: Versatile and crisp, this vermouth has the palest straw tinge and a mild scent that suggests honey, white peach and  dried herbs. The palate is juicy with stone fruit, finishing clean.

title: Vermut Lustau Rojo
description: An interesting newcomer to the U.S. market, the base of this vermouth is rich, nutty Sherry—80% amontillado and 20% Pedro Ximenez, to be precise. It has a coffee-brown hue  and a bright dried-herb scent. The palate wows with sticky toffee, dried apricot, orange peel and cocoa. Ideal for adding complexity to drinks featuring dark spirits.

title: Riserva Carlo Alberto Vermut de Torino Vermut Blanc
description: This is a bold, rich vermouth that could stand up in cocktails with more assertive spirits. Vibrant marigold in the glass, the rich, sweet aroma is almost dessert-like, evoking Sherry, golden raisins, honey and cardamom. The palate echoes those notes—baked apple, vanilla, honey, plus a gentle spiced fade.

title: Brennivin Aquavit
description: Nuanced and palate-cleansing, look for a mild, savory scent and bracing notes of dill, fennel seed and pine, plus a brisk, zingy finish that suggests caraway-seeded rye bread. Pair this refreshing sip with herring or other savory bites.

title: Cinzano Rosso
description: Raspberry jam and dried fig scents mingle in this dark plum-hued vermouth. The palate is mouthwateringly tart, with juicy dark fruit, berry and dried cherry flavors and a  tinge of cocoa on the finish.

title: Alessio Vermouth Torino Rosso
description: Landing on the more bitter end of the vermouth spectrum, almost feeling like a cross between sweet vermouth and amaro, this nut-brown bottling has a roots-and-herbs aroma with a dark berry-like hint in back. On the palate, it's plummy and mouthwateringly tart, with a just-bitter-enough finish that shows dried herbs, sarsaparilla and espresso.

title: Cinzano Bianco
description: The mild scent— honey, ripe pear, elderflower—signals what is to come on the palate, sweet with pear, vanilla and honey, finishing with a gentle citrus note. A versatile option for a wide range of cocktails.

title: La Quintinye Vermouth Royal Rouge
description: Almost reminiscent of an amaro, this deep brown-hued vermouth has a sarsaparilla-like aroma and flavor, with root-and-bark-like notes easing into a chocolaty, minty finish.

title: Atxa White Vermouth
description: With its light honey hue and sweet scent reminiscent of pears, honeysuckle and elderflower, this blanco vermouth is pleasingly sweet on the palate, layering citrus and toasty vanilla. Sip straight or enjoy in a spritz.

title: Drapo Bianco Vermouth
description: Featuring a honey-like color and aroma, this easy-drinking vermouth has a slightly sweet, pleasant oxidized flavor profile, finishing crisp.

title: Boissiere Sweet Vermouth
description: This is a full-bodied vermouth, with plenty of jammy blackberry and dark cherry fading into an appropriately bitter-edged finish.

title: Vermouth Del Professore Vermouth Classic Tradizionale
description: Robust enough to use in whiskey cocktails that call for dry vermouth, this golden selection has a mild, toasty, slightly buttery aroma. It surprises with sweetness on the palate, unfolding juicy orange, honey, vanilla and golden raisin flavors.

title: Ovrevann Aquavit
description: Look for a pleasantly sweet orange peel and caraway aroma. The palate is slightly malty, with a caraway-forward note that accelerates into the tingly finish. Cocktail friendly.

title: Montanaro Vermouth di Torino Rosso
description: Made with 15% marsala as part of the base, look for a plummy aroma accented by a dried-herb note. Mouthwateringly tart, the palate evokes black cherry preserves and damson plum, finishing bitter with a dab of dried apricot.

title: Ransom Sweet Vermouth
description: Packed with citrus and dried fruit, this bold, tawny-orange vermouth has a scent that suggests dried orange peel and dried fig, while the palate mixes grapefruit, orange and honey. The herbal finish is redolent of warm chamomile, cardamom and baking spice.

title: Brovo Witty Dry Vermouth
description: Made with Washington State Sauvignon Blanc and part of a line of accessible vermouths made with cocktails in mind, this is light gold and slightly cloudy in appearance. The bouquet offers zesty herb and a hint of jalapeño layered with cinnamon. The tangy palate has fleeting pineapple and citrus flavors, finishing herbaceous and relatively dry. Try it in a martini.

title: Vya Vermouth Sweet
description: Ideal for Negronis and other cocktails, this zesty vermouth has a honeyed sweetness, dried figs and sarsaparilla, plus a rounded finish with plenty of dried apricot, dried fig, Sherry and baking spice notes.

title: Vya Vermouth Extra Dry
description: Made with a California wine base, this pale straw-colored vermouth has a ripe tropical fruit nose that hints at banana. The tropical fruit is echoed on the palate, fading into subtle, earthy sage.

title: Cruz Conde Vermouth Rojo Reserva 1902
description: A Sherry base (oloroso and Pedro Ximenez) gives this sweet vermouth a rich head start. Scented like dried dates and orange peel, the palate is herbaceous at first sip, then channels dark honey, cardamom and clove-studded orange peel.

title: Miró Vermut Extra Dry
description: This truly bone-dry vermouth is one of the most neutral available on the market right now. Look for a pale-straw hue, a mild clover-and-honey fragrance and a bracing, steely, crisp palate that sets the mouth watering. Try this food-friendly sip with a dish of olives.

title: Riserva Carlo Alberto Vermut di Torino Vermut Rosso
description: Ruddy in the glass, this sweet vermouth has a light, birch beer-like roots and bark scent tinged with cocoa. The palate shows juicy orange, sarsaparilla and dried fig, finishing with dried orange peel and nutmeg.

title: Alessio Vermouth Chinato
description: Reminiscent of a light amaro, this dark-brown vermouth has a mild sarsaparilla-like scent and a pleasingly bittersweet palate. A plummy, lightly bitter flavor finishes chocolaty, with hints of bark, clove and cinnamon.

title: Pallini Roma Limoncello Liqueur
description: The snappy, zesty bouquet is clean, tart and refreshing, then in the latter stages the astringent presence of lemon peel really comes alive. Palate entry is like lemon drop hard candy, sweet but pleasantly tart; by midpalate, the tartness accelerates becoming more astringent and refreshing with every sip. One of the best limoncellos to come my way in a year or two. Best Buy.

title: Broker's London Dry Gin
description: Scents of lemon zest, coriander and orris root. In the mouth, it has the proper level of alcohol for gin, 94 proof; by midpalate, the firmly focused flavor profile features lemon zest and coriander, all buttressed by a buttery, creamy texture. Finishes long, semisweet, tangy and luscious.

title: Whisky Galore Bruichladdich 1991 Islay Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: The opening sniffings pick up scents of a ripe cherries; more time adds notes of lightly salted pretzels and white raisins. The palate entry is full and intensely oily/buttery; at midpalate the butter taste turns paste-like and nougaty. Concludes mildly sweet and woody, with a final blast of sea salt. Delightfully atypical and luscious.

title: Achaia Clauss Ouzo Traditional Anise Apéritif
description: On the nose, anise, pure and simple. Palate entry is sweet and soft considering the alcohol level; by midpalate the sweetness becomes more pronounced as the anise settles back a bit; the texture is rich, Finish slightly prickly on the tongue but delightful.

title: Gozio Amaretto
description: Multilayered aromas of mildly bitter almond meat and spice. Palate entry is delicate and lightly sweet, showcasing the almond. Aftertaste is long, creamy and sublime.

title: Santa Teresa Rhum Orange Liqueur
description: Smells of brandied oranges.  Palate entry is orangy/fruity and semisweet on the tip of the tongue; the midpalate taste is firmly structured in the rum base yet vibrant in a deeply orangy way. Aftertaste is softer than the flavor phase, long and slightly syrupy.

title: Murray McDavid Mission Range Clynelish 1972 Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: Shows a golden Burgundian Chardonnay color. Displays the unmistakable seed-like (sesame), pod-like aroma so representative of this great distillery; later on, the zesty aroma turns briny, lightly peated, grassy and vegetal. This malt takes off once on the palate, starting with dry to off-dry tastes of malt, oak and sesame; at midpalate, the flavor profile takes flight as pronounced, assertive tastes of honey, apple butter and oak resin blend perfectly for a savory taste finale. Finish is oily, rich, somewhat prickly on the tongue.

title: Black Maple Hill 14 Year Old Cask #147 Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Huge waves of corn perfume settle down after aeration with added fragrances of cotton candy, old oak, baked banana, honey and brown sugar. Palate entry is honey sweet and viscous; by midpalate the sweetness gets subdued by a zesty note of spice. Concludes resiny, lip-smackingly corny and sweet.

title: Black Maple Hill 16 Year Old Cask #127 Single Barrel Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Nose displays bittersweet traces of brown sugar, molasses and bubble gum; with aeration the okay aroma becomes a sophisticated bouquet with scents of creamed corn, honey, cocoa bean and dark toffee. Palate entry is lush, oily, creamy and semisweet; by midpalate the flavor features nougat, honey, brown sugar, marzipan and old sweet oak. Finishes chewy, creamy and succulent.

title: Coopers Extra Strong Vintage Ale, Batch No. 4/October 2002
description: Cloudy honey color is nearly opaque; beige foam dissipates quickly. Biscuity opening aroma is semisweet, intensely malty and totally agreeable; time in the glass adds softer notes of flowery hops and tar. Delicious and full-bodied right from the hoppy, slightly bitter palate entry through the malty, nutty, roasted midpalate. Aftertaste is moderately extended, malty and crisp.

title: Amate Reposado 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1137
description: Initial inhalations detect tobacco smoke and palm oil scents; with more time aromas of lanolin, caraway seed and lead pencil emerge. Palate entry is sweet and vegetal; at midpalate the taste profile expands, adding flavors of roasted green peppers, pipe tobacco and cream. Concludes peppery and zesty.

title: Gran Centenario Reposado 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1122
description: First sniffs detect robust aromas of agave pulp, lemongrass, fennel and green vegetable. Aeration allows notes of cocoa bean, olive brine and oaky vanilla to emerge. Palate entry is firm and oily; at midpalate there's a subtle fruitiness that's fino Sherry-like in its bearing. Finishes lovely, round and biscuity.

title: Plantation Rum Old Reserve 1993 Trinidad
description: Initial sniffings offer subtle, earthy, dry scents of tobacco leaf and brown sugar; further air contact releases bittersweet traces of cinnamon, nutmeg and cocoa. Palate is smoky, semisweet and slightly honeyed with cinnamon and clove. Finish is long, semisweet.

title: Port Morant Blackbeard's Reserve 1976 26 Year Old Demarara Rum
description: Bouquet offers enticing stone aromas, ranging from molasses to old oak to wet slate, with marzipan, nougat, pipe tobacco and dry oloroso Sherry scents. Palate flavors are dry and bitter, firm and luscious, offering brown sugar, dark chocolate. Aftertaste is long.

title: Chateau de Laubade 1973 Bas Armagnac
description: The bouquet displays off-dry aromas of gum, coffee bean, vanilla extract, nut butter, dark caramel and molasses. Palate entry is succulent, candied and sweet; the midpalate owns sweet flavors of dark caramel, honey, old sweet oak and maple. Finishes semisweet, chocolaty and luscious.

title: Hart Brothers Finest Collection Inchgower 1976 26 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The first whiffs detect reluctant grain and forest floor notes; the bouquet opens up markedly following aeration, offering off-dry scents of green olive, light peat and sweet midsummer grass. Palate entry supplies a grainy/malty sweet taste that's medium- to full-bodied, then at midpalate the taste takes off in sweet, almost honeyed/Sherried flavors that last well into the long, off-dry finish.

title: Murray McDavid Mortlach 1990 12 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The early aromas of dry malt, light caramel and old oak provide plenty of interest. Further time adds scents of brown rice, cocoa, bacon fat and oatmeal. Palate entry is politely sweet and sap-like, then at midpalate seductive flavors of Christmas spices, nougat and pipe tobacco emerge. Aftertaste is medium-long, sappy sweet and a bit maple-like.

title: Martell Cordon Bleu Cognac
description: Bouquet is semisweet and prune-like; several minutes of aeration unleashes much deeper scents of honeydew melon, cantaloupe, roasted almonds and apple butter. The palate entry is full bodied, generous and sweet; at midpalate, the flavor profile turns satiny as scintillating tastes of black cherry, black coffee and Macadamia nut blanket the tongue. Aftertaste is extended, smoky and luscious.

title: Moletto Distillato d'Uva Immature Brandy
description: Fresh grapy aroma is ripe, viny and just a touch sweet; time in the glass reveals a slightly astringent, pear-like quality that reminds me of Prosecco. Palate entry displays more grapy, peary, spicy ripeness than the bouquet; at midpalate, the astringency noted in the bouquet returns in the form of pomace, grape skins, pulp and light honey. Turns citrusy in the finish. Luscious.

title: Rain Vodka
description: Made from organically grown white corn. Smells of pear drop, moss and hay in the first sniffing; aeration allows the aroma to deepen, especially the appealing earthy moss/wet soil perfume. Palate entry is feather-light; at midpalate there's a firm but satiny taste of sweet grain. Aftertaste is grainy. Delicious and delicate.

title: Dewar's Signature Blended Whisky, Bottle #56
description: Biscuity, almost doughy in the initial sniffings; later sniffings uncover elegant aromas of lightly toasted bread, almond paste and sweet malt, with traces of peat and cigar smoke. Palate entry is dry, grainy and lightly smoked; the midpalate is sap-like, alluringly sweet, woodsy and honeyed. Finishes medium-long and toasty. Core malt hails from the Central Highlands distillery, Aberfeldy. Terrific job of blending magic.

title: Mathilde Liqueur Peches
description: First inhalations pick up nothing but sweet, beguiling ripe peach perfume; aeration expands the aroma by adding tarter scents of peach skin and pit. Palate entry is lean, tart and acidic yet ripe; the midpalate finds the acid underpinning gracefully balancing the sweet, peachy ripeness. Aftertaste is long, light-bodied and appropriately juicy.

title: Mathilde Liqueur Poires
description: The perfume of fresh pears is astounding. Palate entry is delicately sweet; the midpalate is ambrosial and shows a hint of tartness through all the ripe pulp. End is clean, fruity and fresh.

title: Coeur de Lion 1966 Calvados Pays d'Auge
description: Bouquet provides fruity, if reluctant aromas of tropical fruit, dried fruit, refined sugar, honey and oloroso Sherry aromas. Flavor features integrated, concentrated tastes of ripe apple, baked apple strudel and apple butter. Finish is long, sweet, oaky, seed-like.

title: Duncan Taylor & Co., Ltd. Benriach 1968 Cask 2592 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The vibrant, dry aroma is briary and floral; extra time presents the more delicate, heathery/flowery/ fruity side of the district with style and elegance. Palate entry is dry, minerally and totally focuses on the malt; the later flavor stages introduce maple, vanilla bean, coffee and black pepper. Concludes gently and politely in a soft, warm wave of malty flavor.

title: Duncan Taylor & Co., Ltd. Bruichladdich 1969 Cask 2331 Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: The early nose is charged with woody resin, nougat and honey; aeration adds more aromatic dimension in the forms of tobacco leaf, sea breeze and blue cheese. Palate entry is massive and concentrated; at midpalate, intense, sweet and buttery/oily tastes combine with dark honey, oloroso Sherry, marzipan, coconut, cocoa and dark toffee to make a lovely flavor experience. Ends sweetly. Find and buy.

title: Duncan Taylor & Co., Ltd. Glen Grant 1968 Cask 3882 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The higher alcohol content is immediately apparent in the early whiffs as are unusual (for the distillery) scents of sulphur/burnt matches, saddle leather and candied almond. Palate entry is sweet, sugary and intensely honeyed; the midpalate stage continues the honey, brown sugar, hard candy and dark caramel theme. Finishes fiery on the tongue, concentrated. When room temperature mineral water is added, this malt comes alive.

title: Lagavulin 16 Year Old Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: Soy sauce, olive brine, peat, honey, oloroso Sherry, brewer's yeast, bread dough, barley malt and cigar smoke in the bouquet. The flavor that magically includes the innate intense peatiness of Islay malts and the masterly employment of oak barrels phase defines “classy Islay.” Concludes sweetly, without sacrificing the tangy, astringent peatiness that is inherent. Gorgeous.

title: AsomBroso Anejo 100% Agave Tequila
description: At first, I am puzzled, if thrilled, by the semisweet, delicate, honey-like opening sniffs; the honey component expands to include vanilla, buttercream and light toffee. Palate entry doesn't mirror the bouquet as the initial taste goes surprisingly dry to off-dry and oily; by midpalate, sweeter tastes of malt, light toffee, oaky vanillin, palm oil and milk chocolate are featured. Finishes smoothly, with a honeyed sweetness.

title: Tequila Corralejo Triple Distilled Reposado 100% Agave Tequila
description: Delicate fragrances of pine needle and green olive greet the olfactory sense in the first two minutes of sniffing; additional air contact unleashes peppercorn, brine, fennel, lead pencil, and a faint hint of honey. Palate entry shows dry, astringent tastes of agave, hemp and resin followed at midpalate by integrated flavors of light caramel, cream, metal and milk chocolate. Finishes sweet, soft, and pleasingly vegetal.

title: La Clandestine Absinthe Supérieure
description: La Clandestine Absinthe Supérieure (Switzerland; DC Craft Spirits, Monarch Beach, CA). Based on a 1935 recipe, this clear spirit louches to milky white. Silky and light-bodied, this mild absinthe mixes floral notes with licorice candy, though the anise grows bolder with repeated sips. Consider pairing with oysters or other briny seafood.

title: Sirene Absinthe Verte
description: The lime green liquid is beautiful, both in the Art Nouveau-inspired bottle as well as in the glass, where it louches to opalescent yellow-green. The aroma is particularly citrusy, evoking juicy Key lime mixed with fennel. It's super-light on the palate, with most of the anise coming forward on the finish. Mix into an absinthe frappe.

title: Redux Absinthe Superieure
description: This mellow, herbaceous absinthe starts out a mossy olive hue, louching to murky yellow-green. The bracing aroma mixes fennel and spearmint, which is echoed on the palate alongside lingering anise.

title: St. George Absinthe Verte
description: Made with a brandy (grape) base, this deep-gold absinthe tinged with mossy olive louches to opalescent yellow tinged with green. Consider using a light hand when adding water; once the right balance is found, delicate mint and dried herb flavors come through. Aromatics include fennel, lemon balm, tarragon and a slightly oxidized note, like Sherry.

title: Heritage
description: Made with grape neutral spirit base (as opposed to grain), this absinthe has a distinct sweetness, reading almost like Good & Plenty candies, finishing with pleasing, citrusy hint. Olive green in the glass, it louches to a pale yellow glow.

title: Copper & Kings Blanche Absinthe
description: This newcomer is distilled from Muscat grapes, and has a particularly sweet and juicy aroma that some might find similar to fruit-flavored vodka. When louched—which adjusts the appearance from clear to pearly white—the aroma opens up to a more herbaceous, lemon verbena-like tone. The flavor mixes anise and a faint fruity touch, with a hint of sweetness on the licorice-laden exit.

title: Vieux Carré Absinthe Supérieure
description: Paying tribute to New Orleans and its Vieux Carré cocktail, this olive-drab absinthe louches to a burnished gold. The anise aroma is particularly concentrated. The flavor almost washes out mid-palate, but finishes with a strong, lingering anise twang. The gift-worthy, perfume flask-like bottle stands out on any bar.

title: Parnasse Absinth Superiore
description: Like a theme-park version of absinthe, this spirit glows neon green in the glass, louching to bright jade, and it's sweet and candy-like on the nose and palate. It's not unpleasant to drink, but it's missing the herbaceous nuance that makes absinthe so intriguing.

title: Absolut Elyx
description: This vodka is simply clean, from the mildly sweet aroma to the crisp finish. The palate holds pleasant notes of marshmallow, grapefruit peel and chalk give way to a faint vanilla-citrus exit. Made from single-estate grain distilled in a 1921 copper column still, this is an ideal companion for pretty much anything served in a martini glass.

title: Russian Diamond Vodka
description: Made from a wheat and rye blend, this silky vodka is neutral overall, with a faint citrusy scent and mild sweetness on the palate. The spirit is filtered through a myriad of materials, including Siberian pine needles, fabric, and as befits the name, various precious metals and stones.

title: Voli Vodka
description: This vodka, made from French wheat, has a hint of anise in the aroma and a slightly sweet vanilla note on the palate, finishing brisk and citrusy. It feels light, almost airy, and will please vodka drinkers looking to sip or mix.

title: American Harvest
description: This organic vodka, made from winter wheat, veers into gin-like or flavored vodka territory, though the producer insists it is not a flavored vodka. Though it's neutral on the nose, the flavor is relatively bold, suggesting melon, almond and vanilla.

title: Tigre Blanc Vodka
description: Made in the Cognac region of France and packaged in a particularly gaudy, gold tiger-striped bottle, this vodka has a bit of spicy tiger bite up front, mingling ginger and white pepper before fading into a mild, smooth finish.

title: Blat Vodka
description: The producers bill this as “advanced vodka,” distilled from non-GMO French wheat and claiming to be “the only vodka 100% free of impurities.” Overall, the spirit is neutral on the nose and palate, with a tinge of marshmallow sweetness and a crisp, perky finish.

title: Slovenia Vodka
description: This spirit was created by Chef Peter X. Kelly and his team to be “the culinary vodka” for pairings and making cocktails. Distilled from winter wheat, “with just a whisper” of Slovenian buckwheat (less than 1%), this vodka is generally neutral on the nose and palate, with touches of grapefruit peel and white pepper on the astringent finish. Serve well-chilled and possibly paired with smoked salmon, cheeses or other savory treats.

title: Soyombo Super Premium Mongolian Vodka
description: Look for sweet marshmallow in the otherwise neutral aroma and flavor, plus a faint charcoal note on the palate. The finish is crisp, with fiery hints of anise and black pepper. According to the backstory, this vodka is distilled on the site of the last Mongolian Emperor's palace.

title: Van Gogh Blue Vodka
description: Clean and crisp, a gentle breeze of citrus and pine seems to blow through this vodka. The dry finish is flecked with white pepper heat. It was made with a “triple wheat blend” of vodkas made from wheat grown in France, Germany and New Zealand.

title: Premium Gera Vodka
description: This wheat-based vodka is neutral on the nose, while it's lightly sweet on the palate, showing a faint rosewater note and pink peppercorn finish. Sip or mix into cocktails.

title: Ultimat Vodka
description: Made from a blend of wheat, rye and potato, this vodka has a mild citrus peel note on the bright, zippy finish and a silky, slightly oily texture that coats the palate. Ideal for mixing into cocktails.

title: Wheatley Vodka
description: From Bourbon-maker Buffalo Trace, this small-batch vodka is remarkably soft, with subtle undertones of vanilla and cinnamon on the warming finish.

title: CH Vodka
description: Made from Illinois wheat and rye, this vodka is light and neutral, with a fleeting banana note and a flicker of black pepper heat. It finishes crisp, though it delivers a wallop of persistent, lip-numbing alcohol heat.

title: Absolut Vodka
description: Distilled from Swedish winter wheat, this neutral vodka shows a faint earthiness in the scent and fleeting notes of chalk, white pepper and lemon peel on the palate.

title: Black Button Wheat Vodka
description: Made from local wheat grown on a family farm, this “grain-to-glass” vodka is on the sweet side, offering hints of banana and an elongated vanilla finish with a clove-like spark.

title: Catskill Mountain Whole Wheat Peace Vodka
description: This robust vodka is made from New York red winter wheat in copper pot stills. The aroma is distinctly funky, while the palate shows subtle banana and coconut tones that linger into the finish.

title: Reisetbauer Carrot
description: Fresh, clean and lightly vegetal—but not outright carroty—this palate-cleanser of an eau de vie will remind some of a delicate aquavit. It would be dynamite in a refined take on a bloody mary with tomato water instead of tomato juice.

title: Reisetbauer Williams Pear
description: The aroma is like a freshly sliced pear is being held right under your nose, it's so amazingly bold and true. On the palate, look for fleeting sweetness, bold pear flavor and a drying finish laced with cinnamon heat.

title: Clear Creek Distillery Williams Pear Brandy
description: Soft and subtle, this clear eau de vie has a gentle but authentic fresh pear aroma. On the palate, it's slightly perfumy, then pear flavor bursts through on the finish, accompanied by spicy ginger and white-pepper notes. Overall, this offers a remarkably pure expression of fruit.

title: St. George Pear Brandy
description: One of the bolder pear brandies, it offers a bright, slightly sweet fresh pear and honey aroma. Flavor-wise it offers a big pop of rounded pear warmed with baking spice entices up front. Made from dry-farmed organic Bartlett pears, about 30 pounds of fruit per bottle.

title: Kuuch Honey & Anise X'tabentun
description: Honeyed X'tabentun liqueur has been finding its exotic way into some bartender cocktails recently. This golden version has a sweet, long honey aroma and flavor but it's smooth and light, not cloying or sticky at all. Although anise is called out on the label, it's difficult to detect.

title: Reisetbauer Ginger
description: The bright ginger aroma is underpinned by an earthy note. On the palate, this eau de vie is light and fresh, with mouthwatering salinity. Delicate gingery heat comes forward slowly on the finish. Some will miss the sweetness typically found in ginger liqueurs; there's none here.

title: WhipperSnapper Oregon Spirit Whiskey
description: Light amber hue, pungent anise notes on the nose and tongue. With time, the flavor opens up to more cereal-like and oaky tones, finishing with an invigorating hit of cinnamon. A real live-wire of a whiskey.

title: Jack Daniels Old No. 7 Black Label Tennessee Whiskey
description: Familiar maple syrup color and vanilla and oak flavor, good dose of alcohol burn. Finishes relatively dry, with some vanilla and caramel. Jack and Coke is the classic combo.

title: Canadian Club Reserve Aged 10 Years
description: Amber color, not much aroma. Soft feel, well-structured. One-dimensional flavor but nice finish: nutty, crème brûlée, vanilla.

title: Glen Breton Rare
description: A 10-year-old single malt whisky modeled on Highland Scotch. The influence shows in the fruity, honeyed scent, with just a hint of smoke to tickle the nose. The flavors are almond-like, with pleasing touches of peat and cocoa, though it finishes oddly yeasty and beer-like. This whiskey would do well balanced with sweetness, as in a whiskey sour.

title: Hirsch Selection 20 Year Old American Whiskey
description: Light amber in color, with warm, heady butterscotch and cookie dough fragrances; too bad the taste doesn't mirror the scent. Instead, there's a flash of sweetness on the tongue and a nice vanilla finish, but it is all quickly overwhelmed by alcohol. Even cut with water, the spirit is just too darn hot.

title: Penderyn Single Malt Welsh Whiskey
description: At first glance, it's easy to mistake this whiskey for wine, thanks to the bottle shape and design and the light amber liquid within. Though finished in Madeira casks, it is unmistakably whiskey. The rich, faintly caramel scent hints at Madeira, but unfortunately it's not apparent in the flavor, which tends more toward oak and anise.

title: Canadian Mist Blended Canadian Whisky
description: Amber in color, with a resiny, nutty scent. Despite oaky flavor and a thin feel, there's a very nice vanilla finish. Alcohol bite. Mix it in a cocktail and feel no guilt about it.

title: Hirsch Selection American Corn Whiskey
description: It's hard to believe that a spirit aged over four years has such a pale straw color and mild aroma. There's a strong whiff of alcohol, with slightly apple- and plastic-like aromas. Light feel.

title: Carpano Antica Formula
description: This dark, mysterious vermouth is rich, complex and layered, boasting aromas of mint and other herbs, plums and figs, reminiscent of Madeira. The rich flavors are hard to pin down: cocoa, red wine, almonds, bitter marmalade, hints of spice and toffee all play across the palate, finishing with a bracing bitter edge. This delectable sweet vermouth would shine in a Manhattan.

title: Averna Amaro Siciliano
description: Complex and appealingly herbal, this spirit is marked by its coffee-brown color and a scent like spearmint-spiked espresso. The flavor is sweet, faintly coffee-like, with warm Dutch licorice, anise and sarsaparilla notes. The brisk finish is minty then bitter. Heavy, syrupy feel.

title: Domaine Chateau de Fontpinot Cognac XO
description: This is a mellow, easy-sipping spirit with a copper penny color and bright aromas of pears, honey and Sherry, opening up later to a more pronounced caramel scent. On the tongue, look for coffee, hazelnuts, rancio and bittersweet cocoa, tapering off to a pleasingly smooth, elegant caramel note.

title: Martell VSOP Medaillon
description: A lively, fruity and well-balanced Cognac with bright pops of cinnamon and cardamom winding into a long toffee finish. Light amber color, sweet and toasty vanilla and orange aromas.

title: Camus VSOP Elegance
description: This smooth Cognac offers an array of rich, downright luxe aromas: caramel apples, floral honey, Sauternes, dried fruit. The flavors start with a flash of sweetness and alcohol bite, fading into a long, pretty finish of apple and maple sugar candy. Medium body, pleasantly tongue-coating feel. Try pairing with dark chocolate.

title: Vieux Pontarlier Absinthe Francaise Superieure
description: Beneath the perky lime-green color and a clean, bright licorice and mentholated lemon scent, this absinthe has soul. Surprisingly deep and musky star anise, Dutch licorice and sarsaparilla flavors fade to a citrus finish. Lovely with sugar too. A first-rate choice for an absinthe Frappe.

title: Pierre Ferrand Selection des Anges
description: Something about this well-balanced liquid entrances, leading from sip to sip. Maybe it's the amber color, flecked with pretty orange and yellow highlights. Perhaps it's the complex aromas, which showcase sweet high notes reminiscent of dried fruit, toffee and Sauternes, or the warm, fruity flavor with a touch of almond extract. Whatever it is, pour a snifter and curl up by the fireplace.

title: Courvoisier Connoisseur Collection 12 years aged
description: Maple-y amber color and ripe fruit and vanilla scents with honeysuckle notes. This is a well-balanced spirit with a sweet flavor and just enough alcohol to be bracing. Look for a lingering and luscious caramel finish with cinnamon and ginger spices, and a viscous feel. Try a glass with a pastry or cake.

title: Hine Rare Fine Champagne VSOP Cognac, Appellation Fine Champagne Controllee
description: This rich, supple Cognac is a liquid expression of a vintage leather club chair. The nut-brown spirit has big aromas of crème brûlée, toffee, cigar tobacco and cocoa. After an initial sweetness on the tongue, it finishes relatively dry with lingering caramel, raisin, leather and orange peel flavors, and a bracing alcohol bite.

title: Landy Cognac XO No. 1
description: One of the most highly aromatic Cognacs, with deep and rich notes of toffee, hazelnut, raisins and apricots. The flavors are equally deep and rich, with lots of caramel, cigar, leather, rancio and a wisp of smoke, finishing relatively dry and mellow.

title: Courvoisier VSOP. AOC
description: Orange-amber color and deep aromas of honey and Sherry, with undertones of toffee and chocolate, and a fleeting floral note. The flavors start with a touch of sweet caramel and finishes with big, complex, deep burnt-orange and toffee notes, with surprising delicacy and richness on the tongue. Medium-bodied and balanced, with just a bit of alcohol sting.

title: Mata Hari Absinthe Bohemian
description: A subtle and addictive absinthe, best when louched. The pretty pine-green color transforms to sea-foam green, and basil and cinnamon notes join the already pleasantly lemony scent. The flavors of the thick, mouth-filling liquid are similarly restrained, and adding ice water brings out a sweet pine note and a touch of aniseed.

title: Conjure Cognac
description: This is an anti-snob Cognac, accessible, affordable and straightforward. The amber-orange liquid is fragrant with nuts and a touch of orange, with dark chocolate undertones. The flavors are relatively sweet, but not overwhelmingly so, with notes of honey and bitter almond. It finishes a little hot, but with a lingering caramel tone. Mellow and mouthwatering with a thick, slightly syrupy feel. It would be great in a Sidecar or other cocktails.

title: Pacifique Absinthe Verte
description: Yellow-green color and a pronounced citrus/lime and vegetal fennel aroma. Viscous, thick mouthfeel and strong alcohol sting prior to louching. Initially, this absinthe has a tart flavor, although ice water coaxes out more herbal and grassy notes and the lingering finish is smoothed with a touch of anise sweetness.

title: Mansinthe by Marilyn Manson
description: Everyone will ask about this bottle with the goth-rocker Marilyn Manson brand. Undiluted, this jade green absinthe has Good-and-Plenty candy aromas, and mild citrus and floral flavors that finish with heat and some licorice. Adding ice water transforms the scent to more anise-like, even a touch minty, and brings out a big, pure licorice finish that lingers on and on like the last notes of a big-finish guitar solo.

title: Remy Martin 1738 Accord Royal, A.O.C.
description: The label on this light caramel-brown liquid says it's blended “for aromatic intensity.” Mission accomplished: The aromas are indeed intense, with sweet, high bursts of burnt caramel and orange peel, opening up to a slightly chocolaty fragrance. On the tongue, this one is a big, solid block of flavor, with lots of caramel from start to finish, adding some coffee and dark chocolate notes at the end. Despite the big-brute flavor, it has a mellow finish.

title: Camus Borderies XO
description: There is  an abundance of alcohol on the nose, but once you get past that the scent of this nut-brown spirit displays notes of almonds, marzipan, oranges and Sherry. On the tongue, caramel sweetness fades into a long, burnt-toffee finish. Medium body, smooth and silky texture.

title: Courvoisier Exclusif
description: Amber color and warm aromas of floral honey, burnt orange peel and a deep caramel note, with some alcohol on the nose. The flavor is rich and caramelly, with a touch of walnut-like bitterness and allspice. Finishes relatively dry. Given some time, it opens up to a touch of sweetness. Medium body.

title: Landy Cognac VSOP
description: Topaz color and scent of honey and dried fruit, with time opening up to deeper toffee aromas. Inside the pretty, tactile oval bottle, the liquid is sweet on the tongue, with an assertive, lingering caramel finish and medium body. The flavor is rather one-note, but it's a very pleasing note. Given time, this spirit opens up to more complex flavors, especially on the finish, teasing out a bit of coffee and cigar tobacco.

title: Camus Cognac XO Elegance
description: Topaz color with orange flecks and aromas of caramel, burnt orange and floral honey. The flavors show burnt toffee and oak tannin, fading into a lingering finish of caramel and maple. Medium body and a round, creamy mouthfeel.

title: Pernod Absinthe Superieure
description: At first, there's nothing subtle about this vivid lime-green liquid. With its bright anise scent and thick mouth-coating effect, it's like drinking licorice candy. But with ice water, everything changes – it cools and become more classically Pernod-like, with a lighter flavor and texture, and a burst of licorice on the finish. The assertive note would stand out well when used to rinse a glass for a drink like a Sazerac.

title: Leopold Bros. Absinthe Verte
description: A clean, straightforward and refreshing absinthe: pale straw yellow-green liquid with a wallop of licorice aroma and flavor and medium body. Adding ice water coaxes out more complex lime and cinnamon scents, as well as lemon, orange and anise notes on the finish. Adding sugar makes it reminiscent of cinnamon candy.

title: 2 Rooz Neutral Vodka
description: The nosing passes find scents of charcoal, chalk and gum. The palate entry is full-bodied, acidic, sharp and moderately oily; at midpalate the grapy spirit stings the tongue. Finishes ramped up on the piquant spirit, but that's all right. An attractive, no-frills, unflavored vodka.

title: Swan's Neck Lemon Zest French Grape Vodka
description: Lemon candy perfume clubs you over the head in the first whiffs; after aeration, the aroma settles down and exhibits a pleasing blend of lemon peel and grainy spirit. Palate entry is concentrated in its zestiness, but not overbearing; in the midpalate, the lemon flavor turns very lean and peel-like. Concludes fresh, lemony and correctly acidic.

title: Rubi VSOP
description: The opening aroma is pruny, ripe, grapy and floral; following aeration the bouquet turns leathery and spicy. The palate entry displays succulent tastes of melon, dried fruit, nuts and pear; the midpalate point is focused, ripe, slightly woody and spicy. Finishes clean, smooth and elegant.

title: The Irishman Superior Irish Whiskey
description: First sniffs detect fruity aromas of grain kernel and dry breakfast cereal in abundance; the aroma fades with further air contact, leaving behind mere traces of dry grain and wet soil. Palate entry is spicy, savory and toasty; midpalate is medium-weighted, a touch oily, peppery and turns intensely grainy at the finish.

title: Siku Glacier Ice Vodka
description: The bouquet is understated and elegant with delicate scents of wheat and oatmeal with earthy, mossy notes. The palate entry is engagingly sweet and biscuity; the midpalate is firmly viscous and grainy sweet. Ends gracefully, with a touch of grain kernel tang.

title: Tommy Bahama White Sand Rum
description: Initial aromatic bursts are delicate and gently semisweet; additional air contact offers subtle traces of unsalted butter, nutshell and paraffin. Palate entry offers tastes of butter cream and refined sugar; by midpalate, a viscous texture and animated tastes of nutshell, nutmeg and molasses emerge. Finishes gracefully, elegant and creamy.

title: Sauza Tres Generaciones Anejo Tequila 100% Puro de Agave
description: In the opening passes, the aroma is biscuity amd vanilla-like; fragrance picks up momentum with further aeration in the forms of saltwater taffy, light caramel and vanilla extract. Palate entry is sweet and caramel-like; by midpalate, the caramel wrests away control of the taste profile. Concludes sweet in an oaky manner and vegetal, with mild green-olive flavors.

title: Single Single Malt Vodka
description: The rather inexpressive bouquet offers moderately evolved scents of dry grain and sour mash. The palate entry shows more personality as the taste goes oily and semidry; at midpalate a touch of lanolin firms up the flavor profile as the grain becomes more intense. Finishes dry and vegetal.

title: Cane Louisiana Rum Aged Five Years
description: The nosing passes find slightly sweet, grassy, baked and cinnamon cake aromas. The palate entry is caney sweet but not cloying; at midpalate the sweetness is nicely balanced by the acidity making the taste slightly bitter and cocoa bean-like. Finishes medium-long, bittersweet and tangy.

title: A. Hardy Napoléon Cognac
description: The bouquet is a compelling mix of fragrances of vanilla, nutmeg, sweet oak, saddle leather and palm oil. The palate entry is sweet, but not cloying, chocolaty and fruity; at midpalate the sweetness explodes, drowning out all other taste aspects. Finishes sweet and silky.

title: Pages Vedrenne Forgotten Casks Vat 48 Rare Cognac
description: Another muted bouquet with aromas of dark chocolate malt, old oak and old wood-paneled library that don't evolve in the glass. Entry is very sweet and intensely honeyed but balanced by the acidity; at midpalate the flavor becomes chocolatey. Finishes buttercreamy and raisiny sweet. The sweetness will not be to every Cognac lover's liking.

title: The Singleton Single Malt Scotch Whisky of Glendullan 12 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The nosing passes find aromas of sugar cookies, orange zest, baked pineapple, dry breakfast cereal and citrus-flavored hard candy. Entry is malty sweet, woody and toffee-like; at midpalate the flavors include walnut butter, nougat and honey. Finishes as pleasant and sweet as it began.

title: The Irishman Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: Smells curiously of vegetable stock that's loaded with celery, onion, carrots and parsley; aroma becomes toasty with aeration as the grain finally emerges through the stock-like surface smell. Palate entry is grainy sweet and pleasantly dry and lean, even a touch austere; midpalate is prickly and acutely peppery. Ends toasty.

title: Swan's Neck French Grape Vodka
description: Initial sniffings detect grapy and musty notes; after further air contact, the grapiness turns more red fruit-like, almost to the point of resembling Port or vermouth. Palate entry is fruity and overripe; at midpalate, the acid deficiency comes into play as the flavor profile becomes fat and flabby, lacking crispness and therefore structure.

title: Sauza Conmemorativo Anejo Tequila
description: Initial whiffs detect textile and waxy notes upfront and deeper notes of butter and vegetable oil that seem to underpin the beeswax scent. Palate entry is mildly sweet and caramel-like, but without much of an agave personality; by midpalate, the spice element recedes, leaving behind a spirit that's drinkably average. There's no edge to it.

title: O2 945 Sparkling Super Premium Vodka
description: Looks like club soda. The initial bouquet shows evidence of grain; following aeration the aroma goes slightly sour and doughy.
