description: Two years of barrel aging yields a soft pale gold hue and a vanilla-brown sugar profile touched with banana and cinnamon (think bananas foster). Sip or mix.

title: Pisco Porton
description: Ideal for tropical drinks and pisco punches, this approachable, earthy-fruity pisco pops with lots of perky banana, pineapple and lychee, sliding into a spiced finish that suggests cinnamon- and cocoa-dusted pineapple slices.

title: Campo de Encanto Pisco Distiller's Reserve Moscatel
description: This single vineyard pisco is made with grapes from famed Pampa de Villacuri Vineyard. It opens with delicate rosewater and white flower aromatics. The floral notes echo boldly on the palate, easing into a brush of tropical fruit and finishing with a floral exhale.

title: La Caravedo Pisco Puro Quebranta
description: From the makers of Porton, this pisco has an earthy scent that hints at coconut and orange peel. On the palate, coconut dominates the flavor profile, which is rounded out with vanilla, fleeting fruit juiciness at the back of the palate, and a prickle of clove and cinnamon heat on the finish. Try it in a pisco sour.

title: Maison Leblon Selecao Verde
description: Pungent, grassy and visceral, this unique single-vintage cachaça almost reads like rhum agricole, showing lemongrass, banana and a fiery finish. It's a 2014 vintage made from “select sugar cane” and bottled at still strength. The producer likens it to “Brazilian Beaujolais” – not literally, of course, but here's hoping Leblon will follow the wine world's lead and release more single-vintage bottlings like this memorable one.

title: Don Alvaro Pisco Acholado
description: The aroma is particularly herbaceous, with notes of dill and mild pickle brine. The palate reads as floral, suggesting violet candy and a savory hint of dill, finishing with warm cassia bark and a drying feel.

title: La Diablada Pisco
description: Named for an Andean spiritual dance enacting a fight between angels and demons, this acholado-style pisco mixes sweet and spicy. The aroma is fruity and grape-like. However, the palate leads with violet, showing dusty, spicy nutmeg and black pepper before exiting with a floral, slightly soapy note. Producer recommends mixing into pisco punch.

title: Dillon's Rose Gin
description: This ruddy gin-based liqueur, infused with rose hips and petals and sweetened with turbinado sugar, will appeal to fans of aperitif cocktails. The bold, herbal aroma and sweet notes of burnt orange peel and clove read almost like an herbaceous root beer or a light amaro, finishing with bracing pink peppercorn. Sip over ice or experiment with Negroni variations.

title: Vikre Boreal Juniper Gin
description: Consider this a head start on gimlets and other citrusy cocktails. With a bright, slightly sweet, candied lemon peel profile, this citrus-forward gin is pleasant to sip and finishes with a sprightly ginger note.

title: Hana Gin
description: Hana is Japanese for flower, as the orchid etched into the teardrop-shaped bottle suggests, and this gin does show subtle white floral notes. The bright, delicate aroma suggests floral and mild vegetal notes reminiscent of fresh snow peas. The flavor is equally bright and bracing, with a fleeting berry sweetness and crisp, lightly floral finish. Nuanced and versatile enough for a wide range of classic cocktails.

title: Spirit Works Barrel Gin
description: Golden in the glass, this gin is scented with rich, buttery vanilla touched with honey and fresh apple. It's slightly oily on the palate, where vanilla sweetness is shored up with mint, pine, cinnamon and cardamom. Though it sips well alone, this wheat-based gin works in cocktails, too.

title: Vikre Boreal Spruce Gin
description: The earthy aroma shows anise at first, with time in the glass opening to a fresh, grassy note. On the palate, this gin is soft and herbaceous, with notes of spruce, spearmint, tarragon and anise, plus a surprising tart lime note that bounces into the brisk finish. Mix with tonic and enjoy.

title: Langley's Distilled London Gin
description: This complex, balanced gin has a citrusy, lightly sweet palate, hinting at grapefruit and delivering a faint, pleasing white floral note. The finish offers citrus and spicy zing.

title: Dillon's Unfiltered Gin 22
description: Distilled from a Niagara grape base and infused with 22 botanicals (hence the name), this small-batch gin is light and soft, with notes of lemongrass, juniper and lime zest, finishing zingy and brisk. Though the producer warns that the gin is unfiltered and may appear cloudy, it looked clear in the glass. Martini material.

title: Uncle Val's Restorative Gin
description: Bridging sweet and savory, this gin has a citrusy fragrance, which also shows up on the palate. Starting out with mild pineapple-like sweetness and traditional juniper, this gin segues into a spicy, mouthwatering finish with white and black pepper, coriander and ginger spice.

title: Chabot Armagnac Vintage 1960
description: An appealing nutty aroma with barely discernable traces of hard cheese and marzipan. The palate entry is raisiny sweet with a slight toffee kick; at midpalate the taste profile adds deft flavors of toasted almond, oak, and black pepper, becoming more off-dry than sweet as a result. Finishes smooth, mature and integrated.

title: Luxardo Sambuca Cream
description: Initial nosings pick up a solid scent of beany espresso that overrides the cream and sambuca elements; air contact sees the cream take command as the espresso recedes. Palate entry deals with the creaminess; by midpalate, the anise/licorice spirit base makes itself known as the espresso all but disappears. Aftertaste is creamy and pleasant.

title: Arran Single Bourbon Cask/Cask Strength Isle of Arran Single Malt Whisky
description: First sniffings pick up aromas of vanilla, maple, and honey; following more air exposure, the bouquet turns bread-like and baked, with notes of resin, paraffin, cowhide, hemp, and egg noodle. Palate entry is sweet, maple- and sap-like; at midpalate, the cask strength alcohol kicks in, warming the tongue and offering sweet flavors of honey, toffee, and marzipan. Concludes with parting tastes of honey and toffee

title: Bruichladdich XVII 17 Year Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky/Islay
description: Aged in 100% Bourbon barrels. Pale straw hue. In the first two minutes concentrated grainy aromas, delicately touched by honey backnotes impress; seven more minutes allow the aroma to evolve into a solid bouquet, notable for its biscuity, wafer-like, poached pear and malty scents. Palate entry is firm, sugar cookie-sweet and displays a welcome hint of oiliness; midpalate is cereal/malty sweet and oily but hardly unctuous as the acidity level is clearly high enough to retain a lovely tartness/crispness. Finishes long, if a bit narrowly focused on the resiny acidity.

title: Citadelle Vodka
description: Beauce wheat; distilled five times. Nosing passes pick up concentrated aromas of grain, moss and wet earth. Palate entry is grainy, off-dry and piquant; at midpalate, the grain, cracker, off-dry flavors deepen slightly. Aftertaste is long, clean and agreeably grainy.

title: Tovtry Golden Fields Vodka with Natural Flavors
description: Aroma is pure and moderately grainy. Palate entry is dry, grainy and concentrated; by midpalate, there's a mild oiliness to the texture and a semisweet flavor of grain mash. Finish goes dry and moderately grainy with just a trace of rye spice.

title: Duncan Taylor Macallan 1968, Cask #10558 Speyside Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: The first whiffs find lovely, sweet scents of cream, cake frosting and candied almond; aeration stimulates additional scents of heather honey and dates. Palate entry is creamy and oily; by midpalate there's a sweet creaminess that supersedes the oiliness, making for lip-smacking drinking. Finishes honeyed, sweet, floral and biscuity.

title: Hpnotiq Cognac, Vodka and Natural Tropical Fruit Juice Liqueur
description: Tropical fruit, citrusy and mango-like aromas. Light, acidic and very tart at palate entry; the midpalate is refreshing, intensely juicy and almost sour. Aftertaste leans heavily on the tartness.

title: Apreval Reserve Calvados Pays d'Auge
description: Smells of apples, spice, beeswax and oil. Palate entry is off-dry and caramel-like with a silky texture that forms a base for the semisweet, toffee and apple and pear-like flavors.

title: Baron du Lustrac 1972 Domaine de Lacaze Cepage Bacco, Bas Armagnac
description: The initial aroma shows round, biscuity and mature praline-like notes that are simultaneously nutty and sweet; aeration allows the bouquet to focus on the bittersweet candied almond core aroma. Palate entry is firm, bittersweet and nicely viscous; midpalate the candied almond dominates to the point of exclusion. Concludes bittersweet and nutty.

title: Caledonian Selection Clynelish 1972 29 Year Old Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky – Cask Strength
description: Golden hue. Initial nosing passes unearth dry, unfocused, slightly muted scents of malt, sesame and even, in the distance, mustard seed; additional time releases scents of palm oil, lanolin, egg white, slight brine and fresh almonds. Better in the mouth than on the nose, the palate entry is deeply grainy/malty, sweet and oily; by midpalate sensuous tastes of dark chocolate, sugar cookies, brown sugar, oak and honey delight. Finishes medium-long, moderately sweet and succulent.

title: Wet by Beefeater Gin
description: Beefeater base with a delicate infusion of pear flavor. Initial nosing passes detect the telltale, semisweet botanical London Dry thumbprint of Beefeater but with a subtle fruity enhancement; time serves only to bring out the pear component a smidgen more, except that it reminds me more of banana than pear. Palate entry is nicely textured, semisweet and elegant; it isn't until the midpalate that I can isolate the pear/banana element from the rest of the botanicals. Finish is long, fruity in a slightly bitter pear peel way and full on the tongue. I commend Beefeater for trying something different and a little bit daring.

title: Chinaco Anejo 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1127
description: Inexcusably large amount of sediment and floating debris displayed. Subtle bouquet is lightly peppery and mildly herbal; aeration releases aromas of fennel, green onion, Sherry and oak resin. Palate entry is oily/creamy and moderately sweet; midpalate shows green vegetable, Sherry/honey, and herbal agave flavors. Finishes sweetly.

title: Players Extreme Green Apple Infused Vodka
description: Tart green apple perfume jumps from the glass and eventually calms down with aeration. Palate entry is pleasingly tart and crisp, then at midpalate there's a nice oiliness that complements the fruit.

title: Hart Brothers Finest Collection Clynelish 1988 14 Year Old Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: The aroma begins in an intensely grainy, dry breakfast cereal-like way; additional time in the glass adds woodsy/open field notes of pine/cedar, heather and wood resin. Palate entry is dry to off-dry and grainy, then at midpalate flow semisweet waves of woody vanillin, cocoa, malt and light toffee. Finishes in a flurry of woody/caramel-like tastes.

title: Sting Sour Raspberry Schnapps Liqueur
description: Bouquet offers ripe red raspberry perfume. Ultra-sour at palate entry, but  by midpalate, the sour raspberry flavor is borderline astringent. Aftertaste is sour and mouth-puckering.

title: Martin Miller's Reformed London Dry Gin
description: Opening whiffs are of freshly ground black pepper and cassia bark; after six minutes, the intriguing bouquet adds subtle fragrances of licorice, juniper berry and bitter orange peel. The prevailing early-on flavors feature the bitter orange peel; at midpalate, juniper dominates, effectively vanquishing its flavor peers. Turns pleasantly floral and fruity in the finish.

title: Jameson 18 Year Old Master Selection Irish Whiskey No. 03895
description: Opening aromas are of cotton fabric and wet hay; time in the glass doesn't deepen the fragrance, adding only very delicate notes of damp grain, nectarine and spearmint. Palate entry is properly sweet and deliciously grainy; at the midpalate the flavor profile does its best work as taut tastes of oak resin, malted grains, pears, light honey and toasted honey wheat bread make a clear, definitive statement. Aftertaste is predictably mild, softly sweet and more grainy than woody.

title: Pallini Raspicello Raspberry Liqueur
description: Whiffs are of raspberry. Palate entry features a near-syrupy texture that underpins the juicy, preserves-like red raspberry flavor; at midpalate, the fruit's acidity helps to balance some of the jamminess/ripeness. The aftertaste reverts back to the keen, sweet fruitiness found in the bouquet.

title: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Rum
description: The no-nonsense bouquet opens up with marshmallow, light toffee and light honey. Early taste is sweet and molasses-centric, then at midpalate there's a spiced honey flavor that gently guides you to the creamy, cake frosting finish. I liked this affable spiced rum when I first reviewed it 12 years ago and I still like it.

title: Loujan 22 Year Old Bas Armagnac
description: Opulent but astringent scents of honey, nut candy and dark toffee impress the olfactory sense. Flavor is tart, lean and brown sugar-like at first, then it explodes with marzipan, brown sugar, honey, cocoa and toasted almond. Aftertaste is long and bittersweet.

title: Oban 14 Year Old Western Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: The early aroma is a combination of malt, wood and sea breeze; the later bouquet is a deliciously harmonious, even creamy marriage of maritime atmosphere and malted barley. Palate entry is chock full of biscuity, peaty, tobacco leaf tastes; the midpalate stage is sweet. Concludes strong, firm, slightly hot, pungent and briny. The best-kept secret of Scotland's Western Highlands.

title: Scorpion Reposado 100% Agave Mezcal with Scorpion, Lot #37
description: The aroma offers real herbal/peppery/briny agave quality, plus notes of gum, wheat bread toast and spice. Palate entry highlights a piquant green pepper taste; the midpalate features softer, even delicate flavors of steamed asparagus, herbs and bittersweet agave juice. Finishes gently.

title: Scorpion Anejo 100% Agave Mezcal with Scorpion, Lot #30
description: Opening bouquet emits strong, firm aromas of saddle leather and oak; aeration adds minimal scents of vinyl, grass and distant honey. Palate entry offers sap-like tastes of maple and butterscotch; by midpalate, soft, almost plump flavors of sap, steamed green vegetables and palm oil take charge. Concludes warm in the throat.

title: Destileria Porfidio Single Cane Rum
description: Opening aroma owns a distinct, bitter aroma of green olive; aeration introduces atypical aromas such as sea air, green peppercorn and steamed broccoli, especially. Palate entry is bitter going on semisweet and vegetal/grassy rather than sugary; by midpalate, the taste offers bittersweet and oily cane-like flavors. Ends grassy and green. Worked for me.

title: Sambuca di Puglia Liqueur
description: First inhalations unearth mildly zesty aromas of licorice and brambles; richer, more muscular scents of black licorice, freshly ground black pepper and fennel rise with aeration. Palate entry is piquant, prickly yet velvety and slightly stinging on the tongue; by midpalate, the taste profile offers a viscous texture and heady flavors of anise and licorice. Ends smooth and thick.

title: Bushmills Malt 10 Year Old Single Malt Irish Whiskey/Green Label
description: The early stage aroma is fresh, malty, yeasty/beery and honey-like; further aeration stimulates intriguing notes of nougat, milk chocolate and oaky vanilla. Palate entry offers pleasantly fruity/grainy tastes that are off-dry. Ends up semisweet, candied and even a tad sherried.

title: Duncan Taylor & Co., Ltd. Glenrothes 1968 Cask 9970 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: Opening whiffs find old library-like aromas of parchment, cardboard and malt; more aeration reveals evolved scents that feature palm oil, lanolin, old oak, wood resin and faint vanilla bean. Palate entry offers a lip-smacking taste that's part maple and part oaky vanillin; by midpalate, the flavor displays semi-rich, woody, Sherry/honey tastes. Ends sweet and cocoa-like.

title: Danzka Citron Lemon Flavored Vodka
description: Nosings discover fresh though indistinct citrus aromas that one recognizes as lemon. At palate entry, the lemon component becomes more apparent as a pleasingly tart/bittersweet taste refreshes the taste buds; at midpalate, a flavor of lemon hard candy takes charge, lasting well into the clean, acidic finish.

title: Crater Lake Hand Crafted American Vodka
description: The aroma is distant except for a slight corny/buttered popcorn trace. Palate entry is silky smooth and oily; at midpalate there's a sooty/ashy core flavor. Ends smoothly and with a touch of spirity fire. Not a great vodka, but nicely balanced, completely dry and very silky.

title: Hudson Manhattan Rye Whiskey
description: Balanced, light and versatile, and likely a good foil for cocktails. Smoky fragrance with hints of caramel and dried apricots. The golden color, medium weight and flavors pleasantly evoke maple syrup and caramel at first, although zingy, oaky flavors soon follow. With ice, the wood becomes more pronounced. A nice, smooth and dry finish lingers but doesn't overstay its welcome.

title: Rittenhouse Straight Rye Whiskey
description: Complex and dry, with a shifting array of aromas and flavors. At first, this rye smelled spicy and orange-y, but later opened up to a strong caramel fragrance. In addition to heavy wood in the flavor, caramel, dark tea, and tobacco also can be detected. Light, smooth finish is velvety on the tongue. Light to medium body, with the right amount of bite. With some dilution from ice, it opens up, and becomes even more light and crisp. Seems like a good rye for Sazeracs and other cocktails.

title: Russell's Reserve 6 Year Old Rye Whiskey
description: Silky, smooth and syrupy, with a lightness that would lend itself to a Sazerac. Light tawny golden color, scent of vanilla, oranges and, faintly, peaches. Caramel flavors wind up into a pleasantly warm and smooth finish.

title: Rittenhouse Very Rare 25-Year-Old Straight Rye Whiskey
description: Complex and bold, with a deep amber color. This one is 100 proof, and won't let you forget it—the alcohol hits right on the nose, but so does a concentrated deep toffee and coffee-ground fragrance. The flavor hints at sweetness at first, then opens up to oak, caramel and spice. The finish is smooth, with lots of lingering caramel, but also a powerful bite. This is a beautiful example of what an aged rye can be, and it probably would have rated even higher if it weren't so powerfully alcoholic.

title: Michter's US*1 Single Barrel Rye
description: Crazy-sweet aroma, full of caramel, vanilla and a slight floral touch. The bite comes first (and lingers awhile), followed by vanilla, caramel, coconut flavors. It mellows considerably with ice, and becomes quite likeable, drinkable and mild.

title: Michter's 10-Year Old Single Barrel Rye Whiskey
description: Dark amber color, strongly and sweetly aromatic with hints of cigar tobacco and allspice. Pleasant, deep toffee flavors almost threaten to turn sweet, but the finish is brisk, brief and dry. Medium body.

title: Jim Beam Rye
description: This rye has a classic profile—a bit of spice, light flavor and good structure. Sweet caramel and aromas faded surprisingly quickly. Flavors featured vanilla and tannic black tea, and finished with alcohol bite and a caramel finish.

title: Wild Turkey Rye Whiskey
description: The kickin' chicken was a total chameleon: on the first pass, it reflected deep, round, almost sweet aromas, like fruitcake and spice, and equally sweet flavors of toffee and orange peel. But on the second pass, especially with ice, it became more brisk, dry, and light. However, the lingering, tannic bite and orange-amber color remained constant.

title: Redemption Rye
description: This high-rye spirit (close to 95% rye) is manly and rugged, like chewing on saddle leather. Elegant, straight-edge bottle design. Golden color and medium body. Aromas evoked burnt orange peel and ripe cheeses, while the flavors were boldly oaky and bitter, with notes of tobacco, leather and black tea. Dry, short, stinging finish.

title: Templeton Rye
description: Medium-amber color, citrusy aromas opening up to caramel scent. Big flavors of tobacco, oak, and leather lead to a lingering, tannic, alcoholic and slightly bitter finish. Cocktail purists will love the label showing old-time gentlemen in hats tippling at the bar.

title: Absolut Citron
description: Features a bright, pleasantly familiar orange-lemon lollipop scent and fresh, clean and brisk flavors, with most of the lemon in the finish. Balanced, with the right amount of alcohol bite. A sure classic for vodka tonics.

title: Hangar One Mandarin Blossom
description: The deep, sweet orange and honeyed-floral fragrance is the first signal this vodka will be special. The flavors are clean and brisk, followed by a strong bite and honey and tangerine notes. It finishes sweet, with faint floral and vanilla notes coaxed out over ice.

title: Finlandia Grapefruit Fusion
description: Opens with a fruity, slightly overripe aroma, very close to true grapefruit. The flavors of pomelo and lychee are more dry than sweet, finishing with a touch of anise and moderate bite.

title: Van Gogh Oranje
description: The sweet, high but slightly orange-soda ersatz scent accurately reflects the equally sweet and intensely orange taste of this vodka. Because it finishes smooth, with rounded orange and tangerine notes and a Cognac-like, warming touch of honey, it's addictively sippable.

title: Belvedere Orange
description: Pleasantly aromatic, with punchy orange blossom and lime candy notes. An initially neutral flavor gives way to a touch of sweetness. It finishes smooth, with a lingering hint of orange.

title: TRU Organic Lemon
description: Eco-advocates will love that the packaging is carbon-negative. But how's the liquid inside? Subtle and lovely. It's one of the few vodkas with a hint of pale yellow tint, as well as a slightly viscous body. The scent is light, natural, and lemon zest-y. The flavors also are on the subtle side, hinting at orange blossom, and tapering to lemon peel on the finish. This vodka would blend particularly well into sour-based cocktails.

title: Skyy Infusions Citrus
description: Bright, lemon-lime soda aromas, a touch ersatz. The pleasant flavor is reminiscent of sweet lemonade, finishing with a surprising herbal note. It braced up further over ice.

title: Absolut Mandarin
description: Luscious and perfumy, with Christmas clementine and vanilla aromas. However, there's far more orange on the nose than on the palate:  a big alcohol bite comes first, followed by neutral flavor with just a suggestion of orange, and a floral finish.

title: Smirnoff Twist of Orange
description: True fruit fragrance of orange peel oils, tangerine and a touch of lemon. Restrained and light on the palate, with most of the orange on the lingering finish.

title: Finlandia Lime Fusion
description: Despite a faint lime-lollipop scent, the flavor of this vodka tilted more toward lemon than lime, with perhaps a touch of lime-leaf essence. The subtle flavor and light feel would make for a polished, high-end cocktail.

title: Orange V
description: Crystal clear appearance, despite the striking orange bottle, and slightly viscous body. Nothing subtle here: get ready for big, sweet, Orange Crush aromas mirrored by sweet, absolutely huge orange flavors. While it was too sweet neat, almost like a liqueur, it gained more bite and structure over ice, and finished with a touch of lemon/citron. Very sippable.

title: Finlandia Tangerine Fusion
description: The flavors are more reminiscent of pear than orange, and lead to a mouthwatering finish, with just the right amount of bite to balance it out. Juicy, almost too overripe tangerine scent.

title: Stolichnaya Citros
description: The fragrance is sweet and like lemonade. Initially neutral flavor gives over to alcohol bite, and then a powerful, lingering bitter lemon finish. Probably would be good in a lemon drop, or cocktail that adds some sweetness to balance out the bite.

title: Elijah Craig 18-Year-Old Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Dark honey color, lushly aromatic, fragrance like a bouquet of wildflowers:  honeysuckle and clover. Viscous and luxurious on the tongue, it offers bold flavors of dark toffee, lots of oak, and finishes with bitter almond and a touch of raisin. Mellow; hardly any bite when chilled, which makes it highly sippable, almost like Cognac.

title: Elmer T. Lee Single Barrel Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Complex and addictive.  Scents of cinnamon, hazelnuts, and dried fruit precede big flavors: cinnamon spice, raisinated and plummy, like Madeira or Sherry. Long finish, with a bit of a bite.

title: Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey, 20 Years Old
description: Dark, spicy-sweet, deep vanilla aroma, and unlike many Bourbons, it tastes just like it smells. Medium to heavy body, with a mellow, lingering finish. Great sipper on a blustery night.

title: Wild Turkey Kentucky Spirit Bourbon
description: Lively, complex and deeply aromatic, with hits of Christmas spice, orange blossom and vanilla. It's spicy on the tongue, with lots of woodsy vanilla and orange. Medium body, this would rock a Bourbon-based Sazerac.

title: Elijah Craig 12-Year-Old Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Deep color, medium-to-heavy feel. Strong, sweet fragrance with wood and spice tones. Butterscotch candy flavors, so strong I almost hear cellophane unwrapping, are echoed by some oak, caramel and vanilla. Smooth, not too much alcohol fire. Mellow, long finish with a touch of herbal and anise notes.

title: Parker's Heritage Collection Golden Anniversary Bourbon
description: Extremely well balanced—it's complex but no single element stands out. Flavors are of caramel, burnt orange peel, toastiness and oak. Medium body, silky and long finish, with the right amount of bite, lingering aniseed note. Highly versatile.

title: Blanton's Single Barrel Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Pour it, and let it sit awhile; this one opens up and gets more aromatic, rich and flavorful, like wine. It starts off with a candied sweetness and touches of coconut and tea on the nose, then opens up to deeper caramel tones. Orange and caramel flavors, mellow, smooth, linger on the finish. Light-bodied, despite the bold, luxurious flavors. And oh, that pretty bottle, like an oversized perfume flask. Add this one to your gift list.

title: Colorado Premium Vodka
description: A clean, solid, totally dry and stone-like vodka bouquet. The palate entry is medium-full, dry and grainy; the midpalate displays a smooth oiliness that turns pleasantly vigorous and nearly prickly in the throat. Finishes long, stony and expectedly piquant.

title: FireFly Muscadine Wine Flavored Vodka
description: The opening aroma is thick with a pear-like ripeness and the musty smell of grape skins; aeration allows a grapiness that's gum-like and citrusy to emerge. There's a pleasant fruity burst of flavor at palate entry; the midpalate features an acidity that keeps the fruit ripeness in check. Concludes viney, winey, acidic and clean.

title: Bowmore 1968 Limited Edition 37-Year-Old Bourbon Wood Islay Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: A curious aroma of clear vinyl smells with meager scents of red cherry and orange peel. The palate entry is better than the bouquet, featuring an agreeably toasty, maple-like surface flavor; at midpalate the flavor profile expands to include butter, almond paste, bacon fat and pork rind. Finishes long, spirity, warm and elegant.

title: Perfect Vodka
description: The unremarkable bouquet only offers an extremely faint scent of cotton. The palate entry is pleasantly smooth, off-dry, and snack-cracker-like; the midpalate displays medium weight, moderate oiliness and a chewy quality that's grainy. Concludes bittersweet, a bit licorice-like and nicely balanced.

title: Echte Kroatzbeere Blackberry Liqueur
description: The bouquet offers intense bramble, but scant fruit fragrances. The palate entry is rich and concentrated with a deep blackberry taste; by midpalate the tastes becomes stony, ripe, preserves-like and ripe-sweet. Finishes jammy and ripe.

title: Hiram Walker Pomegranate Schnapps
description: The aroma is as much berry- and melon-like as it is pomegranate-like. The palate entry is nicely sour and tart; the midpalate offers acidic crispness that accentuates the freshness of the fruit. The tasty finish is lean and tart. Not the equal of the more pomegranate-like PAMA or Bauchant XO but very good.

title: Hiram Walker Tangerine Schnapps
description: The attractive bouquet is pleasantly citrusy and tangerine/blood orange-like. The palate entry is lusciously tangerine-like and sweet/sour; the midpalate takes a sweeter turn, sacrificing a portion of the citric acid to heighten the sweetness. Ends zestily and ripe.

title: Teton Glacier Potato Vodka
description: The aromas include a bittersweet vegetal scent and a fiber-like hint of hemp with a keen fragrance of charcoal or tar. The palate entry is pleasant and sweet; at midpalate the taste profile turns sharp, smoky and bitter.

title: Depaz Blue Cane Rhum Agricole
description: The compellingly complex and multi-layered bouquet includes fragrances of nutmeg, oak, wet grass, rubber pencil eraser, white pepper and carnations. The palate entry has flavors of   herbs, caney sweetness and flower garden; the midpalate features elements of smoke, tobacco leaf, black pepper, cinnamon, vanilla bean, nut paste and honey. Stupendous.

title: Plymouth English Gin
description: The full bodied, spicy aroma offers delicate notes of juniper berry oil, citrus, orris, coriander and caraway seed. Palate entry is mildly peppery, floral and fruity; at midpalate the flavor profile focuses more on oils and juniper. A unique and great gin.

title: Cuba Libre White El Dorado Demerara Rum
description: Early aroma sincludes ashy, tarred cinders/asphalt and molasses; following aeration the sweetness element comes to the forefront. The palate is bittersweet, a tad chalk-like and warming, then offers a highly pleasing bitterness. Finishes mellow, cocoa sweet, and lusciously medium-weighted in texture. What all molasses-based white rum should be.

title: Shustov No. 28 Vodka
description: A grainy, sweet, inviting bouquet turns bakery-like. The palate entry is soft and delicate; the midpalate features high levels of bittersweet grain kernel flavor, laced with clean acidity and ample viscosity. Ends gracefully, tight and bean-like.

title: Cuba Libre 5-Year-Old El Dorado Demerara Rum
description: Lovely bouquet that is delightfully fruity and nutty at the outset and then turns vanilla-like and winter holiday spicy. The palate entry is engagingly and moderately sweet; midpalate offers long, honeyed flavors without a hint of acidic edge or spirit-induced heat. Ends up plump and properly sweet.

title: Cuba Libre 21-Year-Old El Dorado Demerara Rum
description: Aeration allows aromas of oak, winter holiday spice and vanilla cake frosting to emerge. Supple palate entry, moderately honeyed; midpalate highlights include the buttery/creamy texture and tastes of cocoa, fiber, ash and beans. Sophisticated and world-class.

title: Regalia Vodka
description: Aromas of breakfast cereal, slate, charcoal and wet grass. The palate entry is supple and smoky sweet, thick in texture and altogether delightful; midpalate highlights the ashy sweetness. Finishes robustly and with panache.

title: Aperol Aperitivo Liqueur
description: Sophisticated and delightful aromas of tangerine and rhubarb. The palate entry is delightfully citrusy and sweet; the midpalate phase offers just enough herbal bitterness to balance. Ends up refreshing, orangey sweet and delectably herbal. This deserves to become a popular pre-dinner quaff.

title: George Dickel Barrel Select Tennessee Sour Mash Whiskey
description: Attractive scents of peanut butter, citrus peel and unsalted butter. The palate entry showcases the peanut quality, but adds a hint of charred oak; at midpalate the taste profile becomes more bacon fat-like and smoky, with nuances of palm oil, nut paste and cream.

title: George Dickel Superior No. 12 Tennessee Sour Mash Whiskey
description: The delightful bouquet offers potent tobacco ash, paraffin, sweet oak and grain kernel. The palate entry has spirity warmth and tastes of cigarette tobacco, light honey and cereal grain; midpalate texture is creamy and deliciously sooty. Finishes buttery, spirity and clean.

title: Cuba Libre 15-Year-Old El Dorado Demerara Rum
description: A medium-complex bouquet that demands focus and time; offers scents of grass, textile, peanut, beeswax with an underlying honeyed sweetness. The palate is mellow and marshmallow sweet, then features luscious and delicate flavors of honey, cola nut and cream. Elegant, poised and succulent.

title: Quadro Ultra Premium Vodka
description: The first nosing passes detect an intriguing ashy/charcoal quality; aeration stimulates scents of kernel, dry grain and a touch of white pepper. The palate entry is fat, buttery and mildly grainy sweet; the midpalate is full-bodied, intensely oily, moderately sweet and grainy. Ends on a sweet, biscuity note.

title: Regalia Royal Vodka
description: This was matured for six months in vats lined with white gold. Smells of glass, sand and grain. The palate entry is sweet, waxy and quite delicious; at midpalate there's a thrust of minerals, wheat and a leanness that's crisp, acidic and very refreshing.

title: DH Krahn Gin
description: The bouquet is woodsy and peppery with only faint juniper evidence. The sweet and oily palate entry shows good substance; at the midpalate stage the the juniper emerges and overshadows other botanicals.

title: Francis Darroze 1986 Domaine de Rieston Bas Armagnac
description: The nose displays its elevated abv and smells fiber-like with additional scents of wood chips, sawdust and distant tropical fruits. The palate entry is pipe tobacco-like and nicely prickly; the midpalate shows the oak influence in forms of vanilla, maple, butterscotch, dark toffee and nougat. Ends unbelievably rich and honeyed.

title: Hennessy Ellipse Cognac
description: The nosing passes find appetizing scents of caramel apple, dates, figs, white raisins and distant hints of spice. The palate entry is rich, floral and fruity; the Cognac takes flight at the delightful midpalate as delicate flavors of honey, marzipan, light toffee, and spice merge. Concludes gently and with elegance.

title: G'Vine Gin de France Small Batch Gin
description: Aromas of floral botanicals, lemon peel, cassia, cubeb berries and piny juniper. The palate entry focuses squarely on orange blossom and orange peel; the midpalate expands to highlight the spice elements, especially nutmeg and coriander, in a satisfying mouth experience. Ends up lean, moderately oily, bark-like and floral.

title: Francis Darroze 1978 Domaine du Martin Bas Armagnac
description: The nosing passes find a zesty, citrusy, spirity bouquet with aromas of beeswax, lanolin, resin and polish. The palate entry offers luscious flavors of candied apple, cotton candy and caramel corn; the midpalate features buttery, silky-smooth flavors that gently coat the tongue. Concludes sweet, toffee-like, oaky, slightly smoky and luxurious.

title: Yes Vodka
description: The nosing passes find pleasantly sweet, plump, mildly baked and grainy scents of oatmeal, tar, tobacco leaf and vines. The palate entry is sap-like, bitter, yet firm and sturdy; the midpalate stage features the hearty, toasted and dry grain underpinning flavor. Concludes too minerally/ metallic.

title: Corzo Anejo Tequila NOM 1487 CRT
description: A delicate, non-woody bouquet with notes of fennel, pickle brine, cucumber, green pepper, and escarole. The palate entry is medium-dry, and peppery; at midpalate tastes of semisweet oak, agave sugars and herbs are added. Ends up more dry than sweet and keenly earthy/vegetal as the oak element vanishes.

title: Los Azulejos Silver Tequila NOM 1437 CRT
description: The bouquet offers pleasing notes of green chili pepper, dill, rubber soles, beeswax, and slate/limestone. The palate entry is agave sweet and slightly peppery; the midpalate rings with agave juice sweetness and lesser tastes of tobacco, asparagus, and sage. Concludes nicely with flavors of black pepper, ash, and green vegetables.

title: Burnett's Peach Flavored Vodka
description: The pleasing bouquet features ripe scents of fresh white peaches. The palate entry is nicely peachy; the midpalate stage isn't quite as natural as the bouquet, but it's still agreeable enough to be recommendable. Ends up fresh, ripe and fruity.

title: Leopold Gourmel L'Age de Fleurs Fins Bois Cognac
description: This bouquet doesn't open up until substantial aeration time has elapsed when lively scents of pears, apples, paraffin and nutmeg emerge from the thin upfront nose. Palate entry is toasty, maple-like and pleasingly sweet; midpalate offers sweet and toasted tastes of nougat, baked apple, fruit pastry and honey. Finish is lusciously fruity and dry.

title: Leopold Gourmel L'Age de Epices Fins Bois Cognac
description: The bouquet is MIA except for meager aromas of spice and fruit. Palate entry is succulent and dried fruit-like and seductively honey-like; midpalate shows a touch of rancio flavor as well as lots of black raisin, prune Danish and baked pear tastes. Concludes pruny, sap-like, maple-like and intensely honeyed.

title: G. Bertagnolli Grappa Torre di Luna
description: The somewhat lackluster bouquet offers aromas of glue, new leather and coin with a discrete undertone of grape pomace. Palate entry is nicely ripe and grapy sweet; midpalate is slightly toasty, which complements the ripe raisiny quality. Finishes concentrated, sweet and extended in the throat.

title: Qi White Exotic Oranges & White Tea Liqueur
description: The aromatic profile is triple sec-like with aromas of perfumed, slightly sweet orange blossom, orange hard candy and orange zest/dried peel. Palate entry continues the triple sec theme with tastes of tart, bitter orange astringency; at midpalate the tea component finally gets involved in a mellow, seamless manner. Ends up clean and tasty.

title: Qi Black Lapsang Souchong Tea Liqueur
description: The unusual bouquet offers aromas of burning rubber tire, burnt autumn leaves, Band-Aids and burnt tropical fruit. Palate entry is intensely smoky—even smokier than the bouquet; midpalate offers aggressive flavors of Lapsang Souchong, wood smoke, cigarette ash and creosote. Idiosyncratic and interesting but not for everyone.

title: Leopold Gourmel Premieres Saveurs Fins Bois Cognac
description: Nosing passes find pleasingly delicate orchard fruit perfumes. Palate entry is light-footed, pear-like, bittersweet and nearly honeyed; midpalate has a dried fruit composition, which is nicely balanced except for a touch of spirity harshness. Concludes a bit lean but with enough lingering dried fruit for a nice aftertaste.

title: G. Bertagnolli Grappa di Moscato
description: The nosing passes find fragrances of orange blossom, cucumber and spring garden. Palate entry is pleasingly orangy, nearly rich and very drinkable; midpalate is sweet/sour with orange concentration and grapiness. Ends up on a strong, punchy note of grapiness and orange water intensity.

title: Joseph Cartron Cacao Brun Liqueur
description: Bouquet offers a fat cocoa butter scent that is part cacao pod and part butter. Palate entry is delightfully dark chocolate-like and malty; midpalate furthers the cacao focus without allowing the sugar to overshadow the dark bittersweet chocolate flavor. Ends intensely bittersweet, beany and viscous.

title: Bowmore 1991 16 Year Old Islay Single Malt Whisky Port Matured/Non-Chill Filtered/Cask Strength
description: Wonderful aromas of creosote, burning cigarette, kippers, olive brine, salty sea spray, furniture polish and ink. Palate entry tastes include green peppercorns, green tea, burnt sugar and custard cream; midpalate adds flavors of red wine, pipe tobacco, lead pencil, bittersweet honey, cocoa bean, vanilla bean all without losing sight of its innate Islay brininess. Fabulous.

title: Lagavulin 21 Year Old Rare Edition Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: The nosing passes find potent aromas of baked ham, baked pineapple, crispy pork rind, brown butter, smoked haddock, toasted marshmallow, charcoal briquette and charred steak. Palate entry is intensely peaty and tastes of olive brine; midpalate is wonderfully peaty. It ignites on my tongue in the fiery finish. Love it.

title: Brugal Ron Extra Viejo Gran Reserva Familiar Dominican Rum
description: The bouquet features aromas of oak barrel, toasted cereal, dried fruit and toasted nuts. Entry is spicy and buttered-toasty; midpalate turns more honeyed with background tastes of egg yolk. Ends caramel sweet and toasted marshmallow-like.

title: Skyy Infusions Cherry Vodka
description: The bouquet offers succulent scents of red cherries and cherry compote. Palate entry is alive with fresh red cherry flavor; midpalate bursts with ripe cherry taste yet is acidic enough to hold the tartness. Ends in a cherry rush of flavor that's terrifically satisfying and vibrant.

title: Bruichladdich 1993 Italian Collection 14 Year Old Islay Single Malt Whisky Double Matured in Barolo/French Oak
description: The initial bouquet offers captivating aromas of buttercream, pine tar, sap and grape vines; following aeration the viney quality transforms into a winey fragrance that includes oily scents of Danish pastry, dried fruit and yellow cake batter. Concludes clean, peppery sweet and astringent. Delicious in an austere and compact manner.

title: Skyy Infusions Citrus Vodka
description: First nosing passes find delicate scents of lemon, tangerine, blood orange and lime; following aeration the fruit element turns riper and more juicy, enlivening more acidity. Palate entry is deliciously lemony, acutely tart and crisp; midpalate stays tart and the acidity builds slightly as the fruit juice quality stays strong. Finishes sharp and crisp, clean and refreshing.

title: Leguas 7 Añejo 100% Agave Tequila
description: Properly peppery and vegetal aromas initially; following aeration the bouquet turns more briny and spicy. Palate entry is nicely oaked, but not enough to be resiny and retains enough savory agave character; midpalate is beautifully balanced between a calm oaky sweetness, agave character, acidity and saltiness. Concludes woody and clean.

title: Leguas 7 Reposado 100% Agave Tequila
description: First nosings find soft, elegant aromas of gentle cinnamon and vanilla, agave juice, green vegetable and black peppercorn; these are supplanted by traces of spice and oak. Entry is buttery, almost light toffee sweet, yet correctly acidic; midpalate is lightly peppery, with hints of vanilla and nutmeg. Finish is wonderfully restrained and elegant.

title: Springbank 16 Year Old Rum Wood Campbeltown Single Malt Whisky
description: The reluctant bouquet features weak notes of textile, sea breeze and gun metal. At entry rich, oaky and guardedly sweet tastes gradually build in intensity; by midpalate all the parts (acidity, oak, grain, rum-impact) are working in harmony. Finish is lean but sweet, malty but oaky, focused but unbridled. Wonderful recovery after disappointing bouquet.

title: Talisker 30 Year Old Rare Edition Skye Single Malt Whisky
description: The nosing passes find scents of sea breeze, kippers, brine, leather, barley malt, light oakiness and tannin. Palate entry is dry at first then opens up with succulent tastes of smoked trout, green peppercorn and sea salt; midpalate is oily, salty, oaky sweet with some bitterness to balance the sweetness. Ends lean, sweet and delicious.

title: Brugal White Label Dominican Rum
description: First nosing passes find aromas of marshmallows, cotton candy and grass, which grow in sugar-cane intensity. Entry is silky, concentrated, lusciously buttery, spicy and molasses-sweet; midpalate features a vanilla bean bonanza. Finishes long, oily, bittersweet and silky.

title: Skyy Infusions Passion Fruit Vodka
description: Passion fruit fragrance is true, fresh and succulent; aeration rounds off the acidic edges, making the fruit plumper and riper. Palate entry is rich, intensely fruity, tart, yet ripe and pleasing; midpalate turns tarter and therefore fresher and cleaner than the meatier entry taste. Finishes concentrated, clean and genuine.

title: Skyy Infusions Grape Vodka
description: The bouquet offers delicate scents of grape soda and Concord grape jam, which are acidic enough to keep sweetness in check. Palate entry is sweet, a touch steely and nicely astringent; midpalate turns almost too sweet but holds it together into the aftertaste as the ripe grapiness wins out.

title: Leguas 7 Blanco 100% Agave Tequila
description: Pleasant aromas of asparagus, dill, white pepper with a slight toffee-like undertone that complements the vegetal base aroma. Entry is clean, smooth and a touch sweet; midpalate is adequately veggie-like, spicyand lightly buttery. Finishes with a whisper of peppery agave. Lightweight, but recommendable because of its understatement and quality.

title: Lagavulin 1991 Distillers Edition Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: Uneven bouquet features smells of peanuts, almond paste, pipe tobacco with atypical scents of limestone, metal tubing, Band-Aids and peated malt. The one-dimensional entry is austerely focused on the oak; however, at midpalate the flavor turns honeyed, nougaty, concentrated and lusciously dark caramel-like. Finishes with assertive tastes of butterscotch, marzipan, sherry, egg cream and brine.

title: Bruichladdich 1993 Italian Collection 14 Year Old Islay Single Malt Whisky Double Matured in Sassicaia/American Oak
description: First nosing passes find aromas of seared oak barrel, brown butter and smoked trout; aeration adds layers of tree bark, cedar and salt. Palate entry is off-dry but slightly bitter; midpalate features firework displays of pork rind, jerky and cigar tobacco. Finishes expressively astringent and a tad too fiery in throat.

title: Bruichladdich 12 Year Old Islay Single Malt Whisky Second Edition Traditional
description: Timid bouquet offers lean smells of earth, beeswax, salted peanuts, moss and dry grain. Palate entry is lovely, feminine, moderately briny, zesty and peppery; midpalate maintains the spiciness established in the entry and carries that forward on an medium-oily texture. Ends a touch flattened out and meek.

title: Skyy Infusions Raspberry Vodka
description: The nosing passes find a nice red raspberry jam bouquet that's simultaneously sweet and tart. Palate entry leans towards the brambly side of red raspberry and that vinous face slightly distorts the natural fruitiness; midpalate remains bramble-like. Unfortunately, the mouth phases doesn't fulfill the promise of the bouquet.

title: Coole Swan Superior Dairy Cream Liqueur
description: Delightful aromas of vanilla, double cream, egg cream, nutmeg, plus some beeswax and cocoa. Palate entry features succulent tastes of cocoa, white chocolate and Irish double cream; midpalate is thick, rich, gently sweet, ideally spicy (mostly cinnamon) and a touch grainy. Concludes luxuriously textured and dashed with holiday spices. Delicious.

title: Crispin's Rose Liqueur
description: The remarkable, fabulous bouquet smells of a room filled with (genuine) roses at their peak bloom; aeration allows a beguiling sap-like, pollen-like sweetness to emerge. Palate entry is delicate, concentrated, flowery and sweetly rosy; midpalate offers layer after layer of gentle, stately rose tastes. Ends moderately sweet, with a slight metal-like edge. Spectacular.

title: Joseph Cartron Crème de Cassis de Bourgogne
description: The perfect crème de cassis bouquet features concentrated black currant skin aromas and extreme tannic acid. Palate entry is super tannic and astringent and focused on the black currant juice and skins; the midpalate is perfectly balanced between the ripe fruit, acid, tannin and sweet tartness. Concludes thick, incredibly tart and astringent, and utterly luscious. A crème de cassis beauty.

title: Delamain Le Voyage Grande Champagne Cognac
description: The fabulous bouquet features wonderful scents of white chocolate, marshmallow, dried apricot, tropical fruit, English toffee, buttercream, chocolate covered orange rind, marmalade, and the beginnings of rancio. Palate entry is resiny, beany, and moderately oily; midpalate includes tastes of caramel, treacle, prunes and very old Sherry. Ends elegantly yet forcefully. A gem.

title: Sauza Blue Tequila Silver
description: This opens with aromas of bright mint and fresh basil. The palate has similar mint and menthol notes, along with jalapeño and a flash of petrol on the midpalate. It finishes with a scorpion sting of alcohol heat.

title: Amaro Montenegro
description: One of the lightest and gentlest amari, this amber spirit delicately mixes sarsaparilla-like herbal notes and honey sweetness with just the right bitter edge. Mix it into cocktails—mixologists love this amaro—or sip it as a delightful digestif.

title: Amaro Nonino
description: Tawny and bright in the glass, this mellow, bittersweet beauty offers caramel and vanilla, braced by allspice and bitter orange. Although Nonino is best known for its grappas, this amaro, flavored with herbs from the mountains of Friuli, is worth seeking out. Consider it for dessert pairings or an edgy spin on a negroni.

title: Vecchia Romagna Riserva
description: Rivaling fine French brandies of similar age (10 years), this riserva is scented with honey and dates. On the palate, complex flavors run to dried fruit, baking spice and caramel.

title: Caffo Solara
description: Made with brandy and oranges from southern Italy, this orange liqueur is rich and authentic, with orange peel and blossom aromas and flavors as well as a long, vanilla-forward finish. A flicker of alcohol-derived heat balances out the sweetness. Savor it as a delicious finish to a meal or use it as a versatile cocktail mixer.

title: Carpano Antica Formula
description: Rich, fruity and enticing, this sweet vermouth is warmed with notes of fig and dried cherries, and just faint hints of spiced gingerbread and bitter orange peel. Drinkable solo as an apéritif, or use it as a cocktail-mixing favorite.

title: Carpano Bianco
description: New to the U.S. market, this dry vermouth smells fresh and fruity. It's well-structured, too: sweet at first, with fleeting pear and tropical fruit flavors, a trace of minerality on the finish and a faint bitterness. An excellent choice for martinis and other cocktails calling for dry vermouth, but unlike most dry vermouths, this one would be pleasing on its own, with ice and a twist of orange peel.

title: Dominique Brandy Italiano Riserva
description: Burnished gold in color, this soft Friuli brandy, aged for more than three years, hints at golden raisins drizzled with honey, dried apricots and figs, and ripe pears. Use this warming sipper to spike a dessert, or serve it alongside the grand finale to a meal.

title: Vecchio Amaro del Capo
description: Made using a mix of 29 Calabrian herbs and roots, this ruddy amaro is herbal and seductive, mixing root beer-like notes with honey and vanilla sweetness, all enlivened by a spicy accent on the finish. Versatile enough to mix into cocktails before dinner or to sip with dessert afterward.

title: Ramazzotti Amaro
description: Although it appears dark, inky and sin¬ister in the glass, this amaro is on the sweet and gentle side. Think ripe plums, dark berries and cola, with a pleasingly spiced finish and just the faintest bitter edge. It's enjoyable to sip straight up with a twist of lemon peel, or lightened with a splash of club soda.

title: Limoncino dell'Isola
description: Cloudy in the glass but bright on the palate, this sweet-but-sprightly liqueur has candied lemon-peel notes jazzed up by ginger and white pepper accents on the clean finish. Made with Calabrian lemons, it's lovely for sipping solo, but would shine in a cocktail with gin or a bubbly element.

title: Amaro Meletti
description: The brisk, invigorating scent of this amaro hovers between herbal and medicinal. On the palate, it skews sweeter, with rich caramel and hazelnut flavors and just enough bitterness and baking spice to keep things interesting.

title: Punt e Mes
description: This aroma of this sweet vermouth suggests dark berries and savory spices. The first sip is sweet, rich and plummy, with flickers of juicy orange. The long finish is shored up with baking spice and dried thyme. Recommended for cocktails.

title: Averna Amaro Siciliano
description: Opaque and inky brown, the restrained aroma hints at espresso. On the palate, it's a wash of espresso, hazelnut and cola, with a pleasantly fleeting sweet-ness followed by a long, herbal finish.

title: Faretti Decadent Biscotti
description: Luscious and—as the name says—decadent. Expect thick, rounded hazelnut, chocolate and almond, cut by a fleeting hint of fennel and good alcohol balance. Serve alongside a plain, quiet dessert, so this full-flavored liqueur won't compete for attention, or use it to sweeten coffee.

title: Vecchia Romagna Brandy
description: This brandy leads with powerful, rounded vanilla notes and finishes with lots of baking spice on the finish. In between, look for honey and date flavors, and a moderately viscous feel.

title: Amaretto Liqueur
description: This golden sweetie is like marzipan in a glass. Candy-like Sicilian almonds, vanilla and a touch of orange coat the palate, flavors lingering long after the liquid is gone. A dessert-like choice for amaretto sours and other cocktails.

title: Casoni 1814 Aperitivo Liqueur
description: This rosy-bright aperitivo is similar to Aperol, although it's more delicate and complex. It's bold and juicy-sweet on the palate, with a faint grapefruit-like bitterness and a floral touch on the long, elegant finish. Made in the Emilia-Romagna region.

title: Antica Sambuca Classic
description: Among the best of the sambucas, this one features a clean and bold licorice profile, a classic flavor in the Italian spirits canon. Serve with coffee, or straight up with three coffee beans floated for luck.

title: Cynar
description: One of the classic amaros every bartender seems to have on hand, this artichoke-based spirit is on the gentler side of the amaro spectrum. It doesn't really resemble artichokes; instead, the aroma is intensely herbal, even slightly medicinal, and on the tongue it's sweet and light, laced with herbal flavors and notes of allspice and cola.

title: Grappa Nonino Antica Cuvee Riserva
description: Compared to most fiery grappas, this one, aged 18 months, enters aged brandy territory. It has a bright topaz hue and a big, butterscotchy flavor accented by clove and hot cinnamon sparks, with a drying feel. Pair it with a rich, fruity dessert.

title: Meletti Cioccolato
description: Chocoholics, take note: here's a digestivo that looks and drinks like rich chocolate syrup. The flavor lands somewhere between milk chocolate and semisweet, and it's like a dessert in itself. Some may find the superthick, palate--coating liqueur too rich for sipping—in which case, pour it over ice cream, affogato style.

title: Aperol Aperitivo Liqueur
description: Among the canon of Italian spirits, Aperol and the Aperol Spritz cocktail are classics, available at a growing range of America's best bars. The lurid red hue is recognizable from across the room. It's light on every count—in terms of alcohol content, sweetness level and texture. The gentle sweet-bitter profile goes down easy—especially when lightened with bubbles.

title: Faretti Biscotti Famosi
description: Hailing from Northern Italy, this tawny-orange liqueur is based on biscotti cookies. It has a remarkable pastry-like quality, from the rich roasted-almond aroma to the sweet, syrupy, almond-paste flavor flecked with fennel. Use to sweeten coffee, tiki drinks in place of orgeat syrup, or to add flavor to baked goods.

title: Meletti Anisette
description: Among the best of the its category, Meletti made its name experimenting with anise plants from numerous Italian provinces as far back as 1870, determining finally that the best quality anise grew on the Adriatic Coast directly east of Rome. The end result: a pungent aroma hinting at anise and fennel, and a mellow, sippable flavor that slowly unfurls fiery cinnamon, anise, Dutch licorice and a sweet-herbal hint of sarsaparilla.

title: Meletti Limoncello
description: This lemon liqueur appears slight at first: pale yellow and slightly cloudy, lightly fragranced with lemon oil. Yet one sip, and the favor is unmistakably bold, balancing sweetness with an authentic and clean lemon-peel acidity.

title: Molinari Sambuca Extra
description: This is among the best of the sambuca category. Look for sweet licorice and fennel aromatics, and bold anise flavor on the palate, which grows bolder and more rounded with repeated sips. The alcohol bite softens with the addition of ice or coffee, while the licorice flavor continues to sing out.

title: Luxardo Aperitivo Liqueur
description: Made in Padua, this lurid, transparent red liquid is similar to Aperol. It has a fruity, slightly floral aroma and bold flavors that start with grapefruit-like bitterness and end moderately sweet. The texture is light and silky. Serve with a hearty splash of Prosecco.

title: Averna Sambuca Agrumi
description: This intriguingly fruity take on sambuca, made with Sicilian lemons and grapefruit, is surprisingly sippable. Although the anise and licorice notes quickly overwhelm the fruits's flavor, a bit of refreshing citrus peeks out on the rounded finish. Pour over ice in a tall glass and lighten with soda water.

title: Martini Gran Lusso
description: Developed to celebrate the 150th anniversary of Martini, Gran Lusso means “grand luxury.” The limited-edition sweet vermouth has an appropriately plummy, luscious quality. Mixing white Trebbiano and red Barbera wines (their other vermouths are made solely with Trebbiano) yields notes of ripe fruit and savory oregano-like spice that finish semisweet.

title: The Jewel of Russia Ultra Vodka
description: The delicate perfume is softly grainy, with nuances of white pepper, wheat crackers and cigarette tobacco. The palate entry is elegant yet a touch hot; at midpalate the dry flavor turns silky in texture and minerally and stone-like in taste. Concludes bean- and kernel-like, bittersweet and a touch soy curd-like. A subtle, understated vodka with lots of layers and grip.

title: Borsci Succ'Agro Lemon Liqueur
description: The intensely lemony, sour initial aroma has perfect acid/fruit/alcohol balance; after aeration the bouquet resembles sour lemon-flavored hard candy. Palate entry features squeaky clean, lemon juice sourness that continues throughout the excellent midpalate stretch. The finish is clean, sour, and tight as a drum. One of the best limoncellos I've tasted.

title: Whisky Galore Bowmore 1991 Islay Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: First sniffs find sweetly medicinal aromas of worn cowhide, cigarette ash, fruity pipe smoke and sea breeze; aeration adds scents of beeswax and clover. The lush palate entry is honeyed, sherry-like and dried fruit-like; at midpalate the spirit jumps on board directing the fruit and honey towards a beguiling cherry cake-like taste. Finishes sweet, fruity and mildly iodine-like.

title: Gosling's Family Reserve Old Rum
description: The bouquet changes dramatically within the 10-minute nosing period from a baked aroma to an earthy, spicy, woodsy aroma. The palate entry is smooth, intensely oaky, yet semisweet; at midpalate the sweetness picks up in the forms of honey and molasses. Concludes elegantly, satiny smooth in the throat, and properly bittersweet.

title: South Premium Gin
description: Alluring opening scent is stunningly baked and pod-like; further air contact releases aromas of moss, slate, charcoal and mint. Palate entry is bittersweet and grainy; at midpalate the juniper peeks out from the behind the luxurious curtain of wet earth, angelica, orris and green vegetation. Concludes on a sweet, juniper note and with a touch of warmth.

title: The Dalmore 21-Year-Old Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: A superb and complex bouquet with aromas of old leather, palm oil, and cigar tobacco with deeper layers of spice, caraway seed, black pepper, dry malt and oak. The palate entry is buttery, medium-bodied and stunningly toffee-like; at midpalate the flavor goes mildly citrusy, creamy and bittersweet. Finishes with flavors of barley and maple

title: Marie Duffau Hors d'Age Bas Armagnac
description: The opening aroma has potent notes of vanilla extract, figs, and resin; aeration stimulates lighter scents of marzipan, caramel corn and Danish pastry. The palate entry offers rich, near-smoky flavors of cigar box, tobacco, and herbs; the midpalate stage is more focused and tobacco-like than the entry. Finishes bittersweet with a taste of dates/figs. Handsome, concentrated, baked.

title: Averna Amaro Bitter Liqueur
description: An initial aroma of bittersweet dark chocolate, orange peel, and herbs; air contact stimulates scents of flowers, jasmine, bark, forest, honey, and very light quinine. The palate entry is intensely sweet and floral; at midpalate the taste profile turns cocoa-like with notes of citrus rind, molasses, brown sugar, and grass. Concludes sweet, thick, and luscious.

title: Starbucks Coffee Liqueur
description: Luscious aromas are of cocoa bean, cigarette tobacco, and sand/gravel. The palate entry is strong yet elegant, coffee-like and bittersweet; at midpalate the bittersweet element gives way to an intense coffee bean flavor that's right on the money. Finishes bitter and genuinely coffee-like.

title: Glen Garioch 1958 46-Year-Old Natural Cask Strength Eastern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: Only 43 bottles for the U.S. Spearmint, shale, wet cement, light toffee, gum, white pears, cigarette ash, bay leaves and pineapple in the nose. Palate entry is earthy-floral, herbal, and dry to off-dry; at midpalate the taste profile shows flavors of dry malt cereal, oak, vanilla bean, cocoa bean, and nougat. Ends up off-dry to bittersweet, balanced, intensely cereally.

title: Lombard Teaninich 12-Year-Old Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: The opening inhalations pick up horsey/outdoorsy/ paddock scents like saddle leather, cut grass, hay, turned earth, sweat and summer garden. Palate entry is tight, sweetly malty, toffee-like, and grainy; at midpalate the flavor turns toasty, slightly smoked, rich, creamy and lush. Ends up fat, creamy, oily and luscious. Best Buy.

title: Rhum Clément V.S.O.P. Aged Rum
description: A muted aroma of brown sugar and milk chocolate with traces of peanut and black pepper. The elegant yet assertive palate entry is firm, peppery, moderately sweet, and cane-like; at midpalate the texture turns silky, semisweet and cocoa-like to the taste, and eminently elegant and sophisticated in style. Finishes sweet, honeyed, medium-bodied, svelte and utterly yummy.

title: Burnett's Cherry Flavored Vodka
description: The initial aroma is tremendously ripe and alluring in its true-to-the-fruit-source manner; following aeration the aroma changes to a more cherry preserves leaning than fresh-picked. The palate entry is properly sweet, ripe and cherry-like; at midpalate, the taste profile becomes more Maraschino cherry in nature than just-off-the-tree. Finishes well and vibrantly fruity. A stunning bargain, Best Buy.

title: Rain Vodka
description: The sweet corn aroma right after the pour is enticing, clean, and soft; aeration further stimulates an appetizing corn-like sweetness. The palate entry is more bittersweet than the aroma, but just as seductive; at midpalate there's a focused lead-pencil taste that brings the grainy sweetness into check. Finishes sweet, warming and a tad prickly. Best Buy.

title: Chabot Armagnac Vintage 1972
description: The toasty nose is full right from the first whiff; later nosings detect lovely scents of dark toffee, marzipan, roasted chestnuts, and oaky resin. Palate entry is fat, mildly spirity and warm, and semisweet; at midpalate there's a rush of fruity/grapy flavor that overrides the wood and toffee. One of the better, more vigorous vintage-dated armagnacs from Chabot. Bravo.

title: Darroze 1979 Domaine de Guillemouta Bas Armagnac
description: First whiffs showcase a buttery richness that's inviting and creamy; aeration adds seductive scents of roasted almond, palm oil and light oak; highly complex bouquet. Palate entry is semisweet, oaky and resiny; midpalate is sap-like, sweet, nougaty and medium-rich. Aftertaste is apple-like, ripe and caramel-intense. A multilayered beauty.

title: De Montal 1969 Armagnac
description: Initial nosing pass reveals banana, guava, cherries and baked pear scents; aeration stimulates balanced aromas of wood, resin and maple; the aroma stage is vibrant and ambrosial. Palate entry shows a sap-like opening flavor that's sweet and maple-like; at midpalate, caramel, toffee and nougat take the helm and guide the taste phase through the sweet, lip-smacking finish. Hearty, candied.

title: Laberdolive 1962 Pillon Bas Armagnac
description: First sniffs reveal deep-seated aromas that are dry, moderately candied and oaky on the surface; with swirling, the bouquet exposes dry aromas of orange pekoe tea, cedar, black pepper and old oak. Semisweet to sweet entry tastes of dark caramel, nougat and bittersweet chocolate; flavors of marshmallow, candied almonds, dried apricot and honey get added to the mix at midpalate. Huge depth and multiple layers in the taste and finish phases. A brandy beast to stalk your cellar.

title: Santa Teresa Gran Reserva Ron Anejo Rum
description: The aroma after the pour is lightly spicy and delicately brown sugar-like; air contact stirs deeper scents of molasses, dark caramel and lead/minerals. The palate entry is sugar sweet; at midpalate there's a taste rush to marshmallow, confectioner's sugar, oaky vanilla and light honey. Finishes gracefully, with lip-smacking tastes of bittersweet brown sugar and honey. Best Buy.

title: Old Pogue “Master's Select” Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: The nosing passes find alluring, sweet grain and plum scents, delicate aromas of paraffin, confectioner's suga, and a trace of maple. Palate entry is silky smooth and tastes of light caramel, buttered sweet corn and maple. Concludes firm, warm on the tongue, and moderately oily. A new American small-batch gem.

title: Coyopa 10 Year Old Rum
description: Zesty scents of cinnamon, oaky vanilla and cocoa. Sap and maple-like flavors bring the taste buds to full attention; by midpalate, the flavor explodes in waves of butter cream, brown sugar, honey and chocolate-covered cherries. Finish offers hints of marshmallow and dark chocolate.

title: Svoboda Vodka
description: Shows typical Russian aromas of off-dry grain mash, light dried herbs, smoke and charcoal. Sweet, grainy, almost candied tastes on entry lead to spirity fire, sweet grain and coconut oil. Finish is long, embers-warm, intensely sweet and charcoal-like.

title: Ciclón Bacardi Premium Gold Rum Infused with Imported Blue Agave Tequila & Natural Lime Juice
description: Made from Puerto Rican rum, lime juice and 100% agave Tequila. First sniffings are dominated by the tart perfume of fresh-squeezed lime juice; aeration heightens the lime juice intensity. Palate entry is dry, herbal; by midpalate, it's obvious that the rum is merely a base for the Tequila-lime-juice combo.

title: Lindemans Kriek Cherry Lambic
description: Deep crimson/ruby hue; pink foam. The sweet, ripe black cherry aroma is nuanced and seductive. On palate, the taste explodes on the tongue, offering concentrated flavors of hardcore black cherry and blackberry. Aftertaste is razor-edged, refreshing, tart and acidic. Loved it from start to finish.

title: Arran Single Sherry Cask/Cask Strength Isle of Arran Single Malt Whisky
description: First nosing seems green and vegetal, with a background trace of sea salt; further time stirs additional scents, including wet sand, green olives, and linseed oil. Palate entry is lightly honeyed and caramel-like; by midpalate, the sherry influence is in full bloom as succulent flavors of dark caramel, black tea leaves, nougat, treacle, and marzipan thrill the palate. Finishes sweet, plucky, and heady.

title: Peter Jake's Private Keep 10 Year Old Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Bright topaz/honey color. The initial passes detect fruity aromas, almost like baked apple plus a trace of pekoe tea; additional time in the glass stimulates scents of corn husk, light caramel and mildly prickly spirit. Palate entry is vibrant, spirity but neither harsh nor raw; midpalate features lovely flavors of sweet corn, toffee and baked pear. Aftertaste is long, mildly oily and semisweet. A dazzlingly good combination of maturity and vigor.

title: Bowmore 1964 Oloroso Sherry Cask Single Islay Malt Scotch Whisky/Cask Strength
description: Old copper penny/vintage Armagnac color. Initial nosing passes offer assertive aromas that include hints of old oak, palo cortado Sherry and wood resin; additional time adds firmly structured, oily scents of almond butter, sea salt and malt. Palate entry is oily, buttery and semisweet; by the midpalate there's a touch of orange pekoe tea leaves, tobacco smoke, mince pie, honey, molasses and Sherry. Aftertaste features the delightfully oily texture and the honey-like oloroso Sherry.

title: Macallan Cask Strength Single Highland Malt Scotch Whisky/Speyside
description: Chestnut/oloroso Sherry-like hue. Smells of baked bananas, rancio, hard cheese, burnt matches, oloroso sherry, fruit cake, dark chocolate and charred hickory. On palate it's firm, not as hot as I thought it might be and lip-smackingly luscious; at midpalate the intensity of the alcohol slightly burns the tongue; once spring water is added the taste profile readjusts itself and emits ambrosial flavors of Christmas pudding, honey, molasses and dark caramel. Aftertaste is long, chewy and chunky. Luscious.

title: Precis Vodka
description: 100% corn; single distilled and unfiltered. Opening nosing passes betray the unmistakably soft sweetness of corn. Palate entry is sweet on the tongue and delightfully viscous; by midpalate, the integrated, sweet corniness becomes kernel-like. Finishes smoothly, warmly in the throat. An understated but elegant unflavored vodka that comes off extremely well when it is allowed some time to develop in the glass.

title: Compass Box The Peat Monster Vatted Malt Whisky
description: An intensely smoky initial bouquet which then becomes creamy, concentrated, citrusy, mash-like, and very malty. At palate entry heavily smoked flavors of charred barley and kippers appear; at midpalate the taste profile turns sweet, bonfire-like, and strikingly like smoky green tea and honey. Ends sweet, moderately smoky, ash-like, and even caramel-like. An elegant malt despite its moniker.

title: Rob's Mtn Gin Formula No 11
description: This special limited-edition gin (only 400 bottles were made), is made with botanicals sourced within five miles of the distillery, including basil, rosemary, lemon balm and lemon cucumbers. Pronounced anise scent and flavor, with hints of cucumber and pine. This gin would work particularly well in a cocktail with herbal notes, such as The Last Word (made with Green Chartreuse).

title: Cadenhead's Old Raj Dry Gin
description: At 46% alcohol by volume, the saffron-spiked red label version is strong (but not as strong as the overproof blue label version). This is an intriguing, old style of gin, with a faintly yellowish tinge and light, earthy flavors that wind into a complex, spicy finish marked by hints of black pepper, anise and cassia bark. Best when served very cold.

title: St George Terroir Gin
description: One of a trio of new gins from this artisan distiller, this gin's claim to fame is that it was inspired by a hike on Mt. Tam, and the distiller describes it as akin to “drinking a martini in a pine forest.” Some will find the juniper essence too strong, although it also reads as clean and bracing, and it's laced with a peppery finish. Botanicals include Douglas fir, fennel, bay laurel and sage. A portion of the profits from the gin are donated to support California wilderness.

title: Cadenhead's Old Raj Dry Gin Blue Label
description: The 55% abv blue label is one of the strongest and most expensive gins on the market. Look for the trademark faint yellowish-saffron tinge and herbal scent, with assertive pine and anise flavors and a tart lemony touch. Serve this overproof gin tamed with ice and lots of tonic.

title: The Botanist Islay Dry Gin
description: Although the “Botanist” name might suggest a floral gin, instead the flavor profile veers toward herbs and spices. There's a subtle, herbal scent, with anise flavors up front, backed by coriander seed and cassia bark on the spicy finish. Made by Bruichladdich Distillery, which is renowned for its Scotch, on a pot-still named Ugly Betty. Sold in an attractive, square-shouldered, gift-worthy bottle.

title: Brandon's Gin
description: This small-batch American beauty has a sweet, candied lemon-peel perfume and a warm anise flavor with a long, citrusy finish. Although the alcohol level feels a little hot, just imagine cooling it down with a tall glass of lemonade, or mixing it with effervescent bitter lemon.

title: Damrak Amsterdam Original Gin
description: Boasts a clean, fresh scent, with notes of lavender and grapefruit peel. The lingering juniper flavor finishes with a sweet lemony note. Quirky old-school swing-top cap on the bottle.

title: Ridge Gin
description: The mild aroma gives no warning that you're about to be whacked over the head with a licorice mallet. Sweet flavor, with loads of black licorice front and center. This sambuca-like spirit would benefit from a more delicate touch, and might be balanced by more citrus flavor. Made in Kalispell, Montana.

title: Cardinal American Dry Gin
description: A resiny aroma masks what seems to be floral botanicals underneath. On the palate, look for juniper, floral and vegetal cucumber notes, with anise on the finish. Striking square bottle with bold red-and-black cardinal logo.

title: Jameson 18 Years Old Limited Reserve
description: As “the master blender's special selection of very old Jameson Irish Whiskey,” this bottling represents. Rich honey color, tropical fruit scent with a touch of thick caramel. The flavors are bright and vibrant—lychee, banana, orange peel, tempered by a wash of honey—and the finish is intriguing and dry with nuances of white chocolate, banana, leather and nutmeg. Beautiful.

title: The Tyrconnell Single Malt Irish Whiskey, 10 Years Old Finished in Sherry Casks
description: One of three cask finishes, the Sherry version layers bold and lovely dried fruit and hazelnut tones over the existing warm golden-vanilla 10-year-old whiskey base. Dessert-worthy.

title: Jameson Rarest Vintage Reserve
description: Inside the fancy, expensive-looking packaging is a single distillery blend made from “the oldest and rarest Jameson reserves.” As with many older spirits, this one benefits from extra time in the glass to open up. Then the aromas show a mix of stone fruit and caramel, with dry leather, espresso and dark chocolate flavors evolving into a long burnt-orange and toffee finish. It feels a little hot, best with a dash of ice water.

title: Jameson 12 Years Old Special Reserve
description: This golden spirit is maple-sweet on the nose. The flavor is on the pleasingly sweet side too, especially compared to the drier 18-year-old version, with big strokes of honey and caramel winding into a scattering of mellow baking spices. Velvety feel, full bodied. A fine dessert accompaniment.

title: Finian's Five Provinces Irish Whiskey
description: Recommended for peat lovers, as well as peat novices who want to see what all the fuss is about. This blended whisky has a vibrant deep gold color, yeasty, baked apple aromas and a smoky, lingering flavor. More sipping equals more smoke, but it's still not overdone—it just wafts over the vanilla in an inviting way.

title: Redbreast Single Pot Still Aged 12 Years
description: From county Cork comes this bartender favorite. Look for a vibrant golden color and enticing honeysuckle and buttery brioche aroma. This whiskey feels soft and sets the mouth watering with lightly smoky notes tapering off to jazzy layers of honey, dried fruit, cinnamon and ginger.

title: Greenore Single Grain Irish Whiskey, 18 years old
description: Break out this small-batch, limited-edition bottling after dinner. Guests will enjoy the luxe butterscotch scent, soft feel and lingering roll of vanilla, crème brûlée and allspice over the palate. Only 4,000 bottles produced. This is one of the few Irish whiskies made primarily from corn, with just a little barley, which may account for its sweet character.

title: Michael Collins 10 Year Old Single Malt
description: “Lightly peated” and matured in Bourbon-seasoned casks for a minimum of 10 years, this spirit has a particularly beautiful scent, melding fresh fruit aromas with a hint of smoke. On the palate, the smoke is more apparent, but still has a rich apples-and-honey finish. Overall, a nicely balanced whiskey with a soft, full-bodied feel.

title: Connemara Cask Strength Peated Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: One of the most intensely peaty Irish whiskies, this pale-straw specimen is surprisingly smooth despite its cask strength (though most still will want to dilute it a bit). Aggressive smoke aroma, with mild black pepper and green bell pepper notes. On the tongue, look for a flash of sweetness and moderate smokiness through to the elongated finish, finishing with a perky menthol fillip. Should pair nicely with aged cheeses.

title: The Tyrconnell Single Malt Irish Whiskey, 10 Years Old Finished in Port Casks
description: One of three cask finishes, the Port version is especially dessert-worthy. Honey color, baked apple aroma, soft feel. The warm, big caramel flavor finishes with a roar of spices: clove, allspice, ginger, cinnamon. Pair with a rich dessert with caramel flavors, such as crème brûlée.

title: Knappogue Castle Aged 16 Years Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: The mellow, light-bodied specimen is also among the most aromatic, scented with fresh apples, pears and vanilla. Although it's a Sherry-finished single malt, the Sherry characteristics aren't readily identifiable, there's just an oaky vanilla flavor that builds on the finish, accompanied by a little cinnamon spark. Only 1,900 bottles produced, all signed and numbered.

title: Redbreast Single Pot Still Aged 15 Years
