description: Made with a combination of malted and unmalted barley, this 15-year-old builds on the beautiful flavors of the 12-year-old version, adding big, mouth-filling caramel tones, a spicy finish and a velvety feel. It's also higher proof than the 12-year-old and needs some dilution to help cool it down.

title: Wolfhound Irish Whiskey
description: Don't be fooled by the mild light-gold color or pretty, perfumy honeysuckle scent. This is a hearty whiskey, brisk, big and butterscotchy, which should mix well in a wide range of cocktails. Lingering vanilla finish, with a slight malty edge and a touch of ginger.

title: Ball of Malt Single Barrel Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: “Ball of Malt” is a whimsical Irish expression for a glass of Irish whiskey. Here, this offering made at the Cooley Distillery shows lots of vanilla and a bit of smoke, which builds powerfully into the finish. Still, this light gold spirit has an appealing freshness and delicacy in its grassy, green apple scent. Aged for 11 years.

title: Powers Gold Label Irish Whiskey
description: Reminiscent of an oaked Chardonnay with a bit more muscle to it, this vibrant yellow-gold whiskey has a sweet vanilla flavor at first, with hints of tropical fruit and bracing smoke and oak. Give it some time in the glass to open up and let an initial resin-like scent dissipate. Smooth feel.

title: Greenore Single Grain Irish Whiskey, 8 Years Old
description: This straw-colored, small-batch whiskey has a sweet aroma that mixes fruit and toasty oak. A surprising burst of lemon zest on the palate fades into vanilla sweetness on the finish. Light-bodied, with a delicate freshness to it. Its sweet character could be due to the fact that it's made primarily from corn, with just a little barley.

title: The Tyrconnell Single Malt Irish Whiskey, 10 Years Old Finished in Madeira Casks
description: One of three cask finishes, the Madeira version shows a rose-gold hue and Sherried, dried-fruit and red fruit flavors finishing dry with caramel, cocoa, allspice and clove. Soft feel, and a little hotter on the alcohol than the other cask-finished versions.

title: Knappogue Castle Aged 12 Years Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: This single malt “very special reserve” is light-bodied and perky, from its herbaceous, grassy scent to its citrusy flavors and almost effervescent feel. It finishes light and creamy, with a touch of honey and a whisper of smoke. Because it's so light, it would be good with savory appetizers, such as cheeses, charcuterie and anything encased in puff pastry.

title: Tullamore Dew
description: Bright yellow-gold, with a light vanilla aroma and flavor and soft, light feel. This blended whiskey is malleable and versatile, and best with some dilution and sweetness added, such as in a cocktail with a splash of vermouth or built tall with ginger ale.

title: Michael Collins Irish Whiskey
description: Honey colored and bright in the glass, with a mild, bright fruit aroma. The flavors of this blended whiskey are a bit discordant, mixing fruit, floral, a bit of peat and a bit of spice, with the peat building into the finish. Opt for the robust and well-balanced single-malt version instead.

title: Paddy Old Irish Whiskey
description: Light gold, with a fruity aroma underpinned by a tickle of oak. Most of the flavor is on the lingering finish, which shows pear touched with cinnamon. Although a splash of water opens up the finish to bigger and broader notes, it leaves you wanting more on the aroma and flavor.

title: Laphroaig Quarter Cask Double Cask Matured/Non-Chill Filtered Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: The first nosings find clean, apple peel-like and peat-free scents; later inhalations find a more sea breeze like, mildly briny character. Palate entry is lean, earthy, moderately smoky and lemony; midpalate is oily with flavors of ash, peat, sweet malt and brine. Concludes sweet, peaty and cigarette ash-like, with a bite of green olive.

title: Canadian Club Sherry Cask Blended Canadian Whisky
description: The bouquet offers potent spirity notes atop more subtle marshmallow and toffee scents. The palate entry is robust, nutty, semisweet and honeyed; by the midpalate stage the taste profile is nougaty, mildly cocoa-like, Sherried and marzipan-like. Concludes with flavors of dried red fruits, Sherry and dark caramel. A guilty pleasure of a sweetfest.

title: The Macallan 12 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: The initial aroma is sweetish, winey and oaky; aeration allows the aroma to expand to include marzipan, treacle, molasses, honey, vanilla bean, cinnamon and cocoa butter. The palate entry is sweet, creamy and assertive; at midpalate the flavor becomes intensely nutty, buttery and bacon fat-like, with the beginnings of rancio. Remains one of Speyside's standard-bearer 12 year olds.

title: Beefeater London Dry Gin
description: A textbook London Dry Gin bouquet; floral, earthy, spicy and crisp with dry notes of orange peel and black pepper all underpinned by the presence of juniper berry. The palate entry is sharp, crisp, dry and botanically balanced; at midpalate a burst of citrus juiciness counters the earthiness of the juniper and angelica root. Finishes with a wonderful rush of juniper.

title: Faretti Biscotti Famosi Biscotti Liqueur
description: The opening whiffs find pleasing confectioner's sugar and cookie batter scents; aeration adds a note of orange peel that mingles well with the sugar and batter aromas. The palate entry is sweet, intense and biscuit-like; the orange aspect emerges at midpalate and balances the sugary sweetness. Ends elegantly.

title: Elisir Gambrinus Wine Based Liqueur with Natural Aromatics
description: The nosing passes discover a curious fig-like bouquet of dried red fruit, browned butter, black truffles  and soft spirit. The palate entry is intensely fig-like, but sour enough to maintain a beguiling freshness; the midpalate offers concentrated flavors of prunes, figs, dates and raisins. Finishes moderately sweet, with a dash of bitterness. Unusual but very good.

title: De Kuyper Pomegranate Liqueur
description: The somewhat lackluster aroma is very fruity, if a touch candied, but is moderately true to pomegranate. The palate entry is delightfully tart, even sour, and less ersatz than the aroma; the keen acidity heightens at midpalate making the fruit element more genuine. The more than substantial gains made on palate make it unmistakably recommendable.

title: TMD Macadamia Nut Liqueur
description: The pleasant bouquet is clean, almost fruity, with intense aromas of freshly shelled macadamias. The palate entry is concentrated and properly nutty; at midpalate the flavor is accurately macadamia-like and a bit cocoa-like. The cocoa element picks up steam on the appealing finish.

title: The Australian Herbal Liqueur
description: The nosing passes find assertive aromas of peppermint and eucalyptus. The palate entry is reminiscent of mouthwash or cough lozenges, but is clean and refreshing; by midpalate the peppermint dominates to the near-exclusion of the eucalyptus. The pleasant finish is crisp, acidic, and citrusy. I suggest serving on its own over ice with a twist of lemon.

title: TMD Chocolate Liqueur
description: The aroma profile offers a truffle-like surface scent with milk chocolate fragrance underneath. The palate entry does, at last, see the chocolate component pushed forward ahead of the earthy notes; by midpalate the chocolate is in full charge and is borderline bitter/semisweet, but tasty. Finishes with a background fruitiness that's almost strawberry-like.

title: TMD Honey Dew Melon Liqueur
description: The nosing passes find assertive and fresh fragrances of perfectly ripened honeydew. The melony taste is genuine and fresh from the garden at the palate entry; at midpalate the natural acidity increases keeping the taste on course and in focus. Concludes clean, crisp and very melon-like.

title: Ardbeg Airigh Nam Beist 1990 Non-Chill Filtered Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: Aroma is delicate and grainy sweet; additional time brings out more peat fire, cigar tobacco, seaweed and ocean breeze. Palate entry is sap-like in its gentle sweetness; by midpalate, my palate is enchanted as lush, but pointed tastes of sea salt, gentle pipe smoke, peat and pineapple converge. Finishes smoky and salty. Wonderful.

title: Bowmore 18 Year Old Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: The nose has loads of chocolate-covered cherries and orange peel, honey, Sherry, s'mores, cocoa, black coffee and dark fudge. All these fragrances are present in the mouth. Ends luscious, sweet and generous.

title: Highland Park 12 Year Old Orkneys Single Malt Whisky
description: The aromatic profile is assertive yet welcoming, sweetish yet cereal dry, and oaky yet floral and a touch briny; the quintessential 12-year-old malt bouquet. In the mouth, the integrated flavors come in waves of toasted walnut, dark caramel, toasted marshmallow and barely perceptible seaweed.

title: Trump Super Premium Vodka
description: Vodka from The Donald. Nosings reveal dry, earthy scents of grain, paraffin, kid leather, jasmine, flowers, moss and soot. Palate entry displays far better than average grain focus and viscosity; at midpalate, the taste profile turns off-dry, intensely breakfast cereal-like and biscuity. Finishes oily/creamy and snack cracker-like.

title: Ledaig 10 Year Old Isle of Mull Single Malt Whisky Tobermory Distillery
description: I love the intensely malty and enticingly peaty opening aroma that emits pungent notes of filled ashtray, soot, sea breeze and kippers. Palate entry is dry initially then rapidly turns off-dry and salty; at midpalate, the taste profile explodes on the tongue in flavors of salted peanut, smoked fish, paraffin, light toffee and salted butter.

title: Tommy Bahama Golden Sun Rum
description: First inhalations pick up baking spices, most notably, cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla bean; further aeration reveals coffee bean, cocoa, new saddle leather and toasted marshmallow. Palate entry is semisweet, leather-like and smoky; the taste profile fills out with mature flavors of oaky vanilla, sautéed butter, molasses, butterscotch and almond paste. Concludes semisweet, medium-weighted in texture and elegant.

title: Cachaça da Roça
description: Initial whiffs pick up cocoa-like scents that are likewise moderately fruity (red fruits, especially). Palate entry is a bit tanky/metallic for me, but does display sugar cane grassiness; by midpalate, the flavor recovers its sugar cane base material character to fully express itself in waves of refined sugar, sugar beets and grass.

title: Maison Rouge VSOP Cognac
description: First nosing passes pick up delicate scents of apple, grape and pear.  Palate entry is mellow, rounded and mildly spiced; by midpalate, the taste gains in scope as the flavor of the wood underpins the fruitiness. Ends firmly and with an unexpected oiliness that works in its favor.

title: Sauza Hornitos Reposado Tequila 100% Puro de Agave
description: Aroma after the pour is lean and paraffin-like; swirling and additional time in the glass stimulate more expressive aromas of black pepper, sea salt and jalapeño pepper. Palate entry is tight, acidic and keenly peppery; by the midpalate stage, the flavor profile's sinewy character goes totally dry and spicy. Ends up very trim.

title: Dewar's Aberfeldy 12 Year Old Central Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: I pick up baked yellow fruits (banana, pear, quince) and round, lightly toasted scents of malt in the aroma. Palate entry offers clean, crisp tastes of dry breakfast cereal and lightly toasted barley malt; by midpalate, the dry to off-dry flavor profile includes oak-induced vanilla, light toffee, and nougat. Ends on a woody note.

title: Origine Platiné Grand Reserve Caribbean Rum
description: The complex bouquet first offers intensely fruity and spicy fragrances; aeration and swirling brings out scents of textile, horseradish and pepper. The palate entry is oily and lusciously bittersweet; the oily texture gives way to succulent tastes of cocoa butter, nut meat, cinnamon and vanilla cake frosting at midpalate. Finish is elegant, with ideal viscosity.

title: Delamain Extra Extra de Grande Champagne Cognac
description: The bouquet is a model of aromatic elegance with subtle aromas of oak, bacon, oak, toffee, baked pear, baked banana and honey. The palate entry finds harmonious, completely integrated tastes of honey, oak, grapes and spice; at midpalate tastes of bacon fat, pork rind and oaky vanillin are added. A masterpiece.

title: Absolut Pears Pear Flavored Vodka
description: The pear scents of the bouquet are very inviting. The palate entry is clean, ripe, fruity and keenly pear-like; at the midpalate the taste turns softly ripe and sweet. Finishes elegantly and with a last minute thrust of pear that's vivid, crisp and authentically pear-like. An outstanding flavoring job.

title: Finlandia Grapefruit Flavored Vodka
description: The fresh, citrusy, acidic, juicy, just-squeezed grapefruit is unbelievably attractive and genuine. The palate entry is engagingly grapefruit-like, juicy, tart and ripe; by midpalate the grapefruit flavor is so authentic tasting as to be more like an infusion. Finishes as seductively as it began.

title: Appleton Estate Extra Rum
description: A world-class spirit bouquet with wonderfully melded and balanced scents of bacon fat, walnut butter, buttered corn on the cob, oak resin and marzipan. Palate entry is dusty, dry and buttery; the flavor goes full-throttle at midpalate with buttery, creamy, brown sugar and rancio-like tastes. Finish is savory and bittersweet.

title: Appleton Estate Reserve Rum
description: The first nosing passes find tight notes of molasses and walnut; aeration time releases bigger scents of nutmeg and spiced apple. The palate entry is wonderfully warm and spicy; at midpalate the taste turns cocoa- and vanilla-like, creamy and honeyed. Concludes creamy and delicious.

title: Delamain Reserve de la Famille Grande Champagne Cognac
description: The first nosing passes find subtle but firm scents of pepper, spirit and wood; following aeration traces of grapes, paraffin and spice are added. The palate entry is honey sweet and woody with a touch of bacon fat; midpalate offers delightful semisweet tastes of marzipan, English toffee and egg cream. Finishes as elegantly as it began.

title: Appleton Estate 21 Year Old Rum
description: The bouquet is floral, bean-like and pleasantly nutty. The palate entry is acutely astringent; the midpalate is baked nut-like with bitter tastes of oak and molasses. The aftertaste is long, desert-dry, sugary and sap-like. Not as overly woody as many old rums are; delicious in an old-guard style.

title: Appleton Estate V/X Rum
description: The first nosing passes find gentle scents of light spice and brown sugar; aeration reveals solid aromas of molasses and buttered toast. The palate entry is delicious, rich and toasty; the midpalate features elegant flavors of toasted honey-wheat bread, honey and refined sugar. The finish is more bittersweet than sweet.

title: Gem & Bolt Mezcal With Damiana Added
description: This savory-sweet mezcal will remind many of pizza, given sun-dried tomato sweetness coupled with green notes of fresh oregano, thyme and mint. The spicy finish is sprinkled with white and black pepper, plus a prickle of jalapeño heat.

title: Bozal Cuixe Mezcal
description: This mezcal has a hint of sweetness and mild saline scent. The bone-dry palate offers lavender, sage and plenty of alcohol heat, finishing long and herbaceous.

title: Santo Mezquila
description: This newcomer is a Tequila-mezcal hybrid, backed by musicians Sammy Hagar and Adam Levine. It has a mild honey-like scent, and the palate has a bit of sweet smoke plus faint hints of honey and almond sweetness and a peppery finish; the smoky-peppery notes accelerate with repeated sips. Could be useful as a gateway for skittish mezcal drinkers.

title: Citadelle Reserve Solera Gin
description: An unusual, complex gin made using a total of 23 casks, including barrels that previously held Cognac, Pineau des Charentes and Bourbon, among others. It has a light straw hue and gentle vanilla scent, opening smooth and sweet with hints of grapefruit peel, ginger and pink peppercorn zing, and a mellow fade marked by cinnamon, coriander, almond and coconut. Sip or mix.

title: Snowdrop American Dry Gin
description: The subtly sweet scent suggests citrus and coriander, which is echoed on the soft, flavorful palate. Cardamom and anise accent the brisk, clean finish. Overall, this is a London Dry-style gin with a few unusual botanicals (cocoa, sarsaparilla root) adding nuance.

title: Bristow Gin Single Barrel Reserve
description: Reminiscent of gingerbread, this honey-hued gin is aged in new American oak for more than one year and has a sweet scent and bold palate that shows vanilla bean, cinnamon, clove, cardamom and a hint of molasses, finishing with a sarsaparilla-like roots-and-bark finish. Try it in an Old Fashioned-style cocktail.

title: Big Gin London Dry
description: The brisk, piny aroma leads into the notably silky palate, marked by mild juniper and fennel and finishing with bracing hints of lime peel, white pepper and cinnamon. Versatile for a wide range of cocktails.

title: The Revivalist Botanical Gin Solstice Expression
description: This robust, deliciously juicy sipper spent time in former red wine casks. It has a rose-gold hue and shows plenty of fruit and spice, starting with dried cherry and leading into ginger, nutmeg and cinnamon, plus a burst of anise on the finish. This barrel-aged gin is begging to marry with sweet vermouth, so mix it into Old Fashioned- or Manhattan-style cocktails; cherry garnish, of course.

title: Whistling Andy Gin
description: The anise scent is echoed on the palate, alongside lemon verbena and pine-y freshness, finishing smooth and brisk. The gin is steeped with pears and pink peppercorns, though it's hard to detect the subtle fruitiness unless you're actively looking for it. Versatile cocktail option.

title: Woodcut Barrel Rested Gin
description: Made with a Navy Strength gin base rested in ex-Bourbon barrels, this gin has a light straw tint and aromatics that suggest a classic dry gin: mild juniper and citrus, plus a hint of almond nods to the oak influence. The palate is distinctly sweet and light, weaving honey, coriander seed and lemon peel with lychee-like floral notes. Plenty of white pepper and ginger braces up the zingy finish. Think gin and tonics.

title: ESP Smoked Gin
description: Part of a trio of “culinary-inspired” gins, this is clear in the glass, with hints of rye bread-like caraway, rosewater and black pepper on the nose and palate. It reads more as peppery-spicy than smoky, but it's definitely a daring spin for the often-genteel gin category.

title: Four Pillars Rare Dry Gin
description: Warm with orange and spice notes, this gin is earthy and woodsy, finishing with a hint of bitter orange peel. Mix this mouthwatering gin made in Australia's Yarra Valley into Negronis and other bold-flavored cocktails.

title: Booth's Finest Dry Gin Cask Mellowed
description: This gin, “mellowed in sherry oak casks,” offers a pleasing balance between citrus, spice and juniper. Light straw in the glass, look for mild vanilla sweetness, delicate vanilla, cardamom and lemon peel, and a solid juniper backbone. The crisp, slightly drying finish is accented with white pepper.

title: Peat Barreled Big Gin
description: The peat influence in this intriguing FrankenGin is very subtle, showing as just a faint iodine breeze on the palate. Overall, this gin, which spent four months in emptied Peated American Single Malt Whiskey barrels from Westland Distillery, has a light straw tinge and almost neutral scent, while the palate shows almond, a juniper-menthol zing, plus a bit of peppery heat on the finish.

title: Junipero Gin
description: The 20th anniversary of this robust spirit, the first craft gin distilled in the U.S. after Prohibition was in 2016. The aroma mingles juniper and citrus; the palate also shows plenty of lemon curd sweetness and peppery spice (cubeb, grains of paradise, pink peppercorn), finishing spicy with white peppercorn and coriander seed.

title: Prescribed Spirits Gin
description: The scent of this gin is almost neutral, but the palate is pine-y and bracing, with a big anise twang, spearmint, juniper and a clean, brisk finish marked by alcohol heat. Think G&Ts; and other cocktails with plenty of dilution.

title: No. 209 Chardonnay Barrel Reserve Gin
description: Part of a series of wine barrel-finished gins, this will please those who can't decide between a martini or a glass of Chard. Complex and nuanced, the soft palate opens with gentle vanilla, almond and coconut, leading to a mildly spiced midpalate with hints of coriander, cardamom and white pepper and wrapping up with lemon zest zing.

title: Stonecutter Spirits Single Barrel Gin
description: Aged in former Bourbon barrels for four to six months, this “Bourbon barreled” gin has a pale straw tinge and spicy aroma. The palate shows mint, vanilla and cardamom. The drying, oaky finish sizzles with cinnamon heat. Sip or mix.

title: Beehive Distilling Barrel Reserve Gin
description: This small batch gin starts with a classic London Dry profile, but takes a surprising turn, aged in charred French oak barrels that previously held white wine. The end result is a mild honeysuckle fragrance and warming, honeyed flavor with a spiced midpalate, finishing with juniper twang.

title: Bourbon Barreled Big Gin
description: Aged for six months in former Heaven Hill Bourbon barrels, this gin has a light straw hue and aromas that hint at coconut and white flowers. The palate builds on that mild coconut sweetness with vanilla and plenty of spicy fireworks—coriander, white pepper and cayenne—finishing flavorful but fairly hot. Recommended to mix.

title: ESP American Beauty Gin
description: Part of a trio of “culinary-inspired” gins, this has a distinctly floral-fruity profile, with rosewater, lychee and fennel, emboldened with pink peppercorn and anise on the silky finish. Ideal for floral-tinged martini-like concoctions.

title: Hawthorn's London Dry Gin
description: This single batch gin is made from English wheat. Look for a mild citrusy scent and subtle palate with earthy hints of cedar, cardamom and grapefruit peel, which lingers into the drying finish. Cocktail friendly.

title: Pine Barrens Barrel Reserve Botanical Dry Gin
description: The base spirit is distilled from Long Island potatoes, then finished in barrels that once held Pine Barrens American Single Malt. The scent is fresh and citrusy, plus a hint of vanilla. On the palate, the flavors deepen into honey and a hint of sherry, plus cayenne and ginger sparks. Dilute in a long drink like a gin and tonic to keep the mellow honey notes but tone down the considerable alcohol punch.

title: Bristow Gin
description: The sweet aroma offers candied lemon peel and coriander seed. The palate follows through with lots of coriander up front, plus a citrusy hint and juniper, anise and pine. It goes from tingly to downright hot from the first sip, so be prepared to mix.

title: Dripping Springs Artisan Gin
description: Lemon peel and bold anise resonate on the nose and palate, leading to a spicy finish laced with pink peppercorn, cayenne and clove. Quite spicy, even hot, but should add pep to G&Ts; and other long drinks.

title: Swallowtail Gin
description: Made from a corn base, this zingy gin is pleasingly perky, showing plenty of lime and juniper on the nose and palate, resonating with mouthwatering anise on the finish.

title: Prescribed Spirits Barrel Finished Gin
description: Think of this gin as “amaro adjacent.” The roots-and-bark aroma and flavor are reminiscent of that category of bitter-edged liqueurs: cinnamon bark, sarsaparilla, vanilla, allspice, toasty oak. The drying finish offers a cinnamon red-hot note plus hints of red fruit and Port. Mix into cocktails with—what else?—amaro.

title: Russell Henry Dark Gin London Dry Gin
description: Golden in the glass, this oak-barreled gin offers an almond scent and alcohol-forward palate that shows cayenne, black pepper and coriander, smoothed by honey on the crisp, mint-accented finish.

title: St. Augustine Distillery Barrel Finished Gin
description: Enlivened with red fruit and spice, this is a limited-edition small batch gin made with a base of cane neutral spirits. The bold, fruity scent hints at berries, stone fruit and cinnamon. The palate brings the juniper forward, leading with tingly spearmint and cinnamon, then easing into hints of red fruit and vanilla on the fade.

title: Rusty Blade Gin
description: The barreled counterpart to Blade Gin, look for a copper hue and tons of bold spice: clove, cinnamon and allspice lead, mellowing to oaky vanilla midpalate, and finishing with fiery cayenne heat. Mix into cocktails to tame the alcohol heat but keep the spiced, oaky notes.

title: The Grangestone 21 Years Old
description: This intriguing Highland bottling opens with sweet vanilla and fruity, almost grapy flavors, then dries on the palate into complex and lingering notes of espresso, oak, allspice, dried figs and sarsaparilla.

title: Ledaig The Maltman Aged 8 Years
description: A spell in Sherry casks lends delectably dessert-like flavors—cocoa, espresso, hazelnut and clove—to this otherwise big, enticingly peaty Scotch. It's like a game to identify the sweeter flavors before they're all enveloped in a swell of smoke on the next sip. Limited quantity, with only 270 bottles available.

title: Spey River Speyside Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: This 12-year-old Speyside, matured in Bourbon oak, offers soft notes of honey, buttery brioche, tropical fruit and citrus. It's fresh and aromatic.

title: Spinnaker 12 Years Old
description: This remarkably flavorful Speyside is fruity and bright, offering plentiful notes of orange peel and rounded butterscotch and a spicy finish. Add a splash of water to coax out still more ginger, black pepper and clove.

title: The Balvenie 17 Year Old Doublewood
description: Redolent of honey and fresh apple, this double wood (American oak and Sherry cask) whisky is rich and slightly viscous on the palate, showing a deep crème brûlée note laced with zesty lemon peel and ginger.

title: Jura Diurachs' Own
description: Bracing and muscular, this 16-year-old Isle of Jura whisky may remind some of hoppy beer. The flavors run towards bitter orange, cedar, sandalwood and earthy tea, plus there's a puff of smoke on the finish.

title: Glenfarclas Highland Single Malt Scotch Whisky Aged 17 Years
description: This is a perfect match for the season's gingerbreads and spice cakes. Look for a warm, toasted-brioche aroma and pronounced flavors of vanilla, oak, dried figs, clove and allspice.

title: Jura Superstition
description: From the Isle of Jura comes this lively number, layered with caramel and orange peel. On the palate, it dries out to a spicy, citrusy finish reminiscent of tea and cigar box. Soft in feel.

title: Glenfiddich 12
description: Lush and rich, this honeyed whisky is loaded with dense notes of creamy custard and tropical fruit, finishing with a flourish of baking spice.

title: Glen Kirk 8 Years Old
description: Although the label says this Speyside bottling is peated, the smoke is barely detectable. Instead, the dominant flavors evoke caramel-drizzled baked pears sprinkled with baking spices. It's outstanding as a dessert pairing.

title: Hamiltons Speyside
description: This golden Speyside has a bold nutterscotch aroma and creamy feel, while the honeyed flavors are tinged with butter. The finish is soft and lightly floral.

title: Aberfeldy Single Highland Malt Scotch Whisky
description: This fresh and springy 12 year old is from Dewar's, a brand known best for blended Scotch. This single malt is “the heart of all the Dewar's blends,” the producer says. Despite delicate notes of vanilla and white flowers, this whisky surprises the palate with a waft of peat before heading into a crisp finish.

title: Auchentoshan 18 Year Old
description: The dense aroma, profound with honey and wafting with smoke, hints at what's to come. On the palate, sweet vanilla and baked apple give way to lots of mouthwatering spice on the finish—clove, cinnamon and nutmeg.

title: Bunnahabhain 10 Year Maltman
description: This 10-year-old single malt, produced by the Bunnahabhain Distillery and aged in Sherry casks offers bold, fruity tones plus an interesting cigar-wrapper note. Yet it also provides a big, spicy finish, with a pleasing smoky hit.

title: Sheldaig Speyside Aged 18 Years
description: Look for sweet apple and creamy honey notes in this 18-year-old Scotch. There's a hint of smokiness on the palate and a finish touched by oak, vanilla and clove.

title: Hamiltons Highland
description: This light golden Scotch is mild and fresh, offering apple and grass—even slightly floral—notes. The exit braces up with a bit of drying oakiness, light vanilla, ginger and cinnamon.

title: Sheldaig Speyside Aged 12 Years
description: This is an elegant expression of Speyside. On the nose, it's fresh and light, showing vanilla, white flowers, pear and light smoke. On the palate, the smokiness is more pronounced, but still balanced, allowing fresh fruit flavors to come sailing through, underpinned with lingering vanilla.

title: Provenance Single Cask Malt Scotch Whisky Produced at Inchgower Distillery. Distilled 1999 12 Year Old
description: The fresh apple and honey fragrance also translates to the palate, where these notes are joined by surprising smoky and pleasantly mouthwatering iodine and saline notes. The smoke lingers on, but overall a perception of delicacy remains.

title: The Balvenie 12 Year Old
description: An aromatic Scotch with bright honey, pear and floral touches, this single-barrel offering features creamy custard, banana and a touch of cocoa before finishing on a baking spice note. The alcohol presence is considerable; temper it with a good dose of water and consider pairing it with a rich dessert.

title: The Grangestone 18 Years Old
description: This amber Highland whisky has a rich aroma that mingles Sherry-like dried fruit and toffee. Yet it's surprisingly dry and austere on the palate, reflecting oak, baking spice, dried fig, black tea and cigar box notes.

title: Glenfarclas Highland Single Malt Scotch Whisky Aged 12 Years
description: This Speyside Scotch is rich with vanilla notes, along with bright tropical fruit and a touch of smoke on the finish.

title: Glen Garioch Highland Single Malt Whisky 1986 Vintage
description: This cask-strength small-batch release offers plenty of excitement. The bold, rich aroma features caramel, crème brûlée and citrus peel. On the palate, look for a burst of hot cinnamon, followed by a rush of peat, smoothed over with honey as it tapers into the finish.

title: Provenance Single Cask Produced at Glenlivet Distillery Distilled 1997 12 Year Old
description: This 12-year-old Scotch, produced at Glenlivet Distillery, has pretty citrus and honey aromatics. On the palate, look for notes of black tea, vanilla and creamy citrus, topped with an assertive bloom of smoke that lingers into the finish. There's a distinct alcohol presence, so keep the water handy.

title: The Torran 12 Years Old Scotland
description: While the aroma features rounded butterscotch and vanilla, this single malt bursts into smoky notes on the palate. It's tempered by warm butterscotch and almond notes with clove and ginger on the finish.

title: Hamilton's Lowland
description: White floral notes highlight this golden, delicate Lowlands Scotch. It's backed by waxy honey and vanilla flavors and has a soft feel.

title: Montgomerie's Rare Select Highland
description: Made from a single cask distilled at Ben Nevis in 1995, then aged for 17 years, this is a complex and kaleidoscopic Scotch. It looks murky in the glass—like weak tea—and is scented with apples and honey. The palate is very tannic and drying, tending toward oak and chamomile before turning to apples, pears and baking spices midpalate. It ends with a long, spicy finish interspersed with cigar smoke and cedar. There's a strong alcohol feel.

title: Glenlossie 19 Year Maltman
description: Made at Glenlossie Distillery and aged for 19 years, this buttercup-yellow single malt is earthy and yeasty, with notes of honey, rising bread and custard, accented with ginger.

title: Hamilton's Islay
description: Despite a powerfully peated aroma, this Islay has a lighter touch on the palate. A mouthwatering brininess is evident from the first sip, followed by delicate smoke and touches of vanilla and spicy clove on the finish.

title: Highland Park Loki Aged 15 Years
description: The second release in the lauded Highland Park Valhalla Collection, this limited edition shows caramel, toffee and hazelnut between smoldering waves of peat. Named for a particularly “treacherous and mischievous” character in Norse mythology, it makes sense that instead of a gentle fade, this Scotch grows brawnier and more drying with repeated sips.

title: Jura Origin
description: From the Isle of Jura, this 10 year old appears light and delicate in the glass, but is powerful and smoky on the palate. Toffee mingles with smoke, then the smokiness builds and gathers strength into a dark, languorous finish.

title: V One Vodka
description: An earthy, spicy aroma includes dry scents of black pepper, moss and mushrooms. The palate entry is keenly spicy and sharply sweet, while the midpalate boasts a strong spirit presence with a touch of honey or sugar cane. The aftertaste is sweet and hefty,

title: Benriach 20-Year-Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The opening whiffs are reminiscent of forest floor leafs; following aeration deeper aromas of dry malt, linseed oil and pine emerge. The palate entry is balanced between acidity and malt sweetness; at midpalate the flavor profile highlights tastes of oak

title: Chantal Comte Distillerie Depaz Plantation de la Montagne Pelée X.O. Rhum V
description: A wonderful bouquet full of enticing scents such as cigar box, paraffin, sautéed butter, cinnamon, honey, Sherry, and marshmallow. The palate entry is silky and intensely honeyed; the midpalate flavor displays tastes of vanilla extract, cinnamon, brown su

title: Krakus Exclusive Polish Vodka
description: A meek bouquet of soft grain and parchment. The palate entry is punchy and piquant with sweet tastes of wheat and vanilla bean; by the midpalate stage, the flavor unfolds completely in waves of delectably sweet, oily grain. The finish is long, thick and a

title: Reyka Vodka
description: A sooty initial aroma; following aeration, enticing, dry notes of palm oil, unsalted butter, grain mash and slate emerge. The palate entry is bone dry as soot and slate tastes meld, then turn delightfully oily and textured. Clean, medium-weight and nicely

title: White Birch Vodka
description: The bouquet is neutral and closed off. But the palate entry displays lots of typical vodka character with off-dry flavors of sap, bark, and unrefined sugar. The firm, medium-bodied, semisweet aftertaste is graceful and refined. Best Buy.

title: Famous Grouse 18-Year-Old Blended Malt Whisky
description: The bouquet features rich aromas of fudge, dark caramel, and cocoa. The palate entry is very toffee-like and honeyed; at midpalate the flavor becomes downright assertive with the butterscotch, marshmallow, and honey intensity. The aftertaste is very long,

title: Benriach 16-Year-Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The bouquet offers scents of green apple, with aromas of candle wax, linseed oil, grass and mint. The palate entry is a tad bitter; at midpalate the acid recedes, leaving behind a sweetly malty flavor. Maltiness comes to the foreground on the graceful fin

title: Origine 8-Year-Old Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: The somewhat thin aroma includes scents of slate/minerals, cornmeal, bubble gum and moss. The palate entry is bittersweet grainy/mashy; at midpalate, core tastes of oaky vanilla, sweet corn, sautéed butter, light caramel and marzipan arrive. The finish is

title: Dwor Artusa Polish Vodka
description: The nosing passes find zesty, bone-dry scents of minerals, slate, lead, peach pits and a touch of spirity piquancy. The palate entry offers off-dry to moderately sweet tastes of grain and metal; at midpalate the flavor leans more toward the grain than the

title: Benriach 12-Year-Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The initial delicately sweet malty aroma becomes more assertive after aeration with added scents of banana and pear. The crisp palate entry offers tastes of dried banana chips and light oak-influenced vanilla; the midpalate rounds off nicely as the woody/

title: Duncan Taylor & Co., Ltd. Strathisla 1967 Cask 1534 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The first minutes of sniffing reveal lovely, cheese-like, oaky aromas; extra time unleashes deeper aromas of old oak, baked bread, light peat, butter cream and almond paste. In the mouth, it's round, chewy, and steeped in dark caramel/toffee, dark coffee tastes. Finishes semisweet, oily and with a flash of heat.

title: Glenrothes 1974 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: Only 3,000 bottles allotted for the USA. Bouquet is comprised of deep, moderately smoky, and robust aromas of old oak, black pepper, road tar, maple, dark-roasted malt and brown sugar. Palate entry is sweet, honey-like and very dark caramel-like; at midpalate, the taste profile highlights caramel and honey and a velvety texture. Aftertaste features a peppery, cocoa-like and Sherry sweet taste. The finest malt whisky that Glenrothes has ever released. Buy two.

title: Appleton Estate Reserve
description: Like spice cake in a glass, this light, silky rum is scented with toffee and allspice. It features notes of brown sugar, vanilla and baking spice on the gentle palate.

title: Cockspur 12
description: Made with a blend of older rums, this addictive sipper is on the dry side, evoking espresso, oak, bittersweet chocolate and cigar wrapper notes. Long and complex, the finish suggests spiced Mexican chocolate.

title: Canne Royale Extra Old Rum
description: A blend of five- and eight-year-old rums, this golden XO has mild vanilla and honey flavors, with some oak structure and a lively cinnamon and clove finish. Feels silky, even oily, and would mix well with ginger and lime.

title: Brinley Gold Shipwreck Coconut Rum
description: This rum blended with coconut extract makes one tasty piña colada shortcut. It's clear, quite sweet and palate-coating like a liqueur, with bold coconut flavor.

title: Facundo NEO Silver Rum
description: Made with rums one to eight years old, it's carbon-filtered after aging to remove any color. The result is a medium-bodied, silky rum perfect for top-flight mojitos. It has a bold sugar-cane aroma and lightly sweet palate, with faint marshmallow and almond sweetness. Part of Bacardi's special-edition rum line.

title: Seven Fathoms Cayman Islands Premium Rum
description: The story behind this amber rum is that it's “matured underwater at a depth of seven fathoms (42 feet),” beneath the Caribbean seas. Look for bold toffee and brown sugar notes, finishing exceedingly long and spicy. It's just the ticket for rum punches.

title: Cockspur Fine Rum
description: Golden in color, it has a fresh, fruity fragrance with hints of apples, pineapple, and honey. On the palate, the experience is a bit more rich, cushioned with vanilla, honey and pecan and finishing with brisk notes of tea and cedar. Pair this versatile rum with ginger beer or other mixers.

title: Brinley Gold Shipwreck Coffee Rum
description: Though this amber rum flavored with Brazilian coffee extract has a mild coffee aroma, it's quite bold and syrupy on the palate. The flavor leans toward light-roasted coffee, not dark espresso, with a touch of hazelnut on the finish. The coffee flavor doesn't linger on forever, so it's just right to add subtle flavor to cocktails.

title: Cannes Brulées Classic White Rum
description: Clear and star-bright in the glass, this rum has a mildly sweet aroma, with a faint hint of banana. On the palate, expect light fruitiness, marshmallow sweetness and baking spice, with a lovely bloom of flavor on the finish.

title: The Real McCoy Rum Aged 5 Years
description: Aged in former Bourbon barrels, this bright topaz rum has notes of resin and vanilla on the nose. On the palate, it's silky, bold with vanilla and a prickle of baking spice on the finish.

title: Captain Morgan White Rum
description: This clear rum is full-bodied, even slightly viscous, with vanilla, coconut and marshmallow sweetness and a touch of charcoal on the finish. Even smoother with ice, this should be a front-runner for mojitos and other mixed drinks.

title: Brinley Gold Shipwreck Spiced Rum
description: Some spiced rums are merely colored, not aged; but this nut-brown spirit is made from a base of rum aged for four years in oak barrels. In that context, the substantial, oaky flavor makes perfect sense, rounded out by vanilla, dusty nutmeg and allspice. Mix with cola or ginger ale.

title: Blue Chair Bay White Rum
description: “Inspired by” country singer Kenny Chesney, this clear rum is meant for mixing. It has a mild, lightly sweet aroma and flavor, with fleeting notes of vanilla and white pepper leading to a crisp finish.

title: Cockspur Spiced Rum
description: Bright gold in the glass, it delivers a sweet, spiced aroma recalling red-hot candies. Considering the brash aromatics, it's a surprise to find that it's quite mild on the tongue with a bare simmer of cinnamon on the finish—more flavor and body would be welcome.

title: Harvest Rum
description: Made from Kentucky sorghum molasses and finished in used Bourbon barrels, this small-batch rum has plenty of personality. It has a soft golden tint and a bold, slightly funky aroma that hints at honey and bananas. On the palate, a resiny note leads, but cedes way to waxy honey, banana and a mouthwatering touch of maple. Finishes long, spiced and bold.

title: Brinley Gold Shipwreck Mango Rum
description: Golden and syrupy, this flavored rum has a juicy mango aroma. On the palate, it's quite sweet, with a waxy, toasty note on the finish that finishes more honeyed than fruity.

title: Cannes Brulées Banane
description: This clear flavored rum has a light banana fragrance, and a light flavor that suggests banana-flavored taffy. Use to add a hint of banana to coladas and other cocktails.

title: Wray & Nephew White Overproof Rum
description: Despite the fact that at 126 proof it may be best suited for lighting your tiki torches, it has body and a juicy, apple-like sweetness. However, it finishes so fiery it's literally tongue-numbing. Use sparingly as a float on top of tiki drinks.

title: Cockspur 130 Overproof Rum
description: From the first sugary whiff, the overproof nature of this clear rum is immediately evident. On the palate, it has a fleeting sweetness and boy, does it clear out the sinuses. Even mixed, it packs quite a punch.

title: Tanqueray No. Ten
description: More citrus-forward than the standard Tanqeray Dry bottling, this is gin-and-tonic perfection. The classic aroma features juniper and touches of mint, anise and coriander. The same is echoed on the palate, though it's also bursting with grapefruit and lemon peel, finishing soft and herbaceous but perked up with a white peppercorn spark. The No. Ten also has a new art deco-inspired bottle, making it a particularly gift-worthy choice for summer party-goers.

title: Tanqueray Malacca Gin
description: For years, Malacca was best known as a cult gin. Slightly sweeter and less junipery than London dry gins, it is supposedly based on Charles Tanqueray's own 1830s recipe. It was made available briefly in the late 1990s, before it was whisked off the shelves. Once again, this is a limited-edition bottling. It's soft, herbal and fresh, with green notes that evoke spearmint and basil, just enough juniper for backbone, and a delicate rosewater finish. It's a natural for classic cocktails, so let's hope it sticks around a while this time.

title: Watershed Distillery Bourbon Barrel Gin
description: Infused with citrus peel and spices, then aged in a former   Bourbon barrel for 12 months, this mellow, soft gin has lots of body. Look for a good dose of vanilla chased by cinnamon heat, plus touches of honey, oak and citrus on the finish. With a splash of simple syrup, this complex, golden gin is almost a cocktail on its own.

title: Karner Blue Distilled Gin
description: This brisk, citrusy gin is made for classic cocktails. Bold lemon and grapefruit notes meld with a light floral note and just enough juniper to hold it all together. Amid the bright citrus bouquet, you might detect another, more elusive fruity scent. Surprise! This gin is distilled from apples.

title: Waterloo Texas-Style Gin
description: So what is “Texas--style” gin, exactly? It's “big as Texas,” the producer boasts. More specifically, it's bright, fresh and well-structured, bursting with juniper, rosemary and grapefruit. Bottled at 94 proof, it's also quite muscular, finishing with a warmth that should be tempered when mixed into drinks. Pecans are listed among the botanicals used, although they are impossible to detect.

title: Bluecoat American Dry Gin
description: Made in the London dry style and packaged in a distinctive peacock-blue bottle, this gin has mild aromatics and fleeting sweetness on the palate chased by citrus, juniper and spice. The finish is crisp and assertive, even slightly hot at 94 proof, but that won't matter once mixed into a tall gin-and-tonic or Tom Collins.

title: Watershed Distillery Four Peel Gin
description: As the name suggests, this is a citrus-forward gin. It's lightly sweet, with notes of candied lemon peel and lemon verbena, finishing with white pepper and ginger sparks plus a subtle floral note. Score a bottle to lend extra presence to citrusy drinks like gin-and-tonics or sour-style cocktails.

title: Counter Gin
description: The gingerbread-like aroma entices with a fleeting whiff of nutmeg and baking spice, while the palate zings with grapefruit-peel bitterness and lemon verbena. The mouthwatering finish harmoniously echoes the spicy notes detected in the aroma: anise, cardamom, baking spice, and a final dose of citrus, all smoothed over by a cucumber-like freshness.

title: Waterloo Antique Barrel Reserve Gin
description: Bold and gutsy, this burnished-copper, barrel-aged gin resembles a cross between whiskey and aged rum. The deep, funky aroma suggests molasses and root beer, though the palate veers closer to brown sugar, finishing with dry notes of chamomile tea, cedar and clove. In some ways this unusual gin is similar to the sweeter old tom-style genre; it should be interesting to watch how bartenders use this to re-create Martinez cocktails and other gin-soaked classics.

title: TRU Organic Gin
description: Though golden orange in the glass, this is not a barrel-aged gin; rather, it's infused with botanicals (as most gins are), but hasn't had the color distilled out. It's sweet and soft on the palate, and the different constituents sing out clearly: juniper, anise and clove are backed by a wave of honey and allspice, plus a surprising dark-fruit note in the back of the palate and a light floral accent on the exit.

title: Bummer & Lazarus Dry Gin
description: Distilled from California grapes, it holds a bold, mildly sweet profile. At first sip, candied citrus peel seems to dominate, but star anise really rings through on the spicy finish. It delivers a soft and smooth feel.

title: Captain Morgan Tattoo Puerto Rican Rum with Spices & Other Natural Flavors
description: Smells faintly of aniseed, cinchona, ginger, and tree bark; following aeration the ginger dominates. The palate entry is off-dry, fruity, sap-like, and mildly spiced; at midpalate the bittersweet taste profile centers on the core flavors of ginger, cola nut, and bark becoming almost root beer-like. Finishes overly sweet.

title: Cannes Brulées Banane Banana Flavored Rum
description: Only the faintest of hints of banana are found in the nosing passes. The palate entry is tight, dry and squeaky clean; at midpalate a softly fruity, but crisply dry core flavor of dried banana chips emerges. Concludes clean, refreshing, but merely suggestive of banana.

title: Everglo Vodka-Tequila-Ginseng Liqueur
description: A muted aroma of citrus, sweet/sour spice and crushed herbs. The palate entry is light, fruity, and sweet/sour; at midpalate, I keep wondering where the tequila is in the slick mass of citrusy sweet, sticky taste.

title: Hang Loose Kauai Dark Rum
description: The initial aromatic blast comes off as a simple just off-the-column still scent; aeration does nothing to help this aroma round off or deepen. Palate entry is mildly sweet and brown sugar-like; by midpalate the flavor turns a touch more woody and honeyed. Finishes mildly pleasant and sweet.

title: Prince Hubert De Polignac V.S.O.P. Cognac
description: Burnished orange. First nosing passes pick up raisins and prunes; aeration expands the bouquet profile by adding zesty scents of black pepper, leather and pear. Starts smoothly at palate entry, then turns a bit hot at midpalate as off-dry flavors of dried red fruit, ripe grapes and candied almonds seem baked, minerally and overly spiced. Rounds out in the steely, slate-like finish.

title: Poyer & Sandri Grappa di Moscato Rosa
description: Limpid. Muscat/orange blossom scent. Palate entry is tart, astringent and pleasantly orangy/citrusy; midpalate is its best stage as the tart orange pulp/orange peel taste starts to sweeten. Ends off-dry to sweet, pulpy and long.

title: Belvedere Vodka
description: A one-note vodka nose featuring a bittersweet to semisweet grainy aroma. The palate entry is intensely kernel-like and beany and, therefore, bittersweet; at midpalate the flavor profile stays the bean/kernel course but adds a trace of tar or creosote. Finishes hot and raw.

title: Gilbey's London Dry Gin
description: The opening whiffs pick up citrus zest; aeration brings out juniper berry. The palate entry focuses totally on the juniper, and then at midpalate the lemon zest is unmistakable and adds a note of keen acidity. Finishes on the citrusy side of the street and a little bit fiery.

title: Chabot Armagnac Vintage 1976
description: Disappointing bouquet offering faint odors of rubber pencil eraser, unsweetened gum, and white raisin, with just the frailest hint of toffee. The palate entry is pleasingly sweet and maple-like; at midpalate the low-key flavor develops a bit more grip in the form of the sweet toffee first noted at the tail end of the nosing phase. Finishes appealingly sweet and mildly maple-like.

title: Domenis Organic Kosher Grappa
description: Initial sniffings offer atypical aromas of cotton, plastic and vinyl; additional aeration time finally stimulates some meager and distant traces of grapes, grape must and stems. Palate entry is off-dry to semisweet and slightly tropical fruit-like more than grapy;  midpalate at least displays more in the way of true grapiness but it still comes off as being reluctant and timid. Aftertaste shows some substance and grapiness but it's a little late and hardly enough to make up for the lack of distinctive virtues.

title: Michel Couvreur Pale Single-Single Aged over 12 years Unfiltered Single Cask/Single Malt Whisky
description: The first whiffs don't uncover much; aeration produces little other than a faint trace of linseed oil. The palate entry is grainy, off-dry and moderately oily; by midpalate the mildly honeyed core flavor displays some elegance, but there's not enough finesse here to justify the hefty price. Finishes with a burnt toast flavor.

title: JdV Mango Cream with Tequila Liqueur
description: Aroma is gently fruity, tropical and easy. Palate entry is ripe, mango-like and properly creamy and semisweet; by midpalate, the taste profile shifts far more to the cream than either the mango or the Tequila and in the process the point gets lost. Aftertaste is all cream.

title: Gozio Liquorice Liqueur
description: The first whiffs pick up delicate scents of Brazil nuts and anise; aeration adds notes of burning rubber, black licorice and paraffin. Palate entry is sharp and intensely aniseed-like; at midpalate a wave of black licorice swamps all other tastes. Concludes rich, but awkward and off balance—there's no subtlety here. Only for black licorice fanatics.

title: Herencia de Plata Anejo 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1124
description: No bouquet worth discussing. Palate entry offers a flat and flabby sweet taste along with some pleasing almond and walnut flavors; at midpalate, the taste profile goes candied and rubbery. Ends pleasantly sweet and oaky.

title: Jules Gautret Quest of Venture VS Cognac
description: Fruity, animated aroma are followed by assertive fragrances of gum, grapefruit, pineapple and white raisins. Palate entry is fresh, grapy and maple-sweet; midpalate the flavor profile suffers from a flash of raw spirity heat and a trace of dullness/flatness. Finishes sweet, a tad lean, banana- and caramel-like.

title: Jules Gautret Quest of Venture VSOP Cognac
description: Aroma is of limp vegetation and hard candy. Palate entry is pleasantly sap-like and sweet; midpalate features traces of oaky, vanilla-like character and eventually a round, even supple ripe grapiness that lasts well into the aftertaste. Decent once past the subdued bouquet.

title: Mojito Club Caribbean Style Rum Cocktail Rum
description: Initial aroma is clean, slightly bitter and not as minty as I expected. Palate is zesty, citrusy and slightly minty, with some evidence of rum. Aftertaste is brief and sour.

title: Poison Wild Berry Schnapps Liqueur
description: Sweet notes of mixed berrieson the nose, while palate entry is tart and bitter.

title: DC Distillers Choice Silver Rum The Spirit of Hawaii Pot Distilled from 100% Hawaiian Molasses
description: The strange bouquet includes scents of rubber band, plastic, wet sand, damp earth and mushrooms/lichen/mold. The taste thankfully doesn't mirror the aroma, giving off a moderate sense of fruitcake, dried fruit and refined sugar; the midpalate taste is off-dry and raisiny. The finish is fruity, lazily floral and mushroomy.

title: Zwack Unicum Liqueur
description: Nosing passes detect delicate odors of lead pencil, fennel and orris root, followed by herbal/vegetal/ spice scents. Palate entry is medicinal, astringent and deeply herbal; by midpalate, there's an underlying nut taste that's reminiscent of cola nut. Finishes intensely herbal and bitter.

title: Early Times Kentucky Whisky
description: The initial stages of the aroma seem a bit muted; aeration allows a soft, rose petal and almond aroma to develop. Palate entry is meek, gum-like and a touch caramel-like; at midpalate tastes of toasted marshmallow mingle with caramel candy. Ends resiny and cheesy. An uncomplicated whiskey of modest proportions.

title: Highland Park 30-Year-Old Orkneys Single Malt Whisky
description: The nose offers subtle aromas of unsweetened coconut, bacon fat, and dark toffee with additional toasty scents of apple crisp, dates and oak. The palate entry is rich and fresh; the midpalate features flavors of bacon fat, dark honey, fudge, and bitterswe

title: Château du Breuil 15-Year-Old Calvados
description: A wonderful bouquet that includes toasty scents of baked apple and baked pear and subtle aromas of brown sugar and marshmallow. There are delicious tastes of ripe apple and pear at palate entry; at midpalate the taste profile offers candied apple, cotton

title: Partida Reposado 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1454-CRT
description: The wonderful bouquet combines elegant scents of sawdust, pine and vegetal agave with aromas of old leather, cigarette ash and pimento. The palate entry is delicate and peppery; midpalate has a honey-like core flavor with supplemental tastes of cocoa, mil

title: Chauffe Coeur Blanc Rhum Agricole
description: A wonderful, layered bouquet that includes aromas of milk chocolate, honeysuckle, cream soda, unsweetened coconut, raw vanilla and cocoa bean, walnut and paraffin. The palate entry is deliciously sweet and oily; by midpalate the flavor includes a foundational spirit presence along with the honeyed taste. Finishes sweet, and textured. A state-of-the-art rhum agricole. Best Buy.

title: Duncan Taylor 1981 Glenugie 23-Year-Old Sherry Cask, Rarest of the Rare Ser
description: The nose is malty, dry and woody; the addition of mineral water introduces linseed oil and beeswax scents. The palate entry is chewy, spirity, caramel- and toffee-like; the delicious midpalate includes maple-like tastes of chocolate-covered banana, Raisin

title: Partida Blanco 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1454-CRT
description: A distinctive and fine blanco bouquet that features savory scents of rubber inner tube, pickle brine, green olive, vinyl, new saddle leather and kale. The palate entry is smooth, off-dry, and lightly peppery; at midpalate the taste is vegetal, then it swi

title: Darroze 1965 Domaine de Peyrot Bas Armagnac
description: Bouquet offers melded scents of wood, old fruit, marzipan and blue cheese. Palate entry is lusciously sweet; the midpalate finds succulent fruit, toasty oak, dark caramel and a touch of honey. Aftertaste is vibrant. A masterpiece.

title: Partida Añejo 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1454-CRT
description: The nosing passes pick up keenly crisp and spicy notes of black pepper and oak with plumper aromas of green pepper, vanilla and cocoa butter. The palate entry tastes of fresh honey and vanilla; the midpalate adds flavors of buttercream, steamed asparagus

title: Chauffe Coeur Brun Rhum Agricole
description: The opening bouquet brims with layers of toffee scents, dry oloroso sherry and fresh honey; aeration stimulates smells of dark caramel, grassy cane, winter holiday spices, and marzipan. The palate entry is silky, zesty, and spicey; by midpalate the flavor includes pipe tobacco, toffee, cocoa butter, and honey. Concludes bittersweet, cocoa-like, and sherried. A Martinique classic. Best Buy.

title: Dripping Springs Vodka
description: Overall pristine and smooth, this corn-based vodka is clean on the nose and palate, finishing with brisk white-pepper heat smoothed by faint almond sweetness. Best Buy.

title: Hell's Half Acre 1885 Vodka
description: Distilled from cassava root, this unusual vodka shows distinct sweetness. Look for a light vanilla scent and hints of dulce de leche, almond and vanilla on the creamy palate, plus cinnamon sizzle on the finish. Ideal for dessert-like cocktails or anywhere a bit of sweetness is desired. Best Buy.

title: Earth Vodka
description: Clean and invigorating, with a suggestion of almond-like sweetness midpalate, this corn-based vodka is neutral overall, finishing with a refreshing flicker of alcohol heat. Versatile for cocktail mixing. Best Buy.

title: D. George Benham's
description: Think Bloody Marys and Dirty Martinis for this vodka with a savory side. Made in Sonoma from grapes (natch) and grain (wheat and rye), a faint vegetal, olive brine note leads into a mouthwateringly brisk, pleasingly earthy fade. Bonus: The handsome green glass bottle with copper accents will look striking on your bar.

title: Mon Bijou Vodka
description: Generally neutral on the nose and palate, hints of rubber and charcoal midpalate lead into a clean finish, with just the right amount of alcohol heat for backbone. A food-friendly companion for smoked fish, aged cheeses or other savory bites. Best Buy.

title: Tower Vodka
description: Smooth and versatile, this “micro batch” vodka offers light coconut sweetness on the palate, fading into cinnamon heat on the finish. Best Buy.

title: Black Cow Vodka
description: Made from whey, this newcomer to the U.S. market has an appealing lushness. The aroma and flavor hints at coconut, marshmallow and vanilla, finishing with gentle sweetness and a mild peppery prickle. Producer recommends serving Dirty Martini-style with olive brine and a green olive.

title: Bootlegger 21 Vodka
description: This corn-based vodka has a nearly neutral aroma and gentle vanilla and coconut sweetness on the palate. It roughs up a little on the drying finish, with hints of fiery ginger root. But chilled well to take the edge off the heat, it's a fine addition to vodka-based martinis, Gimlets and other cocktails.

title: Mamont Vodka
description: The name means “mammoth,” and the enormous, heavy elephant tusk-like bottle is hard to miss. Made in Siberia, this vodka has a fruity scent reminiscent of raspberries and a smooth, drying palate that hints at almond and marshmallow, finishing long with a subtle anise note.

title: Success Vodka
description: Created by distiller/partner Jeff Thurmon, previously a distiller at Tito's Vodka. Look for mild, coconut-like sweetness in this otherwise neutral, silky vodka, winding into hints of lemon peel, ginger and cayenne on the warming finish. Best Buy.

title: Humboldt Distillery Organic Vodka
description: Made from a sugarcane base, the palate on this small-batch vodka leads with a flash of marshmallow sweetness and finishes clean and bracing with ginger and white peppercorn sizzle.

title: Kinky Vodka
description: Best known for liqueurs in lurid pink and blue, this unadorned vodka is more sweet than sass and sips well. It has a coconut-tinged aroma and palate, a soft, almost plush feel, and finishes with cinnamon and nutmeg sparks. Best Buy.

title: Chase English Potato Vodka
description: Banana and raspberry tease the nose and palate. The earthy, silky palate also shows hints of graphite, charcoal and potato skin, finishing with coriander and almond sweetness.

title: Double Circle Columbia Plateau Vodka
description: Backstory: The distiller's family has farmed soft white wheat in Oregon since 1875, the same wheat used to make this new vodka. The spirit has a mostly neutral aroma, plus a saline hint that suggests a seawater breeze. Markedly smooth, it glides over the palate, with mild sweetness and a hint of white peppercorn heat on the fade. Sip or mix.

title: 1876 Vodka
description: Faint marshmallow-like sweetness leads the nose and palate on this corn-based vodka. Smooth and relatively neutral, look for flickers of cardamom and coriander seed on the exit.

title: Riley's Brewing Handcrafted Original Vodka
description: Made from corn, this vodka has a neutral scent and soft feel, with a hint of citrusy acidity, finishing crisp and slightly spicy, tinged with anise and black pepper.

title: Twisted Path Organic Vodka
description: Mix this wheat-based vodka in tropical drinks. The mild scent suggests banana, while the silky palate has a coconut hint that segues into a long, peppery, drying finish.

title: Belle Chasse Vodka
description: Distilled from French wheat, the name translates as “beautiful hunt.” The featherweight vodka is mostly neutral on the nose and palate, plus hints of vanilla sweetness, charcoal earthiness and a bit of cinnamon heat on the exit. Best Buy.

title: Ingenioz Vodka
description: According to the producer, this corn-based “intelligent vodka” is “ultra-purified to zero impurities” using a process that combines ozone and traditional filtration. We haven't sent it to the lab to measure those claims, but we did taste it: The nose and palate are distinctly sweet, with a sugary, marshmallow quality, rounding to a hint of cinnamon on the warming finish. Feels light on the tongue, and faintly effervescent.

title: VKA Organic Vodka
description: Made in Tuscany from a base of organic wheat and spelt, this silky spirit offers faint hints of dusty cocoa powder, almond and vanilla, finishing with nutmeg and cinnamon sweetness and spice. Pour for a White Russian or other cocktails with a sweeter skew.

title: Cathead Vodka
description: Bracing and brisk, this vodka has plenty of citrus and spice, like the very lightest of gins. The scent is relatively neutral, but the palate displays fleeting cucumber, coriander and lemon peel, finishing with white-pepper heat.

title: Green Palm Vodka
description: Formerly on liquor store shelves as VuQo, this coconut nectar-based vodka now undergoes multiple distillations and filtrations, including coconut shell activated carbon during filtration. The upshot: Light, dusty coconut flavor plus a long, slightly sweet finish make this vodka right for mixing into tropical drinks.

title: Red E Craft Vodka
description: “We deliberately didn't shoot for neutral,” says the producer of this Concord grape-based vodka. Mission accomplished: The bold, fruity scent and flavor suggest bananas and raspberries, with fleeting sweetness on the palate and a flash of ginger heat on the finish. Mix into fruity drinks for best effect.

title: Smirnoff Vodka Recipe No. 21
description: The aroma is nearly neutral, with a mild sweetness that's echoed on the palate, where it suggests light almond and coconut tones layered with a faint charcoal note. Finishes with a fiery burst of cayenne and cinnamon heat.

title: Kid Curry Small Batch Vodka
description: Made from corn, look for perky pine and lemon peel notes on the drying, slightly hot palate, smoothed by pleasing sweetness in the fade.

title: Industry Standard Vodka
description: Made with a beet sugar base, this vodka is mostly neutral on the nose and palate, tinged with almond sweetness and finishing long, with cassia-bark sizzle and plenty of alcohol punch.

title: Stateside Urbancraft Vodka
description: This 100% corn-based vodka has a neutral scent and soft, silky palate. The flavor suggests cucumber and almond, finishing dry, with a bit of alcohol heat.

title: Belrose Ultra Premium Vodka
description: Distilled from French grapes, this vodka is mostly neutral, plus mild marshmallow sweetness on the nose and palate. A flicker of alcohol heat builds steadily into the charcoal-accented exit.

title: Kozuba & Sons Vodka
description: Distilled from wheat, this vodka has a faint lemon peel scent. The palate also is accented with mild lemon and pine, like a super-light gin, finishing with anise and cinnamon sizzle.

title: Roofraiser Vodka
description: Distilled from Utah-grown wheat and rye, this vodka has a bold, fruity aroma and flavor, suggesting raspberry and tropical fruit, finishing with a bracing sprinkle of baking spice. Mix into fruity cocktails.

title: BroVo Amaro 04
description: Created with direction from bartender Patrick Haight, this amaro is ruddy and bright in the glass, with a fruity aroma that also suggests eucalyptus and lime blossom. Look for moderately sweet cocoa and tart fruit on the palate at first, which morphs into light bitterness and a warming flicker of cayenne heat.

title: Boomsma Clooster Bitter
description: Bright lime green in the glass, this sweet, viscous liqueur has a mild scent and flavors that suggest lime zest and lime lollipops, plus ginger heat on the finish. Use anywhere you'd use green Chartreuse.

title: BroVo Amaro Kim Chicago 2014
description: This superlight, nuanced amaro has a fragrance that suggests elderflower and vanilla sugar. The palate also mixes gentle floral and vanilla, with only the faintest bitterness on the finish, mingled with subtle orange peel and white pepper sparks. Created with direction from Philadelphia bartender Peter Kim.

title: Don Ciccio & Figli Finocchietto
description: Refreshing and unusual, this Italian-inspired fennel liqueur has a pale straw hue and a fresh, grassy, vegetal scent. It tastes like fennel—meaning lots of anise—plus a dill-like vegetal lightness and subtle funkiness in the finish that's similar to a whiff of cooked cabbage. Overall this is invigorating and sip-worthy.

title: Vicario Sorcerer's Song Liqueur
description: This liqueur is rusty orange in the glass, with an aroma that suggests horehound and orange peel. The palate reads as sherried, with honey, dried apricot and baking spice, plus burnt orange peel bitterness on the finish. The producer recommends it as a hot drink in winter.

title: Maraska Pelinkovac Bitter Liqueur
description: At first glance, this appears to be a sweet fruit liqueur, with a deep garnet hue and aroma that suggests currant preserves tinged with a mild sarsaparilla note. So it shocks to find an intensely bitter palate, like unsweetened chocolate, with the fruitiness showing as bitter dried orange peel around the edges. Fleeting, teasing vanilla sweetness on the midpalate quickly gives over to a bitter finish.

title: Vicario Monk's Secret Liqueur
description: This liqueur, which appears to be loosely inspired by Chartreuse, has a dull green olive-oil hue and a concentrated aroma that's like inhaling a slightly bruised bouquet of fresh herbs, including mint and lemon verbena. Thick and viscous in the glass, look for an intense anise sweetness up front and a stingingly spicy finish, like jalapeño and menthol.

title: Fernet-Branca
description: This amaro seems innocuous at first, with its coffee-brown hue and mild, root-like aroma. But it's intensely bitter from the first sip—so much so that it's hard to detect other flavors, though there's a bitter espresso and unsweetened chocolate core, plus a minty finish. Bartenders love to offer this uber-bitter liqueur as a shock-value shot; it's challenging to sip straight, even though the alcohol level is moderate. But it's also a key component of some classic drinks, like the Hanky Panky, and that's where its value lies.

title: Few Anguish & Regret
description: Classified as a malört—a particularly bitter spirit often consumed as a dare—this one is amped to deliberately vicious levels thanks to an infusion of housemade ras el hanout, a Moroccan spice blend. It has a light yellow hue and minty aroma, with a boozy core that reminds of grappa. The flavor is quite spicy, with a jalapeño note that overwhelms the subtler herbal, floral and icy mint notes on the palate, and frankly numbs the tongue and lips.

title: Sibona Liquore Alla Camomilla
description: This chamomile liqueur, made with grappa, has a burnished gold hue, pleasing honey and peach nectar aroma. It's sweet at first, showing honey, peach nectar, white flowers and beeswax, with an herbal finish that shows mint and a jarring mustard seed note.

title: Borsci Marzano Liqueur
description: Dark brown and viscous, this liqueur has a bold, pungent, earthy aroma. The palate is very bitter and medicinal, mingling with an ersatz cherry-raspberry jam note midpalate, finishing with a drying bitter walnut quality. Taken all together, the effect is disconcertingly like cherry-flavored cough medicine.

title: Lo-Fi Brand Aperitifs Gentian Amaro
description: Made with California wine, this raspberry red-hued amaro has a fruity scent and drinks like cherry juice—juicy and mouthwatering up front—plus suggestions of rosewater, bubble gum and cherry cough drops, finishing with a bitter grapefruit edge.

title: Parker's Heritage Collection Kentucky Straight Malt Whiskey Aged 8 Years
description: Another standout limited-edition release to raise funds for ALS research, in honor of Heaven Hill Master Distiller Emeritus Parker Beam. This copper penny-hued American single malt has a bold caramel aroma and kaleidoscopic flavor that starts with sweet, dark toffee and cola notes. This then morphs to orange peel, vanilla, allspice and clove, with a wisp of sweet campfire smoke on the extremely long finish. 65% malted barley, 35% corn.

title: Hibiki 21 Years Old
description: This blended whisky is an ideal sipper, with an enticing crème brûlèe and dried apricot scents. Those notes are echoed on the palate, but are layered with drier oak and cigar wrapper notes, woven together on a light layer of peat smoke. Soft, complex and well-balanced.

title: George Dickel Barrel Select
description: Sip or mix this Tennessee beauty. It has a maple hue and a boozy but gorgeous aroma, mixing caramel and burnt orange peel. Those flavors are reflected on the supersoft palate, finishing long on drying notes of cocoa, spice, vanilla and orange peel.

title: Westward Oregon Straight Malt Whiskey
description: Made from 100% malted barley grown in the Pacific Northwest and fermented with ale yeast, this single-barrel single malt is brisk, flavorful and hints at beer. The sweet, gentle aroma offers vanilla and a subtle root beer-like herbal note. The palate is on the drier side, but pleasing, showing lots of vanilla and a hoppy note at the end chased by allspice and clove.

title: Brenne Ten
description: Golden and delicately perfumed with peach, white flowers and tropical fruit, this newly-launched 10-year-old French single-malt whisky shows coconut, almond, vanilla and tapers off gently with cinnamon and clove. Add a splash of water or a cube of ice to soften the alcohol sting (it's 96 proof, after all). Aged in a mix of new French oak and old XO Cognac casks. 290 cases produced.

title: The Yamazaki 18 Years Old Whisky
description: This complex single malt whisky has a dark honey hue and a bold aroma that entwines vanilla and juicy red apple. The silky palate mixes gentle smoke with mouthwatering dry notes—oak, leather and tea, finishing with a smoky exhale accented by orange peel and espresso.

title: Nikka Taketsuru Pure Malt Whisky
description: The luxe aroma mixes rich butterscotch and apple sweetness. On the palate, this whisky is light and gentle, interspersing fruit and smoke and finishing with a spark of cinnamon heat. Add a splash of water; recommended for sipping.

title: Collier and McKeel Tennessee Whiskey
description: Made from a mash of corn, rye and malted barley and aged four years, look for very sweet, bold aromas: lots of vanilla and caramel. The first sip is dry, showing cocoa, espresso and leather, but then the flavors seem to grow sweeter, more in line with the aromas, and coat the mouth with crème brûlèe and a hint of butterscotch. It finishes spiced, with a flicker of alcohol heat.

title: Virginia Distillery Co. Highland Malt Whisky
description: Highland malt whisky from Scotland is finished in former Port casks at the distillery in Virginia. The end result is a deep amber hue and a rich caramel and campfire-smoke profile, finishing dry and slightly hot, with sarsaparilla and lots of spice.

title: Jameson Irish Whiskey Caskmates Stout Edition
description: Beer lovers will enjoy this Irish whiskey aged in craft beer barrels. It appears burnished gold and smells oaky and grainy. The flavor evokes a pleasing combination of beer and whiskey, accented with hops, bitter chocolate and a clove-spiced finish. It even feels slightly fizzy, like the carbonation of beer.

title: Hibiki Japanese Harmony
description: The newest blended whisky offering from Hibiki is burnished gold in the glass and has a bold aroma that mixes vanilla, fresh pear and a hint of smoke. The smokiness comes forward at the first sip, wrapping around a core of oak and vanilla custard and finishing long, with a mouthwatering bitter chocolate note.

title: Bain's Cape Mountain Whisky
description: This unusual whiskey was built like a Bourbon—made with 100% corn and aged in ex-Bourbon casks for an average of five years—but sips like a mellow Canadian whiskey. It's supersoft, with lots of vanilla and sweet maple, plus a gentle, drying finish of allspice and clove. A surprising, rounded black cherry note suggests Manhattans in this whiskey's future.

title: Rogue Chipotle Whiskey
description: This chile pepper-flavored whiskey launched in August 2015. Made with jalapeños grown on site at Rogue Farms, allowed to ripen until bright red, the peppers are smoked and brewed into a “chipotle whiskey wash.” More chipotles are added during distillation, and again during barrel aging. The end result is an apple-y sweet, vanilla aroma and palate followed by a gentle chile simmer and light smokiness. The heat builds with repeated sips, but chileheads probably wouldn't have it any other way.

title: Teeling Single Grain Irish Whiskey
description: New to the U.S. market in March 2015, this rose-gold whiskey is finished in former California Cabernet Sauvignon casks. The aroma shows nuts, vanilla and orchard fruit. It's light-bodied and slightly buttery on the palate, with lots of vanilla and custard, and a slightly fruity finish and a build of alcohol heat.

title: Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky
description: The name of this whisky has nothing to do with coffee—rather, it's named for a type of still invented by Aneas Coffey, which is used to make this golden spirit. It offers mild vanilla-pear aromatics and is relatively light and silky on the palate. Look for a light vanilla sweetness at first, which gives way to a rounded dark chocolate note and baking spice finish. Recommended for highballs and other mixed drinks.

title: Spirit Works Distillery Straight Wheat Whiskey
description: Made from 100% wheat grown and distilled in California, then barrel-aged for a minimum of two years, this amber whiskey mingles vanilla, maple and orange peel in the aroma. It's oaky up front, fading to creamy vanilla and cocoa plus white pepper and ginger sparks. Add a cube of ice, or try it mixed in an old fashioned or Manhattan.

title: Egan's 10-Year-Old Single Malt Irish Whisky
description: This golden whisky has a bright, fresh scent bursting with fresh-cut apples and vanilla. It feels quite hot on the palate, hiding behind fiery cinnamon and alcohol heat. Tamed with plenty of water, it softens to show vanilla and fresh fruit.

title: Wigle Aged Wheat Whiskey
description: Made from organic wheat and aged in new oak barrels for at least 12 months, this craft whiskey has a velvety feel and lots of oak up front, fading to a cookie dough-like finish with vanilla, cocoa and allspice. It feels a little hot, but has good flavor. Mix into whiskey sours and other cocktails.

title: Climax Joven Tequila NOM 1522
description: A solid bouquet that doesn't scrimp on agave presence. The palate entry shows enough herbal/peppery agave thrust to impress; but at midpalate a metallic aspect takes charge, leaving the agave element in the dust. Concludes brassy and too bitterly astringent.

title: Crown Royal XR Extra Rare Blended Canadian Whisky
description: The bouquet offers rich, pastry scents with deeper fragrances of old oak, figs, dates and prunes. The palate entry is creamy, engagingly nutty, acidic and fresh; the midpalate offers long, expansive tastes of oak resin, paraffin, nougat and walnut paste. Concludes elegantly, sinewy and off-dry. This whisky has it all.

title: Louis XIII de Remy Martin Grande Champagne Cognac
description: The aroma features fig, prune, pastry dough, honey and maple scents. On palate, Louis XIII offers long and intensely woody flavors; additional layers of flavor, including figs, dates, prunes, dried apricot and vanilla, are featured at midpalate. Finishes elegantly, warm, smooth and more oaky than fruity succulent. Only minor rancio.

title: Rhum J.M. Blanc White Rhum Agricole
description: An atypically textile-like and grassy rhum agricole bouquet. The palate entry is fruity sweet and not in the least hot, considering the 100-proof status; the midpalate features tastes of beans, vanilla, sugarcane and jellybeans. Ends up moderately sweet, graceful and invitingly warm. Masterfully distilled.

title: Comte Louis de Lauriston 40-Year-Old Calvados Domfrontais
