description: The compelling brandy bouquet offers lean scents of resin, baked apple and vinyl. The palate entry is controlled sweet/ripe; the midpalate offers more generous flavors of baked apple, fruit pastry, pipe tobacco, new honey and oak. Ends crisp and properly acidic with baked flavors of fruit, nuts and nougat.

title: George Dickel Barrel Select Tennessee Sour Mash Whiskey
description: The nosing passes find attractive scents of hazelnut, wax paper, lime, peanut butter, citrus peel and unsalted butter. The palate entry showcases the peanut quality but adds a touch of charred oak; the taste at midpalate becomes more bacon fat-like and smoky, with nuances of palm oil, nut paste and cream. Very nicely done.

title: Gordon Graham's Black Bottle Blended Scotch Whisky
description: The nosing passes find aromas of peat, iodine and ash with subtle scents of hemp, road tar, burnt toast and seaweed. The palate entry is medium-weight, smoky sweet and oaky; at midpalate the strong taste of sautéed butter wonderfully suits the aroma. One of the best deals in Scotch whisky at present.

title: Francis Darroze 1979 Domaine de Rieston Bas Armagnac
description: The aroma is intensely waxy, tea-like, fibery with scents of nutshell, toasted almond and hemp/rope aromas. The palate entry is nutty and mildly tobacco-like; the midpalate is keenly resiny and bittersweet with touches of early-budding rancio, oaky vanilla, cocoa bean and walnut paste. Finishes well and semisweet.

title: Park VSOP Cognac
description: An enticingly fresh bouquet with acidity enhancing the fruit component. The palate entry retains the acid backbone which allows the light wood and fruit elements to charm the taste buds; the midpalate stage features lively, immature flavors of ripe grape, slightly awry acid levels and touches of pineapple and mango.

title: Rhum J.M. élevé sous bois Rhum Agricole
description: The bouquet features plump, sweet aromas of buttercream and cake frosting. The palate entry is properly sweet and caney; the midpalate is delightfully sweet and almost candied. Finishes plump, sugary sweet and pleasant in the mouth and throat.

title: Rhum J.M. Vieux 1997 Rhum Agricole
description: The bouquet offers scents of fruitcake and rummy sweetness/oakiness; the vegetal/grassy quality expected from this category is missing. The palate entry is sweet and bubble gum-like with nary a hint of grass or sugarcane; the midpalate stage is pleasing and mature, sweet and woody. Concludes sweet, sap-like and a touch maple-like.

title: Agua Luca Cachaça
description: Sooty/ash-like fragrances are underpinned by cane and creosote base aromas. The palate entry is zesty, semisweet, herbal and tar-like; the midpalate taste offers deeply herbal/vegetal flavors of vegetation, textile and light smoke. Ends up off-dry and piquant.

title: Agua Luca Cachaça
description: Sooty/ash-like fragrances are underpinned by cane and creosote base aromas. The palate entry is zesty, semisweet, herbal and tar-like; the midpalate taste offers deeply herbal/vegetal flavors of vegetation, textile and light smoke. Ends up off-dry and piquant.

title: The Famous Grouse Finest
description: Pleasantly toasty and buttery in the first nosings; aeration stimulates lightly peated scents of butterscotch, light toffee and marzipan. The palate entry features delightful and gently sweet grain and caramel tastes; the midpalate sensation is round, slightly prickly, buttery and caramel sweet.

title: Wasabé Vodka Blended with Saké
description: The initial aroma is properly grainy and cracker-like; aeration brings on a gentle fruitiness; not a lot of depth. The palate entry is warm, dry and grainy; at midpalate a mildly fruity sake element emerges on the tongue. Concludes well as the sake aspect becomes more of a factor.

title: Comte Louis de Lauriston VSOP Calvados Domfrontais
description: Following aeration the aroma offers fragrances of oaky vanilla, baked pear and baked apple. The palate entry is lovely, elegant, semisweet and fruity; at midpalate the spirit foundation emerges and the taste turns brandy-like, clean, refreshing and mildly spicy. Finishes woody and moderately oily.

title: Pig's Nose 5 Year Old Blended Scotch Whisky
description: The bouquet features pleasantly off-dry and nutty cereal-like aromas. The palate entry is moderately sweet, biscuity, pastry-like and deeply grainy; at midpalate the taste profile displays a bit of heat that lies underneath the breakfast cereal surface flavor. Finish is dry, nutty and grainily wheat-like.

title: Comte Louis de Lauriston Hors d'Age Calvados Domfrontais
description: The aroma features scents of cooking spices, tobacco leaf, spiced apple, traces of pear pulp, parchment, textile fibers and oak. The palate entry is delightfully sweet, fruity and lean; the acidity kicks in at midpalate, giving the brandy a fine, lithe mouthfeel and a crisp taste. Concludes drier than the entry.

title: Park XO Cognac Traditional Reserve
description: The nosing passes find seductive aromas of soft cheese, ripe fruit, mature scents of vanilla and cinnamon. The palate entry highlights waxy flavors of palm oil, pork rind and bacon fat; at midpalate the taste profile turns maple-like and slightly spicy. Ends up honeyed and oaky.

title: Louis de Lauriston Fine Comte Calvados Domfrontais
description: The initial nosings find light, perfumed, juicy orchard fruit smells; the more peel-like aromas that appear following aeration lack the succulence of the early nosings. Palate entry is pleasingly fruity; the midpalate features the tart/astringent peel as much as the fruit meat. Too harsh and crude for my taste.

title: Comte Louis de Lauriston 20-Year-Old Calvados Domfrontais
description: The limp bouquet offers notes of oak, butterscotch and soft honey. The palate entry offers some pleasant woodiness and maple flavor; the midpalate overly showcases fatty/oily and chunky flavors. Finishes oily, buttery and without a whisper of acid. Lacks acidity and, therefore, freshness.

title: Auchentoshan 18-Year-Old Limited Edition Oloroso Sherry Matured Lowlands Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: The bouquet offers toffee aromas with complementary smells of bakery spices, especially nutmeg, vanilla and cinnamon. The palate entry is delightful and focused on delicate sherry sweetness; the midpalate tastes include spice, baked bread, sherry, caramel, and nougat. Yet another sterling expression from this hallmark distillery. Classic.

title: Bowmore 1990 Limited Edition 16-Year-Old Sherry Matured/Cask Strength/Non-Chill Filtered Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: The aroma features assertive scents of lead pencil, iodine, sea salt and inner tube with salty Sherry notes, dates, black raisins, cigarette ash and smoked trout. On palate the taste profile is equal parts Sherry and seaweed; the midpalate showcases the Sherry influence and the result is deliciously raucous and hearty. A tongue-tingling experience.

title: Duncan Taylor Auld Blend 38-Year-Old Blended Malt Whisky
description: 70% malt; 30% grain. The bouquet is lean and svelte with scents of hemp, wheat kernel, crackers and dry breakfast cereal. The palate entry is fuller and sweeter than the bouquet indicated; the midpalate reminds me of baked bread with herbs and seeds, like rosemary and caraway. Finishes dry and keenly sappy.

title: Schönauer Apfel German Apple Schnapps Liqueur
description: The bouquet is pleasantly ripe and pastry-like. The palate entry is deliciously appley and more tart than sweet; the midpalate stage offers keen red-apple tartness and enough acidity to maintain the impression of authentic apple crispness. Lovely all the way.

title: Soho Lychee Flavored Liqueur
description: The highly perfumed aroma features good smells of lychee with additional layers of fragrances of parchment, palm oil, flowers and sealing wax. The palate entry is gently sweet and properly fruity; the midpalate displays a textured sweetness/ripeness that is delicious and light-to-medium weighted. Wraps up sweet, succulent, and genuinely tasty.

title: Duncan Taylor Auld Reekie 12-Year-Old Islay Malt Scotch Whisky
description: The initial sniffs pick up iodine and peppery scents; aeration elevates the pepperiness and adds dry notes of old parchment and gravel, sand and dry earth. The palate entry is dry, woody, and like unsalted butter; the midpalate offers tastes of saltwater taffy, egg cream, fino Sherry and almond butter. Ends on a prickly, peaty note.

title: Duncan Taylor Big Smoke 40 Islay Malt Scotch Whisky
description: The initial sniffs find an intense cigar smoke aroma; following air contact the scent becomes spicy, mildly smoky or peaty, green pepper-like and semisweet. The palate entry is oaky and pipe-tobacco sweet; the midpalate is lean to medium-weight, sappy and toffee-sweet, and delightfully peaty. Finishes gracefully, medium smoky and warming.

title: Stoli Blueberi Blueberry Flavored Vodka
description: The blueberry muffin perfume is alluring. The palate entry is delightfully fruity, berry-like and fresh; the midpalate stage reflects the careful merging of the fruit essence with the neutral grain spirit. A more than worthy addition to the already fine Stoli flavored portfolio.

title: Svedka Apple Flavored Vodka
description: The excellent bouquet owns a crisply acidic green apple perfume which following aeration turns peel-like and very tart. The palate entry displays a mild sweetness; at midpalate the taste profile accurately mirrors fresh green apple flavor and is delightfully razor-edged. Finishes tart, piquant and lean.

title: Vincent Van Gogh Double Espresso Double Caffeine, Coffee Flavored Vodka
description: The supple bouquet has a strong coffee bean-like quality with additional scents of cocoa, road tar, roasted chestnut and wood smoke. The palate entry and midpalate are nicely mellow with plenty of rich espresso character. Finishes smoked and tar-like, with the coffee taking a back seat.

title: Delord Napoleon Bas Armagnac
description: The opening aroma is atypical but following aeration the aroma becomes more of a customary Armagnac perfume as scents of sweet oak, prunes, cocoa, spice and raisins meld. The palate entry is assertive, sweet and raisiny; at midpalate a brief flash of spirit is followed by fat flavors of sautéed butter, almond paste, nougat and dark honey. Aftertaste is rich, long and sweet. Best Buy.

title: Corzo Reposado 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1487 CRT
description: The bouquet features zesty aromas of green chili peppers and asparagus with touches of vanilla/oak, palm oil and almonds. The palate entry is sweetish and oaky; at midpalate a delicious buttery taste underpins flavors of oak, light spice and sautéed almond. Finish is elegant, long and satiny.

title: Heavy Water Vodka
description: The attractive, understated bouquet is nicely oily with a cottony scent. The palate entry is vibrant, grainy and off-dry to moderately sweet; the midpalate is keenly fresh and delightfully grainy/spirity. Finishes well as it cleanses the palate in well-defined tastes of grain and oil. A sophisticated spirit that puts a premium on elegance.

title: Cesar Monterrey Anejo Reserva 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1486 CRT
description: The aroma is zesty, acutely peppery and briny with scents of new oak, tobacco leaf and light honey. The palate entry is long, sweet, oaky and slightly honeyed; the midpalate stage boasts a sturdy agave sweetness. Finishes in a honeyed, almost Sherry-like manner that's highly charming.

title: Domaine d'Espérance 1990 Vintage Bas Armagnac
description: The bouquet offers scents of roasted chestnut, sautéed almonds, and caramel. The palate entry is more toffee-like than nutty; at midpalate the flavors include cocoa, dark caramel, and honey. Finishes maple sugar sweet and delicious.

title: No. 209 Gin
description: The nosing passes find generous notes of citrus zest, juniper berry, orris root, licorice, coriander and angelica. The palate entry is bittersweet, intensely grainy and speckled with licorice and orris root; at midpalate the flavor turns delightfully herbal. Finish is decidedly herbal/leafy/seed-like and, finally, bittersweet. An adult gin with an adventurous attitude.

title: Delord XO Bas Armagnac
description: The bouquet features scents of vanilla bean, dark honey, nougat, pipe tobacco and rancio. The palate entry is fat and creamy; at midpalate intensely sweet flavors of honey, dark toffee and cocoa take charge. Texture is heavy. Finishes on a honeyed note.

title: Scapa Vintage 1980 25 Year Old Cask Strength Orkney Islands Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Following aeration, swirling and a few added drops of mineral water a floral, dry grainy bouquet emerges. The palate entry is minerally and dry; at midpalate, with a few more added drops of water, the grain/malty elements mingle with oak, black pepper and grassy notes. Finishes lean, off-dry and intensely grainy/malty.

title: Vincent Van Gogh Black Cherry Vodka
description: The aroma is deeply cherry-like, ripe, tart and fresh. The palate entry goes very sour at first but at midpalate the flavor becomes noticeably sweeter as the fruit pulp and juice elements move to the forefront. Finishes juicy, medium-weighted, and moderately sweet. A flavored vodka clinic.

title: Corzo Silver 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1487 CRT
description: A fresh and seductive fragrance that includes scents of cucumber, agave pulp, fennel, pine, coriander and mint. The palate entry is smooth and correctly agave juice-sweet; at midpalate the flavors meld into a semisweet and lusciously prickly taste thrust. Finishes on a heated note as the spirit races ahead of the agave.

title: Evan Williams Vintage 1996 Single Barrel Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: The nose is disappointingly limp. The palate entry finds deep flavors of corn syrup, breakfast cereal and oak; the midpalate is properly oily, buttery, corny and honey sweet. Finishes in a flurry of sap-like tastes and a round, honeyed texture. Nice but disappointing compared to earlier vintages in this series.

title: High Spirits Prickly Pear Flavored Vodka
description: A pleasant earthy/vegetal bouquet that displays the acidic nature of prickly pears. At palate entry the prickly pear flavor loses much of its fruitiness and leans heavily on the natural acids; the midpalate is astringent and tart. The aftertaste is short, refreshing and understated. Would make an interesting mixer with the right fruit element to bolster the acidity.

title: Tobermory 10 Year Old Isle of Mull Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: The elegant bouquet is rich, gently sweet and generously malty. The palate entry is slightly salty and faintly peaty; at midpalate the grainy sweetness returns with traces of green vegetable, mint and black tea. Finishes with the tea flavor dominant. A good introductory island malt of finesse and substance.

title: Roberto Cavalli Vodka
description: The bouquet offers slightly bitter smells of toasty grain, parchment and cardboard with minimal depth and expansion. The palate entry is clean, grainy and off-dry; at midpalate the graininess counters the spirits influence. Finishes gracefully, if somewhat meekly. For this price I'd like to get a pair of designer cufflinks as well.

title: Cesar Monterrey Blanco Reserva 100% Blue Agave Tequila NOM 1486 CRT
description: An attractive, true to the source bouquet. The palate entry shows a pleasing sweeter, agave juice side to this tequila; at midpalate the black pepper/red pepper note drives the flavor forward into the delightfully prickly and full-weighted finish. A well-made blanco suitable for all types of Tequila-based drinks.

title: Three Olives Citrus Flavored Vodka
description: The nosing passes find zesty smells of lemon and lime peel. The palate entry is suitably bitter/tart with a strong fruit pulp underpinning; at midpalate the taste turns sweeter as some of the bitter peel quality is softened. Finishes citrusy sweet and only moderately tart: I would have preferred enhanced sourness. Best Buy.

title: Woodford Reserve Master's Collection Four Grain Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: The four grains are corn, malted barley, rye and wheat. A mildly intriguing, if a touch flat aroma. The palate entry features flavors of honey wheat bread, sweet oak and light honey; the midpalate is round, elegant, mildly buttery/oily and gently honeyed. The aftertaste is understated and pleasingly easy.

title: John McDougall's Selection Bladnoch 15 Year Old Lowland Single Cask Scotch Whisky
description: The strange bouquet features smells of ceramic tile, cement, wet sand and moldering vegetation with minor malty notes. The palate entry is mildly sweet and very grainy; at midpalate the flavors include bittersweet tastes of brown sugar, light honey and light toffee. The aftertaste is green and vegetal then grainy sweet and breakfast cereal-like.

title: Domaine d'Espérance 10 Year Old Bas Armagnac
description: The initial aroma is toasty and nutty; aeration allows scents of vanilla and cocoa bean to emerge. The palate entry is bittersweet and intensely beany; at midpalate the taste shows an inviting oiliness/butteriness. The finish is too sharp and resiny.

title: Three Olives Berry Flavored Vodka
description: The bouquet features aromas of fresh-picked raspberries and blackberries. The palate entry is berry sweet/ripe and concentrated; by midpalate the fresh flavor intensity starts to fade. In the finish the flavor leans towards the berry preserves. Best Buy.

title: Frida Kahlo Anejo 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1079 CRT
description: The nosing passes find scents of brine, peanut butter and lanolin with later sniffs discovering soft notes of vanilla, hemp and dried herbs. The palate entry is grassy and sweet; the midpalate stage is a tad restrained, but oily/buttery and deeply herbal. Finishes mildly sweet, and more timid than I like for an anejo.

title: Domaine d'Espérance 5 Year-Old Bas Armagnac
description: The aroma is delightfully pungent with spicy scents of black peppercorn and caraway seed. The palate entry is semisweet with tastes of palm oil, beeswax and light toffee; the midpalate finds astringent and bittersweet flavors of coffee bean, tobacco leaf, pine and new oak. Finishes clean and assertive. An example of how compelling young Armagnacs can be.

title: Vodka Fourteen Vodka Made From Organic Grain
description: The nose displays a solid, grainy, cracker-like aroma with notes of nuts, parchment and palm oil. The palate entry is smooth, a little toasty and very refreshing; midpalate highlights the deep grain taste along with touches of smoke and spice. Aftertaste is long and grainy/spirity with a dash of prickliness.

title: High Spirits American Vodka
description: A different style of vodka bouquet that includes faint scents of peach and cantaloupe, sand, tilled soil and green vegetation. The palate entry offers immediate bittersweet tastes of licorice, molasses and vanilla bean; the midpalate stage highlights the beaniness and a subtle trace of nutmeg. Finishes delicious, medium-weighted, a tad fiery and vibrant.

title: Tullibardine 1993 Central Highlands Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: An uninteresting bouquet consisting only of off-dry, slightly cardboard-like grainy/grassy notes. The palate entry, like the bouquet, is frustratingly meek and grassily off-dry; at midpalate there are faint tastes of barley malt, light caramel and wood. Finishes as timidly as it began.

title: Phillips Union Whiskey
description: A blend of Bourbon from Kentucky and Canadian whiskies. The hybrid bouquet bears witness to both types of NA whiskey. The palate entry is exaggeratedly sweet and more like a whiskey liqueur than a blended whiskey; the midpalate is sappy sweet. Finishes on a mildly pleasing spicy note that doesn't offset the intense sweetness sufficiently.

title: Cesar Monterrey Reposado Reserva 100% Blue Agave Tequila NOM 1486 CRT
description: The nosing passes detect a dominant pickled aroma that's quite nice. The palate entry is very sweet and pleasantly oily; the midpalate features lesser flavors of black pepper, slate and mineral. Finishes sweet, plump and one-dimensional. This reposado doesn't quite pull the components together into a harmonious statement.

title: The Glenlivet Cellar Collection 1972 Vintage Cask Strength Speyside Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: The opening aroma shows lots of oak, with minor scents of mint and dried sage after which the bouquet doesn't expand much. The palate entry is off-dry and oaky; the midpalate is astringent, a bit pinched, with intensely woody/oaky flavors that don't allow the grain to develop properly. Finishes lean and angular. A disappointing departure from form for The Glenlivet.

title: Three Olives Grape Flavored Vodka
description: The palate entry is sweet, slightly sugary and light; the midpalate is slightly better than the entry as the grape flavor settles down.Aftertaste is short, sweet and grapy.

title: El Tesoro Reposado
description: Pale straw color and smoky, vegetal, brisk scent. It tastes the same as it smells:  smoky, vegetal, and herbal, with notes of oregano, anise, mint. Lightly smoky finish.

title: Avion Añejo Tequila
description: The smoky, vegetal scent of this gold-hued añejo is reminiscent of mescal, but has a lighter, softer texture. The honeyed flavor is quickly overwhelmed by a tingly, peppery finish.

title: Partida Añejo Tequila
description: Aged in barrels that once held Jack Daniels whiskey, this añejo has a sweet honeyed flavor and finishes nicely smoky with a touch of butterscotch. This Tequila would have rated higher if not for the plastic-y aroma.

title: Tequila Don Julio Blanco
description: It looks silvery blue in the bottle, but it's crystal clear in the glass.  Citrusy, peppery fragrance, grassy, herbaceous flavor. Finishes dry and a little hot.

title: Familia Camarena Silver Tequila
description: Sweet scent, with just a puff of smoke. Sweet and earthy, with a jalapeno-like snap and a dry finish.

title: Peligroso Tequila Reposado
description: Smoky, fruity scent like apples and pears. What hits first is the alcohol bite, followed by vanilla flavor, lingering smoky notes, and another wave of alcohol bite. This Tequila needs to be tamed with ice.

title: Plata Hornitos
description: Sweet, almost marshmallow-like smell and a sweet flavor relieved by a clean, citrusy finish. finish.

title: Espolon Tequila Blanco
description: Mild, slightly coconutty scent and a neutral flavor with slight sweet and grassy notes. Some alcohol zing.

title: Silver Patron
description: Honey scent and super-peppery flavor, with some heat in the back of the throat. This lively Tequila would be best mixed with ice and juices, since it's crying out for sweetness to mitigate the burn.

title: Avion Reposado Tequila
description: Six months of aging impart a faint yellowish tinge, a citrusy scent, and a mild, smoky flavor that finishes with some mint and anise tones.

title: Herradura Blanco
description: Faint yellow tint and delicate honey and citrus-peel perfume. Thick, viscous mouthfeel. Tastes peppery, with a slightly petrol, minty finish.

title: Chinaco Reposado Tequila Exceptional
description: This light gold Tequila has a lightly smoky aroma with a hint of butterscotch.  A vegetal, smoky, spicy flavor is chased by a nice caramel finish, which is unfortunately marred by a plastic-like aftertaste.

title: Chinaco Blanco Tequila Exceptional
description: Slightly sweet, vegetal aroma. Sharp, earthy flavor, with a slight touch of anise and a clean finish.

title: Don Roberto Reposado Tequila
description: Beneath the sweet honeysuckle fragrance, this soft reposado mingles oaky and smoky flavors. It would do well in a cocktail with some sweetness to it, or a long drink that adds some fizz and dilution.

title: Partida Reposado Tequila
description: Tawny color and lightly smoky aroma. At first, honeyed sweetness washes over the tongue, then a raw and lingering alcohol bite takes hold, even through the pleasantly smoky, herbal finish. This Tequila is better in the lively silver or the richer, mellowed Añejo expressions.

title: Casa Noble Tequila Añejo
description: This amber spirit smells smoky and vegetal, but with a lush caramel note in the back. It tastes just as the aroma suggests, with caramel and smoke mingled together. Where the reposado expression was super smooth, additional aging seems to bring out a little harshness in the añejo variation.

title: Cabo Wabo Tequila Blanco
description: This unaged Tequila has a warm, smoky/peppery flavor, and the pepper continues into the finish. It's not bad, but the barrel-aged version is vastly better.

title: Dulce Vida Blanco TequilA
description: This certified organic, 100-proof Tequila has a vegetal, green-pepper aroma and jalapeno-like flavor:  sharp, grassy, spicy, peppery, with a final smoky, almost bacon-like twang. Would be interesting in a pitcher of Bloody Marys.

title: Tequila Añejo Campo Azul
description: A pale gold, light-bodied liquid with a lightly smoky aroma. This aged Tequila has a sweet honey flavor with a smoky finish and a sharp alcohol bite.

title: Reposado Hornitos
description: This Tequila has a light straw color, a floral-vanilla scent and a smooth, tongue-coating texture. Although it tastes sweet at first, it finishes with smoky and sour notes.

title: Dulce Vida Reposado Tequila
description: Even 11 months of aging in Kentucky whiskey barrels fails to tame the sting of this 100 proof spirit. Smoky, fruity scent and vibrant yellow hue. Certified organic.

title: Chinaco Añejo Tequila Exceptional
description: This light amber Tequila had a warm caramel scent with smoky, vegetal notes. Like the reposado expression, the añejo had a caramel flavor but a strong plastic-y finish.

title: El Tesoro Añejo
description: A pale gold, light-bodied spirit with a brisk feel and hearty alcohol sting. The scent landed somewhere between smoky and menthol, bringing to mind menthol cigarettes.  But the flavor was warm and honey-like.

title: Tequila Reserva 1800 Silver
description: Petrol, herbal scent, and a lingering sweetness with a slight anise note. The highlight here was the bottle stopper, which is creatively engineered to be a shot glass.

title: Citadelle Gin
description: A soft and refined standout. Bright, citrusy aroma. This supersilky gin has a big licorice and juniper twang and a slight quinine flavor—in other words, it cries out for tonic water. The sweet, lingering finish evokes pink peppercorns, citrus peel and white wildflowers.

title: Darnley's View Gin
description: Fresh, delicate fragrance of anise and coriander. This light-bodied, soft gin has a clean, brisk finish with anise and eucalyptus notes. A beautiful small-batch gin.

title: Beefeater 24 London Dry Gin
description: Polished, versatile and well-balanced. Clean, mild aromas of juniper and citrus, and a sweeter flavor than most gins, with a bracing, astringent, citrus-peel finish. The gin's famed tea botanicals were not apparent in tasting; it had more of a pronounced grapefruit profile. The bottle is striking, with a red base and decorative glasswork.

title: Broker's Premium London Dry Gin
description: Unscrew that adorable bowler-hat bottle top, and a warm fragrance of orange peel, cinnamon-cassia, juniper and licorice wafts out. Well-balanced, clean, medium feel. Classic, strong juniper flavor, with a refreshing citrusy, piny finish, spicy and lively. Good value. Gin and tonic all the way.

title: Martin Miller's Gin
description: One of the most aromatic and least junipery gins, with aromas of cucumber, white pepper and lemon zest. On the tongue, look for a brief sweetness and floral taste, which rolls into invigorating, pleasingly bitter flavors of orange pith and pine.

title: Tanqueray London Dry Gin
description: The vibrant juniper and licorice flavor and a pretty, slightly floral, rosewater finish is braced up with a peppery spine. Give this gin some time to open up for optimal aromatics—the reward is a citrusy zing. Good value.

title: Caledonian Selection Bowmore 1992 10 Year Old Islay Single Malt Whisky – Cask Strength
description: Golden straw color. Sea breeze/briny nose comes right at you in the opening sniffings; aeration releases pungent notes of dill, fennel and dry malt. Palate entry is marked with aggressive tastes of tobacco leaf, cigarette smoke, brine and wood resin; by midpalate, there's a slight settling down of the flavor profile as calmer tastes of cocoa, vanilla and maple make for sweet and pleasant sipping. Finish is raw, sweet and aggressive. The potential is there, but this malt simply isn't ready to be consumed yet.

title: Tiger Gold Medal Lager
description: Gold appearance; egg white-colored head; unusual opening perfume is strangely broth-like and off-dry; aeration serves to stimulate further weird aromas like egg noodle and cotton—where are the hops and malt? Palate entry is light, palatable and mildly hoppy while the midpalate phase displays hints of steamed white rice, lightly toasted malt, pineapple and flowery hops. Finishes dry and properly malty. Some minor charm, but too uneven to be recommended.

title: Greenall's Original London Dry Gin
description: Opening sniffs pick up lightly spiced, lean aromas from the citrus peel/botanical element; further aeration adds bittersweet notes of cassia bark and juniper berries. Palate entry emits slightly metallic tastes of slate, mica and pewter; at midpalate a botanical sweetness tries but fails to overcome the mineral/rock-like flavor. Ends a bit raw.

title: Skyy Spiced Vodka
description: Spicy aroma highlights the clove component. In the palate entry, cinnamon makes its first appearance, but by midpalate, the cinnamon/nutmeg tandem comes together. Aftertaste is dominated by the cinnamon.

title: Skyy Vanilla Vodka
description: Vanilla bean fragrance in the opening passes is assertive and semisweet. Palate entry owns a vanilla bean core and by midpalate a mineral/chalky quality derails the vanilla element. Aftertaste is mellow.

title: Chateau de Laubade 1984 Bas Armagnac
description: Initial sniffs find bittersweet, intense, assertive and very nutty aromas; further aeration time accelerates the bittersweet concentration of oaky resin. Palate entry is seriously sap- and maple-like, then by midpalate the taste shifts from sap to the resiny, seed-like and bitter flavor of unseasoned oak, road tar and black tea leaves. Finish is firm but so resiny and tea-like that it's just flat-out bitter. Shows potential, but it's angular at this stage.

title: Kahlua Kuya Fusion Rum
description: Initial nosings pick up a sweet aroma that's equal parts vanilla, cola nut, citrus and cinnamon. Palate entry is very vanilla cola-like and sugary; by midpalate, the citrus element kicks in adding a balance to the sugary sweetness.

title: Viper Sour Apple Schnapps Liqueur
description: The peculiar aroma initially smells of new carpeting; with aeration, green apple emerges. Sour and astringent on the palate.

title: Château de Laubade 1964 Bas Armagnac
description: First whiffs uncover scents of cotton candy, gum and dried tropical fruit; additional aromas include chocolate bar, nougat and oil. Flavor is intensely cocoa-like and bittersweet early on, then a heavy cloak of sweetness quashes the virtues. Concludes long, concentrated and too sweet.

title: Duncan Taylor & Co., Ltd. Glenlivet 1968 Cask 2844 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The aroma is ethereal, astringent, and spirity. Palate entry is properly flowery (heather with a trace of rose petal) and mildly fruity (green apple, pears); the midpalate is moderately sweet, malty and floral, but there's a fundamental hollowness to this edition. Finishes malty sweet.

title: Scorpion Silver 100% Agave Mezcal with Scorpion, Lot #34
description: Aroma is peppery, clean and dry; later aromas include saddle leather, herbal agave and wood resin. Palate entry emits simple tastes of dried herbs and black peppercorn; by midpalate, the flavor turns astringent and prickly on the tongue. Ends up desert dry, warm and resiny.

title: Jean Durée V.S.O.P. Fine Cognac
description: Initial nosings pick up notes of bacon and oak; aeration stimulates, distant scents of chalk, black pepper and dried red fruit. Palate entry is off-dry to semisweet and candied; at midpalate the flavor closes in on itself, shutting out all possibility for depth of taste. The finish is roasted, toasty and bittersweet.

title: Hine Rare VSOP Fine Champagne Cognac
description: Mild, light aromas of tropical fruit and parchment. Palate entry displays a nut-like opening taste, then at midpalate there's an expanding profile that includes oaky vanillin, young spirit and pear drop. Concludes austere and thin.

title: Oro de Oaxaca 100% Agave Mezcal with Worm
description: Opening aromatic salvo offers air-from-deflating-tire mustiness; time in the glass does little to bail this bouquet out of the stale soup. Palate entry shows a bit of zestiness as the taste goes peppery and bittersweet; the midpalate displays road tar, cigarette ash and distant brown sugar. Finishes flat and off-dry.

title: Absolut Vodka
description: Aroma is vaguely grainy, fresh and pleasing in the initial sniffs; further aeration brings out a mildly oily scent. Palate entry is simple, fundamentally sound and intensely dry and grainy; by midpalate, a shy, kernel-like, bittersweet taste enters the picture, then fades quickly. Ends meek and ethereal.

title: Strom Vodka
description: An unpleasant fishy aroma. The pleasing palate entry taste bears no resemblance to the bouquet, going potato sweet and a touch honeyed; the midpalate stage echoes the entry flavor. Ends up semisweet, a bit fishy or briny, and very odd.

title: Deret VS Cognac
description: The bouquet is appealingly fruity and develops with notes of green melon, banana, sultana, light spice, green grapes and pear. The opening taste is toffee and baked pear-like; then at midpalate the flavor loses the fruit component and accents oaky resin. Concludes flimsy and too intensely resiny/woody.

title: Seagram's Black Cherry Flavored Vodka
description: An aroma reminiscent of chocolate covered cherry candies. The palate entry is clean, semisweet and candied; at midpalate the taste is manufactured and clinical, bearing little resemblance to fresh fruit or fruit essence. Concludes sweet. Certainly drinkable and mixable.

title: Black Velvet Blended Canadian Whisky
description: The opening aroma is a touch herbal, and properly grainy; aeration time adds simple scents of marshmallow and cedar. The palate entry is creamy at first, and then turns a little hard-edged in the acidity department; at midpalate there are muted tastes of roasted hazelnuts and cereal grains. Concludes flat, very lean and acidic, but drinkable.

title: Voyant Chai Cream Liqueur
description: The eggnog-like first scents remind me of those sickly sweet, supplemental drinks that you're supposed to begin consuming the day you turn 60; later whiffs find aromas of ginger, cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, and black leaf tea. Palate entry is creamy and sweet, with a touch of cinnamon spice; at midpalate the ginger and clove kick in. Concludes pleasantly.

title: Rochinha Single Barrel 12-Year-Old Aged Artesian Cachaça
description: Floating detritus makes this libation look unappealing. The initial nosings detect unpleasant traces of creosote, paint thinner, anise and green pepper. The palate entry highlights flavors of black pepper, stone and egg whites; at midpalate, the taste turns slightly sweet and toffee-like, becoming more acceptable.

title: Belle-Vue Kriek Cherry Ale
description: Gorgeous cherry wood/ruby hue; faint white foam. Bing cherry nose is sweet, almost soda pop-like. More sweet than sour in the nose. Tastes of ripe red cherries; no subtlety or complexity here. Aftertaste is limp. Drinkable, but ordinary.

title: Cask & Cream Caramel Temptation Liqueur
description: Opening aroma comes off as being “manufactured”; five more minutes doesn't seem to stimulate much more than a desultory caramel flavor. Palate entry is mildly caramel-like; by midpalate, the caramel flavor component finally gets together with the cream and makes a decent, moderately sweet showing. Concludes sweet and candy-like.

title: Destinee Sapphire Liqueur
description: This nose is barely fruity in the first sniffings, then in later passes a cotton candy scent takes charge. Palate entry is sweet/sour and ripe; the midpalate stage sees a touch of the vodka come through, but not enough to bolster the flabby fruit flavor. Concludes sour.

title: Old Forester Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Fragrant, flowery, popcorn-like aroma; aeration reveals underlying scents of sweet grain, ripe red plums, spice and buttered sweet corn. The palate entry is hard, brittle and unwelcoming; at midpalate there's a slight reflection of the fetching grainy aroma, but that's washed away in a torrent of oaky resin. Ends up bitter and biting.

title: Federation Angel Ale
description: Bronze color topped by a beige head. Opening aroma is fresh, malty and off-dry; time in the glass adds subtle notes of hops and breakfast cereal. Palate entry is dry, toasty and more hoppy than malty; by midpalate, the taste is astringent, hinting slightly of lead pencil or metal. Finishes intensely hoppy, lead-like and bitter. Drinkably average but after liking the bouquet so much I expected more satisfaction from the taste and finish.

title: Three Olives Raspberry Flavored Vodka
description: Perfumed scent of fresh-picked raspberries is enticing. Palate entry is tart and fruity, then at midpalate the taste develops a ripe sweetness that turns too sugary and syrupy. Aftertaste is long and candied.

title: Players Extreme Rum
description: Weird nose after the opening has a burnt match/sulphury quality. Palate entry flavor is simple and sugary. Aftertaste is sweet and moderately pleasant.

title: Francis Darroze 1987 Domaine Aux Ducs Bas Armagnac
description: The early aroma displays peppery spice and celery; aeration adds fiber-like scents of flax or nylon; an odd kind of synthetic bouquet. The spirit is aggressive in the palate entry; vigorous tastes of light caramel, unsalted butter and oak resin rule in unquestioned authority. Too volatile, ungainly and immature.

title: Tortuga Gold Rum
description:
The opening nosing finds marshmallow-like scents; later sniffs pick up disintegrated aromas of tobacco, tar, light honey and spice. The palate entry is candy sweet; the midpalate improves with tastes of molasses, cake batter, dried fruits and winter holiday spices, especially 
cinnamon and nutmeg. Decent, best drunk in a cocktail.

title: E&J; XO Vintage Reserve Brandy Limited Release Aged 7 years
description: The first inhalations find succulent aromas of butter, cream, and oak resin; following aeration the bouquet displays alluring notes of baked apple and almond paste. The palate entry is engagingly toffee-like and oily; at midpalate the taste becomes more complex, offering layered notes of light caramel, candied pear, and maple. Concludes semisweet and silky. Best Buy.

title: Bacardi Coco Original Coconut Rum
description: A balanced approach to the coconut flavoring; aeration allows delightful, low-key and unsweetened coconut perfume to appear. Palate entry is moderately sweet and coconut-like; by midpalate, the coconut flavor turns drier and crisper. Finish is long, and savory. Terrific in any piña colada.

title: Bacardi Razz Original Raspberry Rum
description: Zesty opening bouquet is fruity and raspberry-like. Palate entry is keenly tart and fruity in an unripe way; at midpalate, the taste turns very tart, almost sour, but stays the raspberry course. Aftertaste is medium-long, sour and angular.

title: Whaler's Big Island Banana Rum
description: Opening nose is off-dry and very banana-like; with time in the glass the banana perfume turns candy-like, but it's perfectly fine. Entry is dry to off-dry, somewhat banana-like and a touch bean-like; the midpalate shows more actual banana fruit. Finish is mildly sweet and long.

title: Duncan Taylor Strathmill 1975 Speyside Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: The initial aroma is fruity and winey and almost sour; more air contact brings out an alluring linseed oil/candle wax scent. The palate entry shows a solid, high-octane, spirity and almost fiery profile; at midpalate the alcohol heat reduces, allowing toasty tastes of hazelnuts and figs to emerge. Concludes cleanly, mildly hot and oily.

title: Glenmorangie Burgundy Wood Finish Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: The first whiffs pick up pork sausage, pork rind, green olive and peanuts; following aeration scents of baked pears, sesame oil and buttered popcorn appear with traces of dried herbs and fennel. At palate entry there's a moderately oily, semisweet taste of pear; at midpalate the pear presence expands. Ends buttery, silky if a bit fey. A very good malt for aficionados of lighter malt styles. Best Buy.

title: Whisky Galore Glengarioch 1988 Eastern Highlands Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: The first nosing passes find a backbone aroma of malted milk; further aeration adds nuances of coconut, fudge, mead and toffee. The palate entry is warm and bittersweet; at midpalate flavors of light toffee, light honey and nougat are highlighted. Finishes as handsomely as it started.

title: Barenjager Honey Liqueur
description: Delicate, lightly honeyed and not overlysweet scents with a buttery/creamy quality. Palate entry is gooey, concentrated, chewy and numbingly sweet; the midpalate phase heightens the impressions of the entry. Aftertaste is scoop-out-with-spoon thick and tonsil-screamingly sweet.

title: Vendome Platinum V.S.O.P. Brandy
description: The initial nose emits expressive notes of light toffee, nougat and grain-like sweetness; after aeration the bouquet turns fruity, especially apples, pears, cherries and peaches. Palate entry is cocoa-like and smooth; at midpalate the flavor profile turns caramel- and toffee-like. The finish is long, sweet, satiny and nutty. A well-made and uncomplicated quaff. Best Buy.

title: Merry's Irish Cream Liqueur
description: The opening sniffing picks up alluring, rich creamy/spicy notes. With aeration the spice element recedes, leaving the creamy/milky aroma. Palate entry is pleasantly sweet; at midpalate the taste goes bittersweet and chocolaty. Concludes well and on a balanced aftertaste of cream, cinnamon stick and milk chocolate. Good job here. Best Buy.

title: Marchesa Anna Maria Toscano Limoncello Liqueur
description: Aromas are fruity/citrusy and moderately tart. Palate entry is sweet/sour and intensely lemony. Finish is brief, concentrated and citrusy.

title: Armadale Vodka
description: Made from wheat and barley, the wheat component is apparent in the early-stage bouquet; further aeration allows a dry stony/mineral-like aroma to mingle with the biscuity underpinning scent. Palate entry is surprisingly semisweet and delicious; at midpalate the taste profile shows flashes of spirity heat that pull the rug out from under the terrific palate entry. Finishes oily and raw.

title: Piave Grappa Selezione Cuore
description: Initial whiffs detect a strong musty-mushroomy aroma which after aeration turns remarkably rubbery. Significantly more attractive in the mouth than in the nose, the palate entry is grapy, intense and semisweet; at midpalate the taste profile turns seed-like, bittersweet and very dried fruit-like. Concludes off-dry, bitter and musty.

title: Planat X.O. Cognac
description: Maple scents lead the way over more subtle fragrances of gum, old oak and prune. Palate finds ripe red fruit, light honey and caramel. Finish is long.

title: Milford 10 Year Old Single Malt Whisky Distilled in 1991 Batch 1M32
description: Opening sniffs discover a tightly wound aroma featuring chalk, minerals, flowers and cowhide; aeration stimulates scents of gum, allspice, ginger, saddle leather and pencil eraser. Palate entry is dry and astringent; at midpalate a flash of smoke/peat makes things momentarily interesting, but then the mineral-like taste returns. Finishes spicy/gingery and moderately grainy.

title: Amate Anejo 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1137
description: Early-stage aroma is keenly briny/salty/herbal; more time allows dark honey and light toffee to emerge. Palate entry is pleasantly sweet and viscous; midpalate features tastes of roasted agave, tobacco leaf, black pepper and palm oil. Ends clean and buttery.

title: Jules Gautret 10 Year Old Cognac
description: A weary opening bouquet of black raisins and plums; further aeration only arouses meek, off-dry scents of tobacco, oak and fruit candy. Palate entry at least offers tastes of baked banana, pear drops and guava; midpalate the flavor turns sap- and maple-like. Finishes sappy sweet, moderately fruity and pleasant. Best Buy.

title: Players Extreme Mandtango Infused Vodka
description: Exotic aroma is inviting, citrusy and mild. Palate entry is keenly tart, then by midpalate the taste profile accents the orange and mango fruit elements nicely. Finish is tart, crisp and long.

title: Francis Darroze 1978 Domaine Aux Ducs Bas Armagnac
description: The peppercorn-like opening aroma is firm and vegetal; further air brings traces of wood resin and licorice. Palate entry is luscious and chocolaty; at midpalate, the flavor stays the sweet, dark chocolate course, adding subtle notes of butter, cream and oil. Finishes long, oily and intriguing.

title: The Arran Malt Limited Edition Isle of Arran Single Cask Single Malt Whisky
description: The opening sniffs encounter a candy-sweet, ripe red fruit bouquet that's ambrosial; the bouquet stays the fruity/estery course as a subtle, underpinning note of confectioner's sugar comes alive. Palate entry flashes spirity fire but underlying that is a delicious honey-like, almost buttercream taste; the midpalate shines for its sherry and cocoa-like sweetness. Aftertaste is sweet, malty and spirity.

title: 42 Below Passionfruit Flavored Vodka
description: The first nosing provides a fruity/ripe experience that's elegant and restrained; aeration allows the bouquet to evolve into a splendidly fruit-salad fragrance. Palate entry is bittersweet and juicy; by midpalate, the flavor profile accents the grainy spirit as well as the passionfruit infusion. Finish is long and more beany than fruity.

title: Pravda Vodka
description: Not much happens in the initial minutes of nosing; more air contact helps in releasing supplementary aromas of black pepper and cardamom. Palate entry taste shows minor league cereal grain spice (rye) and a welcome flash of spirity warmth; at midpalate, this vodka displays some grip and character in the forms of oily texture and the piquant, spicy graininess. Aftertaste hangs its hat on the spicy, rye-grain flavor that dominates at the tail end.

title: Dr. McGillicuddy's French Kiss Vanilla Schnapps Liqueur
description: Mildly sweet vanilla bean perfume. Palate entry is sweet, while the midpalate displays a thick texture that supports the velvety vanilla frosting flavor. Finish is acceptably sweet and lip-smacking.

title: Escorial Liqueur
description: Initial whiffs detect gently spiced and herbal scents that include traces of peppermint and dried herbs. On the palate entry, a potent taste of mint grows in intensity on the tongue; at midpalate, there's really nothing new except for an expanding bittersweet element. Finishes very cleanly and intensely pepperminty.

title: Beachcomber Coconut Flavored Rum
description: Aroma is fresh, mildly sweet and properly coconut-like. Taste is gently sweet, coconut-true and has a marshmallow-like quality that's attractive in its simplicity. Aftertaste stays the course set out at palate entry.

title: Larressingle XO Grande Reserve Armagnac
description: Lovely, burnt umber/honey color—excellent purity. The opening nosings detect concentrated, nutty scents followed by dry, cardboard, parchment, and brown rice-like aromas; the palate entry is rich, honey-like and sweet. The midpalate gushes with piquant taste of nuts, nougat, dark caramel and dark honey; ends a bit too mossy/earthy/ mushroomy and sweet.

title: Bruichladdich Vintage 1973 Limited Edition Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: Offers gently sweet, moderately nutty scents of banana bread, just-cracked walnuts, grass, hay and light brine. The litheness found in the nose doesn't prepare you for the alluring firmness and spirity punch of the palate entry; by midpalate, there's a lovely honey/toffee quality that's succulent. Ends politely and moderately sweet and honeyed.

title: Murray McDavid Mission Series II Caperdonich 1968 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The aroma is assertive, vegetal, and damn near prickly in the nasal cavity at first, then with aeration it turns malty, biscuity and leathery in the final stages. Palate entry is sweet, concentrated, honeyed and caramel-like; the richness found in the entry continues at midpalate as the taste profile goes creamy, fatty and pleasantly oily. Finishes semisweet, malty, oily and warm in the throat.

title: Murray McDavid Mission Series II Glen Grant 1969 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The early stage aroma reeks of malt, porridge and heather; aeration brings out appealing scents of pears, peaches, brown sugar, honey and almond butter. Palate entry shows firm and slightly oily, light toffee, nougat tastes; by midpalate the flavor profile offers off-dry to medium-sweet tastes of oaky vanilla, maple, marzipan and oloroso Sherry. Concludes with a rush of toffee/maple.

title: Talisker 10 Year Old Skye Single Malt Whisky
description: The piquant nose offers immediate and stunning notes of sea salt, peat reek and black pepper; aeration time encourages deeper aromas including malt and almond. Palate entry is malty sweet and nicely peppery, then at midpalate the peaty iodine character kicks in. Finishes well as it gives off fiery, peaty/tobacco-like flavors.

title: Sorus Fine Hand-Distilled Ukrainian Vodka
description: Pronounced “so-rush” (like “so Russian,”) this wheat-based vodka has an aroma that whispers faintly of cool cucumber and mint. Meanwhile, the palate skews fruitier, with boisterous banana and raspberry warming to cinnamon sizzle on the finish.

title: Straw Boys Irish Vodka
description: This wheat-based vodka is made in Ireland by Connacht Whiskey Company. Look for a bit of almond and vanilla sweetness on the palate, finishing with a plume of intense black pepper heat.

title: Tommyrotter Distillery Small Batch Vodka
description: Made from New York state grain, this vodka shows faint vanilla on the nose and palate, plus charcoal midpalate warming to black pepper and hot cinnamon on the fiery finish.

title: Alphabet Vodka
description: This corn-based vodka has a sweet scent and flavor reminiscent of raspberry and banana, finishing with earthy black pepper sting. The liquid is packaged in bottles shaped like letters, hence the name, which is cute but some shapes are awkward to hold and pour.

title: Jelzin Vodka
description: For those who seek neutrality in vodka, this spirit offers little on the nose or slick, silky palate, finishing with muted cinnamon heat.

title: Montana Cold Spring Vodka
description: While the aroma is nearly neutral, the flavor of this corn-based vodka has a distinctly savory, vegetal, almost funky quality up front, fading into sugary sweetness and then a ginger-laced finish.

title: Opaline Vodka
description: Look for a lightly fruity scent from this vodka distilled from sugar beets. Soft and subtly sweet on the palate, but otherwise neutral, the finish is quite fiery, with plenty of alcohol punch.

title: Main Street Vodka
description: A small-batch vodka made from corn, this spirit has a powerful, distinctly funky aroma. That umami characteristic shows up on the palate too, alongside a rubbery note, but finishes cleanly and smoothly.

title: Twisted Path Distillery Organic Overproof Vodka
description: Reserve this 100-proof vodka for making infusions. The aroma is distinctly fruity, redolent of banana, lychee and pineapple. The bold tropical fruit is evident on the palate too, but the initial peppercorn sting quickly turns into a four-alarm alcohol blaze—ouch.

title: Midleton Very Rare Irish Whiskey
description: Complex, robust, and hard to put down, this sipper offers big, buttery, toasty flavor. Look for crème brûlée and custard, caramel apple and brioche rounding into a gently spiced finish. Limited production.

title: Barr an Uisce 1803 Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: Balancing fruit, spice and oak, this 10-year-old whiskey offers enticing orchard and stone-fruit aromas warmed by a whiff of butterscotch. The palate opens with zingy baking spice and winds into a long exit with citrus peel and buttery brioche. A splash of water tames the spicy heat, but still leaves plenty of sprightly flavor.

title: Green Spot Single Pot Still Irish Whiskey
description: The bold, fruit aroma suggests fresh-cut apples and honeysuckle, while the silky palate offers deep, bold flavor. Look for dark honey and clove, edging into tea, oak and cocoa midpalate. Apple freshness brightens the dry finish. An ice cube is the only adornment needed for this well-structured, tasty sipper.

title: Yellow Spot Single Pot Still Irish Whiskey Aged 12 Years
description: Aged in former Bourbon, Sherry and Malaga casks, look for a deep orange-gold hue and inviting baked-pear aroma. The robust, spiced palate offers brown sugar, honey, golden raisins and vanilla-tinged baked pear.

title: Midleton Dair Ghaelach
description: Made with a range of 15- to 22-year-old whiskies, this big, flavorful bottling will remind some of bourbon. Look for a rich amber color and caramel scent, and a robust palate with tons of vanilla, peach and a warming cocoa and espresso-tinged finish. Add a splash of water to balance out the high proof. Note: Each label is marked with the number of the tree (sustainably grown and harvested) from which the barrel was made, making this an ideal gift for an environmentally minded whiskey lover.

title: Tullamore Dew Single Malt 18 Years Old
description: A quartet of casks (Bourbon, Sherry, Port, Madeira) provide a spice-cake-like sipper. The complex, drying palate opens with candied citrus peel and almond, warms up with hints of molasses, ginger and vanilla, and finishes with rounded toffee, cocoa and spice.

title: Powers John's Lane Release Aged 12 Years
description: A dark, moody, almost Scotch-like take on Irish whiskey. The concentrated aroma suggests caramel and vanilla. Meanwhile, the velvety palate starts at caramel but quickly deepens to dark chocolate, molasses and coconut, teased at the edges by campfire smoke and mint, finishing with anise and black pepper heat. Think of s'mores held a little too long at the fire and you get the idea.

title: The Tyrconnell 10 Year Old Sherry Cask
description: Break out the water and ice, because this Sherry-finished single malt is packing plenty of alcohol heat. That said, there's also plenty of flavor: vanilla and butterscotch, plum and dried apricot, plus baking spice and a whiff of smoke in the finish.

title: Redbreast Aged 21 Years
description: Burnished gold in the glass, this robust sipper offers complex vanilla, caramel, almond, butterscotch and honey. A splash of water opens up fruitier notes: dried apricot, buttery baked pear and a rounded, clove-accented finish.

title: The Tyrconnell 16 Year Old
description: This new single malt,  debuting in March 2017, has a fresh, grassy scent, a  drying feel and plenty of bold flavor. Think rounded  almond, subtle vanilla sweetness and coconut  cream pie, finishing with a burst of citrus- and  ginger-peel  zing.

title: Green Spot Château Léoville Barton
description: Atten¬tion wine-lovers: Meet an Irish whiskey aged in former Bordeaux wine barrels—specifically, barrels from Château Léoville Barton, established by native Irishman Thomas Barton in 1725. The end result is a grassy, bright whiskey with a baked pear note mid¬palate and a subtly smoky finish.

title: Knappogue Castle 12 Year Old Single Malt
description: The aroma is enticingly bright and fruity, like fresh pears, while the palate is silky and mellow. A fruity core is layered with vanilla, hints of salted butterscotch and buttery croissant, plus a light sprinkle of cinnamon and clove.

title: Jameson The Cooper's Croze
description: This new blended Irish whiskey is intended to showcase flavors imparted by the barrel. (A cooper makes barrels; a croze is a tool used to cut grooves in the barrel.) Look for a bright, fresh scent layered with fresh pear and sweet vanilla, which is echoed on the palate. Adding water coaxes out more vanilla, crème brûlée and baking spice. A real sipper, this whiskey warms all the way down.

title: Kinahan's Single Malt Irish Whiskey Aged 10 Years
description: This golden whiskey has a gentle honey aroma and complex, layered flavor. Look for waxy honey, white flowers, dusty plum and black pepper tingle, finishing long, with a brisk, drying feel.

title: Slane Irish Whiskey Blend
description: An easy, elegant sipper, look for a gentle vanilla-caramel-almond profile on the nose and palate as well as a silky feel. Mild baked pear and dried apricot midpalate wind into a cinnamon and clove finish. Sip or mix.

title: Barr an Uisce Wicklow Rare Small Batch Blended Irish Whiskey
description: Made by Wicklow Hills Whiskey Company, cut with water from the family well, and aged in former Bourbon and oloroso Sherry barrels. The end result: a mild vanilla scent with hints of pineapple and lemon zest and a light, creamy palate. Look for vanilla, lemon cream and honey, finishing smoothly with ginger, cinnamon and cayenne heat. A splash of water teases out more vanilla, oak and a hint of cocoa sweetness.

title: Knappogue Castle 16 Year Old Single Malt
description: This special-edition whiskey matured for 14 years in former Bourbon cask, then spent additional time in oloroso Sherry casks. The end result is a vanilla-caramel scent and relatively dark flavors. Oak, caramel and toffee dominate, with baked pear in the middle and drying to vanilla, cocoa and clove on the finish.

title: Tullamore Dew Trilogy 15 Years Old
description: This blended whiskey was matured in Sherry and Bourbon casks and finished in former rum casks—the latter an unusual touch for Irish whiskey. All this yields vanilla sweetness on the nose and palate, plus almond, creamy honey and an exceedingly long finish with plenty of ginger and sweet cinnamon sparks.

title: Kinahan's Blended Irish Whiskey
description: Made from a combination of whiskeys made with malted and unmalted barley, this is a gentle, versatile spirit to sip or mix. The honeyed scent leads into a light, sweet flavor profile that shows coconut and vanilla, plus a bracing sprinkle of nutmeg and cinnamon heat on the drying finish.

title: Redbreast Lustau Edition
description: This robust newcomer is a collaboration between the master blender at Midleton Distillery and winemakers at Bodegas Lustau; the whiskey spends time in former oloroso Sherry barrels. Big, spicy flavors sweep over the palate in waves: vanilla, waxy honey, apple butter, dried apricot and dried fig, drying to chamomile tea and oak midpalate, and winding into a rich honey finish.

title: The Tyrconnell 10 Year Old Madeira Cask
description: This single malt has a fresh, bright scent with stone fruit and vanilla. The drying, relatively hot palate skews a bit darker, deepening to cocoa, oak, almond and dried apricot, plus a smoky hint in the finish and plenty of cinnamon and clove finish. A splash of water helps tone down the heat and softens flavors to vanilla, peach and ginger sizzle.

title: Black Button Distilling Moonshine
description: Clear in the glass, this corn-based whiskey offers a sweet, slightly fruity scent and lots of fruit on the palate, ranging from raspberries to ripe banana funk. It feels soft, though there's lots of alcohol bite on the long, spicy finish.

title: Orphan Barrel Forged Oak
description: This 15-year-old Bourbon was distilled at the New Bernheim Distillery and found in the old Stitzel-Weller Warehouses (both in Louisville, KY), then bottled in Tullahoma, TN. The aroma and palate show bold vanilla and a subtle waft of mesquite smoke. It finishes long and drying, with clove, cinnamon and black pepper spice.

title: Few Single Malt Whiskey
description: Made from 100% malted barley, a quarter of which is smoked with cherrywood, this single malt is aged in barrels that previously held Few's own Bourbon and rye. The end result has a honey hue and aromas of honey, cedar and oak. Soft on the palate, it delivers most of its flavor on the rounded, honeyed finish. A splash of water coaxes out additional vanilla sweetness and baking spice.

title: American Born Moonshine Original
description: This unaged corn whiskey is clear in the glass, with a nearly neutral, slightly fruity scent. On the palate, sweetness mingles with alcohol bite, leaving behind a lingering, pleasantly fruity note. Producer recommends serving as a “moonshine sour.”

title: Wild Turkey Kentucky Spirit
description: This fiery single-barrel Bourbon has a burnished copper hue and rich caramel aroma. That concentrated caramel-toffee note shows up on the palate too, finishing oaky with clove and cinnamon burn.

title: Catskill Provisions New York Honey
description: Reminiscent of tea with honey, this bottling is a collaboration between a whiskey producer and a honey purveyor, both from upstate New York. The three year-old rye is infused with a “slight amount” of raw local honey, creating a light-bodied, drying whiskey, with notes of cedar and black tea, and slightly a sweet honey accent on the finish

title: Maker's Mark Cask Strength Bourbon
description: This new offering is bottled at 113 proof, making it fiery but flavorful. Expect a stab of alcohol even while inhaling the lovely crème brûlée-like aroma. The palate is extremely drying, showing mainly oak at first, but opening up to caramel, toffee and burnt orange peel. Adding much-needed water pales the taste to cinnamon Red Hots.

title: Few Rye Whiskey
description: This amber-hued rye shows notes of oak, chamomile tea, vanilla and cedar, concluding with a pleasingly juicy orange-peel note on the fiery cinnamon finish. 70% rye.

title: Double Diamond Whiskey Limited Edition Single Malt
description: Bold topaz in the glass, this single malt features a rich maple scent with a flicker of spice. The palate is drier, showing oak, vanilla and just a trace of maple, finishing spicy and fiery.

title: Troy & Sons Small Batch Moonshine
description: Made with Crooked Creek Corn, an heirloom variety, this clear whiskey has a sweet marshmallow scent and a relatively neutral palate, finishing with marshmallow, vanilla and a flicker of alcohol heat.

title: High West Whiskey American Prairie
description: Made with a blend of straight Bourbons, this whiskey has a mild vanilla and resin scent. On the palate, flavors run to vanilla, cedar and citrus. Adding water brings out distinct cinnamon and peach notes, before fading into vanilla.

title: Short Mountain Shine
description: Made from a mix of 70% cane and 30% corn, this small-batch 'shine is clear in the glass, with a sweet banana-like scent. The palate reads as fruity with a touch of oakiness, finishing with a hot and puckery feel.

title: Wild Turkey American Honey Sting
description: This Bourbon-based liqueur is made with honey and infused with ghost pepper, which is reputed as one of the hottest chile peppers in the world. The golden liqueur has a mild caramel-honey scent. At first sip, it shows a slight fruitiness, like red apples and vanilla, and mild heat. But the slow burn builds with each sip, showing cinnamon, black pepper, cayenne and chile heat.

title: Few Bourbon Whiskey
description: A fleeting vegetal note, like fresh celery, underscores the vanilla and oak aroma and flavor, finishing distinctly spicy with lots of cayenne and black pepper.

title: 13th Colony Southern Rye Whiskey
description: Made with a mashbill of 96% rye and 4% barley, this rye whiskey tastes relatively young, showing mostly oak on the nose and palate. But there's potential, with enticing caramel and orange peel lurking just below the fiery surface.

title: Silver Lightning Moonshine
description: This “moonshine-style” unaged corn whiskey is clear in the glass, with a very sweet, corn-like aroma. It's exceedingly hot on the palate. A touch of sweetness reads almost like cherries, but the sharp alcohol heat obliterates most of the flavor. Small batch

title: Mosby's Spirit
description: This unaged 100% rye-based is intended to evoke early whiskeys distilled in Colonial Virginia. This has a malty, slightly sweet scent and a rawness that finishes with green apple and a subtle floral note.

title: O'Begley Poitin “Irish style moonshine”
description: The owner of this Irish-style, American-made small batch whiskey is named Begley, not O'Begley, but this product nonetheless is intended as a nod to his Irish roots. Made primarily from barley, the spirit has a warm, grainy aroma and bold, malty palate, finishing long and lip-numbingly hot at 100 proof.

title: Twelve Five Rye
description: Though this topaz rye smells bright and fresh, on the palate it's quite fiery at 95 proof. Adding water coaxes out some vanilla sweetness and flecks of cinnamon, but the whiskey doesn't stand up well to dilution. Named for the date FDR signed the 21st Amendment into law (December 5, 1933); Cedar Ridge is the first licensed distillery in Iowa since Prohibition.

title: Chicken Cock Cherry Bounce
description: Intended as cherry-cola-flavored whiskey, this amber spirit has an herbal scent that suggests horehound and cherry-flavored cough drops, and an ersatz flavor redolent of cherry cough syrup. The producer suggests drinking as a shot.

title: Don Pancho Origenes Reserva Aged 30 Years
description: The magnum opus of rum maestro Francisco “Don Pancho” Fernandez, this velvet-soft, limited-edition rum is redolent of rich, warm caramel accented with espresso and cocoa. It fades gracefully into long notes of toffee and clove.

title: Diplomatico Ambassador Selection
description: Rich and concentrated, this is a blend of rums aged up to 12 years, then aged an additional two years in former PX Sherry casks. The end result is luxurious, thick in caramel, toffee and gingerbread flavors that finish long and elegant, with clove, allspice, dry cocoa, leather and orange peel accents. It sips beautifully.

title: Siesta Key Spiced Rum Distiller's Reserve Solera Blend
description: This Florida-made rum, with honey and spices added, shows a light touch yet is remarkably complex for a flavored rum. Velvety soft, with just a touch of sweetness, it offers notes of brown sugar, vanilla, coconut and cinnamon that waft across the palate. Sip or mix.

title: Diplomatico 2000 Single Vintage
description: Single-vintage rums are few and far between. This one, distilled in 2000, is worth seeking out. Aged for 12 years before finishing in Sherry casks, this sipper offers rounded, lip-smacking notes of caramelized brown sugar and allspice, fading into a rich hazelnut and toffee finish. The proof feels comparatively high, but an ice cube or two should help restore balance.

title: Don Pancho Origenes Reserva Aged 18 Years
description: Despite being aged 18 years, this suprisingly easy sipper is full of rich toffee and crème brûlée aromas and flavors, finishing long, with touches of orange peel and spice.

title: DonQ Gran Anejo
description: This light and silky rum offers vanilla and honey, brightened by tropical fruit and finishing with pops of baking spice. Made with a blend of rums aged 3–12 years, and aged via solera method in Sherry casks, it's packaged in a bottle resembling an oversized perfume flask

title: Six Saints Caribbean Rum
description: Golden and light-bodied, this small-batch rum mixes honey and oaky vanilla notes with fresh apples, pears and pineapple. It offers pleasant sipping and a light, spicy finish. The slow-building alcohol heat suggests this is an ideal rum to mix in tropical drinks.

title: Selvarey Cacao
description: This chocolate-flavored dark rum is soft and delicious, with a slightly nutty flavor and a dusty cocoa finish. Mix with cold-brew espresso and coconut milk for a memorable coffee-spiked libation.

title: Tiburón Rum
description: Adorned with a shark tooth and an etched image of a shark, this small-batch rum attracts attention. In the glass, look for bold and warming notes of honey, vanilla and coconut, ideal for tropical libations. Made from a blend of four-, six- and eight-year-old rums.

title: Pusser's Navy Rum Nelson's Blood Aged 15 Years
description: Since Pusser's utilizes traditional wood pot stills in addition to copper pot stills, that may account for the unusual flavor profile. Overall, the rum is light bodied, showing oak and resin-like flavors layered with vanilla, plus notes of cedar, chamomile tea, honey and a flash of dried apricot. Finishes dry and spicy.

title: Cruzan Black Strap Rum Navy Tradition
description: Toasty/roasted aromas of molasses, black coffee and road tar begin the nosing stage, then bittersweet scents of oatmeal stout ale, licorice, dark cocoa, pipe tobacco and brown sugar take over. Palate entry is long, more sweet than bittersweet and dark chocolate-like; at midpalate, tastes of bacon fat, oak resin and brown sugar turn creamy. Finishes smooth, creamy and dense.

title: Emerald Vodka
description: First nosings find a starchy, cotton fiber, desert dry aroma that's appealing; aeration heightens and reinforces the dry, starch- and seed-like bouquet. Squeaky clean and dry at palate entry; by midpalate, there's a faint bittersweet note that fades quickly, leaving the astringent, pod-like flavor. Ends up oily in texture and taste. A solid vodka that comes on strong when you want it most, in the taste and aftertaste.

title: Shustoff Luxury Vodka
description: Opening inhalations offer proper, if standard-issue, scents of grain and dry-roasted peanuts; more air contact introduces totally dry aromas of cardboard, synthetic fibers and palm oil. Palate entry flavors offer vivid, off-dry tastes of wheat and resin; by midpalate, the taste expands to include bittersweet cocoa and prickly (a plus) cereal spirit. Concludes offering moderately hot tastes on the tongue.

title: Svedka Raspberry Flavored Vodka
description: The seductive perfume of ripe raspberries fills the office upon pouring; air contact stimulates ambrosial, berry-like, properly fruity aromas. What's attractive about this bouquet is that it holds onto the natural fruit acidity/astringency aspect. Palate entry is tart; by midpalate, the tartness begins to turn peel-like and seed-like. Ends tart and bitter. One of the best less-than-$15 berry flavored voddies out there, period.

title: Kahlúa Liqueur
description: Starts out concentrated, coffee bean- and kernel-like in the aroma, which turns more cocoa/dark chocolate-like with aeration. Palate entry is creamy, thick and intensely black coffee-like; at midpalate, the sweetness accelerates and includes toasty flavors of roasted nuts and tar. Ends sweet, rich and properly coffee-like.

title: Bushmills Original Blended Irish Whiskey/White Label
description: Early-stage sniffings find delicate aromas of green vegetables, carnations and grain mash; further air contact brings up slightly sour notes of damp soil, glue and marshmallow. Exceedingly pleasant, grainy sweet and genial on the palate. Finishes cleanly.

title: Merry's Irish Cream Liqueur
description: The opening sniffing picks up alluring, rich creamy/spicy notes. With aeration the spice element recedes, leaving the creamy/milky aroma. Palate entry is pleasantly sweet; at midpalate the taste goes bittersweet and chocolaty. Concludes well and on a balanced aftertaste of cream, cinnamon stick and milk chocolate. Good job here.

title: Basilica CreamAretto Liqueur
description: The first inhalations find a charming, sweet, nutty and fruity bouquet; further time stimulates the dairy element and accentuates the fruit component. Palate entry is intensely fruity and almost too sweet and syrupy; by midpalate the taste profile includes chunky cherry-like fruit, milk chocolate, a faint hint of spice and hardly any nuttiness. Finishes thick and sweet.

title: Myers's Rum Original Dark
description: The initial inhalations expose a moderately spicy, black peppercorn perfume; aeration brings about flax, cooked vegetables, and brown sugar. The platform flavor is intensely cocoa-like, then at midpalate, the taste leaps into deeper cocoa/bittersweet chocolate territory before turning lean and keenly bittersweet, oily and chocolaty in the finish.

title: Duc de Loussac VSOP Bas Armagnac
description: Nose displays an early oakiness, then well-developed aromas of nut paste, roasted almond, cola nut and meringue. Flavor is dusty, semisweet and caramel-like, with late notes of nougat and marzipan. Finishes sweet, raisiny and toffee-like.

title: Loujan 12 Year Old Bas Armagnac
description: Aromas include walnut butter, nougat, jasmine, papaya, grape skins and leather. Rich, textured, sweet, honey flavors emerge at palate entry, then stately tastes of nougat, toasted almond, sweet oak, vanilla bean and tobacco emerge. Ends long. and maple-like.

title: Old Charter 8 Year Old Kentucky Straight Bourbon
description: Delicate, biscuity, sugar cookie batter aromas start the experience; another six minutes bring forward scents of ripe yellow fruit, gum, confectioner's sugar and a distant hint of honey. Palate entry features the corn component in its finest grainy sweet state; by midpalate, flavors include caramel corn, cocoa butter, oak resin and honey. Finishes sinewy smooth in the throat.

title: Sahuaro Vodka
description: The aroma is pleasingly oily, mildly sweet and bean-like; air contact does little except to bolster the bean/kernel quality as the bouquet becomes intensely cereal-like. Palate entry is bittersweet and beany and the oily texture works for me; at midpalate, the intensity of the grain kernel flavor accelerates. Finishes sweetly and quietly.

title: Svedka Vanilla Flavored Vodka
description: The beany vanilla bean aroma leaps from the sampling glass; aeration encourages the vanilla essence to turn plumper, more fatty and biscuity than bittersweet or extract-like. Palate entry is bittersweet and intensely beany while the midpalate stage is all about the buttery/oily side of processed vanilla essence. Concludes by going a bit soft in the finish.

title: KWV Van Der Hum The Original Cape Liqueur
description: Bouquet leaps from the glass in waves of perfectly ripe tangerine/blood orange, citrusy scents. Sweet-and-sour palate entry features the tangerine, but in a dried pulp, rind-like way; at midpalate, bitter traces of cardamom, bitter root, fennel, rosehip and mustard seed prevail. Finishes sweet and sour.

title: Bowmore 12 Year Old Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: The unabashedly briny opening bouquet is all peat, sea salt and salted focaccia; time in the glass serves to bring out a refined Sherry scent. In the mouth, it's lean, surprisingly sweet and acutely resiny. Ends pine-like, resiny, moderately salty, fruity (yellow fruit, like yellow plum or banana) and semisweet.

title: Skyy Vodka
description: The grain takes a backseat in the early sniffing stages as bittersweet bean- and kernel-like scents dominate; later whiffs merely confirm the intense bean/cocoa quality. Palate entry mirrors the bouquet to a tee; at midpalate, the kernel-like intensity turns smooth and viscous on the tongue. Ends bittersweet and oily.

title: Des Ribauds XO Coeur du Temps Fine Champagne Cognac
description: The early whiffs find spicy/peppery notes that are semi-dry and alluring; later sniffings pick up deeper scents of toffee, citrus rind and hazelnuts. Palate entry starts semisweet then immediately turns bittersweet and resiny; midpalate the flavor profile focuses almost entirely on the oak, leaving the fruit way behind. An ethereal, sinewy Cognac with no fat on it.

title: Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Tennessee Whiskey Rick No. L-24, Barrel No. 4-0623, Bottled 2-26-04
description: The first sniffings pick up lively scents of buckwheat and hemp; more time encourages spirity aromas of light toffee, nougat and oak to emerge. The palate entry is moderately sweet, lead pencil-like and a touch chalky; at midpalate the roasted/toasty grain mash flavor gives way to tastes of baked pear, pie crust and spice. Concludes very warm, toasted and tobacco-like.

title: Amazon Rainforest Vodka
description: Sniffings detect dull notes of burnt paper and charcoal. The palate entry is sweet and toasty; at midpalate a moderate oiliness acts as a nice foundation for the toasty, sweet, almost smoky/sooty taste. Ends sweet and oily. A vodka with a “save the rainforest” theme and a bonfire-like personality.

title: Seagram's Platinum Select Vodka
description: Whiffs detect notes of dry breakfast cereal, egg cream and a touch cocoa/chocolate-like. The palate entry is alluringly oily, bittersweet and vanilla bean-like; at midpalate toasty, roasted grain tastes impress the taste buds. Finishes with the sweet grain taste center-stage.

title: Marie Brizard Crème de Menthe Liqueur
description: Neon forest green appearance. Initially smells like Scope mouthwash or minty toothpaste, aeration allows a more nuanced leafy, minty core, totally dry and piquant to appear. The palate entry is rich, intensely minty and only moderately sweet; at midpalate the mint comes on strong, cleansing the tongue and leaving behind a fresh taste. Concludes concentrated and properly minty.

title: Regency Amaretto di Vinci Liqueur
description: The nose after the pour is moderately expressive and nutty/sweet; aeration doesn't smooth out the icky-sticky sweet, only mildly almond-like aroma. Palate entry is moderately tasty and almondy but the syrupy texture and candied sweetness nearly obliterate the chance of any kind of classic amaretto flavor profile. Ends better in the throat than on the tongue.

title: Mishka Vodka
description: The opening aroma offers dry graininess; later sniffings discover scents of chalk or limestone and wheat. The palate entry is elegant, smooth, and dry to off-dry; at midpalate there's a quick flash of spirity warmth, then a grainy dryness. Ends up off-dry, minerally, and admirably clean and lean.

title: Mount Gay Mango Flavored Rum
description:
The peculiar, but appealing bouquet includes unexpected aromas of lead pencil, baking bread, baked pear, and sautéed butter with hints of mango. The mango core flavor is detected quite clearly in the palate entry, and then it makes a slightly bigger fruity splash at midpalate. Concludes mildly sweet and fruity. A classy fruit 
flavored rum that gains momentum with time. Best Buy.

title: Business Class Cranberry Vodka
description: The bouquet contains delicate aromas of red fruit and cranberry . The palate entry reflects that delicacy; at midpalate the taste of cranberry is faint and fresh. Finishes elegant, clean, semisweet, ripe, and with a whisper of fruit. Best Buy

title: Barsol Pisco Traditional Peruvian Torontel Grape Brandy
description: The initial sniffings pick up delightfully fruity, jammy aromas. The palate entry is sweet, ripe, and intensely grapy with a bit of welcome heat on the tongue. Finishes grapy and ripe.
