description: Nondescript nose only offers dry notes of parchment, stone and lead. Entry is sweet and a touch flabby due to lack of acidity; the midpalate improves but reflects the acid deficit. Finishes as it starts with no glaring flaws, but blander than I expect from a Russian vodka.

title: BenRiach Madeira Wood Finish 15 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: After the first rush of alcohol the spirit diminishes, leaving behind big, accessible smells of grain, malt, light caramel, light fudge and almond butter. Entry is big flavored and spirity, with upfront tastes of marshmallow, buttercream, egg cream, dark chocolate, nougat and vanilla bean. Luscious; a Speyside classic.

title: Bruichladdich Rocks Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: The inviting bouquet offers aromas of fruitcake, banana nut bread, sweet malt, crispy pork rind, sweet oak, vanilla, red grapes and blackberry jam. Entry is sweet and grainy; at midpalate the taste profile suddenly bursts with red fruit presence and oaky vanilla. Finishes clean as a whistle, chewy and concentrated.

title: Chauffe-Coeur Hors d'Age Calvados
description: The complex bouquet offers scents of very toasty baked apple, pie crust, spicy and rancio  notes, walnut meat, butterscotch and hard cheese. Entry taste is like caramel-covered apple, baked apple with cinnamon and honey; the sweetness level rises at midpalate as the flavor profile grows more succulent, plump, and buttery. Hints of rancio in the finish. Wonderful.

title: Poli Miele Honey Liqueur
description: Smells of pine cones, new rubber soles, candle wax, dried flowers, juniper, tree sap, and cedar. Entry is sweet but not cloying, buttery and gracefully honeyed; at midpalate the taste profile becomes creamy as the honey, pine, juniper, flowers and spirit integrate with precision and elegance. A perfect liqueur.

title: BenRiach Pedro Ximenez Sherry Wood Finish 15 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: Heady aromas of dark chocolate, cocoa butter, cream sherry, dates, black raisins and sweet barley malt. Entry tastes include honey wheat bread, prune Danish and lots of honey; by midpalate the taste profile increases, as hardy flavors of marzipan, treacle, blackberry preserves, cherries covered in dark chocolate and orange-flavored chocolates bombard the taste buds. Not to everyone's taste but I love it.

title: BenRiach Tawny Port Wood Finish 15 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: A more austere and citrusy bouquet than the previous two BenRiachs, with latent smells of oak, vanilla, nutmeg and old leather. Entry is satiny, plummy sweet, and ripe; the midpalate is deep-running, concentrated, chocolaty and honeyed. Ends masterfully in a velvet rush of sweet oakiness, cocoa and cake frosting.

title: Chauffe-Coeur VSOP Calvados
description: The nosing passes find buttery scents on top of baked apple and wood aromas with additional nuances of nutmeg, apple peel, flowers and earth. Entry taste is austere at first, then it explodes in assertive waves of apple pastry, mineral and oaky vanilla; the midpalate adds a delicious layer of honey and light toffee. Finish is elegant, dry to off-dry and wonderfully toffee-like.

title: Bruichladdich Infinity Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: The first nosing passes find surprising floral notes; following aeration, scents of kippers, brine, seaweed and asphalt emerge. Entry flavors include spirit, bacon, pork roast and smoke; the midpalate is concentrated and spirity, with tastes of almond, dry malt, black pepper and cocoa. Ends vibrantly oaky, with clear evidence of vanilla cream, chocolate and Sherry.

title: BenRiach Dark Rum Wood Finish 15 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The delightful, understated bouquet smells of marshmallow, white raisins, chalk, sawdust and gently ripe, delicately fruity, earthy scents. Entry is malty-sweet and medium-textured; the taste profile turns more intensely fruity at midpalate, offering white peach, white chocolate, wet earth and pastry dough. Ends ripe, creamy and lithe.

title: Tres Rios Reposado 100% Puro de Agave Tequila NOM 1482 CRT
description: The nosing passes find scents of pickle and olive brine, burnt match, gunpowder, used ashtray and over-steamed asparagus. Entry is semisweet, tobacco-like, slightly honeyed and caramel-like; at midpalate the oak presence is clearly evident as the flavor softens into a plumpish taste that features notes of toffee, nougat and peanut butter. Ends up nicely briny and medium-sweet.

title: Bruichladdich Turnberry Links 14 Year Old Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: Upfront there are notes of pineapple, papaya and mango, but then the bouquet goes flat in the second stage of nosing. Entry is subdued, mildly nutty, grainy and malty, but without a clear direction; the taste profile at midpalate picks up some steam as flavors of vanilla, maple and dry breakfast cereal are added. Concludes light, lithe and nuanced.

title: Jacques Cardin VSOP Cognac
description: Appealing scents of white raisins, baked pineapple, new leather, marshmallow, orange peel and orange marmalade. Entry is tart and bittersweet, with well-balanced tastes of citrus, sweet oak and nougat; the midpalate is firm, nicely acidic and woody but lacks depth and layering. Concludes off-dry and savory.

title: Knappogue Castle 1995 Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: The bouquet aromas include barley malt, asparagus, hollandaise, dry breakfast cereal, white peppercorns, salt, phenols and mild esters. Entry is soft, citrusy, moderately baked and toasty; an almond nougat taste enters at midpalate and nicely offsets the dry maltiness and vegetal flavors. Shows solid presence and a hint of heathery floral character in the finish.

title: Tres Rios Añejo 100% Puro de Agave Tequila NOM 1482 CRT
description: The bouquet offers scents of burning rubber, pickle brine, burnt matches and gunpowder. Entry is toasty and road tar-like; by midpalate the taste profile offers incongruous but doable flavors of vanilla, oak, honey, gunpowder, dill, green olive and metal. Weird but oddly attractive.

title: Jacques Cardin Apple Flavored Cognac
description: The aroma leans more toward dried apple peel than fresh apple, making for slightly austere aromatics. Entry tastes include apple butter, apple sauce, and spice; the midpalate features sweet, ripe apple with touches of oak, almond butter and paraffin. Ends well, as the apple peel flavor gracefully accents the cinnamon-nutmeg spiciness.

title: Michael Collins Blended Irish Whiskey
description: The interesting bouquet offers pleasantly grassy, waxy and vegetal notes with the aroma becoming more expressive and focused on the grain component following aeration. Palate entry is a touch smoky and biscuity sweet; the flavor profile turns intensely grainy and almost like sweet corn at midpalate. Finishes composed, doughy and slightly honeyed.

title: Jacques Cardin Jasmine Flavored Cognac
description: The perfumed scent of jasmine dominates the bouquet. Entry is off-dry, floral, and leafy; at midpalate the jasmine becomes all that you taste, overwhelming the Cognac base. Finishes more liqueur-like than brandy-like in its flowery, grapy sweetness. Wasn't as intriguing as I'd hoped.

title: Four Roses Small Batch Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: The nosing passes find luscious notes of dark chocolate, toffee and hemp with fruity elements added in the latter sniffing stages. The palate entry tastes are biscuity and vanilla bean- and toffee-like; at midpalate the flavors turn resiny and rancio-like, citrusy, and caramel corn concentrated. Finishes with a seductive maple-like flavor. A fabulous small batch Bourbon.

title: Partida Elegante Extra Añejo 100% de Agave Tequila NOM 1454 CRT
description: Smells of mint, light toffee, summer vegetation and gum with subtle scents of cookie batter, tapioca, brown rice and a touch of honey. At midpalate the taste turns peppery, honeyed, oaky, slightly toasty and spicy. Finishes elegantly, moderately sweet and integrated.

title: Chauffe-Coeur Hors d'Age Armagnac
description: The bouquet features mature, cigar wrapper scents, prunes, burning leaves and tar. The entry is rich and nutty; at midpalate vanillin leaps to the forefront, then is eclipsed by dark chocolate, then that gets overshadowed by pipe tobacco and honey; evidence of cheese-like rancio at the finish.

title: Four Roses Single Barrel Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey Warehouse #CS Barrel #48-SP
description: The beautifully balanced bouquet features leathery, mildly sweet breakfast cereal and honeyed grainy scents. The entry is equally splendid with smoldering flavors of light caramel, nougat or almond paste, and oaky vanillin; the midpalate features tastes of toasted cereal, toasted rye bread, popcorn, and fresh honey. Aftertaste is of chocolate covered walnuts and that ever-present honey.

title: Trago Reposado 100% de Agave Tequila NOM 1474 CRT
description: The bouquet offers fruity, toasty and leathery scents with nuances of chalk, pickle brine, dill and buttercream. Entry is moderately sweet and keenly toasty; the midpalate is creamy, concentrated, yet still peppery, earthy and fruity. Ends on notes of oak, vanilla, honey, orange peel and jalapeño.

title: Trago Añejo 100% de Agave Tequila NOM 1474 CRT
description: Nosing finds green pepper-like spiciness and hints of leather, malted milk, rubber pencil eraser, textile-fiber and delicate honey. Entry is smooth with semisweet tastes of honey, orange peel, dry soil and vanilla; the midpalate is sweeter, saline and citrusy. Finishes sweet, creamy and spicy.

title: Trago Silver 100% de Agave Tequila NOM 1474 CRT
description: The bouquet features peppery notes and scents of minerals and agave fiber. The entry is herbal, vegetal and off-dry; at midpalate the flavor profile turns sweeter, more peppery and spicy. Concludes earthy and gritty, peppery and piquant.

title: Borsci San Marzano Elisir Italian Liqueur
description: The nosing passes find scents of rubber inner tube, burning paper, window cleaner, vinegar, asphalt and moss. Entry is delectably bittersweet, coffee bean-like, tar-like, even a touch cocoa-like; the moderately sweet midpalate stage highlights cigar tobacco, cigar wrapper, prunes, figs and black raisins. Finishes pleasantly bittersweet, pruny/fruity and plump.

title: Chauffe-Coeur VSOP Armagnac
description: The bouquet features aromas that include paraffin, flax, charred oak, buttered almond, caramelized onion and buttered popcorn. Entry is honeyed, rich, assertive and luscious; tastes of brown butter, treacle, nougat, marzipan and baked pineapple. Finishes clean, honeyed, oaky, slightly resiny and burnt.

title: Leblon Cachaça
description: Inside the tall, distinctive lime-green bottle, look for a faintly yellow-tinged liquid with pungent, ripe tropical fruit aromas. Though it's a little intense straight up, with brown sugar sweetness fading into a long fruity finish, it stands up well in a long drink with soda, like a mojito.

title: Novo Fogo Organic Silver Cachaça
description: The heavily fruity aroma is deceptive. Instead, this unaged, certified organic cachaça is light, tingly and spicy, with cinnamon, ginger and clove notes. Try adding this spirit to a fruity cocktail.

title: Pisco Portón Mosto Verde Pisco
description: Earthy, resiny scent with a hint of fruit in the background. At first, the flavor is a little raw, but given some time to aerate, it mellows to an earthy, tropical fruit sweetness. Soft feel. A fine addition to a Pisco Punch.

title: Tacama Pisco Acholado
description: The sugary scent is reminiscent of grape soda, but the flavor is bold and grappa-like, with sweet notes up front and a pleasingly astringent finish.

title: Don Cesar Pisco Puro
description: A mild, light, dry pisco, and a good candidate for pisco sours. Vanilla sugar and herbaceous notes in the aroma. At first, the flavor is sweet and light, but it also has some peppery notes and a clean finish.

title: Cachaça 21
description: Clear. Sweet scent, with a slight vegetal twang. Sweet flavor, zesty, lightly smoky finish, well balanced with just the right amount of alcohol bite.

title: Campo de Encanto Acholado
description: The label has a fabulous turn-of-the-century feel. The spirit clocks in at 85 proof, which is immediately apparent on the nose and the tongue. Given some aeration and time, fruity/floral aromas and an elegant floral finish emerge from beneath the booziness.

title: Pisco Capel Alto del Carmen
description: An unusual golden pisco, made from 100% Muscat grapes and aged six to eight months in oak casks. The result is a deep butterscotch scent and sweet flavors reminiscent of bananas drizzled with maple syrup.

title: Macchu Pisco
description: A zesty pisco with an unusual Tequila-like character, from the vegetal, citrusy scent to the sweet, peppery punch on the palate. Light-bodied.

title: Ypioca Cachaça Crystal
description: Judging by the other expressions from this estate-produced brand, it improves the longer it's aged. In this case, the spirit is aged for one year, yielding a barely perceptible straw color and an earthy, slightly vegetal, slightly sweet scent. The flavor leads with a sweet sugar cane note, but it also has a brisk smokiness, like mescal, on the finish.

title: Don Cesar Pisco Especial
description: Grassy, sweet bell pepper scent, with a mild vanilla note. This pisco has a sweet, round flavor with a licorice finish, and a more pronounced alcohol bite compared to the Pisco Puro.

title: Vinas de Oro Mosto Verde Italia
description: This pisco is for those who love a floral profile. The scent is a virtual bouquet of candied violets, with hints of fruit and spice. The flavor is warm and fruity, but has a lingering floral finish that reads a bit soapy.

title: Boca Loca Cachaça
description: Warm scent of vanilla sugar and light fruit. Of all the cachaças tasted, this one has the sweetest, most pronounced vanilla flavor, which lingers on and on. Save this one for cocktails with a sweeter profile, such as a creamy Pina Colada variation.

title: Piscologia
description: For those who enjoy floral piscos. The aroma features violet, rosewater and banana notes. Inside the lovely art nouveau bottle, the spirit is sweet and floral to the point of soapy, straight through to the lingering finish.

title: Tequila Don Julio 1942
description: A stunning limited-edition añejo. The golden color and caramel scent hint at what's to come: sweet agave flavor, a lingering whisper of smoke and mellow notes of tropical fruit, Sauternes and butterscotch.

title: Riazul Premium Tequila Añejo
description: This Tequila is aged for two years in oak barrels previously used for Brandy/Cognac production. The aging shows in the bewitching scent of toffee and sarsaparilla, and deep flavors of caramel, amaretto, Tootsie Rolls, honey and espresso. Weird and special.

title: Antiguo de Herradura Reposado
description: The expressions from this brand were very good and value priced across the board, but the reposado was especially memorable. Pale straw color, pleasant mix of vanilla, floral and faint pear fragrances. The flavor is sweet, with a lightly smoky finish with some vanilla tones, reminiscent of lighter peated whiskey. Medium body, smooth feel.

title: Peligroso Tequila Silver
description: Delicious and dessert-like, with flavors ordinarily expected from an aged Tequila, not a blanco. Light floral and vanilla scent, sweet vanilla flavor with a bare whisper of smoke on the finish, and a creamy mouthfeel.

title: Tequila Don Julio Añejo
description: Aged a mere 18 months, this Tequila is well-balanced and sippable, with honey sweetness and a long butterscotch finish.

title: Cabo Wabo Tequila Reposado
description: Yes, this is the brand founded by rock star Sammy Hagar, former front man for Van Halen. Stop rolling your eyes: This is a robust, addictive Tequila, especially recommended for those who love peaty Scotches. The spirit has a sweet scent of ripe oranges and vanilla, powerful butterscotch and honey flavors and a raucous smoky finish.

title: Cabo Wabo Tequila Añejo
description: You can thank former Van Halen frontman Sammy Hagar for this great example of a classic añejo Tequila:  fruity, floral aroma, soft feel, and a nice agave-honey flavor that finishes with a slight peppery prickle.

title: Herradura Reposado
description: This straw-hued Tequila is highly aromatic, with floral and butterscotch notes. At first, it's relatively dry and smoky, but winds down into a long, juicy, caramel-tinged finish. Mouthwatering.

title: Familia Camarena Reposado Tequila
description: This is a full-bodied, lush Tequila with honey sweetness and a big butterscotch finish beneath a fine veil of smoke. Good value.

title: El Jimador Tequila Blanco
description: Among the best of the blancos. The scent is almost like an infused vodka, zingy, bright, citrusy and sweet. Sweet flavor, with hits of lemon and pepper on the finish. Smooth, soft feel, and definitely Margarita material.

title: Añejo Hornitos
description: This nut-brown aged Tequila almost smells like Cognac, featuring rich raisin, fig, honey and toffee aromas. Rich, deep caramel flavor with a peppery finish. Mouthwatering.

title: Peligroso Tequila Añejo
description: Save this aged, dessert-like Tequila to savor after dinner. This velvety, burnished gold spirit has a vanilla and pina-colada aroma and vanilla custard flavor. Pair it with a creamy dessert like dulce de leche or flan.

title: Charbay Tequila Blanco
description: Neutral, slightly vegetal scent, a little like sun-dried tomatoes. The flavor is sweet and smooth, with light citrus notes and a faintly spicy, warming finish. A great candidate for Tequila-based Bloody Marys.

title: Corzo Tequila Silver
description: A clean, lean Tequila with an herbal, grassy scent and soft feel. The spirit has a neutral flavor with a mineral note and finishes with agave sweetness.

title: El Jimador Tequila Reposado
description: Pale yellow tint, and a mild, lightly fruity scent.. Smooth, silky feel.  This Tequila finishes moderately smoky, with a lingering hint of caramel. Very nice. Good value for a reposado.

title: Antiguo de Herradura Añejo
description: This añejo features a peachy, lightly smoky scent, and a sweet flavor with a mouthwatering deep toffee finish and faint smoky note. Good value, particularly for an añejo.

title: Powers Gold Label Special Reserve, Aged 12 Years
description: Give this one a little time in the glass, and the boozy nose dissipates, leaving a pleasant hint of butterscotch. Intense gold flavor and velvety feel, but not a lot of flavor, just a fast vanilla fade on the finish.

title: Clontarf 1014 Irish Whiskey
description: This honey-colored whiskey needs a lot of time in the glass to aerate, allowing a resin-y aroma to dissipate, leaving a ginger ale-like sweet scent. On the palate, astringency nearly masks the red fruit and caramel flavors.

title: Grand Marnier Cuvée du Cent Cinquantenaire
description: This version of Grand Marnier uses rare Cognac reserves aged up to 50 years. Here, the flavor and scent are closer to Cognac than orange liqueur. Look for a rich topaz color, with heady dried fruit notes as well as a clear hit of juicy orange fruit. It's mellow, mouthwatering, and it seems a shame to mix it, though it's been spotted at some restaurants in “ultrapremium margaritas.”

title: Grand Marnier Cuvée du Centenaire
description: This premium version of the standard Grand Marnier uses Cognacs aged up to 25 years. The result is a deep amber color and earthier scent, showing aromatic orange peel and honeysuckle notes. The flavor is richer than the regular Cordon Rouge bottling, but still honeyed, showing bright orange notes on the finish. Full-bodied and sippable.

title: Mandarine Napoléon Grande Cuvée Liqueur
description: Especially recommended for sweetening cocktails made with dark spirits, this liqueur is made with Cognac, Mandarin oranges and spices. Look for a vibrant orange color, citrus and tropical fruit aromas and a sweet, mouthfilling flavor that mixes bold orange with caramel.

title: Bauchant Orange Liqueur
description: Floral and rich, this Cognac-based amber liqueur has an orange peel and honeysuckle scent and a vanilla-honey flavor spiked with cinnamon plus a rich Sauternes-like undertone. Although this lovely liqueur would blend well into a broad spectrum of cocktails, why stop at drinks? The spirits maker says the product also is endorsed by a growing number of pastry chefs for flavoring cakes, crêpes and more.

title: Grand Marnier Cordon Rouge
description: Grand Marnier—or “GrandMa,” as some cocktail geeks gleefully shorthand it—remains one of the classics. Although it's Cognac-based, it's a versatile match for other spirits, too. The liqueur is extremely aromatic, with lots of sweet and bitter orange notes exploding out of the glass. Look for a warm, honeyed flavor and a nice burst of orange peel and spicy cinnamon and ginger on the long finish.

title: Pierre Ferrand Dry Curaçao
description: New to the U.S. market in 2012, this “dry” Curaçao is intriguing and should work well as a sophisticated sweetener alongside bitter-edged spirits and darker, biting spirits like rye whiskey. While not precisely dry, this golden liqueur has its vanilla sweetness tempered by a wash of bitter orange. The scent is rich and agave-like, with a touch of mezcal-like funkiness.

title: Gran Gala Liqueur
description: Made with Italian VSOP brandy, this complex and rather sippable spirit is highly aromatic, with lots of juicy orange and a whiff of vanilla. A perceptible touch of alcohol balances out the mix of orange flesh, peel and lingering caramel tones.

title: Cointreau
description: A classic, can't-go-wrong workhorse spirit that provides a versatile option for a wide range of cocktails. This clear liqueur has a bright, true orange scent with a hint of bitter orange on the aroma. The flavor mix is of candied orange slices and lightly bitter orange peel. The finish is warm and clean. Good balance.

title: Royal Combier Grande Liqueur
description: Though this vibrant yellow-orange spirit comes on strong at first, with its mix of bitter and sweet flavors, it has an appealingly delicate side too, finishing with gentle floral and baking spice notes.

title: di Amore Quattro Orange Liqueur
description: This clear, perfumy spirit has a bright aroma of fresh orange and lemon peels. Though very sweet on the palate, with most of the orange on the juicy Creamsicle finish, a bit of alcohol braces it up. Thick, luxurious feel.

title: Kappa Pisco
description: A newcomer to the Pisco scene, created by a scion of the Lapostolle Wines family. The spirit is distinctly sweet and floral, but it's the sexy midnight-blue bottle with white stars and clear panels that truly attracts attention.

title: Agavero Orange Liqueur
description: Made with silver Tequila and agave nectar, this liqueur is a natural match for margaritas. Juicy sweet-orange scent. At first powerfully sweet, the flavor finishes refreshingly clean, with a tingle of pepperiness.

title: Angel d'Or
description: From the sun-soaked isle of Majorca comes this pale-straw liqueur with a light orange blossom fragrance. On the palate, it doesn't read as orange. Instead, this sweet, syrupy spirit warms with flavors of apple, pear and a touch of almond.

title: The Dalmore Cigar Malt Reserve
description: Honey-amber color and a big butterscotch aroma. Intriguingly dry and earthy, with leather, tobacco, dark chocolate and clove flavors, which accelerate with repeated sips and linger on. Add ice if you must, but avoid watering down this delicious after-dinner treat, which would be even better accompanied by a well-selected dark chocolate or two.

title: Douglas of Drumlanrig: Laphroaig 17 years old
description: For those who prefer a peaty Scotch style, this is an excellent, food-friendly example that won't blow out your palate with smoke. This straw-colored spirit has a pronounced but delicate brininess, which builds gently with repeated sips. Pair this light-bodied spirit with oysters or other shellfish.

title: Glenmorangie Signet
description: This dark and luscious spirit is made using “high roast” malted barley to coax out chocolate and espresso flavors, then married with other “rare and ancient” whiskies. The end result is a burnished copper glow, intense toffee aroma, resonating espresso, nut and toasty oak flavors and a lingering cinnamon-clove finish. Each sip warms all the way down. A soft, warm spirit in glossy, gift-worthy packaging.

title: Glenmorangie The Nectar D'Or 12 Years Old
description: This golden spirit is often flagged by bartenders and sommeliers as a favorite; it's easy to see why. A decade in Bourbon casks, plus an extra two years in Sauternes barriques yields a fresh honeysuckle and vanilla perfume and a super-smooth spirit with creamy honey and nut flavors, with hints of dark chocolate and cinnamon. Very few spirits have such elegance and silky finesse. Good value, too.

title: The Balvenie 17 Year Old Peated Cask
description: The tagline on the label reads “sweet spice and smoke,” and it's an apt description. This bright amber spirit with golden highlights has a fruity, fresh scent and a light waft of smoke on the palate, finishing with orange peel and caramel. Add water to for a smoother, creamier texture. Just enough smoke and alcohol bite.

title: Glenfiddich Snow Phoenix
description: A light, meadow-like scent opens with grassy, floral and green apple notes. It has a soft feel, with a honeyed sweetness and floral-vanilla finish braced up by zingy ginger. Adding ice water reveals a whisper of smoke. This limited-edition bottle from 2010 would be a knockout with aged cheeses.

title: Glen Garioch 1994 Small Batch Release
description: This 17-year-old Highland Scotch is well structured and remarkably aromatic. The incredibly rich, buttery vanilla scent all but leaps out of the glass, tempered by fresh apple and floral notes. The flavor is bracing and briny, light-bodied and with just a hint of caramel. Pale straw color.

title: The Dalmore King Alexander
description: Wine lovers will want to cap a special-occasion meal with this rich and interesting Highland specimen. Created from Scotches matured in a variety of wine casks, including Madeira, Port, Marsala, even Cabernet Sauvignon, look for a copper-penny color, heady aromas of red berries, dried fruit and marzipan, and a toffee-sweet flavor with a spicy finish. Striking, gift-worthy bottle with a stag's head on the front.

title: Paul Masson VSOP Grande Amber Brandy
description: It's hard to say which is more surprising, the fact that this blend of American brandy and French Cognac yields such a Cognac taste-alike, or the remarkably gentle pricing. It has a copper penny color, boozy hazelnut fragrance and a dry flavor with a powerful finish of allspice, espresso and cigar tobacco. Good value.

title: Prophecy
description: A smooth and soft option for peat lovers. This golden spirit has a lightly smoky aroma, with rounded caramel flavor and just the right amount of lingering smoke. Limited edition release.

title: The Glenlivet 18 Year Old
description: Vibrant orange-amber color and a warm, citrusy scent. Expect lots of honey and caramel from the get-go, winding into an interestingly dry and lingering finish entwining leather, cocoa, coconut and ginger. Good value.

title: Highland Park Aged 12 Years
description: Elegant, light and pretty. This amber spirit has a light, briny vanilla scent and a silky feel. A veil of smoke rises through the Scotch (but fades out fast), leaving behind a sweet nutty, vanilla finish.

title: Glenmorangie The LaSanta 12 Years Old
description: Aged in Bourbon casks for 10 years, then “extra matured” for two years in Oloroso Sherry casks. The result is luxe and rich, a fine after-dinner sipper. Allow a little time for the aroma to emerge, and a splash of water for maximum flavor. The reward is a thick caramel aroma and flavor, with mouthwatering spicy notes of clove, cassia bark and a hint of orange peel.

title: Douglas of Drumlanrig: Glen Grant Aged 25 Years
description: This golden spirit is complex and lush, with a rich caramel-apple scent. On the palate, this 25-year-old Scotch is soft and viscous, as a flash of sweet honey turns to mouthwatering caramel and coconut, with a light dusting of cinnamon and clove. Well balanced despite the relatively high proof.

title: Glen Garioch Founder's Reserve
description: This vibrant gold Highland Scotch has a caramel scent and a complex flavor, fading from sweet and lightly smoky to dry, with oak, caramel and leather notes sparked with a clove and cinnamon tingle.

title: Chartreuse Green Liqueur Fabriquée par Les Pères Chartreux
description: The bouquet is vibrant, prickly, and displays cedar, coriander, cardamom, aniseed, jasmine, rosemary, sage, basil and other botanicals. The palate is lushly textured, herbal sweet, peppery, and minerally. Sublime aftertaste.

title: Vincent Van Gogh Mojito Mint Vodka Mint Flavored Vodka
description: The spry mint aroma makes for fresh, invigorating, and stunningly vivid nosing. The palate entry is crisp, intensely minty, and sweet at the back end; the midpalate is semisweet peppermint with a hint of balancing citrus/lime. Ends up moderately fiery in the throat yet smooth and generous. So well-crafted that it squeaks with tightness.

title: Chartreuse Yellow V.E.P. Liqueur Fabriquée par Les Pères Chartreux
description: Extra-aged Yellow Chartreuse. Prickly scents of bramble, fennel, and licorice are followed by a supple sweetness. Palate is floral, with sage, saffron, elderberry, anise, licorice, flowers, and thyme. Finishes elegantly, softer and divinely satisfying.

title: Chartreuse Yellow Liqueur Fabriquée par Les Pères Chartreux
description: The nosing passes pick up smells of aniseed, cardamom, licorice, hay, white pepper, floral/viny scents along with coriander, sage, and thyme. The palate entry is sweet, floral, peppery, and viny; the midpalate features fennel, rosemary, allspice, and bark. Ends up herbal sweet.

title: X-Rated Vodka
description: The first nosing passes find minerally scents of limestone, granite, and soil; aeration stimulates grainy odors of dried grain kernels and dry breakfast cereal. The palate entry is off-dry, concentrated, and oily; the midpalate features an oily/grainy richness with off-dry tastes of wheat crackers. Ends on an oily note with a flash of spirity heat.

title: Bailey's Original Irish Cream Liqueur
description: The nose is nutty; aeration brings out some spice. The palate entry continues with the nut-fest; at midpalate the flavors of cocoa bean, café au lait, Brazil nut and Christmas spices take flight. Concludes chocolaty.

title: Le Réviseur VSOP Fine Petite Champagne Single Estate Cognac
description: Sniffs find a young, piquant and sophisticated aroma with caramel and toffee emerging. The palate tastes of honey and chocolate; the midpalate finds almond butter, brown sugar, and cocoa. Concludes satiny and sweet.

title: Vaghi XO Bas Armagnac
description: The bouquet is woody and nicely paraffin-like with distant accents of pine nuts and cedar. The palate entry is engagingly sweet, with a pleasant vanilla extract taste. Finishes with tastes of chocolatecovered cherries, fresh honey and vanilla cake frosting. Good value.

title: Le Réviseur VS Fine Petite Champagne Single Estate Cognac
description: The bouquet offers succulent aromas of fruit tart, sugar cookie batter, newly tanned leather, marzipan, cinnamon, and honeysuckle. The palate entry is softly sweet: yellow fruit with a vanilla/spicy oak quality. Finishes measuredly sweet. A sound no-nonsense Cognac.

title: Vaghi 1986 Bas Armagnac
description: The underwhelming aroma features vibrant spirit and a fibery/ropy odor. The palate  improves, with well-defined tastes of baked fruit, light toffee, resin, vanilla extract, and honey. Ends up buttery, satiny, composed and sweet.

title: Alizé Red Passion Cognac with Passionfruit, Cranberry and Peach juices
description: The aroma bursts with fresh, ripe but tart, tropical fruit perfume. The palate is lush, fruity and berry ripe with a hint of spirit. Ends well, fruity, and correctly acidic.

title: Château de Briat 1986 Baron de Pichon-Longueville Bas Armagnac
description: Smells of chocolate covered almonds, figs, pine needles; oak, wood resins and beeswax. The palate entry tastes sweet and caramel-like; the wonderful midpalate flavors are slightly more honeyed. Closes with sturdy grace, assertive tastes of toffee, honey, creamy butter, and even a dash of rancio.

title: L'Amour des Trois Oranges Oranges Macerated in Sugar with Chateau de Briat Bas Armagnac
description: The opening aroma of ripe oranges is seductively sweet; aeration allows the scents of orange peel oil to come to life. The palate entry is lovely, round, and delightfully spirity; the midpalate offers notes of caramel, Armagnac, and honey that mix well with the heightened orange peel tartness. Finishes gracefully tart, oily and clean.

title: Smirnoff Twist of Lime Vodka Recipe No. 21
description: The bouquet is fresh and tartly citrusy. The palate entry is clean, keenly astringent and tightly focused on lime peel; at midpalate the peel gives way to fresh-squeezed lime juice. Finishes a tad flat and raw but that's a minor misstep.

title: Gélas 20-Year-Old Bas Armagnac
description: The lovely bouquet features scents of cheesecloth, wool, leather, grapefruit, oak and unsalted butter. The palate entry is lusciously maple-like and earthy; the midpalate stage showcases the oak influence in the forms of cocoa, honey and oaky vanilla. Ends up very sweet, thickly textured, toffee-like, and robust.

title: Gélas 50-Year-Old Bas Armagnac
description: The nosing passes find dry oaky aromas with subdued notes of marshmallow, dried orange, dried red fruit, minerals and slate. The palate entry is deliciously sweet and oaky; the midpalate is mature, oaky, rum-, mocha- and vinyl-like. Finishes intensely sweet and brown sugary.

title: Château de Pellehaut Reserve Tenereze Armagnac
description: Aromas are of nuts, unsalted butter, distant scents of palm oil, very old oak and spice. The palate entry is semisweet, intensely sugar cane-like, and woody enough to be slightly bitter; by the midpalate the flavor profile is candy sweet with a background hint of honey. The finish is warm, nutty, fatty and vanilla extract-like.

title: del Capo Liqueur of Calabrian Herbs
description: The nosing passes discover tangy scents of orange zest, orange blossom, mint and aromas of pine, cedar, jasmine and flowers. The palate entry is citrusy, bittersweet and medium-bodied; at midpalate the taste profile turns increasingly root-like and earthy making this liqueur distantly similar to American root beer. Concludes bittersweet.

title: High Spirits American Vodka
description: A different style of vodka bouquet that includes faint scents of peach and cantaloupe, sand, tilled soil and green vegetation. The palate entry offers immediate bittersweet tastes of licorice, molasses and vanilla bean; the midpalate stage highlights the beaniness and adds a subtle trace of nutmeg. Finishes delicious, medium-weighted, a tad fiery and vibrant.

title: Chantal Comte Distillerie Depaz L'Arbre du Voyageur V.S.O.P. Rhum Vieux Agricole
description: Nosing reveals understated scents of sugar cane, carnations and cotton candy with more pronounced aromas of gun metal, honey and spice. The palate entry is spicy and mildly sweet; the midpalate taste features core flavors of sap/maple, brown sugar, and nutmeg. The aftertaste is long, moderately sweet and honeyed.

title: High Spirits Prickly Pear Flavored Vodka
description: Has a pleasant earthy, vegetal bouquet. At palate entry the prickly pear flavor loses much of its fruitiness and leans heavily on the natural acids; the midpalate is astringent and tart. The aftertaste is short, refreshing and understated. Would make an interesting mixer with the right fruit element to bolster the acidity.

title: Krzeska Herb Flavored Small Batch Vodka
description: The nosing passes encounter scents of parsley, sage, rosemary, green chili pepper, pine needles and tarragon. The palate entry offers intense tastes of tarragon, scallion, and rosemary; the midpalate adds tastes of palm oil, butter mixed with sage, and steamed green vegetables. Concludes on a concentrated herbal/vegetal note. Good, but for a niche audience.

title: Palm Key Lime Vodka
description: The timid bouquet is only vaguely lime-like. The entry displays moderate authentic key lime features; the midpalate improves the taste profile as the tart, properly astringent, and distinct taste of key lime comes through. Ends up tangy, lime-y and oily.

title: Origine Caribbean Amber Estate Reserve Rum
description: The nose is largely closed down emitting only timid scents of mild spice. The palate entry is smooth, clean and nicely toasted and medium-sweet; the midpalate is pleasingly oily in texture and nougaty in flavor. Concludes bittersweet, intensely oaky and molasses-like.

title: Gélas 10-Year-Old Bas Armagnac
description: The bouquet springs to life following aeration and offers lush smells of light caramel, English toffee, baked apple pastry, pineapple and oak. The palate entry finds oaky sweet tastes of nougat, milk chocolate and chocolate-covered raisins; the midpalate stage is candied with suddenly bittersweet flavors of treacle and marzipan. Finishes candied, nougaty and vigorous.

title: Palm Vodka
description: The aroma initially exhibits a potato-like sweetness as well as a grainy, dry cereal-like leaning but then turns lead-like, stonily dry, and featureless. The palate entry is clean, a touch biscuity and semisweet; the midpalate is minerally, sweetly potato-like with a background note of wheat cracker. Concludes well, lean, and delectable.

title: Chateau de Maniban Mauléon d'Armagnac Bas Armagnac
description: The one dimensional bouquet offers dry to bitter aromas with some orange peel scents. The palate entry is fruity and borders on astringent; the midpalate improves as a mild dose of oak pairs up nicely with the citrus fruitiness. Finishes with flavors of baked apple and singed orange rind.

title: Pirate's Choice Key Lime Rum
description: The bouquet offers tart scents of key lime. The palate entry is startlingly sweet and cloying; in the midpalate the taste is still unbalanced but shows more of the key lime flavoring. Ends up citric acid-like, mildly key lime-like, and sweet.

title: Braddah Kimo's Mo'Bettah Gold Rum
description: A most unpleasant bouquet of burning tires, chili peppers and cat pee. At palate entry the taste of sugar cane/brown sugar comes to the rescue; the midpalate stage has a smoky/ tobacco-like leaning. The finish is gently sweet and just a bit honeyed.

title: Universum Vodka
description: The nosing passes detect off-dry to semisweet notes of parchment, grain mash and rye bread toast. The entry offers only partially defined flavors of refined sugar, spice and honey; the midpalate profile continues the semisweet grainy route. The finish comes off as a bit jaded.

title: Modern Spirits Grapefruit Honey Flavored Vodka
description: The bouquet is deftly crafted and true to its sources beginning tart and juicy and then turning milder and less acidic. The palate entry features the ripeness of the grapefruit and then evolves at midpalate into a delicately sweet/sour taste in which both flavor infusions complement each other. Finishes with more of the grapefruit influence showing.

title: Château du Busca Hors d'Age Cigare Tenarèze Armagnac
description: An expressive and integrated aroma with lovely fragrances of baked pear, mince meat, pine sap and pipe tobacco. The palate entry tastes of dried red fruits, maple sugar, and pine; the succulent midpalate is laced with tastes of maple, pear in brandy, sap, oaky vanilla and pipe smoke. The aftertaste is as gratifying as the bouquet and midpalate. Best Buy.

title: Château du Busca Hors d'Age 15 Years Old Tenarèze Armagnac
description: The wonderfully zesty aroma includes notes of margarine, lanolin, dark caramel, buttery oak and holiday fruitcake. The palate entry is rich, creamy and honeyed; at midpalate the woody/creamy flavor suggests rancio beginnings. Finishes semisweet, cocoa- and maple sugar-like, and intensely oaky. Best Buy.

title: Château du Busca 1985 Tenarèze Armagnac
description: The complex bouquet consists of smells that include candied, smoky scents and toasty and vanilla-laden scents which accent the wood/oak core aroma. The spectacular palate entry is sophisticated, semisweet, cola- and toffee-like; the midpalate offers integrated tastes of nougat, roasted chestnuts, dark chocolate, orange rind and treacle. Finishes with a deft touch of budding rancio. An instant classic.

title: Modern Spirits Chocolate Orange Flavored Vodka
description: Initially, the intensity of the dark chocolate/cocoa perfume almost negates any trace of orange but aeration time allows the orange flavor to peek out. At palate entry the chocolate element rounds off into a more gently sweet influence; at midpalate the orange makes a stronger statement, balancing the keen sweetness/beaniness of the dark chocolate.

title: Château du Busca 1975 Tenarèze Armagnac
description: Dried cherry and baked banana scents dominate the initial nosings; following aeration, a a woody, slightly spicy scent of oak is added. The palate entry is off-dry to bittersweet, tannic and focused on the dried fruit element; the midpalate offers slightly restrained flavors of spice, honey wheat toast, raisins and prunes. Finishes smoothly.

title: Modern Spirits Black Truffle Flavored Vodka
description: The opening whiffs pick up mushroomy/earthy scents of truffle. The palate entry is remarkably truffle-like and as a result is keenly earthy and herbal; at midpalate the taste profile delivers the goods in a mildly bitter and mineral-like manner. Truffle aficionados should definitely check out this one-of-a-kind vodka.

title: Modern Spirits Celery Peppercorn Flavored Vodka
description: The bouquet accurately reflects the celery and peppercorn. The palate entry is surprisingly delicate in its vegetal-spice display; at midpalate the pepper distinguishes itself while the celery taste serves as more a support player. Finishes in an oily, peppery, nicely spicy manner. Try this in a Bloody Mary.

title: Château du Busca XO Nº 1 Tenarèze Armagnac
description: Understated floral scents of jasmine and honeysuckle along with aromas of dried yellow fruit, buttered almonds and orange blossom are discovered in the nose. The palate entry is lusciously oily, semisweet and buttery while the midpalate stage highlights the oak, cocoa, black tea and walnut paste. Finishes gracefully, semisweet, and tightly structured.

title: Modern Spirits Tea Flavored Vodka
description: The bouquet offers luscious scents of mild English Breakfast and vegetal/leafy green teas. The palate entry is elegant and mildly sweet with an underpinning of pleasing tea leaf bitterness; at midpalate the taste profile features more black tea astringency and pungency. Finishes delicately, leafy and a bit spiced.

title: Modern Spirits Candied Ginger Flavored Vodka
description: The aroma is ginger-like in an elegant and understated way. The palate entry is semisweet, properly gingery and zesty; the midpalate is monotonal, to be sure, but it's appealingly spicy, with a dash of spirity warmth as the midpalate evolves into the aftertaste.

title: Bunnahabhain 25-Year-Old Islay Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Scents of walnuts, baked bread, old oak, herbs, dry earth and soft brine. The entry offers tastes of salt water taffy, toffee and tea leaves; the midpalate features flavors of toasted malt, sautéed butter, sultanas and oak. Finishes slightly oily, long and smoky.

title: Cragganmore Distiller's Edition 1992 Double Matured/Port Cask Finished Speyside Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Closed initially, but then notes of red fruit, grapes and oak emerge, with scents of dried red fruit and raisins. The palate entry is smooth, medium-sweet and woody; the midpalate is honeyed and gum- and maple-like. Finishes in a flurry of lychee, caramel and toffee.

title: Dalwhinnie Distiller's Edition 1990 Double Matured/Oloroso Sherry Cask Finished Central Highlands Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Aromas of marshmallow, cotton candy and toffee. The palate entry features a dry, malty and slightly honeyed profile; at midpalate the honey intensifies, making the flavor almost bittersweet but long in the throat. Finishes drier and malty.

title: Glen Ord 30-Year-Old Cask Strength Northern Highlands Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Aromas of oak, palm oil and tea. The entry displays a fiery core, with flavors of sweet grain and crackers; at midpalate the oak reemerges. Mineral water brings out pleasing tastes of honey and caramel. Finishes lean, assertive and grainy.

title: Glenkinchie Distiller's Edition 1991 Double Matured/Amontillado Sherry Cask Finished Lowlands Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Narrow but pleasing aromas with notes of dried yellow fruit and gum. The palate entry is dry and mineral-like, with a dash of woodiness; at midpalate the taste turns more concentrated, malty, oaky and lightly honeyed. Sweeter on the aftertaste.

title: Modern Spirits Pear Lavender Flavored Vodka
description: Dried lavender scents prevail with very faint evidence of pear in the aroma phase. The palate entry is fruity and ripe, more in an indistinct yellow fruit way than obvious pear; the midpalate is medium-weight, mildly oily in texture and even a touch buttery. The aftertaste features the dried lavender.

title: Bunnahabhain 18-Year-Old Islay Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Intensely malty. The palate entry is off-dry, slightly salty and intensely cereal-like; the midpalate stage highlights the medium-sweet grain and oak. Finishes off-dry to medium sweet and grainy-malty.

title: Chartreuse Green
description: Invented by the Carthusian Order of Christian monks in Grenoble, France in the 1760s. Pale green-yellow color. Mesmerizing, multilayered, complex bouquet includes scents of licorice, anise, violets, spearmint and basil. On palate, it's very spirity, with sweet tastes of candied banana, key lime pie and peppermint. Finishes mellow, herbal and minty. A one-of-a-kind legend.

title: Richard Hennessy Cognac
description: A blend of over 100 Cognacs, some of which date back to the early 1800s. The aroma requires time; when it does emerge, it blossoms into a multilayered bouquet laced with tea leaves, red pepper, dried fruit and old oak. Starts sweet and caramel-like at entry; sensational midpalate features rancio, raisins, vanilla extract, dried flowers and honey. Finish is semisweet. Hennessy's pinnacle achievement.

title: Jacopo Poli Sarpa di Grappa
description: “Sarpa” means “pomace.” The piercing ripeness of the opening aroma is more astringent and sap-like than fruity or ripe; it ends up being a rugged, musty, traditional bouquet of grape skins, pulp and seeds. In a startling turn away from the bouquet's direction, the taste is sublimely sweet and fruity at entry; at midpalate the taste features an ambrosial richness rarely found in grappa. Finishes long and sweet.

title: Benedictine D.O.M.
description: Developed in the early 16th century at Fécamp Abbey in France. The delicately herbal bouquet is an unusual combination of earth and flowers; one of the more seductive, unique and piquant liqueur perfumes in existence. In the mouth, the full texture coats the tongue as sweet flavors of honey, citrus peel, rosemary, sage and basil harmonize perfectly. Aftertaste is silky-smooth and extended. Magnificent. Best Buy.

title: Edmond Briottet Crème de Cassis de Dijon
description: Inky purple color. Opening bouquet is ripe, fruity, pulpy and correctly bitter; later sniffings discover intriguing notes of black pepper, cigar box and dried herbs. In the mouth, it's silky, ripe, fruity, concentrated and jammy. Finishes long and satiny. Crème de cassis doesn't come any better. A masterpiece. Best Buy.

title: Edmond Briottet Crème de Cerise
description: Resembles an old Burgundy in its weathered brick color. Bouquet is fruit stone-like, minerally at first, then a mature, ripe scent of black cherry fruit takes command. Very tart initially at palate entry, then turns concentrated, sweet and intensely cherry-like at midpalate. Aftertaste is sweet and ripe. Lovely. Best Buy.

title: Glayva Liqueur
description: Color of an amber amontillado Sherry. Assertive nose brims with clean, mildly sweet aromas of anise, honey, heather, bacon fat and malt whisky. Displays a controlled sweetness on the tongue; midpalate highlights astringent tastes of malt whisky, botanicals and herbs. A high-quality liqueur that deserves a wider audience. Best Buy.

title: Agavero Tequila Liqueur
description: Originally around in the mid-1990s, this liqueur was recently reintroduced. Amontillado Sherry-like harvest-gold hue. Surface aromas ring with agave herbal-vegetal perfume while base scents feature wood resin, carnations, key lime and asparagus. Polite, moderately sweet at palate entry, then the taste turns keenly herbaceous at midpalate. Finishes sweet.

title: Grey Goose Vodka
description: Crystal-clear and pure. Nose is unabashedly smoky in the first nosings; aeration smoothes it out as fetching aromas of mint, harvested grain and grain husk assert themselves. On palate, the entry is intensely grainy, silky and off-dry; the midpalate offers moderate bite plus chewy tastes of cracked wheat and cocoa bean. Aftertaste is dry, cleansing and medium-long.

title: Ketel One Vodka
description: Clear as rainwater. The bouquet doesn't reach up and grab you as much as it seduces you with gentle waves of mild spirit and grainy richness. The palate entry offers mild spiciness and cereal sweetness. Finishes marvelously long, doughy, round, subtly citrusy and moderately sweet. Classy, complex and multilayered.

title: Jacopo Poli Grappa Amorosa di Merlot
description: Nose is inviting, lean and pointed after the pour; aeration brings out a fresh mineral-like back-note that nicely supports the fruit. Zesty palate entry sets the tongue tingling; midpalate goes satiny in texture and off-dry in taste as subtle flavors of pomace and vegetables make their presence known. Delicate aftertaste. Stately and refined.

title: A. Hardy XO Cognac
description: Sunset-orange color. Savory bouquet is ripe and fruity through all sniffings. The stunningly elegant flavors marry ripe pear, roasted almond and apricot scents to cheese-like rancio. Finishes firmly and long. An opulent, plump style.

title: Big Bottom Oregon Gin
description: The aroma teases bright grapefruit peel, otherwise this silky gin is like drinking in a forest, enveloping the palate in pine and juniper, with a lightly sweet white flower and white pepper finish. The alcohol heat is too strong for straight-up sipping, but tempers well in cocktails without relinquishing flavor.

title: Brockman's Premium Gin
description: It would be easy to mistake this gin for a raspberry-flavored vodka. With a distinct raspberry note in the aroma, this gin offers notes of lemon peel and black pepper, rounding into a raspberry note on the clean finish.

title: Greyling Modern Dry Gin
description: This well-balanced gin has a faintly marshmallow-y scent. On the palate, anise is backed up by touches of citrus and juniper, finishing crisp with a flourish of white pepper.

title: St. Augustine New World Gin
description: Made from cane sugar, look for clean, slightly sweet aromatics with a citrusy kick. Grapefruit peel leads on the palate, echoed by anise and coriander, finishing long and fragrant with lavender.

title: Captive Spirits Big Gin
description: Robust and substantial, this flavorful gin combines juniper, citrus, a brush of mint and a mouthwateringly savory note reminiscent of olive brine and black pepper. The finish is spicy but balanced. A top choice for Gibsons or dirty martinis.

title: Sipsmith London Dry Gin
description: Made with 10 internationally sourced botanicals—Seville orange peel, Italian orris root, et al.—this gin rings with plenty of juniper and licorice upfront, followed by lavender and citrus peel. Finishes smooth and mellow.

title: Deepwells Botanical Dry Gin
description: Made from a potato base and infused with a lengthy list of fruits and vegetables (apples, pear, pineapple and watermelon, among others), this gin has a bright, slightly sweet and cucumber-y aroma. On the palate, juniper leads, finishing crisp, light and slightly citrusy, if slightly hot. It's surprising that it's not fruitier considering the botanicals list, but that neutrality makes for a fine martini gin.

title: Crystal Peak Gin
description: This earthy small-batch gin hints at coriander on the aroma and warms the palate with anise and pungent cinnamon, black pepper and coriander on the finish, chased by fleeting sweetness. The base spirit mixes grapes (via North California) and grain (distilled in Colorado).

title: Principe De Los Apostoles Mate Gin
description: This unusual and appealing gin is made with yerba mate tea (“the most Argentinean drink of all,” the producer says) and dials back traditional juniper in favor of sprightly eucalyptus and peppermint. It's a warmer expression of gin, with a supersweet, cocoa-like aroma and flavor and velvety feel on the palate.

title: Barr Hill Reserve Tom Cat
description: Distilled from corn and finished with raw honey, this barrel-aged bottling is billed as a “modern day adaptation of Old Tom Gin,” a sweetened style. It has a burnished rose gold hue and the scent mingles honey and juniper. It's slightly sweet up front, with brisk pininess midpalate before it fades into vanilla and a surprising brush of peach.

title: Russell Henry Dark Gin
description: This small-batch gin was made using antique Cognac stills, then aged for one year. It's golden in the glass, with a mild, minty aroma. On the palate, it's notably silky, light and delicate. A smooth vanilla note leads into spearmint and lemon peel, before drying to cayenne and black pepper tingle on the finish. Only 100 cases made, so snap it up while you can.

title: Greenhook Ginsmiths Old Tom Gin
description: This history-minded bottling was made in collaboration with Brooklyn barmen Damon Boelte and Maxwell Britten. It's made from an 18th-century recipe, pot distilled using “exotic spices inspired by the British Spice Trade,” and finally, aged for 12 months in Bourbon and oloroso Sherry casks. All that adds up to a light gold hue, light sweetness (typical of the Old Tom style) and a pleasing, robust vanilla-mint profile with flecks of rosemary and lemon peel, finishing long and spicy. Sip or mix.

title: Spirit Works Distillery Gin
description: Sweet and slightly fruity on the nose, juniper-forward on the palate. This small-batch gin distilled from organic California wheat feels brisk and bracing, showing a twist of citrus and finishing with very light berry note.

title: Xoriguer Gin de Mahon
description: Look for a zesty, pungent aroma reminiscent of tomato water. The palate takes a different direction, skewing floral with a touch of lavender, with juniper and white pepper emerging on the silky finish. Consider jumping on Spain's gin-tonic trend to showcase this intriguing newcomer.

title: Geranium Gin
description: As the name suggests, the London Dry Style gin has a floral cast, though it's delicate and not at all overpowering. The mild, slightly citrusy aroma leads to a light rosewater sweetness on the palate, spiced up with white and black pepper and lime peel into the brisk exit. Sleek square bottle.

title: Beehive Distilling Jack Rabbit Gin
description: The scent evokes candied lemon peel, while the complex palate shows cucumber, anise and cardamom, plus a lingering rosewater note on the finish. Consider for aviations and other cocktails where a floral touch is desired.

title: Opihr Oriental London Dry Gin
description: Packaged in an exotic-looking, elephant-emblazoned bottle with a red tassel around the neck, this gin explodes with spice box aromas the minute it's poured. Though relatively neutral on the palate at first, the lingering finish whispers with cumin, coriander, black pepper, ginger and clove. If you were thinking of infusing a spirit with spices for a cocktail, use this instead.

title: Seattle Distilling Gin
description: Scented with juniper and an earthy hint of anise, on the palate anise dominates, though it's tempered by pops of black pepper and an elusive sweetness (hazelnuts are among the botanicals used).

title: Uncle Val's Peppered Gin
description: Ideal for those who love chili pepper heat, this pale-straw gin has a mild, candied lemon peel scent but hits the palate with a one-two peppery punch. Reminiscent of mezcal, smoky notes mingle with honey sweetness and pops of menthol and mint, finishing fiery with jalapeño and cayenne heat.

title: Boodles British Gin
description: An old-school London Dry style gin recently re-introduced to the States, look for a classic juniper-pine aroma and a grapefruit-like flavor finishing with spicy hints of coriander, rosemary and black pepper. Despite that perceived flash of grapefruit, no citrus is used in the ingredients, a nod by the original creators that “any proper gin drink always included the addition of a slice of lemon or lime, and to include it in the gin's recipe would be redundant.”

title: Solveig Gin
description: Made from rye grain grown on the distillery's farm, this soft, unusually full-bodied gin has a sweet bananas-and-honey aroma and flavor sprinkled with hot cinnamon and grapefruit peel. Consider for cocktails where a sweeter/fruitier profile is desired.

title: The London No 1
description: It's hard to miss the pale robin's egg blue of this London Dry-style gin “with certified color.” Though neutral in scent, it's complex on the palate, starting with a delicate floral note that morphs into lemon and grapefruit peel before fading into a clean, bracing, peppery finish. Adds surprising color to G&Ts; and other mixed drinks.

title: Bourbon Barreled Big Gin
description: Rested for six months in former bourbon barrels, this complex aged gin shows bright rosemary, citrus and mint, finishing long with spicy cayenne and cinnamon. It's soft on the palate, but sharpens with alcohol heat on the tip of the tongue.

title: Botanica Gin
description: This bracing, pungent gin shows bold mint, menthol and pine. On the palate, it's relatively earthy, with lots of licorice and pine, offering a juicy, slightly sweet finish that might be due to the cucumbers macerated in the gin.

title: Gustaf Navy Strength Gin
description: Made from a rye grown on the distillery's farm, this gin mixes bracing notes of anise, Meyer lemon, fennel and pine. The flavor grows with repeated sips, but so does the fiery, even numbing alcohol heat, which is to be expected from an overproof spirit.

title: South River (Red) Gin
description: Part of this craft producer's “avant garde collection,” this gin has rested for five months in former red wine barrels. It has a pale ruddy hue and mixes notes of juniper, soapy rosewater and red berry, finishing with perky anise.

title: Old English Gin
description: The baffling use of a cork closure (grab a corkscrew!) for a modern gin bottling is meant to highlight the Old World nature of this genever-like gin. Warming and pleasantly malty, this pot-stilled spirit offers notes of anise and juniper, backed by a substantial body, that finishes with a faint effervescent feel on the tongue.

title: Vikre Boreal Cedar Gin
description: This unusual gin is infused with cedar wood. Though it smells like a traditional gin, with licorice, sage and a touch of juniper in the scent, it's bold and earthy on the palate, almost reminiscent of genever, and has a distinct woody finish showing a trace of smoke. Try in a cocktail that includes sweet vermouth, like a Martinez.

title: Master's Selection Gin
description: Bright aromas of citrus and pine show on the nose and palate of this classic London Dry-style gin. It finishes brisk, rather hot and drying, with a prickle of cinnamon heat.

title: Loyal Gin
description: What's unique about this London Dry-style gin is the “gunpowder” green tea used as a botanical, sourced from a local tea shop. There's not much tea presence in the gin; rather, it has a clean and citrusy presence, with a piney juniper bounce and a slightly hot, drying finish.

title: Armagnac Laubade 1956
description: This complex gem offers toffee and peach aromas that are surrounded by a faint smoky wisp. Caramel-sweet and soft on the palate, this is no fading violet; it finishes with a spicy cinnamon and cayenne pepper prickle—memorable to the end.

title: Chateau du Tariquet Famille Grassa XO
description: Named for the Grassa family, which settled in the Château du Tariquet in 1912, this is made from a blend of Ugni Blanc and Baco grapes. Here, a heady vanilla tone mixes with a fresh apple flavor, leading to a hint of rich butterscotch and a surprisingly delicate white-flower note on the finish. Pair with tarte Tatin.

title: Chateau du Tariquet Famille Grassa 1995
description: As one of the few Armagnacs bottled as cask strength, the “Millésime 1995,” as this is also known, has a sharp alcohol presence, but it's balanced by rich, sweet cola, hazelnut and stone-fruit tones, with clove, cinnamon and ginger notes surfacing on the superlong finish.

title: Les Domaines Grassa Reserve Armagnac
description: From Château du Tariquet, this fruity-floral treat melds together apple, pear and hazelnut notes, ending with a long, soothing toffee-flavored finish.

title: Domaine du Chateau a Laree, Baron de Lustrac 1995
description: Bright, light and citrusy, this is made from 100% Ugni Blanc. The color is light amber, with bright golden highlights, and the flavor tends toward lemon cream, with notes of nutmeg and spicy cinnamon on the finish. Consider a savory pairing, such as blue cheese or nuts.

title: Domaine de la Croix Pelanne, Baron de Lustrac 1980
description: Made with 100% Baco, this vintage Armagnac has a nut-brown color and maple-sugar aroma. Rounded sarsaparilla and vanilla flavors finish with an almost effervescent sensation on the tongue, along with a tannic oaky pucker.

title: Darroze Les Grand Assemblages 12 Years Old
description: Allow this bright amber brandy some air exposure, and the reward is a dried- fruit aroma and a vanilla flavor, with touches of cinnamon- and clove. It feels a bit drying on the palate.

title: Chateau de Laubade VSOP
description: This burnished-gold-colored spirit is made from a blend of Baco, Folle Blanche, Ugni Blanc and Colombard. The scent is light, with a funky touch of resin. On the palate, vanilla and maple flavors mix with a hint of citrus peel and a faint smoky note on the finish. Brisk in feel, this is recommended for mixing into cocktails, such as a sidecar variation.

title: Darroze Les Grand Assemblages 60 Years Old
description: A rare sexagenarian spirit, this is intense and a bit challenging to drink but likely would soften alongside a rich and creamy dessert. Look for a dark amber hue and aromas of fruit, caramel and sweet tea. Citric and tart at first, the flavors soon morph into dark toffee, espresso, burnt edges of crème brûlée, dried figs and black currants.

title: Armagnac VSOP Aged 10 years Castarède
description: Given some time to aerate for full aromatic effect, the end result is a maple- and vanilla-scented nose, with a butterscotch-banana flavor and abundant baking spice notes that are heaped on the long finish. Brisk in alcohol but balanced, this feels like a great foundation, but would benefit from more aging time.

title: Laubade 1968
description: Sweet vanilla and orange flavors are jarred by a resiny note at the back of the palate, then rescued by a smooth, buttery finish. Hard wax cap.

title: Delord Napoléon
description: Versatile and a good choice for mixing, this has a maple color, with dried-fruit aromas and a hint of fresh sugar-cane funk. On the palate, a long, soft vanilla flavor fades into clove and cinnamon sparks. Soft but brisk in alcohol, this is aged for a minimum of 10 years. Hard wax cap.

title: Marie Duffau Napoléon
description: This offers a mix of fresh and dried-fruit aromas and a slightly resiny nose. Its juicy apple cider, vanilla and toasty baking-spice notes suggest this would be a fine choice for mixing- into a mulled brandy punch for winter parties. Hard wax cap.

title: Chateau du Tariquet Blanche Armagnac
description: Clear, funky, grappa-esque and muscular, this is a bit much straight up, but could have cocktail applications similar to cachaça or pisco. Blanche Armagnac Caiprinhas, anyone? Made using 100% Folle Blanche, this comes in a clean, modern-looking bottle. The producer suggests serving it well chilled alongside smoked salmon or caviar.

title: Domaine de Courros a Salles Baron du Lustrac 1986
description: A 1986 vintage made from only Folle Blanche—is it possible that it was allowed to age too long? The effect is one of fleeing sweetness, overwhelmed by an oaky, tannic feel, even lingering into the vanilla-tinged finish.

title: Blanche Armagnac Castarède
description: This clear blanche has big, funky, fruity flavors, with a robust alcoholic twang and a long brute of a finish. Use for mixing into cocktails.

title: Chateau du Tariquet Armagnac 8yr Color Collection
description: This Armagnac is cask strength and feels it. Beneath the alcohol lurks rich scents of apple and honey, with a sweet, nutty palate that's nearly obscured by fierce alcohol heat. 100% Folle Blanche.

title: Maison Leblon Reserva Especial Caçhaca
description: Most caçhacas are crystal-clear, but this unique aged version has a pretty amber cast and enticing aromas that evoke butterscotch and hazelnut. The flavor runs to brown sugar, with a warm, nutty finish. Delicious, and new to the market as of summer 2012.

title: Appleton Estate 12-Year-Old
description: Hailing from Jamaica, this smooth 12-year-old rum features a sticky dark-toffee aroma accented by almond and peach notes. On the palate, look for a nice rounded caramel flavor that flashes lots of clove and cinnamon tones on the finish.

title: Don Q Añejo
description: Smooth and mellow, this tawny aged rum features light almond and crème brûlée flavors, and a long finish accented by notes of black tea and clove. It's good for sipping with a block of ice. Made from a blend of rums aged 2–7 years.

title: Arehucas Ron Miel Guanche
description: From Spain's sunny Canary Islands, this honey-sweetened 7-year-old rum has a lovely sweet-spice scent akin to chai tea, a sweet vanilla-bean—almost dulce de leche—flavor and a honeyed finish that coats the tongue.

title: Bacardi Oakheart
description: This amber spiced rum, which debuted last October, is aged in charred oak barrels, yielding a smooth, oaky vanilla flavor with a bit of spice on the lingering finish. Use as a mixer for rum and cola or in tiki-inspired drinks. Best Buy.

title: Whistling Andy Hibiscus-Coconut Rum
description: With its transparent pink-blush hue that was imparted from hibiscus flowers, this unusual flavored white rum resembles rosé wine in the glass. But the delicate flavors tend toward sugary coconut, touched with vanilla and a hint of juicy red fruit. Made from sugar cane in a Montana microdistillery. Use for tropical drinks.

title: Caliche Puerto Rican Rum
description: A collaboration between rum producer Roberto Serralles and nightlife impresario Rande Gerber, this clear rum has a mild, sweet coconut flavor and a faint citrusy tang. Made with rum aged up to four years, it's presented in a rustic-looking bottle with a rope coiled around the neck. Mix it into fruity daiquiris and mai tais.

title: Fortuna Añejo
description: Give this amber rum, which is made using rums aged between 8–10 years, a chance to open up in the glass. The reward is a warm, honey-like flavor touched with notes of dry tea and oak, with a toffee accent toward the back of the palate. The lingering, warm finish is reminiscent of brandy. Made with 100% molasses, sourced from one of the oldest sugar-cane fields in Central America.

title: Bacardi Light Mojito
description: Supposedly, the mojito is the drink that bartenders hate to make—that muddling of the fresh mint and lime juice is tedious. Bacardi's ready-to-drink version goes down easy, like minty limeade. It's no substitute for the real thing, but it's not a bad way to enjoy a mojito at home without suffering the bartender's scowl. Fewer than 95 calories per serving.

title: Captain Morgan Black Spiced Rum
description: This new spiced blackstrap rum is dark and dangerous, with a cola-like flavor that explodes into spicy fireworks of cinnamon and clove. Rum aged in double-charred blackened barrels results in an oaky, slightly bitter edge. Some may prefer the lighter hand of the original Captain Morgan for rum and Cokes.

title: Bacardi Black Razz
description: As a mixer, this clear, flavored rum should appeal to the vodka-tonic crowd. Look for a sugared berry scent and a juicy, mouthwatering raspberry flavor.

title: FlipFlop Spiced Rum
description: Proceeds from this light-gold spiced rum benefit   Soles4Souls, an international shoe charity providing footwear to those in need. Flavors run to vanilla and clove, a fine match for tropical-style cocktails. The playful label sports a floral Hawaiian-shirt motif.

title: Geronimo's Treasure Island Spiced Rum
description: This pale-gold spiced rum has sweet vanilla and cola aromas, with mild flavors of honey, cassia bark and clove. Mix with cola or fruit juice.

title: Romance Vodka
description: Silvery and clear. Dry, delicate and mildly creamy in the initial sniffings; time in the glass allows other scents to emerge, especially wet grass, new leather and a fresh-off-the-still flowery perfume. Palate entry is stone-dry and minerally; at midpalate the flavor turns grainy sweet and a touch smoky. Aftertaste shows a bit of charcoal smokiness. So savory, maybe other Mexican distillers should begin thinking “vodka.”

title: Delamain Pale & Dry Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Visually appealing pale flax color. Bouquet offers seductive aromas of almonds, crushed violets, truffles and dark caramel at all nosing stages. Palate entry taste is focused on the fruit, which is more tropical (pineapple) than grape-like; midpalate experience is extraordinarily complex as flavors of black pepper, old oak, spirit, lead pencil and red fruit disarm the taste buds. Finishes dense, multilayered and medium-long. A textbook Cognac. Best Buy.

title: Andrea da Ponte Uve Bianche
description: Chardonnay and Malvasia grapes. Delicate, crisp bouquet offers nuances of pomace, orange peel and clove. Understated taste at palate entry is elegantly grapey; midpalate showcases tastes of tropical fruits, in particular, citrus and pineapple. The refined, warming aftertaste shows genuine finesse.

title: Lheraud XO Lot #0370 Petite Champagne Cognac
description: The nose at opening is peppery, lean and fruity; aeration stimulates scents of vanilla bean, piquant spirit and oak. In the mouth, restrained, stately tastes of dried fruit and raisins delight the taste buds at entry; midpalate shows tastes of baked apple, sweet red pepper and light caramel. Finish is elegant, sweet and long. One of the more refined XOs in the marketplace.

title: Frangelico
description: Luminous, golden nectar-like hue. Smells of nut meat and nut butter with equal parts of dried herbs. Creamy tastes of hazelnut and butter are featured at midpalate. Finish showcases hazelnut. Classy, focused and delectable. Best Buy.

title: Absolut Citron Vodka
description: Pristine appearance. Lovely, clean and intense aroma of tangerine is full and squeaky tart in the first whiffs; aeration serves to bring out zesty, spot-on scents of lemon juice and lemon peel. In the mouth, the crisp, razor-edged lemon taste dominates from entry into midpalate. Finishes tangy, pleasantly tart and irresistibly fresh. A superb, prototypical flavored vodka. Best Buy.

title: Noilly Prat French Dry Vermouth
description: Extremely pale yellow. Wonderfully alive in the nose, as subtle, woodsy scents of juniper, thyme and laurel make an impression. It's clean, dry and refreshing at palate entry; midpalate shows traces of citrus, pine and berries. Aftertaste is harmonious and medium-long. The finest dry vermouth money can buy.

title: Martini & Rossi Rosso Vermouth
description: Cola hue. Sensuous nose features ginger, prunes, sap and bark aromas. In the mouth, it's supple, sweet, winey and almost Sherry-like at entry, then at midpalate citrus and grape flavors appear. Finishes luscious and semisweet.

title: Mazzetti d'Altavilla Grappa di Nebbiolo da Barolo
description: Pale lemon-juice hue. Initial nosings detect musty, ripe fruit pomace aromas; aeration releases succulent scents of banana, peach and pear. Palate entry is ripe and sweet; midpalate shows concentrated pear, yellow-plum and white-raisin tastes. Aftertaste is full, moderately sweet and very long. Superbly satisfying and graceful.

title: Château de Fontpinot Très Vieille Réserve du Château Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Mahogany color. Rich, semisweet nose is so ideally melded that no one attribute leaps out except for traces of cinnamon and cedar; an exquisite, mature Cognac bouquet of the top rank. Sweet, ripe and grapey at palate entry; midpalate is warming and oaky, with a healthy dose of rancio similar to wood resin and maple. Aftertaste is extended and fruity. A class act.

title: Charbay California Pastis
description: Nose is divine in the first whiff, as evolved scents of fennel, anise and peanut butter impress the olfactory sense; later sniffings find the deep anise perfume enchanting. Beautifully balanced on the palate, with tantalizing, dry and sweet flavors of licorice. In my book, this intense thoroughbred runs rings around the category leaders.

title: Grand Marnier Cordon Rouge Liqueur
description: Goldenrod-orange color. Unique, sweet-sour bouquet of mandarin orange and a hint of Cognac. Supple, satiny on tongue; tastes of orange zest and sinewy Cognac; the alcohol-acid- fruit harmony is seamless. A timeless liqueur.

title: Remy Martin Louis XIII Grande Champagne Cognac
description: The youngest eau-de-vie in this legendary blend is 50 years old. 100% Grande Champagne. Amber color. Harmonious, hallmark bouquet of blue cheese-like rancio, truffles, roasted chestnuts and prunes; the aroma stays firm and concentrated through 10 minutes of nosing. Accessible, satiny smooth at palate entry, then at midpalate the flavor profile turns semisweet, profound and pruny. Finishes gracefully, almost like a ghost on the tongue. Lovely.

title: Jepson Signature Reserve Mendocino Alambic Brandy
description: Extremely bright amber color. Scents of baked pears and oak; aeration releases additional aromas of vanilla and cinnamon; it's a sophisticated bouquet. Palate entry is slightly sweet; midpalate features oaky vanilla, ripe grapes and tropical fruit. Aftertaste is clean, lean, even austere.

title: Lepanto Solera Gran Reserva Brandy de Jerez
description: Part of this brandy's story is its luminous orange-honey color. Aromawise, Lepanto is almost Cognac-like in its grapey, piquant, generous but focused bouquet; it presents a very disciplined nose. The off-dry flavor brims with mellow fruit at entry and midpalate, then fades neatly into a tobacco leaf, tea leaf, tar-like finish that's off-dry and tight.

title: Hidalgo 200 Solera Gran Reserva Brandy de Jerez
description: Pretty burnished-orange hue. Generous opening bouquet emits scents of nougat and cake frosting; aeration stimulates deep aromas of dark caramel, roasted almonds, oloroso Sherry and rancio. In the mouth it tastes of white raisins, cake batter, orange rind and oak resin. Finishes manageably sweet. A gorgeous treat from Spain.

title: Cardenal Mendoza Solera Gran Reserva Brandy de Jerez
description: No wallflower, this one. The intensity of the bouquet starts right with the pour as waves of prunes and raisins rise from the glass; air contact stirs deeper aromas, most notably orange rind, peppermint and roasted nuts. This rich, heavyweight brandy features layers of flavor, including cocoa, toffee, caramel, cream Sherry and oaky vanilla. Finishes as large and robust as it started.

title: Camus XO Cognac
description: Dark copper color. Aroma is full, concentrated and oaky-resiny at first, then with aeration it expands and deepens, showing walnut, plum, pear and cheese-like rancio; a seamless bouquet. Palate entry is dry; midpalate highlights oak, toasted nuts, dried fruit, bittersweet chocolate and rancio. Finish is luxurious on the tongue, sweet and oaky.

title: Hennessy Paradis Cognac
description: A sublime marriage of over 100 eaux-de-vie, some more than a century old. Amber/gold appearance. Textbook tête de cuvée Cognac bouquet of pine needles, clover honey, rancio, sweet oak and spiced apple. Offers elegant flavors of fatty rancio, soft cheese, wood smoke and bacon fat from entry through midpalate. Finishes more woody and resiny than fruity-ripe. Still a favorite after all these years. Gorgeous.

title: Charbay Grappa di Marko Merlot
description: Crystal-clear appearance. Full-throttle, aldehydic nose of grape must, freshly mown hay and cut flowers provides a rollicking, all-you-can-smell banquet of intense, fresh spring-garden fragrances. In the mouth, the highly concentrated, raisiny flavor is sweet right from the pour through the entire midpalate. Aftertaste is fruity and long. One of America's premier grappas.

title: Kelt Tour du Monde XO Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Pretty topaz color. Opening bouquet is round, assertive and pear- and nectarine-like; further air exposure unearths harmonious scents of quince, old oak and butter. Taste is polite, if reserved, showing sweet flavors of raisins and wood. Finish is sweet, warming and elegant. Owns a quiet power.

title: Celtic Crossing Original Celtic Liqueur
description: Light amber hue. Nose is very softly perfumed. In the mouth, this delicate liqueur is manageably sweet and round, offering hints of yellow fruit and honey. Ideal for people who don't care for icky-sticky liqueurs.

title: Gran Gala Triple Orange Liqueur
description: Deep copper hue. First nosings detect intensely acidic notes of orange peel; later whiffs are treated to chunky aromas of marzipan, candied orange rind, dried apricot and almond oil. Palate entry is heavy, syrupy; midpalate is pleasantly fruity, orange-like and sweet. Finishes long and thick.

title: Rinquinquin Peach Apéritif
description: Straw-yellow color. Bouquet is dry, fruity and soft, with a trace of peach pit bitterness. On palate, the peach flavor is delicate, yet ripe; by midpalate, the ripe peach taste dominates. Aftertaste is fruity, but carries enough acidity to maintain crispness. Serve slightly chilled at 50°-55°F. Best Buy.

title: Hennessy XO Cognac
description: Hennessy XO Cognac (France; Schieffelin & Somerset, New York, NY); 40% abv, $150. The eaux-de-vie range in age from 10 to 70 years. Deep amber/chestnut brown hue. Nose is opulent, elegant and emits mature aromas of cheese-like rancio, black tea leaves, raisins and oak.
