description: This shows a honey hue and slightly cloudy appearance. The aroma is honeyed and rich, with a nutty hint, while the velvety palate carries a dry, walnut flavor into the clove-laced finish, showing only a trace of sweetness. Would be welcome at the dessert table or mixed into cocktails.

title: Purus Organic Vodka
description: Subtle and refreshing, look for mild almond sweetness on the nose and palate, finishing crisp on a surprising minty note. Distilled from grain.

title: Veil Caramel Flavored Vodka
description: Clear in the glass, this vodka offers a sweet, nutty scent. The slightly viscous palate leads with caramel sweetness and spice, winding into pleasingly a nutty finish reminiscent of pecan pie, plus a warming cinnamon-clove kick. Sip it straight or mix into dessert-style drinks. Best Buy.

title: Hierarchy Vodka
description: This corn-based vodka opens with perky lime peel on the nose and palate, expanding into earthy hints of graphite, slate and anise on the midpalate, finishing clean and citrusy.

title: Veil Pineapple Flavored Vodka
description: Look for a fresh pineapple scent and a hint of caramel warmth. The palate mixes sweet and mouthwateringly tart flavors with a caramel undercurrent that suggests pineapple cake. Pour as a head start on lighter piña colada variations and other tropical drinks. Best Buy.

title: Gold Star Vodka
description: This grain-based vodka has a neutral scent. The palate hints at coconut-like sweetness, finishing crisp and clean on a dose of cinnamon heat. For each bottle purchased, $2 is donated to charities that benefit military veterans and their families.

title: Nemiroff Vodka
description: Bracing and versatile for a wide range of cocktails, this wheat-based vodka is relatively neutral in terms of aroma and flavor, though the palate hints at vanilla and hot cinnamon. It feels very light, almost effervescent. Best Buy.

title: Eight Degrees Grapefruit Flavored Vodka
description: Lime blossom freshness leads the nose, while the palate mixes sweetness with mouthwatering acidity, finishing on hints of ginger and grapefruit peel. Consider this a head-start on Gimlets and other cocktails. Base vodka is made from Dutch wheat. Best Buy.

title: Montana Cold Spring Lemon Flavored Vodka
description: This easy-sipping, corn-based vodka offers a lemon peel scent and sweetness on the palate that reads as lemon lollipop, finishing with a zingy pop of lime.

title: Dripping Springs Texas Orange Flavored Vodka
description: Clear in the glass, this vodka offers light, pleasant hints of orange peel on the nose and palate. Otherwise, the palate is relatively neutral, finishing on a prickle of alcohol heat. Versatile for mixing, since it adds aroma but won't fight with other flavors. Distilled from corn.

title: Swallowtail Vodka
description: This small-batch cocktail is scented with hints of grapefruit peel and coconut sweetness. The smooth, silky palate shows hints of charcoal and coconut, finishing with white pepper heat. Made in the Willamette Valley from non-GMO corn.

title: Eli's StrongArm Vodka
description: Vanilla sweetness leads the nose and palate, which then dries a more neutral finish, laced with a hint of baking spice. Pleasing to sip or mix. Small-batch vodka made from 90% wheat and 10% Missouri rye.

title: Luxardo Amaretto
description: Look for a bold marzipan aroma and almond flavor with a baking-spice finish and velvety feel. Use for dessert cocktails.

title: The Bitter Truth Violette Liqueur
description: The dense color is hypnotic: an impressively deep, dark, inky violet blue. Luckily, the flavor is less intense. Instead, it's sweet and light bodied, with a distinctive violet flavor that pulls back before it becomes too perfumy or overpowering, with a delicate, clean finish. Overall, an excellent pick for floral-tinged cocktails, like an aviation.

title: Gabriel Boudier-Dijon Crème de Fraises
description: Heads up to bartenders fond of using jam in cocktails: here's a viable alternative. Made with wild strawberries and black currants, this spirit boasts a nice true-berry flavor that's earthy and complex, with a faint cinnamon note on the finish. Almost Port-like, this berry elixir would be outstanding paired with dark chocolate.

title: Briottet Crème de Cassis
description: A deep, dark burgundy color, this black-currant liqueur is rich and thick, with jam-like grape and raisin flavors.

title: Senior Curaçao
description: This clear and bright orange liqueur features a perky candied-orange flavor and aroma, with brisk lemon peel on the finish. Light, clean and appealing for a broad range of cocktails.

title: Schwartzhog Kräuter Liqueur
description: Look for a deep brick-red color and pleasing orange and dried-fruit scents. Light and mouthwatering, finishing with an herbal lilt. Nice postprandial sipper.

title: D'Aristi Xtabentun
description: This exotic liqueur comes with a spicy story: supposedly it's named for Xtabay—a disgraced Mayan prostitute—and the aromatic flowers that eventually sprung from her grave, named xtabentun. The thick, pale yellow liqueur is made with honey, anisette and rum, and has a warm, funky honey-and-spice profile. It's currently a darling among the mixology set, who are using it to flavor Tequila and other spirits.

title: Echte Kroatzbeere Blackberry Liqueur
description: Rich and lovely, this wild-blackberry liqueur is reminiscent of fresh fruit warmed in the sun. A concentrated, nearly opaque plum hue, the earthy, ripe fruit flavor builds with repeated sips. Dash a bit into a bubbly drink like a Kir, or serve as a dessert pairing with dark chocolate.

title: Southern Comfort
description: This classic whiskey-based liqueur has a familiar mix of oak, caramel and vanilla flavors. Since it's only moderately sweet (despite the candy-like aroma) and has a fair amount of alcohol, it's a versatile mixer with a wide range of soft drinks and juices.

title: Fennellys Irish Cream
description: This light brown Irish-whiskey-based liqueur is reminiscent of chocolate spiked with a hint of baking spice. It boasts a rich and creamy feel, with enticing chocolaty aromatics.

title: Luxardo Bitter
description: The bright, vivid orange-red hue and Campari-like bitter scent and flavor make this a natural choice for Negronis, Americanos and the like.

title: Luxardo Limoncello
description: This light limoncello has a candied-lemon aroma and flavor and a zingy herbal note on the finish, similar to lemongrass. Light feel.

title: Di Amore Gran Orange
description: With its luscious sugared-orange peel and spicy cinnamon and ginger notes, this lovely triple sec is a top pick for a sidecar—or any brandy cocktail, for that matter. The warm, elegant, velvety feel belies its stance at 80 proof, on the high end for a liqueur. Think of it as an iron fist within that velvet glove.

title: Sorel Liqueur
description: This new spirit based on a traditional Caribbean recipe features a deep plum color thanks to macerated hibiscus and a spicy clove aroma that seems to leap out of the glass. Although it can be used to add pretty color to gin or vodka cocktails, or to spice up a warm toddy, it's addictively sippable straight up, with a mild alcohol level that won't leave you reeling.

title: Tuaca
description: This vanilla-citrus liqueur is a good, complex sweetener for cocktails made with brandy, whiskey or other dark spirits. The amber liquid has a warm caramel aroma. On the palate, orange is the dominant flavor, warmed up with a bit of vanilla on the boozy finish. When the temperature sensitive bottle is chilled, the color of the design on the bottle changes from white to bright blue.

title: Irish Mist
description: This dark amber liqueur is made with Irish whiskey, honey and spices. Expect warm honey and vanilla flavors, with a perky cinnamon note that winds into the finish. Creamy honey-like mouthfeel and syrupy consistency; excellent for mixing.

title: Wild Turkey American Honey
description: From the makers of Wild Turkey Bourbon, this lovely liqueur is honey-sweet at first sip, but it braces up with a whisper of alcohol. As the sweetness fades away, it leaves behind pretty honeysuckle and vanilla notes on the long finish. Enjoy this on the rocks or mixed.

title: Frangelico
description: Part of the classic liqueur canon, this rich, sweet hazelnut cordial is instantly recognizable. Whether mixed into coffee, whiskey or creamy cocktails, this light-gold liqueur is as addictively sippable as ever.

title: The Old Liquor Store Honey Liqueur
description: Smooth and sippable, this bright gold liqueur has a sweet honey scent, with notes of vanilla and tea. Look for a very sweet, creamy honey feel and flavor, enriched by a touch of hazelnut.

title: Bottega Limoncino
description: Made with Sicilian lemons and grappa, this “limoncino” has a lingering, bright lemon-candy flavor cut by a welcome fillip of brisk alcohol, which softens the sweetness, and a hint of lemongrass. Although the brand recommends using the spirit for lemon drop cocktails, it would be equally at home in a drink with gin or infused with botanicals like rosemary.

title: Luxardo Amaro Abano
description: Some amaros are tongue-curlingly bitter, but that is not the case with this one. Instead, bitter, sweet and herbal flavors are in harmonious balance, entwined with lingering spice, espresso and sarsaparilla notes. Great for apéritif and digestif cocktails seeking a bitter touch.

title: The Bitter Truth E**X**R
description: Produced by vermouth-maker Dolin in France for Germany's Bitter Truth label, this nut-brown liqueur has a surprising bitter aroma and a mix of bitter and berry-sweet on the tongue, finishing with a smattering of ginger, cinnamon and black pepper. Although this would be ideal dashed into cocktails, it's also enjoyable splashed into ginger ale.

title: Jägermeister
description: Despite its overuse among college students as a get-drunk-quick shooter to cascade down ice luges, this is excellent digestif material for grown-ups too. This ruddy, herbal spirit is dominated by licorice and clove flavors, with a faint, bracingly bitter tinge in the medium-bodied mouth and on the finish. The college crowd got one thing right, though: Jäger is best icy cold.

title: Irish Mist
description: This dark amber liqueur is made with Irish whiskey, honey and spices. Expect warm honey and vanilla flavors, with a perky cinnamon note that winds into the finish. Creamy honey-like mouthfeel and syrupy consistency; excellent for mixing.

title: Mathilde Orange XO
description: Made with Cognac, this deep-gold orange liqueur is higher proof than most, and comes across as a little hot. Nevertheless, it's delicious, with enticing honey, baking spice and flower notes. A pleasing note of bitter orange peel cuts the sweetness and refreshes the palate. This would be particularly delightful mixed with brown spirits like brandy or whiskey.

title: Merlet Crème de Peche
description: Bright gold, with a rich, sticky ripe-peach aroma reminiscent of the juice in a can of peaches. The flavors evoke Sauternes and honey, with a surprisingly light finish. Great addition to sparkling wine for a Bellini-style drink, or mix with white rum for a light, peachy cocktail.

title: Becherovka
description: This cheery buttercup-yellow spirit evolves from sweet to bitter in seconds flat. At first, it has a sweet, honey-like cast, then ginger and other herbal notes develop and, finally, it finishes dry, with an amaro-like bitter note. Traditionally consumed neat, Becherovka also stands up well to dilution (tonic, club soda) and makes a particularly refreshing apéritif chilled with a squeeze of lime.

title: Alberti Limoncello
description: Pale yellow and slightly cloudy, this limoncello has a mild lemon-juice scent and interestingly complex flavors. Although candy-sweet at first, the liqueur evolves into an elongated, palate-cleansing finish with lemongrass, white pepper and a faint touch of anise. Would be lovely frozen into sorbet or poured over crushed or shaved ice.

title: Luxardo Cherry Liqueur
description: The deep, dark garnet hue hints at the earthy, subtle cherry aroma and dark-berry flavors. This is warming and medium bodied.

title: Senior Curacao Chocolate
description: Those who hoard chocolate oranges at Christmas time will love this liqueur, which melds orange-peel and fudge flavors in a very grown-up way. With a translucent reddish-brown hue, bright chocolate-almond aroma and brandy-like finish, this is an excellent mixer that can add an elusive chocolate edge to a cocktail or pair with dessert.

title: Martin Miller's Westbourne Strength
description: This gin has a soft feel and English-garden aroma reminiscent of cucumber and fresh-cut flowers (iris is one of the botanicals). On the tongue, look for cucumber and juniper, and a sweet and slightly floral finish. Drink this gin in a tall glass garnished with cucumber slices, preferably while relaxing in a porch swing.

title: Bluecoat American Dry Gin
description: A classic London Dry gin to sip in tennis whites. Assertive, brisk and showing lots of lemon with just a hint of sweetness, it finishes dry and citrusy. Strong anise and juniper aroma and soft feel. Save the gorgeous peacock-blue bottle for a vase.

title: Bombay Sapphire Distilled London Dry Gin
description: Sweet, mild, clean fragrance of lemon, juniper and licorice. This is a complex gin; more flavors can be detected with each sip: cinnamon spice, astringent pine needles, a touch of lime zest and, finally, a big licorice finish comes singing through. Slightly oily feel. Great for a gimlet or martini with a lemon twist.

title: Beefeater London
description: At first, this gin comes across as sweet, clean and mild, but it finishes with a pronounced spice box punch of juniper, cardamom and citrus. Note to mixologists: Thanks to the assertive finish, this gin would hold up in a cocktail with a lot of other flavors.

title: Greylock Gin
description: Perfumy pine and licorice, with some citrus in the background. This gin starts floral and dry, and finishes with bitter orange peel, clove and peppery bite. When chilled, this gin has a sweetness to it. Would make an intriguing martini.

title: Oxley Classic English Dry Gin
description: This gin features an astringent, lemony scent and crisp feel. At first, the flavor is sweet and piney, but finishes relatively neutral and dry. Gift-worthy, masculine packaging:  handsome leat

title: Bombay Dry Gin
description: Mildly scented with ginger, anise, honeysuckle and juniper. The gin has a pronounced but fleeting sweetness, and a lingering finish laced with lemon peel and licorice/fennel seed. Gin & tonic materal.

title: Gentleman Jack Rare Tennessee Whiskey
description: This honey-colored whiskey is mellow, smooth, mouthwatering and delicious. Rich and pretty caramel and citrus aromas precede complex flavors of leather, tobacco, vanilla and cocoa. Its long finish displays lots of caramel, spicy cinnamon and ginger. Pair with a cigar.

title: Slieve Foy 8 year old Irish Single Malt Whiskey
description: This was a pleasant surprise: soft, fresh, delicate and lovely. It has a light straw color and is perfumed with pineapples and tropical fruit. The slightly fruity flavor finishes with a wispy smokiness, and lingers on.

title: Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Select Tennessee Whiskey
description: At first, this whiskey is easy to underestimate, since the amber color and mild toffee aroma give little away. But one sip, and it is clear this whiskey means business: Deep vanilla cookie and cigar tobacco flavors unfold to a big, burnt-caramel finish, which washes over the palate like a rolling wave. Manhattan-worthy.

title: John L. Sullivan Irish Whiskey
description: This Bourbon-barrel-finished whiskey is a treat, with a light amber color, caramel and orange peel aroma, and a lingering caramel and spice finish. Soft, smooth and full-bodied.

title: Charbay Hop-Flavored Whiskey
description: This whiskey reads like a cross between Bourbon and a fine Cognac, delivering rich aromas of caramel, espresso and crème brûlée. Although initially brisk and spicy, the flavor fades to a long burnt-toffee finish and bracing bite. Feels warm and soft on the tongue.

title: Armorik Whiskey
description: A single malt with a golden color and scent of apple, oak and vanilla. A light, citrusy flavor finishes with a smoky, peaty note. Medium feel.

title: Canadian Club Sherry Cask Whisky
description: Aged eight years, then finished in Spanish Sherry casks. The final product is mellow, silky and refined. While the Sherry influence isn't overt, the extra cask aging shows in the deep nut-brown color and warm flavors of dark chocolate, Guinness stout and hazelnuts, which fade into a long, intriguing finish. Pair with a sweet and sticky dessert.

title: Bernheim Original Kentucky Straight Wheat Whiskey
description: This small-batch whiskey, with its bright copper penny color and bewitchingly sweet aromas of cocoa, mocha and fresh-baked cookies, is one of the few “straight wheat” whiskeys out there. The flavors are brisk and restrained, with leather and tobacco tones and a clean citrus and vanilla finish. Despite a relatively high proof, it still comes across as mellow and balanced. Drink straight up, with ice.

title: Canadian Mist Black Diamond Premium Select Whisky
description: This leather club chair of a whisky has a nut-brown color and a pert vanilla aroma. The flavor is all on the finish: complex, rich, lingering notes of cocoa, coffee and leather, balanced with the right amount of bite. Good value.

title: Connemara Peated Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: Smoke bomb alert! Imbibers who love a peaty profile will enjoy this smoky-but-smooth single malt. Pair with assertive flavors, like sausages or charcuterie.

title: Stranahan's Colorado Whiskey
description: This 100% malted barley spent two years in new charred oak and boasts an amber color, sweet caramel scent with a touch of coconut and juicy apple, and relatively dry flavors. What sets this whiskey apart is the remarkable deep cocoa and pronounced coffee finish and velvety, creamy mouthfeel, reminiscent of ice cream and root beer foam. An alcohol sting cuts through, but should temper over ice nicely.

title: Kilbeggan Irish Whiskey
description: Golden honey color. The aroma is a pleasing mix of caramel and faint smoke. Bold, oaky flavors, rich feel and beautiful, lingering butterscotch finish with a faint whisper of smoke and just the right amount of bite. Sip over ice.

title: Hibiki Aged 12 Years Whisky
description: With a little water, this golden blended whisky opens up to delicate, nuanced honey and floral aromas and flavors. Finishes smoky, dry and brisk.

title: Jameson Irish Whiskey
description: Golden color, apple and oak aromas and a medium feel. Finishes full and oaky, with faint butterscotch and smoky notes and an alcoholic bite.

title: Caribou Crossing Single Barrel Canadian Whisky
description: A smooth and enjoyable caramel bomb, from the pretty scent straight through to the lingering finish. Sippable over ice.

title: The Yamazaki Single Malt Whisky
description: Apple and pear aromas, and delicate floral and fruity flavors. This Japanese whisky finishes smoky, elegant and restrained.

title: Red Stag by Jim Beam
description: Who says all whiskey needs to be so serious? This black cherry-infused Bourbon is just plain fun. Look for strawberry jam fragrance and a big, raucous, sticky, supersweet vanilla and cherry soda flavor. It has a syrupy, viscous feel, but just enough whiskey bite to be drinkable straight up, or mixed with ginger ale.

title: Danny Boy Premium Irish Whiskey
description: Golden color, vanilla and slightly smoky scent. The taste is smoky but not overpowering.

title: Hirsch Selection Canadian Rye
description: This 20-year-old Canadian rye retains a light touch. Golden color and soft citrusy scent with a hint of vanilla. Flavors are light and honey-like, with a floral and vanilla finish, and that signature rye bite.

title: Royal Canadian Small Batch Canadian Whisky
description: The quiet dignity of the bottle reflects the dark amber liquid inside. Give this one some time to open up, and the reward is a restrained coffee, tobacco and oak profile with a long caramel finish.

title: Classic 12 by Canadian Club
description: This honey-colored spirit is packaged inside an impressive bottle with wide shoulders and a cut-glass base. The whisky has virtually no aroma, which seems like a missed opportunity given the array of flavors: a sweet dark-chocolate note segues into a mellow finish of honey, oranges, cinnamon and clove. Ends with a tongue-coating finish.

title: Connemara 12-year-old Peated Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: A rugged, undeniably peaty whiskey, with lots of smoke offset by undertones of vanilla and faint butterscotch.

title: The Tyrconnell Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: Light gold color and sweet, juicy fragrance of apples, pears, and honey. Despite a soft feel at first, this whiskey shows a smoky rawness and alcohol bite.

title: Wild Turkey 81 Proof
description: This Kentucky Bourbon is aged up to six to eight years in “alligator charred” barrels, yielding honey-vanilla aromatics and mouthwatering, rounded maple and vanilla notes that close out with clove and cinnamon spark.

title: Espolon Tequila Reposado
description: This light gold reposado balances vanilla sweetness with mild, zingy notes of mint, menthol and green pepper, finishing with a perky cayenne pepper tingle.

title: Skyy Infusions All Natural Blood Orange
description: This flavored vodka is sweet on the palate, with a berry/citrus flavor and a mouthwatering citric quality. Serve well-chilled, in fruity cocktails.

title: George Dickel Tennessee Sour Mash Whiskey No. 8
description: With its tawny hue, smooth caramel and maple notes braced up with a slight oaky edge and buttery finish, this is a whiskey to savor. Try it in a Manhattan.

title: Wild Turkey 101 Proof
description: Bolder but hotter than the 81 proof version, this Kentucky Bourbon has a drying feel, and lots of maple, caramel and vanilla flavor, finishing long with touches of dried orange peel and clove. Add a splash of branchwater to even out the alcohol.

title: 1800 Silver Tequila
description: Surprisingly floral and delicate, this workhorse silver tequila has a pleasing agave aroma and a crisp, peppy flavor profile with touches of vanilla and white pepper. Margarita material.

title: Bols Amaretto Liqueur
description: Appropriately sweet, syrupy and dessert-like, this deep amber liqueur coats the palate with loads of marzipan and sweet almond. Serve as a dessert pairing or post-prandial digestif.

title: Kirkland Tequila Añejo
description: Though relatively light-hued and subtly–flavored for an Añejo, this still is a pleasantly honeyed tequila with cooked agave and vanilla, pepped up with just a hint of jalapeño heat on the finish. The price point means it won't hurt to use it as a cocktail base.

title: Leaf Vodka Made From Alaskan Glacial Water
description: Local water sources are the centerpiece of this vodka line, and this bottling features Alaskan glacial water from Alaska's Blue Lakes and organic wheat. The nose and palate are appropriately neutral, plus a barely discernible almond sweetness. It feels silky, with a brisk alcohol presence.

title: OR-G
description: Another entry in the mini-category of bottled fruity “infusions” with suggestive names and eye-popping colors aimed at the club-going crowd, this one has a vodka base flavored with “persimmon mingling with papaya, mango and lime.” It has a bright blood-orange hue and sweet, citrusy aroma and flavor, and goes down easy like fruit punch.

title: Brandymel Liqueur
description: Reminiscent of authentic honey syrup, this viscous liqueur is aged in oak barrels up to one year. It looks and smells like waxy honeycomb and tastes like dark honey, finishing with mouthwatering notes of molasses and brandy.

title: Cinzano Bianco Vermouth
description: Marked by a faint straw hue and an appealing freshness, this vermouth has a light sweetness on the palate alongside notes of lemon peel, fresh and dried herbs and honey. Finishes crisp. Appealing to sip straight with ice and curl of orange peel, or for cocktails.

title: Genius Gin
description: From a proud small-batch distiller, this gin features floral notes—geranium, iris—shored up by coriander spice and a faint tropical fruit finish. Though some may find it slightly soapy, overall it's smooth, silky and a good match for aviations and other gin cocktails.

title: Don Alejandro Silver Tequila
description: A good match for margaritas and other cocktails, this tequila has a mild, lightly floral aroma and brisk flavors that mingle white pepper, fresh jalapeño and just a touch of sweet vanilla.

title: Platinum Vodka
description: For those who prefer a vodka on the sweeter side, this bottle offers a light marshmallow scent and lingering notes of sweet vanilla, plus a pleasantly weighty feel on the palate.

title: Skyy Infusions All Natural Cherry
description: This flavored vodka features a bold, enticing black cherry scent, though some may find it too similar to cherry-flavored cough syrup. Finishes cleanly, with a pleasing tartness on the back of the tongue.

title: Captain Morgan 1671 Commemorative Blend
description: The backstory behind this spiced rum is that it's finished in Spanish oak barrels believed to be similar to those found on board Captain Henry Morgan's ship. The end result is a mixable rum that's a step up from the flagship bottling: vanilla and oak flavors fade into a mildly spiced finish.

title: Leaf Vodka Made From Rocky Mountain Mineral Water
description: Local water sources are the centerpiece of this vodka line, and this bottling features Rocky Mountain mineral water and organic wheat. The nose and palate are appropriately neutral, with just a whisper of gin-like menthol, pine and citrus. It feels light, with a touch of alcohol heat.

title: Celtic Pride Irish Spirit
description: To be clear, this is not Irish whiskey (which would be made exclusively from grains), it's a “spirit drink” distilled from beet, barley and lactose. Yet this offbeat, honey-hued offering is quite drinkable, characterized by oak and vanilla sweetness, while rounded butterscotch brings it home on the finish.

title: Cachaça São Paulo
description: A complex and interesting cachaça, look for a funky, bright tropical fruit aroma and rounded, bold lychee and creamy banana flavors topped with caramelized sugar and ginger spice.

title: Cinzano Rosso Vermouth
description: The mild aroma of this plum-hued vermouth suggests dried figs and allspice. Those notes are amplified on the palate, with bold figs, dates, raisins, spice cake, allspice and sarsaparilla, finishing on a note of bitter grapefruit peel. It would meld seamlessly with any amaro or dark spirit, like rye whiskey.

title: Grays Peak Meyer Lemon Flavored Vodka
description: This corn-based small-batch vodka has a bright lemon lollipop scent and sweet-tart lemon flavor with a clear, almost puckery lemon peel finish. Smooth and light, mix into Cosmopolitans, Lemon Drops and other vodka-centric cocktails.

title: Don Reyes Dominican Premium Aged White Rum
description: This mellow white rum is aged two years by solera method, then filtered to remove color. The end result is a sweet, sugary scent and an intriguing flavor profile that layers sweet marshmallow and vanilla over a surprising citric tartness. Make pitchers of daiquiris, and dial down the lime.

title: Skyy Infusions All Natural Dragon Fruit
description: Modeled on the exotic dragon fruit, this flavored vodka is sweet and mild, with a juicy, almost grape-like scent and flavor, finishing with a slight bitterness typical of many flavored vodkas.

title: Fabrizia Limoncello
description: Pale yellow and cloudy in the glass, look for a clean lemon-peel aroma and sweet, sorbet-like lemon flavor with a dusty feel on the finish.

title: Marie Brizard Anisette Liqueur Extra Fine
description: Clear in the glass and featuring a bold, sweet, long-lasting licorice candy vibe, this extremely viscous liqueur is downright palate-coating. Use sparingly in drinks where an anise/licorice flavor and strong sweetness is desired.

title: Ouzo by Metaxa
description: Pours clear, this louches to attractive opalescent when ice water is added. Look for a bright licorice scent and bold, mouth-filling licorice candy flavor.

title: Espolon Tequila Blanco
description: The mild aroma hints at green bell peppers; the flavor also has a distinct vegetal note, mixing bell and jalapeño peppers along with agave. Finishes long, with white pepper and ginger sparks.

title: Sugar Island Coconut Rum
description: Made with rum sourced from the West Indies and Barbados, then blended and bottled in California, this super-sweet coconut-flavored rum is almost a liqueur. Clear in the glass and loaded with a coconut aroma and flavor that may put some in mind of suntan lotion, it's sweet but not cloying, making it a match for piña colada variations and other tropical libations.

title: Skyy Infusions All Natural Citrus
description: With its pleasant lemon lollipop scent, this flavored vodka is a welcome pick for Cosmopolitans and other cocktails in need of a citrusy kick. Light on the palate, it has a candied-lemon quality with a breeze of pine on the finish.

title: Highland Park Aged 18 Years
description: This Scotch is a big boy—look for assertive, brawny flavors and alcohol burn. However, it still has nuance. Aging in Sherry oak casks draws out a dark amber cast and rich caramel, honey and dried-fruit aromas. The flavor grows more interesting with repeated sips—piquant peaty notes are joined by deep, complex toffee.

title: Glenfarclas 40 Year Old
description: There aren't many 40-year-old Scotches out there. This one makes its age known with a deep nut-brown color and a modest booziness on the nose, in addition to deep toffee, cocoa and hazelnut aromas. Oak is the dominant flavor, finishing with dry cocoa and leather accents. Water helps tease out additional orange peel, nutmeg and toasted coconut tones. Velvety feel.

title: The Glenlivet Nàdurra Aged 16 Years
description: Light and versatile, although at over 100 proof “natural cask strength,” this golden spirit could stand some dilution, whether via a dose of ice water or mixing into a cocktail. Perfumy floral-honey nose, with flavors of vanilla lemon, oak, and a hint of smoke on the finish.

title: Laird's Applejack
description: A Jack Rose cocktail wouldn't be the same without this historic “blended brandy” spirit, blended from 35% apple brandy and 65% neutral spirits. Smooth, warm and bright, with a rich, juicy apple flavor and caramel finish. Mouth-coating and very soft in texture.

title: The Macallan 18 Years Old
description: This Speyside single malt is matured in Sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, for a minimum of 18 years. The amber spirit has a big, warm caramel flavor, finishing with a touch of sweet honey, bitter chocolate and espresso on the lingering finish. Viscous, creamy mouthfeel.

title: Etude Pinot Noir Brandy
description: This 100% Pinot Noir brandy, from Etude winemaker Jon Priest, warms gently all the way down the gullet. A warm scent of caramel and candied oranges precedes a relatively dry palate, which shows fruit laced with leathery notes, finishing with crème brûlée, nutmeg and cardamom. Well-balanced, with just a little puckery tannin. Although it would be a shame to mix this “extremely limited bottling” (600 cases made), it would shine in a cocktail sassed up with a little vermouth and bitters.

title: Osocalis Apple Brandy
description: Made with a whopping 15 different types of apples, this barrel-aged California brandy has a sweet, fruity scent and sip, drying to an elegant and complex finish with light notes of honey, dried fruit, leather, walnut and allspice. Viscous feel. 60 cases produced.

title: Auchentoshan Three Wood
description: The “three wood” name refers to the three casks used to mature this Lowlands Scotch: American Bourbon, Spanish Oloroso Sherry and Pedro Ximenez Sherry. Married together, the result is a maple syrup hue, an oaky, toffee-like scent, and sweet dried-fruit flavors that fade into a lingering, luscious caramel finish. A particularly dessert-friendly single malt.

title: Bowmore 15 Year Old
description: Sherry cask aging provides this Scotch with a rich, dessert-worthy profile. Look for rich caramel and chocolate notes accented by dry cigar, leather and dried orange peel notes. Amber hue, soft feel. Pair with a rich and creamy dessert like crème brûlée.

title: The Glenrothes Vintage 1998
description: Distilled in 1998, this Speyside Scotch has a soft feel and an enormous butterscotchy flavor and aroma, lightened by dark chocolate, clove and cinnamon fireworks. Pair with chocolate or other dessert fare.

title: The Macallan 15 Years Old
description: Golden straw color and a light honeysuckle scent. The flavor is warm and honeyed, with light lychee and pineapple notes drizzled over with caramel and a touch of zingy ginger and cinnamon on the finish. Pair with a honeyed dessert like baklava, or cheeses on the sweeter side.

title: Auchentoshan 12 Year Old
description: Fruity and vegetal scent, in equal measures. Allowed to sit, it shows more caramel, even a light Sherry-ish character. Lots of lovely caramel flavor, with a baking spice finish. Soft, smooth and very sippable. Good value.

title: The Dalmore 18 Years Old
description: Sherry finishing is particularly evident in the amber color and pretty dried fruit aromas. Give this Highland single malt a few minutes to open up, then enjoy the lively burnt orange peel, toffee and clove flavors.

title: Glenmorangie The Quinta Ruban 12 Years Old
description: While “extra finished” for two years in ruby Port casks, the impact on the spirit is minimal, imparting a rose-gold hue and a shadow of red berry flavor. Though it lacks the “wow factor” of the Nectar d'Or, it's still quite good: Expect a warm, fruity scent with a hint of cedar and a smooth caramel-honey flavor with baking spices on the finish.

title: The Glenlivet The French Oak Reserve 15 Years of Age
description: Don't dilute this light, gentle Scotch too much. Enjoy the honeyed, fresh tropical fruit aromas and mouthwatering vanilla and almond flavors with a hint of smoke and spice on the finish. Light body. Good value.

title: Glenmorangie 25 Years Old
description: Know someone celebrating a special quarter-century birthday or anniversary? Splurge on this bottle in gorgeous, gift-worthy packaging—it feels precious before it's even opened. Pour it and let it sit in the snifter for a few minutes for maximum aroma and flavor (and to let some alcohol dissipate). Smooth texture, deep, warm floral and caramel scent. The finish really lingers, shifting among honey-toffee notes, pops of clove and ginger and a touch of oak.

title: Charbay Brandy N0.83
description: Master Distiller Miles Karakasevic has created a dry and sophisticated California brandy, distilled in 1983 (hence the name) and aged for 27 years in French oak barrels. It has an enticing floral and vanilla-bean perfume and intriguing flavors of Port-like red fruit, tart lemon peel and a toasty oaky note smoothed over by almonds and brioche, finishing with a raisiny touch. The extended barrel time means more flavor, but also more intense alcohol.

title: Ardbeg 10 Years Old
description: For peat lovers only. Pale straw, briny nose. On the palate, this is like a time-release smoke capsule—after a flash of sweetness, the smoke just keeps rolling on in waves. Water adds some softness and mitigates the smoke a bit. Well-constructed and classic. Good value.

title: Glen Garioch 1991 Small Batch Release
description: Lightly smoky and pleasant, with a gentle peated profile that simply drifts in and drifts away. However, the vanilla scent nods to aging in Bourbon casks. Light-bodied and golden; the overproof alcohol level is barely felt, though it's noticeable on the nose. Consider this one as an apéritif, perhaps paired with bold blue cheeses.

title: The Glenrothes “John Ramsey Legacy”
description: This limited-edition Speyside single malt was the swan song of John Ramsey, who was the “Malt Master” for Glenrothes from the 1990s through his retirement in June 2009. Only 1,400 bottles were made, and a mere 200 allocated to the U.S. This is a rich and dry Scotch, with a fresh fruity, floral aroma and a light, soft texture. Adding water teases out caramel flavors, along with leather and cocoa.

title: Glenfiddich 21 Year Old
description: Celebrating a special birthday? Here's your bottle: one of the few Scotches finished in Caribbean rum casks. Most of the flavor in this bright amber spirit is on the finish, with its lingering Sherried-fruit, caramel and nuts. A splash of water further amps up the flavor. Pairs well with savory game dishes as well as fruit desserts.

title: Balblair 1989
description: Based on the pale straw color and tropical fruit scent alone, some might guess this to be a Sauvignon Blanc rather than Highland Scotch. But the first sip tells a different story, showing a fruity flavor with a bit of smoke and a light vanilla finish. Strong alcohol, light body. Attractive bottle with raised curlicue design on the side.

title: Glenmorangie The Original Ten Years Old
description: Smooth and mellow, like nuts drizzled with honey or Bit O'Honey candy, with a light vanilla finish. Matured in Bourbon casks for 10 years.

title: The Glenlivet 12 Years of Age
description: Vibrant gold with orange highlights, fruity scent of apples and pears plus a whiff of vanilla. Soft, velvety feel. This is a pleasant and drinkable Scotch, but the flavors are relatively muted. It mixes well with other flavors, making it a good contender for cocktails. Good value.

title: Glenfarclas 17 Year Old
description: Amber, with a caramel and apple scent and a big caramel finish mixed with creamy citrus. Brisk alcohol means this smooth spirit is best mixed with alcohol.

title: Ardbeg Alligator
description: Although relatively new to the market, already this rare limited release, made with heavy “alligator char” inside the barrel, has found cult status among peat-loving whiskey enthusiasts. The aroma is intriguing, briny, peppery and pungent, with a breeze of spearmint. On the palate an insistent mix of smoke and sweet caramel evokes barbecue sauce.

title: Auchentoshan Classic
description: This light-bodied Lowland single malt has a light and intriguing mix of sweet vanilla, honeysuckle and gentle brininess, like a flower garden by the seaside. Good value.

title: Glenmorangie Extremely Rare 18 Years Old
description: Some of the Scotch is finished in Oloroso Sherry casks, which accounts for the honey and dried fruit fragrance. The spirit has a smooth, soft feel and a touch of juicy sweetness. Look for caramel and vanilla and rather aggressive oakiness, finishing with orange peel. Best with some time to open up.

title: Osocalis Heritage Alambic Brandy
description: Give this bottling, “drawn from our oldest brandy stocks,” a little time to open in the glass. The musky fragrance soon gives way to honeysuckle and warm brown sugar and vanilla notes. On the palate, this brandy is bitingly dry, with an assertive baked-apple flavor and a lingering, complex finish of vanilla, dried orange peel, clove, and bitter chocolate. 112 cases produced.

title: The Glenrothes Vintage 1995
description: A Speyside Scotch reminiscent of a zesty lemon meringue pie, with its golden color, vanilla, honey and pineapple scent, and sweet, creamy honey-citrus finish.

title: Jacopo Poli Arzente 10 Year Old Grape Brandy
description: The initial nosing passes find fetching scents of light caramel, brown butter and nougat; following aeration the aroma turns mildly burnt and slightly pipe tobacco-like. Entry tastes of cocoa and is very honeyed; the midpalate offers smoky tastes of brown sugar, sweet oak, vanilla extract and chocolate covered orange. Concludes semisweet, nutty and medium-weighted.

title: Jacopo Poli Lamponi di Poli Raspberry Brandy
description: The initial bouquet features scents of ripe, juicy, just-picked raspberries; following aeration the aroma turns jammy and concentrated, balanced by a brambly quality. Entry highlights more of the ripe raspberry fruit than jamminess; the midpalate features solid, authentic raspberry flavor with high acidity. Ripe aftertaste works well.

title: Etter Zuger Kirsch Fine Eau de Vie
description: The bouquet smells enticingly of fresh cherries, cherry pit, limestone and cooking spice. Entry is ripe and seductively sweet, with touches of spice; the midpalate explodes with juicy cherry and cherry compote tastes, supported and balanced by mineral. Concludes with a lovely rush of ripe cherry flavor.

title: F. Meyer Eau de Vie de Mirabelle Mirabelle Plum Brandy
description: Opening whiffs detect subtle scents of yellow plums and baking spices; the aroma turns more stony with aeration. Entry is sweet, ripe and intensely plum; the midpalate is long, medium-fat and oily. Concludes with a hit of spirit on the tongue and a delectable ripeness that's engaging and pleasingly sweet.

title: Jacopo Poli Pere di Poli Pear Brandy
description: The opulent bouquet features scents of pear fruit and nutmeg. Entry is ripe, properly acidic, tart to off dry and balanced; the midpalate is pleasingly fruity, a touch baked and a bit minerally. Ends up medium-sweet and tasting of peel and fruit meat. Elegant, true to the source and concentrated.

title: Remy Martin Extra Fine Champagne Cognac
description: The initial nosing passes find subtle traces of dried fruit, black pepper and oak; aeration time adds potent, off-dry scents of spirits, oak, spice and marzipan. Entry is wonderfully elegant and integrated; at midpalate the taste profile becomes more focused, especially on the oak and dried fruit. Finish is graceful, chewy and harmonious.

title: Van Winkle Family Reserve Rye 13 Year Old Kentucky Straight Rye Whiskey
description: The bouquet features smells of worn leather, parchment and uncooked beans. Entry is incredibly concentrated, bittersweet and honeyed; the midpalate is full-weighted, chewy, oaky and reeks with cooking spices such as allspice and coriander. Concludes silky and long.

title: White Horse Blended Scotch Whisky
description: Lovely aromas of seaweed, green vegetable, straw, grain kernel, toasted almond, dried fruit, pastry and oak. On the palate, early tastes include light toffee, brown butter, almonds and pine; the dry midpalate features subtle peatiness, butter cream, cooking oil and bacon fat. Concludes oily, concentrated and peaty. Fantastic value.

title: F. Meyer Eau de Vie de Quetsch Dark Red Plum Brandy
description: Nosing passes find nice earthy, plumy aromas with a dash of baking spice. Entry features vibrant deep dark plum and black currant acidity and fruity richness; the midpalate, while very good, loses a bit of momentum as the flavors appear to be less lively than the entry. Finish is balanced, medium-weighted and slightly oily.

title: Maison Surrenne Ancienne Distillerie 1993 Harvest 100% Petite Champagne Cognac
description: The bouquet offers nice aromas of ripe banana, marshmallow, peach, white grapes and milk chocolate, with background notes of oaky vanillin. The oak-influenced vanilla-bean element forges ahead at the entry; midpalate sees spice development (mainly nutmeg). Finishes clean, gently spicy and moderately toasty.

title: Hancock's President's Reserve Single Barrel Kentucky Bourbon Whiskey
description: The nice early aromas of toasted honey wheat bread, cinnamon and breakfast cereal disappointingly trail off following aeration. Entry is acutely sweet in a sap and maple manner; the midpalate features lovely tastes of baking spices, fudge, butterscotch, maple syrup and light toffee. Concludes engagingly sweet, medium-weighted and satiny. Bounced back beautifully in the taste stages.

title: Old Fitzgerald Very Special 12 Year Old Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Aromas of old worn leather, popcorn and breakfast cereal with more subtle notes of creamed corn, dark caramel, molasses and fudge evolving after aeration time. Entry is buttery, with flavors of sweet corn and maple; the lovely midpalate features tastes of cooking oil, lanolin, caramel, dark fudge, cocoa and brown sugar. Ends with a flourish of oaky vanilla.

title: Old Grand Dad 114 Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Nice bouquet that includes defined aromas of buttered corn-on-the-cob, sawdust, freshly sawed pine, cedar, baking spices and dried fruit. Entry is vividly spirited and potent but not harsh or overpowering; the midpalate highlights corn meal, breakfast cereal, orange rind, dark chocolate and toffee. Sophisticated, yet powerful and assertive.

title: Van Winkle Special Reserve 12 Year Old Lot “B” Kentucky Straight Rye Whiskey
description: The bouquet is somewhat lacking in “grip” with initial aromas of peanuts and peanut butter; following aeration the bouquet turns more like fiber/textile. Entry is long, oily, remarkably substantial, and maple sweet; midpalate features tastes of light fudge, maple, chocolate covered orange, caramel and honey. Finish is elegant and sturdy.

title: Bols Peppermint Schnapps Liqueur
description: The aroma features peppermint fragrance underpinned by a stony smell. Entry is sharply minty, yet pleasingly sweet; the midpalate is delightfully zesty and tangy, and the über-mint flavor isn't too syrupy or sweet. Finishes cool, leafy and keenly refreshing.

title: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year Old Kentucky Straight Rye Whiskey
description: Initially smells of buttered popcorn and well-crisped bacon, but with aeration a lovely honeysuckle scent appears making the final stages of sniffing a delight. Entry is caramel sweet and red fruit ripe; the midpalate is pleasingly oily, fatty, chewy and bittersweet. Finish is nicely assertive with top notes of dark toffee and fudge.

title: Bols Hot Cinnamon Liqueur
description: The nosing passes find engaging smells of piquant cinnamon. The entry is intensely cinnamon and sweet, though not cloying; the midpalate is better as the spice element cuts through much of the sugary sweetness. Concludes long, moderately cinnamon, slightly (and nicely) bitter, and properly zesty.

title: F. Meyer Eau de Vie de Kirsch Cherry Brandy
description: The nosing passes find an assertive ripe cherry juice aroma. Entry is sharply acidic, pleasingly tart and adequately cherry ripe; the midpalate is the best phase of the evaluation as the flavor turns viscous, full, intensely ripe but not in the least over-sweet. Finishes minerally, still potent and spirity.

title: F. Meyer Eau de Vie de Poire Williams Pear Williams Brandy
description: Bouquet offers generous, but slightly dull aromas of pear skin. Entry highlights the pear peel element as the acidity drops in strength, leaving behind a rush of ripe fruit; the midpalate is the best stage as the flavor evolves into a gently sweet, mildly spicy taste. Finish is tarter and a touch earthy.

title: Old Grand Dad Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: The somewhat sloppy bouquet features undirected caramel corn and marshmallow scents with moderately complex aromas of nut paste, pastry dough, yeast and dry breakfast cereal. Entry improves matters as appetizing tastes of bacon fat and corn meal dominate; the midpalate improves even further as the oak balances the grain tastes. Ends with a dash of fire.

title: Jim Beam Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: A lovely, sophisticated bourbon bouquet comprising fruity, cornmeal aromas which are followed by a red fruit scent, all underpinned by an oaky vanilla quality. Entry is reserved, gently sweet and toffee-like; the midpalate features succulent tastes of light caramel, honeywheat bread, caramel corn and toasted almond. Concludes fruity and corny. The best value American whiskey in the marketplace.

title: Etter Framboise Fine Eau de Vie
description: The nosing passes find vivid scents of fresh raspberries with nuances of brambles and vines. Entry offers a surprisingly lean raspberry fruit flavor that's tamped down by the high acidity; the midpalate doesn't quite deliver on the fresh raspberry taste that was implied by the promising bouquet. Finishes smooth, adequately raspberry-like and clean.

title: Jacopo Poli Vespaiolo Grape Brandy
description: Disappointing bouquet, neutral and industrial. The entry improves matters with pleasing tastes of ripe grapes, raisins, marmalade and even a touch of honey. Finishes elegantly, with ample viscosity and a dried fruitiness that's pruny and bittersweet. Recommendable because of the recovery in the mouth.

title: Jacopo Poli Torcolato Grape Brandy
description: The bouquet smells unappealingly of vinyl or plastic, shoe leather and Styrofoam. Entry features underwhelming flavors of wax, paraffin and fiber; the midpalate, at least, sees a trace of fruitiness allied with a mossy earthiness. Finish is moderately ripe, minimally grapy, tea-like and austere.

title: Blanton's Single Barrel Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey Warehouse H/Rick #9/Barrel #150
description: Emits a pleasing aroma of cracked corn, creamed corn and oatmeal; aeration adds meager scents of baking spice, new felt and resiny oak. Entry is assertive, spicy and sappy sweet; the midpalate offers tastes of flax, new oak, spirit attack and sap. Finishes resiny, full-weighted, chewy and concentrated on the sap flavor.

title: William Grant's Blended Scotch Whisky The Family Reserve
description: The muted nose features scents of heather honey, oak and dry breakfast cereal. Palate is very nice with floral, intensely grainy and off-dry flavors; midpalate displays harmonious flavors including black pepper, honey, light caramel and wood resin. Ends with no single component dominating.

title: F. Meyer Eau de Vie de Framboise Raspberry Brandy
description: The nosing passes find sweet, almost sugary aromas that are deficient in freshness. Entry is mildly pleasing, assertive in its ripeness and a trace manufactured with sugar; the midpalate is concentrated, sweet and bordering on top-heavy with ripeness. Ends on a spirity, sharp, sweet/sour note. Too sweet and not enough delicacy (and acidity).

title: Aqua Perfecta Pear Eau-de-Vie
description: The bouquet offers wonderful scents of baked pear pastry, pear peel, and bread. Entry is intensely pear meat-like, fresh, and authentic; the succulent midpalate introduces a ripe sweetness that's balanced by a rise in the acidity. Finishes ripe yet austere, fruity yet minerally, and like liquid silk. Outstanding distilling.

title: Etter Williams Fine Eau de Vie de Poire
description: The bouquet is perfectly balanced between smells of pear peel, pear meat, subtle baking spice, and natural acidity, all wrapped in a minerally/stony aroma. The entry features genuine pear juice/pear peel tastes; the midpalate is correctly and sharply acidic and delightfully pear meat flavored. Finish is dashingly clean, austere, razor crisp, and first-rate.

title: Germain-Robin Single Barrel Viognier Brandy
description: The nosing passes find lovely aromas of spice, orange rind, orange blossom, and black tea leaves. The delicious entry is honeyed and remarkably fruity (baked banana/baked peach/baked pear); the midpalate is silky, semisweet, with melded flavors of peach, pear, grapefruit, and caramel. The finish is round, ripe, savory and altogether splendid.

title: LiV Vodka
description: Initially smells of sweet potatoes, then turns more spirity following aeration and even turns pleasingly ashy and potato chip-like. Palate entry is sweet and nicely oily in texture; midpalate highlights the oiliness as the taste profile turns drier. Finishes delicately sweet and keenly toasty. An up-and-down ride.

title: Metaxa Private Reserve Greek Specialty Liqueur
description: Initial nosing passes find smells of brown butter and cooking oil; aeration brings out a toastiness that's one-part cigar tobacco and one-part buttered popcorn. Palate entry is fudge-like and intense in its sweetness and woodiness; midpalate introduces some wood resin to counter the sweetness. Finishes toasty, bittersweet, caramel-like and woody.

title: Siembra Azul Añejo 100% Agave Tequila
description: First nosings detect pleasing scents of charcoal/soot/smoke that lie just beneath the vegetal/peppery agave surface aroma; further air contact releases smells of dill and green olive brine, as well as a textile/fiber. Palate entry is smooth, tar-like, and tobacco-y; midpalate is toasty, clean, focused and resiny dry. Ends on a mild, oily note.

title: Renegade Rum Company Guyana Rum 1995
description: The bouquet is somewhat limited in scope: mineral-like, chalky and dry with a textile quality. Palate entry is sweet, a touch resiny from the oak, and still acutely mineral-like; midpalate is pleasingly balanced between sugary sweetness and dry-leaning stoniness. Ends on a savory, bittersweet note. A sipping rum that I liked for its idiosyncratic character.

title: Metaxa Grande Fine Greek Specialty Liqueur
description: The bouquet comes off very mature, brandy-like, raisiny and pruny with a genuine wood influence and vanilla-like sweetness that rounds out the raisin/prune aspect. Palate entry is truly raisiny/pruny and more bittersweet than sugar sweet; midpalate stage features a wood resin impact on the fruitiness and a honey and orange zest presence. Concludes long, gently sweet, moderately fruity and woody.

title: Metaxa Classic Five Star Greek Specialty Liqueur
description: Nice, bakery-like bouquet. Palate entry is raisiny sweet and focused on dried red fruits, honey and trail mix-like flavors; midpalate comes up with a citrus zestiness as well as an almond background taste that goes well with the fruit peel. Fruity and nutty finish.

title: Prairie Organic Vodka
description: The limited bouquet displays the merest hints of grain and spirit; aeration only adds a distant stoniness and a flash of textile fiber. Palate entry is sweet, medium-weighted in texture, moderately oily and very clean; midpalate reflects all the qualities found at entry, adding nothing new. Its neutral posture is acutely evident throughout.

title: Syn Exceptional Vodka
description: The nosing passes detect subtle scents of sweetish grain and cocoa; aeration time further brings out the appealing Cocoa Puffs-like cereal sweetness. Palate entry is sweet, grainy, and chocolaty; midpalate doesn't display much in layered depth but remains pleasantly sweet and grainy. Ends up sweet in a ripe rather than sugary manner. Simple, pleasant, tasty.

title: Tabasco Premium Gold Spicy Tequila
description: Mixto Tequila blended with McIlhenny's Tabasco  sauce. Unmistakable aroma of Tabasco and habañero peppers first off; following aeration time the bouquet turns vinegary, pleasantly piquant and seductively prickly. Entry is sharply peppery and keenly spicy, yet controlled and savory; midpalate is vegetal, dill-like, vinegary and medium hot. The finish is delightfully peppery and hot. The best flavored Tequila available at present.

title: Jagermeister Liqueur
description: Comes off alluringly herbal and root-like in the opening sniffs after the pour; the rooty earthiness becomes more like a tree bark bitterness following aeration. Palate entry is nicely bitter but with a background, low-key sweetness that balances the bitterness; midpalate is clipped, bittersweet, bark-like and tangy.

title: Metaxa Seven Star Greek Specialty Liqueur
description: Nosing passes find mineral scents, like limestone, browned butter, nougat, almond paste and pumpkin and sunflower seeds. Palate entry is far fruitier than the bouquet, introducing flavors of prunes, figs and dates; midpalate goes the pastry route, especially prune Danish, blackberry preserves and date paste. The pastry shop dried fruit element continues on into the aftertaste.

title: Dooley's Original Toffee Cream Liqueur
description: First whiffs detect slightly metallic nutty and nougat-like scents; aeration brings out plentiful savory aromas of baking spice and toffee. Palate entry is nutty, slightly bitter and only moderately sweet and creamy; midpalate is lush, nougaty, slightly fruity and candied without being cloying. Ends with notable creaminess and a very pleasant toffee core flavor.

title: Johnnie Walker Swing Blended Whisky
description: Biscuity, caramel and floral opening aroma; further air contact stimulates scents of baked bread, toasted bread, buttered popcorn and light smoke. Flavor is dominated by sweet toffee and fudge notes. Sweetest and most buttery of all Johnnie Walker expressions.

title: Arakú Rum & Coffee Liqueur
description: The nosing passes find true, delightful scents of black coffee; a beany, dusty dry and charming aroma. Palate entry is coffee bean bitter and keenly roasted; at midpalate the taste turns plump and sweet (but not overly so) and well balanced with the coffee bean intensity. Concludes more bitter and beany than sweet.

title: Qi White Exotic Oranges & White Tea Liqueur
description: The aromatic profile is triple sec-like with aromas of perfumed, slightly sweet orange blossom, orange hard candy, and orange zest. Palate entry continues with the triple sec theme with tastes of tart, bitter orange astringency; at midpalate the tea component finally gets involved in a mellow, seamless manner. Ends up clean and tasty.

title: UVIX Vodka
description: This unusual vodka bouquet features delicately fruity scents and a stemmy fragrance complemented by aromas of aluminum foil, chalk and granite. Entry is intriguingly touched with botanical spice and black pepper; midpalate displays dry flavors of stone, grape vines and pomace. Strange but compelling.

title: Grand Traverse True North Natural Cherry Flavor Vodka
description: Cherry fruit scents of the bouquet evolve to a dried cherry perfume to smells of cherry pastry by the end of the sniffing rounds. Palate entry focuses on the dry and spicy cherry pastry flavor; midpalate is long, intensely dried cherry-like and loaded with spicy tastes. Finishes a little bitter and keenly tart.

title: Pirassununga 21 Cachaça
description: Smells intensely of cane, grass, earth, olive brine and white pepper initially; aeration allows the bouquet to round-off, leaving more graceful scents of herbs, chalk and rubbing alcohol. Palate entry is surprisingly sweet and sugary; midpalate features dried herbs, cooking spice, tree bark, pine and fresh sugarcane. Clean, medium-weighted, oily, concentrated and mildly sweet in the finish.

title: Rubi Rey Reserve Rum Single Barrel Finished White Rum
description: The nosing passes find a background hint of molasses, grassy and vegetal notes, and subtle traces of lead pencil and black pepper. Palate entry is substantial, moderately oily, and dry; midpalate shows more molasses intensity and sweetness than the entry. Finishes cleanly, drier than the midpalate, cocoa-like and with a touch of lead pencil.

title: KWV 10 Year Old Brandy
description: At first, smells of toasted almonds, toasted walnuts; aeration adds white raisins, white peach and marshmallow. Entry is semisweet, toffee-like and angular; midpalate displays toastiness in the forms of pastry and toasted nuts. Concludes well, medium-weighted, semisweet.

title: Gran Gala Triple Orange Liqueur
description: Initial sniffs detect fresh orange peel, nuts and background brandy notes; aeration adds notes of pineapple, tangerine and orange peel to the brandy structure. Palate entry is acidic and very orangey, with no evidence of the brandy; at midpalate the brandy emerges to complement the orange peel taste. Concludes fresh, a touch too woody and acidic.

title: Karlsson's Gold Vodka
description: Bouquet is earthy, new potato-like, vegetal and slightly salty. Palate entry is nicely succulent; midpalate is keenly astringent and tastes a bit like lead pencil, shale, minerals, nickels—a little too harsh and raw. Ends up bittersweet and dark chocolate beany.

title: Highland Harvest Organic Blended Scotch Whisky
description: Fruity, ripe, gently sweet and grainy aromas with hints of beeswax and lemon drops. Palate entry is grainy and breakfast-cereal sweet; midpalate adds almond, cooking vanilla and light caramel. Finishes smoothly, affably and without any burn.

title: Qi Black Lapsang Souchong Tea Liqueur
description: The unusual bouquet offers aromas of burning rubber tire, burnt autumn leaves, Band-Aids and burnt tropical fruit. Palate entry is intensely smoky—even smokier than the bouquet; midpalate offers aggressive flavors of Lapsang Souchong, wood smoke, cigarette ash and creosote. Idiosyncratic and interesting but not for everyone.

title: Pearl Plum Flavored Vodka
description: The plum-like perfume is delicately sweet and ripe; aeration time allows deeper, more juicy aromas to evolve. Palate entry is richly plummy, a dash sugary, but very tasty; midpalate is long, sugary sweet, candied, but holds enough acidity to maintain balance. Finishes very ripe.

title: Martell Creation Grand Extra Cognac
description: The nosing passes find aromas of cherries, strawberries, blueberries, white chocolate, prunes and black raisins with subtle hints of oak. Palate entry is full-weighted, long and nougat-sweet; midpalate is multilayered with aspects of dried fruits, pastry fillings, brown butter and dryness. Concludes extended, but dry and cocoa bean-like. Supremely satisfying.

title: Laubade Extra Bas Armagnac
description: Nosing finds luxuriously mature aromas of old library leather, dried yellow fruit, nougat, cocoa paste, oak, honey, candied orange and even some black pepper. Palate entry is full-weighted, sweet, concentrated, nutty and buttery; midpalate adds rancio, honey, earth and apricot nectar. Concludes sweet, tobacco-like, mildly smoky and marshmallow-like. Flat-out delicious.

title: Laubade 1982 Bas Armagnac
description: The initial bouquet offers wonderful aromas of pipe tobacco, nougat, almond paste and old, well-worn leather; aeration sees the nuttiness take precedence and a brown-butter element emerge. Palate entry is keenly nutty, moderately sweet, cocoa butter-like, and a touch oaky or resiny; midpalate adds a touch of toasted marshmallow. Full-throttle finish in terms of taste. Scrumptious.

title: Martell Cordon Bleu Grand Classic Cognac
description: The wonderful bouquet offers scents of walnuts, dried flowers, dried pears and white raisins. Palate entry is languid, oily, buttery and decadently rich; the silky, rich midpalate exhibits complete flavor integration with prune and raisin tastes. Finishes extended, smooth as satin, medium-weighted and a bit caramel-like. Love it.

title: Laubade 1970 Bas Armagnac
description: The bouquet is somewhat disappointing in that it smells engagingly, if subtly, of dried yellow fruit but doesn't expand beyond that. Palate entry improves by offering leathery, mature tastes of nut paste, marzipan, treacle and dark chocolate; midpalate is chunky, sweet, raisiny, pruny and fat. Finishes huge, assertive and diametrically opposed to the fey bouquet.

title: Bozal Mezcal Tobasiche
description: Showing just the faintest straw tinge in the glass, this single-maguey mezcal offers a zesty dried-herb scent. The palate also shows plenty of dried herb flavor, plus hints of tomato, citrus peel and a strongly smoky midpalate, finishing with a minty fade.

title: Don Amado Pechuga
description: This unusual pechuga is made with no animal fats or by-products, just a whole lot of fruits (wild apples, bananas, apricots), nuts and spices. The end result is vegetal and complex, with sun-warmed hints of fresh tomato, bell pepper and basil in the nose and on the palate. Black pepper and peat-like smoke add a darker note, finishing with a spearmint jolt.

title: Gracias a Dios Mezcal Tobalá
description: Look for delicate hints of white floral and vanilla in the nuanced, slightly sweet aroma. On the palate, light sweetness is chased by smoke, finishing with a citrusy, fresh herb lilt.

title: Wahaka Mezcal Jabali Joven
description: The aroma is deliciously savory, evoking zesty hints of tomato and dried herbs. The palate opens with fleeting sweetness, leading to rounded, smoky midpalate and a long finish tinged with menthol, spearmint and fresh rosemary.

title: Mezcales de Leyenda San Luis Potosí
description: The aroma almost suggests a Bloody Mary with its mix of tomato water, lemon balm, cilantro and saline sea breeze. The palate is gently sweet and lemony, with minimal smoke and a light, almost foamy texture. Sip or mix.

title: Creyente Mezcal Joven
description: The aroma mixes honey and floral notes with a zestier zing. On the palate, the balance shifts, with bold zesty-savory notes coming forward and floral and mineral notes taking a more subtle role. A ribbon of smoke ties it all together and wafts into the finish.

title: Mezcal Santa Pedrera
description: The aroma suggests roasted peppers, comfortingly warm and bold. The silky, herbaceous palate evokes fresh oregano and mint. A gentle echo of roasted-pepper sweetness joins on the exhale, accented by black pepper and mild smoke.

title: Mayalen Mezcal Borrego
description: Brisk and refreshing, expect a citrusy explosion on nose and palate, with waxy lemon peel and lemon verbena followed by pine, cilantro, fresh bay leaf and mint, plus a drying, lip-smacking finish marked by cayenne heat.

title: Gracias a Dios Mezcal Tepextate
description: Think of this as an alternative to smoky mezcal. The bright scent offers lemon peel, fresh basil, chipotle pepper and a slightly soapy floral note. Delicate, zingy lemon notes lead the palate, which has an effervescent feel, finishing with perky white pepper and ginger sparks.

title: Mezcal Amarás Cupreata
description: A savory-sweet roasted bell pepper scent leads the nose. The palate opens with a flurry of black and cayenne pepper; sweet smoke, reminiscent of cigar smoke, takes over midpalate, drying to a complex finish mingling smoke and peppery heat, wrapped with gentle almond sweetness on the warming fade.

title: Mezcal Amarás Espadín
description: White pepper and lime peel open the light, bone-dry palate, chased by a modest amount of smoke and a peppery, piquant finish that echoes the mouthwatering citrus note. Best Buy.

title: Viejo Indecente
description: Complex, light and crisp, look for dried oregano, lavender and mineral-y wet slate. Mellow honey and vanilla sweetness is perked up by grapefruit peel on the drying finish.

title: Espiritu Lauro Mezcal Artesanal
description: The muscular aroma evokes rubber, petrol and a whiff of fresh oregano. Brisk herbaceous notes on the palate—rosemary, pine, a hint of lemon peel—almost suggest a gin, set against a core of rubber and smoke. Finishes dry and bracing, with herbal notes returning on the exhale.

title: Sombra Mezcal
description: This smoky mezcal is reminiscent of peated Scotch. It opens with fleeting vanilla-almond sweetness and quickly accelerates into a smoky midpalate, finishing with menthol, black pepper and an earthy hint of dark chocolate. Sip or mix. Best Buy.

title: Don Amado Arroqueño
description: Savory and herbaceous, look for bold cracked pepper, roasted jalapeño and honey on the nose and palate, finishing with mouthwatering salinity and a menthol-like exhale.

title: Bozal Mezcal Espadín-Barril-Mexicano Ensamble
description: Expect a concentrated smoky profile, from start to finish. This mezcal opens with menthol and mint, backed by vanilla-sugar sweetness in the background. The midpalate turns smoky and piny, like embers billowing in the forest, and finishes relatively fiery, echoing a smoky menthol note.

title: Gracias a Dios Mezcal Espadín Reposado
description: Aged four months in American oak, this reposado mezcal has a pale straw hue and vanilla and cigar wrapper aromas. The buttery palate integrates almond sweetness with sweet smoke and peppery-clove spice.

title: Mezcal Amarás Espadín
description: White pepper and lime peel open the light, bone-dry palate, chased by a modest amount of smoke and a peppery, piquant finish that echoes the mouthwatering citrus note. Best Buy.

title: Gracias a Dios Mezcal Cuixe
description: Dried herbs dominate the nose and palate, but look also for mild smoke, graphite and a fiery finish that incorporates cayenne, black pepper and intriguing hints of lavender and dark chocolate.

title: Bozal Mezcal Ancestral
description: An appealing mix of sweet and savory, this mezcal opens with vanilla, coconut and roasted pepper sweetness, then the drying finish is grassy and accented with ginger and cinnamon heat, plus a surprising red-berry note on the exhale.

title: Don Amado Rustico
description: The peppery scent suggests jalapeño and roasted tomato. Meanwhile, the palate shows a pineapple-like sweetness layered with white pepper and habanero heat, finishing with an intense alcohol wallop.

title: Tres Papalote Mezcal
description: Actor Cheech Marin is a partner in the brand. Look for a bright spearmint aroma with zesty undertones. On the palate, horseradish-like pungency dominates, then the finish is grassy and gentle, with a faint puff of smoke on the exhale.

title: Vago Mexicano
description: The mild aroma suggests dried tomato and a hint of agave sweetness. That agave note is echoed on the palate, plus hints of menthol, fresh mint and lavender. Distinctly drying, with a wave of alcohol heat.

title: Gracias a Dios Mezcal Espadín
description: Overall, a mix of fresh herbs, gentle smoke and agave sweetness. Hints of honey, tropical fruit and almond lead the palate, while the midpalate offers cooling mint and rosemary. The brisk, fiery finish warms up with habanero heat.

title: Machetazo Mezcal
description: Mixing herbaceous and fruity notes, the palate explodes with mint leaves and fresh rosemary, winding into a lemon and grapefruit peel finish accented by white pepper.

title: Don Amado Largo
description: Bold and herbaceous, this mezcal is moderately smoky, punctuated by bursts of lemon, fresh sage, spearmint and cayenne heat on the smoky exhale. The alcohol heat can be tongue-numbingly fiery, but it's the price for bold flavor here.

title: Mayalen Mezcal Guerrero
description: The fresh, sweet aroma nods to candied lemon peel and vanilla. The palate is more vegetal, mixing those citrusy notes with pine needles, fresh jalapeño and black pepper heat. The drying, rather hot finish reminds that this is an overproof spirit.

title: Mezcal Alipus Ensamble
description: An initial citrus peel scents open up to a savory, almost meaty aroma. The drying palate shows lots of citrus up front with a savory undertone, finishing with cinnamon and cayenne sting.

title: Vago Madrecuixe Jarquin
description: The mildly sweet, mineral-like aroma lures you in with wet slate, fresh tarragon and a breezy saline hint. The crisp palate echoes these notes, but on a grander scale, resounding with menthol and petrol, finishing big and relatively fiery with sea salt, smoke and slate.

title: Wahaka Mezcal
description: A minerally profile leads the nose and palate, suggesting wet rocks, pencil lead, petrol and fresh rosemary. The long, drying finish offers anise and plenty of black pepper, clove and jalapeño heat.

title: Old Reserve 1998 Plantation Rum
description: This limited-edition single cask rum is made with 100% pressed sugar, similar to rhum agricole. Golden hued, this rum features butterscotch notes and an unusual smoky accent, leading it to read almost like a slightly sweet whiskey. Made by Cognac Ferrand.

title: Deep Matured Gold Rum Phraya
description: A rum from Thailand? That's correct, made with Thai sugar cane and aged between seven and 12 years in warehouses “sited over cool lagoons,” the producer says. The end result is a rich burnished-gold color and a light, enticing aroma melding citrusy and creamy vanilla notes. The flavors run to cola and crème brûlée, finishing smooth with a generous dose of baking spices notes. The exotic, gift-worthy bottle is tall, slim and overlaid with gold metal latticework.

title: Rhum J.M Gold Rum
description: The aroma of this golden rum combines brown sugar and fresh-cut grass. On the tongue, flavors evoke bananas Foster, with brown sugar caramelized goodness enlivened by allspice, ginger, cinnamon and sea salt. This would be a natural in Ti'punches and other fruity cocktails.

title: Glaser Distillery White Rum
description: Made from blackstrap molasses, this white rum has more warmth and character than many long-aged amber rums. It has a sweet, funky character, reminiscent of vanilla frosting and ripe pears, plus clove and black pepper sparks.

title: Cruzan Estate Diamond Light Rum
description: Part of the “Distiller's Collection” launching in September 2013, this light rum has a faint straw color and sugary aroma with a touch of pineapple. On the palate, look for toasted coconut and marshmallow, with a hint of oak and lime peel on the brisk, crisp finish. Made with a blend of rums between five and 12 years old. Recommended for tropical drinks.

title: Siesta Key Spiced Rum
description: Made with molasses from Florida sugarcane, with honey and spices added, this sunny golden spiced rum is smooth and pleasant, suitable for a wide range of cocktails. On the palate, the flavor is vanilla-forward and similar to cola. Yet it's not overly sweet and allows nutmeg and cinnamon to shine through.

title: Papa's Pilar Dark
description: Developed in conjunction with Ernest Hemingway's estate, this deep, dark rum blended in the Solera style and finished in Spanish Sherry casks will satisfy tipplers with a sweet tooth. It reads almost like a spiced rum—soft and sweet, with notes of brown sugar, toffee, sasparilla and allspice, though it also has some dry aspects on the finish, showing baking spices, leather and dark chocolate.

title: Cruzan Estate Diamond Dark Rum
description: Part of the “Distiller's Collection” launching in September 2013, this tawny, well-balanced rum has a mild vanilla aroma and flavor, finishing with ginger and black pepper. Made with a blend of rums between five and 12 years old.

title: Cruzan Estate Diamond Dark Rum
description: Part of the “Distiller's Collection” launching in September 2013, this tawny, well-balanced rum has a mild vanilla aroma and flavor, finishing with ginger and black pepper. Made with a blend of rums between five and 12 years old.

title: Clément Aged 10 Years Tres Vieux Rhum Agricole
description: Aged in charred oak barrels, this rum offers dense honey, vanilla and tropical fruit aromas. On the palate, the fruit takes center stage, finishing with a spicy ginger and cinnamon flourish, and a persistent resin-like note.

title: Caña Brava
description: This bartender-owned brand has created a light, nearly neutral rum perfect for mixing into Papa Dobles and other cocktails. Though barrel--aged for three years and blended with older rums, the appearance is nearly clear, with just a faint golden tinge. Relatively neutral on the nose and palate, this rum almost reads like vodka, with pleasant marshmallow, ginger and lime zest notes on the clean finish.

title: RumChata
description: Though modeled after horchata, a Mexican drink made with ground almonds, rice and cinnamon, this liqueur is made with rum and cream. It has an opaque, milky appearance, almondy notes and a spiced aroma. Thick, velvety and tongue-coating, this liqueur-like rum evokes egg nog and goes down easy.

title: Clément Premiere Canne Rhum Agricole
description: The aroma of this clear rum is like a breeze: herbal, grassy and fresh. Look for a soft feel, with a touch of fruity flavor and a mouthwatering, slightly salty finish not unlike Manzanilla Sherry or even buttered popcorn.

title: Cayrum
description: This sunny golden-orange liqueur is made with rum aged for three years prior to infusion with honey, ginger and host of other spices. Consider swapping out triple sec in a cocktail for this spicy-sweet liqueur, with its notes of orange peel, cardamom and warm honey. Or pair a small glassful with sticky baklava or other honeyed desserts.

title: Shellback Caribbean Spiced Rum
description: This new entrant into the spiced rum category from wine giant Gallo is golden and bright, and should blend seamlessly into rum & Cokes and other mixed drinks. Like many spiced rums, Shellback is dominated by vanilla, although it has a mellow, oaky edge and cinnamon and nutmeg highlights too.

title: Cruzan Key Lime Rum
description: Clear, bright and easy-drinking, this is an ideal flavored rum for the vodka-tonic set. It has a sweet, ersatz limeade aroma and flavor, and finishes cleanly with bold lime-zest flavor and a tart, mouthwatering quality at the back of the tongue. Top with soda or tonic for a mojito-style long drink.

title: Rhum J.M. White Rum
description: This clear rum has faintly tropical fruit aromas and flavors, with a concentrated sweetness and marshmallow-like aftertaste. With its strong alcohol presence, some might liken it to moonshine. Use its sweet character to advantage in mai-tais and other exotic cocktails.

title: Cruzan Passion Fruit Rum
description: This clear flavored rum has the potential to give flavored vodkas a run for the money in building flavored 'tinis and other mixed drinks. The ersatz, fruity aroma and flavor evoke lychee and bubble gum, although some berry notes come through into the clean finish.

title: Papa's Pilar Blonde
description: Developed in conjunction with Ernest Hemingway's estate, this solera-blended rum has a pale straw color and rich brown sugar aroma. Despite an odd plastic note midpalate, this rum finishes with lots of bold vanilla and sticky brown sugar, and should do well mixed with ginger ale, or in any cocktail where a sweet note is desired.

title: Shellback Caribbean Silver Rum
description: This new entrant into the white rum category from wine giant Gallo is clear, with a sweet, very fruity nose and mild flavor that mixes vanilla and a touch of pineapple. Value-priced and meant for mixing.

title: Evan Williams Single Barrel Vintage 2002 Edition
description: Extremely flavorful and rich, with a lush caramel scent and notes of butterscotch, hazelnut, toffee and fig. Savor with an ice cube or two. The 2002 edition represents the 17th year of production for this bottling.

title: Evan Williams Single Barrel Vintage 2003 Edition
description: Evan Williams has released a vintage Bourbon every year since 1986, and they tend to be excellent. The 2003 edition upholds that reputation, layering butterscotch, sturdy oak and rich maple, and finishing mellow and smooth. Recommended for sipping straight up, or with ice.

title: Hillrock Solera Aged Bourbon Whiskey
description: From master distiller Dave Pickerell, this estate-grown, field-to-flask offering makes good use of oloroso Sherry barrels. Look for peach and vanilla aromas, bold raisin and brown sugar flavors and a gentle exit that just hints at Sherry. At nearly 93 proof, the alcohol makes its presence known, so add some water or vermouth if you must. Attractive and substantial squared bottle.

title: Parker's Heritage Collection
description: This limited edition (6,000 bottles) Bourbon finished in Cognac barrels has a rich amber color with orange highlights, and enticing aromas of raisin and chocolate. This full-bodied wow of a whiskey coats the palate with big, rich flavors, leaving a lingering finish of toffee, orange peel and espresso. It's 100 proof, so keep the branchwater on hand.
