title: Bulleit Bourbon Frontier Whiskey
description: Golden and bright, this straight Bourbon whiskey is one of the most versatile around. Though it starts with a sweet flavor profile with hints of vanilla and cookie dough, it finishes supple and dry, with notes of leather, black   tea and cinnamon. Bracing alcohol levels.

title: Sazerac Rye
description: Versatile, crisp, and an ideal match for cocktails that also include orange liqueur, as well as its namesake classic cocktail. Light aromas include vanilla and a touch of juicy citrus. Flavors run to bitter orange, dark chocolate and black tea, finishing with a pepper tingle. Velvety feel, despite the brisk alcohol.

title: Wild Turkey Rye
description: Made with a mix of 4- and 5-year-old rye whiskies and aged in barrels with “alligator” char to add more flavor, this relatively new offering is delicious. Look for a bright, saturated golden color and sweet vanilla and fruit aromas. On the palate, it has a soft texture and rounded feel, and lingering caramel notes pepped up with the bold spiciness characteristic of rye.

title: Angel's Envy Cask Strength
description: Some might prefer the more sippable regular-strength version, but for those seeking higher proof, this lively expression is surely a contender in the growing cask-strength category. The nose is rich with touches of peach and toffee, while the palate finds velvety caramel and dark-fruit notes attributable to a turn in Port barrels. 600 bottles released.

title: Angels Envy Rye Whiskey
description: This honey-hued rye has a remarkable aroma, melding cookie dough, hazelnut and marzipan. The same luscious flavors show up on the palate, rich and sweet, leading into a confected finish of Nutella sprinkled with nutmeg and cinnamon. The sugar-and-spice effect is due to 18 months finishing time in casks that first held Cognac, then Caribbean rum.

title: Dickel Rye Whisky
description: Despite a mash bill of 95% rye and 5% malted barley, this golden-bright, small-batch rye is smooth and not as spicy as other rye whiskies. It has a surprising freshness, with bold vanilla, nut, fresh apple and white-flower aromas leaping out of the glass. While charred-oak flavors hit the palate first (it's matured in charred oak barrels for at least five years), it finishes downright buttery, touched with ginger and maple sweetness.

title: Père Magloire XO Calvados
description: Aged nine years, this brandy retains a lightness where many veer toward over-oaked. It's bright and tawny in the glass, with a rich caramel aroma accented by baked apple. The palate starts with dried apricot, cedar, oak and tea, deepening to baked apple, vanilla and a light wash of caramel on the finish.

title: LeCompte Originel Calvados Pays d'Auge
description: Light golden in the glass, this spirit has a restrained honey and fresh pear scent. The flavor is correspondingly mild, showing honey and almond, plus a resin-like note midpalate, before finishing with gentle hints of pear, white flowers and ginger. Recommended for mixing.

title: Christian Drouin Sélection Calvados
description: Light gold in the glass, the scent suggests fresh apple and pear, honeysuckle and vanilla. The palate is light, showing lots of vanilla, hints of fruit and an intriguing, very faint smokiness on the clove-accented finish. Sip or mix.

title: Menorval Prestige Calvados
description: Made with brandies aged two to three years, this Calvados features a ripe pear aroma. It's a bit tannic and drying, with a resin-like note up front that mellows into chamomile tea and sandalwood, plus baked pear and baking spice on the finish.

title: Lecompte 5 Years Old
description: The aroma suggests baked apple and caramel, plus a hint of cedar. The palate leads with a resin-like note, leading into cedar, spice, and chamomile tea, finishing with hints of dried apricot, cooked banana and vanilla. Feels relatively hot.

title: Usquaebach Blended Malt Scotch Whisky Aged 15
description: A blend of selected Highland malts from the proprietor's “own special reserve,” this is a complex, lovely sipper to savor. The rich bouquet offers dried apricot, sherry, vanilla and baked apple. The robust, rounded palate is relatively dry, resonating with almost Bourbon-like leather, tobacco, tea and oak, finishing in long, mouthwatering notes of orange peel and spice, and just a hint of peat.

title: Usquaebach Old Rare Blended Scotch Whisky, 2015 Release
description: This gorgeous blended Scotch opens with Sherried notes of apricot and honey on the nose and silky palate, winding into a long, smooth vanilla finish and a warming sprinkle of cinnamon. A splash of water opens up more lemon cream, vanilla and white flower notes.

title: The Exceptional Malt Scotch Whisky by Sutcliffe & Son
description: Made in collaboration with Willie Phillips—who for 23 years was The Macallan's managing director—this blend of malts offers an enticing, breezy bouquet that evokes fresh apples, pears, vanilla and white flowers. The silky palate leads with vanilla and lemon peel, with a core of peat smoke that builds gradually with repeated sips before finishing on lemon-cream pie and baking spice tones. The fade is delicate and ethereal.

title: Compass Box Circus
description: What's unusual about this limited-edition bottling is that it's made primarily with long-aged lots of whisky, which results in a deep, brooding, complex flavor profile. Each sip brings deep, rich toffee and caramel flavors, drying to leather, espresso, chamomile tea and amaro-like hints of roots and bark. It finishes with a gentle spice accent and the barest wisp of smoke.

title: Kirkland Signature Blended Scotch Whisky Aged 27 Years
description: A mix of Highland and Lowland whiskies, this topaz-hued sipper offers bold pear and caramel scents. On the palate, creamy, palate-coating caramel leads, while fruity flavors—pear, tropical fruit and marmalade—emerge midpalate before finishing with a gentle smoky-spiced fade.

title: The Feathery Blended Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Made from a blend of rare and old Highland malts, this tawny Scotch is earthy and complex. The aroma mixes baked apple, subtle smoke and toffee richness. The palate is relatively restrained, starting with unsweetened chocolate and campfire smoke that evolves into a smoky-spiced midpalate tinged with espresso. It finishes long, with subtle, earthy funk reminiscent of aged cheeses. The name refers to a predecessor of the golf ball, a leather hide stuffed with chicken feathers.

title: Kirkland Signature Blended Scotch Whisky Aged 24 Years
description: The restrained aroma hints at coconut, vanilla, almond and tropical fruit. Those flavors are amplified on the bold palate, followed by a brisk, spicy, mouthwatering finish that offers plenty of orange peel, clove, nutmeg and black pepper.

title: Chivas Regal Ultis Blended Scotch Whisky
description: The aroma of this tawny whisky is distinctly fruit forward, packed with apples, pears and peaches, as well as honey and Sherry notes in the background. The palate reads as relatively dry at first, showing leather, cigar wrapper and oak, plus a fleeting dark-honey note midpalate that rounds out to a crème brûlée sensation. It finishes with clove-spiked warmth and a mouthwatering flash of salinity.

title: The Lost Distillery Company Benachie
description: Part of a series, this is Lost Distillery's take on what Benachie Distillery's whisky might taste like today, had it not closed in 1913. It has a notably dark amber hue, and a bouquet that suggests toffee and campfire smoke. On the palate, it's a relatively dry sip, starting with toffee but unpacking slow-building smoke, clove and burnt orange peel, and finishing with cigar wrapper, unsweetened chocolate and spice. A good contemplative sipper. Best Buy.

title: The Lost Distillery Company Towiemore
description: Had the Dufftown/Speyside Towiemore Distillery not closed in 1931, this is Lost Distillery's take on what the whiskey might taste like today, part of a series. This blended Scotch has a copper penny hue and an aroma that intertwines light peat smoke with baked pear and tea. The palate shows cocoa, peat smoke, cigar wrapper and tea, finishing with clove sparks in a long, warm, smoky and chocolaty finish. Best Buy.

title: Compass Box Great King Street Glasgow Blend
description: This robust bottling is a permanent addition to the Great King range, added in 2014. Light golden in the glass, look for a lightly smoky aroma with fresh pear notes underneath. On the palate, a waft of peat smoke mingles with lemon cream, vanilla and pear, flavors supplied by Sherry cask-aged whiskies. Slight salinity sets the mouth watering. Best Buy.

title: Usquaebach Reserve Blended Scotch Whiskey
description: Made with a blend of rare whiskies aged 16, 17 and 18 years, combined with younger malts. Look for a bright yellow-gold hue and fresh, grassy fragrance with a mild heather note. The palate is smooth and light, layering smooth, mild grassy and floral notes with gentle billows of peat smoke, finishing with bracing hints of cinnamon and clove. Best Buy.

title: John Barr Reserve Blend Blended Scotch Whisky
description: A mix of malt and grain whiskies from the Highland and Speyside regions yields a fresh apple scent accented by a touch of vanilla. On the palate, this is smooth, light and easy-sipping, leading with vanilla and caramel, plus gentle peat smoke floating into a baking spice finish. Sip or mix. Best Buy.

title: The Exceptional Blend By Sutcliffe & Son
description: Created in collaboration with Willie Phillips (who for 23 years was The Macallan's managing director), this blended Scotch has a yellow-gold hue and mild vanilla-bean scent. It's silky on the palate, with vanilla and a touch of coconut segueing into a mildly smoky exhale, with lingering peat and iodine notes. A touch of lemon cream pie smooths out the finish.

title: Compass Box Enlightenment
description: This new limited-edition blended Scotch has a notably pale straw hue and a delectably juicy aroma that suggests fresh apple slices and tropical fruit. The palate surprises with gentle smoke, which drifts into the fruity, vanilla-tinged finish that echoes the aroma. Overall, it's a delicate, pleasing sip.

title: Wemyss Malts Peat Chimney Blended Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Peat-lovers will enjoy this blended Scotch, which leads with smoke and baked pear on the nose and a heavy dose of peat on the palate. A bit of honeyed sweetness underpins notes of smoke, iodine, soot and charred oak, accelerating straight through to the rounded, peppery finish. Best Buy.

title: The Lost Distillery Company Lossit
description: Had Islay's Lossit Distillery not closed in 1867, this is Lost Distillery's interpretation of what the whisky might taste like today, part of a series. This golden Scotch has a peaty aroma, with a honeyed undercurrent. Notably smooth and silky on the palate, a medicinal, iodine note leads on the palate, followed by bold peat smoke and hints of BBQ-like mesquite. A faint citrus note plays on the smoky, peppery fade. A splash of water helps temper the lip--numbing alcohol heat.

title: Wemyss Malts The Hive
description: While the aroma shows honey, vanilla and stone fruit, those flavors are obscured on the palate by a front-loaded blast of peat smoke and iodine. Eventually, the smoke clears to allow a little honey and dried apricot to peek through, but the smoke obscures most nuance, which is unfortunate for a bottling meant to showcase its honeyed character. It finishes with touches of ginger and black pepper heat.

title: HM The King Blended Scotch Whisky
description: Light goldenrod hued, the mild scent of this Scotch is honeyed yet fresh, with some tropical fruit vibrancy. The mild palate layers vanilla and fruit, and most of the flavor lingers through to the long finish, which drips with honey and gingery spice. Recommended for mixing into highballs.

title: Wemyss Malts Spice King
description: The fresh bouquet features honey and heather, while the palate is a little warmer, showing dried apricot, baked apple and honey. The sweet-spiced finish highlights clove and cayenne heat, interwoven with a bit of peat smoke and alcohol bite.

title: Kirkland Signature Blended Scotch Whisky Aged 12 Years
description: The fresh, appealing scent offers notes of apples and pears. The relatively hot palate echoes that fruitiness, plus a sprinkle of cinnamon. Stone fruit and honey smooth out the spiced finish.

title: Hankey Bannister Blended Scotch Whisky Original
description: Mild vanilla and coconut mark the nose and palate. Most of the flavor is on the spicy finish, which shows cinnamon and cayenne sizzle plus mouthwatering salinity and a punch of alcohol heat.

title: Kirkland Signature Blended Scotch Whisky
description: Look for mild peat smoke, cedar and resin notes that lead into a spicy finish, with a flourish of alcohol heat. A splash of water coaxes out more vanilla and honey.

title: Brennivin Special Cask Selection
description: This limited-edition “winter aquavit” is finished in former Bourbon and oloroso Sherry casks. The end result is an excellent sipping spirit, exploding with vanilla and fresh pear sweetness. The finish is long and complex, with hints of banana, rye bread, baking spice and subtle smokiness.

title: Dopo Teatro Cocchi Vermouth Amaro
description: This silky, garnet-hued sipper features a double dose of bitter quinine, but don't worry, it doesn't read as especially bitter. It features an enticing spiced-cherry scent and a flavor that suggests cherry compote, with a violet lilt on the finish and just the right amount of bitter edge. Sip or mix.

title: Drapo Rosso Vermouth
description: The raisiny aroma is an indicator of the dried date- and raisin-flavored palate, which finishes with a lightly amaro-like bitter edge. A cocktail-friendly red vermouth.

title: Vermouth del Professore Rosso All'Uso di Torino
description: Aged six months in large wooden barrels, this sweet vermouth is zesty and mildly spicy on the nose and palate. Flavors layer molasses and maple with dried sage and savory spices, plus a hint of orange peel in the back.

title: Miró Vermut Rojo
description: The mild aroma has a medicinal tinge, while the palate shows plenty of dark fruit up front, drying to a relatively tannic finish. Notes of cocoa, dried dates, dark honey, sarsaparilla and cardamom round out each sip. Suggested for whiskey-based cocktails.

title: Routin Vermouth Rouge
description: A discordant molasses and dried oregano scent precedes a smooth, honeyed palate mixed with dried dates and figs. It finishes with dried herbs and cardamom, with a drying feel.

title: BroVo Jammy Sweet Vermouth
description: Made with a base of Washington State Merlot, this deep purple vermouth skews a bit drier than the “jammy” moniker suggests. That's not really a knock—this vermouth will appeal to those who love big red wines meant to pair with steaks. It features a savory dried-herb aroma, with just a touch of fruit underneath, while the flavor is quite spicy, suggesting cayenne and lots of cracked black pepper. A subtle blackberry and raspberry fruit flavor lies underneath, finishing dry and herb-touched.

title: BroVo Pink Rosé Vermouth
description: Made with a base of Washington State Pinot Noir, this vermouth has a rosy, saturated hue and a bright scent that suggests rosewater and fresh raspberries. The palate reads as quite sweet and very floral, with a cherry juice finish that hints at bubble gum. Developed by a bartender, perhaps this was engineered with a specific cocktail in mind, but most will find the dominant floral note a bit heavy-handed.

title: 3 Howls Blood Orange Flavored Vodka
description: The light aroma mingles orange, lemon and a faint floral note. The palate shows juicy, bouncy, lively tangerine flavor, finishing with a gentle hint of anise. Overall, it's complex and light, with just the right amount of flavor for cocktails and punches without being overpowering.

title: Silo Vodka
description: Nuanced, flavorful and clean, this offers a light scent that mixes vanilla and citrus. The smooth palate has mild sweetness that suggests cocoa and almond, but finishes citrusy and brisk, with a fleeting pine note. It will please those seeking a vodka that's neutral but not bland. Distilled from Vermont corn.

title: Claremont Vodka
description: Soft and mild, this potato vodka has a neutral aroma and flavor, finishing clean with the barest earthy-cocoa note on the exit. Mix it into chilled vodka martinis.

title: Charbay Vodka
description: With touches of almond sweetness and a faint citrusy note on the smooth finish, this vodka made from corn and rye will please those seeking a pure, neutral canvas, with just enough nuance to keep things interesting.

title: Cardinal Spirits Vodka
description: Wine-lovers will approve: this vodka is made from white grapes that are fermented in Italian wine tanks and then distilled. The result is an enticing cocoa character on the nose and creamy palate, along with subtle vanilla braced with alcohol heat on the nutmeg-accented finish. Overall it's a versatile, mixable vodka.

title: Square One Bergamot
description: Light, complex and not overly sweet, this flavored vodka offers a warm, welcoming orange-peel scent that reads more like bitter orange on the palate, accented with cardamom and ginger heat. This rye-based vodka is infused with bergamot, mandarin, navel orange and tangerine—a whole lot of citrus in one bottle.

title: Black Raspberry Bramble
description: Rosy in the glass, this dangerously easy-sipping vodka features fruity-floral notes of raspberry and hibiscus. A delicate cantaloupe note comes midpalate, with pleasing, mouthwatering tartness around the edges. Sip or mix—or follow the producer's unusual suggestion to cellar this flavored vodka like wine, for additional mellowness.

title: Vodkila Straight
description: A blend of 80% corn vodka and 20% blanco tequila, bottled in Michigan, this offers a warm honey aroma and soft, slightly viscous texture. The palate echoes honey sweetness and layers in plenty of spice: cinnamon, nutmeg, white pepper and a long finish featuring gentle cayenne heat.

title: 49th Parallel Vodka
description: This robust, corn-based vodka has an earthy aroma that hints at cacao, plus a slight raspberry-jam fruitiness. The cacao note is echoed on the palate, finishing surprisingly long and spicy, if a little bit hot. Mix into White Russians and other dessert-like drinks.

title: Square One Organic Vodka
description: The neutral aroma hints at orange peel. On the palate, this vodka is silky, with a faint anise note and a brisk, bracing finish. It's ideal for vodka martinis and other cocktails. Made from 100% organic rye.

title: Mayfair English Vodka
description: This brisk, crisp vodka is all about nuance. Although it's neutral overall, hints of citrus peel and cinnamon sweetness and spice give a warming impression. Sip or mix.

title: Texas Pride Vodka
description: This corn-based vodka, “created by Texans for Texas,” has a neutral aroma and smooth, pleasing palate marked by subtle marshmallow sweetness and sparks of black pepper on the finish.

title: Re:Find Vodka Finished in Barrel
description: The base is distilled from red wine grapes, and the vodka is then barrel-aged. The end result is an experimental bottling that looks, smells and tastes like a young Bourbon. It's oak-forward at first sip, but finishes round and luscious, with plenty of caramel and cinnamon-clove sparks. Slip it into a blind tasting alongside traditional whiskey and watch Bourbon-lovers lose their minds. Newly released June 2016.

title: Deep Eddy Vodka
description: Relatively neutral and versatile, this light, silky vodka shows almond sweetness and finishes with an echo of cinnamon spice. It's ideal for a wide range of cocktails.

title: Dirk's Texas Vodka
description: Distilled from grapes, this vodka has a neutral aroma with the faintest touch of almond sweetness. The palate is silky and lightly sweet, suggesting almond and cocoa powder, and finishing with a flicker of alcohol heat

title: Chopin Rye Vodka
description: Relatively neutral on the palate, this vodka has soft vanilla and caraway scents and a subtle but surprising rich dark-chocolate undercurrent. It finishes clean, with a flicker of ginger heat.

title: Native Nectar Organic Vodka
description: Pot-distilled from “Northern Colorado maize,” an heirloom variety of corn, it offers a sweet, mild vanilla scent. The viscous palate also shows vanilla-almond sweetness and a flourish of black-pepper heat on the finish. Small batch.

title: Wyborowa Wodka
description: Overall, this rye-based vodka is neutral and pristine, with a faint sweetness on the nose and a palate that hints at bitter almond. It offers a modest peppery bite on the finish. Recommended for Bloody Marys and other savory sips.

title: St. George All Purpose Vodka
description: Distilled from grain and fruit—specifically, Bartlett pears—this complex vodka doesn't have the neutral profile some vodka drinkers expect. The warm scent suggests roasted almonds. On the palate, vanilla and almond intertwine with a mild sweetness that recalls agave, with a barely perceptible, mouthwatering salinity. The finish is malty and roasty. The overall effect is a vodka that ever-so-subtly winks at the whiskey bottle down the shelf.

title: She's Wild Vodka
description: Made from Idaho wheat and packaged with horse imagery on the bottle, this vodka is generally neutral on the nose and palate, finishing with warming notes of burnt orange peel and spice.

title: 50 Bleu Ultra Premium Vodka
description: Made from rye, this vodka leads with a neutral bouquet, with just the faintest earthy whiff. The palate echoes that earthiness, with mild, long-lasting marshmallow sweetness on the finish. It feels light.

title: Duckworth Vodka French Oak Barrel
description: This golden-hued specialty bottling is a cane-based vodka that's rested in French oak wine barrels. The result is a light almond scent and pronounced vanilla on the palate, finishing with oak and maple.

title: Dillon's Small Batch Distillers Method 95 Vodka
description: Made from Niagara wine grapes, this vodka has a slightly sweet profile, hinting at banana, lychee and marshmallow. It's surprisingly thick and velvety, but would be pleasing served well chilled for straight-up sipping or mixed into fruity cocktails.

title: Stolichnaya Vodka Gluten Free
description: This new extension to the Stoli line-up is made from a blend of corn and buckwheat. It's relatively neutral, with a moderately viscous feel, mild sweetness midpalate and a clean finish that hints at bitter lemon.

title: Aqua Perfecta Kirsch Eau-de-Vie Cherry Brandy
description: The sublime bouquet offers authentic, ripe scents of red cherry; aeration stimulates deeper red cherry fruit and juice smells. Palate entry is delicate, elegant, intensely fruit stone-like and astringent; midpalate features the flowery taste of unaged distillate that complements the cherry fruit tastes. Finishes grandly and firmly, with a welcome touch of oiliness. Wow.

title: Arakú Rum & Coffee Liqueur
description: The nosing passes find true, delightful scents of black coffee; a beany, dusty, dry and charming aroma. Palate entry is coffee bean-bitter and keenly roasted; at midpalate the taste turns plump and sweet (but not overly so) and well balanced with the coffee bean intensity. Concludes more bitter and beany than sweet.

title: Aqua Perfecta Poire Williams Pear Liqueur
description: The lovely, understated bouquet smells of ripe pear and pear peel initially; aeration releases hints of vegetation, delicate spice and pear pulp. Palate entry is juicy, lean and tart, with subtle background citrus notes; midpalate features delicious, mouthpuckering, sour candy-like flavors of pear juice and pear peel. Ends charmingly tart, yet ripe and authentic.

title: Dooley's Original Toffee Cream Liqueur
description: First whiffs detect slightly metallic nougat-like scents; aeration brings out plentiful savory aromas of baking spice and toffee. Palate entry is nutty, slightly bitter and only moderately sweet and creamy; midpalate is lush, almondy, slightly fruity and candied without being cloying. Ends with notable creaminess and a very pleasant toffee core flavor.

title: Bache-Gabrielsen Natur & Eleganse XO Cognac
description: Nice nutty aromas countered with subtle notes of tropical fruit. Palate entry features roasted tastes of toasted wheat bread, buttered almonds, nougat and sweet oak. Concludes with a bit of tobacco leaf, prune, fig and honey. Lithe, nutty and delicious.

title: Bache-Gabrielsen XO Fine Champagne Cognac
description: The nosing passes find scents of pork rind, palm oil, lanolin, lard, raisins, cranberry, toffee, salted butter and old leather. Palate entry finds layered flavors of cocoa bean, brown butter, bacon fat, cinnamon, fruitcake and dark caramel; midpalate offers dry, dusty flavors of mineral, prune, black raisins and figs. Finishes long, off-dry, caramel-like, lightly honeyed and silky.

title: Paul Giraud Napoleon Grande Champagne Cognac
description: The bouquet is, like the VSOP, disappointing with muted scents of dates, black raisins, holiday baking spices and pecans. Palate entry is elegant, understated and clean, properly acidic and mildly sweet; midpalate is moderately toasty and gently pruny. Finishes a touch lean. Nice, but a Grande Champagne should offer more depth.

title: Paul Giraud VSOP Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Opening sniffs detect soft aromas of clay, white grapes, and banana; aeration fails to further develop the bouquet, which is disappointing. Palate entry is medium-bodied, satiny and properly toffee-like; midpalate tastes include oak, sawdust, white raisins, figs and almonds. Ends well with good fruit-acid balance and elegance.

title: Aqua Perfecta Zinfandel Grappa
description: First nosing passes find aromas of cotton fabric, goose down and new wool blanket; aeration exposes a correct must/pomace scent. Palate entry is dry, tart, earthy and peppery; midpalate initially displays a fleeting touch of orange blossom flavor that is followed by a dominate green pepper taste. Ends on a grapy, musty note.

title: Courvoisier Exclusif Cognac
description: The pleasing bouquet features scents of raisins and prunes, with background traces of oloroso Sherry and egg cream; aeration changes the fruit smells into baked pineapple and guava aromas. Palate entry is pleasingly sweet and caramel-like; midpalate offers good balance between fruit and acid but is just a touch too candied. Concludes full, assertive, toffee-like and clean.

title: KWV 10 Year Old Brandy
description: First nosing passes find smells of toasted almonds, toasted walnuts; aeration adds scents of white raisins, white peach and marshmallow. Entry is semisweet, toffee-like and angular; midpalate displays the toastiness of the first sniffs in the forms of pastry and toasted nuts. Concludes well, medium-weighted, semisweet.

title: Gran Gala Triple Orange Liqueur
description: Initial sniffs detect fresh orange peel, nuts and background brandy notes; aeration adds notes of pineapple, tangerine and orange peel to the brandy structure. Palate entry is acidic and very orangy, with no evidence of the brandy; at midpalate the brandy emerges to complement the orange peel taste. Concludes fresh, a touch too woody and acidic.

title: Aqua Perfecta Framboise Eau-de-Vie Raspberry Brandy
description: Disappointing bouquet that is slightly metallic; aeration activates a reluctant raspberry fruit aroma. Palate entry is tart, astringent and not raspberry-like enough; midpalate stage brings out more of the raspberry fruit and pulp, but not enough to rescue it.

title: Balvenie Sherry Oak 17 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: Deep scents of charred oak, caramelized onion, bacon fat, dark honey, oloroso Sherry, dates, prunes and dark caramel. Palate entry is intensely sweet and honey-like; midpalate features toasted tastes of chocolate covered- walnuts, coffee beans and chocolate fudge. Concludes fat, chewy, and buttery. Terrific as a digestif.

title: Russell's Reserve 6 Year Old Straight Rye Whiskey
description: Initial sniffs find fruit, lanolin and vanilla bean aromas; later sniffs encounter dry grain, breakfast cereal, trail mix and dried yellow fruit. Palate entry is wonderfully oily, concentrated, off-dry and grainy; midpalate is focused on delicious tastes of rye bread, sesame seed, sesame oil, peanut oil and unsalted butter. Ends creamy, robust and elegant.

title: Evan Williams Vintage 1998 Single Barrel Kentucky Straight Bourbon Barrel #1
description: The bouquet offers aromas of peanuts, flowers, vinyl, flowers, light toffee, lead pencil and margarine. Palate entry is biscuity, popcorn-like and minerally; midpalate features intriguing flavors that include coins, oak resin, unsalted butter and that ever-present taste of popcorn. Finishes with a dash of soothing warmth. Elegant and austere.

title: Rittenhouse 23 Year Old Single Barrel Straight Rye Whiskey Barrel #8, Bottle #95
description: Delightful aromas of old leather, library books, pipe tobacco, pineapple, oak resin and trail mix. Palate entry features deep flavors of brown butter, walnut butter and palm oil; midpalate is luscious and resiny with integrated flavors of black pepper, oak and dried fruits. Finish is long, honeyed and treacle-like. Not for the faint of heart.

title: Mitchell's Glengyle Blended Whisky
description: Lightly peated and briny initially; aeration stimulates deeper, fruitier fragrances to salted pretzel, kiwi, kumquat and smoldering embers. Palate entry is salty and seaweed-like, with hints of cigarette ash and loose-leaf tobacco; midpalate highlights the briny sea air and powdered cocoa. Finishes zesty, delicately peaty and clean. Delightfully agile and lean.

title: Johnnie Walker Blue Label King George V Edition Blended Whisky
description: Slightly disappointing bouquet features smells of roasted walnut, figs, dates and beeswax. Palate entry is honey-sweet, fruitcake-like, with flavors of pineapple, apricot and white raisins; midpalate becomes deeper with layers of oak, resin, oloroso Sherry, dark caramel, dark bittersweet chocolate and egg cream. Concludes with power and grace. Delicious.

title: Bushmills 1608 Blended Irish Whiskey
description: The nosing passes find notes of almond paste, straw, brown butter, nougat, dark toffee, worn saddle leather and canola oil. Rich flavors of caramel, cocoa, and malted barley at entry; midpalate adds flavors of tapioca, old honey and butter cream on top of the intense graininess. Finishes malty sweet, buttery, oily and multilayered. Very nice.

title: Auchentoshan 18 Year Old Lowlands Single Malt Whisky Bourbon Matured/Cask Strength
description: The first nosing passes find concentrated, spirited scents and fruity aromas of pears, hazelnut and oak; aeration adds subtler notes of orange peel, paraffin and cake frosting. Palate entry is prickly, zesty and acidic; midpalate is toasty, creamy, spicy, leathery and oily. Finishes warm, moderately sweet, oily and succulent.

title: Auchentoshan 1965 40 Year Old Lowlands Single Malt Whisky
description: Delicate aromas of apple peel, dried herbs, leather, beeswax and palm oil. Palate entry is biscuity, softly Sherried and honeyed; at midpalate the alcohol turns pleasingly prickly and vibrant with cookie dough and honey tastes. Concludes on a sweet note that's just the right intensity.

title: BenRiach 1976 30 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky Single Cask/Port Pipe Finish
description: Leathery and oily in the opening waves of aroma; nougaty following further air exposure; cocoa-orangey at the very last sniff. Palate entry is tart, fresh, oaky and prickly; midpalate features tastes of old leather, prunes, dates, black raisins, marzipan, brown sugar and dark caramel. The finish goes from sweet to bittersweet, smooth to raw, and orangey to oaky.

title: James MacArthur's Old Masters 14 Year Old Peated Single Malt Irish Whiskey Cask Strength/Cask #3676
description: The bouquet features smells of rubber tire, rubber band, glue, yeast, celery, brown rice, soy, burning sage, and peat. Palate entry features sweet, malty and caramel-like tastes; midpalate becomes very smoky with a sweet, grainy leaning. Concludes delightfully sweet, malty, smoky and piquant. Great job here.

title: BenRiach Importanticus Peated Malt 12 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky Tawny Port Wood Finish
description: The first nosing passes find medicinal reek; this blows off after aeration, leaving behind delightful scents of baked pear, Key lime, meringue and joss stick. Entry is intensely spirity, and almost too hot; at midpalate the flavor becomes pastry-like, malty, fruity and moderately peaty. Finishes a touch lean, nearly astringent and pleasantly smoky.

title: Pikesville Supreme 3 Year Old Straight Rye Whiskey
description: Smells of wet blue jeans, damp soil, spring garden after a shower. Palate entry is deliciously oily, bittersweet, astringent and grainy; midpalate showcases tastes of chocolate covered orange, orange rind, honey wheat bread, fruitcake and dried red fruits. Finishes smooth, clean, decidedly sweet and nutty.

title: BenRiach Aromaticus Peated Malt 12 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky Dark Rum Wood Finish
description: The bouquet is sooty and intensely resiny. Palate entry is resiny sweet and smoky; midpalate is less aggressively peaty and deliciously malty. Concludes sooty and less sweet than the midpalate, returning to the sap and peatreek of the bouquet and entry. Uneven but good.

title: Chivas Regal 25 Year Old Blended Whisky
description: The bouquet features round, fruity fragrances supplemented by hints of light toffee and marzipan; Entry is full-bodied and oaky; midpalate features a seductively sensuous and satiny texture plus evolved flavors of caramel, maple, fudge and chocolate-covered orange peel. Finish is like chocolate-covered peanuts and honey. Very nice but I prefer the fabulous Chivas 18.

title: Mellow Corn Bottled-in-Bond Kentucky Straight Corn Whiskey
description: An uninteresting bouquet of dull aromas of canned corn and squash. Palate entry is hot and aggressive, but displays an appealing corndog plumpness; midpalate tones down the alcohol, leaving behind a fat, oily whiskey that's intensely buttery and rich in the aftertaste. A bit too awkward and rudimentary.

title: Stranahan's Colorado Whiskey Straight Rocky Mountain Whiskey Batch #14
description: Aromas of palm oil, lanolin, unsalted butter; sawdust and tar. Palate entry shows some grainy charm and sweetness as well as traces of black pepper and light caramel; midpalate offers tastes of honey, new oak, lanolin and bitter grain kernel. Ends up tarry, a bit smoky, harsh and prickly. Too raw but shows promise.

title: Jim Beam Beam & Cola
description: This r-t-d uses genuine Jim Beam Bourbon, not malt liqueur. Initial nosing pass has grainy bourbon whiskey written all over it. Tasty palate entry has both the cola and Jim Beam accounted for; the midpalate is pleasant, more off-dry than sweet and true to the Jim Beam element. Finishes savory and sweet. The real deal.

title: Canadian Gold Very Light Canadian Whisky
description: First sniffs pick up delicate, grainy aromas that are simple but mildly alluring; more air contact stimulates a caramel-like sweetness, with a trace of almonds. Palate entry is pleasingly sweet in a sugary manner; the midpalate is sugary then leans more towards honey in the finish. Unpretentious, drinkable and recommendable for whisky neophytes.

title: Duc de Loussac VS Bas Armagnac
description: Scents of wood and grapes evolve into aromas of peanuts, baked bread and oak resin. Taste is dry to off-dry, with flavors of light toffee, honey, caramel, peanut butter and marshmallow. Ends long, a little narrow in scope, and semisweet. A young Armagnac that requires a bit of patience.

title: Dalwhinnie 15 Year Old Central Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: Opening aroma is assertive, dry, with peppery scents of barley husk, grainy oil and cracked wheat wafer; seven more minutes bring out a mildly sweeter, slightly vanilla bean, brown rice-like side. Palate entry is pleasantly prickly, textured and moderately sweet; at midpalate, the taste profile turns stunningly sappy and resin-like. Finishes dry to off-dry and keenly resiny.

title: Duncan Taylor & Co., Ltd. Bunnahabhain 1967 Cask 3326 Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: Displays a strong, mildly salty sea breeze aroma plus traces of mild peat, smoke and freshly mown hay. Palate entry taste is off-dry, grassy, moderately briny and delicate; by midpalate, the flavor profile shifts gears by going sweeter, more caramel-like and malty. Ends up on the sweeter side of the scale.

title: Tequila Corralejo Blanco 100% Agave Tequila
description: Initial whiffs detect an alluring road tar/asphalt, licorice-like sweetness; aeration expands the bouquet by including smoky scents of cigarette ash, tobacco and vanilla bean. Palate entry is sweet, nearly maple-like and viscous; by midpalate, the sweetness turns intensely bitter, bean- and sap-like. Concludes sweet in the throat.

title: Svedka Clementine (Orange) Flavored Vodka
description: Opening bouquet is elusive and coy; time in the copita brings out a touch more in the way of astringent orange zest and pulp. Palate entry is clean, acidic, bittersweet and straightforward; by midpalate, the pleasantly acidic and refreshing orange pulp taste takes control. Ends understated, composed, lean and a winner, especially for the money.

title: Johnnie Walker Black Label 12 Year Old Blended Whisky
description: The opening aromas are firm, mature and biscuity; seven minutes in the copita allow this lovely blend to accentuate the subtle, sea breeze-like, saltine-like virtues even more. Palate entry is peaty and oily; by midpalate, the island/salty/baked bread influence of Talisker is undeniable. Finishes with a kiss of dark caramel.

title: Absolut Peppar Vodka
description: The piquant, intense opening bouquet offers prickly darts of black pepper and hot red chili pepper. Palate entry is mildly hot and spicy, giving off deep tastes of dried red chili pepper; at midpalate, there's a brief respite but at the finish the chili pepper heat returns, most pleasantly.

title: Gosling's Gold Bermuda Rum
description: The opening sniffings find scents of caramelized sugar and burnt match; later inhalations detect deeper scents of saddle leather, light maple and molasses. The palate entry is pleasingly sweet and intensely rum-like; at midpalate the sweetness diminishes slightly with flavors of maple, molasses, vanilla bean and cinnamon. Finishes shyly, but agreeably spicy. Best Buy.

title: Deret VSOP Cognac
description: he delightful bouquet includes notes of baked apple, marshmallow, raisins and banana with perfumy scents of carnations and honeysuckle. The palate entry displays flavors of light caramel and nougat; the midpalate tastes include marzipan, honey and candied pear. Ends up integrated and semisweet. Very nice.

title: Deret XO Cognac
description: The first sniffings find the fruity/apple/pear thumbprint detected in the VS and VSOP; later inhalations pick up pine, cedar, cardamom and a hint of sautéed butter. The palate entry is smooth, pleasantly oaky and off-dry; the semisweet midpalate flavors include dark caramel, walnut paste, oak and palm oil. Finishes woody, semisweet and nutty.

title: Scorpion Mezcal Anejo 7 Years Old
description: The first inhalations find typical mezcal scents such as rubber tire, India ink and vinyl; after more air contact the aroma adds only baked aromas, mostly of burning rubber. The palate entry is surprisingly sweet and mild; at midpalate a robust sooty flavor takes charge of the flavor. Ends up moderately sweet and smoky.

title: JB Wagoner's 100% Blue Agave Spirits
description: An initial aroma of sweet-sour scents of nail polish and flowery fresh-off-the-still spirits; later sniffings pick up vegetal, sour aromas of cucumber, lemongrass, cactus, spice and citrus. Shows some semblance of green agave at palate entry; at midpalate a pleasantly piquant smoke and charcoal sweetness takes command. Ends up sweet and vegetal.

title: Rhum Clement Creole Shrubb Rum Liqueur
description: Mildly sweet scents of orange peel and raw cocoa. The palate entry is sweet, thick and orangey, countering the sugary sweetness.

title: Clontarf Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: Delectable scents of pork sausage, malted milk, and grass; aeration time brings up sour, lemony, yeasty/doughy notes balanced by the sweet grain. The palate entry is firm, silky and moderately sweet; at midpalate there's a pleasing oiliness underpinning the sweet, grainy, lightly wooded taste profile. Finishes malty, breakfast cereal grainy, lightly honeyed, and zesty.

title: Burnett's Mango Flavored Vodka
description: The first whiffs pick up a pleasant mango meat/pulp freshness; over time, the aroma becomes slightly spicy and even green melon-like. The taste at palate entry is off-dry, suitably fruity and mango-like; at midpalate the mango flavor is less pronounced as the acidity turns stronger. Ends up nicely ripe and mellow. Best Buy.

title: Osocalis Rare Alambic Brandy/Fall 2003 Bottling
description: Initial aroma of acidic scents of grapes, green apple and citrus; aeration improves the bouquet as the fruity aromas mingle with resiny wood, distant toffee and beeswax. Palate entry offers measured sweetness and light caramel; the flavor then broadens to include charred marshmallow, dark toffee, nougat and milk chocolate. A California distiller to watch closely.

title: Scott's Selection Glen Grant 1977 Speyside Single Malt Whisky Natural Cask Strength
description: Opening aroma is alluringly creamy and toffee-like; aeration adds notes of milk chocolate, coffee with cream and candied almonds. The palate entry is sweet and sap-like; then at midpalate the flavor profile turns Sherried and intensely spirity. Finishes in a flurry of spice and caramel tastes. Add a good measure of mineral water.

title: Absolut Raspberri Raspberry Vodka
description: The opening perfume is extremely raspberry-like; aeration tones down the jammy intensity a little as the bouquet turns seed-like. The palate entry is fruity, mildly sweet, ripe and pleasant; at midpalate there's a slight embers-on-the-tongue warmth that accompanies the ripe raspberry flavor. Ends comfortably fruity and acidic.

title: Chabot 30-Year-Old Armagnac
description: Wonderful things are promised in the early nosings as baked aromas of cherry pastry, dark bread (pumpernickel?), and toffee thrill the olfactory sense; aeration doesn't advance the bouquet to the next level. Palate entry displays soft but plump flavors of toast with honey and oaky vanilla, then at midpalate there's a rush of dark caramel/toffee/honey that nearly overwhelms the taste buds. Ends sap-like.

title: Armazem Vieira Rubi Aged Artesian Cachaça Solera 8-Year-Old
description: The initial aroma says “eggs over easy”, green olive brine, and white pepper; further aeration time sees the brininess scent become reminiscent of escarole soup. The palate entry is pleasingly sweet; the midpalate stage shows even more charm as the flavor profile turns lean and sugarcane sweet. Finishes on a sweet note balanced between the sugar cane, resiny wood and eggy sourness.

title: Beleza Pura Super Premium Cachaça
description: An amazing experience of aromatic waves of beans, then raw sugar cane, burning tires, black pepper, hemp, steamed asparagus, celery salt, and tar. Tastes strongly of ash, soot and burning rubber at palate entry; at midpalate a sly sweetness acts as a foundation for smoke and tar. Finishes semisweet and smooth. Best Buy.

title: John Barr Premium Reserve 17 Year Old Blended Scotch
description: The opening nosings uncover aromas of toffee, biscuit batter and buttered corn; the bouquet expands only slightly, offering slightly pinched scents of green tomatoes, green vegetables, mint, and cedar. The palate entry offers notes of mint baked apple pastry and tea leaves; the midpalate stage is smooth, biscuity, woody, grainy sweet and very toffee-like. Concludes sweet, satiny on the tongue, smoldering/warming, and resiny.

title: Don Eduardo Triple Distilled Silver 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1110 CRT
description: The nose is fresh, vegetal and pine-like; aeration allows the pine/cedar scent to dominate the latter nosing phase. The palate entry is sweet and sap-like, almost honeyed; at midpalate the flavor profile turns bittersweet and bean-like. Ends well. Solidly made and intense.

title: Chabot Armagnac Vintage 1964
description: Opening aroma shows nicely toasted and fruity notes of oak, pine, pineapple, and banana; following aeration, the aroma evolves into a bouquet with succulent notes of deep maple, caramel and nut butter. Palate entry is rich, lip smacking sweet, and oily; at midpalate the taste profile turns cake frosting-like, sap-like, nougaty and luscious. Concludes on a minty note that undercuts the high-quality entry and midpalate phases.

title: Glengoyne Limited Edition Scottish Oak Wood Finish Central Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: Opening aroma is soft, malty and even a dash peppery; bouquet deepens considerably in the glass, emitting succulent scents of light caramel, marshmallow and almond butter. Palate entry is tight, lean and gently sweet and malty; midpalate stage shows lovely, moderately complex flavors of cocoa, black coffee, oak resin and cake frosting. Aftertaste is long, grainy sweet and austere.

title: Scott's Selection Littlemill 1984 Lowlands Single Malt Whisky
description: This grassy, green opening aroma has Lowlands written all over it; more aeration turns the aroma into a sweet, malty/breakfast cereal bouquet that's approachable and easy. Palate entry offers ripe tastes of green apple, ripe pear, and figs; at midpalate, the flavor adds a cedar/pine/resiny background flavor that complements the fruity greenness. Finishes resiny/piney.

title: Ladyburn 1973 Single Cask Single Malt Scotch Whisky/Lowlands Rare Whisky
description: Opening nosings detect peculiar, but pleasant scents of oatmeal, grape must and guava; aeration encourages even more fruitiness to emerge; not a complex bouquet, but appealing all the same. Palate entry starts with a bang of ripe, fruity, grainy tastes; by midpalate the flavor profile teems with rich, biscuity, cake-like flavors and a firm sweetness. Aftertaste is long, off-dry and warming. Best Ladyburn I've had.

title: Michel Couvreur 33-Year-Old Very Sherried Unfiltered Single Cask/Single Malt Whisky
description: The opening inhalations detect charred beef, charcoal and butterscotch; later sniffings dredge up black tea leaves, burning electrical wire, and dark caramel—not the honeyed, bacon fat Sherry-a-thon that one would expect. Palate entry is moderately honeyed and waxy; by midpalate the taste turns mildly buttery and nougat-like. Concludes sweet and concentrated. Other heavily Sherried malts exist for less than half this price.

title: Milagro Select Barrel Reserve Silver
description: Delicate and light, and presented in a gorgeous bottle with a spiky glass piña (agave) blown inside. The mild, almost neutral aroma hints at vanilla. The feather-light flavors seem to float off the tongue, suggesting vanilla, jalapeño, granite and a flicker of cayenne sizzle on the exit.

title: El Charro Tequila Silver
description: Given some time to open up, this silver Tequila almost reads like an eau-de-vie, with subtle plum notes, agave sweetness and a peppery zing on the brisk finish. That peppery presence builds with repeated sips.

title: Tequila Don Ramon Silver
description: Pleasantly peppery, this silver Tequila offers plenty of citrus, jalapeño and a clean finish. It provides a versatile backdrop for mixing a wide range of cocktails.

title: Tequila Reserva de Don Julio Blanco
description: The aroma is on the sweet side, mixing honeyed and grassy notes with a touch of fresh pear. It's sweet and fruity on the palate as well, with a light, silky feel and a flourish of baking spice on the crisp finish.

title: Tequila Platinum Barón Blanco
description: Mellow and sweet, this silky blanco is full of mint and other fresh herb flavors, balanced by a rounded vanilla note that veers into cookie-dough sweetness and finishes with a sprinkle of baking spice. Hefty, gift-worthy bottle embellished with two dragons flanking an agave plant.

title: Tequila Terra Firme Blanco
description: The sweet aroma layers agave and citrus with a faintly minty note. Look for that and more on the palate, as flavors of jalapeño and cayenne peppers round the bases into a citrusy, crisp finish.

title: Tequila Corazon Blanco
description: The super-fruity aroma suggests peaches and pears. On the palate, it's more lean and green, with jalapeño pepper and black pepper smoothed with agave. The fruitiness just peeks out on the finish.

title: Tequila Arette Artesanal Suave Blanco
description: Close your eyes and you might think that's tomato juice in the glass. It's clear, but the fragrance is zesty, lemony and yes, fresh tomato-like. On the palate, dried oregano and green pepper come forward, plus a trace of tomato savoriness, and it finishes light, with lively lemon zest. It's mouthwatering, with moderate alcohol feel.

title: Tequila Corazon Expresione Blanco Artisanal Edition
description: Very different from the standard-issue Corazon Blanco, this joint effort between Tequila Master Distiller Miguel Cedeno Cruz and whiskey-barrel expert Harlen Wheatley is aged in former Bourbon and rye casks from Sazerac's collection. Earthy yet fruity, this blanco brings mushrooms and bruised apples to mind. The finish displays some alcohol heat, and shows flashes of ginger, white pepper, eucalyptus and anise.

title: Chinaco Blanco Tequila
description: Look for mild, herbaceous aromas and a fleeting orange-peel note on the palate, concluding with a jalapeño snap. The alcohol is well balanced.

title: Ixa Organic Tequila
description: This botanical Tequila mixes vanilla, white flowers and a whiff of mint with welcome grapefruit peel bitterness and a twang of black pepper. Alcohol builds with repeated sips. This would be a great addition to a paloma or other citrusy cocktails.

title: Luna Nueva Tequila Silver
description: Most of the Luna Nueva bottlings are marked by luscious, dessert-like flavors drawn from barrel aging. Without the oak, what remains is fresh and pleasantly herbal and citrusy. The mint, fresh basil and lemon notes segue into jalapeño prickle and a brisk finish. Definitely margarita material.

title: Tequila Cabeza
description: Made by bartenders for bartenders, not surprisingly this is a versatile, cocktail-friendly Tequila. It's honeyed and faintly citrusy, shored up by jalapeño and black pepper flavors as well as brisk alcohol.

title: Familia Camarena Tequila
description: A touchpoint for the lush, gorgeous reposado expression, the blanco is herbal and astringent, with mineral notes and touches of vanilla and coconut. It finishes spicy, all fiery cinnamon and clove.

title: Tequila Arrogante Blanco
description: Sweet, mild aromas top this blanco. This is lively on the palate, with green apple-like acidity playing off agave sweetness, followed by spearmint and jalapeño spice on the exit.

title: Monte Alban Tequila Silver
description: Surprisingly vanilla-forward for a Tequila without significant barrel time, this blanco also offers creamy honey flavor, finishing with cayenne and jalapeño pepper heat. Serve well-chilled and it should be pleasant to sip.

title: Milagro Tequila Silver
description: Heady aromas of vanilla, spearmint, green pepper and thyme lend a sprightly note to this blanco. The palate is brisk and bright, with savory dried oregano and a flash of sweet mint. Finishes fiery, with notes of black pepper, cayenne and hot cinnamon.

title: Trianon Tequila Blanco
description: The herbaceous, savory aroma is reminiscent of a bloody mary, with its dried-herb, jalapeño and lemon notes. On the palate, menthol and hints of barbecue spices emerge, finishing with a chipotle-like smoky swagger.

title: Tres Agaves Blanco Tequila
description: Relatively restrained, this blanco has just the slightest tinge of straw color and an invitingly warm, herbaceous aroma. On the palate, it's light bodied, with citrusy and savory, almost saline notes, and a faint campfire-smoke aroma. The modest flavors and balanced alcohol should make for food-friendly pairings.

title: Tequila Pueblo Viejo Blanco
description: This is almost neutral on the nose, with a slightly fruity fragrance. On the palate, this soft blanco shows anise, lemon peel and touches of violet and spicy cinnamon. Interestingly, the delicately fruity-floral notes suggest a grappa or pisco rather than a classic Tequila.

title: Excellia Blanco
description: This unique Tequila sees just a few weeks in Sauternes and Cognac barrels. The end result is a pale straw tinge and a sweet aroma that mixes honeysuckle and citrus. On the palate, this is a zesty, mouthwatering blanco, with lots of jalapeño, cayenne and black pepper flavor. The spicy finish is tempered by a hint of vanilla. Compared to the company's lovely reposado, the blanco feels slightly raw. Consider this lively contender for margaritas and other cocktails.

title: Rudo Tequila Blanco
description: Big, bold and gutsy in every way, from the colorful Mexican wrestler motif on the label to the zesty blanco inside. The tomato- and oregano-laden aroma leads to rounded, citrusy flavors with a faint, rounded butterscotchy note on the exit. A natural match for sangritas, bloodies and other savory drinks.

title: Blanco Lunazul Tequila
description: Pineapple and sweet agave drive the fragrance. On the palate, however, it's peppery from the get-go, with fruitiness wafting in later, alongside a soft vanilla note to close things out.

title: Tequila Fineza Blanco
description: Vegetal and fresh, the aroma leans toward green bell peppers and jalapeño peppers. The same vegetal flavors are reflected on the palate, smoothed with a lingering touch of honey. It feels substantial, with muscular alcohol presence.

title: Tequila Arette Blanco
description: This blanco has a delectably sweet fragrance—honeyed agave accented by a slight floral note. On the palate, this is a fiery number, although the alcohol heat fades into a mellow, sweet agave finish with touches of vanilla and white flowers.

title: Rock N Roll Tequila Blanco
description: First impressions count: there's no getting around the heavy, guitar-shaped novelty bottle with a bottle cap full of mango licor de Tequila. The Tequila is relatively neutral, with a light, marshmallowy scent and a juicy, citrusy flavor that seems ready-made for mixing margaritas.

title: Selección de 1580 Blanco
description: The aroma is almost neutral, with a delicate herbal, grassy whiff. On the palate, this Tequila displays well judged barrel--aging, already showing gentle notes of coconut, crème de cacao, lemon cream pie and a pretty baking-spice finish.

title: Suerte Tequila Blanco
description: Perky spearmint and honey intertwine on the nose of this fresh, grassy blanco. The palate reveals menthol and a hint of petrol, finishing on a citrusy note with a spark of ginger and a dry feel.

title: Tequila Blanco Técnico
description: The whimsical Mexican wrestler motif on the label commands attention first. Inside, this blanco has a mild, herbaceous aroma and vegetal palate that mingles green pepper, a minerally touch and vanilla sweetness. The alcohol presence is pronounced.

title: Tequila Campo Azul Blanco
description: Give this blanco a little time in the glass to open up, which helps coax out a sweet, pear-like scent. The flavor mingles perky jalapeño and a fleeting fruity-agave sweetness, though just a couple of sips in, and those flavors are nearly obscured by fiery alcohol heat.

title: Darroze 1983 Domaine de Coquillon Bas Armagnac
description: Opening nosing passes pick up nut/nougaty scents; plump, maple-like aromas of caramel, sap, baked apple and toasted almond emerge with aeration. Palate entry is sap-sweet, concentrated, candied and toasty; midpalate features resiny tastes of nougat, oak and palm oil. Finish is oily, woody, medium-hot and semisweet. Shows a quick furnace-blast of heat in aftertaste. Keep away from children and open flames.

title: Darroze 1967 Domaine de Saint Aubin Bas Armagnac
description: Initial fragrances are of lead, black pepper and tobacco leaf; with another six minutes of aeration, the bouquet turns bitter, steely and metallic. Palate entry displays semisweet tastes of marshmallow, cola and walnut; midpalate is highlighted by chewy flavors of almond butter and bacon fat. Finish is oily, thick and semisweet. Weirdly appealing.

title: Poyer & Sandri Grappa di Muller-Thurgau
description: Nose is fruity, peel-like and slightly tart in the initial passes; subsequent sniffings reveal appetizing scents of mildly sweet fruit, cardboard, pencil eraser and pomace. Palate entry is tart to off-dry, gently fruity and focused; once the flavor profile gains its footing, it displays evolved tastes of ripe grapes, pears and gum, all without incinerating the taste buds. Ends elegantly.

title: Poyer & Sandri Acquavite di Ciliege/Cherry Brandy
description: Crystalline. Ripe scents of cherries and red fruit; an elegant cherry eau-de-vie perfume. Palate entry is sweet, ripe, almost candied but fresh and firm; there's a moderate spirity heat that does not obstruct the fine fruit flavor that's sweet and plump. Concludes with a bit more just-manageable fire. Savory and easily recommendable.

title: Cruzan Raspberry Rum
description: The raspberry aroma after the pour is true-to-the-source, ripe and fresh; following aeration the aroma turns more preserves-like than fresh-picked fruit-like. Palate entry is sweet, yet tart and pleasantly fruity; by midpalate the flavor profile turns savory, fruity and decidedly sweet/tart. Concludes elegantly and ripe. Another how-to lesson on rum flavoring by the wizards at Cruzan. Best Buy.

title: Levsha Vodka
description: Triple-distilled whole wheat and rye mashes. Displays the prototypical Russian vodka bouquet that's equal parts grain, herbs (especially dill) and black pepper. Palate entry features sweet grain and a pleasantly oily texture; midpalate flavors of charcoal, tobacco smoke and lead pencil add to the strong grain flavors. Aftertaste is oily, medium-long and as herbal as it is grainy.

title: Balinoff Vodka
description: The opening sniffings offer muted aromas of corduroy, cardboard and slate; further air contact releases scents of grain mash and corn husk. Far more enjoyable in the mouth, Balinoff's entry taste is dry and moderately grainy; by midpalate the satiny texture underscores the intense graininess and dryness. Finishes stone dry and mildly grainy. Best Buy.

title: Yazi Ginger Flavored Vodka
description: Snappy, ginger root initial aroma; aeration stirs additional aromas of cola nut, steel wool, and thistle; an overall pleasant bouquet, providing you like ginger. The palate entry is very sweet and texturally thick; at midpalate a mild background spicy/peppery warmth emerges but doesn't overshadow the ginger influence. Concludes moderately peppery, zesty and ginger beer-like. Best Buy.

title: Scott's Selection Interleven 1979 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: Early scents of grain husk, paraffin, and grape seed oil get supplemented with aromas of bran, malt, and cardboard. Palate entry is vigorous oily, malty, and sweet; at midpalate, notes of butter, light toffee, and fudge accent the taste phase. Finishes sweet, oily, and cereal-like.

title: Speyside 12-Year-Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: Ripe pineapple and banana opening bouquet is inviting; six more minutes of aeration add woody/leathery aromatic notes that complement rather than overshadow the fruit element. Palate entry is sweet, grainy, mashy, and caramel-like; by midpalate, the taste profile expands marginally to include tastes of glycerine, heather honey, and almond paste. Concludes moderately sweet and warming. Best Buy.

title: Alizé de France Bleu Premium French Vodka & Cognac with Natural Exotic Fruit Juices
description: Bouquet is properly snappy, tart and tropical. Palate entry is pleasingly sour and refreshing; by midpalate, a deft touch of sugary sweetness enters the picture. Finishes sour, fruity, delectable. Best Buy.

title: Cask & Cream Chocolate Temptation Liqueur
description: Owns a sweet, slightly nutty opening scent; further aeration encourages a pleasing note of winter holiday spice, especially cinnamon. Palate entry is milk chocolate-like and only moderately sweet; at midpalate, the spice element backs off, allowing the nutty chocolate flavor to take command. Ends with the chocolate component seeming more like cocoa than watered down milk chocolate. Best Buy.

title: Hart Brothers 1972 Balmenach 30 Year Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky/Eastern Highlands
description: Bouquet is angular, lean, dry and fabric-like at first; further aeration encourages meatier, more complex aromas to develop including roasted chestnut, lanolin and marshmallow. Palate entry shows a more generous side as rich, chocolaty flavors greet the taste buds; at midpalate the flavor gets even more honeyed. Aftertaste is long, toffee sweet and a bit Sherried.

title: Hart Brothers 1967 Longmorn 33 Year Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky/Speyside
description: First nosing passes detect uncharacteristic (for the distillery) scents of green apple, pineapple and gum. In the mouth, this old, atypical Longmorn shows off-dry tastes of malt and toffee; by midpalate the flavors shift into higher gears, offering near-succulent flavors of honey and vanilla. Finishes with suppleness and mildly sweet tastes of honey, old oak and milk chocolate. Gets off the ground rather late, but once it does it's amiable and nice.

title: E&J; XO Vintage Reserve 10 Year Old Brandy
description: Opening nosing passes are greeted by delicate, ripe scents of grapes and oak; additional aeration time doesn't stimulate further aromas. Very pleasing and easy at the palate entry; midpalate offers ripe but off-dry tastes of light caramel, resiny oak, vanilla frosting and toffee. Finish is long, sweeter than the midpalate and elegant.

title: Citadelle Raspberry Vodka
description: Beauce wheat; distilled five times. The vibrant, ambrosial bouquet emits succulent, ripe aromas of raspberry and a trace of red currant. Palate entry is dry and acidic, then at midpalate the flavor explodes in tart raspberry splendor. Aftertaste is medium-long and more tart than sweet.

title: Tovtry Ternopil Vodka with Natural Flavors
description: Palate entry shows little flavor other than a limp graininess, but the pleasant midpalate flavor profile displays some defining characteristics in the forms of underripe red berries and elusive mint. Aftertaste is long, mostly grain mash-like and off-dry.

title: Tovtry Old Fortress Vodka with Natural Flavors
description: Understated aromas of roasted grain, toasted bread and lead pencil. Palate entry is off-dry, mildly oily and mash-like; by midpalate, there's a trace of spicy flavor, but it's hidden in the background. Finish is off-dry, pleasant and far more “unflavored” than “flavored” in scope. All three of these Ukrainian vodkas are nicely made, but the supposed differences are paper thin.

title: John Barr Excellence Cask Strength/Single Cask 29 Year Old Highland Single Malt Whisky
description: Only 258 bottles available. Aeration brings out notes of dried figs, pork sausage, sawdust, and sultanas. Palate entry is grainy, sweet and honeyed; at midpalate, the heat-burst cools off, leaving behind toasty grain and oak flavors; finishes well, sweet, woody and lightly spiced. This is one case in which water doesn't work well with the cask-strength whisky.

title: Trapiche Del Valle Premium Aged Rum
description: Big-hearted scents of old oak, vanilla extract and tobacco ash; further time in the glass unleashes butterscotch, light caramel and lanolin. Palate entry is maple-like and bittersweet; the midpalate displays touches of honey, mead and cocoa. Finish is long, off-dry to semisweet and caramel-like.

title: Whaler's Pineapple Paradise Rum
description: Aromas offer delicate traces of crushed pineapple fruit. Palate is off-dry and true to the fruit source. Aftertaste is lean, tart and just a touch fruity. A good ingredient for piña coladas.

title: Old Forester 100 Proof Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: The opening whiffs encounter melded notes of spice, sweet grain and saddle leather; additional aeration allows a forceful bouquet of brown rice, beef stock, heady spirit, oak and pork rind to appear. The palate entry is rich, creamy and honey-like; at midpalate the corny/grainy sweetness turns spicy, zesty and spirity as the proof kicks in. Ends assertively. Best Buy.

title: JdV Coffee Cream with Tequila Liqueur
description: Mild aromas of coffee bean and cream. Palate entry is soft, creamy, plush and moderately sweet; by midpalate, the coffee bean taste gives way slightly to the herbal/dill taste of agave spirit. Finish is semisweet.

title: Limonice Liqueur
description: Subtle and mildly juicy aromas of lemon. Palate entry is viscous, thick and off-dry. dominated by the lemon flavors. Aftertaste is zesty, lemony and full.

title: Château de Pellehaut Reserve Tenareze Armagnac
description: The comely aroma is assertive and intensely fruity, especially unsweetened pineapple and papaya. In the mouth, the entry taste is dry and resiny; at midpalate, the flavor turns candied and concentrated. Finishes semidry, caramel-like and bittersweet.

title: Murray McDavid Mission Range Royal Brackla 1975 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: Amber/honey/Sauternes gold color. First two nosing passes detect evidence of tea leaves, hay and flowers; exposure to air releases deeper scents of toffee, wet vegetation, cedar and oak resin. Palate entry is dry and cereal-like, then at midpalate the taste expands to include almond butter, resin, dried fruit and oily. Finishes squeaky clean and dry, with just a trace of malt.

title: Full Sail Switchback Ale
description: Henna/auburn color topped by a fast-dissipating tan head. Opening nose shows evidence of distant dried fruit (berries) and little else; aromatic shades of malt dominate the latter stages of the nosing. Palate entry is moderately bitter, hoppy and malty then at midpalate the taste turns off-dry, toasty and slightly fruity. Aftertaste continues the light fruit profile but adds a zesty bitterness that underscores the whole experience nicely.

title: Plantation Rum Old Reserve 1992 Venezuela
description: Opening nosing pass offers cinnamon, candied almonds and honey. Palate entry is pleasantly raisiny and mildly burnt; the midpalate phase adds notes of spirity warmth, sweet oak and lead pencil. Finishes on a semisweet note.

title: Cazadores Reposado 100% Agave Tequila
description: Early nosings detect notes of dill and black pepper. On the palate Cazadores is nimble and off-dry at entry, then by midpalate the flavor resembles cocoa bean and asparagus. Finish is clean, light and off-dry.

title: Siglo Treinta XXX Gold Tequila
description: A mixto tequila, meaning a blend of 51% agave spirit and 49% sugar cane distillate. Nosings pick up sweet, pulpy and peppery aromas and nuances of corn syrup, black pepper, green olives and brine. Palate is sweet, herbal and botanical, unabashedly sweet and keenly peppery. Aftertaste is long, a touch honeyed and surprisingly rich.

title: Shakka Eau-de-Vie Apple
description: The robust aroma is of ripe, red apple. The palate entry is clean, lithe, and apple-like; the pleasant tartness comes on strong at midpalate. Ends up pleasantly astringent, keenly tart, and just a whisper ripe and sweet.

title: Shakka Eau-de-Vie Grape
description: The transparent purple/shiraz-syrah/dark gray appearance and fruity grape juice-like aroma remind me strikingly of a soda pop – Nehi Grape – from my childhood except that it has a well-concealed 15 percent alcohol as its foundation. Simple, straightforward, and very quaffable.

title: Hiram Walker Butterscotch Schnapps
description: The aroma offers toasty, candied aromas of butterscotch, caramel and salted butter. Palate entry is off-dry to bittersweet, with delicate flavors of butter, caramel and saltwater taffy; at midpalate the flavor is off-dry and intensely caramel-like. Finish

title: Origine V.S. Private Reserve Cognac
description: The reticent bouquet offers timid scents of raisins, faint oak and sweetened coconut. The palate entry is pleasingly sweet and smooth with tastes of mint, cedar, almond, and white raisins; at midpalate the flavor becomes more intense with more concentrate

title: Duncan Taylor Bruichladdich 1966 Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: Whiffs detect subtle notes of green apple and pear. The palate entry is tightly structured, oily, and moderately grainy; at midpalate the taste profile becomes bittersweet as flavors of malt, oloroso sherry, marshmallow, and nougat take charge. Concludes pleasantly semisweet and mildly fruity.

title: El Diamante del Cielo Anejo 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1472-CRT
description: The opening bouquet is nicely biscuity, oaky sweet, and mellow; after more air contact briny, herbal, peppery scents emerge. The palate entry is semisweet and oily/resiny; at midpalate the maple/honey sweetness takes over, overshadowing much of the agave

title: Château de Laubade 1958 Armagnac
description: Aromas are spirity and oaky, with traces of worn saddle leather and cedar. The palate entry is moderately rich, caramel-like and chewy; at midpalate the taste displays off-dry to bittersweet flavors of nougat, bacon fat and old oak. Ends up warming, nutty

title: Dogfish Head Brown Honey Rum
description: The first whiffs find smells of honey with subtle traces of cheese and wood added by the final sniffings. The palate entry is honey sweet; in the midpalate stage tastes of resin balance the honey sweetness. Finishes more resiny than honeyed. An oddball with a rudimentary charm.

title: Chinaco Reposado 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1127-CRT
description: The initial nosings discover interesting scents of chalk/slate, green vegetable, and grass; aromas of rubber, black pepper, green pepper, broccoli, and thyme are added after aeration time. The palate entry is pleasantly peppery and off-dry; by midpalate the astringent vegetal taste is underpinned by a satiny texture. Concludes lean and peppery.

title: Shakka Eau-de-Vie Kiwi
description: The neon color is a see-through yellow/lime green. The aroma is a faint green apple/kiwi smell. The palate entry is delightfully juicy and tart; the midpalate becomes sweet/sour as the intense juiciness builds into a pleasing crescendo in the aftertaste.

title: Brady's Irish Cream Liqueur
description: The bouquet includes some nice nutmeg-like spiciness, scents of nuts and, of course, cream. The palate entry is pleasantly spicy and creamy; the midpalate offers more in the way of nuttiness/dairy presence than in the entry. Aftertaste is mellow, moderate

title: Bruichladdich 20-Year-Old Second Edition Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: Aroma includes notes of just-polished hardwood floor, tobacco leaf, pork rind, old saddle leather and black tea. The palate entry is off-dry, almost bitter and a bit fudge-like; the midpalate highlights the fudge/cocoa quality. The aftertaste is extended,

title: Origine 12-Year-Old (Benriach) Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: An ordinary bouquet of malted barley and breakfast cereal. The palate entry is clean, medium-bodied and intensely grainy sweet; at midpalate the flavor finds pleasant tastes of nougat, almond paste and toffee. The finish is pleasingly malty, sweet and eve

title: Hirsch Selection 10-Year-Old Canadian Rye Whisky
description: The nosing passes encounter only faint traces of cedar/evergreen and fresh garden herbs. The palate entry is sweet and oaky; the midpalate shows a bit of resiny astringency that counters the caramel sweetness. Ends with some tasty mellowness, but ultimately not enough core character or innate finesse.

title: Jose Cuervo Golden Margarita, Margarita made with Cuervo Gold Tequila & Gra
description: The citrus rind aroma features a faint hint of Grand Marnier. The palate entry is citrusy, energy drink-like, and sour; the midpalate primarily tastes of pre-mix citrus and sweetener. A bit more of the Jose Cuervo Tequila emerges at the finish.

title: Hirsch Selection 8-Year-Old Canadian Rye Whisky
description: A pleasant bouquet of violets, marshmallows, dried flowers, light English toffee, and milk chocolate. The palate entry is semi-rich and candy sweet; at midpalate there is little evidence of grain as the candy sweetness and brown sugar/molasses dominates. Concludes concentrated and sugary sweet. An uncomplicated, inoffensive, wholly unexceptional beginner Canadian rye whisky.

title: Origine V.S.O.P. Rare Cognac
description: Another meek bouquet that offers languid scents of pine, grass, and nondescript yellow fruit. The palate entry is flabby and lightweight; by the midpalate stage the taste profile includes equal measures of oak/wood, prunes and a nice sweetness that lasts

title: pXs Lively Green Passion in Excess, Cognac, Vodka, Passion and Citrus Fruit
description: The initial aroma has a soft vegetal smell that must be the cactus; aeration brings out the citrus element; not bad but it's a bit Gatorade-like. The palate entry is tart to off-dry and cactusy; midpalate shows more evidence of spirit and citrus. Finishes on a tart, astringent citrus note.

title: pXs Spicy Red Passion in Excess, Passion and Red Fruit and Cognac Liqueur
description: The bouquet features background traces of over-the-hill passion fruit with little sense of freshness. The palate entry is tart to sour, mildly fruity, and a bit stale; the midpalate offers more fruit than the entry, but not enough. Concludes moderately fruity and sweet/sour.

title: Père Magloire Fine Calvados
description: Smells of underripe apples and the bouquet is a bit sharp. Tastes sweeter than it smells; the hollow flavors include apple pastry, brown sugar. Finishes clean, lean, and toasty, if totally ordinary. Nothing special.

title: Auchentoshan Limited Edition 17-Year-Old Bordeaux Wine Cask Finished Lowlan
description: The wonderful, multilayered bouquet offers scents of pine needles and moss and deeper aromas of black tea, sawdust and coffee grounds. The palate entry is initially sharply spirity before turning sweet and cocoa-like; at midpalate a remarkable caramel-lik

title: The Balvenie 1971 Single Cask, Barrel #8935 Bottle #29 of 219 total bottles
description: The elegant bouquet includes fragrances of pear, tangerine and nectarine with foundational aromas of oak, soft cheese, honey and leather. The palate entry finds tastes of vanilla-like oak and sautéed butter; at midpalate the toffee-caramel-honeyed tastes

title: Auchentoshan 1973 Limited Edition 32-Year-Old, Sherry Cask Finished Lowland
description: The aroma includes saddle leather, pork rind, black pepper, sausages, pine, blue cheese, candle wax, and a hint of rancio. The palate entry is meaty and intensely spirity; at midpalate, with a dash of mineral water added, the taste turns chocolaty, silky

title: Grand Marnier Cuvée du Centenaire Triple Orange Liqueur
description: The palate is balanced between the citric acid, alcohol, Cognac and wood, with the Cognac always prevailing. Concludes with finesse, a sweet-sour presence, and an incredibly lush texture.

title: Imperia Vodka
description: The first sniffings find dry cereal-like aromas; the later sniffings detect aromas reminiscent of old-fashioned egg cream soda. The palate entry shows bittersweet notes of vanilla extract, unsalted butter and grain  mash; at midpalate the astringency of t

title: Famous Grouse 12-Year-Old Blended Malt Whisky
description: he aroma includes scents of toffee and raisin/cinnamon bread; baked apple crisp, toasted cereal, roasted almonds, and nougat. The palate entry is full of raisiny and orange rind-like tastes; the midpalate is filled with tastes of spice, sweet cereal, Dani

title: Marti Coco Suave Licor de Ron Rum with Natural Coconut Flavor
description: Scents of unsweetened coconut and vanilla extract delight the olfactory sense. The palate and midpalate stages are intensely coconut-like making it a perfect ingredient for piña coladas and other coconut-driven cocktails. The aftertaste is surprisingly el

title: Charbay Green Tea Vodka
description: The overall bouquet impression includes seductive fragrances of ripe green melon, sage and lightly honeyed green tea with later whiffs of jasmine and honeysuckle. The palate entry is gently tea-like and a touch honeyed; the midpalate profile borders on be

title: Old Russian Vodka
description: The nosing passes pick up scents of wheat cracker and pine with minor aromatic additions of grass, autumn leaves, mineral and coal. The palate entry tastes of moderately sweet grain and beeswax; the midpalate is elegantly sweet, creamy textured and minera

title: Origine Vodka
description: The bouquet features subtle scents of lavender, grain mash and wheat with barely discernable citrus zest, hemp and cracker-like notes. The palate entry is grainy and off-dry to semisweet; at midpalate the taste profile turns citrusy, semisweet and astring

title: Cardenal Mendoza Sanchez Romate Solera Gran Reserva Brandy de Jerez
description: A delightful and massive bouquet of ripe grapes and fruit-topped cheesecake with deep-seated aromas of prunes, dates, figs, coffee beans and chocolate-covered cherries. The palate entry is long, sweet, cocoa-like and rich; at midpalate subtle bittersweet hints of citrus, black coffee and caramel emerge. Finishes virile, sweet and concentrated.

title: Opal Nera Original Black Sambuca Liqueur
description: Sniffings pick up beany and dry aromas  along with licorice. The palate entry is guardedly sweet but intensely licorice-like; at midpalate the aniseed component develops deliciously well within the licorice flavor frame. Finishes svelte and bittersweet.

title: Barsol Pisco Traditional Peruvian Italia Grape Brandy
description: A bouquet of banana, guava, and papaya, with a slight dash of sweet herbs. The palate entry is sweet, ripe, and silky; at midpalate the tastes of ripe grapes and yellow watermelon are exhilarating. Concludes on a semisweet, fruity/acidic/melony note. Very elegant. Best Buy

title: Talisker 18-Year-Old Isle of Skye Single Malt Whisky
description: First sniffings boast big-hearted aromas of maple sugar and caramel; further  aeration stimulates marine notes of seaweed and light brine, but deeper notes of chili pepper, black  pepper, honey and vanilla top off the experience. Palate entry is honeyed and full; at midpalate  the taste profile inches its way towards the smoke-tobacco-ash-tar side of the flavor scale, but is sweet. Concludes moderately oily and lightly salty.

title: Bortolo Nardini Riserva Aquavitae Grappa
description: Lovely aromatic notes of seaweed, green olive brine, and musty pumice greet the olfactory sense; aeration brings out a pickling quality that's quite vinegar-like, but fresh.
