Palate entry is sweet, clean and intensely grapy; at midpalate flavors of buttercream and green vegetable are added to the taste mix. Concludes sweet, grapy/must-like and full-bodied.

title: Villa Zarri Acquavitae di Vino Immature Chardonnay Brandy
description: Chardonnay brandy. Aeration stirs only distant background notes of grape pomace/grape skins and a light herbaceousness. Palate entry tastes are dry to off-dry and intensely grapy/plummy; at midpalate, the flavor expands, adding tastes of cocoa butter, wood resin, paraffin, palm oil and grape jam. Concludes warm, chewy, grapy and elegant.

title: Rhum Clément Premiere Canne White Rum
description: A pure aroma with notes of sugar cane, cola nut, vanilla bean, and fresh, flowery spirit just off the pot still. A sensational palate entry with tastes of cocoa bean, bittersweet chocolate, black tea, and unrefined sugar; the midpalate adds an element of fresh, raw spirit. Concludes gracefully, with subtle notes of sugary sweetness, zesty spirit, and vanilla. Best Buy.

title: Starr African Ultra Superior Light Rum
description: An earthy, dry, clean, and bean- and cane-like aroma with delicate scents of cocoa bean, vanilla bean, and brown sugar. The palate entry is bittersweet, concentrated and beany; at midpalate the flavor profile becomes sweeter and more like vanilla extract. The bean intensity reaches its bittersweet zenith in the high-flying aftertaste. Chic, racy, and delicious.

title: Clynelish 14-Year-Old Coastal (Northern) Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: The initial aroma is large, biscuity and grainy sweet; the aroma then becomes more sugar biscuit-like and a touch salty. Palate entry finds generous and malty-sweet flavors; by midpalate distinctive notes of black pepper, seaweed, oaky vanilla, honey and dark caramel are added. Finishes elegantly, sweetly and malty, with just a barely discernable influence of the sea. Best Buy.

title: Glenfarclas 17-Year-Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The generous aroma emits powerful scents of honey, oloroso Sherry and dark toffee; aeration stimulates additional scents of nougat, roasted peanuts, sautéed butter and very sharp cheddar. The palate entry finds flavors of sugar beet, candy bar, maple and oak; at midpalate the taste expands to include marzipan and brandied cherries. Finishes beautifully, if a bit tight and suddenly reined-in.

title: Glenfarclas 105 (No age statement) Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The alluring opening aroma offers scents of plum pudding, mince pie and dark caramel; aeration reveals notes of roasted chestnut, beeswax, pork sausages, old saddle leather and vanilla wafer. The entry is prickly, but sweet and sappy; at midpalate large flavors of dark caramel, oloroso Sherry, vanilla cream and dark chocolate are added. Concludes with deep flavors of sweet oak, toffee and butter cream. Luscious.

title: A. Hardy Noces de Perle 30 Year Old Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Amber honey hue. Initial nosing pass detects a mildly spicy bouquet that's ready to fly; aeration doesn't deepen this nose as much as it sweetens it, blending in comely notes of toffee, brown sugar, leather and vanilla extract. Palate entry is sap-like, sugary and oaky; midpalate shows generous flavors of pineapple, guava, mint, caramel and oak resin. Aftertaste is firm, semisweet and more fruity than woody.

title: François Voyer XO 25 Year Old Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Attractive bronze hue. Opening nosing passes detect  traces of butterscotch and dark caramel; further time expands the bouquet to include scents of honey, bark, ripe grapes and leather. Palate entry is pointed, tart, semisweet and moderately honeyed; at midpalate, mature, fully evolved, dessert-like  flavors of brown sugar, old oak and cocoa take charge. Finishes with spirity heat that warms the tongue. Intriguing and piquant.

title: Buffalo Trace Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Initial aroma displays elements of spice, sautéed butter and old leather gloves; following aeration the fat/butter component dominates. Palate entry is corny sweet and almost fruity; at midpalate tastes include sweet oak, cinnamon, nutmeg, honey, tar and beeswax. Concludes spirity and feisty. One of the greatest values in the worldwide whiskey category. Best Buy.

title: Canne Royale Extra Old Rum
description: Nosings pick up sweetly fragrant aromas of vanilla bean and brown sugar. Palate entry is toasty and mildly sweet; midpalate is sweeter, as sugar cookies, brown sugar, honey and vanilla bean unfold. Aftertaste is long and bittersweet.

title: 42 BELOW Vodka
description: Smells of wet cement or damp stones in the initial minutes before the aromas shift gears, offering toasty, ash-like, smoky scents of tobacco leaf, roasted cereals, pencil eraser and vegetable oil. Palate entry shows an oily texture and tastes of charcoal and mildly sweet grain; midpalate displays well-structured flavors of lead pencil, off-dry grain and licorice. Finishes full in the mouth, acceptably fiery and off-dry.

title: Russia Vodka
description: Quadruple-distilled whole wheat and rye mashes. Nose showcases dill, a pinch of black pepper and a dash of off-dry grain mash; aeration adds licorice and rubber eraser. Palate entry is herbal; midpalate highlights silky and oily tastes of black pepper, linseed oil, charcoal and pipe tobacco. Aftertaste is long, satiny and a touch hot.

title: Samuel Smith's Old Brewery Pale Ale
description: Firm, yeasty, sour apple, fresh spring garden bouquet. Sweet, raisiny flavor at palate entry; hoppy and fruity at midpalate with a final touch of coffee bean. Lush and elegant aftertaste.

title: Finlandia Mango Infused Vodka
description: The opening bouquet is fruity, ripe and true to the infusion source; aeration intensifies the luscious, off-dry mango perfume. The palate is silky, properly fruity, moderately sweet and ripe. Ends wonderfully mango-like and firm. By leaving the alcohol level at 40% (most flavored vodkas are 35%), Finlandia has given this beauty the spirit foundation that's frequently lacking in so many other flavored vodkas.  Best Buy.

title: Chabot Armagnac Vintage 1956
description: Lovely brilliant rust/burnt orange/iron ore hue. The opening nosings pick up lush scents of old saddle leather, soft oaky spice and sap; following aeration subtle scents of beeswax and carnauba are added. Palate entry is savory, semisweet and maple-like; at midpalate the sweet oak returns to dominate. Ends succulently sweet and intensely oaky.

title: Chabot Armagnac Vintage 1952
description: A multilayered bouquet offering semisweet aromas of almond paste, oak resin, dark toffee, coffee bean and candle wax. The palate entry is mildly candied and coffee-like; at midpalate the flavor profile expands to include walnuts, palm oil, the beginnings of blue cheese-like rancio, almond paste and caramel. Finishes oily and sedately.

title: Domenis Kosher Sambuca
description: Organic. Crystal clear. Nose at opening is razor-sharp and totally focused on the anise; the aroma expands to include deep licorice and wet stone. Palate entry is sweet; strong, licorice/anise midpalate. Aftertaste is long, medium-viscous, semisweet and luscious. Definitely one of the finest sambucas.

title: Scott's Selection Longmorn-Glenlivet 1968 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The first inhalations detect dense aromas of black tea leaves, lead pencil, minerals, and straw; the aroma deepens to include concentrated scents of candle wax, green olives, and linseed oil. Palate entry displays deep flavor notes of caraway, bacon fat, matchstick; at midpalate, the bacon fat/oil element turns creamy, vanilla-like, rancio-like, and nutty. Finishes luxuriously sweet, oaky/vanilla-like, caramel-like, and honeyed.

title: George T. Stagg Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey Uncut/Unfiltered
description: First whiffs pick up potent scents of alcohol and rancio; after seven minutes in the glass, layers of walnut butter, linseed oil, charred oak, mocha and minerals  enchant the nose. Palate entry is hot, caramel-like and sweet; midpalate offers intense flavors of raisins and other dried fruit, oak, marzipan and that touch of nobility, rancio. Finishes boldly, richly and with enough heat to keep your attention. This cask- strength Bourbon and others like it are most balanced when the alcohol level hovers between 45–50%, so add a generous splash of mineral or spring water.

title: Bowmore 1964 Fino Sherry Cask Single Islay Malt Scotch Whisky/Cask Strength
description: Attractive, light amber color. Elegant opening bouquet is evolved, mature, tart, even a tad yeasty; seven more minutes of air exposure produces an animated, lightly fruity (banana? guava?). The palate entry is off-dry, salty/yeasty and mildly cracker-like; at midpalate a peppery quality emerges on the tongue that complements the oak resin. Finishes more dry than off-dry.

title: Bruichladdich 1966 “Legacy Series One” 36 Year Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky/Islay
description: Only 1,500 bottles worldwide. 100% American oak hogsheads. Initial whiffs pick up garden-like, almost woodsy and hay field scents; following a bit of swirling, the bouquet starts displaying ethereal scents including paraffin, minerals and sweet oak. Palate entry is off-dry and resiny; midpalate is the highlight as toasty, semisweet tastes of raisins, cocoa and oak impress the taste buds. Finish is surprisingly hot, but clean and honeyed. Excellent, multilayered and more robust than expected considering the moderate alcohol level.

title: Domenis Kosher Grappa
description: Crystalline, clean appearance. Bouquet is lean yet ripe and fruity in the opening nosing stages; more air contact turns the aroma delicately plump, musty and viny, even seed-like. Palate entry is tart, acidic and very must-like; midpalate displays delightful, balanced flavors of grape seed, must, grape pulp and skins. Finishes gracefully, showing no spirity fire or prickliness.

title: Liquid Ice Organic Grain Vodka
description: Made from organically grown wheat, oats, corn, rye and barley; quadruple distilled and filtered three times through lava rock. Opening bouquet is intensely grainy, a touch cocoa-like and bittersweet. Initial taste is bittersweet and dark cocoa-like; at midpalate there's a minerally, smoky sweetness. Aftertaste is long, sweet, coffee bean-like and a touch ashy.

title: Michel Couvreur Aged 12 years Unfiltered Vatted Malt Whisky
description: The opening nose is rich, fat, and biscuity; aeration reveals touches of lead pencil, stone and slate. The palate entry is peaty, smoky, and oily; by midpalate there's a layer of bacon fat that underscores the smoke and oil to near-perfection; ends up sweet, sap-like, and intensely oily. A stud of a vatted malt.

title: The Dalmore 1973 Vintage Gonzalez Byass 30 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: Opening bouquet of confectioner's sugar, lemon drops and seaweed; aeration unleashes atypical scents of gum, banana extract, bread yeast, pineapple and roasted grain. Palate entry is tart, doughy and a tad prickly; by midpalate a citrusy/yeasty flavor is elegantly underpinned by tastes of oak resin, malt and vanilla. Finishes oily, deep and sensuous. An underappreciated exemplary Northern Highlands malt.

title: Vieux Carre Absinthe Superieure
description: On the outside, the gorgeous, gift-worthy bottle with the Belle Epoque design is a showstopper, but inside, this “100% natural” absinthe just isn't pretty: it's a mossy dark green color speckled with unappetizing bits of dark floating sediment. Adding ice water transforms the thick, viscous liquid from hot and vaguely herbal to a spice-box of flavors: ginger, cardamom, star anise and clove, with a dry, fennel-like finish.

title: Deau XO Artisan Cognac
description: At first this mahogany spirit has just a fleeting honeyed fragrance, but with time it opens up to a deeper, sweet caramel aroma. Get past the initial dauntingly hot alcohol bite, and the reward is a sweet and nutty flavor, finishing with a pretty cinnamon spice and caramel note.

title: Pierre Ferrand Ambre
description: As the name suggests, this 10-year-old spirit has a golden amber color. Alcohol is what hits first on the aroma, followed by floral and citrus notes and toffee undertones. The liquid tastes of honey, dried fruit and vanilla, leaving behind a lingering caramel finish and an edge of tannins on the tongue. Light to medium body.

title: Pierre Ferrand Reserve
description: This 20-year-old Cognac made from Grande Champagne grapes has a warm orange-peel and honey aroma and a honeyed-nut flavor, followed by an unexpectedly dry, caramel and citrus finish. Light to medium body.

title: St. George Absinthe Verte
description: This is a funky, herbal, and brawny absinthe. The dark greenish-brown color louches to a swampy dark green. Earthy aromas include lemon balm, tarragon and star anise; louching brings anise to the foreground. There's pure star anise flavor, with an aggressive, tarragon finish and a big, mouth-coating feel, which oddly grows even thicker with ice water. The apothecary bottle and label design is fun and appealing, but the cork closure makes it difficult to recap for storage.

title: Lucid Absinthe Superieure
description: Versatile and cocktail-friendly. This absinthe is relatively light-bodied, with a pale translucent green color and an overwhelming licorice-candy scent, like a box of Good & Plenty. With ice water, fennel flavors become more pronounced. Although this isn't a sweet absinthe, it blended easily and pleasantly with sugar.

title: Deau Artisan Cognac VSOP
description: Topax color and sickly-sweet aromas of honey, apple juice, and clover. Not much flavor up front, a hint of sweetness, finishing into burnt caramel and oak, and alcohol bite. This spirit improves with a little time to open, showing a richer, more raisiny fragrance and a marzipan-like finish. Medium body.

title: Duplais Swiss Absinthe Blanche
description: This is an absinthe-hater's absinthe. It starts clear and louches to pearly white, and has modest anise on the nose and the palate, both of which emerge further with ice water. Medium body and sharp alcohol bite.

title: Del Maguey Chichicapa Cask
description: If “sipping mezcal” doesn't exist, the category may have to be created for this limited-edition mezcal (only 14 three-bottle sets were produced). This “single village” mezcal is aged for 14 years in glass bottles and then is finished in a Stags Leap Cabernet barrel for 43 days. The result is a light nut-brown color and offers beautiful aromas of raisin, vanilla and dark chocolate, with a mellow pepper note in the background. Sweet agave nectar and honey flavors finish with a muted peppery sting.

title: Sombra Mezcal
description: Beneath an edgy Hell's Angel-esque black-and-silver label, the clear liquid gives off aromas of jalapeno, green bell pepper and a sun-warmed savory-sweetness that hints at ripe tomatoes. A slightly sweet flavor quickly gives way to a pleasant hot pepper singe and just enough alcohol for balance. Silky feel on the tongue, medium body. Outstanding for a Bloody Mary or other tomato-based cocktail.

title: Scorpion Mezcal Anejo 1 Year
description: Aging the spirit one full year in oak yields a muddy brown color as well as a powerfully Bourbon-like, caramel aroma, with hints of agave and pepper and cinnamon spice. The flavors also are sweet, with notes of vanilla, oak, tobacco and leather. A smooth, peppery finish reminds this is mezcal, not Bourbon after all. One revolting scorpion is revealed at the bottom of the bottle.

title: Scorpion Mezcal Reposado
description: This aged spirit has a light straw color, and an intriguing mix of smoky spice and caramel aromas. Allowed to sit, the caramel scent intensifies. The flavor starts as vaguely sweet and vanilla-like, with a soft feel on the tongue, then turns peppery, and finishes with anise and a strong alcohol bite. Despite two offputting scorpions at the bottom of the bottle, a sophisticated approach to mezcal.

title: Del Maguey Santo Domingo Albarradas
description: Another single-village mezcal from Del Maguey. This crystal-clear mezcal has not much aroma, just a spicy scent which later opens up to a faint, grassy sweetness. Vegetal, grassy, slightly sweet flavors finish dry and pleasant, with just a little spice. Light body, unctuous feel.

title: Ilegal Reposado Mezcal
description: Restrained, mellow, balanced, elegant —not something usually expected from the mezcal category. The aged mezcal has a light gold color and soft aromas—a whisper of pepper, a hint of smokiness, later opening to a big caramel scent. Peppery flavors and some agave sweetness finish with a sharp bite, which might mellow over ice.

title: Dona Maria Chagoya Mezcal Anejo
description: This mezcal retained more agave character compared to other anejos. With a light amber color and a smoky, sweet honey scent, the flavor reflected agave sweetness reminiscent of maple syrup along with spicy clove notes and a faint green pepper, vegetal twang. Smooth, black peppery finish.

title: Del Maguey Minero
description: Clear color and vegetal aromas of green pepper, green jalapeno, along with black pepper and a hint of smoke and dried oregano. A sweet, fruity flavor at first quickly unfolds to lots of smoke and jalapeno pepper, and a spicy, bitingly alcoholic finish. A bracing backbone for mixed drinks.

title: Ilegal Joven Mezcal
description: This smooth, well-balanced mezcal seems unremarkable at first, but has a certain addictiveness. The clear color and sweet, vegetal, slightly smoky fragrance seems pleasant but ordinary. But the alluring honeyed pepper notes and silky mouthfeel bring you back for more.

title: Ilegal Anejo Mezcal
description: A pervasively peppery mezcal. Medium amber color and smooth feel. Chile pepper aroma with hint of vanilla and licorice, sweet and spicy flavor finishes peppery, with some caramel aftertaste.

title: Del Maguey Tobala
description: This single-village mezcal made from wild mountain maguey (agave) has a clean, peppery flavor and high, sweet fragrance with a peppery zing.

title: Los Danzantes Mezcalero Release #2
description: A brisk, even slightly raw, unaged mezcal that clears the sinuses. Clear color and astringent, super-smoky scent precede a faint agave-sweet flavor, then a big dose of pepper and spicy, lingering finish.

title: Del Maguey Vida
description: This clear and light-bodied mezcal has a faintly smoky aroma and a mildly peppery flavor. A potent, alcoholic finish fades into black pepper.

title: Scorpion Mezcal Anejo 5 Year
description: This limited-edition mezcal was aged for five years in oak. Perhaps the angel took more than his share, because this gave the perception of the most alcohol bite, though it was labeled at a mere 80 proof. The muddy brown liquid has a strong alcohol nose, as well as smoky and spicy notes balanced by a toffee-like fragrance. Very spicy and alcoholic flavor, finishing with caramel and anise, and again, harsh alcohol, so much that it burns. Elegantly packaged in a curved glass bottle with one inelegant scorpion at the bottom.

title: Fidencio Mezcal Joven sin humo
description: This clear, delicate, almost gin-like mezcal is the debut offering from Fidencio, and the “con humo” (with smoke) and aged versions could prove very interesting with this unusual base. This light-bodied product has pepper and overripe pineapple aromas, a soft feel and a faintly floral/menthol flavor with a light, peppery finish. It's not very flavorful, but intriguing nevertheless.

title: Escorpion La Estanzuela Felino Reposado
description: A slightly aged, light amber mezcal with a good give-and-take of raw agave flavors and the softening influence of the barrel. Assertive aromas of caramel and spicy pepper, in equal measure. Agave, honey, and pepper flavors, with a long anise and oaky finish disrupted by a too-hot alcohol bite.

title: Scorpion Mezcal Silver
description: This clear liquid has an overwhelmingly fruity pineapple-and-pepper scent, like a flavored vodka. Oddly overripe sweetness, then a spicy/peppery finish on the tongue and a strong alcohol burn. I could see this adding zing to cocktails made with tropical or exotic fruits.

title: Dona Maria Chagoya Maria Mezcal Reposado
description: Light golden color, thin body. This aged mezcal has an intensely sweet, caramel aroma with dissonant pepper and pine notes. The flavors are piny and smoky, with a peppery, dry finish.

title: Oro de Oaxaca Mezcal
description: Oro means “gold,” though the liquid appears more of a pale straw than golden. Not much aroma, slight green pepper. Smoky, complex flavor, vegetal notes. Pleasantly warm, slightly oily feel. Not much of a finish —some pepper & tannic pucker. This was the only mezcal to arrive with a worm in the bottom of the bottle, which resembles a tiny turd.

title: Del Maguey Pechuga
description: This expensive, triple-distilled single-village mezcal is a bartender favorite, but I just don't understand why. The scent on this clear liquid was reminiscent of pizza with smoked mozzarella: tomato, black pepper and oregano, and light smoke. But the flavors reflected none of this. Instead, it had distinctive and intense licorice and petrol-like flavors, like ouzo without any sweetness and a faintly peppery, astringent finish. Oily, viscous feel.

title: WhistlePig Straight Rye Whiskey
description: First, a warning: this is only for those who like their rye big and brawny. It starts off innocuously with a maple-syrup color, and a pretty, complex and subtle scent: honey, vanilla, a sight medicinal tinge and faint clover notes. It feels silky on the tongue and at first, the flavors reflect caramel, burnt orange and a whisper of smoke, but then a mouth-warming wave of tannic bite sweeps over all and lingers for a good long time. Straight up or on the rocks.

title: Rendezvous Rye
description: Strong but intriguing. Medium color and body, with rich aromas of burnt orange and caramel. The flavor also reflected burnt orange and caramel, plus a spicy tinge reminiscent of cassia bark or Red-Hot candies. The finish lingers, pleasant, inviting and warm. Might be good for Manhattans—a touch of fruit or sweetness would go well with this rye. Excellent value.

title: Early Times 354 Bourbon
description: Surprisingly fruity, with notes of apples and pears, and a caramel note that accelerates into the finish. Despite a jarring resin note in the aroma, this is a decent mixer for cocktails, and you're not going to beat the price.

title: Stolichnaya Gold
description: This mellow, balanced vodka is at its best when well chilled and paired with smoked salmon or other savory bites. Perky anise note, citrusy finish and slightly viscous feel.

title: Hangar One Maine Wild Blueberry Vodka
description: Made with Maine blueberries, this clear spirit has a warm blueberry scent and a sweet flavor with a candy-like berry flavor on the lingering finish. It has a juicy feel to it, and should be great for adding scent and flavor to cocktails. The rustic-looking label is reminiscent of labels on boxes at the greenmarket.

title: ROKK Orange Vodka
description: Clear color and pleasing juicy-sweet aroma, like Satsuma oranges or tangerines. Nice bitter-orange flavor, sweet with a clean finish.

title: Stolichnaya Vodka
description: Smooth and cocktail worthy, this vodka has a neutral scent with a very faint malty note, a crisp, lightly sweet flavor and a clean finish. An excellent choice for those who prefer vodka martinis.

title: Zu Vodka
description: Previously known as Zubrowka, the Polish word for the bison grass that flavors this spirit, this vodka has a faint yellowish tinge and mixes intriguing herbal, menthol and sweet vanilla flavors. It has a bit of alcohol bite, but that serves to add delicacy and liveliness. Look for a blade of bison grass inside the bottle.

title: Ultimat Vodka
description: Distilled from a mix of grain and potato, this vodka has fresh, zingy citrus notes and an almost juniper-like flavor that brings a mild gin to mind. Pronounced and lingering sweet vanilla finish. Consider mixing this spirit with cucumber and tonic for a tall summer refresher. Sold in a striking cobalt-blue bottle with a serious glass stopper.

title: Vesica Vodka
description: Distinctly fruity, featuring a soft raspberry aroma and flavors of red berries, dry cocoa and marshmallow notes that resonate through to the long finish. The crescent-shaped bottle that houses this potato vodka fits well in the hand for pouring.

title: Belvedere Lemon Tea
description: New to the market, this perfectly clear vodka smells and tastes like black tea with lemon and honey. Use this demure spirit to spike lemon gimlets, punches and Arnold Palmer variations, and tea time will never be the same.

title: Wodka Vodka
description: Does any spirit have a name that's more fun to say? Overall, this rye-based vodka is pleasantly neutral, with a citrusy spark and a sweet, marshmallow-like finish. Goes down smooth.

title: Absolut Orient Apple Vodka
description: Though crystal clear, this vodka has a heady, bright green-apple fragrance and a fleeting touch of zingy ginger on the palate. Although this rather light flavor might fall flat in a vodka-soda, its juicy aroma would nicely accent cider-based drinks and other autumn cocktails.

title: Stolichnaya 100 Proof Vodka
description: The growing category of high-proof spirits is not for everyone, and, frankly, most will find this vodka too strong. However, bartender types will want it for infusions. Expect a bracing touch of alcohol on the nose and palate, sweet, faint lemon and lime notes and a lightly effervescent feel.

title: Bak's Bison Grass Vodka
description: Infused with fragrant bison grass, this pale green-gold vodka has a candied lemon-zest character, with notes of coconut and lemongrass, and a sweetness that dominates through to the finish. Watch for the blade of bison grass inside the bottle.

title: Luksusowa
description: In general, this potato-based vodka is neutral, with faint vanilla and marshmallow notes. The alcohol prickle is a little too intense and hot, but could be moderated in a fruity drink or a long vodka tonic.

title: Siete Leguas Reposado
description: Excellent all around, for sipping or mixing, this highlands Tequila has a delicacy and an almost whiskey-like feel to it. Pale straw, almost no color at all, with lightly smoky and herbaceous flavors finishing with a hint of vanilla.

title: Luna Nueva Ultra Premium Limited Edition Tequila Reposado
description: On the dessert-like side, this limited edition Tequila has a light gold cast and rich crème brûlée aromas. Silky, rich and beautiful, with soft, sweet butterscotchy notes and just enough peppery tingle to brace up the spirit, consider this as a sipping Tequila after dinner. Aged in French and American oak casks for at least five months.

title: Tequila Corrido
description: “Corrido” is Mexican folk music, originating from the late 1800s. Nodding to the musical name, a guitar pick on a leather strap is wrapped around the bottle's neck. Perhaps because it's aged twice (first in Jack Daniel's barrels, then in Maker's Mark barrels), this highlands Tequila is dessert-like and reminiscent of an añejo. It would make a good sipping Tequila. Look for maple syrup and apple notes, with a creamy mouthfeel and tingly cinnamon spice on the finish.

title: Don Roberto Reposado
description: Don Roberto is one of the few remaining 100% Mexican- and family-owned Tequila producers. The brand launched in 1924 as the family's private stock, and was originally not commercially available, but given only as gifts. It's still gift-worthy, bursting with butterscotch flavors and ending with a lilt of fresh apples, pears, and light brush of black pepper. Aged six months.

title: Karma Tequila
description: Aged nearly a full year (even one more day would have classified this as añejo), this pale-straw spirit has a caramel foundation, but retains a pleasing lightness. The aroma is delicate and floral, while the flavors surprise, with cinnamon, cardamom and nutmeg woven into the caramel. It doesn't hurt that this highlands Tequila comes in a gorgeous bottle with a glass stopper and leather bracelet wrapped around the bottle's neck.

title: 1921 Tequila Reposado
description: Luscious butterscotch notes touched with lemon peel lead the way, while dry cocoa, leather and cigar tobacco notes develop on the finish. Soft feel. Based on this complex and mouthwatering reposado, the añejo must be a knockout.

title: Jose Cuervo Tradicional Tequila Reposado
description: A solid cocktail choice, this 100% agave Tequila has rich, rounded vanilla and zingy peppery notes followed by a dry cocoa accent on the finish. The bottle is a stunner, with its yellow, red and black Day of the Dead graphic that's meant to be frozen to bring out additional thermochromic details. (It's a bit of overkill—the bottle is plenty eye-catching at room temperature.)

title: Tres Agaves Reposado
description: Give this light reposado a little time to open up. The aroma morphs from a smoky, almost barbecue sauce-like aroma to softer, fruiter, even lightly floral notes. The spirit, aged six to nine months in previously used Bourbon casks, offers a vanilla flavor with an assertive herbaceous, grassy finish, faintly touched with menthol and fresh basil.

title: Azul Imperial Reposado
description: Give this bright yellow-gold reposado a little time for the alcohol to dissipate. Look for a mild honey-agave scent and round, buttery flavors with a faint peppery tickle in the back of the throat. The spirit finishes dry and clean, with a bit of oakiness.

title: Olmeca Altos Reposado Tequila
description: Within the square bottle with tactile raised graphics, this spirit is loaded with tropical fruit (pineapple and lychee) chased by robust caramel notes and waft of smoke. Leaning toward dessert-like flavors, this highlands Tequila veers close to añejo territory.

title: Luna Nueva 2012 The Mayan Prophecy Edicion Especial Tequila Reposado
description: On the nose and palate, expect lots of vanilla, punctuated with a gentle, peppery note and a touch of oaky sweetness. Well balanced. The attractive frosted glass bottle with colorful Mayan graphic art is a nice touch, too.

title: T1 Tequila Reposado Excepcional
description: Rested in barrels previously used to age Scotch whisky, this Tequila is complex, earthy and unlike any other. Where others are caramel-forward (the result of resting in used Bourbon barrels), this reposado is crisp, with woodsy, green flavors and subtle notes of coconut and toffee on the finish. The striking, bulbous bottle looks like a genie should pop out, capped as it is with a flame-shaped glass stopper.

title: Tequila Teirras Reposado
description: This certified organic Tequila has a fresh, fruity aroma, with faint touches of pepper and hay. On the palate, look for bright jalapeño flavors, like a blanco, covered with a thick blanket of vanilla. Soft feel.

title: Gran Amigo Tequila Reposado
description: Smoky notes barrel out first, followed by rounded butterscotch and nutty flavors on the elongated finish. This pale-straw reposado would make a great margarita, it's crying out for lime.

title: Pueblo Viejo
description: Has a well-constructed mix of fruity sweetness and oaky vanilla, with a light but lingering smoky finish.

title: Excellia Reposado
description: Aged in Sauternes and Cognac casks, this light gold spirit has notes of sweet vanilla, delicate oak, and a faintly smoky finish. The bottle looks sophisticated, with a pretty red glass flower inset.

title: Don Julio 70 Añejo Claro
description: Billed as the world's first white añejo, it indeed has an unusual clear appearance, hence the name “claro.” Created to celebrate Don Julio's 70th anniversary, this limited edition bottling, aged for 18 months, has powerful charred oak, honey and vanilla notes, and a banana-like finish.

title: Dulce Vida Organic Tequila Añejo
description: This is a unique, certified organic, small-batch Tequila with a distinct whiskey-like presence due to a full 24 months of aging in former Bourbon barrels. Look for a golden color and rich honey notes with a bit of peppery sting. The assertive alcohol can't be ignored (it's 100 proof, after all), but it fades into pleasingly mellow agave notes.

title: Piedra Azul Blanco
description: Great for salty dog cocktails or sangritas, this blanco Tequila is crisp and clear, with a bright agave and vanilla scent. On the palate, touches of jalapeño and vanilla appear, mixed with bold peppery notes and a gentle floral finish.

title: Don Weber Extra Añejo
description: Double distilled and aged for a full three years, this golden extra añejo mixes honey, pepper and herbal notes, winding into a peppy menthol finish.

title: OniliKan Aguardiente de Mango
description: Distilled from mango, this clear aguardiente, or “firewater,” has a light mango scent and a super-light, teasing mix of fruity, briny and peppery notes.

title: Downslope Distilling Ould Tom Citrus Flavored Gin
description: Cocktail history buffs will want to get their hands on this bottle, stat. Made in the lightly sweetened Old Tom style, this golden gin lends itself to classic Martinez or Tom Collins cocktails. Barrel aged for three months, this soft, buttery gin features honey and pear flavors, sprinkled with brown sugar, cinnamon bark and honey notes. It's even mellow enough to sip neat.

title: Greenall's London Dry Gin
description: Smooth, crisp and well balanced, this is a martini-worthy gin. Despite the nearly neutral aroma, look for big juniper, lemon peel and coriander flavors on the palate.

title: Flight 69 Gin
description: Distilled from California grapes, this intriguing, fruity and floral gin finishes smooth and clean, and it offers hints of black pepper and vanilla on the finish. This would make a good addition to a Negroni.

title: No. 3 London Dry Gin
description: Fresh and aromatic, this traditional London dry style gin offers juniper, coriander, grapefruit peel and anise notes. It's versatile and well suited for making gin and tonics. It comes in a distinctive squared-off bottle with a metal key that's embedded in the dark green glass.

title: Bloom Premium London Dry Gin
description: Between the name and the pale-green bottle that features a tactile vine overlay, you'd anticipate a superfloral flavor profile. Fortunately, the chamomile and sweet honeysuckle notes are subtle, woven with delicate juniper, grapefruit peel and coriander accents. The finish is dry and well structured.

title: Greenhook Ginsmiths Beach Plum Liqueur
description: Inspired by England's sloe gin and made with beach plums from Long Island, New York, this gin has round, sweet and tart flavors, with an earthy cinnamon touch on the finish. With its distinctive dark-cherry-juice color and aroma, this lends itself to making fizzes and other cocktails. It's distilled from cane sugar, but it's not supersweet.

title: Vincent Van Gogh Gin
description: This is clear, bright, light and supercitrusy, and using this to make a gin and tonic, you could conceivably skip adding extra citrus to the drink. This veers on the sweet side of the spectrum, and it offers an almost marshmallow-like flavor, punched up with a light cinnamon spark.

title: Comb Jarhead Gin
description: Distiller Ed Tiege, a former Marine, created this limited-edition gin “to honor the sacrifices the members of the U.S. Armed Forces have made.” For each bottle sold, he donates $1.50 to the Wounded Warrior Project. Despite the hauntingly dark, military-style label, the gin inside is surprisingly light and delicate. Made from organic wheat and honey, this has sweet, citrusy flavors, plus anise, black pepper and cardamom notes. Semper Fi.

title: Edinburgh Gin
description: One of the rising number of Scottish-made gins, this small-batch spirit has a good dose of piny juniper aroma and flavor, balanced by citrus peel and surprising flower notes, plus ginger and coriander accents on the finish. A good choice for martinis, with a lemon twist, please.

title: Smugglers' Notch Gin Blend 802
description: This is scented with a lively mix of juniper, citrus and anise aromas, and on the palate, the anise note pushes forward, and it finishes with a candied citrus-peel touch. It's a small-batch gin with a velvety texture, and it's recommended for gimlets and other citrus-forward cocktails.

title: Uncle Val's Botanical Gin
description: Sweet-tasting and citrusy, this has a light herbal aroma. It shows distinct cucumber and lavender notes on the palate, and it should lend itself to spring and summer cocktails. Keep an eye out for exciting savory and spicy variations of Uncle Val's that may be coming to market soon.

title: Nolet's Dry Gin
description: Distinctly fruity and floral on the palate, this has notes of rosewater and raspberry, braced by pepper and ginger flecks. This smooth and well-balanced gin is a good choice for making a berry-forward cocktail like the classic bramble.

title: Greenhook Ginsmiths American Dry Gin
description: This spicy, flavorful Brooklyn gin starts out light, with an upfront, fleeting, fruity sweetness, but powerful flavors of juniper, black pepper, coriander and anise quickly rush forward. Combine this with tonic or another mixer to tame the alcohol heat.

title: Half Moon Orchard Gin
description: From the upstate New York distiller best known for creating Hudson Baby Bourbon comes this crisp and appealing gin, which is packaged in an attractive, nautical-themed bottle. The aromas are of citrus and anise, although on the palate the anise thrusts forward to overshadow the citrus note. The gin is distilled from a mix of 80% wheat and 20% apples. Although there's nothing apple-y about the flavor profile, the wheat yields a flavorful mix of piquant spices on the finish. Ideal for briny olive-spiked martinis.

title: Breucklen Distilling Glorious Gin
description: Distilled from 100% New York wheat, this brisk, perky gin is bright and sweet, and it offers notes of candied lemon peel and rosemary, plus a warm touch of anise.

title: Kinsey Distilled Dry Gin
description: The aroma is bright, fresh, and piney, with a hint of green apple. By comparison, the flavor is relatively neutral, and it offers a bit of fruity green-apple sweetness that builds pleasantly onto the finish.

title: Comb 9 Gin
description: Distilled from honey, this smooth New York dry gin is on the gentle side. Although it starts with a warm licorice note, it concedes to sweetness on the palate, with black pepper, lavender and candied lemon peel flavors. It has balanced alcohol and relatively neutral aromas.

title: Ingenium Gin
description: Any guesses on the botanicals?” distiller Ned Wight asked. This could be a challenging drinking game. The only clue on the label is that it's made with “traditional and nontraditional botanicals,” including “a few extras” that Ned picked up on his travels through Southeast Asia. The base of the gin is bold and distinctly earthy, with malt and warm anise notes, plus juniper, mint, white pepper and lemon-grass hints.

title: Junipero Gin
description: “San Francisco's original craft gin,” as Junipero is billed, features a light, piny fragrance and a pungent, earthy flavor, with loads of anise and a good wallop of alcohol.

title: Myer Farm Gin
description: This small-batch, estate-grown “field-to-flask” gin bears a passing resemblance to its malty cousin, genever. It has a bold anise aroma and flavor, and a warm, almost buttery feel.

title: Black Zephyr Gin
description: This smooth, versatile mixer has a neutral aroma and a gentle, lightly floral flavor that mixes citrus and ginger notes. The botanicals include elder-flower and elderberry.

title: Blu Zephyr
description: The pale robin's-egg blue hue, which is derived from iris flowers, is no doubt this gin's most striking feature. Infused with elderberry and gardenia, this has flavors of sweet-tasting but ersatz ripe fruit, and it has a drying feel. Still, this should make for some colorful cocktails.

title: Los Amantes Mezcal Joven
description: Among the best of the joven/silver category, this refreshing mezcal offers bright anise and pine notes, backed by apple and sweet agave flavors and delicate smokiness. Brisk but balanced alcohol levels make this a top contender for cocktails.

title: Del Maguey Single Village Mezcal Arroqueño
description: Del Maguey has built a stellar reputation with their single-village mezcals, and this beauty is a case in point. Sprightly aromas of pine, rosemary and sage lead into savory, citrusy and even meaty flavors, with a mouthwatering brininess and a smoky finish that's reminiscent of Islay Scotch. Pair this velvety mezcal with seafood or aged cheese.

title: Koch El Mezcal
description: This citrusy artisanal mezcal is made from four types of agave: Cirial, Tobasiche, Tobala and De Lumbre. The aromas tend toward sweet vanilla and lightly roasted characteristics. A big citrus twang on the palate gives way to a lively note of cayenne pepper on the finish.

title: Four Roses Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: This mellow Bourbon is scented with vanilla and a hint of stone fruit. On the palate it's light and creamy, with nuanced notes of vanilla, almond and pecan, plus a gentle baking-spice finish. Sip or mix.

title: Bulleit Bourbon Frontier Whiskey
description: This workhorse Bourbon is a worthwhile addition for cocktails or straight-up sips. Look for bold caramel and spice, accented with fresh pear and ginger, finishing long.

title: Low Gap California Whiskey Bourbon
description: Golden in the glass, this distinctly light, silky whiskey offers vanilla and maple on the nose and palate, finishing long and elegant with baking spice, citrus peel and a surprising hint of anise. Sip or mix.

title: Bulleit Bourbon Frontier Whiskey Aged 10 Years
description: The creamy caramel and vanilla scent is echoed on the palate, where it's also interwoven with espresso and clove, finishing relatively dry. A splash of water mellows the alcohol heat and the flavor still sings out boldly.

title: Catskill Distilling Company The Most Righteous New York Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Made from New York State grains and aged on site, this dark-amber Bourbon has a bold caramel and toffee aroma. On the palate, drier flavors dominate: espresso, toffee, cocoa and leather. It offers burnt orange-peel brightness on the long, mouthwatering finish.

title: Catskill Distilling Company The Most Righteous New York Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Made from New York State grains and aged on site, this dark-amber Bourbon has a bold caramel and toffee aroma. On the palate, drier flavors dominate: espresso, toffee, cocoa and leather. It offers burnt orange-peel brightness on the long, mouthwatering finish.

title: Old Forester 2015 Birthday Bourbon Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: The latest in the annual series has a cedar and sandalwood aroma, plus a maple undertone. It's cask strength, and stands up to a bit of dilution, still offering a big, fruit-forward rush of flavors with oak, orange peel, dried apricot, almond and vanilla.

title: Union Horse Distilling Co. Reserve Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Despite the rich brown sugar and vanilla aroma, this whiskey is relatively lean and austere, featuring plenty of oak up front, leather midpalate and finishing long with plenty of tingly spice. Good sipper.

title: A.D. Laws Four Grain Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Look for an enticing vanilla scent with a hint of almond extract. The palate opens with vanilla and oak, then dries to dark toffee and espresso, finishing with clove and cardamom. This small-batch whiskey was made from corn, barley, wheat and rye.

title: Flatboat Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Sip or mix this Bourbon that shows pleasing notes of sweet vanilla bean, almond extract and orange peel, finishing with cocoa and hint of campfire smoke.

title: Amador Whiskey Co. Double Barrel Kentucky Bourbon Whiskey Finished With Napa Valley Wine Barrels
description: This whiskey is made from a blend of Kentucky Bourbons aged from three to ten years old and finished in former Napa Valley wine barrels. Caramel sweetness intertwines with oak, vanilla and coconut, while a meandering, slightly earthy finish suggests mellow cocoa and a puff of campfire smoke. Dilution coaxes out a marshmallow-y sweetness. Overall, the experience is reminiscent of s'mores, with that cocoa-smoke finish. Sip or mix.

title: Four Roses Small Batch Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: This skillfully blended Bourbon has a gentle vanilla fragrance and plenty of vanilla, pecan pie, maple sugar, oak and lemon-peel flavor.

title: Tatoosh Bourbon
description: Aged three years, this smooth and relatively dry whiskey leads with oak and vanilla, then winds into cigar wrapper, clove and cracked black pepper on the finish.

title: Jefferson's Reserve Groth Reserve Cask Finish Very Old Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: This experimental “very small batch” bottling is made with “very old” Kentucky Bourbon finished for nine months in barrels that previously held Cabernet Sauvignon from the Napa Valley winery Groth. The end result is a caramel and dried-fruit nose and a relatively dry, tannic whiskey with a port-like dark-fruit undercurrent. Debuted May 2015.

title: 1792 Single Barrel Kentucky Straight Boubon Whiskey
description: his Bourbon is packaged in a hefty bottle that looks like the ones seen on the Cognac shelf; the whiskey inside has a brandy-like flavor profile too. The aroma suggests Sherry and dried fruit, while the palate shows bold caramel and maple laced with mocha, clove and cayenne. At nearly 100 proof, it needs a bit of dilution to soften the alcohol edge; that also brings forward the Sherried fruit promised by the aroma.

title: High Wire Distilling Co. New Southern Revival Bourbon Whiskey Finished in Madeira Barrels
description: Almost a history lesson in a bottle, this was made with four local heirloom grains and finished with Madeira—a fortified wine with deep Charleston history. Look for a woody aroma with a hint of dried fruit. The palate shows a flash of sweetness up front and a woody midpalate mixed with dark fruit and honey that slides away into a fruitcake-like finish.

title: Orphan Barrel The Gifted Horse American Whiskey
description: his is made with a 17-year-old Kentucky straight Bourbon mixed with a younger (4-year-old) Bourbon and corn whiskey, both sourced from Indiana. The aroma is delicious, bold with Sherried fruit and caramel. The palate follows through with bold fruitcake-like flavor, lots of molasses, caramel, orange peel and clove, finishing long. But the proof is so high, even with plenty of dilution it's still quite fiery and challenging to sip.

title: I.W. Harper Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: The vanilla aroma carries hints of fresh-cut pear and apple, but the flavor is woody, not as sprightly and fresh as the aroma suggests. Nonetheless, it shows vanilla and almond plus warming nutmeg and cinnamon on the drying finish.

title: Trail's End Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: his Kentucky Bourbon “finished with Oregon oak staves” offers a caramel and coconut scent that is echoed on the silky, lightly sweet palate, finishing with nutmeg, clove and a wallop of alcohol heat. It's recommended for mixing into old fashioneds and other cocktails.

title: Redemption Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Distilled in Indiana and bottled in Kentucky, this golden Bourbon has a honey and cedar aroma. Quite light on the palate, it features mellow honey, coconut and almond flavors, finishing with mild baking spice.

title: High Wire Distilling Co. New Southern Revival Bourbon Whiskey
description: Made with four local grains (heirloom white corn, red winter wheat, malted barley and Carolina Gold rice bran), this Bourbon has a dark burnished copper hue and woody aroma. The palate shows vanilla, cedar and oak, finishing with bitter chocolate, espresso and clove, plus a rounded dark-fruit note on the exit.

title: Charles Goodnight Small Batch Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: This small-batch Bourbon offers a warm vanilla aroma with hints of coconut and almond. Quite hot and drying on the palate (it's 100 proof, after all), it needs to be dosed with water to coax out vanilla, oak, coconut and an intriguing wisp of campfire smoke on the finish.

title: Rough Rider The Happy Warrior Cask Strength Straight Bourbon Whisky
description: This cask-strength Bourbon is aged four years, then finished in former Chardonnay casks from a Long Island winery. The aroma is rich with caramel and vanilla. It's quite drying on the palate, so adding water tempers the flavor profile to vanilla, oak and orange peel.

title: Kirkland Signature Premium Small Batch Bourbon Aged 7 Years Tennessee Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Ideal for mixed drinks, this toffee and caramel-scented Bourbon offers plenty of toasty flavor and hints of almond extract, finishing with cedar, oak and vanilla. At over 100 proof, it also offers a fiery dose of alcohol heat.

title: Colter's Run Bourbon Whiskey
description: The vanilla aroma is accented with bright orange peel. Meanwhile, the palate is relatively dry, leading with oak and some vanilla, then finishing with baking spice. Mix with ginger ale and lime. It's named for John Colter, a scout with the Lewis and Clark Expedition.

title: Blind Tiger Bourbon Whiskey
description: The name of this small-batch Bourbon—blind tiger—is a Prohibition-era synonym for a speakeasy. This whiskey has a concentrated oaky aroma and flavor, and is best with plenty of dilution, which dials back the woodiness and brings forward espresso and cocoa notes.

title: Garrison Brothers Texas Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: This amber-hued whiskey is made with Texas corn, and the label on the bottle provides an endearing amount of detail, spelling out the corn variety (#1 Panhandle white) and where it was farmed (Dallam County), the year the corn was harvested, plus details related to distillation and aging. The whiskey itself is a bit oaky, showing some vanilla and caramel, finishing long and slightly hot. I'd love to see a longer-aged version of this whiskey.

title: J.P. Trodden Small Batch Bourbon Whiskey
description: The brisk, woody aroma hints at almond. On the palate, light almond sweetness is chased by oak into a vanilla finish. It's relatively hot and drying. The flavor doesn't stand up to dilution; it becomes lighter and smoother, showing just a light vanilla wash on the exit.

title: Rough Rider Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: This Bourbon has a maple-y scent with just a hint of smoke. On the palate, resin dominates at first, then gives over to dried apricot and oak, with a pleasing Sherry-like echo on the finish.

title: Citadelle Gin
description: Light and complex, this gin, made by Cognac producer Maison Ferrand, has a restrained lemon peel aroma and gently sweet palate accented by citrus, coriander and cardamom. The finish is markedly soft and bright, with just a hint of sweetness.

title: Three Olives Vanilla Flavored Vodka
description: Emits round, softly sweet scents of vanilla bean; aeration brings out more profound vanilla qualities. Palate entry is bittersweet and intense; at midpalate, the flavor profile shifts to a sweeter, almost honeyed or even Sherried taste. Aftertaste is long and delicious.

title: Plantation Rum Old Reserve 1990 Guyana
description: Earthy and biscuity aromas, like cake batter, cocoa, lead, slate and rubber are all bundled together. Palate is bittersweet, then the off-dry to semisweet core taste turns intensely maple-like. Aftertaste is long, sappy and oily.

title: Francis Darroze 1988 Domaine de Coquillon Bas Armagnac
description: The initial nosings pick up spirity, almost prickly scents of grapefruit and green melon; aeration allows a peppery, nearly chili-like perfume to overcome the fruitiness. Palate entry is warm, cottony and bittersweet; by midpalate, a refined smokiness appears, followed by a creamy nut-like taste in the finish that sums up the whole alluring experience.

title: Stolichnaya Stoli Cranberi Cranberry Flavored Vodka
description: First inhalation stamps the impression of ripe, fresh cranberry; with further time in the glass, the cranberry settles down. Palate entry is subtle as the  ripe cranberry essence emerges at the end of the first taste wave; by midpalate, the flavor becomes graceful as the cranberry taste turns ripe, sweet and juicy, but neither cloying nor domineering. Aftertaste is long, ripe and properly acidic.

title: Hart Brothers Finest Collection Macallan 1968 34 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: Early aromatic nuances of grass/forest vegetation and pine; with aeration, the bouquet expands, adding zesty, dry notes of cedar, black pepper and hay. Palate entry is lean, off-dry and sap-like; by midpalate, the flavor swings more in the traditional Macallan way, offering luscious vanilla-laden, oloroso Sherry, maple-sweet tastes.

title: Murray McDavid Laphroaig 1988 14 Year Old Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: Displays peatiness/sea breeze right from the first whiff; further air contact releases medicinal aromas of iodine, antiseptic, seaweed, light wood smoke and kippers. Lovers of hearty Islay malts won't be disappointed with the concentrated and cigarette smoke-like palate entry; at midpalate the taste comes off mildly maple-like, corn sugar-like and honeyed. Finishes clean and briny.

title: Cruzan Mango Rum
description: Opening whiffs detect subtle, skillfully balancescents of barely ripe mango; the aroma turns into an ambrosial bouquet that highlights the mango but offers lesser aromatic roles to pear and papaya. Palate entry is tart, even bitter, then at midpalate the flavor turns ripe and succulent. Aftertaste is sweet and fresh.

title: Prichards' Fine Rum
description: Teasing, atypical aroma opens up with subtle traces of black pepper, minerals and oak; after more aeration, the bouquet adds hints of black licorice, lemon drop and beeswax. Palate entry's first impression is of black licorice, then a resiny oakiness takes over; by midpalate, the black pepper/spice returns along with a bittersweet flavor that's nutty and nougat-like. Aftertaste is medium-weight and bittersweet.

title: Hennessy Le Peu Single Distillery Cognac
description: The upfront aroma is austere and unripe; further air contact shows nectarine and pear—be patient with this bouquet. Palate entry is all about ripe grapes and tropical fruit, while the midpalate exposes vanilla, honey and oak. Aftertaste reflects the agile nature of this delicate Cognac.

title: Francis Darroze 1970 Domaine de Gaube Bas Armagnac
description: Touches of nail polish remover and boiled cabbage prick the olfactory sense to attention; later passes detect  more well-rounded, almost fat, aromas of almond and lanolin. There's a rush of fatty butter flavor at palate entry, then at midpalate the flavor includes oak, black raisins and dark caramel. Aftertaste is thick, long and sweet.

title: Francis Darroze 1976 Domaine de Guillemouta Bas Armagnac
description: The aroma bristles with vivid fragrances, including cotton and pine; air contact heightens other aromas, namely plums, chocolate cake frosting and spice. Palate entry is astringent and fruity; by midpalate, there's a surge of oak that underpins the tastes of light toffee and marzipan. Finish is prickly, nougat-like and honey sweet.

title: Maison Védrenne Hospices de Beaune 1993 Eau de Vie de Marc
description: The pungent aroma is intensely grapy and viny, astringent and pulpy. The palate entry is stonily dry, cleansing, and acidic; at midpalate the acidic/minerally astringency gives way momentarily to a flash of ripe grapiness/pulpiness. Finishes intensely grapy and musty, verging suddenly on being ripe and even raisiny. Now, this is marc.

title: Amaretto di Puglia Liqueur
description: The assertive bouquet opens up with hearty, bittersweet scents of almond and apricot stone. Palate is lush, firm in texture and richly sweet; the midpalate is toasty, warm, intensely nutty and silky. Concludes medium-long and downright luscious.

title: Zaya 12 Year Old Gran Reserva Rum
description: Seductive nose is juicy, with ripe, fruity aromas of baked apple, baked pear, nutmeg, vanilla bean, cardamom and dried orange peel. Flavor is firm, bittersweet, focused and more maple-like than sugary. Ends moderately oily and keenly bittersweet. In that league of aged rums that begin to resemble brandies.

title: Bruichladdich Legacy II 37 Year Old 1965 Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: Aroma offers ripe, fruity notes of guava, light caramel, peach, banana, spice and maple; a totally integrated bouquet. Palate entry displays a honeyed richness that coats the tongue; at the oily midpalate, semisweet tastes of pipe tobacco, marzipan, cocoa and lanolin delight the taste buds. Concludes a touch smoky, warm and semisweet.

title: Cragganmore 12 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The succulent aroma develops with aeration in the sweet forms of barley, cream, light caramel, and a trace of tropical fruit. Palate entry is round, borderline plump, breakfast-cereal sweet, and honeyed; at midpalate, there's a slightly oily peat smoke. Sweetly concludes with the focus on the malt.

title: Cabo Wabo Anejo 100% Agave Tequila
description: Initially smells of black peppercorn and oak resin; more time shows baked banana, bacon fat, dried sage, dried thyme, brown rice and broccoli. Entry has a bean-like quality; midpalate flavors include sweet, wood-influenced tastes of honey, milk chocolate, cream Sherry and vanilla cake frosting. Ends wrapped in smoky vanilla and cocoa.

title: Cabo Wabo Blanco 100% Agave Tequila
description: Bouquet offers aromas of salty brine, fennel and green peppercorn; in time, a dried-sage aroma takes command, with assistance from burnt match and metallic notes of lead, rust, nickel. Palate entry is vegetal-herbal, but semisweet and oily; the midpalate is sweet, buttery, fatty and intensely peppery.

title: Tequila Corralejo Anejo 100% Agave Tequila
description: Concentrated, intense aromas include lead pencil, steamed asparagus and rubber eraser; another seven minutes sees the raw aroma transform into a bouquet that features scents of palm oil, jalapeño, oak resin and stone/granite/mineral. Palate entry offers subtle, semisweet tastes of toffee and egg cream; by midpalate, the taste includes vanilla, cocoa, margarine, peppercorn and honey. Ends in sweet, creamy tastes that highlight the toffee.

title: Absolut Citron Vodka
description: Citron's bouquet sings with fresh, vibrant, lemon zest right from the opening bell; the prototypical citrus-flavored vodka bouquet. Palate entry is so clean and effortless that you just want to consume more immediately; at midpalate, there's a rush of lemon zest and oil. The distillers reached the ideal degree of flavor balance, without submerging the vodka presence.

title: Bowmore Mariner 15 Year Old Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: The initial nosings encounter hints of sweet oak and honey rather than salt/brine; aeration stimulates the gentle sea salt component as the oak/fruit element recedes to the background. Palate entry is succulent, elegant and creamy sweet; at midpalate, tastes of cocoa, coffee bean, butterscotch and caramel blossom on the tongue. Finishes sweet, viscous and maple-like. Shows an extraordinary amount of grace and harmony.

title: Duncan Taylor & Co., Ltd. Macallan 1968 Cask 5585 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The heady aroma is dominated at first by the piquant spirit, followed by aromas of toffee, unsalted butter and pear drops. Palate entry features an intensely oily, minty flavor; by midpalate, the flavor returns to the oak/malt core while a light creaminess mitigates some of the oiliness. Finishes semisweet, viscous and spirity.

title: Frapin Chateau Fontpinot XO Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Made from estate-grown, chateau-bottled Grande Champagne grapes and eaux-de-vie that are between 15 and 20 years old. Aroma of damp earth, succulent fresh fruit, flowers and spice. Palate entry is off-dry, caramel-like and properly oak; at midpalate, the flavor deepens, offering lip-smacking tastes of light toffee, almond butter and vanilla extract. Finishes candied and rich.

title: Marie Brizard Orange Curaçao Liqueur
description: Stunning rich bronze/copper color. The first whiffs find scents of dried orange rind and lemon zest; aeration adds subtle notes of white pepper, jasmine and palm oil. Palate entry is luxuriously thick, oily, off-dry to bittersweet and mildly orangey; by midpalate the flavor is deeply orangey, sweet/sour and nearly pulpy. Ends sweet and with the correct amount of rind.

title: Benriach Curiositas 10-Year-Old Peated Malt Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The opening aroma is pleasingly smoky and soot-like, then the bouquet opens up to include aromas of creosote, olive brine and cigarette ash. The palate entry is warming, nougaty sweet and sap-like; at midpalate the chunky flavor profile offers a well-integrated marriage of barley malt and sweet smokiness/peatiness. Finishes on a sweet, grainy note. Best Buy.

title: Bernheim Original Kentucky Straight Wheat Whiskey
description: Initial scents are floral and wheat cracker-like; aeration adds deeper, mildly sweet aromas of sap, fresh vanilla bean and light honey. Palate entry is finely balanced with wood, moderately sweet grain and acidity; by midpalate the alcohol warms the throat with off-dry flavors of charred oak, light toffee and sap. Finishes elegant and warm. A true sipping whiskey.

title: Marie Duffau Napoleon Bas Armagnac
description: The opening nosings find smells of roasted chestnut and baked pear; later sniffings pick up succulent notes of pineapple, caramel, black raisins, prunes and old oak. The palate entry is creamy textured and semisweet; at the midpalate the flavor becomes integrated and very nutty/woody. Concludes oily, semisweet and oaky. Best Buy.

title: Miller's Westbourne Strength Reformed London Dry Gin
description: The initial bouquet has scents of lime peel and cassia bark; aeration adds traces of juniper, angelica, and coriander. The palate entry features snappy tastes of off-dry licorice and orris root flavors; at midpalate there is a mellow creaminess accented by juniper, tropical fruit, and a hint of nutmeg. Finishes gracefully off-dry, textured, moderately creamy, and savory.

title: El Tesoro Reposado 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1139-CRT
description: There are subtle notes of cocoa, white chocolate and straw in the first whiffs after the pour; aeration adds aromas of tar, gum, parchment and grass. The palate entry is intensely vegetal and tobacco-like; midpalate finds tastes of uncooked asparagus, sweet oak, light toffee and skimmed milk. Finishes elegantly, smooth and semisweet. A class act. Best Buy.

title: Brugal Anejo Gran Reserva Familiar Rum
description: A mature bouquet of mildly toasty aromas of marshmallow, light toffee, caramel, and milk chocolate; further aeration stimulates background notes of nutmeg and cinnamon. The palate entry is integrated, moderately oily, chocolaty and gently sweet; at midpalate the taste profile expands to include honey, molasses and egg cream. Finishes up elegantly and sweet. Best Buy.

title: Kilbeggan
description: Light and fresh, this golden beauty has a mild white-floral note in the aroma and a gentle softness on the palate. Honey, vanilla and almond wash over the palate, with a moderately spicy finish.

title: Bushmills 10 Year Old Single Malt
description: Though it's a workhorse whiskey, it's still full of surprises. The sweet, bright aromas of honey, vanilla and pear and the velvety feel belie the rich, bold salted-butterscotch umami on the palate.

title: Malloye Whiskey
description: This light gold whiskey has fresh scents of apple and pear, followed by a light smokiness on the palate. Smoke accelerates into the finish in a pleasing way, with a prickle of ginger.

title: Bushmills Irish Honey
description: More of a honey-spiked whiskey rather than a liqueur, this is ideal for mixing or introducing beginners to the pleasures of Irish whiskey. Authentic honey richness comes through on the palate, but it's subtle and not overly sweet, and doesn't lose the pleasures of the fresh, lightly fruity base spirit.

title: Tullamore Dew 12 Year Old Special Reserve
description: With its mild aromatics and flavor, this light-gold blended whiskey is suitable for sipping or mixing. Look for vanilla, caramel, touches of nuts, orange peel and gentle spice notes on the finish.

title: Concannon Irish Whiskey
description: This venture from Cooley Distillery and Concannon Vineyard brings a whiskey aged in ex-Bourbon casks for at least four years, then rested for at least four months in barrels that previously held Concannon Petite Sirah. The end result is light-bodied and silky, with smoky flavor and touches of vanilla and lemon zest on the finish. Some might hope for a more wine-like profile, but it's pleasing nevertheless.

title: Bushmills Original
description: Light and easy-sipping, this light-gold whiskey has a grassy, slightly vegetal aroma, with a hint of Granny Smith apple. Look for vanilla and honey flavors, with a bit of cinnamon sizzle on the finish.

title: Kavanagh Irish Whiskey
description: Look for aromas of fresh-cut grass, pears and vanilla. At first sip, baked-pear flavor bursts on the palate, followed by a long, mouthwatering vanilla finish and a bit of alcohol heat.

title: Tullamore Dew 10 Year Old Single Malt
description: Light and downright juicy, this pale-gold whiskey actually smells like apple juice spiked with a hint of booze. It's more complex on the palate, mixing fruit and vanilla flavors with ginger and cinnamon on the finish.

title: Redbreast 12 Cask Strength
description: Straight up, this cask-strength whiskey is crazy hot, almost too hot to drink. But it shines as a base for mixed drinks, as its honeyed Sherry scent and mix of malty apple and faintly smoky flavors stand up to significant dilution. For straight-up sipping, seek out the excellent—and 80 proof—Redbreast 12 year old.

title: Knappogue Cask 14 year old Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: The aroma of this light-gold whiskey mixes notes of faint smoke and fresh apple. On the palate, vanilla, citrus and dried fruit mingle with an oaky astringency and strong alcohol heat. Aged for 14 years in oloroso Sherry casks and Bourbon barrels.

title: Jameson Irish Whiskey
description: A favorite for shots at bars across the nation, Jameson has a bright, juicy aroma and a drying feel. Look for baking spices, red apple, a fleeting resin note and rounded vanilla tones. It's a versatile addition to cocktails or simply mixed with ginger ale.

title: Charbay Hop Flavored Whiskey— Release III 1999
description: Double-distilled from Pilsner beer, flavored with hops and aged for 14 years (six years in oak, eight years out of oak), this limited-edition whiskey isn't for everyone. It's powerful, big and oaky on the palate, with lots of tannins rounding out into vanilla, honey and sweet-yet-bitter orange peel. Bottled at an over-the-top 132 proof, it needs a lot of dilution, but once the alcohol is tamed, an enticing velvetiness emerges. This whiskey is different, interesting and oddly haunting. It would make a wild Manhattan.

title: Jim Beam Maple
description: This maple-flavored Bourbon features rich and sweet maple and vanilla aromas and flavors, plus a lingering butterscotch note. A flicker of heat on the finish reminds one there's actually whiskey in there, and serves to balance out the sweetness with cinnamon and ginger sparks. Surprisingly addictive, this is one of the few flavored whiskies that works equally well mixed or sipped straight up.

title: Knob Creek Smoked Maple
description: Whiskey first, flavoring second in this bottle. The alcohol presence comes through early on the nose and palate (it's 90 proof, after all), followed by undercurrents of maple and vanilla. It finishes with flourishes of spice and heat, with a welcome orange-peel note. If you're seeking a quality flavored Bourbon that will stand up to mixing, here it is.

title: Jack Daniel's Winter Jack Tennessee  Cider
description: A lighter style of whiskey, this blend of apple cider liqueur and Tennessee whiskey smells fresh and inviting, hinting at apples, pears and baking spices. Sweet and tart on the tongue—resembling a light version of ice wine—this easy-drinking seasonal offering works well either warm or chilled.

title: Charbay S Hop Flavored Whiskey
description: Distilled from beer and aged in French oak, this is a sophisticated flavored whiskey. The aromas are honeyed and sweet, with touches of beer and a faint floral note. On the palate, it shows oak, a bitter hoppiness and a wash of honey. It tastes hot, so have some branch water at the ready.

title: Paddy Bee Sting
description: This mix of Irish whiskey, liqueur, honey and flavorings offers a honey aroma with a strong waxy note. On the palate it's viscous, almost creamy, with bold apple and honey flavors accented by spice and floral notes on the finish. It's appealing to sip or mix.

title: Vanilla Mist
description: A mix of vanilla liqueur and blended Canadian whiskey, this bottle has a rich vanilla aroma and flavor, with touches of maple and brown sugar. Though it's easy-sipping, balanced alcohol keeps the sweetness in check.

title: Early Times Blind Archer Spiced Apple
description: Made with spiced apple liqueur blended with Early   Times whisky, anticipate a fresh apple scent and sweet, rounded apple and vanilla flavors. There's also a mouthwatering quality, with a fleeting saline note. Light and recommended for mixing.

title: Early Times Fire Eater Hot Cinnamon
description: Don't let the name scare you: even spice wimps should be able to handle this one, especially when mixed. This blend of cinnamon liqueur and Early Times Whisky yields a honey color, with zesty aromas and flavors resembling cinnamon red-hot candies. Despite some cinnamon and cassia heat at the back of the tongue, the spice doesn't completely overwhelm, and serves to balance out the otherwise sweet viscosity.

title: Wild Turkey Spiced
description: The Bourbon base of this product punches through on first sip, showing oak upfront on the palate, followed by vanilla and gentle spice. The spice builds with repeated sips, as does the alcohol heat, though it retains a soft feel. Enjoy on the rocks or mixed.

title: Pow-Wow Botanical Rye
description: The unusual herbal notes in this rye whiskey-based product yield an almost amaro-like aroma. Flavors run to vanilla and sarsaparilla, which yield to assertive bitter elements that resemble dried citrus peel or hops, and finish with a bright citrusy note.

title: Maple Mist
description: A blend of maple liqueur and Canadian whiskey, this offering's rich, creamy maple and caramel notes are a treat. It's viscous and sweet, but not overwhelming, and finishes with subtle ginger and cinnamon spices.

title: J.P. Wiser's No. 5 Spiced Whisky Vanilla
description: Tawny-colored, this flavored Canadian whisky starts with a bold, candy-like vanilla scent, which deepens to butterscotch on the palate. Assertive alcohol cuts through the sweetness. Recommended served tall, with ginger ale and ice.

title: Paddy Devil's Apple
description: This flavored Irish whiskey offers a bold green-apple scent brushed with vanilla. On the tongue, look for sweet, slightly ersatz but pleasing green-apple flavors and a cinnamon flourish on the finish. Though it's slightly too sweet to sip straight up, this is a fun addition to cocktails.

title: XXX Shine Salted Caramel Corn Whiskey
description: Presented in a moonshiner's glass jug, this amber corn whiskey has deep maple syrup and caramel scents. The flavor tastes oaky rather than caramel-like, while a mouthwatering saline touch around the edges adds interest. The producer recommends mixing the whiskey into coffee or into a stout float, with ice cream and stout beer. It can stand up to strong flavors in creative cocktails.

title: Henebery
description: What a roller-coaster! This spice--infused, young high-rye whiskey seems to evolve with every second it's in the glass. The complex fragrance is cinnamon-spice, herbal and fruity, all at once. On the tongue, it tastes herbal, even slightly bitter. It shifts from bitter orange to citrusy, to sarsaparilla and cinnamon, and back to bitter again. Medium to light weight, it also has a modest alcohol bite. Straight up, it's not unlike taking a slug from a bottle of bitters, but this intriguing little wonder has interesting implications for mixed drinks.

title: Cinnamon Mist
description: Amber-gold, sweet and candy-like, this flavored Canadian whisky resembles red-hot cinnamon and fireball candies more than natural cinnamon spice. Viscous, and intended for mixing.

title: Peach Mist
description: The bold peach-nectar aroma separates this flavored Canadian whisky from the pack. On the palate, flavors blend peach and vanilla, with a slightly bitter edge. Mix with iced tea for a Southern-style sipper.

title: Herradura Añejo 100% de Agave Tequila Natural
description: The bouquet features wonderful aromas of caramel, cream, pastry dough and nutmeg with a background hint of honeyed peanuts. Entry is spicy and full-bodied; the midpalate displays a trace of vanillin that supports the more vibrant flavors of brine, salt, green vegetable and green pepper. Finishes clean, a touch smoky and delicately spiced. A classic añejo Tequila. Delicious.

title: Old Raj Gin
description: This is the lower-proof version of the classic Old Raj. Lovely, complex gin bouquet offers aromas of coriander, juniper, anise, orris root, ground pepper, lemon peel, lead pencil, earth and tree bark. Palate entry is creamy, fruity, spicy and minty; midpalate offers layers of botanical complexity over the core juniper taste. Finishes with a wonderful rush of mint and baking spice. Fabulous.

title: Herradura Silver Blanco Suave 100% de Agave Tequila Natural
description: The bouquet is marvelously animated with vibrant herbal and earthy aromas of dill, green pepper, mace, hemp and tilled earth. Entry is intensely herbal and earthy, and keenly peppery; at midpalate the acidity fuels the flavor push of brine, dill, soil, textile and light spice. Concludes as peppery and forceful as it began. A world-class spirit.

title: Grand Traverse True North Vodka
description: Very nice bouquet consisting of pleasant aromas of bread dough, black pepper, new leather and toasted grain. The grainy toastiness and spiciness continue at palate entry; midpalate shows a touch of spirity heat in line with the inherent peppery quality. Finishes with tastes of fudge, egg cream, toasted wheat and toasted rye bread.

title: Herradura Reposado 100% de Agave Tequila Natural
description: The aroma is a little sweet; the sweetness diminishes slightly following aeration, but is still firm, biscuity and dill-like. Entry is delightfully off-dry, keenly acidic, fresh and slightly spicy; the midpalate features long, oily tastes of wax, black pepper and palm oil. Finishes oily, textile-like and a touch metallic. A leaner style of reposado.

title: Stolichnaya Vodka
description: Early scents of Wheat Thins crackers; aeration stimulates deeper notes of metal, minerals and a dash of tobacco smoke. Entry is beefy, firm, big-textured and dry; at midpalate the taste turns markedly sweeter and adds a charcoal, soot aspect that nicely balances the grain. Sturdy, sweet and sap-like finish.

title: Pearl Blueberry Flavored Vodka
description: Smells initially of blueberry muffins and ripe blueberries; aeration time brings out the fruit's acidity and an appealing tartness. Palate entry is sweeter and riper than I expected; midpalate features dried blueberries as the taste remains unrepentantly sweet and fruity. Concludes clean, intensely fruity and savory. Captures authentic blueberry qualities.

title: Herradura Seleccion Suprema Extra Añejo 100% de Agave Tequila Natural
description: The initial nosing passes find resiny, textile-like notes; following aeration time an oaky sweetness emerges in the aromatic form of malted milk and pastry dough. Entry is slightly fat, with an oaky creaminess; the midpalate offers earthy tastes of egg cream, peppery spice, jalapeño pepper, dill leaf and nutmeg. Concludes on an off-dry note that's nicely peppery and woody.

title: Grand Traverse True North Natural Cherry Flavor Vodka
description: Cherry fruit scents of the bouquet evolve to cherry pastry by the end of the sniffing rounds. Palate entry focuses on the dry and spicy cherry  compote flavor; midpalate is long and intense with dried cherry fruit and peppery flavors. Finishes a little bitter and keenly tart.

title: Pearl Plum Flavored Vodka
description: The plum-like perfume is delicately sweet and ripe; aeration time allows deeper, more juicy aromas to evolve. Palate entry is richly plummy, a dash sugary, but very tasty; midpalate is long, sugary sweet, candied, but holds enough acidity to maintain balance. Finishes very ripe.

title: UVIX Vodka
description: This unusual vodka bouquet features delicately fruity scents and a viny, stemmy fragrance complemented by aromas of aluminum foil, chalk and granite. Entry is intriguingly touched with botanical spice/root and black pepper; midpalate displays dry flavors of stone, grapevines and pomace. Grapy, near-ripe in the finish. A strange but compelling vodka.

title: Martí Auténtico Dorado Especiál Ron Limitado Cuban-Style Rum
description: Medicinal, pill-like aromas appear at first; these disappear following aeration as a feeble mown-grass sweetness takes over—an anemic bouquet. Things improve with the palate entry, which is of cocoa and dark chocolate; the pleasing midpalate is honey-sweet, a trace fruity and baking spice-like. Ends up bittersweet, oaky and resiny.

title: Rubi Rey Reserve Rum Single Barrel Finished White Rum
description: The nosing passes find a background hint of molasses and vegetal notes with subtle traces of metal coin, lead pencil and black pepper. Palate entry is substantial, moderately oily and dry; midpalate shows more molasses intensity and sweetness than the entry. Finishes cleanly, drier than the midpalate, cocoa-like and with a touch of lead pencil.

title: Tortuga Banana Flavored Rum
description: Initial inhalations pick up a soft baked banana scent; following aeration a delicate spiciness is added to the mix. Palate entry features savory tastes of banana custard, nutmeg and banana cream; midpalate is manageably sweet and baked banana-like, with subtle hints of burnt sugar and brown butter. Concludes silky smooth and sweet, like crème brûlée.

title: Karlsson's Gold Vodka
description: 100% “virgin” (sic) potato, according to the label. Bouquet is earthy, new potato-like, vegetal, and slightly salty. Palate entry is nicely succulent; midpalate is keenly astringent, and tastes a bit like lead pencil, shale, minerals, nickels—a little too harsh and raw for my taste. Ends up bittersweet and dark chocolate beany.

title: The Original Bombay Dry Gin
description: Nosing passes find a peppery bouquet of zesty, mildly citrusy scents of juniper, cedar, Christmas tree sap, coriander and orris root.
