Entry is silky, smooth, moderately sweet and keenly pine-like; the midpalate is elegant, floral,  and sweet with a touch of sap. Finishes clean, citrusy and spicy. Better than its sibling, Bombay Sapphire.

title: Bacardi Peach Red Original Peach Rum
description: Nice first aromas are of ripe, juicy peach; aeration brings about more tartness and acid presence. Palate entry is juicy, fresh and borders on being a bit too sweet, but it's still delightfully fruity and ripe; midpalate is zestier, more astringent than the entry and therefore more enjoyable.

title: SurReal Vodka
description: First nosing passes find dry, slightly metallic, grainy, breakfast cereal scents; aroma turns acutely metallic after further aeration with scents of sawdust, wood chips and peanuts appearing in the final sniffing round. Palate entry is sweet, almost honeyed and surprisingly viscous; midpalate continues a bit too heavily in the sweet vein. Drinkable but ordintextured and dry; at midpalate the taste turns markedly sweeter and adds a charcoal, soot aspect that nicely balances the grain. Sturdy, sweet and sap-like finish.

title: Tortuga Coconut Flavored Rum
description: Smells of heavily sweetened coconut; the bouquet is lacking in acidity, which would balance the intense sweetness. Palate entry is concentrated, near syrupy and driven solely by sugary sweetness disguised as coconut flavor; midpalate is more palatable as the sweetness recedes to a more moderate level. Finishes sweet, vanilla-like and coconuty.

title: Gran Duque d'Alba Brandy de Jerez Solera Gran Reserva
description: The fabulous bouquet offers aromas of old leather, old books, toasted marshmallow, pipe tobacco and deep scents of prune Danish. Entry is luscious, ripe and sweet but not cloying; the midpalate is concentrated, fruity, Sherry-like and caramelized. Concludes balanced and honeyed. A masterpiece.

title: Jacopo Poli Moscato Immature Grape Brandy
description: Mesmerizing perfumes of orange blossom and honeysuckle emerge from the glass; following aeration the aromas become  a mix of orange, citrus, peach and tangerine. Entry is lusciously fruity, peachy and orange marmalade-like; the midpalate is gently sweet with ripe fruit flavors that highlight the orange, citrus and tangerine components. Finish is succulently ripe with a riot of evolved fruit tastes.

title: Jacopo Poli UvaViva Italiana di Poli Immature Grape Brandy
description: The wonderful bouquet is delicately sweet with ethereal aromas of orange blossom, green melon and peach stone. Entry is sweet, supple and properly acidic; the midpalate offers integrated earthy (flowers, grass) and fruity (orange peel, melon, white grapes) tastes. Ends gently sweet and delicately ripe. Fabulous.

title: Rock Hill Farms Single Barrel Kentucky Bourbon Whiskey
description: The nosing passes pick up seductive aromatic notes of toasted walnut, dried red fruits, marzipan, black pepper, spices, cocoa and marshmallow. Entry is zesty, fruity, candied and almost Sherry-like; the midpalate bursts with flavors of cocoa, dark chocolate, chocolate covered almond, coffee, tobacco and dark caramel. Ends smooth, silky, toffee sweet and honeyed. Wow.

title: Aqua Perfecta Poire Eau de Vie
description: The bouquet offers wonderful scents of baked pear pastry, pear peel and bread. Entry is intense pear meat, fresh and authentic; the succulent midpalate introduces a ripe sweetness that's balanced by a rise in the acidity. Finishes ripe yet austere, fruity yet minerally, and like liquid silk. Outstanding distilling.

title: Jacopo Poli Ciliegie di Poli Cherry Brandy
description: Wonderful, delectable ripe cherry bouquet. The entry is perfectly balanced between ripe cherry meat and cherry pit with a dash of bittersweet juiciness; the midpalate features the juice more than the cherry meat and is delicious. Concludes clean, semisweet, intensely ripe, round, smooth as silk and perfect. Cherry brandy splendor.

title: Etter Williams Fine Eau de Vie de Poire
description: The bouquet is perfectly balanced between smells of pear, subtle baking spice, and natural acidity, all wrapped in a stony aroma. The entry features genuine pear juice and peel tastes; the midpalate is acidic and pear-flavored. Finish is dashingly clean, austere, razor crisp and first-rate.

title: Germain-Robin Single Barrel Viognier Brandy
description: The nosing passes find lovely aromas of spice, orange rind, orange blossom and black tea leaves. The delicious entry is honeyed and remarkably fruity (baked banana, peach, pear); the midpalate is silky, semisweet, with melded flavors of peach, pear, grapefruit and caramel. The finish is round, ripe, savory and altogether splendid.

title: Conde de Osborne Brandy de Jerez Solera Gran Reserva
description: The nosing passes find scents of beeswax, marzipan, burnt toast, honey, bacon fat, butter and caramel. Entry is big, pruny, Danish pastry-like and more bittersweet than sweet; the midpalate tastes delightfully toasted, of dried fruit, honey and a touch smoky. Ends clean, intensely bittersweet and pruny.

title: Bauchant Napoleon Liqueur d'Orange au Cognac Brandy
description: The lovely bouquet offers scents of orange zest, tangerine juice, Mandarin orange, chocolate-covered orange peel, distant honey and orange bitters. Entry is off dry and intensely orange; at midpalate the taste increases in orange concentration, advancing from off dry to bittersweet and is intensely citrusy. Finishes with orange panache and delicacy. A lovely triple sec.

title: Henry McKenna 10 Year Old Single Barrel Bottled in Bond Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: The bouquet features smells of new car leather, breakfast cereal, cornmeal, pepper and hemp. Entry is nicely sweet and intensely grainy; the midpalate is the high point as the taste profile expands to include semisweet flavors of caramel corn, toasted marshmallow, dried fruit and chocolate covered cherry. Concludes oaky sweet and chewy.

title: Headbanger American Gold Spirit Whiskey
description: Clearly designed to mix or shoot—not sip—this spirit whiskey (made with 92% neutral spirits, 8% aged whiskey) is light straw in the glass and has a bold butterscotch aroma. The palate shows some butterscotch as well, but that fades to a bitter, oaky midpalate and finishes short on a buttered popcorn note. Strong alcohol burn.

title: Faretti Decadent Biscotti Chocolate
description: Dessert-like and delicious, this medium-bodied liqueur has a rich cocoa and marzipan scent, and tastes just like its namesake biscotti cookies. It warms the palate with nutty and chocolate flavors, perked up by hints of fennel and orange peel.

title: Belle de Brillet Pear Liqueur
description: This Cognac-based liqueur incorporates 20 pounds of pears in each 750-ml bottle, yielding a rich golden hue and bold fresh-pear scent. As a digestif-worthy sipper, look for a balanced honey and vanilla flavor profile, with a suggestion of pear on the finish. Ideal for cocktails, baking or sipping straight.

title: Tempus Fugit Spirits Crème de Cacao a la Vanilla
description: Made with Venezuelan cacao and Mexican vanilla, this complex take on a staple liqueur is ruddy in the glass and flavorful with cocoa powder, almond, vanilla and a touch of hazelnut richness on the long finish. Viscous and slightly too thick for straight-up sipping, this is a tasty upgrade for cocktails. Based on a 19th-century recipe.

title: Licor 43
description: Bright yellow in the glass and lightly spiced, this versatile liqueur is made with 43 ingredients, hence the name. The flavor profile runs from vanilla to brown sugar and baking spice. It plays particularly well with dark spirits like rum and brandy, without overpowering.

title: Saliza Amaretto
description: Distilled from almonds, not just flavored, this tawny liqueur offers bold, sweet almond and marzipan flavors without becoming too heavy or cloying, braced up by a sprinkle of cinnamon on the finish. Ideal as a dessert pairing, or for use in sweetening cocktails or baked goods.

title: Bottega Gianduia
description: Resembling chocolate milk in the glass, this decadent, dessert-like sipper melts like a chocolate truffle, coating the tongue and palate with creamy, milky, rich hazelnut and cocoa flavors. Chocolate-lovers will enjoy this velvety, luscious treat.

title: Ancho Reyes Ancho Chile
description: Though it's made with ancho chiles, this liqueur is modest on the spice scale. Caramel-y brown in the glass, look for a lightly herbaceous aroma similar to root beer and rounded flavors that mix caramel and cocoa with raisin and cinnamon heat, with a faint smokiness on the finish. Particularly harmonious mixed in cocktails with brown spirits like whiskey.

title: Patron XO Café Incendio
description: Delicious but not for the faint of palate, this deep brown chile-chocolate liqueur has a spicy jalapeno whiff with just a touch of cocoa underneath. The spice explodes on the palate. Quick-building cayenne and habanero-like heat yield a dark Mexican chocolate effect overall. Many will find it too spicy for comfort, but chile-heads will surely enjoy the burn.

title: Marie Brizard Liqueur Pear William
description: This viscous, pale straw liqueur mingles honey and pear in the fragrance. The sweet but relatively light flavor profile starts with pear, gives over to vanilla mid-palate, and finishes with a bright flick of ginger. Recommended for cocktails

title: Bols Crème de Cacao Liqueur
description: This clear spirit has a mild cocoa scent and sweet, mocha-like flavor with a surprising flick of espress on the finish. Relatively thick and viscous, this liqueur is recommended for mixing rather than sipping.

title: Borducan Orange Liqueur
description: Deep golden in the glass, look for a pleasant citrus peel and orange blossom scent. The flavor shows big, bold orange and honey notes. A touch of bitter orange peel on the exit cuts through the sweetness nicely.

title: Seattle Distilling Coffee Liqueur
description: This small-batch liqueur bears more than a passing resemblance to a cup of joe, with its deep brown hue and lightly sweetened coffee scent and flavor, finishing long and medium bodied. Made with a vodka base and The Vashon Island Coffee Roasterie's Orca Blend, a medium roast that supports Puget Sound whale research.

title: Rivulet Artisan Pecan Liqueur
description: This amber liqueur features a rich pecan pie scent and a very sweet flavor profile that mingles caramel, baking spice and oak, finishing long and sticky. Though made with a brandy base (and pecans), this liqueur almost reads like flavored whiskey.

title: Peligroso Tequila Liqueur Cinnamon
description: Rose-gold in the glass, the dried-fruit characteristics of this liqueur suggest mulled wine or amber vermouth, showing raisins, dried figs, apple cider and cinnamon, with a touch of cinnamon red-hot candy at the back of the palate. Not too sweet, and warms all the way down. Made with silver tequila infused with natural cinnamon extract.

title: Cour di Cioccolata
description: Described as a “chocolate grappa,” this liquid is thick and opaque brown in the glass, with an oily sheen on top. The aroma is both chocolaty and boozy; on the palate, it's thick and tongue-coating at first, with a pleasing, not-too-sweet cocoa powder quality, but the grappa shows up on the palate-cleansing finish. Packaged with two sleeves of ice cream cone-like wafers tucked inside the box. Made in Trentino, Italy.

title: VOV Zabaglione Cream
description: Inspired by zabaglione, the custard-like Italian dessert, this liqueur has an appropriately creamy yellow-ivory hue and bold vanilla aroma. It's extremely thick on the palate, with an oddly egg-y texture and long vanilla finish that suggests vanilla cream filling or thick egg nog. Made with egg yolks and Sicilian Marsala.

title: Jose Cuervo Cinge
description: Looking for candy-flavored tequila shots? This clear tequila-based liqueur, infused with “cinnamon and natural flavors,” smells like fireball candies, with a ferment-y cooked agave back note that reminds the base is silver tequila. The flavor is reminiscent of candy red hots, but it's not as sweet as the aroma suggests.

title: Sweet Revenge Liqueur
description: This wild strawberry liqueur is made with a sour mash whiskey base, and features a stunning, lurid pink hue. The aroma and flavor is reminiscent of cherry cough syrup, not wild strawberries. The producers recommend mixing the liqueur with lemonade.

title: Aberlour Double Cask Matured 12 Years Old
description: Aged in oak and former Sherry casks, this enticing Scotch has a ripe red-apple scent and rich salted caramel and butterscotch on the palate. It's powerful, with a thick, buttery feel and a long finish of lip-smacking spice cake and sea brine notes.

title: The Glenlivet Founder's Reserve
description: Delicate and complex, this newly released Scotch boasts scents of maple sugar and spice, and unfurls on the palate with a distinctly floral start that evolves into creamy vanilla, honey, sarsaparilla and baking spice. Light and silky, it almost feels effervescent on the tongue, finishing with a perky herbal note reminiscent of hops.

title: Glenmorangie Tùsail
description: Another delicious offering from the Glenmorangie portfolio, this whiskey is vibrantly golden in the glass. Look for light aromas of vanilla, custard, lemon cream pie and honeysuckle, with fleeting touches of banana and smoke on the back. This balanced sipper finishes with notes of nutmeg, cinnamon and citrus peel.

title: Bowmore 15 Years Old Darkest Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: No shrinking violet, this copper penny-hued Scotch hits the nose and palate with a robust but harmonious mix of toffee and peat smoke, in equal measures, finishing dry and spicy. Darkest is an apt description for a whiskey partly matured in former oloroso Sherry casks, which adds deep, raisiny tones.

title: The Dalmore Cigar Malt Reserve
description: Aged in a series of barrels—first American oak, then transferred to a former oloroso Sherry cask and finished in used Cabernet Sauvignon barriques—this Scotch would be an outstanding dessert accompaniment too. Look for dusty cocoa and lots of Sherried dark fruit, like figs and dates, wrapped in caramel and baking tones that linger on the spicy finish.

title: Old Pulteney Navigator Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Though it's not intensely aromatic, showing only shy hints of caramel, fruit and smoke, this Scotch is concentrated on the palate and evolves with every sip. Add just a splash of water, and it sings with honeysuckle sweetness up front, turning smoky, then fruity, with Sherry-like accents that fade into a smooth vanilla-caramel exit. Matured in former Bourbon and Sherry casks.

title: Glenfiddich Excellence 26 Year Old
description: Light and silky, this Speyside Scotch, matured in former Bourbon casks for a minimum of 26 years, boasts scents of apples, pears, vanilla and a whiff of jasmine. There's a sweet smoke tone upfront, while flavors of vanilla and custard-like sweetness unfold with each sip, fading to a more delicate floral and lemon curd finish.

title: The Balvenie DoubleWood Aged 12 Years Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Silky and downright succulent, this Scotch is made with two types of oak casks—as the DoubleWood name suggests—but it's really all about the influence of the ex-Sherry cask. Aromas suggest golden raisins and dried apricots. The silky palate starts out moderately smoky, but glides into a richer, honeyed, nutty profile that finishes with cocoa and clove accents.

title: Aberlour 12 Years Old
description: Amber in the glass, this Scotch has a rich butterscotch aroma, with touches of fresh apple and tropical fruit. Look for dried fruit and Sherry upfront on the palate, with additional notes of vanilla and oak that hang on through the exceedingly long and rounded finish. Though it's mouthcoating and oily, it's also roughed up a bit by the high proof, giving it a drying edge on the close.

title: Auchentoshan Three Wood Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: The name of this whisky is a nod to how it's matured in three different casks: American Bourbon, Spanish oloroso and Pedro Ximénez Sherry. It's robust, with a deep amber hue and rich caramel scent. The flavor profile shows toffee, campfire smoke and a mouthwatering butterscotch note on the exhale. It almost reads like a peated Bourbon.

title: Glenfiddich The Original Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: This burnished gold whisky, ideal for a dessert pairing, boasts pleasant scents of vanilla, apple and pear. On the palate, look for custardy sweetness, a faint banana note and a rich vanilla fade that's perked up by a spark of sweet cinnamon. This limited-edition bottling was inspired by a 1963 single-malt release, which Glenfiddich credits as the first single-malt Scotch to be released worldwide.

title: The Dalmore Aged 18 Years
description: This amber Highland Scotch was aged in former Bourbon and oloroso Sherry casks. The end result is a robust, full-bodied, luscious sip, with plenty of rich, concentrated caramel, toffee, fudge and cocoa. It finishes long and bracing, with clove, cigar wrapper and espresso accents.

title: The Dalmore King Alexander III
description: Caramel and toffee lead the nose, alongside a puff of smoke. The palate is robust and velvety, with dusty notes of cocoa, unsweetened chocolate and caramel. The finish is dry and complex, with hints of tea, leather, cocoa, cigar wrapper and vanilla. The producer says it's the only single malt in the world to incorporate six different cask finishes: former Bourbon, oloroso Sherry, Madeira, Marsala, Port and Cabernet Sauvignon barrels.

title: Speyburn Aged 10 Years Highland Single Malt Whisky
description: Golden in color, this smells bright, with fresh pear and pineapple aromas alongside a faint smokiness. An attractive, forward sweetness quickly morphs into iodine astringency, finishing with lemon peel and light smoke accents. It feels light on the palate, while the brush of peat on the finish grows in intensity with each sip.

title: Auchentoshan American Oak
description: Smooth and light, this single-malt Scotch segues effortlessly from vanilla, butterscotch and coconut sweetness to soft smokiness and back again, finishing on a zesty hint of citrus flavor.

title: Talisker Storm Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Made on Isle of Skye, this brisk, briny single malt carries honey and campfire smoke aromas on the nose. On the palate, a salted caramel flavor unfolds, with smokiness leading into the brisk finish that brushed with fleeting notes of citrus and rich espresso. It has plenty of alcohol punch, so be sure to add a generous splash of water.

title: Speyburn Arranta Casks Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Exclusive to the U.S. market, this single-malt Scotch bursts with baked apple, vanilla and coconut aromas, with a light brush of peat. The palate shows vanilla sweetness and mouthwatering salted caramel, finishing brisk and moderately smoky.

title: Sullivans Cove Double Cask Single Malt Whisky
description: Hailing from Tasmania, this golden single-malt whiskey offers aromas of pear, banana and honey. Light, smooth and easy sipping, the palate shows fruity notes alongside hints of almond, vanilla wafer and just a wisp of smoke.

title: Glen Garioch 1797 Founder's Reserve Highland Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: This silky Highland sipper seems to glide on the palate. Aromatics include vanilla and caramel, with a faint smokiness. This is echoed on the palate, with vanilla leading into butterscotch that's tinged with a light saline note, turning to peat smoke on the exhale.

title: English Classic Single Malt Whisky
description: Made at St. George's Distillery in Norfolk, England, using 100% English barley, this straw-hued spirit is scented with fresh apple, vanilla and peat smoke. All three echo on the palate, with smoky peat taking center stage. It finishes spicy, with cinnamon and black pepper sizzle.

title: Highland Park Odin
description: The powerful aroma suggests gingerbread, molasses and chamomile tea. On the palate, the sticky-toffee note is enveloped by an intense wallop of peat. An undercurrent of Sherry and gingerbread sweetness runs underneath the smoke, entwining into a mesquite-like smoky-sweet and spicy finish. A splash of water coaxes out a subtle bacon note. Aged 16 years, this limited edition is named for the Norse god Odin and comes packaged in a wooden frame intended to evoke the contours of a traditional Viking long ship.

title: The Hakushu Single Malt Whisky Aged 18 Years
description: This honey-hued single malt is soft and perfectly balances vanilla-caramel sweetness and peat smoke on the nose and palate. Add a splash of branch water to offset alcohol heat on the drying, spiced finish.

title: The Balvenie Caribbean Cask Aged 14 Years Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: After regular maturation, this Scotch is “extra matured” in former rum casks. The end result layers rich, mouth-coating dried apricot, honey and Sherry notes on top of Balvenie's usual caramel and light peat profile. It finishes flavorful, though with a distinct burst of alcohol warmth.

title: Glenglassaugh Torfa
description: Torfa is old Norse for “peat,” and this Scotch delivers on that promise with delicacy and finesse. Light golden in the glass, the nose shows a vanilla aroma tinged with peat smoke and oak accents. The palate is bright and briny up front, with a peat smoke character becoming more pronounced with each successive sip. That smoky-saline balance provokes cravings for oysters and aged cheeses.

title: The Hakushu Single Malt Whisky Aged 12 Years
description: This golden, silky single malt mingles vanilla and honey with fresh apple and pear aromas. These notes are echoed on the palate alongside a wave of peat smoke. Add a splash of water to offset the modest but persistent alcohol heat and further coax out the fruity-smoky flavors.

title: Glen Garioch Aged 12 Years Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Look for a crème brûlée fragrance and vanilla richness on the palate, all blanketed with smoke. It finishes long, dark and spicy, with clove, allspice and black pepper notes and a quick bite of alcohol warmth.

title: Glen Moray Elgin Classic Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: An excellent value, this Speyside spirit offers fresh apple and tropical fruit aromatics. It's relatively sweet up front, showing maple and vanilla, though a citrusy note unfolds midpalate and it finishes crisp and bracing, with a faint puff of smoke. Ideal for mixing whisky highballs.

title: Oban 14 Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Look for pleasant sweetness and spice up front, as the nose offers a complex mix of oak, maple sugar, fresh apple, clove, black pepper and cinnamon. The flavors dry to a spicy midpalate before exiting on a long, concentrated maple-like note.

title: The Balvenie Single Barrel Sherry Cask Aged 15 Years
description: Matured exclusively in a former Sherry cask for at least 15 years, this amber single-malt Scotch has Sherry-like dried-fruit and vanilla scents. The palate is boldly smoky and relatively dry, with a lift of iodine and sea breeze, plus vanilla, praline and a spicy, rather fiery finish. The production size is no more than 650 bottles drawn from a single cask.

title: Bowmore 12 Years Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: This Islay Scotch would be a home run for peat lovers. Every scent and sip entwine rich caramel and peat smoke, ending on a long, bold, smoky sweep and an echo of salty sea breeze.

title: Glencadam Aged 15 Years
description: This golden, Highland single-malt Scotch smells delicious, like honey, vanilla and fresh-cut apples. It feels light yet slick on the palate, balancing vanilla, honeysuckle, fruit and just the right amount of smoke. Each sip ends with a pleasantly peaty exhale, which seems to gently drift away on the palate little by little.

title: The Yamazaki Single Malt Whisky Aged 12 Years
description: Smokiness is the defining characteristic of this golden single malt. The aroma is distinctly fruity, mixing fresh apple and tropical fruit with a touch of vanilla. But from the first sip, it's all about the smoke, with just a little bit of fruit peeking through to the spicy, slightly hot finish.

title: Laphroaig Aged 10 Years Original Cask Strength
description: Islay's Laphroaig is famed for its intensely peaty profile, and this single-malt Scotch delivers on that reputation. The amber spirit opens with a smoky aroma that's underpinned by vanilla and light floral notes. There's plenty of peat on the palate too, backed by olive brine, espresso and chocolate characteristics. Beware: Cask strength means that an overproof alcohol level delivers strong flavor but also a hefty burn.

title: Glenfiddich Bourbon Barrel Reserve Aged 14 Years Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Aged 14 years in former Bourbon barrels, this is an amber-colored whisky that's scented with vanilla and peach. The palate is also peachy, highlighted by hints of almond, oak and sandalwood. The finish is drying and lightly spiced.

title: Armorik Breton Single Malt Sherry Finish
description: This French single malt opens with aromas of caramel, honey and fresh pear. A surprising billow of smoke unfolds on the palate, mellowed by touches of honey and salted caramel. A splash of water provides balance to the fiery finish that pops with cayenne and alcohol heat.

title: Kinahan's Single Malt Irish Whisky
description: This golden whisky offers a fresh, grassy scent. Matured in former Bourbon barrels for at least 10 years, it's soft yet smoky on the palate, though not overwhelmingly so. The smoke leaves plenty of room to enjoy the breezy tropical fruit, almond and ginger notes, finishing with a mellow honeysuckle accent.

title: Glenglassaugh Revival
description: Matured in a combination of used red-wine casks and Bourbon barrels, then finished in oloroso Sherry barrels, this honey-hued Scotch has a Sherried peach-nectar aroma. The palate shows notes of almond and cedar, finishing with hits of lemon peel and smoke.

title: Armorik Breton Single Malt Classic
description: The nose of this golden whisky entwines aromas of vanilla, smoke and fresh apple. From the first sip, peat smoke is the dominant flavor, overpowering more delicate fruit and iodine accents. It finishes with warm, prickly notes of black pepper and cayenne.

title: Amrut Fusion Single Malt Whisky
description: This Indian single malt is so named because it's made with “a fusion of Indian and Scottish barley.” The aroma is deliciously fresh, suggesting crisp apple slices. It's silky on the palate, showing plenty of caramel followed by a billow of peat smoke. It finishes dry, with an intriguing mix of cigar tobacco, leather, Baker's chocolate, bitter orange peel and spice. At 100 proof, it's predictably hot; be prepared to dilute it to taste.

title: Amrut Single Malt Whisky
description: Made with 100% Indian barley, this burnished-gold whisky is perfumed with scents of vanilla, coconut and white flowers. Almond and brown sugar flavors dominate the palate, followed by peat smoke and a long, honeyed finish, with a slight floral note and a bit of alcohol sting.

title: Balblair 1990
description: The year on the bottle—1990—is not an age statement, but instead was the year this single-malt Scotch was laid down. Robust and full bodied, this deep amber whisky has a powerful caramel aroma that's accented by notes of cedar and resin. It's quite drying on the palate, with flavors that suggest strong tea, oak and beer, all leading into the warm, chocolaty finish.

title: Bushmills Malt 16 Year Old Irish Single Malt Whiskey
description: The smashing bouquet features delightful notes of toasted wheat bread, oatmeal, black raisins, trail mix, roasted chestnuts, bacon fat, sweet butter, ruby Port and prunes. Entry is peppery, moderately sweet and smoky; midpalate features succulent tastes of dark chocolate-covered cherries and strawberries, honey and smoked nuts. Finishes elegantly and clean, with deft traces of smoke and cocoa.

title: Poli Miele Honey Liqueur
description: Smells of pine cones, new rubber soles, candle wax, dried flowers, juniper, tree sap and cedar. Entry is sweet, but not syrupy, buttery and gracefully honeyed; at midpalate the taste profile becomes creamy as the honey, pine, juniper, flowers and spirit integrate with precision and elegance. A perfect liqueur.

title: Midleton Very Rare 2006 Blended Irish Whiskey
description: Wonderful aromas of smoked trout, lead pencil, ink, dried fruit, beeswax, toasted Brazil nut and parchment. Entry is satiny, potent yet grainy sweet, and honeyed; at the fabulous midpalate the flavors include sweet grain, paraffin, salted butter, dry breakfast cereal, toffee, honey and a trace of Sherry. Finish is sublimely elegant and sophisticated.

title: Parker's Heritage Collection Cask Strength Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: The nosing finds oaky scents underpinned by deeper aromas of spice, banana, parchment and green vegetation. Palate entry is chewy and caramel-flavored; the midpalate is powerful, intensely spirity, vegetal, peppery and resiny. Finish offers succulent tastes of fudge, dark chocolate, tobacco leaf and brown sugar. Dilute with mineral water.

title: Chivas Regal 18 Year Old Blended Scotch Whisky
description: The wonderful bouquet includes scents of bacon fat, honey, orange rind with deeper smells of black pepper, cinnamon, vanilla bean and pipe tobacco. Entry is silky smooth, semisweet, concentrated and honeyed; the midpalate offers grainy sweet, yet spicy, tangy, fruity, nutty and floral tastes. The oak element really emerges in the aftertaste, ideally completing this sensational blended Scotch. One of the finest blended Scotches in the world.

title: Borsci San Marzano Elisir Italian Liqueur
description: The nosing passes find scents of rubber inner tube, burning paper, window cleaner, vinegar, asphalt and moss. Entry is delectably bittersweet, with coffee bean, tar and even a touch of cocoa; the moderately sweet midpalate stage highlights cigar tobacco and wrapper, prunes, figs and black raisins. Finishes pleasantly bittersweet, pruny, fruity and plump.

title: The Tyrconnell Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: Nice aromas of roasted nuts, nougat, light toffee, candy bar, mild oak and brown sugar. Entry is satiny smooth, honeyed and near lush in texture; the midpalate point brings in spicy notes, in particular, black pepper and clove. The malt component takes charge in the finish, bringing a keen graininess.

title: Casoni Limoncello di Sorrento Liqueur
description: The bouquet is of enticingly tart lemon. Entry is sharply acidic (as it should be) and intensely lemon (more zest than juice or pulp); the midpalate stage features heightened lemon zest concentration and a real sense of authenticity. Concludes wonderfully tart, astringent and lemony.

title: Jameson 12 Year Old Blended Irish Whiskey
description: Opening aroma is smoked, waxy, nutty and intensely grainy; aeration adds a buttery succulence and a fruity ripeness. Entry is toffee-like, grainy sweet and honeyed; the midpalate stage is all butter, cream, smoked trout, roasted nuts, bacon fat, bacon rind and spice. Delightful finish is potent, grainy and honeyed.

title: Chivas Regal 12 Year Old Blended Scotch Whisky
description: The nosing finds dry grainy notes with background scents of dried flowers and parchment, and deeper fragrances of light toffee, almond paste and yellow fruit. Entry is oily, buttery and semisweet; the whisky dazzles at midpalate with layered flavors of brown butter, cooking oil, barley malt and oatmeal cookie underpinned by the single malt foundation. Concludes smoky, satiny and ultra-sophisticated.

title: Jameson Blended Irish Whiskey
description: The bouquet features charred paper smells of toasted walnuts, roasted chestnuts, paraffin, cardboard, parchment, dry grain and herbs. Entry is grainy sweet and moderately oily; the midpalate stage is loaded with grainy breakfast cereal flavors and, at times, even comes off like oatmeal. Ends well on an oily, satiny note.

title: Old Fitzgerald's 1849 Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: The bouquet is somewhat inexpressive and offers faint smells of toffee, egg cream and wax. Entry is full, assertive, dry to off dry, and grainy; the midpalate point offers a vertical, tightly wrapped flavor profile that tastes of caramel and fudge, but likewise oaky vanilla and marzipan. Finishes long, gently sweet, corny and savory.

title: Sam Houston Very Small Batch Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey Batch #52; Bottle #480
description: First smells are leafy like green vegetation; following aeration it turns mildly oaky, grainy and roasted green peppery. Entry is intensely dry, like sawdust, and buttery in the background; the midpalate brings the butteriness to the forefront. Concludes off dry and oaky, with a nice texture. Seemed a little too reined-in overall.

title: Kilbeggan Blended Irish Whiskey
description: The initial earthy, vegetal aromas expand to include deeper aromas of grain, malt, flax and oak following aeration time. Entry is light and gently sweet; the midpalate displays a bit more profundity in the grain depth and flavor length. Ends up delectably sweet, easy and smooth.

title: Tullamore Dew Blended Irish Whiskey
description: Lovely scents of sweet grains, sugared breakfast cereal and pine make for pleasing sniffing. Entry is nimble, gently sweet, almost piney and honeyed; the midpalate stage carries on with style and smoothness, as the taste profile remains steadfast and mildly sweet. Finishes with a honey thrust that's exhilarating and delightful.

title: McIvor Blended Scotch Whisky
description: The aroma includes pleasant scents of biscuits and cookies, sweetened breakfast cereal, honey, pastry dough and beeswax. Entry is toffee sweet (but not cloying); the flavor turns drier at midpalate with bittersweet tastes of candied nuts, milk chocolate and egg cream. Finishes sweet and balanced by a spirity tang of metal coin. Great value.

title: Castries Peanut Rum Creme
description: Smells of roasted peanuts and, in particular, peanut butter. Frothy to the feel at entry, the taste is milky and peanuty and not in the least chalky or cloying; the midpalate flavor displays a heightened roasted quality that's appealing. Finishes thick, like a milkshake, and properly peanuty.

title: Clan MacGregor Blended Scotch Whisky
description: Opening aroma is intensely grainy and cracker-like, with background notes of flowers and pine; aeration brings out the grain spirit in uncomplicated scents of pine, flax and beeswax. Entry is pleasantly sweet like caramel (but not too sweet); the midpalate adds sweet flavors of honey, pipe tobacco and tar. Ends nicely sweet and grainy.

title: John Begg Blue Cap Blended Scotch Whisky
description: The bouquet offers interesting aromas of cooking oil, rope, wood resin, fried egg and sulfur. Entry is delicately sweet and fruity; the midpalate stage offers more succulence in the forms of sweet grain, sugared breakfast cereal and heather honey. Finishes light and clean.

title: B. Nardini Acqua di Cedro Liqueur
description: The bouquet offers delightfully piquant aromas of lemons, limes and tangerines. Entry is balanced, simultaneously tart and sweet; at midpalate the taste profile becomes a bit too sweetly unctuous. Regains its acidic, tart, citrusy footing in the finish. Need a sweet tooth for this one.

title: Highland Park 25-Year-Old Orkney Islands Single Malt Whisky
description: Smells smoky, along with nuances of sea salt, flowers, cookie batter and light toffee. Entry is oily, oaky and richly salt-and-peppery; the midpalate is where all the components merge into a crescendo of elegant and potent maritime single malt flavors. Along with HP 12, 18, and 30, the finest whisky product line.

title: Jacopo Poli Barrique 1993 Single Vintage Grappa
description: Fruitcake, cinnamon, nutmeg and honey aromas are followed by baked banana, pineapple and vanilla soda smells. Entry is concentrated, Sherry- and honey-flavored, and spiced; midpalate taste profile expands to include baked fruit (nectarine, peach), clove, fruit pastry (Danish, prunes, black raisins). Finishes with integrated flavors. Could sell for $100 per bottle.

title: Glenmorangie The Nectar D'Or Extra Matured Range Sauternes Cask Non-Chill Filtered Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: Smells of smoky, burnt nectarine, apricot and buttery scents that are toasty, nutty and heavenly. Entry is chewy, viscous, concentrated and intensely honeyed; the midpalate is waxy, mildly spicy, jammy, nutty and utterly decadent. Finishes with panache and grace.

title: Macallan 30 Year Old Fine Oak Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: Smells of chocolate-covered orange, dry malt and oak; aeration stimulates dry breakfast cereal, lanolin, beeswax and palm oil aromas. Entry is layered by sweet grain, oak barrel, vanilla wafer, toffee and fudge; midpalate gives off wave after wave of integrated spirit, grain, wood and acidity. A perfect Speyside single malt.

title: Frapin Extra Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Mature fragrances of dried peach, oak, wood resin and vanilla extract delight; further aeration stimulates toasted scents of almond, fruit compote, dried fruit pastry and moss. Entry is oily, silky, fruity and spicy; midpalate highlights honey, vanilla, dark caramel, fudge, coffee bean and old oak. Wow, what a beauty.

title: Highland Park 18-Year-Old Orkney Islands Single Malt Whisky
description: Opening aromas are of sea breeze, cigar smoke, oak and malted barley; air contact releases light caramel, fudge, cocoa bean, burnt candle wick and heather. Entry is the most complex of any whisky; midpalate soars on oak, spirit and grain tastes. The greatest distilled spirit of this generation. Buy whatever you can find.

title: Jacopo Poli Sarpa di Poli Grappa
description: Smells of ripe grapes, grape must and lead pencil in the initial whiffs; air contact stimulates baking spices, black currants, jasmine, pepper and paraffin. Entry is crisp, tart and intensely ripe; midpalate highlights black grape to maximum concentration. Finishes bittersweet to sweet.

title: Balvenie 12-Year-Old DoubleWood Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: First nosing exposes dry scents of walnuts, grass and dark toffee. Entry is malty and vanilla—extract bittersweet; midpalate is silky, creamy, Sherry sweet, pruny and black raisin-like. Ends on a dark chocolate note that's chewy, medium-sweet and satisfying.

title: The Glenlivet 12 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: Off-dry malted barley and light toffee smells greet the olfactory sense along with flowery fragrances of heather, rose petal and pine. Entry features sweet grain and candied apricot tastes; the midpalate is mellow, malty, fruity (white raisins, apricots) and sophisticated. Ends on a buttery note. Remains the Speyside benchmark.

title: Jacopo Poli Po' Moscato di Poli Grappa
description: Smells of tropical fruits, especially guava, pineapple and banana. Entry is chalky, pleasantly ripe and viscous in texture; midpalate is earthy, floral (since this is Moscato, where has the floweriness been up to this point?), stony and off dry. Finishes minerally and drier than the midpalate.

title: Tiffon Cognac XO
description: The aroma suggests rich vanilla, caramel and fig. On the palate, that vanilla and oak dries midpalate to leather and cocoa, finishing long on cocoa and warming baking spice.

title: Augier L'Oceanique Cognac
description: This straw-hued Cognac has a distinct buttered-popcorn scent. On the palate, that morphs into a salted butter note, with a saline influence reminiscent of some Scotches, coupled with vanilla, a juicy hint of pear, white flowers and a hint of lemongrass on the finish. The mouth waters with a racy astringency not often seen in brandy. Bois Ordinaire region. Made from 100% Ugni Blanc.

title: Cognac Delamain XO
description: From the only house were the Cognacs start at XO, this blend of 20- to 25-year-old brandies is mellow and honeyed. The white flower, honey and pear fragrance leads the nose. A flurry of spice—cinnamon, nutmeg and ginger—enlivens the palate, leading to toasty brioche and vanilla, plus hints of pear and walnut. The finish is long, palate-coating and silky. Grande Champagne region.

title: Paul Giraud Napoleon Cognac
description: Silky smooth and rounded, look for vanilla, honey and lemon cream spruced up with fresh pear and a flurry of spice fading into a long, ginger-spiked finish. Grande Champagne region.

title: Jean Fillioux Cep D'Or Trés Vielle Cognac
description: Instead of dessert, sip on this tawny Cognac. Dusty cocoa and pecan pie richness vie for the palate alongside vanilla and cream caramel, with hints of apple and a zing of ginger and nutmeg. All together, the effect is not overly sweet but still distinctly, enticingly dessert-like. Grande Champagne region.

title: Pierre Patou Cognac XO Black
description: The deep, ruddy hue and toffee-like aroma suggest that this Cognac will be on the sweeter side. The palate delivers cherry jam fruitiness and a burst of heat up front, segueing to fudge and hazelnut on the finish, plus cinnamon and clove. It feels almost like drinking a Cognac Old-Fashioned cocktail.

title: Normande-Mercier La Peraudiére Cognac
description: Look for warm vanilla aromas and a tickle of alcohol from this cask-strength Cognac. The complex, substantial palate starts with lots of caramel and oak up front, rounding to black cherry, dusty cocoa and orange peel midpalate, and drying to a citrusy finish. Grande Champagne region.

title: Prunier Cognac XO
description: Made with a blend of Cognacs aged 20 to 50 years, this is a complex, dessert-worthy sipper. The lovely aromas evoke vanilla and caramel apple, while the palate shows brown sugar, candied walnut, dark chocolate and espresso and finishes on warming clove and burnt orange peel. Pair with dark chocolate. Grande Champagne region.

title: Bache-Gabrielsen American Oak Cognac
description: This unusual Cognac is finished in Tennessee oak barrels for a minimum of six months, marking it as an American whiskey-lover's brandy. The nose and palate show plenty of oak, vanilla and baked apple, landing on apricot and orange peel for the spicy, mouthwatering finish. Sip or mix.

title: Hennessy Master Blender's Selection No. 1 Cognac
description: Think Bourbon flavors with brandy delicacy. Notably dark-nut brown in the glass, this Cognac opens with warm caramel, toffee and cocoa on the nose and palate. Echoes of brandied cherry, orange peel and cinnamon-clove spice wind into the finish. This might be just the ticket to experiment with Cognac-based Old Fashioneds.

title: Paul Giraud Cognac VSOP
description: This honey-hued Cognac beckons with a butterscotch aroma. The buttery, slick palate shows baked apple and oak smoothed with caramel, plus a spicy, exceedingly long finish marked by cinnamon and cayenne. Grande Champagne region.

title: Bache-Gabrielsen Tre Kors Cognac
description: This velvety Cognac opens with plenty of oak on the nose and palate. The more you sip, the more the oak recedes and bold vanilla and citrus come forward, fading to a lip-smacking finish of nutmeg and ginger. Sip or mix. Aged a minimum of 2 years.

title: Camus Cognac VSOP
description: This limited edition, “single growth certified” Cognac features lots of concentrated vanilla flavor from start to finish. Cocoa, vanilla, caramel and oak leads the plush palate, winding into leather and orange peel on the midpalate before a vanilla- and cinnamon-laced finish. Borderies region.

title: Pierre Patou Cognac XO Gold
description: Look for oak, vanilla and dark cherry aromas. The palate is fairly sweet, showing caramel and vanilla, progressing to a long, languorous finish marked by caramel, baking spice and a hint of orange peel.

title: Château de Montifaud Cognac VSOP
description: Luscious brown sugar, vanilla, cocoa, hazelnut and lots of oak lead this Cognac on nose and palate, which winds into a long, drying, fairly hot finish spiced with clove. Fine Petite Champagne region. Blend of 8–10 year old brandies.

title: Roullet Cognac VSOP
description: The tantalizing scent evokes vanilla tinged with white flowers and stone fruit. On the silky palate, look for oak and baking spice, finishing with a long dusty cocoa exhale enlivened by a citrusy hint. Grande Champagne region.

title: Tiffon Cognac VS
description: Look for honey, vanilla, and a hint of apricot on nose. Meanwhile, the palate starts with cedar and spice. A burst of citrus midpalate gives way to a honeyed finish perked up by nutmeg, ginger and white pepper heat.

title: ABK6 Cognac XO Family Reserve
description: This single-estate Cognac offers bright orange peel and oak aromas. A hint of sweetness leads the palate, as baked pear, honey and vanilla wind into a drying, relatively hot finish featuring walnut, cinnamon and clove.

title: Château de Montifaud Sélection Cognac
description: Sip this blend of brandies aged from 4 to 6 years alongside or in place of dessert. The luxe, rounded scent suggests butterscotch, caramel and cocoa. Most of the flavor unfolds on the exceedingly, buttery finish, echoing the aromas plus coconut and orange peel. Blend of grapes from Fine Petite Champagne and Grande Champagne regions.

title: Park Cognac VSOP
description: Candied orange peel, vanilla and oak tease the nose. Meanwhile, the palate is oak-forward, translating into vanilla, brown sugar and warming spice. Hints of orange peel, stone fruit and cocoa mark the rounded finish. Sip or mix.

title: Merlet Cognac VSOP
description: Ideal for Cognac-lovers with a sweet tooth, this bottling features plenty of vanilla, caramel and cocoa, starting out sweet and finishing spicy.

title: Park Cognac XO Cigar Blend
description: Deep and dark in the glass, this brandy has herbaceous notes that almost read like an amaro. The concentrated caramel aroma opens up to a sarsaparilla hint on the nose. Caramel sweetness and spice up front lead to a bark-like flavor profile, with a whisper of orange peel and a nutty, drying finish.

title: Grands Domaines Cognac VS
description: The scent suggests vanilla, honey and ripe bananas. Meanwhile, the silky palate is honeyed up front, with flashes of dried apricot and cedar, finishing with a ferocious roar of cinnamon-clove spice.

title: Deux Freres Cognac VS
description: In the glass, this Cognac is yellow-golden, almost a mustard seed hue. The aromas show concentrated vanilla bean, honey and fresh pear. Meanwhile, the markedly sweet palate starts with lots of toasty vanilla up front, mellowing to honey, coconut and peach nectar, and finishing with cinnamon and cayenne sparks on the finish. Sip or mix.

title: Prunier Cognac VS
description: Look for a gentle vanilla-caramel aroma. Meanwhile, the mild palate shows cedar and citrus, with hints of vanilla and oak midpalate. Most of the flavor is on the long and fairly spicy finish, melding vanilla, citrus and spice.

title: Park Fins Bois Single Cru Organic Cognac
description: The concentrated caramel scent hints at what's to come. The palate echoes that caramel, layering it with vanilla and oak, plus a hint of fudge on the silky, spiced exit.

title: ABK6 Cognac VS Pure Single
description: This single estate Cognac offers ripe pear and banana drizzled with waxy honey, finishing spicy with vanilla, nutmeg and clove, plus a pleasing hint of almond. Sip or mix.

title: Pierre Patou Cognac VSOP
description: Rich butterscotch leads the nose and palate, along with a resin-like note midpalate. A hint of apricot emerges on the exceedingly long, clove-spiked finish.

title: Glenfiddich Reserva Rum Cask Finish 21 Years Old Scotch
description: Finished in rum casks, the honey and orange zest aromas suggest a cocktail, not a straight pour of Scotch. These flavors are echoed on the silky palate, opening with cocoa and leather and evolving into a luscious, fudge-like finish, with hints of orange peel and cinnamon. Enjoy with a big rock of ice and a piece of orange peel, it needs no other adornment.

title: BenRiach 10 Year Scotch
description: This rich and nuanced single malt entices with butterscotch and fresh apricot aromas. The palate delivers plush layers of vanilla, butterscotch and mocha wrapped in campfire smoke, finishing with baking spice.

title: Cristall Limited Edition Vodka
description: The nosing passes find a pod-like, almost peppery aroma that is more vegetal and spicy than either grain- or bean-like. The palate entry is nicely peppery and spicy, with underpinning tastes of rye and breakfast cereal; the midpalate is snappy, pleasantly prickly/spirity and dry/bitter. Concludes dry, clean and moderately oily.

title: Baron de Sigognac 1975 Bas Armagnac
description: Semisweet scents of vanilla, Christmas spices, and walnuts complement fragrances of apple, grapes and pineapple. The palate entry focuses on peppery wood and minerals; at midpalate the dry flavor leans heavily towards resiny oak and stone. Finishes moderately oily and earthy/slaty.

title: Los Azulejos Añejo Tequila NOM 1437 CRT
description: The initial aroma is stunningly mineral-like; aeration adds scents of rubber tire, cigarette ash and dried tobacco leaf. The palate entry highlights the sweeter side of the agave juice; the midpalate is more layered, offering tastes of minerals, fruit stone, oak, and a trace of mescal-like ashy smoke. Ends on a vegetal/herbal flavor note.

title: Siembra Azul Blanco Tequila 100% Puro de Agave Kosher NOM 1414 CRT
description: The bouquet is vividly vegetal and green chili pepper-like. The palate entry is agave juice sweet and sappy; the midpalate offers more complex tastes of sweet wood smoke, tobacco and sage. Finishes snappy, sap-like, and zesty. I wish this blanco would have offered more dill/fennel/brine depth.

title: Siembra Azul Reposado Tequila 100% Puro de Agave Kosher NOM 1414 CRT
description: The nosing passes find mild scents of oak, vanilla, olive, ash, vanilla bean, dill, and pickle brine. The palate entry is medium sweet, juicy and sap-like; the midpalate is long, moderately oily, peppery, vegetal and dill-like. Concludes very short and vanilla-like.

title: Bauchant Pomegranate XO Liqueur
description: The delightful bouquet offers alluringly tart and brambly aromas. The palate entry explodes in tart, then ripe, tastes of red berries and pomegranate; the midpalate stage crescendos with a ripe, juicy, tart pomegranate flavor. Finish is clean, lean, refreshingly tart and genuine.

title: Lejay-Lagoute Chocolate Liqueur
description: The spectacular bouquet captures the natural bitterness of cocoa and the bitter-sweetness of luxury dark chocolate. The palate entry is like chocolate fudge; the midpalate is buttery, thick, intensely chocolaty, and correctly bittersweet. The finish is long, decadent and authentic. A must-buy for chocolate lovers.

title: Marcel Trépout 1925 80-Year-Old Armagnac
description: This 80-year-old bouquet rocks with vibrant spirit, orange marmalade, hard cheese, banana-nut bread, white raisins and honey. The entry features succulent flavors of caramel, butterscotch and brown sugar; the midpalate finds tastes of nut paste, sausage, cake frosting, cocoa and dark caramel. Concludes with grace and woodiness. Worth every penny.

title: English Harbour 5-Year-Old Aged Antigua Rum
description: The bouquet sparkles with notes of bark, oak, brown sugar, bacon fat, sautéed banana and maple. The palate entry is creamy, toffee-like and silky; the midpalate offers flavors of pastry, chocolate fudge, nougat, chestnut and honey. Finishes harmoniously with the sweet flavor gracefully melded to the texture. A perfect oak-aged molasses rum.

title: Marcel Trépout Apotheose 30-Year-Old Armagnac
description: The bouquet is relatively toasty/roasted with sturdy scents of walnut paste, apple butter, black pepper and pipe tobacco. The palate entry is maple-like and deeply honeyed; the midpalate adds notes of cocoa, coffee, dark caramel and bacon fat. Ends tight, generous, decadent and unabashedly sweet. This style is not for everyone but I'm an admirer.

title: Square One Organic Rye Vodka
description: A very attractive bouquet with tropical fruit and floral aromas with a grainy, mildly spicy core fragrance of rye. The palate entry is dry to off-dry, intensely grainy and oily; the midpalate offers a dash of prickly heat along with tastes of crackers, breakfast cereal and bread. Finishes warm, grainy, spicy and rich.

title: Bauchant Pear XO Liqueur
description: The bouquet focuses on the fruit fragrance of processed pears rather than just-picked pears. The palate entry is sweet, keenly pear-like and sappy; the midpalate emits low-key but tightly structured flavors of baked pear pastry, spiced pear and brown sugar. Finishes clean, juicy and elegant.

title: Bauchant Raspberry XO Liqueur
description: The bouquet emerges slowly, eventually showing some plump berry fruit perfume that is as tart as it is ripe. The palate entry is astringent, tart and borderline bitter in its raspberry fruitiness; the midpalate features candied raspberry fruit tastes. Concludes sweet, ripe, fruity, and juicy.

title: Touch Vodka Honey & Grain Vodka
description: The bouquet includes delicately scented aromas of honey and parchment. The palate entry is pleasingly sweet as the honey core flavor dominates; the midpalate is marked by a toasty flavor of buttered and toasted honey wheat bread. Concludes silkily, moderately sweet and assertive.

title: Marcel Trépout Hors d'Age 20-Year-Old Armagnac
description: The nosing passes pick up vibrant notes of pineapple, quince, pear and sautéed butter; aeration stimulates deeper scents of palm oil, cigar tobacco and vanilla bean. The silky palate entry is oily, sleek, nutty and pleasingly oaky; at midpalate the taste becomes more honeyed/Sherried than oily/buttery. Finishes elegantly, woody sweet and sublime.

title: Senior Rumraisin and Curaçao Liqueur
description: The bouquet offers notes of raisins, dates and glazed orange. The palate entry is simple, sweet and orangy; the midpalate features rum, confectioner's sugar, orange marmalade and figs. Ends sweet but with enough acidity for balance.

title: Mother Russia Premium Vodka With Natural Flavors and Honey Added
description: The aroma is lovely, grainy and wheat-like. The palate entry is velvety, acceptably hot and sweetly grainy; the midpalate features a minerally/slatey flavor that highlights the earthy core taste. Concludes stoutly, robust and concentrated solely on the grain aspect.

title: Senior Curacao Koffi Korsow Coffee Liqueur
description: Aromas of espresso and molasses. The palate entry is heavily toasted, molasses-like, black coffee flavor-like and sweet; the midpalate phase turns bitter and intensely beany. Finishes sweet/bittersweet, a bit syrupy and correctly coffee-like.

title: Bauchant Apple XO Liqueur
description: The nosing passes find tart aromas of green apple and hard apple candy; following aeration the fragrance is more like spiced apple. The palate entry is clean, green apple sour, and balanced; the midpalate highlights the sour apple aspect. The finish is bittersweet, properly apple-like, and a touch oily.

title: Ron Barceló Imperial
description: Tight scents of tobacco leaf, bacon fat, walnut, lanolin, parchment and brown sugar. The palate entry is caramel sweet with touches of vanilla bean, and honey; the midpalate features pleasing tastes of nut paste, treacle, marzipan and sap. Concludes semisweet, with traces of cola nut, cotton candy and dark caramel.

title: Senior Chocolate and Curaçao
description: The entry is sweet, full-textured, nutty and alluringly chocolate-orange tasting; the chocolate and orange tastes continue at the midpalate. The finish is syrupy, velvety rich, and sweet. The chocolate definition is better than that of the orange.

title: Seagram's Distiller's Reserve Gin
description: The first inhalations offer mineral-like scents of slate, limestone, chalk and granite; following aeration, hints of lemon peel, white pepper and juniper emerge. The palate entry is surprisingly fruity, sappy and corn sweet; the midpalate features traces of orange, angelica, orris and pine. Ends powerful, rich and spicy. An intriguing concept (51% abv) that works.

title: Black 100 100-Proof Herbal Liqueur
description: The bouquet features sweet scents of tobacco and tar with subtle hints of mint. The entry texture is clumsy; thick and awkward. The midpalate improves slightly as the taste emphasizes woodsy-minty flavors. Finishes bittersweet, bark-like and heavy.

title: Bardenay London Style Dry Gin
description: The cedary perfume of juniper is totally dominant in the bouquet. The palate entry is sweet upfront, then prickly on the tongue; the midpalate features sappy/piny gulps of juniper and harsh spirit. Concludes fiery, piny, intense and too powerful. This gin is unbalanced between the alcohol and botanicals.

title: 1800 Colección 100% Agave Añejo Tequila
description: An extra aged Tequila. The many aromatic levels in this bouquet feature notes of asparagus, dill, pickle brine, slate, vinyl and fresh herbs. The palate entry is mildly sweet in an oaky-woody, slightly smoky-pipe tobacco manner; at midpalate the off-dry taste features deep herbal, vegetal and spice flavors. Ends dry and complex.

title: Nocino della Cristina Walnut Liqueur
description: The bouquet features intriguing scents of coffee bean, black walnut, chicory and a hint of quinine. The palate entry is molasses-like and walnutty; the midpalate features tastes of black walnut and buttery richness on top of the roasted coffee bean. Ends stately, concentrated, luxurious, and nuttily delicious.

title: Christian Drouin Blanche de Normandie Normandy Apple Brandy
description: The smell of ripe, just-picked apple is lovely, perfumed and slightly spicy. The palate entry is crisp and tart; the midpalate offers tastes of apple fritter, apple peel, cinnamon and nutmeg. Concludes with a note of cocoa or dark chocolate and turns semisweet and luscious in the finish.

title: Diplomático Reserva
description: The nosing passes find layers of honey, old leather, palm oil, old oak and molasses. The palate entry explodes with succulent tastes of oak, vanilla cream, and honey; the midpalate offers tastes of cookie spices, raisins, dates, and dark chocolate. Ends up balanced, correctly sweet, and elegant. A fabulous deal.

title: Zirbenz Stone Pine Liqueur of the Alps
description: The intriguing bouquet offers a pine cone, cedar, alpine-forest perfume and little else. The palate entry is intensely piny and sappy and marginally sweet; the midpalate highlights the menthol aspect. Finishes bitter with waves of menthol or camphor and pinesap. An idiosyncratic liqueur made with highly skilled distilling and blending craftsmanship.

title: Charbay Pomegranate Flavored Vodka
description: The bouquet features ripe fruit, pulp, red pepper and rind. The palate entry is acidic, astringent, and tart; the midpalate highlights the peppery, zesty side of pomegranate. Finishes more tart than ripe; more biting and sap-like than juicy.

title: BRN Sea Wynde Pot Still Rum
description: Initial whiffs detect seductive fragrances of paraffin, molasses and oak; an extra seven minutes releases semisweet to sweet aromas of maple and brown sugar. Palate entry emits sweet, lightly baked tastes of maple and almond butter; by midpalate, the succulent tastes of cream, cinnamon, clove, oak resin approach rancio-like proportions. Aftertaste is long, fruity and delicious.

title: Mathilde Liqueur Cassis
description: The first sniffs scream “black currants”; further aeration brings out the scent of black currant nicely, without fanfare, jamminess or sweetness. Palate entry is tart, concentrated and curranty; the midpalate is more balanced in that the natural acids offset the intense preserves-like sweetness. Aftertaste is long, more bittersweet than sweet and luscious.

title: Vincent Van Gogh Espresso Vodka
description: The initial aroma is firmly structured and a tad baked; following additional air contact the aroma opens up adding charming scents of burnt match, cigar ash, linseed oil and peanuts. The palate entry is smooth and off-dry; by midpalate, flavors expand to include paraffin, creamery butter and vegetable oil. Finishes elegantly and creamy smooth.

title: Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve 23-Year-Old Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: The initial aromatic burst is chockfull of pork sausage and sweet spice scents; with aeration the aroma becomes a stately, mature, fully integrated whiskey bouquet, emitting scents of dark coffee, marzipan, praline, caramel corn and oaky vanillin. Palate entry and midpalate are melded, elegant, sap-like and sweet. Finishes warm, tangy, sweet and resiny. An American distilling masterpiece.

title: Stolichnaya elit Vodka
description: Aroma is dry, clean, and grainy, with background notes of parchment and litchi; later passes offer semisweet, mildly smoky/ashy scents of charcoal and smoldering embers. Palate entry is firm, moderately oily, bittersweet; at midpalate concentrated and spicy grain flavors mingle adroitly with the smoky, sap- and resin-sweet birch-charcoal filtering influence. Concludes sweetly and almost candy-like.

title: Wokka Saki Vodka with Sake Added
description: A stunningly elegant bouquet with alluring scents of peaches and nectarines. The palate entry is sweet, ripe, oily, and textured; at midpalate the taste profile turns equally grainy and fruity, with the 80-proof alcohol serving well as a base for the nimble flavorings. Ends well in a satiny, oily manner, showing just a trace of peach/nectarine flavor.

title: Xellent Swiss Vodka
description: The initial whiffs find herbal aromas with faint hints of jasmine and moss; additional scents of tea leaves, minerals and wet stone appear in the later passes. The palate entry is semisweet and biscuity; midpalate is nutty, concentrated and remarkably mineral-like. Concludes dynamically. One of only three or four over-$30 superpremium vodkas actually worth the price tag. Wow.

title: Jose Cuervo Reserva de la Familia Colección 2003 Anejo Barrel Select
description: First nosing passes pick up incredibly zesty and harmonious aromas of dill, fennel and pepper; another seven minutes sees the bouquet turn elegant, oaky and herbal. Palate entry is semisweet, with deft traces of caramel and vanilla; by midpalate the flavors include marzipan, hard candy, dried herbs, green pepper and vanilla. Finish is long, luxurious and stately. A brandy-like Tequila that's slightly richer than the terrific 2002 Reserva de la Familia.

title: Lysholm Linie Aquavit
description: Potato spirit flavored with herbs and spices that's been aged in Sherry casks. First nosings expose exotic and compelling aromas of bark, wood chips and fennel; further aeration releases heady scents of spice and honey. Palate entry of caraway-seeded rye bread; by midpalate, the flavor profile adds mild sweetness, soft spice and that persistent caraway seed. Aftertaste is moderately oily, off-dry and intensely herbal. One of the greatest spirits ever from Scandinavia.

title: Vincent Van Gogh Coconut Flavored Vodka
description: The coconut essence in the first whiffs is astonishingly authentic; time in the glass deepens the richness/oiliness of the coconut meat fragrance. Palate entry is dry to off-dry and delectably creamy/oily; at midpalate the coconut meat flavor reaches its peak freshness and soft bitterness level. Ends semisweet, viscous and creamy.

title: Murray McDavid Mission Range Highland Park 1979 Orkney Single Malt Whisky
description: Fino Sherry gold/straw color. Initial scent exhibits delicate notes of honey, oloroso Sherry and tobacco leaf; aeration stirs up succulent aromas including ashes, oaky vanillin, poppy seed and sweet malt. Palate entry is buttery, slightly herbal, lightly peated and oily; by midpalate, the oiliness takes control of the texture while the lightly peated tastes overshadows the honey, seeds and wood. Aftertaste is long, sweet and shows tobacco smoke. A tour de force from the legendary Highland Park.

title: Coeur de Lion 1963 Calvados Pays d'Auge
description: Apple peel-like scents greet you early-on; further time in the glass reveals much deeper, more profound aromas that resemble milk chocolate, cream and cotton. Taste  is clean, acidic and sap-like, then at midpalate the flavor turns slightly sweeter as if the apples were harvested a day before full ripeness. Simply one of the best vintage Calvados I've sampled.

title: George T. Stagg Limited Edition Uncut & Unfiltered Barrel Proof Kentucky Straight Bourbon
description: Due to the bracing cask strength, I first sampled G.T. Stagg neat, then with spring water. Sniffed neat, the aroma offers bittersweet chocolate, egg cream, brown sugar, marshmallow, nougat and dried red fruit; diluted, the aroma turns up the volume on the nougat/nut butter. Palate entry is silky, oily and intensely flavorful (the water brings out a luscious honey-like element); by midpalate, the muscular, Sherry/dark toffee taste reminds me of old Grande Champagne Cognac. Concludes refined and engagingly sweet. A classic.

title: Frapin VIP XO Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Opening aroma is assertive as zesty notes of pine, oak and parchment dominate; aeration serves to enhance the oak by introducing a fine caramel/toffee component. Palate entry is fruity, almost jammy and sweet; at midpalate, the smooth, satiny, creamy texture provides one of the highlights along with beguiling flavors of cocoa, chocolate cake frosting, butter cream and walnut. Concludes elegantly. Nothing less than one of the greatest grape brandies I've ever tasted.

title: Neisson Rhum Agricole Elevé Sous Bois
description: The first nosings find aromas of synthetic cotton; later sniffings pick up vegetal scents of peas and asparagus with a background note of wax floor polish. The palate entry is spirity and lightly toffee-like; the midpalate features accurate tastes of cane, honey, and vanilla bean. Ends on an off-dry note with smooth, biscuity, and grassy flavors.

title: 10 Cane Rum
description: A one- of-a-kind bouquet that includes aromas of cooked brown rice and broccoli, brown sugar, raw cane, brine, soy sauce and vanilla bean. The palate entry tastes of bittersweet sugar cane; at midpalate the taste becomes more sophisticated, silky, honey sweet and lightly spiced. Concludes nicely bittersweet, a bit cocoa-like, and beany

title: Milagro Select Barrel Reserve Anejo 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1420-CRT
description: The opening whiffs detect the buttery, resiny and lightly baked presence of oak barrels; following further air contact, more vegetal aromas appear, including green pepper, green olive, candle wax and garden flowers. The palate entry accentuates the oak-barrel sweetness while the midpalate adds succulent notes of cream, caramel and light honey. Concludes sweet, silky in texture, and classy.

title: Tequila Tezon Reposado 100% Agave Tequila
description: The initial aroma is spiced and intensely peppery; evidence of dill and olive brine comes to the surface in the later sniffings. The palate entry is smooth, creamy and a touch vanilla-like; the midpalate stage finds tastes of black pepper, roasted agave, new leather and pickling brine. Concludes satiny in texture, slightly smoky and sweet.

title: Mendiola Pisco Select Peruvian Quebranta Grape Brandy
description:
Low-key initial aroma that's borderline sweet and sour; followed by a mineral quality that accents the fruit component. The palate entry is long, lean, and vinous; at midpalate the mineral quality dominates the fruit and acidity. Finishes well with all the elements in harmony. 
Best Buy.

title: Barsol Pisco Traditional Peruvian Quebranta Grape Brandy
description: The initial aroma is juicy, concentrated, and jammy. The palate entry is squeaky clean, more than adequately acidic, and intensely grapy; at midpalate the taste profile includes an odd flavor of chalk/limestone. Concludes with a ripe, grapy rush. Best Buy

title: Bruichladdich 3-D “The Peat Proposal” Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: Moderate truckloads of smoky/ashy peat come in waves; further aeration time stirs deeper phenolic, intensely medicinal aromas, including kippers, dried seaweed, iodine and caramelized onion. Palate entry is svelte, medium-bodied and bittersweet; at midpalate there are traces of charcoal, charred meat, pork sausage, dry malt and burnt marshmallow. Ends up salty, off-dry to bittersweet, concentrated, and smoky.

title: Caol Ila Rare Edition 25-Year-Old Natural Cask Strength Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: Green olive, brine, pickling liquid and cedar in the beguiling and soft maritime bouquet. Palate entry is lean, but pipe tobacco sweet; at midpalate traces of unsweetened pineapple, mint, and barley malt are supported by pine, cedar andresin flavors that maintain a good balance between the sweetness of the grain and the resiny char of the bourbon barrel. Finishes like a sweet Vidalia onion.

title: Lombard Bunnahabhain 1979 Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: First aromas are deep and woody; after six minutes of additional aeration seductive notes of sautéed butter, roasted asparagus and scorched vegetation emerge. Palate entry is focused, meaty and mildly salty/briny; at midpalate flavors of buttered walnut, nougat and fudge contribute to an engaging mouth experience. Concludes moderately salty/seaweedy and toasty.

title: Knob Creek 9-Year-Old Small Batch Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Smells of sweet corn, buttered popcorn and pistachio nuts in the early stages; later whiffs pick up well-endowed scents of sautéed butter, oaky vanilla, beeswax and linseed oil. Palate entry is full-bodied, sweet and honeyed; at midpalate the taste profile turns drier, more intensely grainy-mashy and breakfast cereal-like. Finishes with notes of nougat, almonds, candy bar, and oak. Best Buy.

title: Poyer & Sandri Acquavite di Mele Cotogne/ Quince Brandy
description: Clear. Nose is discreet and subtle, showing very little in the way of fruit or spirit at first; aeration stirs some evidence of fruit. First flavors of quince and guava are firm and assertive without being raw or flammable; midpalate displays a touch of fire, but the emphasis is squarely on the quince and tropical fruit flavors. Finishes politely yet solidly. Fruity without being ambrosial. Lovely.

title: Poyer & Sandri Acquavite di Prugne/Prune Brandy
description: Clear. Initial vivacious, incredibly fresh scents of dark plum and wax; bouquet develops a sweet succulence. Palate entry is keenly fresh, moderately hot but brimming with plummy flavor; by midpalate the spirity fire dies down enough for the rich plum taste to take command. Finishes concentrated, plummy, jammy and long. Explosive and aggressive. Deserves a close look.

title: Three Olives Vodka
description: The opening nosings detect subtle odors of sweet grain and fresh, damp vegetation; further aeration introduces aromas of marshmallow and fiber. The palate entry is silky, textured and grainy sweet; at midpalate notes of charcoal/ash are found. Concludes on a smooth, sweet grain, sap-like note. A classy unflavored vodka that deserves a huge audience. Best Buy.

title: Ciroc Snap Frost Vodka
description: Owns a peculiar bouquet reminiscent of turkey dressing. Palate entry is sweet, ripe and grapey, a complete 180-degree turn from the odd bouquet; midpalate highlights the sweet, fruity ripeness to the point where it starts to resemble grappa. Finish is delightfully sweet, polished and elegant.

title: The Glenlivet 15-Year-Old French Oak Reserve Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: First whiffs pick up scents of fresh pineapple, cedar, and paraffin; later sniffings detect subtle notes of baked pear and sweet oak. Palate entry features a firm, moderately oily, and velvety texture; by midpalate, integrated flavors of ripe peach, pear drops and bran delight the taste buds. Finish is extended, semisweet and coconut-like. Replaces the 12-year-old French Oak Finish. Best Buy.

title: Germain-Robin Liqueur de Poète
description: The initial whiffs detect baked, toasted aromas; after another five minutes, caramelized notes of baked pear emerge in tiny increments. Palate entry flavor is soft, woody/resiny and lightly fruited; the midpalate shows a pruney, almost Madeira-like (sercial or verdelho) taste. Finishes sweet/sour, soft cheese-like (feta) and like dried fruit.

title: Hennessy Camp Romain Single Distillery Cognac
description: Early on, the nose is assertive and meaty as evolved aromas of cotton, oak and candy rule; aeration unveils toffee, candied nuts and ripe berries. Palate entry is sweet and candied, while the midpalate is honey-sweet. Finishes nutty, oaky and unabashedly sweet. For lovers of robust brandy.

title: Oronoco Rum
description: Aromas include hefty scents of honey, sugar cane, cut grass, charcoal, light wood smoke and buttermilk. The palate entry is sweet; midpalate is syrupy and thick. The aftertaste is long, intensely grassy and medium-sweet, bringing the focus back to the raw sugar cane juice.

title: Jon, Mark and Robbo's The Smooth Sweeter One Malt Irish & Scotch Whisky
description: A malted whisky blend of Irish malt from the Cooley and Islay's Bunnahabhain. Palate entry is sweet; at midpalate toasted flavors of wood, toffee, honey and mint go a long way in pleasing the taste buds. Finishes light, mildly sweet and grainy.

title: Gilka Kaiser-Kümmel Liqueur
description: Inhalations detect caraway. Palate entry is intensely caraway seed-like and slightly coin-like; at midpalate, the caraway taste blows away any sense of coins/metal, ending up nicely in a firm, oily finish that's concentrated and correctly seed-like.

title: Pallini Peachcello White Peach Liqueur
description: Aromas are of fresh peach. Palate entry offers a tuned-down peach component as the natural acidity deflects some of the juicy ripeness; at midpalate the alcohol gives the flavor phase structure and direction. Finishes well, juicy, ripe and suitably peach-like.

title: Tortuga Light Rum
description: The nosing passes find restrained aromas of dark honey and grass with subtle elements of chalk, molasses and brown sugar. The palate entry is off-dry and chalky; the midpalate emits savory tastes of molasses, dark honey, cream Sherry, cake frosting and cocoa. Finishes bittersweet, sugar cane-like, and a touch light caramel-like. Excellent value. Best Buy.

title: Malibu Passion Fruit Caribbean Rum
description: The aroma of passion fruit rules the bouquet. The palate entry is gently sweet and passion fruit-like; the midpalate stage shows a slight moderation of the flavor as the passion fruit turns mild, smooth, and pleasant, if simple. Ends up ripe, adequately sweet, and controlled. A better than average flavoring job. Best Buy.

title: Mount Gay Eclipse Barbados Rum
description: The soft sugary molasses smell in the first whiffs is mellow and gently sweet; aeration releases aromas of marshmallow, almond paste, and light toffee. The palate entry is slightly smoky and properly sweet; the midpalate phase highlights flavors of honey and vanilla extract. Finishes smooth, soft and eminently drinkable. Best Buy.

title: Mishka Citron Vodka
description: The fist nosings find a hint of lemon peel which after further exposure to air becomes more juicy. The palate entry is intensely lemony and tart; at midpalate the flavor profile turns alluringly bitter and true to the fruit source. Concludes on an astringent, concentrated lemon juice note.

title: Glencadam 15-Year-Old Eastern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: A very pleasant, fresh-out-of-the-oven, intensely grainy bouquet. The palate entry is semisweet and lightly caramel-like; at midpalate there's more of a malty thrust as the taste profile turns a bit sour and astringent. Ends up sweet/sour, grainy, agile on the tongue and medium-bodied. A good introductory Highlands malt.

title: Cannes Brulées Light Classic Premium Red Rum
description: Nosing finds firm, moderately sweet aromas of refined sugar and cake frosting. The palate entry is sweet, satiny, and caney, but cheerily superficial; the midpalate flavor profile reinforces the entry impression, adding nothing new. Ends up silky smooth and appropriately sweet.

title: Business Class White Gold Vodka
description: The first nosings find a gently off-dry to sweet grainy perfume; swirling stimulates further scents, including gum and glue. Palate entry is agreeably sweet and intensely grainy; the midpalate stage shows a nicely firm and silky texture. Ends up extended and beany sweet. Best Buy.

title: Business Class Platinum Vodka
description: The initial aroma is of quartz and stone; later whiffs detect traces of grain and charcoal. The palate entry is very dry, mildly grainy, and squeaky clean; at midpalate there is a pleasing, spirity warmth along with flavors of chalk and quartz. Concludes smooth and chalky with a note of grainy sweetness. Best Buy.

title: The Dalmore 12-Year-Old Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: Opening whiffs detect scents of toasted cereal grains and biscuit batter; air contact stimulates deeper aromas of peanut butter, buttered popcorn, wheat toast and lanolin. Palate entry is sweet, maple-like and sappy; the midpalate features oily flavors of roasted nuts, sautéed butter and nougat. Ends on a nutty, near honeyed note, with a trace of cigarette tobacco.

title: Cognac Toulouse-Lautrec V.S.O.P. Grande Champagne Cognac
description: A pleasing bouquet of paraffin with deeper scents of white pepper, light toffee, and palm oil. The palate entry is round, caramel-like, and nicely acidic; the midpalate stage is biscuity, showing an oak resin leaning at the end. Concludes concentrated and full. Best Buy.

title: Marquis de Montesquiou Napoleon Armagnac
description: A muscular bouquet of sautéed butter, roasted chestnuts, pine, cask resin, and butterscotch. The palate entry is toffee-like, full and semi- sweet; at midpalate the flavor turns dusty, intensely oaky, bacon-like, fat/suet-like, and meaty, with background notes of baked and caramelized banana. Concludes semisweet, fat and nut butter-like. Best Buy.

title: Bortolo Nardini Tagliatella Liqueur
description: The first nosings remind me of cola, quinine, and dried orange peel; aeration releases toasty/herbal notes of fennel and cassia bark. The palate entry is medium-sweet and earthy; at midpalate the flavor profile takes on more of the quinine and the orange peel. A sophisticated, svelte, and lean amaro.

title: Bacardi Big Apple Original Apple Rum
description: A solidly good, tart and real apple bouquet. The palate entry is astringent, cleansing and delectably sweet and sour; the midpalate stage is nicely acidic, crisply apple-like and engaging. Finishes pure, briskly tart and just a touch ripe and sweet. Good job of balancing the fruit, acid, and alcohol components.

title: Busnel Vieille Réserve V.S.O.P. Pays d'Auge Calvados
description: First aroma is apple-like and nicely acidic; later on, huskier notes of oak, hard cheese, baked apple, baked pear and beeswax appear. Palate entry is lean, off-dry, and alluringly baked and wax-like; at midpalate the taste profile turns drier, more caramel- and toffee-like, even maple-like. Concludes bittersweet, refreshingly astringent and resiny. Best Buy.
