However, it has some unusual botanicals: black pepper, basil, peppermint and kaffir lime, and would do well cooled in a tall glass of tonic. Made with Colorado and California juniper berries.

title: Caorunn Small Batch Scottish Gin
description: A Scottish gin, you say? From the Balmenach whisky distillery in Scotland's Speyside region comes this crisp gin, with a light juniper and citrus scent and a surprisingly warm finish with a prickle of anise and alcohol. The distiller notes list a host of intriguing-sounding botanicals, including rowan berry, heather and Coul Blush apple, which unfortunately are undetectable. However, the clean, quinine-like feel suggests this would be a fine match for G&T; lovers.

title: G'Vine Floraison
description: If you're seeking a floral-tinged gin for spring cocktails, this small-batch French number should hit the spot thanks to its very sweet perfume, with lots of lime and white flowers. On the palate, look for a nice balance of citrus and light, fresh floral notes, developing into an elongated floral finish.

title: Farmer's Botanical Small Batch Organic Gin
description: Your favorite vermouth or bitters will shine with this quiet gin as its backdrop. Neutral aroma, with a barely-there whiff of lemongrass, and a nicely round, citrusy flavor with a spicy coriander note and a clean finish. Despite the relatively high proof, this gin has a silky feel.

title: Genevieve Genever-Style Gin
description: There's no mistaking this old-style Genever for its cousin gin–but you might be forgiven for mistaking it for moonshine. The powerful, pungent aroma, malty but fresh, smells like it rolled right off the still. Dry, warm and fairly boozy finish, with a hint of anise.

title: Jacopo Poli Sarpa Riserva di Poli Grappa
description: Sniffs discover zesty aromas of green, red and jalapeño pepper as well as notes of parchment, coin, lead pencil and paraffin. Entry is oily, smooth, off-dry and peppery; midpalate features tastes of oak, vanilla, cream, cooking oil and butter. Concludes clean, bittersweet and oily.

title: Glenmorangie The Lasanta Extra Matured Range Sherry Cask Non-Chill Filtered Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: Stately aroma reminds me of butter- cream candies; further air contact reveals deeper scents of melon, white raisins, dried yellow plums and fudge. Entry is honey-sweet, ripe and fruity (dried yellow fruits, banana, pineapple, pear); midpalate is long, satiny, honeyed, eggy, fruity and balanced. Concludes on notes of Sherry, apricot, white raisins and light toffee.

title: Balvenie 15-Year-Old Single Barrel Speyside Single Malt Whisky Cask #70; Bottled 2006
description: Pungent, peppery, waxy and fiber-like aromas precede deeper aromas of oak resin, beeswax, white raisins and white pepper. Entry is oaky with toffee flavors; the midpalate is salty, smoky, mildly peaty and dry. Aftertaste is crisp, mildly sweet, oaky and austere.

title: Glenmorangie The Quinta Ruban Extra Matured Range Port Cask Non-Chill Filtered Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: Emits delicate, mildly spicy and grapy fragrances at first; additional time fails to open up any more aromatics. Entry is peppery, spicy, astringent and tangy; midpalate is moderately sweet, grapy, ripe and honeyed towards the finish.

title: Glenmorangie The Quarter Century 25-Year-Old Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: Smells of cookie or biscuit batter, with aeration stimulating scents of honeycomb, light toffee and mild oak. Entry tastes of buttercream, light caramel and honey; midpalate offers whipped egg white, creamy flavor and oak-influenced vanilla tastes. Finishes a bit short.

title: Frapin VS Luxe Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Smells of dried berries in the initial sniffs; the aroma turns toasty, with hints of orange marmalade, after another several minutes. Entry has foundation taste of ripe white grapes and oak; midpalate features long, silky, honey-sweet tastes, as well as an astringency that maintains this Cognac's freshness.

title: Rio Joe's Silver Cachaça
description: Smells of white grapes, fresh spirit off the still and sand. Entry is semisweet,  then baked and spicy (black pepper); midpalate is chewy in texture, mildly sweet and grassy, and even honeyed. Finishes well and stable, with delectably sweet tastes that gently coat the throat.

title: Frapin Cuvée VSOP Rare Grande Champagne CognacFrapin Cuvée VSOP Rare Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Baked pear and peach and bakery scents charm the olfactory sense right away. Entry is honey-sweet, fruity, toasty and caramel-like; midpalate highlights the ripe fruit, which seems more tropical in nature than grapy or berry flavored.

title: Chauffe-Coeur Hors d'Age Calvados
description: The complex bouquet offers layers of scents of very toasty, baked apple, pie crust, spicy and resiny, rancio notes, walnut meat, butterscotch and hard cheese. Entry tastes like caramel-covered apple, baked apple with cinnamon, and honey; the sweetness increases at midpalate as the flavor becomes succulent, creamy and buttery. Hint of rancio in the finish. Wonderful.

title: Chinaco Extra Añejo Lot 71 100% de Agave Tequila
description: The nosing passes find zesty scents of jalapeños with deeper aromas of dill pickle, relish, textile, oaky vanillin, salt and brine. Entry is sweet, salty, peppery, and oily; midpalate features creamy, oily and tangy flavors that coat the tongue. Ends earthy, sweet, satiny, concentrated  and oily. A classic extra añejo.

title: Hacienda Los Diaz Reposado 100% de Agave Tequila
description: Aromas of dill, pickle brine, flowers, green pepper, black pepper, flax and tobacco leaf. Entry is earthy and moderately sweet; the midpalate features melded tastes of honey, brown sugar and vegetables. Finish is oily, concentrated, peppery and integrated.

title: Los Danzantes Mezcal Joven
description: The bouquet is rubbery and wet suit-like. Entry is pleasantly oily with pungent tastes of cigarette smoke and burning rubber; the midpalate is surprisingly sweet and relatively well behaved as lively and peppery tastes challenge the taste buds. Finishes in a flurry of smoke, tobacco juice, road tar and burning rubber flavors. Mezcal fans will love it.

title: The Knot 100 Proof Whiskey
description: Delightful bouquet of butterscotch, hazelnut, old cigarette ashes, spices, fennel and honey. Entry is intensely herbal and semisweet; the midpalate is medicinal, a touch smoky, herbal and honeyed. Finishes with a notable honey taste and an end taste reminiscent of Drambuie. I like this flavored whiskey.

title: Absolut 100 Vodka
description: The initial nosing finds pleasantly zesty and pungent smells of grain spirit; following aeration the aroma settles down and features mildly fiery notes of toasted grain, chalk and textile. Entry is warming and intensely grainy; the midpalate stage is surprisingly sweet. Concludes on an aggressive, but not off-putting note of sweet grain spirit.

title: Chauffe-Coeur VSOP Calvados
description: Aromas of baked apple and wood with subtle scents of nutmeg, apple peel, flowers and earth. Entry is austere at first then explodes in assertive waves of apple pastry, mineral, stone and oaky vanilla; a delicious layer of honey/light toffee is added at midpalate. Finish is elegant, dry to off-dry, and wonderfully toffee-like.

title: Opulent Vodka
description: The delightful bouquet has a pleasing crisp graininess early on which becomes even more enjoyable following aeration as scents of peanut and white pepper emerge. Entry is lean, clean and sweet; at midpalate the grain element is sweet but not cloying. Finishes elegantly, smoothly and silkily. An excellent unflavored vodka.

title: Michael Collins Blended Irish Whiskey
description: The interesting bouquet offers pleasantly grassy, waxy and vegetal notes with the aroma becoming more expressive and focused on a grain component following aeration. Palate entry is tobacco-like, a touch smoky and biscuity sweet; the flavor turns intensely grainy and taste almost of sweet corn at midpalate. Finishes composed, grainy, doughy and slightly honeyed.

title: Boulard XO Pays d'Auge Calvados
description: Lackluster bouquet of oak, paraffin, spirit and baked apple smells. Entry is lean, minerally, slightly metallic and disappointing; midpalate finally opens up with tasty flavors of baking spices, tart red apple, under-ripe pear, black coffee, and dark caramel. Concludes well and suddenly toasty and oily. Good recovery from disappointing start.

title: Boulard Grande Solage Pays d'Auge Calvados
description: Early scents of sautéed butter, apple strudel and melon followed by plumper aromas of oaky vanillin, sap and resin. Entry is austere, nougaty and almond-like; the midpalate features ripe, pleasingly sweet and sour apple and pear tastes with caramel and nougat. Finishes gracefully and more tart than sweet.

title: Knappogue Castle 1995 Single Malt Irish Whiskey
description: The bouquet aromas include barley malt, asparagus, hollandaise, dry breakfast cereal, white peppercorns and salt. Entry is soft, citrusy-orangy, moderately baked and toasty; an almond nougat taste enters at midpalate and nicely offsets the dry maltiness and vegetal flavors. Shows solid presence and a hint of heather in the finish.

title: 100 Años Blanco Tequila NOM 1102 CRT
description: The bouquet smells of herbal agave and plastic/vinyl underpinned by a bittersweet agave note. Entry is very sweet and nicely warm, with vegetal tastes of raw asparagus and Brussels sprouts; the vegetal, spicy, herbal qualities are wiped out at midpalate by the flavor becoming even sweeter. Finishes keenly sweet.

title: Jacopo Poli Sarpa Riserva di Poli Grappa
description: The first nosing passes find aromas of green, red and jalapeno peppers; aeration brings out woody notes and subtle scents of parchment, coin and paraffin. Entry is pleasingly oily, off-dry and mildly peppery; the midpalate features tastes of oak, vanilla, butter and cooking oil. Concludes bittersweet, oily, with a trace of black pepper but dominated by the wood.

title: Balvenie 12 Year Old DoubleWood Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The first nosing passes discover scents of walnuts, grass and dark toffee; aromas of black tea and tobacco come to the forefront. Entry is delightfully grainy, malty and vanilla bean-bittersweet; the midpalate is silky, creamy, Sherry-sweet, pruny, black raisin-like and delicious. Ends on a medium-sweet dark chocolate note. A terrific 12 Year Old.

title: Cruzan Black Cherry Rum
description: The ripe and beguiling cherry scent bouquet is strikingly kirsch-like. At entry, the taste is delicate with ripe cherry flavors, elegant and integrated; the delicious taste continues into the midpalate phase as the creamy texture coats the tongue in rich and genuine black cherry flavor. Finishes a touch metallic, but is still a smashing flavored rum.

title: Jacopo Poli Po' Moscato di Poli Grappa
description:
The bouquet offers smells of tropical fruits and baking spice. Entry is minerally, pleasantly 
ripe, viscous in texture; the midpalate point is earthy, floral, stony and off dry. Finishes gracefully, minerally and drier than the midpalate.

title: U'Luvka Vodka Polish Grain Vodka
description: The nose offers firm, concentrated scents of cereal grain, palm oil, parchment and nuts. Palate entry is full, semidry and intensely grainy; in the midpalate stage, the taste profile turns more oily and waxy, all the time maintaining a high degree of grain kernel. Concludes dry, clean and elegant.

title: Snow Queen Vodka
description: The nosing passes pick up delicate notes of quartz crystals, minerals, earth and cotton. The palate entry is surprisingly sweet and assertive; the midpalate is grainy, sweet and minerally enough to offset the sweetness. Concludes grainy, semisweet and clean.

title: Pages Vedrenne Forgotten Casks Vat 54 Rare Cognac
description: The muted bouquet is slow in offering woody, leathery aromas with light touches of cocoa, cola and egg cream. Entry tastes include cocoa butter, honey, treacle, marzipan and nougat; by midpalate the taste profile leans towards fudge and cake frosting. Finishes intensely sweet and chocolaty.

title: Balvenie 15 Year Old Single Barrel Speyside Single Malt Whisky Cask #70; Bottled 2006
description: Deep aromas of oak resin, beeswax, white raisins and white pepper emerge following aeration. Entry is intensely oaky and toffee-like, with subtle touches of salt and butterscotch; the midpalate is salty, smoky, mildly peaty and grainy dry. The aftertaste is cleansing, crisp, mildly sweet and oaky and a touch austere.

title: Dewar's Aberfeldy 21 Year Old Central Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: Initial sniffings detect tart, yeasty aromas of barley malt and bread dough. Palate entry is off-dry and a touch bittersweet in caramel; at midpalate, the taste profile tends to the toasted cereal and toasted bread side of the scale. Finishes gracefully, dry, tart, crisp and clean.

title: Mezcal Union Uno
description: The ripe, fruity style of this mezcal lends itself to making margarita variations and other cocktails. Look for tropical fruit flavors like lychee and banana, and a mild note of jalapeño on the finish.

title: Ilegal Mezcal Añejo
description: As with the (previously reviewed) resposado and joven expressions, Ilegal's añejo is also mellow and elegant, although having spent 13 months in American and French oak, it's richer. The barrel aging contributes lovely aromas of honey and vanilla, which are echoed on the palate, along with a surprising flowery note, a suggestion of smoke and a spiced finish.

title: Mezcal Zacbé
description: From the lovely rounded bottle shape to the gentle flavors to the spirit's soft feel, everything about this mezcal is elegant and polished. While most joven mezcals have no color, this one has a barely-there golden tinge. Look for a warm, fruity, honeyed aroma and a restrained mix of vanilla and light smoke flavors that fade to a minty finish.

title: Del Maguey Single Village Mezcal Espadin Especial
description: The remarkable nose is jammed with pineapple and earthy roasted notes, plus a faint touch of vanilla. This mouthwatering mezcal mixes sweet and salty sensations on the palate, along with just the right amount of smoke. It would be an intriguing addition to cocktails.

title: Métl Mezcal Blanco Espadin
description: This single-variety mezcal, made solely from Espadín agave, has a sweet aroma, mingling a note of tropical fruit with a touch of roasted tomato. It shows fruity acidity on the palate, with moderate smokiness and black pepper flavor that accelerate into the clean finish. The alcohol feels brisk but surprisingly balanced for a product clocking in at 96 proof.

title: Fidencio Mezcal Pechuga 2012
description: The pechuga style of mezcal—which include raw chicken breast as part of the distillation process—has been relatively hard to find in the U.S. This well-structured newcomer is a welcome addition, offering bright, almost berry-like aromas, and warm, moderately smoky and faintly savory flavors.

title: Pierde Almas Dobadaan
description: Made from the Dobadaan agave variety, this joven mezcal has pleasing minty, grassy aromatics and sweet flavors that finish with menthol smokiness. It's bracing and drying in feel thanks to overproof alcohol levels. Pair this with cured meat or smoked fish.

title: Mezcal Yuu Baal Madrecuixe
description: Almost evoking a forest fire, this intense, intriguing mezcal melds fruit and smoke aromas with a rounded, pine-like flavor and a touch of honeyed agave nectar. Serve it with a lick of salt or a salty, savory appetizer for best effect.

title: El Buho Mezcal
description: Inside the squared bottle, this silky mezcal is warm and lightly fruity, with insistent smokiness and perky mint and rosemary accents on the finish.

title: El Diablito Mezcal
description: This pale-straw-colored joven mezcal is tinged with fresh apple, pear, vanilla and smoke notes, with refreshing astringency on the palate. The packaging is intriguing: The label shows dancing devils and skeletons and there's a drinking vessel attached to the bottle neck. The brand recommends drinking this over ice, with grapefruit-flavored soda and lime sprinkled with gusano (worm salt).

title: Fidencio Mezcal Madrecuixe
description: Made from Madrecuixe, a low-yielding wild agave found at high elevations of southern Oaxaca, this mezcal explodes with herbal and minerally flavors that are set against a softly smoky backdrop and bracing alcohol. Because the wild agave is so difficult to obtain, this mezcal is available only in limited quantities.

title: Pierde Almas Tequiliana Weber
description: Perhaps the most gin-like of all the mezcals, this joven, which is made from blue agave, is bright and perky, with pine, juniper and menthol notes, plus a clean finish.

title: Del Maguey Single Village Mezcal San Luis Del Rio Azul
description: Recommended for those who love big, smoky flavors in mezcal, this single-village spirit starts with mellow oregano and herb notes, which are quickly engulfed by waves of iodine and smoke. This is a great way to add a smoke note to cocktails.

title: Mezcal Real Minero
description: This blend of Espadín, Largo, Barril and Tripón agaves yields a mezcal with round, robust flavors of bell pepper and stewed tomato, with sprinklings of oregano, rosemary, black pepper and cayenne pepper on the piquant finish.

title: Wild Shot Mezcal Reposado
description: From country singer Toby Keith, the reposado expression of the Wild Shot line has a soft golden color, with a bold, smoky, roasted aroma. It's not as smoky on the palate as the scent would suggest; instead, flavors run to citrus and vanilla, with a fairly hot, drying finish. Although most quality mezcal producers eschew worms, this brand deliberately flaunts its worm at the bottom of the bottle.

title: Fidencio Mezcal Tobala
description: Tobala, a high-altitude variety of agave, yields a distinct herbal profile. Fidencio's version is fresh and grassy, with a brisk note of pine and a long anise-tinged finish. Between the raucous anise finish and the strong alcohol levels, this bears a passing resemblance to ouzo, the Greek liqueur.

title: El Mezcal Jolgorio Pechuga
description: Another intriguing take on the pechuga style of mezcal, which is usually distilled with a raw chicken breast, this is “twice distilled in copper stills, with fruits, turkeys and roosters creoles of the region.” The end result is mild and peppery, with a distinct fruitiness in the background.

title: Wild Shot Mezcal Silver
description: From country singer Toby Keith, the silver version of the Wild Shot line mixes smoky and herbal notes with a smooth, oily feel and a saline edge on the palate, then finishes with just a hint of smoke.

title: Banhez Mezcal Tradicional
description: Brisk, bold and smoky, this mezcal delivers mineral and petrol notes, and a peppery finish.

title: Espiritu Lauro Mezcal Joven
description: Look for pungent smoke and mentholated aromas and flavors, which fade fast into a light, mouthwatering saline note. Serve this with a lick of salt for more flavor oomph.

title: Doña Sarita Mezcal Blanco
description: The vegetal and fruit aromas are a treat, with bell pepper and oregano notes leading to a juicy pineapple tone. There's a disconnect between the nose and palate, which reflects mild herbal and petrol flavors.

title: Mezcal Siete Misterios Mezcal Joven
description: This has pungent and earthy aromas and flavors, with the aggressive prickle of jalapeño and black pepper on the palate. The proof feels high, so consider serving this with fruit juice and lots of ice.

title: Suntory The Yamazaki Single Malt Whisky Aged 18 Years
description: This is an excellent special-occasion single malt from Suntory. Look for a bold, luscious butterscotch, note, enlivened by touches of stone fruit, lychee, and a faint hint of smoke. The buttery-soft texture and amber color with bright orange-gold highlights add to the luxe experience.

title: Nikka Yoichi 15 Year Old
description: This elegant single malt from Nikka bears a dark, vibrant gold color, with smoke and caramel aromas. On the palate, look for well-balanced notes of citrus peel, cedar and oak, and a gentle waft of smoke. An astringent sensation on the finish sets the mouth watering, leading to a full-bodied, almost oily texture. Recommended for sipping neat.

title: Sheep Dip Malt Whisky
description: The silly name of this delicious, hard-to-put-down blended Scotch supposedly is derived from the days “when farmers hid their home-made whisky from the nosey excise officers in barrels marked ‘Sheep Dip.'” Made with a blend of 16 single malts from the four major whisky regions, this has an intense apple aroma and flavor, overlaid with a faint curl of smoke. The earthy smokiness grows on the finish, with intriguing dry and savory notes, like baker's chocolate and brine. Pair this with crumbly aged cheeses.

title: Nikka Taketsuru Pure Malt 12 Year Old
description: Bright gold in color and fresh, this single malt from Nikka offers a pitch-perfect balance of fruit, oak and smoke. On the palate, this translates to fresh apple and subtle vanilla flavors that taper smoothly.

title: Real Russian
description: This small-batch U.S. wheat vodka is handcrafted by a third-generation Russian distiller, using an heirloom family recipe. The end result is clean, with zingy citrus and pine notes, almost like a superlight gin. Brisk and well-balanced, this would work well in a wide range of cocktails.

title: Marshal 12-Year-Old Scotch Whisky
description: This mellow blended Scotch melds a brisk smokenote with a crème brûlée accent. Adding a splash of water brings a touch of caramel to the surface, while a peat note lingers on the smooth finish. Consider pairing this with a hearty appetizer or a meaty main course, such as beef or game.

title: Broken Shed Premium Vodka
description: This New Zealand vodka—distilled from whey—is smooth, clean, sweet and surprisingly full bodied for a vodka, featuring light vanilla and anise notes.

title: Karlsson's Gold Vodka Batch 2009
description: This limited-edition vintage bottling is made solely from the 2009 harvest of the solist potato crop from the Cape Bjäre region of southern Sweden. It's distinctly sweet and earthy, with a hearty chewiness about it—definitely different from Karlsson's more neutral standard bottling. Available as of November 2012, with fewer than 2,000 bottles made.

title: Scott's Selection Glen Mohr 1978 Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky Natural Cask Strength
description: The first whiffs find pleasant malty scents; after further aeration the bouquet remains grainy sweet and uncomplicated. The palate entry is plump and generously malty; by midpalate the flavor profile gives off tastes of honey and light toffee. Ends with fat, oily, buttery flavors. Delightful due to its sheer simplicity.

title: Old Smuggler Blended Scotch Whisky
description: The initial whiffs find soft, biscuit and sugar-cookie scents; aeration adds deeper aromas of cereal, honey, yeast and light caramel. Fat and creamy at palate entry, then toffee on the midpalate. Finishes up mildly spicy and oaky. A terrific bargain that first became fashionable during Prohibition. Best Buy.

title: Chabot VSOP Armagnac
description: Opening aroma is delightfully toffee-like yet dry; later whiffs pick up mild autumnal scents of dried leaves, herbs, and woods. The entry flavor has more maple/oaky sweetness than the aroma implied it would have, then at midpalate the taste profile turns drier, nicely acidic and cleansing, and slightly bittersweet/resiny in its leaning. Ends up dry, tight.

title: Laberdolive 1946 Jaurrey Bas Armagnac
description: Bouquet is reticent, giving off only a distant scent of marshmallow; aeration breathes life into this bouquet as it starts to emit mature, elegant aromas of old oak, baked pear, apple strudel and dark caramel. Palate entry immediately flashes cheese-like rancio; by midpalate, other mature flavors including honey, tobacco and brown sugar enhance the moderate rancio presence. Aftertaste is chewy, medium long and semisweet. An aging lion whose power shouldn't be underestimated.

title: Jepson Signature Reserve Mendocino Alambic Brandy
description: Owns a forest floor, slightly burnt, ash-like opening aroma, following further air contact the aromatic profile shifts to hot wax, campfire embers, toasted honey wheat bread, and pork rind. The palate entry is waxy and fatty; at midpalate there's a pleasing semisweetness. Concludes on notes of light toffee and almond paste.

title: Armazem Vieira Esmeralda Aged Artesian Cachaça Solera 4-Year-Old
description: The initial nosing passes pick up pungent scents of pickle brine, clam sauce, and green olive; aeration adds sour-leaning scents of fried egg, meringue, and more pickle brine. It's sweeter tasting at palate entry than the nose suggested; midpalate shows an oily texture with a nuance of sugarcane sweetness at the taste's core. Concludes mildly sweet and almost biscuity.

title: Ridgemont Reserve 1792 Barrel Select 8-Year-Old Small Batch Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: The first couple of sniffings detect attractive, dry scents of leather and black pepper; aeration encourages sweeter, woodier aromas to emerge. The palate entry is sap- and pine-like and moderately sweet; at midpalate a flash of cocoa appears, then recedes for additions of sweet oak, vanilla, palm oil and sap. Finishes lean, moderately sweet, grainy/corny and very appealing. Best Buy.

title: Don Eduardo Anejo 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1110 CRT
description: Aromas are of lightly spiced and vegetal green pepper, cotton fiber, and a soft, oaky sweetness. The palate entry is delicate and mildly sweet; at midpalate the taste profile remains rather static and delicate; it's surprisingly meek for an anejo. Concludes softly, moderately sap-like, and vegetal.

title: Black Diamond Vodka
description: Understated aromas of chalk and grain mash; only meek scents of scallion and metal develop with air. Palate entry is sweet and properly grainy; the flavor menu expands at midpalate to include cocoa butter and sesame oil. Aftertaste is long and semisweet.

title: Jazz Vodka
description: Early nosings pick up intense, grain-like aromas; aeration bolsters the concentrated, dry graininess but adds pungent supplemental scents of burning rubber, charcoal, baked beans and cigarette ash. Palate entry is sweet, grainy and a bit muted; midpalate is semisweet, oily and concentrated. Finish is long, sweet and grainy.

title: Wodka Gorbatschow Vodka
description: The bean-like aroma is punchy, semisweet and firm in the initial two minutes of sniffing; following further air contact the bouquet inexplicably flatlines, becoming just a standard-issue grain spirits scent. Palate entry is grainy sweet and a touch lead pencil-like; at midpalate the flavor profile is unabashedly sweet, minerally and grain mash-like. Finishes semisweet and slightly oily. Best Buy.

title: SKYY Orange Vodka
description: Aroma of fresh, rind-like scents of orange. The palate entry is keenly tart and acidic with a pleasant bittersweet leaning; at midpalate the flavor fades slightly; the aftertaste returns to the zesty, rind-like quality first noticed in the early stages of the nosing. Finishes tart and properly fruity. Best Buy.

title: Ambassador Royal Deluxe 12 Year Old Blended Whisky
description: Pretty pale amber. Initial sniffings detect concentrated, nutty and semisweet aromas; aroma develops in the copita and emits notes of butterscotch, almond butter and dry cereal. In the mouth it's firm, intensely grainy; at midpalate the taste profile turns caramel-like. Finishes well, with succulent flavors of nut butter, sweet oak and caramel.

title: Liefmans Frambozenbier Raspberry
description: Brackish, red/brown tone; beige foam. The intensity of the ripe fruit aroma is a revelation; beyond the fruit is a blast of yeast. In the mouth, it's light, tart. Finishes cleanly.

title: Ron Matusalem Platino Rum
description: Offers aromas of molasses and cocoa bean; additional aeration brings out bittersweet vanilla bean. Palate entry is sweet, viscous and intensely bean-like; by midpalate, the flavors also include molasses and raw sugar. Finish is long, sugary-sweet and bean-like.

title: Ron Matusalem Clasico Rum
description: First nosing passes discover delicate scents of sugar cane and honey. Palate entry is biscuity/sugar cookie sweet, pleasant and medium-bodied; by midpalate, there's clear evidence of molasses, sugar cane, pine and cocoa. Aftertaste is long, luxurious and mature.

title: The Famous Grouse 10 Year Old Malt Whisky
description: A lively initial aroma of green forest; more air contact adds traces of unsalted butter and green tomatoes. At palate entry tightly wound, caramel and cotton candy flavors emerge; midpalate finds moderately oily, semisweet tastes of honey/vanilla/maple. Concludes long, honeyed and off-dry. Best Buy.

title: El Tesoro de Don Felipe Platinum 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1139 CRT
description: Green vegetable notes of uncooked broccoli, snow peas and zucchini; extra air contact sees the addition of very light brine. The palate entry is pleasantly creamy and focused; at midpalate the complexion changes, becoming lead pencil-like, narrow and desert dry. Finishes tongue-on-stone dry and medium-bodied. Best Buy.

title: Chateau de Laubade 1954 Armagnac
description: The initial nosing passes discover mature scents of black olive, burnt matches and cigar box; air contact releases expressive notes of black pepper, minerals and old, crumbling parchment. The palate entry features marzipan, prunes, black raisins and cake batter; at midpalate the taste turns flat-out sweet, maple-like and woody/oaky. Ends sweetly, medium rich, and a touch cola-like.

title: Glenmorangie 10 Year Old Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: The first sniffings detect delicate notes of candied apple, light toffee and pear drops; aeration adds nuances of rose petals, carnations and lightly toasted malt. The palate entry is grainy and moderately sweet; at midpalate there's a burst of red pepper backed by tastes of pears, peaches, mushroom, old attic and cigar tobacco. Ends cleanly. A deceptively complex 10 year old. Best Buy.

title: Rumba Coffee Liqueur
description: Palate is sweet and beany with evidence of tobacco smoke, tar, dark cocoa and coffee bean. Aftertaste is semisweet, intensely beany and pleasant.

title: Apreval 1974 Brut du Fut Calvados Pays d'Auge
description: Smells of old casks, butter cream and oil. Palate entry is creamy in texture, bark-like and woodsy in flavor, slightly hot and prickly, with baked apple and oaky overtones.

title: Planat V.S.O.P. Cognac
description: Aromas are plummy and berry with juicy notes of resin, pineapple and tropical fruit. On the palate, sap-like and semisweet flavors of maple, oaky vanilla and light toffee. Aftertaste is brief, semisweet.

title: Caledonian Selection Bruichladdich 1991 11 Year Old Islay Single Malt Whisky Cask Strength
description: Lemon juice/straw color. Gives off a fresh, lightly briny and almost flowery (rose petals?) bouquet in the first couple of whiffs; later sniffings find traces of orange blossom, lemon drop candy, lightly roasted malt, cocoa and sea breeze. Palate entry is delicate, buttery and remarkably smooth, considering the cask strength; the midpalate features sound, solid and flowery flavors that are enhanced by hints of sweet malt, palm oil, bourbon cask, sulfur and sea salt. Aftertaste is brief, nimble and malty.

title: Magellan Gin, The Original Natural Blue Gin
description: Pale aquamarine tint comes from the infusion of Iris root and flower. Opening nosing passes feature clove with supporting traces of cassia bark, grains of paradise and nutmeg; after several more minutes a moderately sweet and fruity bouquet develops, one that highlights orange zest, coriander and juniper berries. Palate entry is bittersweet and acceptably prickly on the tongue; by midpalate, the cocoa and bean-like taste focuses on the earthy/root/bark botanicals, especially the cassia, juniper and licorice. Finishes cleanly, bittersweet and long. One of the more bitter and intensely bean-like gins I've sampled.

title: Crown Royal Fine Deluxe Blended Canadian Whisky
description: Opening nose hints of pine tar, dark caramel and maple syrup with subtle notes of brown sugar and honey. Palate entry has a silk texture; at midpalate there's a minor explosion of dried fruit and chocolate cherry flavor. Concludes quiet and mild. Best Buy.

title: Gran Centenario Plata 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1122
description: Sniffs detect lead/nickel, black pepper, saltines, sesame crackers and dough; an atypical silver/blanco/plata bouquet. Palate entry is viscous and off-dry; at midpalate the flavor becomes smoky and green vegetable-like, with hints of corn husk and agave. Ends moderately spirity and peppery.

title: Players Extreme Banana Flavored Rum
description: The dried banana perfume leaps from the glass. At palate entry the banana taste is softly sweet and ripe; the midpalate offers a pleasantly round, off-dry to sweet flavor of ripe banana. Aftertaste is sweet.

title: Vox Raspberry Flavored Vodka
description: The opening nosings find understated aromas of raspberries still on the vine; after six more minutes of aeration time the bouquet evolveds slightly to include a note of raspberry preserves. Palate entry displays a velvety texture; the midpalate provides this vodka's finest hour as the flavor deepens and showcases the natural tartness and berry nuances of fresh raspberry. The finish is fruity, mildly sweet and ripe.

title: Murray McDavid Macallan 1990 10 Year Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The first couple of sniffings are gently sweet, clearly Sherried and honey-like, then the aroma turns biscuity, oaky vanilla- and marzipan-like, with background scents of wood resin and butterscotch. Palate entry is sweet, oaky and a touch hot and prickly; aggressive notes of bittersweet chocolate and cocoa appear at midpalate, eclipsing the oak. Finishes honey sweet, piquant and spirity.

title: Don Roberto Plata Tequila
description: This fresh, delicate blanco Tequila with a sweet, coconut-like fragrance would blend nicely into citrusy cocktails. Not surprisingly, the older expressions also were lovely, adding caramel tones on this excellent foundation.

title: Casa Noble Tequila Reposado
description: Handsome, gift-worthy blue-and-silver bottle.  Inside, the spirit is light amber and scented with caramel and a peppery undercurrent. This triple-distilled spirit has a smooth texture and a mild honey flavor, with a long smoky finish chased by faint caramel notes.

title: Maestro Dobel Diamond Tequila
description: This crystal-clear blend of reposado, añejo, and extra añejo Tequilas offers a luscious butterscotch flavor and a potent alcohol wallop. Pair with a caramel-rich dessert.

title: Tequila Don Julio Reposado
description: Translucent golden color and pretty floral, light vanilla scent. This is a relatively sweet reposado, with honey and vanilla flavors, and a long, fairly smoky finish.

title: Tequila Reposado Campo Azul
description: This assertive, zesty Tequila is no wallflower. It has a robust, smoky aroma backed by vanilla notes, and a sweet flavor with a strong, smoky finish. This one wouldn't hide in a drink, and would stand up to ice.

title: Tres Generaciones Plata
description: A classic and refreshing blanco profile: pear-like scent and crisp, dry, lightly peppery flavors. Mix this Tequila into Paloma cockails.

title: Senor Rio Tequila Blanco
description: Pop open the striking bottle with thick-cut glass stopper, and out wafts a spicy, oregano-like aroma. The spirit has an agave sweetness and faint coconut note, and finishes a touch peppery. Particularly good for spicy cocktails.

title: Corzo Tequila Reposado
description: Golden. Sweet, vanilla-custard nose. Sweetness at first, then it turns smoky, some caramel and oaky notes. It has a light, even malleable feel. It would meld very well in a cocktail with lime juice and a sweet liqueur or juices. Elegant rectangular bottle.

title: Don Roberto Añejo Tequila
description: Reminiscent of lapsang souchong tea with lemon and honey. This golden Tequila is fragrant with caramel and lemon zest, and tastes warm, brisk and smoky, drizzled with a touch of honey, and finishes relatively dry.

title: Corzo Tequila Añejo
description: Inside the striking rectangular bottle, this spirit has a golden, sunny color and sweet aromas like vanilla custard and baked pears drizzled with honey. Mellow and elegant, with warm honey, agave and Sauternes flavors and just a wisp of smoke on the finish.

title: Riazul Premium Tequila Silver
description: Although this brand is best with some age and oak on it, the unaged version is no slouch. It's still fairly mellow for a blanco, with a soft feel and sweet flavors of coconut and agave.

title: Partida Blanco Tequila
description: Smoky and tomato-like aromas, brisk flavor, and a lightly smoky, peppery finish. This smooth character has surprising finesse for an unaged Tequila.

title: Senior Rio Tequila Reposado
description: Overall, this is a mild, light Tequila, from its pale straw color to its relatively dry, floral flavor and smoky finish. Even the feel is light and smooth. Serve alongside Sangrita or mixed into other spicy, bold cocktails.

title: Senor Rio Tequila Añejo
description: Two years of rest in a cask that previously held Tennessee whiskey yields a mellow Tequila with a coconut-like and smoky aroma, a soft feel, and a light caramel flavor.

title: Tres Generaciones Añejo
description: This light, perfumy añejo is scented with floral, apple and peach notes. On the tongue, look for lots of agave flavor and a lightly smoky finish.

title: Espolon Tequila Reposado
description: Outside, the bottle sports an edgy “Day of the Dead” label design. Inside, this light-gold liquid has a mild, juicy, slightly peppery scent and a surprising floral honeysuckle note with a lingering waft of smoke. The soft, mouth-filling texture is offset by a welcome alcohol bite. This Tequila would prove an interesting mixer for a sour-style cocktail.

title: Milagro Tequila Añejo
description: This balanced Tequila has soft honey color and a lightly smoky scent. A touch of sweetness on the tongue winds into a brisk, smoky finish with a light undercurrent of caramel.

title: Tres Generaciones Reposado
description: This is a refreshing take on resposado. Fresh, tart green-apple scent and a bright, peppery flavor fades into oaky vanilla notes. A light alcohol bite braces up the spirit.

title: Añejo Patron
description: After an initial touch of agave, most of the flavor is on the big caramel finish. This is not a bad thing. Vibrant yellow, mild smoky scent, smooth texture.

title: El Jimador Tequila Añejo
description: This silky añejo reads more like Bourbon than Tequila, from the maple syrup color to the caramel-bomb flavor that echoes through and through. Only a faint peppery not whispers “Tequila.” Good value.

title: Antiguo de Herradura / Blanco
description: This sweet and citrusy Tequila would shine in a Paloma. Sweet, almost pineapple-y fragrance and sweet-tart flavor with a grapefruit peel note and a brisk, peppery finish.

title: Herradura Añejo
description: Honey color and a big, sweet biscuit-y scent, with just a hint of smoke hovering in the background. A tickly pepper note plays across the palate, followed by a major caramel finish that lingers on and on.

title: Riazul Premium Tequila Reposado
description: This reposado is nearly transparent, with a yellowish tinge, and is lightly smoky and sweet on the nose and the tongue. The flavor is intriguing:  light smokiness mixes with a hint of cocoa, then a honeyed, soft finish. Tall, colorful, striking bottle.

title: Tequila Campo Azul Extra Añejo
description: Aged 40 months, this extra-añejo Tequila has a light amber color and a soft, sweet butterscotch candy aroma.  Look for lots of rich vanilla and oak flavor, a little peppery sting, and a tannic pucker on the tongue.

title: Reposado Tequila Corraleo
description: This Tequila has a pale straw color, and sweet, yeasty scent of baking bread. On the tongue, look for fleeting sweetness, then a long, complex finish of equal parts caramel and smoke.

title: Herradura Seleccion Supremo
description: This Tequila, aged for a whopping 49 months, smells boozy and caramelly, like Bourbon, and has a maple syrup tint. Despite the oaky flavor and long caramel finish, a faint peppery touch identifies it as aged Tequila. Coddle this elder statesman with lots of aeration and ice for maximum flavor.

title: Reposado Patron
description: Faint yellow tinge, with a surprisingly light aroma, flavor and body for a resposado. Silky feel on tongue. Lightly peppery, with a citrusy finish.

title: Dulce Vida Añejo Tequila
description: Unlike the silver and reposado, the añejo expression of this Tequila didn't read as 100 proof – apparently two years of barrel aging is what it takes to tame this tiger. Lightly smoky, cola-like scent. Mild flavors of lemon, agave, and oak and a dry finish.

title: Tequila Don Julio Real
description: Blending Tequilas matured in American white oak barrels for three to five years, results in a mix of caramel, peppery, and smoky notes chasing around the glass. The effect is complex, but not completely harmonious.

title: Casa Noble Tequila Blanco
description: A triple-distilled lowlands spirit with a crisp, agave and lemon peel scent and clean, citrusy flavor with a mild, custardy finish and a soft feel. This Tequila is best with barrel aging—hold out for the reposado.

title: Half Moon Orchard Gin
description: Made from New York State wheat and apples, this gin has a pronounced fruitiness, with spearmint, anise, licorice and lime peel, finishing rounded and relatively fiery.

title: WhistlePig 15 Year Rye
description: This remarkably complex sipper leads with caramel and vanilla, then reverberates with rounded dried fruit, sherry and almond, fading into a long, gentle baking spice finish. Made with 100% rye sourced from Canada, this is finished in barrels made from Vermont oak and bottled in Vermont.

title: High West Yippee Ki-Yay
description: Attention wine lovers: this fab bottling with the cowboy label is made with a blend of straight rye whiskies finished in two wine casks, formerly holding vermouth and Syrah. The result is a deep ruddy amber hue and a strikingly concentrated flavor profile. Look for warming layers of caramel, toffee and espresso, drying to leather, zingy orange peel and spice. Sip or mix into Manhattans or any drink including sweet vermouth.

title: Michter's US*1 Barrel Strength Rye
description: This limited-release rye offers a rich aroma of vanilla and caramel. Bottled at barrel strength, it's initially drying and hot on the palate. Complex and echoing with rounded vanilla and allspice, it stands up to plenty of dilution, and finishes on a hint of almond.

title: George Dickel Rye Whiskey
description: On the smoother, sweeter side of the rye spectrum, this whiskey offers a restrained aroma that mixes vanilla and oak and luxe, bold flavors that resound with -cigar wrapper, leather, toffee and cocoa. The long finish is perked up by a fleeting cut-apple freshness, marked by allspice and clove. Cocktail friendly. Made in Indiana, bottled in Connecticut.

title: Rittenhouse Straight Rye Bottled-in-Bond
description: A versatile must-have for mixing cocktails, look for pleasing vanilla, maple and a hint of dried cherry. The finish is long and drying, with plenty of baking spice notes.

title: WhistlePig Straight Rye Whiskey Old World Series: Madeira
description: Why aren't more spirits aged in former Madeira casks? This bold, flavorful bottling is dark amber in the glass, featuring delicious gingerbread and spice cake notes, leading into honey, caramel and sherry, and finishing long with juicy orange plus clove, cinnamon and cayenne heat. With a little water to tame and soften that alcohol fire, it's delicious as a sipping whiskey.  Made with 12-year-old whiskey distilled in Indiana, then aged and bottled in Vermont.

title: Masterson's 10-Year-Old Straight Rye Whiskey
description: The complex aroma suggests rich caramel, maple and butterscotch. The same flavors are echoed on the palate, showing a flash of sweetness, drying alcohol heat and a spicy finish. Water tames this 100% rye to a maple-almond flavor profile, finishing with cocoa and plenty of mouthwatering spice.

title: New Southern Revival Rye Whiskey
description: Made with heirloom Abruzzi rye, white corn and malted barley, this complex whiskey shows caramel, espresso and cocoa up front, and finishes exceedingly long with leather, cigar wrapper, orange peel, allspice, and even a whiff of campfire smoke. Sip or mix.

title: Redemption Barrel Proof Straight Rye Whiskey
description: Aged eight years and bottled at a stunningly high proof, look for rich aromatics of caramel, almond and maple. On the palate, this whiskey almost suggests a dark beer—it feels effervescent, and shows espresso, toffee and clove. Dilution (and plenty of it) coaxes out some sweetness, adjusting the flavor profile to caramel and toffee, finishing dry and spiced, plus a flash of almond. Distilled in Indiana, bottled in Kentucky.

title: Turley Mill Cask Strength Single Barrel Rye Whiskey
description: Aged six years, this unusual “Western whiskey” is scented with rich vanilla and brown sugar. The bold flavor explodes on the palate: tons of vanilla morphs into orange peel and spice cake. It's cask strength, so dilute to taste; it holds up well, still delivering plenty of bold flavor and a lingering ribbon of vanilla.

title: Bulleit Rye
description: Ideal for Manhattans and other cocktails, this 95% rye has a malty profile that mixes vanilla, crème brûlée, and a fleeting citrusy zing on the drying, cinnamon-accented finish.

title: Sazerac Straight Rye Whiskey
description: The aroma entices with bold caramel and vanilla. The palate is brisk and relatively dry, despite the succulent aroma, showing vanilla and oak up front, and rounding into nutmeg, almond, vanilla and bitter orange on the finish. Versatile for cocktails, including its namesake Sazerac.

title: Low Gap California Whiskey
description: The aroma is markedly rich and sweet, evoking tropical fruit, almond, maple sugar and butterscotch. It's relatively sweet on the palate too, with confectionary flavors like almond paste, vanilla, cookie dough and a creamy hint of fudge enlivened by espresso, cocoa and allspice on the lush, velvety finish. One of the few ryes suitable for a dessert pairing.

title: Pikesville Straight Rye Whiskey
description: Look for a rich caramel-maple aroma and spice-forward flavor profile, showing allspice and clove, with a layer of vanilla underneath. Dilution tames this rye to show more vanilla, accented with dry touches of oak, leather and cocoa. Aged at least six years. Sip or mix.

title: Mad River Revolution Rye
description: Made with three different rye varietals, including malted and roasted “chocolate” rye, and aged at least one year, this 100% rye has a notably dark amber hue, with oak and cedar aromas. Fudge, toffee and espresso finish exceedingly long, bolstered by clove and burnt orange peel.

title: Rough Rider Bull Moose Rye Whiskey
description: Named for former president & native Long Islander Teddy Roosevelt and his “Rough Riders” volunteer cavalry. Look for a vanilla and oak scent, plus a touch of apple. On the palate, this rye has a concentrated vanilla flavor tinged with espresso and cocoa, finishing on mouthwatering fruit and spice.

title: WhistlePig Straight Rye Whiskey Old World Series: Sauternes
description: Made with 12-year-old whiskey finished in former Sauternes casks, this bottling balances sweetness and spice. The complex aroma suggests candied lemon peel, figs, caramel and a slight floral note. It's spicy on the palate, with orange peel segueing into a smooth vanilla and caramel exit.

title: WhistlePig Straight Rye Whiskey Old World Series: Port
description: Made with 12-year-old whiskey finished in former Port casks, look for a ruddy amber hue and rich caramel and toffee aromas. It's spicy on the palate, with clove, cinnamon, oak and a rounded red fruit note.

title: Koval Single Barrel Rye Whiskey
description: Burnished gold, this rye has aromas of vanilla and coconut. A faint sweetness shows on the palate, with initial notes of coconut and almond, while the finish is gently spiced and drying. This certified organic whiskey is versatile for cocktails.

title: Nahmias Et Fils Legs Diamond Whiskey
description: Burnished gold in the glass, this rye is boldly scented with baked pear, vanilla and pecan pie. The palate is lighter and crisper than the aroma suggests. The floral entry rounds to a nutty midpalate and finishes feather-light, with a bounce of ginger spice.

title: Redemption Rye
description: This is burnished gold in color, with a sweet vanilla-almond aroma and bold, rounded flavors that suggest oak, vanilla and almond. The finish is slightly hot, with cinnamon and orange peel notes rounding it out. Made in Indiana, bottled in Kentucky.

title: Hochstadter's Vatted Straight Rye Whiskey
description: The sweet scent hints at pecan pie and orange peel. On the palate, it's drying and bold, with a markedly fruity characteristic, suggesting red fruit, orange peel and vanilla. Dilution coaxes out a pleasing nuttiness, and dials the alcohol bite back to a pleasantly warming sensation. Made with a blend of five straight rye whiskeys sourced from the U.S. and Canada, aged from four to 15 years.

title: Rough Rider The Big Stick Rye Whiskey
description: This cask-strength rye is among the highest proof you'll see on the shelf. Uncut, this dark amber whiskey has a rich caramel aroma and a wood-heavy palate that finishes long, spicy and hot. Balanced with plenty of dilution, mellow vanilla, almond and coconut tones emerge.

title: Taos Lightning Governor's Reserve Straight Rye Whiskey
description: This honey-hued rye has a pleasant lemon peel and spice fragrance. It's surprisingly brisk and delicate at first, mixing citrus, vanilla, honey and violet, but that delicacy gets lost in a swirl of alcohol fire and spice in the drying finish.

title: Goldrun Rye California Whiskey
description: This small-batch rye has a ripe banana scent and soft feel. The rounded flavor is fruity, with butterscotch, hits of oak and a perky baking spice finish.

title: William Wolf Rye
description: This Dutch-made rye whiskey is brisk and oaky, accented with vanilla, pecan and dried apricot, finishing lightly sweet and gently spiced. Small batch.

title: Corbin Cash Merced Rye Whiskey
description: Made with 100% Merced rye, a varietal that grows well in cool climates, and aged about three years, look for mild vanilla and orange peel aromas. The drying palate leads with oak, spice and vanilla and finishing with fiery clove, a tease of nutmeg and a whiff of campfire smoke.

title: Knob Creek Straight Rye Whiskey
description: Look for a dry, distinctly oaky, toasty profile, with plenty of deep, dark toffee and cayenne winding into the spicy, warming finish. Dilution pulls the flavors back to vanilla and buttered toast. Small batch.

title: Cody Road Rye Whiskey
description: Bright notes of vanilla and fresh-cut pear run throughout this light, approachable rye, with a brisk menthol note on the midpalate and a zingy finish laced with ginger, lemon cream and cinnamon. Recommended for Sazeracs.

title: Siesta Key Toasted Coconut Rum
description: Honey-hued in the glass, this Florida-made flavored rum is lightly sweet and shows vanilla and pleasantly authentic notes of toasted coconut. Mix with ginger ale and lime, or a splash of pineapple juice.

title: Selvarey Rum
description: Best known as the brand backed by musician Bruno Mars, this versatile white rum has a light, almost neutral aroma and flavor, suggesting coconut and marshmallow. It's a blend of three- and five-year-old rums, made in antique copper stills.

title: St. George California Reserve Aged Agricole Rum
description: Distilled from fresh California sugarcane and aged four years in French oak, this agricole-style aged rum is on par with what you find coming out of Martinique, though it has more sass. Bold aromas of banana and savory truffle burst out the glass the moment it's poured. On the palate, think banana flambé, with ripe fruit, brown sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg, plus a drying, astringent feel.

title: Afrohead XO Premium Aged Dark Rum
description: This 15-year-old rum, a newcomer to the U.S. market, has a multi-island provenance: the molasses is sourced from the Dominican Republic, distilled and aged in Trinidad, and finally, bottled in Barbados. The end result is a mix of brown-sugar sweetness and deep, caramelized banana funk, plus teasing cinnamon heat around the edges of the tongue.

title: Silver Fox Premium Virginia Light Rum
description: Clear in the glass, this rum has a distinctly floral-raspberry fragrance, as well as a pleasant brown-sugar flavor that winds into a very faint, berry-like finish. Suggested for mixing into fruity cocktails.

title: Afrohead Premium Aged Dark Rum
description: This amber rum shows caramel, brown sugar and oak, finishing with rounded, mouthwatering notes of cola and allspice. Mix into tropical drinks.

title: Pusser's Navy Rum
description: Inspired by the recipe once used to produce the daily rum ration given to British Navy sailors, this robust rum layers resin and oak notes with vanilla and pungent hints of tropical fruit, finishing downright fiery. Made with a mix of rums aged three to five years.

title: Twenty Boat Hand-Crafted Spiced Rum
description: Made at the first legal distillery on Cape Cod since Prohibition, this golden rum suggests vanilla, juicy peaches in syrup, perfumy white flowers, allspice and cardamom. Recommended for mixing with ginger ale and juices, as it's too fiery for easy sipping straight up.

title: DonQ 151 degrees
description: At 151 proof, this spirit is literally flammable and is not intended for sipping straight up. Even when diluted by half with water, there's plenty of vanilla bean aroma (and alcohol sting on the nose), and suggestions of cinnamon red-hot candies. Break it out for party drinks meant to be set aflame.

title: Herradura Coleccion de la Casa Reserva 2014 Scotch Cask Finish Reposado Tequila
description: The newest addition to Herradura's stunning collection of cask-finished Tequilas nods to Scotland. It smells like a dessert wine, showing stone fruit, Sherry and honey. Those flavors are echoed on the palate, a lingering, smoky wisp that evokes peaty Islay Scotch. It's smooth and sips well. Aged for 11 months, then transferred to single-malt Scotch casks from the Highland and Islay regions for three additional months of aging.

title: Herradura Coleccion de la Casa Reserva 2013 Cognac Cask Finish Reposado Tequila
description: Fruity and bright, this soft, Cognac cask-finished Tequila evokes honey and butterscotch, with just enough jalapeño backbone to remind that this is an agave spirit. The lovely finish shows honeysuckle and a mouthwatering saline touch. Aged for 11 months, then transferred to former Cognac casks for three additional months of aging.

title: Siete Leguas Tequila Reposado
description: Delicate and balanced, this Tequila is pale straw in the glass, with hardly any color. The nose and palate seem to trade back and forth between jabs of jalapeño pepper and smoothing vanilla-honey sweetness, even into the elongated fade. Sip or mix.

title: Don Ramon Tequila Reposado
description: A warm honey aroma wafts from this smooth and gentle Tequila. Well-integrated flavors of honey and bright jalapeño pepper finish with a prickle of ginger. Recommended for cocktails or straight-up sipping.

title: Casa Noble Tequila Reposado
description: Layering sweetness and spice, this bold honey-hued spirit fills the nose and mouth with brown sugar and butterscotch. Clove, jalapeño and black pepper seem to grow more present with every sip.

title: Partida Tequila Reposado
description: Soft, light and crisp, this six-month-aged reposado is bright in the glass and offers mild honey, pear and white flower scents. It's soft and fruity on the palate, accented by ginger and white pepper. Though an easy sipper, this Tequila would elevate margaritas too.

title: Tequila Tapatio Reposado
description: Though it's light straw in the glass, with hardly any color, the flavor is robust and complex. Scented with perky black  pepper and spice, the palate echoes the pepper up front, followed by a fleeting meaty umami note midpalate and a long finish that boasts sparks of ginger and cayenne. Aged eight months.

title: Lunazul Tequila Reposado
description: Spicy and herbaceous aromas, plus a touch of coconut lead into this Tequila. The palate echoes that coconut, plus vanilla and just enough baking spice heat to provide depth and complexity.

title: IXA Organic Tequila Reposado
description: Bright gold in the glass, this organic Tequila shows rounded notes of vanilla and buttery brioche, enlivened by a gentle white-floral touch and a sprinkling of baking spices. Squeeze some organic grapefruit juice and start making all-organic palomas.

title: Pueblo Viejo Tequila Reposado
description: Opening with zesty fresh oregano and sun-dried tomato aromas, this light-straw Tequila skews a bit sweeter on the palate. Vanilla and coconut flavors tighten to a savory finish, showing dried herbs and black pepper. Aged nine months.

title: Trianon Tequila Reposado
description: Expect lots of peppery punch on the nose and palate. A gentle agave note underpins this spirit, plus mouthwateringly savory notes—fresh oregano, sun-dried tomato, jalapeño and cayenne zing. Consider as an accompaniment to cheeses.

title: Casamigos Tequila Reposado
description: Sip or mix this reposado, which is backed by actor George Clooney. Look for pleasing butterscotch and maple sugar, with just enough spice around the edges to keep things interesting. Finishes smooth, with a cinnamon tingle.

title: Maestro Dobel Tequila Reposado
description: Perhaps one of the most fruit-forward Tequilas around, this reposado is scented with strawberries and raspberries. Agave sweetness leads on the palate, bringing pepper, ginger and a last lick of butterscotch. Aged six months.

title: Riazul Tequila Reposado
description: The enchanting aroma mixes fruit, honey and jalapeño pepper. This Tequila shows lots of peppery spice but it's tempered by vanilla and white-chocolate sweetness on the long finish. Although it feels a bit hot for easy sipping, it still has finesse. Aged nine months in American and French oak barrels.

title: Tres Agaves Tequila Reposado
description: Sip on this Tequila and watch it evolve. At first, the aroma roars out of the glass with bold bell pepper and caramel, yet as it sits it morphs to delicate vanilla and fresh pear. It's a similar experience on the palate. At first the flavors fairly explode with loads of agave and pepper, then it finishes short, crisp and grassy. Aged between six and nine months in former Bourbon barrels.

title: Don Julio Tequila Reposado
description: Featuring an enticing mix of savory jalapeño and sweet vanilla, this light-gold reposado finishes particularly long, with brown sugar, vanilla and nutmeg, concluding with warming prickles of pleasant chili-pepper heat. Aged eight months.

title: Excellia Tequila Reposado
description: This golden, aromatic Tequila entices with silky notes of vanilla, coconut and dried stone fruit, winding into dill, oregano and bell pepper on the warming, rounded finish. The components are aged separately in Sauternes casks and in 20-year-old Cognac barrels, then blended. Mix or sip.

title: Roca Patron Tequila Reposado
description: This is Patron's new premium marque, named for the Spanish word for “rock” (roca), a reference to the giant volcanic-stone wheel traditionally used to crush the cooked agave. The vegetal scent evokes bell and jalapeño peppers. On the tongue, it's fleetingly sweet, with a wash of vanilla and a quite-fiery finish—it's slightly stronger than most Tequilas on the market. Aged five months in former Bourbon barrels.

title: Cruz Tequila Reposado
description: This Tequila is light in almost every way, from the pale straw hue to the gentle vanilla-pepper aroma to the mild sweetness that mixes mint, vanilla and black pepper. Yet it finishes relatively fierce and fiery; it's surprising that six months of barrel time hasn't tamed the heat and added more concentrated flavors. The triangular bottle with raised cross on the front and bottle top is an eye-catcher.

title: Campo Azul Tequila Reposado
description: Mild and easy-sipping, this Tequila has a straw color and almost neutral aroma. Yet on the palate, it comes alive with vanilla, toasty notes of cedar and chamomile, and brief pops of ginger and pepper. Aged four months.

title: Corazón Tequila Reposado
description: Warm, fresh apple aromas waft from the glass, which shows a burnished rose-gold hue. Robust and spicy on the palate, this Tequila balances pepper and agave, with a long, slightly hot finish. Mix into palomas and other cocktails.

title: Glenmorangie Nectar D'Or Scotch
description: This 12-year-old single malt was finished in casks that previously held Sauternes, the golden sweet wine of Bordeaux. Smooth and elegant, look for a honey hue and notes of vanilla and lemon cream on the palate, finishing with baking spice and a puff of smoke. Adding water unleashes more creamy vanilla and citrus.

title: Glen Grant 12 Scotch
description: This burnished gold whiskey shows apple and pear drizzled with butterscotch on the nose and palate, plus campfire smoke and gingerbread spice on the exceedingly long exit. A splash of water tames the heat and transforms the oak into vanilla and buttery brioche.

title: The Balvenie Doublewood Aged 17 Years Scotch
description: This sherry cask-finished Scotch offers creamy vanilla and crème brûlée, plus a mouthwatering citrus astringency on the midpalate and baking spice finish. Adding water pulls it all together, blending together lemon cream, almond and a gently spiced exhale.

title: Glenmorangie Extremely Rare 18 Years Old Scotch
description: Despite the rich, buttery scent this single malt sips relatively dry. Rounded pear and sherry notes lead the palate at first, drying to leather and cigar wrapper and finishing long, with lemon zest and ginger zing. Water brings out more fruit, a tinge of violet, sprinkles of brown sugar and cinnamon sweetness, and a smoky whiff on the finish. Amazing complexity.

title: Laphroaig Lore Scotch
description: This Islay single malt is all about the peat. Golden in the glass, the distinctly smoky scent hints at vanilla and honey underneath. Expect a big billow of smoke from the first sip, underpinned by subtle hints of honey, vanilla and sherry sweetness. The concentrated peat smoke leads right into the drying finish, plus hints of black pepper, iodine and spearmint astringency.

title: Glendronach 12 Year Scotch
description: Aged in former American whiskey casks, then finished in barrels that previously held PX and oloroso sherries, this single malt balances sweetness, spice and oak. Caramel and vanilla aromas are echoed on the velvety palate, plus cocoa and espresso, finishing with clove, cinnamon and a hint of lemon peel.

title: Bowmore 18 Years Old Scotch
description: Complex and contemplative. The enticing scent mixes iodine, sea breeze and salted caramel, while the light, soft palate shows smoke, cocoa and dried fig notes, drying to clove and black pepper sparks. Water softens the overall impression to mocha and spice, with a mild blanket of campfire smoke on the exit.

title: The Balvenie Portwood Aged 21 Years Scotch
description: A port cask finish gives this Scotch a copper penny hue. The aroma suggests baked apple, while the palate has a chewy, concentrated vanilla-oak profile, leading to walnut, leather and espresso. The rounded finish sings with sherry and spice. Adding water coaxes out baked apple sweetness and dials back the oak.

title: The Classic Cask Ben Nevis 17 Scotch
description: The bright aroma suggests vanilla, white flowers and fresh-cut pear. Starting out juicy, the smoky midpalate is a bit of a surprise, winding into a long vanilla finish accented by clove. Adding water integrates the spice notes and pushes back the smoke to more subtle levels, allowing the fresh pear note to shine through. Single cask; 312 bottles.

title: Benromach 15 Years Old Scotch
description: This amber-hued whisky offers caramel, oak and a hint of black cherry on the nose and mouth. The drying palate leads with black cherry and creamy honey, finishing taut, with leather, cigar wrapper, dark chocolate and clove heat.

title: Glencadam Aged 10 Years Scotch
description: Golden in the glass, this Highlands single malt opens with a bright fresh-apple scent. The brisk palate shows plenty of fruit and spice, wrapped up with cayenne fireworks. Dilution mellows the heat, bringing fruit, vanilla and spice into harmonious balance.

title: Glenmorangie The Quinta Ruban Scotch
description: The port cask finish on this 12-year-old Scotch brings a tawny rose-gold tinge and a juicy hint of red fruit to the rich caramel and baked apple aroma. The palate is shows cayenne spice on the first sip, sliding into a caramel finish. Adding water snaps this Scotch into focus, integrating vanilla and spice, with an espresso midpalate and a long, mouthwatering dulce de leche fade.

title: Shieldaig 14 Years Old Scotch
description: A pleasing mix of smoke and oak marks this Islay single malt. The briny, subtly smoky aroma suggests seaweed. The palate is relatively dry, mixing a vanilla core with a dusty hint of cocoa and smoky overlay. Adding water softens the texture and brings out more vanilla and spice, plus bracing citrus and pine on the finish. Sips well.

title: BenRiach Curiositas 20 Year Scotch
description: This comforting dram has an almost chocolaty scent, mixed with vanilla and a fresh white floral note. The palate shows oaky sweetness, vanilla and fudge, finishing with orange and black pepper spice. Adding water nudges forward floral and fresh apple notes and pulls back on the chocolatiness.

title: The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Scotch
description: Look for a rich butterscotch scent and a hint of fresh apricot. On the palate, this Sherry-matured single malt layers on concentrated caramel, butterscotch and custard, finishing long and spiced on a hint of orange peel.

title: Benriach Curiositas 10 Year Peated Malt Scotch
description: Golden in the glass, this bracing Speyside single malt opens with peat smoke and vanilla on the nose and palate. The smoke doesn't overwhelm; peat and iodine mingle with hints of dark chocolate, clove, black pepper and spearmint, plus a mouthwatering saline hint and slightly astringent finish.

title: Laphroaig Aged 10 Years Scotch
description: Look for a distinctly peaty aroma, with hints of smoked fish, bacon and mesquite. The palate shows peat smoke from the first sip plus an undercurrent of honey, finishing with black pepper heat. Water brings out a spearmint note and a touch more vanilla.

title: Glen Grant 18 Year Old Rare Edition Scotch
description: The aroma entices with vanilla, fresh fruit and waxy honey. Meanwhile, palate surprises with spice and light smoke, as mouthwatering waves of cayenne, jalapeño, mesquite and black pepper give way to soothing vanilla and honey. Dilution makes this dram more easy sipping and plays up the vanilla, but doesn't change the peppery profile overall.

title: The Macallan Double Cask 12 Scotch
description: Sip or mix this single malt, aged in American and European ex-sherry barrels. Mellow honey and smooth, nutty flavors taper off into a long fade that shows vanilla, citrus, sweet spices and a hint of cocoa.

title: Jura 10 Scotch
description: The distillery's newest bottling is rich and slightly smoky. Time in former Bourbon and oloroso Sherry barrels means that lip-smacking hazelnut, brown sugar and cocoa take center stage, finishing with dry hints of leather, chamomile and clove.

title: Glenfiddich Small Batch Reserve Aged 18 Years Scotch
description: Aged for 18 years in former oloroso sherry and bourbon casks, the mild aroma has a distinct, sherry-like dried apricot note. The palate is relatively dry, with hints of cocoa, leather, stone fruit and clove. Adding water coaxes out more vanilla sweetness and hints of citrus, exiting dry and spiced.

title: Auchentoshan 12 Years Old Scotch
description: A bourbon-lover's Scotch, look for plenty of vanilla and oak from first sip straight through the finish, plus echoes of cinnamon and dried apricot. Adding dilution brings out mellow mocha and hazelnut, overall suggesting chocolate chip cookie dough. Aged in oloroso sherry and bourbon casks.

title: Benromach 10 Years Old Scotch
description: This copper-hued whiskey offers concentrated caramel, pecan pie and oak aromas. The palate is oaky and drying, not as luscious as the aroma suggests, showing vanilla and spice, plus hints of baked apple and cocoa. Adding water brings out more nutty flavor and a whiff of smoke.

title: Highland Park Valkyrie Scotch
description: Earthy and herbaceous, look for hints of honeysuckle, chamomile and ginger, finishing relatively dry. Adding water coaxes out a bit more honey-like sweetness.

title: The Classic Cask Benrinnes 19 Scotch
description: This 19-year-old single malt, produced at Benrinnes Distillery, is bright gold in the glass and offers aromas of fresh apple and vanilla. The palate is big and bracing, with lots of buttery vanilla and oak, finishing fiery and drying with cinnamon and clove. Dilution coaxes out a bit of vanilla sweetness and a chewy hints of cocoa and cigar wrapper. Single cask; 282 bottles.

title: Glenfiddich Experimental Series #01 Single Malt Scotch Whisky Finished in India Pale Ale Casks
description: Sippable and smooth, this IPA-finished Scotch is bright and bursting with fruit. The first sips bring apples and hints of tropical fruit, which lead into a zingy grapefruit peel finish laced with warming vanilla and nutmeg.

title: The Classic Cask Bunnahabhain 18 Scotch
description: This is an 18-year-old single malt produced at Bunnahabhain Distillery. Look for a golden hue and aromas of peat and brine underpinned by vanilla. Powerful from the first sip, waves of peat, iodine and oceanic brininess pull back just before the point of becoming overwhelming, and finishes with a welcome brush of vanilla. Dilution tames the smoke a bit and pulls out hints of menthol, spearmint and black pepper. Single cask; 162 bottles.

title: Ardbeg Kelpie Scotch
description: This golden dram has a distinctly savory scent: Sea breeze, seaweed and bell pepper. The palate shows fleeting tropical fruit sweetness, then a gentle waft of peat smoke, with subtle vanilla and oak notes in the drying finish. Subsequent sips layer the smoke more thickly on top of the fruit and vanilla undertone, plus a black pepper prickle on the finish. Stands up well to a lot of dilution.

title: Glenmorangie Grand Vintage Malt 1990 Scotch
description: Made in 1990 from a particularly challenging-to-distill barley crop, this honey-hued spirit takes a while to open up; aromas morph from grainy to hinting at tropical fruit freshness. The palate leads on citrus astringency, fading to honey, vanilla and an oaky core, finishing with baking spice. Water softens the oak to a vanilla custard note. This bottling is the first release from the Bond House No. 1 Collection of vintage expressions created for collectors.

title: Glen Scotia Aged 15 Years Scotch
description: This Campbeltown single malt has a topaz hue and crème brûlée scent. The palate is mildly smoky and drying, showing espresso, vanilla, leather and cigar wrapper, plus a baking spice finish. Water pulls out a fudgy undertone, overall it's still relatively oaky and dry.

title: Stolichnaya Chocolat Razberi
description: The photo on the frosted-glass bottle is drool-inducing: a raspberry dripping with chocolate. On the palate, luscious notes of raspberry and cocoa linger, and the dessert-like aroma beckons from a half-foot away. Mix it with pomegranate juice and lemon, served in a martini glass.

title: Wave Chocolate Covered Pretzel Vodka
description: This is an unusual and compelling entrant to the   flavored-vodka market. Riding the salty-sweet dessert trend (think salted caramel), this spirit has warm, rich, hazelnut-like aromas and flavors, with an intriguing umami note. It's surprisingly rich and velvety for a vodka.

title: Bimber Vodka
description: Nicely balanced and neutral, this winter wheat-based vodka is light and soft on the palate, with just a touch of vanilla sweetness. A top choice for citrusy cocktails.

title: Boyd & Blair Potato Vodka
description: This potato-based vodka from a small-scale Pennsylvania producer provides a versatile canvas for a wide array of drinks. With its lightly fruity aromas and flavors and a clean finish, it's also lovely neat.

title: Van Gogh Double Espresso Vodka
description: Made with Colombian coffee beans, this vodka bears a strong resemblance to cold-brewed coffee. It has a translucent dark-brown color, espresso- and fudge-like aromas, and a good espresso flavor, with an appropriately bitter edge and a faintly minty finish. This would be excellent in espresso-tinis and similar coffee cocktails.

title: Van Gogh Dutch Chocolate Vodka
description: An infusion of cocoa beans provides a faint brownish tinge to this otherwise nearly clear spirit. It's sweet on the palate, with lingering fudge-like and milk-caramel notes.

title: Clear10 Vodka
description: This vodka has a nice citrusy zing and a clean finish, bearing a neutral scent with a hint of citrus. The bottle is eye-catching, with a wavy, tactile shape.

title: Shpilka
description: Distilled from Russian wheat, this has a lightly fruity scent and a sweet flavor, with a silky feel and a marshmallow-like finish. The word “shpilka” is the Russian word for “stiletto heel,” and it's clear that the target demographic is women. The product is packaged in a lean, frosted bottle with a graphic of a woman in a sexy red dress.

title: Alchemia Chocolate Infused Vodka
description: From the makers of an outstanding wild-cherry-flavored vodka comes this chocolate offering, in the same striking, tall, pyramid-shaped bottle. Made with Polish cocoa, the vodka is a light translucent amber, with a bold hazelnut and cocoa aroma. Though it has a rich chocolate flavor that carries through to a complex finish of nuts and cigar tobacco, it is fairly hot. Serve over ice.

title: Mile High Vodka
description: Made using “ice-cold spring waters” and Midwestern-grown grains, this vodka has a sweet, milky scent and a sweet flavor, with a crisp finish. Light in feel, this is overall clean and neutral.

title: Ocean Vodka
description: Attention ecoconscious tipplers: This product is certified organic, made with organic cane sugar and desalinated ocean water sourced from 3,000 feet below the big island of Hawaii. A portion of the proceeds from this product benefit organizations that work to conserve ocean resources. With its sweet, lightly vanilla aroma and flavor and island provenance, consider this vodka for sunny tropical drinks.

title: VuQo
description: Technically, this fiery coconut-nectar distillate is considered lambanog in its native Philippines rather than “premium vodka,” as the label states, but that's splitting hairs. Look for a sugary aroma and a coconutty flavor, with a vanilla note on the finish. It has an almost effervescent feel, becoming drying on the finish.

title: Twenty 2 Micro Distilled Vodka
description: This spirit is microdistilled in 50-gallon batches in northern Maine, yielding a neutral product with a bit of marshmallow sweetness. It feels a bit hot, but should do well when mixed.

title: Van Gogh Rich Dark Chocolate Vodka
description: Infused with semisweet chocolate, this translucent dark-brown vodka has rich, pleasing chocolate and espresso tones. A distinct sweet, waxy note is reminiscent of scented candles.

title: Pure Iceberg Ice Infusion Chocolate Mint Flavored Vodka
description: New to the market in fall 2012, this crystal-clear vodka is recommended for its bright aromatics, which are similar to peppermint patties or crème de menthe. On the palate, mint is the overwhelmingly dominant flavor. This line of vodka is made with water harvested from icebergs that float down the eastern coast of Canada in early summer.

title: Vodka by Battistella
description: Made from a Seyval Blanc wine base, this vodka has a sweet, fruity, warm quality, with a resiny note. Only limited quantities made.

title: Soplica Vodka
description: This is slightly sweet and neutral, with a faint citrus note on the finish.

title: Voli Espresso Vanilla Fusion
description: Made in Cognac, France, this spirit has 80 calories pre serving compared to the 100 that most vodkas have. The aromatics lean toward the waxy side. It's mildly flavored, with more vanilla than espresso on the palate, and a floral note that seems out of place.

title: Dancing Pines Chai
description: Tea is one of the hottest flavors in the mixology world now, and bartenders are going to fall in love with this complex, chai-inspired liqueur. Black-tea flavors meld with a vivid, spicy palette of orange peel, cinnamon and clove, with just a hint of sweetness and a mildly spicy finish.

title: Killepitsch
description: The special-edition bottle is modern and trippy, purple with pink lettering and a cartoony Keith Haring-esque design. But the recipe for this traditional herbal liqueur dates back to the mid 1800s—“a taste of old Dusseldorf.” Old or new, it's complex and delicious, with a Cognac-like dried-fruit and spice base—raisins, dates, cherries, figs, cinnamon, sarsaparilla and black pepper all can be detected. Would make a dynamite digestif, especially paired with a fruity dessert.

title: Briottet Crème de Mure
description: This light and nuanced blackberry liqueur is ideal for adding color and flavor to cocktails. Garnet in hue, with a berry-like aroma and flavor with a gentle clove note—this finishes well balanced between tart and sweet.

title: The Bitter Truth Apricot Liqueur
description: Among the best of the fruit liqueurs, this delicious spirit is sippable straight up, and would be a lovely accompaniment to shortbread or other desserts. Rich scents of apples and stone fruits abound, with a faint spicy aroma reminiscent of Cognac. Coats the palate with true apricot flavor and a hint of baking spices.

title: Nardini Amaro
description: Mixologists will love this deep brown amaro for adding complex, sophisticated flavors to cocktails. Bold, warm dark-chocolate notes meld with a minty, herbal, palate-cleansing finish, and a surprisingly but mellow sweetness tempers the forward bitter notes. Lovely and light bodied.

title: Hum Botanical Spirit
description: Developed by Chicago bartender Adam Seger, this rum-based liqueur has had a speedy ascent in the past couple of years as a must-have for mixologists. The deep garnet hue is derived from macerated hibiscus. Although it has a warm, earthy floral-fruity base, the spice notes—ginger, cardamom, kaffir lime—get a little wild and take center stage.
