It can stand alone, but this liqueur is at its best mixed into cocktails.

title: Patrón XO Café Dark Cocoa
description: This addictive newcomer from Tequila maker Patron combines coffee, chocolate and silver Tequila. It looks and smells like a dead ringer for your morning espresso. But on the palate, sweet, almost nutty agave notes emerge, fading into a creamy, caramel milk-chocolate profile, with just a dusting of espresso on the finish. This liqueur lends itself to mixing with coffee or crafting espresso martini cocktails, yet it's polished enough to sip straight up over ice.

title: Merlet Crème de Fraise des Bois
description: Dessert-like and syrupy, this berry liqueur should be considered for pouring over ice cream or using it to glaze berries for a tart. Of course, with its deep cherry color and luscious strawberry-jam scent and bright flavor, it's a pleasing spirit for sipping, too.

title: Senior Curaçao
description: This clear and bright orange liqueur features a perky candied-orange flavor and aroma, with brisk lemon peel on the finish. Light, clean and appealing for a broad range of cocktails.

title: Chocolat Royal Liqueur by Marie Brizard
description: From Bordeaux, this velvety-smooth chocolate liqueur is new to U.S. markets. It resembles dark-chocolate syrup in appearance, aroma, flavor and mouthfeel, and would be lovely in espresso-based cocktails or poured over ice cream.

title: Dancing Pines Cherry Tart
description: Made with tart cherries and no artificial flavorings or colorings, this ruddy spirit blends tart and sweet cherry and cranberry flavors, and would be particularly outstanding mixed with Champagne or gin. The only missed step is that it's not particularly aromatic—otherwise, this spirit would have scored even higher.

title: Mathilde Poire
description: Balanced, light and delicate, this pale gold pear liqueur has a fresh, crisp aroma, melding fruit and white flowers. The fruit flavors are bolder on the palate, sweet but not overly so. While light enough to sip straight, this is also an appealing way to add fruity notes to cocktails made with white rum or gin, or mix it with sparkling wine.

title: Neisson Rhum Agricole Réserve Spéciale
description: The nose offers scents of white pepper, citrus, and saddle leather; old oak, sautéed almonds, candied walnuts, old library, and distant oloroso Sherry. The palate entry is rich, nutty and oaky; the midpalate bursts with woody, sherried, honeyed, vanilla extract flavors. Finishes opulent, honeyed, and elegant. Fantastic.

title: Vermont Gold 100% Maple Sap Vodka
description: The palate entry is toasty, maple sweet, and full-bodied; at midpalate the toastiness evolves to include delicious tastes of sugar maple candy, dark honey, sap, resin, and malt. Finishes divinely sweet and sap-like. Worth every cent.

title: The Dalmore Cigar Malt Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: A lusciously smoky and tobacco-like initial aroma; after aeration the bouquet features semisweet to sweet notes of honey, pipe tobacco, Sherry, honey, and dark chocolate. The palate entry is smooth and caramel sweet; at midpalate the smokiness comes alive with additional tastes of sweet butter, toffee and honey. Finishes in a rush of smoke, charcoal and ash. A malt whisky gem and an incredible bargain. Best Buy.

title: Sam Adams Utopias 2005 Ale Brewed with Maple Syrup
description: No effervescence. Smells of vanilla, saddle leather, baked banana, baked apple, baked pear, oloroso Sherry, and at times brandy; a unique bouquet. Palate shows traces of caramel, nougat, candied nuts, marzipan, dried red fruits, palm oil and cocoa. Ends smooth and harmonious.

title: Cointreau Liqueur
description: A sophisticated orange pulp bouquet which after aeration turns much more dry peel-like. The palate entry is intensely orange peel-like yet more sweet than bittersweet; the midpalate stage is deeply orangey, sweet and sublimely juicy. Finishes ideally citrusy/tart/astringent, then turns lithe and sweet. The benchmark for all orange flavored liqueurs/triple secs. State of the art.

title: Cragganmore Rare Edition 10-Year-Old Sherry Cask Natural Cask Strength Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: Only 2,100 bottles for the U.S. Aromas of grapes, toffee, Sherry cask, ripe tropical fruit, meringue, egg whites and cocoa butter. Palate entry focuses on the honey/sherry tag-team while the midpalate displays sublime butter cream, dark caramel and peanut butter tastes that thrill the taste buds. Ends up maple-like, with a backnote of white chocolate. The finest Cragganmore I've ever tasted.

title: Chabot Armagnac Vintage 1944
description: Initial sniffings discover earthy/woodsy scents of maple syrup, pine nuts and forest floor; aeration reveals traces of hard cheese (rancio), oak resin, butter, grapes and sautéed almonds. Palate entry is rich, sweet and caramel-like; at midpalate the sweetness narrows, allowing bittersweet cocoa, oloroso Sherry, grapes and dark caramel to enter the mix. Finishes cocoa-like and plummy.

title: A. Hardy Noces de Diamant 60 Year Old Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Topaz color. Opening bouquet is compelling as biscuity, spicy, botanical waves of black pepper, milk chocolate and oaky vanilla vie for dominance; bouquet turns fruity, ripe, mildly spirity and leathery later on. Palate entry is firmly structured, candied, grapy and appropriately woody-resiny; midpalate is rich, grapy, honeyed, marzipan-like and nougaty. Aftertaste is ripely sweet. Loved it from start to finish.

title: Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve 15-Year-Old Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Initial sniffings find aromas of sweet corn dripping with butter, dark toffee and hazelnuts; later inhalations pick up notes of chocolate cake frosting, cocoa beans and vanilla. Palate entry is spicy, prickly and raisiny; at midpalate the taste features lead pencil, slate, black pepper, sautéed butter and deep-seared oak. Finishes ash-like, chewy and oily. American whiskey doesn't come any finer.

title: Macallan Fine Oak 15-Year-Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: An initial bouquet of the dried yellow fruit found in muesli; later on, added scents of unsweetened coconut, honey, and light toffee beautifully complement the dried fruit aroma. The palate entry is chewy and honeyed; at midpalate the dried fruit, clover, and honey flavors meld delightfully with the oily, creamy texture. Concludes sensuously and regally. Best Buy.

title: Scott's Selection Highland Park 1985 Orkney Islands Single Malt Whisky
description: The first inhalations find peat reek, seaweed, sawdust and malt; aeration adds scents of almond butter, smoked salmon, damp moss and green tea. The surprising palate entry is long, honey sweet, biscuity and moderately oily; at midpalate the taste profile further develops to include sea breeze, cigar tobacco, kippers and Sherry. Ends delicately Sherried, creamy and sublime.

title: Flor de Caña Centenario 21 Year Old Limited Edition Rum
description: Initial sniffings pick up rich aromas of oaky vanilla, cigar ash, cocoa butter and oil. Palate entry is opulent, viscous, caramel-like and moderately sweet; the midpalate features toasty, tobacco-like tastes that are complemented by the thick, chewy texture. Aftertaste is long and riveting.

title: Zuidam Dry Gin
description: Wonderful beginning aroma of dried citrus zest/rind; following aeration the bouquet turns steely, spicy and earthy. The palate entry is tart, sublimely orangey and borderline sour; at midpalate the angelica, juniper and cardamom take charge, mingling perfectly with the orange rind. Ends silkily with flashes of orange zest and juniper. First class.

title: Baron de Lustrac 1970 Domaine de Courros 100% Folle Blanche Bas Armagnac
description: Zesty scents of pine needle, paraffin, raisins and ripe grapes. Palate entry is lush, bittersweet and caramel-like; at midpalate, the flavor goes decadently chewy, with tastes of vanilla extract, sweet old oak, marzipan, honey and dark toffee. Aftertaste is long, luxuriously sweet and thick.

title: Glenmorangie 1981 Sauternes Wood Finish Single Malt Scotch Whisky/Northern Highlands
description: Spent its last 2 1/2 years of maturation in Château d'Yquem barrels. Striking harvest/honey gold color. Ambrosial and earthy scents of banana cream, pistachio, almond and maple take the olfactory sense to higher planes of pleasure; another eight minutes sees the fruit component go wild, offering rich aromas of baked pear, baked apple, maple syrup and English toffee. Palate entry is divinely rich, thick yet keenly balanced because of the acid presence; midpalate flavors include honey, vanilla extract, banana cream, egg cream and coconut. Finishes warm, fruity and grand.

title: Château de Laubade 1941 Bas Armagnac
description: Semisweet aroma leaps forward emitting toasty, almost smoky fragrances of campfire, charcoal, pipe tobacco, blue cheese and rancio. Taste is elegant, refined and supple, showing mature tastes of oak, marshmallow, honey, oloroso Sherry, black tea and coffee. A seamless six decade-old jewel.

title: Black Maple Hill 21 Year Old Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey Cask #7
description: Brands, San Carlos, CA); 47.5% abv, $108. The early aroma highlights touches of caramel, oak barrel char and palm oil; further aeration yields a whopper of a mature, buttery bourbon bouquet. Palate entry shows incredible firmness, oil/cream and grain/wood presence; at midpalate the taste shifts into overdrive as sweet, sap-like flavors of caramel corn, maple sugar and roasted grain converge to make a sensational taste experience. Finishes sweet, intense and caramel-like. Superb.

title: Glenmorangie Tain L'Hermitage Wood Finish Northern Highlands Single Malt Wh
description: Limited availability. The nosing passes find aromas of hard wood and worn leather with succulent notes of oak resin, nut loaf, light toffee and citrus. The palate entry is focused, winey and lusciously sweet; midpalate adds bittersweet flavors of caramel, nougat, candy bar and sap. Concludes elegantly, sweet, integrated and tight.

title: Booker's 7-Year, 11-Month Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey Batch No. B96-L
description: A first-rate, multilayered bouquet that includes notes of cocoa, cigar tobacco and paraffin with aromas of caramel corn, cotton candy, oak and tapioca. The palate entry features tastes of spice, buttered corn, bacon fat and cream; the midpalate displays traces of butterscotch, nougat, sap, maple and vanilla. Finishes spirity and biscuity. Add water to reduce the alcohol.

title: Dogfish Head Indian Brown Ale
description: Baked, roasted, concentrated and caramel-like, with later notes of toasted barley mixed in with honey, winter holiday spices and high-content cocoa. Midpalate is a feast of molasses, honey, vanilla extract, caramel corn and toasted marshmallow. Concludes smooth, satiny, rich and elegant.

title: Dogfish Head 60 Minute IPA
description: Smells enticingly of rose petals, tangerine, orange zest, grass and nutmeg; later on, the tangerine-orange combo takes charge. The palate entry is squeaky clean, hoppy and tart; the midpalate is long, deep, and engagingly cereal-like. Finishes harmoniously, with a trace of pine or cedar.

title: Milagro Select Barrel Reserve Reposado 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1420-CRT
description: Initial aroma of wax paper and black pepper; aeration stimulates scents of asparagus, broccoli, new leather and herbal butter. The palate entry is spicy and semisweet; the midpalate adds subtle tastes of butter, steamed green vegetables, white rice and light toffee. Finishes satiny smooth and appealingly spicy. A tour de force in balance and harmony.

title: Marquis de Montesquiou 1965 Bas Armagnac
description: The aroma includes toasty notes of burnt match, broiled meat, roasted nuts with scents of old leather/cowhide, bacon, and sautéed butter. The palate entry has tastes of candied apple, caramel, and honey; at midpalate the taste expands to include mead, honey, mince pie, and molasses. Finishes up salty, oaky with a touch of mushroomy, intensely honeyed rancio. About as good as vintage Armagnac gets.

title: Springbank 32-Year-Old Campbeltown Single Malt Whisky
description: Sweet oak, sawdust, linseed oil aromas upfront; following further aeration resiny/oaky, leathery/cowhide-like aromas mesh perfectly. The palate entry is balanced, semisweet, lean and outdoorsy; at midpalate the flavor profile suggests tastes of pork sausage, bacon fat, almond oil, suet and malted barley. Finishes clean, balanced and a touch warm on the tongue.

title: A. Hardy Perfection Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Blended in part from prephylloxera (pre-1870s) Cognacs. Very deep amber color. Initial nosings detect stately aromas, including tea leaves, cigar tobacco and delicate touches of oaky rancio; aeration releases leathery and spicy notes. Palate entry is nougaty sweet, luscious, honeyed and deep; by midpalate the flavor phase reaches a zenith, offering richly sweet tastes of rancio, sap, honey, brown sugar, sugar biscuits and cocoa. Finishes voluptuously honeyed, almost like Pedro Ximenez Sherry. If this Cognac were art, it would be a Rembrandt.

title: Laberdolive 1942 Jaurrey Bas Armagnac
description: Scintillating nose is peppery and has a backnote of caraway seed; bouquet opens up adding notes of rye bread, oak, lard and pear drop candy. Palate entry is unbelievably rich, bittersweet to sweet, concentrated; rancio washes over the taste buds in flavors of bacon fat, almond butter, vanilla extract and palm oil. Finish is honeyed, dried fruit-like and warming. A true Armagnac masterpiece from the World War II era

title: Charbay Vodka
description: Opening nosing passes detect subtle toasty, charcoal aromas. Entry is off-dry to sweet and properly oily; sweet graininess  dominates the midpalate. Aftertaste is long, bittersweet and delectably oily. Fashioned more in the plump, sweet style of Holland than eastern Europe (thick, hearty) or Scandinavia (light, flowery).

title: ZYR Russian Vodka
description: A combination of wheat and rye grains. Firm, assertive aromas of grain mash, wheat biscuit and distant dried herbs enchant; aeration adds wet slate, minerals and seedless rye bread. Palate entry reflects the spirit's Russian heritage as the dry to off-dry taste of grain mash blankets the tongue in richly textured waves; potent but silky flavors of concentrated grain, breakfast cereal and black peppercorn impress at midpalate. Aftertaste is herbal and mildly sweet.

title: Bowmore 25 Year Old Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: A new recipe, one that employs a higher proportion of Sherry-influenced whisky. Initial sniffings are briny, salty and cotton candy sweet; aeration adds scents of pastry, baked pear and butterscotch. Palate entry is rich, almost jammy and peppered with salty/winey flavors; midpalate explodes with deep tastes of maple, honey, brown sugar and toffee. Finish is long, nicely balanced between the sea salt and the sherry, and succulent

title: Douce Provence Poire Williams & Cognac French Liqueur
description: Pale flaxen color. Opening whiffs pick up lightly spiced fragrances of pears and white raisins; together, the pear and cognac provide an elegant, delicate bouquet that's soft, fruity and understated. Palate entry is tart immediately, then quickly turns semisweet as the pear influence overtakes the brandy component. Aftertaste is semisweet, ripe, fruity and intensely pear-like. A world-class liqueur, period.

title: The Old Liquor Store Green Tea Liqueur
description: No doubt, this is a tea liqueur. The amber color evokes weak black tea. The aroma is reminiscent of herbal tea with notes of chamomile and mint. The flavor is similar to sweetened chai, thanks to the allspice and cinnamon finish. It's enough to warrant serving this liqueur in China teacups.

title: Pagès Parfait Amour Crème de Violette
description: The vivid violet color telegraphs the aroma: floral and sweet, like violet pastilles, with a long finish. The violet flavor is clear and true, although it veers dangerously close to soapy.

title: Merlet Crème de Cassis
description: Save this plush black-currant liqueur for adding bold flavor and color to Kir royales—it's almost too thick for straight-up sipping. This deep plum-colored liquid is so viscous, it clings to the sides of the glass, and feels alarmingly like swallowing liquefied jam. Yet, it's a remarkably true expression of fruit: earthy, round and balanced between sweet and tart flavors. Add to gin for a bramble cocktail.

title: Merlet Triple Citrus
description: London-based mixologist Tony Conigliaro collaborated on this 100%-natural orange liqueur, made from blood orange, bitter orange and lemon. It's certainly versatile, and would complement a wide range of cocktails, from margaritas to sidecars. The clear spirit has a sweet orange-peel and lightly floral aroma, and a pure, clean orange flavor, with just a bit of warmth on the finish to balance out the sweetness.

title: Dancing Pines Brûlée Caramel
description: A very pure expression of caramel, this spirit has a dark honey color, mild caramel aroma, and creamy, sticky-toffee flavor. It coats the palate like drinking liquid milky caramel. Mix with Bourbon and other whiskies. It's made with caramelized sugar cane, no other added flavorings.

title: Mathilde Framboise
description: A little of this concentrated, intensely fruity liqueur will go a long way. Almost Port-like or jam-like, this syrupy spirit has a deep garnet hue and a dark berry flavor, making it a fine choice for sweetening a dessert or cocktail. Even with a significant amount of dilution, the fruit continues to ring out.

title: Dancing Pines Black Walnut
description: Complex and piquant, this flavored Bourbon liqueur reads like an amaro. The dark brown liquid has a spicy, herbaceous aroma and flavor, with sophisticated black pepper, ginger and cinnamon accents, and a touch of nutty espresso richness. It doesn't really resemble walnut, but that doesn't really matter. Whatever it is, it's delectable.

title: Santoni Limoncello
description: This vibrant yellow spirit has a strong lemon aroma and a sweet, big citrus flavor that finishes with a pleasing, cleansing pine note. It has a viscous feel.

title: Mathilde Peche
description: This pale-gold peach liqueur has a bright, sweet apple-peach scent and flavor, finishing with a breeze of white blossom. Medium bodied, fresh and sippable, this would be especially nice in a Bellini.

title: Luxardo Apricot
description: Delectable apricot flavor drizzled with sticky Sauternes and a dry finish with baking spice and black tea make this a pleasing choice for a dessert pairing. Sadly, this dark amber liqueur has barely any aroma to match the complex flavors, otherwise it would have scored higher.

title: Southern Comfort Lime
description: This amber liqueur features a fresh lime scent with a hint of vanilla and acidic lime flavor on the palate, finishing bright and clean. The tart, mouthwatering citrus flavor is clearly meant for mixing with cola or ginger ale.

title: Helbing Kummel
description: Despite the tall, square-shouldered green glass bottle, the spirit inside is clear and bright. Look for a light sweetness and pronounced anise and caraway flavors. Induces cravings for a slice of fresh rye bread. Best chilled.

title: The Bitter Truth Pimento Dram
description: This ruddy liqueur has a pronounced clove and allspice fragrance, and a sweet flavor with lots of peppy baking spice on the finish. Drying, tannic feel. Use for tiki drinks and other cocktails when spice is desired.

title: Bellini Limoncello
description: Despite its thin, cloudy appearance and light citrus scent, this limoncello delivers surprisingly big lemon sweetness and zingy notes of ginger and lemongrass.

title: Dancing Pines Espresso
description: This small-batch liqueur is like drinking iced coffee mixed with lots of sugar. Cloudy nut-brown appearance (“Contains real coffee beans. Separation occurs naturally,” the label warns), espresso-like aroma, and sweetness on the palate lead into a light coffee flavor.

title: Goldwasser
description: Made since the 1500s, the trademark of this cinnamon-flavored schnapps is the flakes of 22-karat gold suspended in the clear liquid. The flavor is very sweet, with a candied Red-Hots flavor. It doesn't even feel like 40 proof. No wonder it's so popular as a shooter: it goes down easy, leaving a warm cinnamon glow down the gullet.

title: The King's Ginger
description: “Specifically formulated by Berry Bros. in 1903 for King Edward VII,” this golden elixir has a citrusy aroma and a honey note that zings into a big gingery finish. A versatile cocktail mixer.

title: Bottega Gianduia
description: The innocent-looking light brown hue evokes chocolate milk. But the aroma warns of decadence, with a luscious candy-bar aroma, nuts and rich milk chocolate. In the mouth, it melts into a thick and velvety feel, with a boozy, milky finish. It's like sipping liquified chocolate laced with hazelnut liqueur.

title: Pisa Liqueur
description: The marzipan aroma is huge, wafting off the glass when it is still an arm's length away. The big, sticky-sweet almond and hazelnut flavor is overwhelming at first, but pulls back quickly, leaving just a delicate whisper of nuts and orange on the finish. Beyond the glass, this would be a great addition to baked goods or spooned over fruit or ice cream.

title: Pagès Maurin
description: Perhaps you've seen the dark bottle with the green devil, and wondered what on earth was inside. Answer: It's a fortified sweet white wine spiked with cherries and quinine. All this makes for an enticing apéritif with a cherry-red hue. The flavors are subtle and earthy, alternating between sweet and tart, with a modest—some might say angelic—alcohol level.

title: PAMA Pomegranate Liqueur
description: Made with pomegranate juice, vodka and Tequila, this light-bodied, translucent ruby liqueur is bracingly tart, and reads closer to cranberry than pomegranate juice. This will stand up well to dilution, making it a good pick for cocktail mixing.

title: Barenjager Honey Liqueur
description: Though an old-school German recipe, this thick honey-herbal liqueur is finding increasing use in the mixology world lately, often mixed with tea and dark spirits like Bourbon or brandy. True honey flavor, creamy feel. Cute beehive motif to the bottle and bottle cap.

title: Merlet Crème de Framboise
description: This 100% natural liqueur has a fruity, earthy, deeply concentrated dark-berry aroma and dark purple color that's nearly opaque. On the palate, the flavors evoke blackberry compote and plums, and the spirit has a syrupy feel.

title: Midori
description: You may be surprised to learn this liqueur is made in Mexico—not Japan. Still, most will recognize that textured bottle with the bright neon-green liquid inside. The fragrance is enticing, scented with honeydew, white flowers and fresh green apple. The flavor is sweet, big and melony, with a clean, lightly floral finish. Light bodied, perky and bright, this is meant for mixing.

title: TY KU Citrus Liqueur
description: First, you'll notice the tall, pyramid-like bottle filled with pale jade liquid. Second, when lifting the bottle, you'll notice it lights up. Third, pour and you'll notice the fresh, soft melon scent. The flavor reads tart at first, fading into a juicy, sweet finish, with a touch of mouthwatering acidity. Light bodied and mixable, this is made with soju, as well as yuzu, honeydew and green tea.

title: Stroh Jagertee Liqueur
description: This muscular, somewhat medicinal amber liqueur is made from overproof rum mixed with black tea, herbs and spices. The warming orange-peel, ginger, vanilla, and allspice flavors would work well as a digestif, or rounding out a punch.

title: Bottega Sambuca
description: Made from the essential oils from star-anise seeds, this clear and bright digestif smells and tastes like Good & Plenty licorice candies. Viscous and tongue coating. Stir into coffee or sip straight up, well chilled.

title: Mathilde Cassis
description: Dark purple, nearly opaque, with a wine-like scent. Warm and rich, this black currant spirit coats the tongue and palate with big, grape-berry flavors. It's best lightened with bubbly, as in a Kir royale.

title: Merlet Crème de Poire
description: This 100%-natural pear liqueur has a light, ripe pear scent and a sweet, syrupy flavor that evokes apple, pear and tropical fruit.

title: Southern Comfort Bold Black Cherry
description: A new entry to the SoCo line, explicitly intended for mixing with cola. Despite the pronounced candy-like aroma—like a cherry Charms lollipop—the flavor is not as sweet or cherry-like as expected. Instead, it's a burst of oak and alcohol on the palate, which moderates when mixed.

title: Chivas Regal 12
description: Light, mellow and mildly spiced, this 12-year-old blended Scotch offers rich vanilla, honey and crème brûlée notes, finishing long with citrus and spice. Feels soft and easy to enjoy.

title: The Irishman Founder's Reserve Small Batch Irish Whiskey
description: Light and easy-drinking, this blended Irish whiskey features aromas of apples, pears and fresh-cut grass. On the palate, look for vanilla and salted caramel, with a moderately spiced finish showing allspice and clove.

title: Scallywag
description: As the name and Scottish fox terrier on the whimsical label suggest, this is a playful Scotch, blended from Speyside malts matured in former Sherry and Bourbon casks. The fresh scent mingles apple and vanilla. Flavors seem to tumble over one another. Smokiness leads on the palate, followed by richer notes of vanilla, rounded caramel, nutmeg, a touch of lemon cream, then campfire smoke again on the exit.

title: Johnnie Walker Gold Label Reserve
description: Packaged in a limited-edition bottle that gleams like an Oscar statuette, this ìMaster Blender's Reserveî is hard to miss. The aroma shows baked apple and a hint of smoke. Lots of caramel coats the palate at first, followed by dry leather and a malty note, finishing with a gentle waft of light smoke.

title: Big Peat
description: The name says it all: this Scotch is blended from “a shovelful” of Islay single malts, including Ardbeg, Caol Ila, Bowmore and Port Ellen—producers of some of the peatiest Scotches around. The bold iodine aroma is like breathing salt air at the seashore, and is just subtly smoky. On the palate, expect fleeting vanilla sweetness followed by a huge rush of peat smoke, which pulls back to finish with campfire s'mores and bitter chocolate notes.

title: Crown Royal XO
description: Made with a blend of more than 50 whiskies and then finished in former Cognac casks, this mellow, honey-hued sipper offers vanilla, creamy caramel and fresh apple notes, finishing moderately long with allspice and cinnamon.

title: Pig's Nose Blended Scotch Whisky
description: So named for texture ìas soft and smooth as a pig's nose,î this five-year-old whisky has a bright golden tint and mild notes that balance fruit and sweet vanilla. Add a splash of water to bring out light smokiness and still more vanilla.

title: Bastille 1789 Blended Whisky
description: Aged five to seven years in French oak, this smooth, elegant whisky offers bold, fruity aromatics, with just the faintest suggestion of smoke. On the palate, smoke is evident from the first sip, gentle but persistent, floating over vanilla and almond flavors. That long exhale of smoke continues into the fade, alongside a burst of dry cigar box spice and burnt orange peel.

title: SIA Blended Scotch Whisky
description: Relatively light and delicate, this light-gold whisky might serve as an apéritif or cocktail mixer. Look for a fresh, grassy scent and fleeting, mouthwatering notes of vanilla, tropical fruit and a brief hint of saline. A whiff of smoke breezes by on the finish, dispersing quickly.

title: Campbeltown Loch
description: This blended Scotch has a fresh, honeyed scent with a touch of white flowers. The palate is surprised by light smokiness, but beneath that expect light vanilla, honey and juicy green apple. Each sip concludes with an elegant taper of smoke.

title: Wiser's 18 Years Old
description: The longer this limited-edition whisky lingers in the glass, the richer the vanilla aroma becomes. Super-light and silky on the palate, look for vanilla, almond and warm allspice, finishing crisp. Sip or mix.

title: Johnnie Walker Black Label
description: Bright topaz in the glass, this 12-year-old blend of over 40 whiskies has a pleasant fresh apple and vanilla scent. Polished, versatile and flavorful, look for creamy caramel and vanilla accented by dried orange peel and honeysuckle.

title: Cutty Sark Prohibition Edition
description: Intended as a salute to Prohibition-era smuggler Captain William McCoy, this bold—even rugged—golden whisky has a rich honeyed aroma accented with pear. A beer-like effervescence and hoppiness surprises the palate, cutting the otherwise rich caramel and maple notes before winding into lingering touches of cigar smoke, toffee and black pepper.

title: Johnnie Walker Red Label
description: This mild-mannered, polite sipper is soft and silky, fragranced with honey and fresh pear. Flavors include vanilla and honey, relaxing into a baking-spice finish featuring nutmeg and cinnamon. Recommended for mixing.

title: Syndicate 58/6
description: Blended using a solera system—meaning old and younger whiskies are combined in the barrel—this Scotch contains small quantities of the original 1958 blend. Married and matured in former oloroso Sherry casks, this light amber whisky has a resiny quality at first sniff and sip, but soon explodes with huge, lingering notes of toffee, espresso and vanilla bean, settling into a long, spiced exit.

title: J.P. Wiser's Rye
description: Smooth, well-balanced and recommended for mixing, this rye melds almond, lemon peel and vanilla, braced up with cinnamon spice. Allow some time in the glass to slough off initial plastic-y notes in the aroma and allow more oak and vanilla to step forward.

title: Stag's Head
description: Skewing slightly sweet and boozy, consider this blended Scotch to spike desserts and cocktails. Given some time in the glass to open up, the aroma evokes vanilla, caramel and a surprising cardamom note. Meanwhile, the palate is reminiscent of sticky toffee pudding, shored up by espresso and baking spice.

title: Douglas XO
description: Golden, fresh and scented like fresh-sliced red apples, this blended Scotch shows vanilla, oak and a mild smoky astringency on the finish. The alcohol heat is evident right away, so consider a few drops of water or ice to ease the sting.

title: Pike Creek
description: This small-batch whisky is finished in Port barrels, which isn't seen often in Canadian whisky. More Port-like fruit would have been welcome; instead, the mild scent shows oak and allspice, while the palate has light brushes of caramel, brown sugar, maple and resin, finishing drying and oaky.

title: Rain City Spirits DRIP Coffee Liqueur
description: Made with local cold-brewed coffee, cane sugar and Rain City's vodka, this liqueur has a bold, authentic coffee aroma and flavor, with light sweetness and a slightly creamy mouthfeel. Just add cream for a head start on a white Russian-style cocktail.

title: Damrak Amsterdam Gin
description: Versatile and crisp, this cocktail-ready gin offers a mild lemon peel aroma and mouth-filling notes of sweet, juicy grapefruit tempered by coriander and white pepper.

title: Rain Cucumber Vodka
description: Light, fresh and just faintly sweet, this flavored vodka has spa-like notes of cucumber and lime peel. Smooth sipping, especially when chilled, and a natural for spring and summer cocktails.

title: Tequila Don Ramon Añejo
description: Soft and well-structured, this aged Tequila mixes spicy and sweet to delightful effect. Long honey notes linger on the tongue, tapering off with a welcome touch of cayenne-ginger heat. Sip straight up or pair with Mexican dishes with bold flavors.

title: Marie Brizard Orange Curaçao
description: Made with bitter orange from Haiti and Cognac, this is an orange liqueur with a darker side. It has a deep amber hue and a robust, enticing orange-peel scent. On the palate, it's appropriately thick and syrupy, bursting with orange peel and fruit, burnt orange peel, almond and vanilla. Would work particularly well in cocktails to sweeten dark spirits like aged brandy or rye whiskey.

title: Prairie Wolf Spirits DARK
description: This velvety, nut-brown craft coffee liqueur is reminiscent of sweetened coffee dosed with dried orange peel and maple. Made with Kona coffee beans roasted in Oklahoma, plus vanilla, molasses and cane sugar, it has a rounded, almost Bourbon-like alcohol feel that cuts through the sweetness for a balanced sip.

title: Skyy Vodka
description: Skyy is best known for its flavored vodkas, but this will please most unflavored vodka purists, too. Overall this vodka is neutral in aroma and flavor, with a hint of vanilla and a crisp, light finish.

title: Tanqueray London Dry Gin
description: Inside the recognizable green bottle, look for bold juniper plus notes of anise, lemon peel, and a faint white-floral touch, laced with black pepper heat. Overall, a clean, classic profile that's just the ticket for gin & tonics.

title: The Fat Trout Blended Scotch Whisky
description: Bright gold in the glass, this whisky offers vanilla and fresh-cut grass aromatics. It's similarly light and fresh on the palate, with touches of oak, vanilla and a fleeting tropical fruit note, finishing with a faint salt-air touch. The label makes this bottle a fun gift for a favorite fishing enthusiast.

title: Bols Elderflower Liqueur
description: Relatively light and delicate, this liqueur has a pale gold hue and is fragranced with white flowers and citrus. It's not overly sweet or heavy on the palate, showing subtle floral notes and a whisper of grapefruit peel. This nuanced liqueur would play well with gin or light rum in aperitif cocktails.

title: Patrón XO Café Dark Cocoa
description: Coffee and chocolate liqueur made with Patron silver tequila base. Deep brown and inky in the glass, the fruity aroma suggests blackberry sweetness. The palate echoes that blackberry note, plus honey and Concord grape, fading into dark chocolate. It doesn't taste like a coffee liqueur, but it's still pleasing. Best Buy.

title: Knight Gabriello Italian Espresso
description: A warm, gentle roasted coffee aroma leads. On the palate, this liqueur is light-bodied and chocolaty, showing cocoa and hazelnut, finishing not too sweet with hints of nutmeg and dried orange peel. Sip or mix. Best Buy.

title: Cardinal Spirits Walnut Nocino
description: This is an amaro-lover's nocino, with an herbal-vanilla scent that evokes sarsaparilla and an herbal, root-y flavor up front and a distinctly nutty richness smoothing the finish. Made with green walnuts steeped in a vodka base, sweetened with Indiana maple syrup.

title: Knight Gabriello Coffee Cream
description: This pleasing sipper has a light brown, milky appearance and mild coffee-milk flavor. Thick, creamy and palate coating, stir this cream liqueur into coffee or sip with dessert.

title: Patrón XO Café
description: This tequila-based liqueur has a sweet, mocha-like scent. On the palate, there's a definite tequila presence: Jalapeño leads into dark espresso notes and blackberry midpalate, finishing clean, with perky jalapeño heat.

title: Hoodoo Legba Reserve Chicory Liqueur
description: Savory, herbaceous and complex, this unusual barrel-aged chicory liqueur won't be for everyone. It has a dark, inky hue and a perky, herbaceous aroma. The palate is bitter and amaro-like, leading to a coffee note midpalate before finishing with mouthwatering bitter edge and barely a trace of sweetness.

title: Merlet C2 Café Liqueur
description: The robust scent of this Cognac-based liqueur suggests coffee, layered with an oddly creamy/buttery note. The palate skews herbaceous and amaro-like, has a boozy midpalate with enticing hints of dates and fig, and finishes with a buttery, almost slippery feel. Producer recommends serving topped up with soda water or tonic, in the style of currently trendy coffee tonics.

title: Di Antonio Amaretto Liqueur
description: This deep amber liqueur has a mild, sweet almond extract scent, which is echoed on the palate, plus a flicker of cinnamon on the exit. Mix into Amaretto Sours and other cocktails.

title: Evangeline's Pralines & Cream
description: It looks like creamy chocolate milk and smells like rich, concentrated almond butter. The silky, viscous liquid coats the palate with nut-butter lusciousness and cocoa, finishing long and thick. Sip or mix into coffee, Irish cream-style.

title: Kahlúa
description: Look for a sweet coffee-like aroma touched with vanilla. The concentrated, palate-coating flavor suggests very sweet coffee laced with cocoa and brown sugar richness, plus faint baking spice on the exit. Recommended for mixing into coffee or cocktails. Rum base.

title: Luxardo Espresso Italian Coffee
description: Deep brown in the glass, with a bracing, espresso-like aroma. The palate surprises with intense sweetness, bolstered by coffee and dark chocolate, while slight bitterness braces up the exit.

title: Seymour's Coffee Liqueur
description: Made with a rye spirit base with New England roasted coffee and Vermont maple syrup, this is an earthy sip, channeling espresso mixed with blackberry jam, molasses and dried oregano. It finishes very dry, mildly bitter and tannic, with a hint of unsweetened dark chocolate.

title: Dolce Nero Espresso Liqueur
description: The hue and aroma suggest strong-brewed coffee, while the palate is super-sweet, showing coffee laced with dark chocolate and zippy baking spice, finishing long. Producer recommends for espresso martinis.

title: Di Antonio Amaretto Cream
description: This liqueur has a creamy, chocolate milk-like appearance and almond extract scent. On the palate, it feels surprisingly light and silky, not overly sweet, finishing with a subtle hint of almond extract.

title: Luxardo Angioletto Hazelnut Liqueur
description: Look for a soft golden hue and lightly nutty, lightly sweet aroma and flavor. Although a resin-y note dominates the aroma and flavor at first, a pleasingly light hazelnut flavor eventually emerges, finishing long and sweet. Pair with a square of dark chocolate.

title: Lecompte Age 18 Years
description: A complex, excellent sipper. The rich aroma promises caramel, toffee and oak, which is delivered on the silky, lightly sweet palate. The finish is long, succulent and dessert-like, nuanced with cocoa, candied orange peel, apple compote, gingerbread and spice cake.

title: Père Magloire Memoire XO Calvados
description: Redolent with toffee, vanilla and dried figs, this brandy shows a flash of sweetness up front that suggests Sherry or Madeira, layered with rich caramel, dark honey and a creamy, rounded finish that flirts with cocoa and espresso.

title: Boulard XO Auguste Calvados
description: Robust and dessert-like, look for a very dark, ruddy hue and nutty scent that suggests pecans, toffee and oak. This brandy needs some time to open up in the glass, but rewards with layers of nut brittle, cocoa and espresso, finishing with a spiced, lingering fade. Packaged in a hefty, fancy bottle meant for gifting.

title: Domaine Dupont Vielle Reserve Calvados
description: This golden brandy is scented with rich vanilla and honey, plus a surprising herbaceous lilt. The bold flavor has a savory, almost meaty note at first sip, but finishes with more delicate freshness, fading into honey, white flowers and vanilla. This complex, distinctive sipper is worth getting to know.

title: Boulard XO Calvados
description: Bold, rich and rounded, this sip-worthy brandy shows plenty of maple and sweet caramel, leading into a spicy finish, with cinnamon, clove and a hint of orange peel.

title: Lecompte Secret Calvados
description: Savor this deep, dark sipper over dessert. The scent suggests cedar and oak touched with sarsaparilla and vanilla. The palate has a drying feel and starts with leather, cigar wrapper and cocoa, before rolling into a sweeter, gently warming finish edged with milk chocolate, espresso and spice.

title: Père Magloire Heritage Extra Calvados
description: Rich and fruity, with a luxe, buttery feel, this sipper shows plenty of toffee, cocoa and espresso on the nose and palate. A core of apple strudel and pear compote fades away into lip-smacking caramel, vanilla, almond and cayenne-clove sizzle.

title: Père Magloire Fine VS Calvados
description: Gentle, silky and lean, this is ideal to sip or mix. The rich scent suggests butterscotch, Sherry and dried apricot; the palate is a bit lighter, with pear, honey and butterscotch winding into a graceful, ginger-accented exit.

title: Lecompte 12 Years Old
description: Finished in port wine barrels, this Calvados has a relatively dry, bold character. Rich aromas include baked apple and caramel, with a hint of sherry. Meanwhile, the palate starts with tea, cedar and oak, rounding out to caramel and toffee on exceedingly long finish spiked with stewed apple, orange peel and nutmeg. The overall effect is lots of flavor, but not much sweetness, making for a food-friendly sip.

title: Domaine Dupont Fine Reserve Calvados
description: Pair this fresh, light sip with a cheese plate. Gentle honeysuckle, white flower and fresh pear aromas, plus a fleeting herbal tinge, are echoed on the honeyed palate, finishing with a sprinkle of cardamom and nutmeg.

title: Boulard VSOP Calvados
description: Copper penny-bright in the glass, this blend of 4- to 10-year-old brandies offers a lively scent that mixes baked apple, fresh pear, cedar and vanilla. A burst of baking spice leads the palate, smoothed by concentrated caramel, which slides into a lightly sweet finish laced with orange peel and baked apple.

title: Menorval XO Tres Vieux Calvados
description: A lighter take on Calvados, look for pear and baking spice on the nose and a dry palate marked by honey, cedar, lemon peel and almond. The finish perks up with gentle lavender, nutmeg and cayenne.

title: Domaine Dupont Hors d'Age Calvados
description: Fresh and relatively dry, the aroma entices with pear and honeysuckle. The palate is lightly spiced, layering cedar, chamomile tea and honey, plus a gentle floral echo on the finish.

title: Christian Drouin VSOP Pays d'Auge Calvados
description: Lush notes of salted butterscotch, maple and pear play against a drying core of oak; more fruit comes through on the finish. Relatively full-bodied, with a buttery, palate-coating feel.

title: Père Magloire VSOP Calvados
description: Silky and almost slick on the palate, this spicy sipper starts with vanilla, oak and a hint of orange peel, then accelerates through baking spice to hot cinnamon and cayenne. A splash of water helps moderate the alcohol heat and teases out more vanilla.

title: Kirk and Sweeney 23 Year
description: Complex, delicious and ideal as a sipping rum. The deep aroma suggests caramel, toffee and oak. The velvety-soft palate shows toffee, fudge, cocoa and oloroso Sherry, drying out the long finish with espresso, leather, clove and black pepper.

title: Starr Oak Aged Vieux Rum
description: Launched in October 2016, this lip-smacking bottling is made with rum aged up to seven years. The burnished-gold liquid offers mild brown sugar and butterscotch aromas. The buttery palate starts with oak, vanilla and cookie dough, finishing long, powerful and a bit hot, with a swirl of clove and cinnamon. Cool with an ice cube to sip or mix.

title: Don Q Signature Release 2005 Single Barrel
description: A limited edition bottling made from rum that first met the barrel in 2005, this golden spirit has a bright, fresh banana-and-honey scent. It sips smooth and silky, with lots of honey and hints of coconut and vanilla. First in a planned series of single-barrel-aged rum releases.

title: Crusoe Spiced Rum
description: This silky, particularly aromatic spiced rum is reminiscent of gingerbread, offering plenty of molasses, vanilla, allspice and nutmeg on the nose and palate. Sip or mix into tiki drinks.

title: Warship Reserved Black Strap Rum
description: This white rum is clear in the glass (“black strap” refers to the molasses from which the rum is is distilled). It has an earthy, intense scent that suggests banana, and is quite flavorful, showing lots of fruit and smooth hints of coconut and almond, plus an intriguing saline touch on the finish. Small batch; made with Fair Trade sugarcane from Paraguay, but distilled in Oregon.

title: Kirk and Sweeney 18 Year
description: A deep, dark, complex rum. Redolent of rich caramel and brown sugar on the nose and palate, toffee-like sweetness soon gives way to cocoa, clove, cigar wrapper and espresso on the drying finish. Sip over ice.

title: Wicked Dolphin Spiced Rum
description: Honey-hued and made with 100% Florida sugar, this small-batch spiced rum offers complex aromatics: vanilla, allspice, nutmeg and a surprising lemon-peel note. That citrus note sings out on the palate, accompanied by vanilla and baking spice, leading into hotter cinnamon and black pepper. Sip or mix.

title: Largo Bay Spiced Rum
description: The aroma suggests allspice and sarsaparilla, and the palate is fleetingly sweet, with dusty notes of nutmeg, allspice and vanilla bean. The long, lip-smacking finish delivers a spicy hit of clove and black pepper. Best Buy.

title: Bom Bom Coco Mochanut
description: Made with a base of Barbados rum, this dessert-like cream liqueur resembles chocolate milk and has a rich cocoa and hazelnut aroma. The viscous, palate-coating creaminess is balanced by a welcome boozy hint, winding into hazelnut, coconut and a hint of espresso.

title: The Baron Samedi Spiced Rum
description: This robust rum has a deep, ruddy hue and cola-like vanilla and allspice scent. Despite an initial flicker of brown sugar and black cherry sweetness on the palate, it quickly morphs into a relatively dry finish, with hints of leather, clove, allspice and cocoa. Sip with an ice cube to cool the alcohol heat, or mix. According to the producer, the spirit is Caribbean column still rum enhanced with Jamaican pot still rum.

title: Bumbu Rum Co.
description: Made with a blend of sugar cane “from eight different countries” in the Caribbean and South America, the bottle contains a blend of rums, some aged as long as 15 years. The end result is a maple syrup hue and fruity, peach nectar-like notes on the nose and palate. Look for a lightly sweet flavor, evoking brown sugar, vanilla, fruit and nuts, with a round, cinnamon- and ginger-laced finish.

title: Sugar Island Spiced Rum
description: Don't be fooled by the mild, almost neutral scent; this rum has plenty of flavor. Relatively sweet from the first sip, caramelized sugar, oak and allspice lead into a warming, impressively long finish marked by hazelnut, brown sugar and spice. Best Buy.

title: Sugarlands Shine Mark & Digger's Hazelnut Rum
description: A sweet treat packaged in a mason jar, “moonshine” style. The bold, superrich aroma is redolent of luscious nut butter. The hazelnut sweetness is reflected on the moderately viscous palate, laced with amaretto and a hint of dusty cocoa; a welcome flicker of alcohol heat veers it away from becoming cloying.

title: Monkey Spiced Rum
description: Made with blend of two- to three-year-old rums aged in American whiskey barrels, this rum has a particularly sweet, enticing scent, suggesting butterscotch, pecan and coconut. The palate is a bit lighter, showing coconut and oak, plus lingering buttery nuttiness in the background that winds into a mellow baking spice finish.

title: Alander Spiced Rum
description: Made with Louisiana turbinado and Florida demerara sugar, this light gold rum offers a rich, nutty aroma. The flavor profile is relatively light, with brown sugar and vanilla washing over undertones of pecan and espresso, finishing with ginger, cinnamon and clove sizzle.

title: Cruzan 9 Spiced Rum
description: Burnished gold in the glass, this rum has a mild vanilla cookie-dough scent. The silky, almost creamy palate shows concentrated vanilla up front, finishing long and relatively hot, with ginger and black pepper heat. Best Buy.

title: Kid Curry Silver Rum
description: This rum has a clear appearance and a mild coconut scent, which is echoed on the lightly sweet palate. It feels light and crisp, the mellow almond snapping into a brisk, ginger-accented finish. Small batch. Made with a blend of Virgin Islands light rum and French Indies rum, and bottled in Utah. Best Buy.

title: Twisted Path Distillery Dark Rum
description: This organic rum has a topaz hue and vanilla-forward aroma with a hint of black cherry. On the palate, that intriguing black cherry note leads, followed by vanilla, oak, and an herbaceous, sarsaparilla-like hint midpalate. A drying flurry of cayenne and clove adds up to a spicy but lip-smacking finish. Sip or mix into cocktails.

title: Humboldt Distillery Spiced Rum
description: This small batch, certified organic rum has a golden hue and earthy, honeyed scent. It's relatively viscous and palate coating, starting with a dry oak note up front and rounding out to mellow honeysuckle sweetness tinged with nutmeg and cardamom.

title: Monkey Rum With Toasted Coconut
description: Made with a blend of rums aged from six months to one year, look for a coconut scent that's echoed on the fleetingly sweet and slightly bitter palate, finishing brisk and marked by vanilla. Mix into piña coladas and other tropical drinks. The brand is backed by TV host Zane Lamprey.

title: Don Q Oak Barrel Spiced
description: Made with a three-year-old rum base, this rum has a sweet vanilla bean and baking spice scent. Hot cinnamon dominates the palate, underpinned by a core of vanilla and oak. Though it has plenty of character and bounce, it's too hot to sip straight, so plan to mix into highballs and other rum cocktails.

title: Hammock Bay Spiced Rum
description: Golden and bright in the glass, look for muted honey and vanilla aromatics and a creamy palate reminiscent of cookie dough. Vanilla dominates up front, echoed by a touch of honey and clove, cinnamon and cayenne building into the spicy finish.

title: Pierre's Texas Rum
description: Made with molasses from Texas sugar cane, then aged in former Syrah barrels and finished in Port barrels for a total age of 23 months. All this yields a deep amber hue and rich, sweet brown sugar and caramel scent. Soft on the palate and flavorful: Toffee, vanilla and oak intersperse with hints of orange peel and baking spice.

title: Lucky Oh Horchata Specialty Spirit
description: This adult take on horchata starts with a rum-like base spirit made with Colorado beet sugar (not sugar cane). Amber and cloudy in the glass, the aroma suggests spiced apple cider, and the palate is light and gently spiced, with mild hints of honey, brown sugar and baking spice. It's reminiscent of mulled cider, but it's more lightly nutty than fruity.

title: Foursquare Spiced Rum
description: Named for the oldest sugar plantation in Barbados, look for a mellow baking spice aroma. The palate is relatively dry and oaky up front, finishing light with a sprinkle of nutmeg, cassia bark and a dose of ginger heat.

title: Rondiaz Spiced Black Cherry
description: A flavored addition to the spiced rum canon, this spirit has a dark brown hue and a black cherry soda-like scent. That cherry-soda essence is echoed on the fleetingly sweet palate, accompanied by a note some will find reminiscent of cherry cough syrup. Cinnamon-clove heat builds into the finish.

title: Malahat Spirits Spiced Rum
description: Balancing sweetness and spice, this amber-orange rum leads with cinnamon aromatics. The palate is a bit sweeter, suggesting cinnamon red-hot candies, oak, and vanilla, finishing long and peppery.

title: Marauda Steelpan Rum
description: This limited production rum has an amber hue and aroma that suggests oak, banana and pineapple. Light and silky on the palate, oak takes the lead, followed by fruit (banana, coconut), winding into more confectionary vanilla and spice notes and a drying finish.

title: Providencia Fine Golden Rum
description: While the aroma offers enticing maple, brown sugar and butterscotch, the palate reads as relatively oaky and has a powerful, almost tongue-numbing, alcohol punch. Pleasing vanilla, brown sugar and allspice build into the finish.

title: 3 Howls Spiced Flavored Rum
description: Burnished gold in the glass, this rum has a sprightly cinnamon and vanilla nose. The palate feels relatively hot from the first sip, and hints at vanilla, cinnamon Red Hots candies and espresso.

title: Legacy Blended Canadian Whisky
description: This small batch whisky has a honey hue and fresh scent that evokes juicy apples and maple. Bold, oaky vanilla coats the palate, winding into bouncy clove and allspice on the finish. It finishes a bit fiery, so tame it with ginger ale in a highball.

title: Royal Thistle Blended Whisky
description: This blended Scotch has a bright orange-amber hue, mild vanilla aroma and a smooth palate that combines vanilla, allspice and oak. Consider mixing into Rusty Nails and other Scotch-based cocktails.

title: Sailor Jerry Spiced Rum
description: This rum is made in the U.S. Virgin Islands, then “perfected” (flavored) and bottled in the U.S. The end result is a bold vanilla and allspice scent and a relatively dry, oaky flavor profile that ends with a lively burst of allspice, cinnamon and clove. Excellent mixer.

title: Skyy Infusions All Natural Pineapple
description: This flavored vodka offers a bold pineapple scent, plus a sweet palate that contrasts with a bitter tinge on the finish. It suggests tropical drinks, but doesn't really deliver on the lusciousness of the aroma.

title: Fabrizia Blood Orange Liqueur
description: Lemon yellow and slightly cloudy, expect a mild lemon/orange peel scent. On the palate, a strong, sweet-tart lemon curd flavor evolves into sweeter, more rounded citrus pulp tones, plus a menthol note on the finish.

title: Limoncini Liqueur
description: This limoncello appears slightly cloudy, but very light and bright yellow. It mixes equal parts tart and sweet, with bold, zesty candied lemon peel notes and a pronounced anise note on finish.

title: Ouzo Boutari
description: Pours clear, this louches to cloudy white when ice water is added. Feels light on tongue, and the slow-building alcohol becomes quite fiery with repeated sips. The flavor profile showcases star anise and fennel, with hot black pepper on the finish.

title: Cinzano Extra Dry Vermouth
description: This light and refreshing vermouth has a soft golden hue and a scent redolent of golden raisins and honey, with a slight yeasty note. On the palate it's light and honeyed, slightly tart/citrusy around the edges, and finishes with a dried rosemary note.

title: Kirkland Tequila Silver
description: Inside the enormous bottle, this 100% agave Tequila is zesty and peppery on the nose and tongue, smoothed with honey and ending with a slight petrol note on the bracing finish.

title: Marie Brizard Watermelon Liqueur
description: Vibrant neon pink in the glass, with a juicy scent somewhere between cantaloupe and watermelon, the light but ersatz flavor seems to dissipate as soon as it hits the tongue, leaving just a trace of berry sweetness behind. Use for the unmissable, unnatural color and pleasant aroma.

title: Skyy Infusions All Natural Passion Fruit
description: This flavored vodka has an enticingly juicy, fruity aroma that translates to more of a bubblegum quality on the palate, taking a closer turn to tropical fruit on the finish. Mouthwatering.

title: Skyy Infusions All Natural Raspberry
description: For those who love berry-scented vodka-sodas, this flavored vodka delivers. It has a sweet berry aroma, though on the palate it's closer to the ersatz flavor of raspberry candy, with a bitter finish typical of many flavored vodkas and a faint but mouthwatering tartness.

title: Cavanagh Spirit Drink
description: Made with whiskey and malted barley, this hybrid “spirit drink” has a mild honey aroma and shows oak, vanilla and resin on the palate, morphing into a dry finish with notes of leather and black tea.

title: Bols Melon Liqueur
description: Vibrant neon green in the glass, with a light honeydew melon scent, this liqueur is extremely light and fleetingly sweet. Since this liqueur would add little flavor to a drink, it's best used for the unmissable, unnatural color and pleasant aroma.

title: Don Reyes Añejo Rum
description: Five years of barrel time gives this rum a soft amber hue and mild brown sugar aroma. On the palate, vanilla and oak dominate, joined by brown sugar and clove on the finish.

title: Skyy Infusions All Natural Grape
description: This flavored vodka is clear in the glass, and features a sugary berry/grape candy scent. The palate mingles bitter and ersatz sweetness, but the fruity juiciness promised by the aroma seems to be missing. Clean finish.

title: McFadden Spirit Drink
description: Essentially a flavored Irish whiskey, this “spirit drink” has a spice-forward palate showing cinnamon, clove and dusty cocoa, followed by a long wash of vanilla and maple. Appealing baked apple aroma.

title: Grays Peak Mountain Berry Flavored Vodka
description: Clear and bright in the glass, this corn-based small-batch vodka is overpowered by ersatz berry flavor that will remind many of berry-flavored cough syrup. Can be used to add aroma to cocktails.

title: Sugar Island Spiced Rum
description: Made with rum sourced from the West Indies and Barbados, then blended and bottled in California, this spiced rum has an amber hue and brown sugar and vanilla aromatics. It's sweet though oaky on the palate, finishing with a sprinkle of allspice and cinnamon. Recommended for mixing.

title: McFadden Spiced Spirit Drink
description: Essentially a spice-flavored Irish whiskey, this “spirit drink” has a honey hue and a sweet cinnamon spice nose freshened up with a touch of red apple. Each sweet sip explodes with spice—cinnamon, cayenne, black pepper, anise, clove—which completely dominates the flavor. Many will find the flavor altogether too spicy.

title: Lotus Vodka
description: Distilled from corn, then infused with guarana and ginseng, this vodka has a neutral aroma, with just the faintest citrusy whiff. The palate is almost neutral, but a fair amount of rubber/petrol flavor creeps in around the edges. Crisp finish.

title: Kirkland Vodka
description: Appropriately neutral aroma and flavor, although a distinct rubber note appears midpalate. Recommended for mixing.

title: Sōmrus The Original Indian Cream Liqueur
description: This unusual rum-based liqueur hints at exotic cardamom, almond and rosewater. It's creamy but light, and would be a palate-cleansing way to end a richly spiced meal. The ornate gold and red bottle is an eye-catcher, too. Sip it or try the producer's recommendation to serve frozen into a “kulfsicle.”

title: 300 Joules Lemon Infusion
description: Created by a cardiologist, the name refers to the units of energy used to shock a patient's heart back into rhythm. This pale yellow liqueur offers an appealing fresh lemon peel fragrance and mild lemon-curd flavor. The best feature is that it retains a light freshness.

title: Kringle Cream
description: The name isn't a Christmas reference. Rather, a kringle is a hand-rolled Danish pastry filled with fruit, nuts and spices and topped with icing. This superrich liqueur combines the flavor of the pastry with Wisconsin cream. Reminiscent of milk punch, it's creamy white, with slightly nutty, butterscotchy notes. Sub it for cream in your coffee at dessert.

title: Tolón-Tolón Macadamia Nut Cream
description: Rich and thick, this tan-hued liqueur has lots of bold nutty flavor and pleasingly creamy texture. Consider mixing with raspberry cordial for an old-school “nuts & berries” cocktail or pour over fresh berries.

title: 1921 Crema de Tequila Mexico
description: Though this cream liqueur is Tequila-based, you'd never know it. Instead, you might guess this was a smooth latte, with its tan hue and coffee-tinged aroma and flavor, finishing with just a flicker of cinnamon. Presented in a 1921 replica package.

title: Fennelly's Irish Cream
description: This whiskey-based treat looks and smells just like boozy chocolate milk. On the palate, the subtle flavor suggests mocha cut with cream. It strikes just the right balance between sweet creaminess and alcohol to cut the richness.

title: Tolón-Tolón Whisky Cream
description: Deutsch & Sons–Blue Division, White Plains, NY). Reminiscent of a peanut-butter cup in a bottle, from the chocolate milk-like appearance, aroma and flavor to the surprising—and delicious—peanut-butter note on the finish. Less surprising: it's mighty addictive.

title: Vermont Ice Maple Crème
description: Creamy and lush, but not too thick, this liqueur offers bold maple sugar aromatics, but pulls back on the palate. Easy sipping.

title: Antica Sambuca Black
description: More complex than classic Antica Sambuca, this deep purple-black liqueur has a muted flavor at first, but finishes long, full-flavored and candy-like: think Good & Plenty candies layered with dark herbal licorice. Lingering and powerful.

title: Bràulio Amaro Alpino
description: This brawny alpine amaro has found favor among high-end mixologists for its sharp, distinct pine characteristic. In the glass, it's ruddy brown, and features a dense, piny aroma spiked with mint. On the palate, it's austere, starting with notes of allspice and toffee and lots of pine mid palate, fading into a clean, slightly herbal bitterness. Use to add bracing pine flavor to cocktails or sip as a post-dinner palate cleanser.

title: Grappa Nonino Monovitigno lo Chardonnay in Barriques
description: Chardonnay lovers, take note: here's a grappa for you. With its light gold hue and fresh apple and light vanilla scent, it bears a resemblance to the undistilled wine. Despite the signature grappa heat, it's still juicy, mouthwatering and flavorful, with a pretty finish. Consider sipping this Chard-based “grappa brandy” alongside aged cheeses.

title: il Moscato di Nonino Grappa
description: Fragrant and lovely, this clear grappa offers aromas of dates and figs, lingering violet and rosewater notes on the palate, and a surprisingly soft feel for the oft-fiery grappa category.

title: Varnelli Amaro Sibilla
description: Sweetened with honey from the Sibillini Mountains, this deep-brown amaro is rich, with touches of baked fruit, honey, nuts and dark chocolate. However, a bitter streak plows right through any sweetness on the palate, leaving bountiful herbal and spicy-hot notes in its wake. Use sparingly to add aromatics to cocktails.

title: Vecchia Grappa Caffo
description: Aged in oak for 12 months, this golden grappa edges close to aged brandy territory—although one sip and that grappa heat warms all the way down. That said, this spirit offers lovely enduring vanilla notes that are laced with cinnamon spice, and a velvety feel.

title: Lemoncello Pellegrino
description: Made with Sicilian lemons and colored with saffron, this transparent yellow, bright limoncello is on the sweeter side, reading more lemon lollipop than off-the-tree fruit. A pleasing citric tartness on the mouthwatering finish helps shore things up. Serve cold.

title: Caffo Anisette di Calabria Liqueur
description: Made from Cala-brian black anise, this clear, aromatic liqueur seems almost neutral at first sip. Before long, lingering notes of warm star anise, lemon peel, menthol and black pepper emerge.

title: Sambuca Secolare Liqueur
description: Sweet and viscous, this palate-coating liqueur is like liquid licorice candy, finishing long, strong and confected. That said, it has a strong blast of alcohol heat, so plan to mix it, not to sip it straight.

title: Ramazzotti Sambuca
description: A mellow sambuca. Look for a pleasant, mild licorice aroma and perky, sweet flavor, with a surprisingly buttery feel. Try louching this sambuca with ice water, as you might absinthe, to coax out more anise flavor.

title: Averna Sambuca Liquirizia
description: This golden-hued, syrupy sambuca nicely balances vanilla sweetness and anise flavor, although it feels quite hot. Mix with coffee or into drinks calling for a more complex take on sambuca.

title: il Prosecco di Nonino Grappa
description: The aromatics are gently honeyed and slightly floral. On the palate, look for vanilla, floral notes and a warm, buttery finish.

title: Tia Maria Dark Liqueur
description: Made with Jamaican rum and Jamaican coffee but produced in Italy, this liqueur resembles coffee in appearance, aroma and flavor, though it picks up notes of dark chocolate and a touch of almond. For post-prandial sipping or cocktail use.

title: Borghetti I Vero Caffe Espresso
description: You can't help but notice the aroma of this liqueur first; it exudes strong whiffs of coffee from a foot away. It's a sweet sipper, finishing with espresso and baker's chocolate.

title: Disaronno Original
description: Many will recognize the square dimpled bottle on the back bar right away. The amber liquid inside the bottle is distinctive too, with its sweet amaretto-cookie aroma and thin, almond extract flavor, touched with vanilla and orange. It's a classic for amaretto sours or lacing coffee.

title: G.D. Vajra Barolo Chinato
description: Made with Barolo wine from the Piedmont region, this vermouth-like apéritif has a dark plum hue, lots of dark fruit and a savory spiciness that suggests dill, eucalyptus and dry cinnamon.

title: Grappa di Greco
description: This grappa has an intriguing mellow fruitiness, suggesting plums and ripe grapes, mixed with a malty note, dusty nutmeg and clove. Drink in small doses, it's still quite hot.

title: Meletti Sambuca
description: Despite the mild licorice scent, this clear, thick liqueur is surprisingly bold on the palate, showing lots of candy-like black licorice. It feels quite fiery, especially with repeated sips.

title: Averna Sambuca
description: Made using star anise, look for bold licorice aromas and flavors, like Good & Plenty candies. Like many sambucas, this one is viscous, syrupy and sweet, and retains a wallop of alcoholic heat.

title: Punzone Organic Vodka
description: Italy isn't known for vodka, but this one is distilled from organic Italian wheat. Clear and neutral, with a fleeting marshmallow sweetness, this vodka holds its own in a crowded field.

title: Averna Limoni di Sicilia
description: This vibrant yellow, slightly cloudy limoncello is surprisingly herbaceous and zesty. Despite a distracting pop of jalapeño pepper, this liqueur fades into a more familiar sweet lemon-curd finish.

title: Limoncello di Capri
description: Made using lemons from Capri and Sorrento, this lemon liqueur is slightly cloudy and vibrant yellow, with a mild but juicy lemon scent. The flavor mixes bright lemon with a resiny note, plus mouthwatering citric tartness around the edges of the tongue.

title: Caffo Grappa Italiana
description: Fierce, fruity and fiery, you might think this is southern Italy's version of moonshine, pulled right off the still. It ha a long, fruity finish and an appealingly buttery texture.

title: Bushmills Black Bush
description: This elegant, super-soft sipper is a blend of grain whiskey and malt whiskey that was finished in oloroso Sherry casks—the emphasis on the latter. The Sherry influence shows in the baked apple and dried apricot flavors that round into caramel and butterscotch tones on the finish.

title: Bushmills 16 Year Old Single Malt
description: This robust single-malt whiskey is matured in Sherry and Bourbon casks before finishing for several months in Port barrels. Look for a balanced mix of creamy caramel, maple, dried apricots, a subtle raspberry jam note and a rounded, spicy finish.

title: Midleton Barry Crockett Legacy
description: Intended as a tribute to Midleton Master Distiller Barry Crockett, this delicate, silky whiskey has a golden hue and a lovely fresh-apple scent. On the palate, apple and ripe pear meld with butterscotch and a touch of banana on the long finish. Meant for savoring straight up.

title: 2 Gingers Irish Whiskey
description: A newcomer to the marketplace, this velvety, blended Irish whiskey offers sweet, malty flavors that incorporate baked apple, honey and warm butterscotch.

title: Jameson Select Reserve Black Barrel
description: Like a liquid (if boozy) apple pie, this blended whiskey offers bold, rich aromatics, with lots of dried and stewed fruit flavors and butterscotch. The drawn-out finish incorporates touches of cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice and even a mouthwatering sprinkle of salt.

title: Tullamore D.E.W. Phoenix
description: Teasingly sweet on the palate, this easy-drinking blend has a dark gold cast and notes of honey, rich vanilla, fruit and spice. The finish is long and warming—note the high proof. It's delicious but not too precious to mix into cocktails.

title: Bushmills 21 Year Old Single Malt
description: This aged spirit shows Irish whiskey's dark side. It retains the enticing fresh-fruit aroma of younger bottlings, plus a luscious layer of butterscotch. On the palate, it's oaky and drying, with complex notes of toffee, dark chocolate, toasted nuts, caramel and a spicy finish. The whiskey is aged for a minimum of 19 years in former oloroso Sherry and Bourbon barrels, then transferred to Madeira casks for the final two years of maturation. Treat it like Scotch: add just a splash of water to open up the flavors.

title: Aqua Perfecta Raspberry Liqueur
description: The first scents reek of just-picked, ripe red raspberries; further time in the glass serves to bring out even deeper, juicier raspberry aromas and nuances. Palate entry is tart but juicy, reined in, but focused on red raspberry; the midpalate is so harmonious, so ideally integrated that it's hard to think of this solely as a liqueur. An American classic already and another benchmark from master distiller Jorg Rupf. Best Buy.

title: Macallan Fine Oak 21-Year-Old Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The early bouquet is round, biscuity, and a touch spicy; further aeration reveals a deep aroma of butterscotch, cream, vanilla, marzipan, and candied almond. The palate entry is vividly spirity as the alcohol slightly pricks the tongue; the midpalate stage displays solid flavors of dried orange rind, white raisins, marmalade, and figs. Finishes elegantly and sweet.

title: Scott's Selection Glenrothes 1973 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The opening nose is toasty, malty and dry; aeration releases deeper aromas of milk chocolate, honey, vanilla frosting and dates. The palate entry is decadently oily, creamy and spirity; at midpalate the flavor turns sweet, cocoa-like and concentrated. Concludes velvety, honeyed and downright voluptuous. I suggest a minimal addition of room temperature mineral water. A definitive Glenrothes.

title: Santa Teresa 1796 Ron Antiguo de Solera
description: The first couple of whiffs pick up toasty notes of caramel, almond butter, cotton candy and very old oak; with aeration, more profound aromas develop including saddle leather, vanilla, Sherry and dark caramel. Palate entry is perfectly balanced and sweet; by midpalate the flavor profile is honeyed, slightly cocoa-like, buttery to the feel and utterly decadent. Finishes long, layered, creamy and dark chocolate bittersweet.

title: El Tesoro de Don Felipe Anejo 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1139
description: Elegant nose emits traces of mushrooms, dried herbs and lead pencil with deeper scents of mustard seed, vanilla bean and toffee. Palate is sublimely rich with succulent, brandy/Cognac-like flavors of oak resin, almond butter and tobacco leaf. Finishes Sherry-like and smooth. One of the best Tequilas available.

title: Francis Darroze 1977 Domaine de Dupont Bas Armagnac
description: The first aromatic impressions include scents of mellow spirit, old oak and straw; time in the glass allows scents of palm oil, buttered wheat toast, popcorn and oak to develop. Palate entry is lean and agile; by midpalate, multilayered flavors of light caramel, maple, honey and sweet oak combine for a dazzling experience. Finishes sweet, svelte and zesty. Can Armagnac get any better?

title: Chivas Brothers Royal Salute 50 Year Old Blended Whisky
description: Full, biscuity aromas of light toffee and caramel bloom in the glass early on; later scents of honey, nutmeg and vanilla blend beautifully with the foundational aromas of toffee and caramel. Tastes of honey, marshmallow and cotton candy ignite the flavor profile; by midpalate, fruity elements, especially banana and guava, are added to the taste list but ultimately it's the unsweetened coconut that seduces the taste buds. Finishes well, not in a flurry of flavor but more in an unfolding.

title: Martell XO Suprème Cognac
description: Aromas are ripe and melony, then turn deep with subtle hints of walnut, butter cream, oak and marzipan—a sensational bouquet. Right from palate entry the fruit concentration is perfectly balanced by a resiny, cheesy oakiness that blossoms at midpalate along with succulent tastes of raisins, vanilla and butterscotch. Finishes stately, almost chunky. The touch of rancio in the aftertaste puts it over the top. Gorgeous.

title: Clément Rhum Vieux X.O. Rhum Agricole
description: Luscious; an intensely toasty bouquet with scents of hemp, charcoal, cigarette, paraffin, charcoal and honey. The toasty core flavor is highlighted at palate entry; the midpalate focuses on the brown sugar, honey, oaky vanilla and holiday spice qualities. Semisweet finish, with tastes of nougat, candied walnut and dark honey.

title: Mathilde Liqueur Framboise
description: Very ripe, intense aromas of fresh-off-the-vine raspberries; further aeration stimulates a trace of welcome tartness brought on by acidity that perfectly counters the concentrated ripeness. Palate entry is sweet, ripe and juicy; the midpalate is medium-bodied, ripe, sweet/sour without being jammy or overbearing. Finishes long and intensely raspberry-like.

title: Black Maple Hill 18 Year Old Kentucky Straight Rye Whiskey Cask #R66
description: Complex opening bouquet ranges from scents of burnt marshmallow to cigar box to whipping cream; air contact releases additional scents of cotton candy, candied almond, spicy grain, confectioner's sugar and maple. Palate entry is long, prickly, fruity and semisweet; at midpalate the oily, viscous taste profile surges forward, highlighting flavors of baked pear, apple crumble, toffee and butter cream. Finishes as stately as it began. A true superstar American whiskey.

title: Cabo Wabo Reposado 100% Agave Tequila
description: Aroma is herbal, with a trace of honey, then blossoms into a bouquet that's peppery, herbal, waxy, floral. Palate is medium-bodied, oily, resiny, herbal and semisweet, with balanced flavors of green pepper, red pepper, toffee and honey. Finishes gracefully.

title: Evan Williams Vintage 1994 Single Barrel Kentucky Straight Bourbon
description: A mildly peppery and spicy aroma precedes unbridled, multilayered scents of bacon fat, oak resin, buttered corn and toasted honeywheat bread. Palate entry is firm, assertive, moderately oily and grainy sweet; the midpalate flavor offers bittersweet, harmonious flavors of tobacco leaf, caramel, nougat, pine needle and sautéed almonds. Concludes sweet, moderately oily and luscious. Rivals the now-legendary 1990 vintage in presence.

title: Absolut Kurant Vodka
description: The tart, bitter black currant bouquet is stunning right from the beginning whiffs; time serves to deepen the black currant concentration to  cassis-like. Crisp, tart flavor is razor sharp and clean; at midpalate, there's an oily quality to the texture that underscores the racy, zesty, black currant flavor. Ends up ripe, fruity. Kurant is the unequivocal prototype for all berry-flavored vodkas.

title: Marie Brizard Cacao White Liqueur
description: The opening whiffs find intense aromas of metal, brass and fruit pit; aeration allows the bouquet to become more roasted, green pea- and cocoa bean-like. Palate entry is tightly-wrapped and astringent; then at midpalate the cocoa flavor detonates on the tongue and bam, it's a glorious ride to the lip-smacking, tongue-blanketing, whip-cracking finish. What a rush, what a classic!

title: Citadelle Gin
description: The first nosing passes find scents of fresh flowers, jasmine, honeysuckle, and cardamom; further aeration stimulates deeper, more herbal notes including anise, grains of paradise, and cinnamon. At the palate entry, the off-dry juniper presence is clearly evident; at midpalate the taste profile turns creamy, rich, and flowery once again. Ends up off-dry, high on juniper essence, and elegant.

title: Marquis de Montesquiou 1971 Bas Armagnac
description: The bouquet offers subtle traces of minerals/shale, dried red fruits, and white raisins with deeper aromas of white chocolate, peanut butter, lemongrass, and wool. The alcohol, acidity, and fruit components merge seamlessly at palate entry; midpalate finds flavors of dried herbs, oaky vanillin, pork sausage, dark caramel, molasses, and hard cheese-like rancio. Concludes with semisweet notes of cocoa and honey. Luscious and mature.

title: Chabot Armagnac Vintage 1959
description: The nosings pick up deep scents of old saddle leather, dark coffee, black cherry, pipe tobacco, bittersweet chocolate, plums and toffee. Palate entry is semisweet, coffee-like and concentrated; the midpalate offers decadent tastes of cocoa, marshmallow, sweet oak, and even the beginnings of rancio. Concludes stately and elegant. An Armagnac masterpiece.

title: Michter's 10-Year-Old Straight Rye Whiskey
description: The first aromas are strong, nutty, and mocha-like; further sniffings pick up deep-seeded scents of walnut, new leather, flax-fiber and soft cheese. The sweet and honeyed flavor profile bursts onto the tongue in the entry stage, then turns drier, grape seed-like, and woodier at midpalate. Ends up incredibly honeyed. A tour-de-force rye whiskey that delivers at every level.

title: Darroze 1961 Domaine de Aux Ducs Bas Armagnac
description: First sniffings discover assertive, intensely fruity aromas; offers a lovely, elegant bouquet that's moderately sweet and fruit-forward. Tart at palate entry, with supplemental tastes of lead pencil and slate; buttery/fatty rancio is displayed within the flavors of bacon fat, honey, dark caramel and oloroso Sherry. Finish is long, fatty, resiny. A brandy that's at the peak of its life cycle.

title: Darroze 1968 Domaine de Rieston Bas Armagnac
description: Bouquet has rancio written all over it, especially in the form of bacon fat/lard; other aromas include dried herbs, minerals, dark toffee, lanolin and moss. Semisweet tastes of cocoa butter and dark chocolate at entry; a concentrated, maple syrup, resiny, fatty flavor takes charge at midpalate. Aftertaste features brown sugar, old oak. Fires on all cylinders from start to finish.

title: Hangar One Fraser River Raspberry Infused Vodka
description: The bouquet rushes out from the sampling copita offering concentrated notes of fresh-picked raspberries; with time, the bouquet takes on a densely preserves-like personality.
