The entry flavor is lean, astringent and fruity; at midpalate the flavor turns vinous, leafy, off-dry to bitter, just as raspberries off the vine can be. Ends on a bittersweet note.

title: Domenis Kosher Amaro
description: Organic. Bouquet is delicate, lightly bitter and elegant and doesn't hammer one's olfactory sense into submission; there's gentle orange peel, orris root, anise, bark and angelica; the best amaro bouquet I've ever evaluated. Palate entry is mellow, semisweet, not in the least bitter and botanical; midpalate shows exceptional balance, with a taste emphasis on orange zest. Finishes gently on the tongue. Runs rings around every other amaro out there.

title: The Balvenie Thirty Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: Bouquet offers hints of mead, almonds, pencil eraser, coffee grounds, pork and old leather. Palate entry is intensely resiny, smoldering warm and waxy; at midpalate, taste explosions of honey, oloroso sherry, dark caramel, hard cheese, malted milk, and Christmas pudding treat the taste buds to an extraordinary library of flavors. Ends deliciously sweet and honeyed. The best Balvenie I've ever reviewed.

title: Evan Williams Vintage 1993 Single Barrel Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey Barrel #001
description: Opening sniffs display gentle, fruit-like sweetness; with time the bouquet grows complex, including milk chocolate, marshmallow, sugar cookies and freshly mown hay. Palate entry is concentrated, sweet, mildly oaky and medium-bodied; by midpalate, there's an embers-glow warmth, followed by woody tastes of vanilla and almond butter. Finish shows a touch of honey. One of the whiskeys that I look forward to every time it's released. Continues to be one of the finest whiskey values in the world.

title: Bowmore 1964 Bourbon Cask Single Islay Malt Scotch Whisky/Cask Strength
description: Bright, pretty honey/light topaz hue. The olfactory sense is treated to a friendly, round, grainy and supple bouquet that seems fully matured; the aromatic integration is so complete that no one quality leaps out. The inviting palate entry is honeyed and mildly sweet; at midpalate the flavor profile becomes more honey-like and grainy. Aftertaste is polite, moderately sweet, biscuity and long. My clear favorite of these three Bowmore limited editions from 1964. “Integrated” is the best term to describe this Islay beauty.

title: Germain-Robin Anno Domini 2005 Alambic Brandy
description: An initial aroma of yellow fruit and spice; after further air contact a stunning bouquet of tobacco leaf, tea leaves, burnt orange rind, combed cotton and grapefruit emerges. The palate entry is gently sweet and grapy; by midpalate the taste becomes intensely raisin-and-guava-like. Concludes with incredible finesse and tropical fruit lushness.

title: Shakers Rose Flavored Vodka
description: Exquisite pastel pink hue. Opening whiffs pick up an intense aroma of uncut red roses; aeration deepens the floral perfume and adds traces of rosewater and berries. Palate entry is delicate, floral, perfumed and off-dry; at midpalate a definite grainy sweetness enhances the rich rose-petal flavor. Finishes gently floral and clean.

title: Aspall Dry English Draft Cider
description: Bright gold color topped by a rim of silver fizz; large, splooshing bubbles. Initial nosing passes detect a fine, narrow, very tart green apple bouquet; later sniffings pick up notes of honey wheat bread and apple peel. Palate entry is light, gently effervescent and tart; midpalate stage is agile on the tongue, acceptably sour (but not biting) and refreshing. Finish is sour, apple-like and ethereal. Luscious. Serve well chilled (between 40 to 45 degrees Fahrenheit).

title: Crown Royal Special Reserve Blended Canadian Whisky
description: Aroma includes honey, sherry, dried fruit, spearmint and nougat, black tea, cocoa butter and tropical fruit. Palate offers bittersweet chocolate, brown sugar, honey-coated peanuts, melon, Sherry and nougat. A modern-day classic. Best Buy.

title: Stolen Whiskey Aged 11 Years
description: From a producer known for unusual spiced rums, here's an 11-yearold whiskey flavored with “double smoked” barrel staves. The aroma suggests brown sugar, marzipan and butterscotch. That brown sugar is echoed on the palate, along with oak and plenty of baking spice. The finish is long and a little hot, a cinnamon tingle dancing on the tip of the tongue.

title: Boondocks American Whiskey
description: This 11-yearold whiskey has a golden hue and mellow almond,  coconut and vanilla tones. It feels silky and finishes with gentle cardamom and nutmeg.

title: Old Potrero Hotaling's 16 Year Old Single Malt Rye Whiskey
description: This 100% rye American single malt offers fresh apple and pear aromas underpinned by oak. The palate flips that, leading with drying, resiny oak, with just a hint of fruity freshness wafting into the spicy black pepper finish. Limited edition; fewer than 200 bottles available.

title: Koval Single Barrel Whiskey Four Grain
description: The four grains in question: oats, malted barley, rye and wheat. The result: an amber whiskey with luscious butterscotch and caramel on nose and palate, plus a spicy clove-pepper finish. Adding water tames the alcohol heat, turns down the volume on the butterscotch and brings forward mellow hints of banana and vanilla.

title: Low Gap California Whiskey/Blended Whiskey
description: Made with a blend of corn and barley, aged for 2-plus years in small oak barrels. The end result is a pretty vanilla aroma with hints of white flowers and fresh apple. The palate is bolder and richer, with vanilla sliding into luxe butterscotch, then a fresh finish laced with cinnamon and nutmeg.

title: Sugar House Distillery 100% Malt Whisky
description: Yes, they spell it “whisky,” which makes sense when you realize this is a Scotch-inspired, small-batch American single malt, made with 100% malted whiskey, as the Scotch do, but aged in charred new American oak barrels, as Bourbon-makers do. The nose and palate are oak forward, with a core of toffee and caramel and a long, creamy finish accented with hot cinnamon.

title: Heat Wave Cinnamon Liqueur With Whiskey
description: Smells like cinnamon Red Hots or Fireball candies. The palate is very sweet, and tastes just like the aroma suggests, showing cassia bark and cayenne heat on finish.

title: Pine Barrens American Single Malt Whisky Batch No. 16
description: Distilled from beer and aged for one year in new oak casks, this small-batch whisky is bright and distinctly fruity. The aroma is mild, mixing caramel with a hint of red fruit. The plush palate shows more red fruit and black cherry, drying to cocoa, leather, oak, black pepper, cayenne and clove. Quite a bit of dilution is needed to bring down the alcohol sting, which unfortunately fades out the lovely fruit and brings a more generic vanilla profile forward.

title: Virginia Black American Whiskey
description: This high-rye Bourbon has a deep, tawny hue and a sweet scent that suggests raisins, dried figs and vanilla; it's almost like an oaky Cognac. The smooth palate shows oak and vanilla, finishing long with hints of toffee, orange peel and baking spice. A collaboration between Brent Hocking (founder of DeLeón Tequila) and recording artist Drake. Sip or mix.

title: Wyoming Whiskey Outryder
description: The rich butterscotch scent doesn't quite prepare you for the blast of alcohol heat that accompanies the very first sip of this 100-proof whiskey; underneath that, butterscotch and oak emerge on the palate. With dilution, the flavor softens to vanilla-almond flecked with cinnamon and clove. Made with rye, corn and malted barley.

title: Copperworks Distilling Company American Single Malt Whiskey
description: Lightly sweet and warming, this unusual small batch whiskey smells a bit like a bakery: cookie dough, nougat, almond, vanilla. The palate also shows almond and vanilla, backed by oak, orange peel and a hint of peach. Sip or mix. Made with “pale malted barley” and aged for 30 months.

title: Old Potrero 18th Century Whiskey
description: Aged two and a half years in lightly toasted barrels, this light amber whiskey offers an oaky nose and palate. The oak doesn't overshadow the flavor nuances, which morph from orchard fruit and pineapple to roasted grain, to a finish tinged with coffee and cardamom.

title: The One and Only Buckwheat
description: Oak and caramel lead the nose on this small-batch, buckwheat-based spirit (which technically isn't a whiskey, since buckwheat is a seed, not a grain). The palate weaves oak with caramel, vanilla, and orange peel, finishing long, creamy and warming, plus a pop of baking spice at the end. Made from 80% buckwheat and 20% grain, aged over two years.

title: Westland Garryana 1.0
description: The first thing most will notice about this American single malt is the stunningly high proof—ouch!—which shows up as spicy cayenne fire from the first sip. Adding much-needed dilution changes the flavor profile from orange and vanilla to mellower almond and coconut, with a mouthwatering clove finish.

title: Wigle Organic Wheat Whiskey/Small Cask Series
description: Bold and earthy, this opens with hints of stone fruit and herbaceous sarsaparilla. The light, silky palate offers roots- and bark-like notes, hints of orange and dried apricot, and a peppery finish. Sip or mix into amaro-laced cocktails. Made with local grains including heirloom wheat (80%), barley and rye, and aged two years.

title: Stonecutter Spirits Heritage Cask Whiskey
description: This is a high-rye bourbon aged at least four years, then finished in Cabernet barrels. The end result is a delicate honeyed aroma and a rounded palate that flashes red fruit up front, followed by coconut, vanilla and almond, finishing with prickly clove. Add a brandied cherry and you're on your way to a Manhattan.

title: Pine Barrens Cherrywood Smoked Malt American Single Malt Whisky
description: Herbaceous and hoppy, with an almost beer-like twang, this flavorful whiskey offers oak, vanilla and coconut nuttiness. Made from “heavily hopped” English-style barleywine ale, aged for one year in new oak casks.

title: Wigle Quaker Strength Whiskey
description: Inspired by oatmeal stout mash, this is a hearty, roasty whiskey, with a deep amber hue and a drying palate layered with cocoa, espresso, toffee, plenty of oak and clove. Aged 16 months in new barrels.

title: Cedar Ridge Wheat Whiskey
description: Aromas of honey, cedar and vanilla are echoed on the earthy palate on this golden small-batch wheat whiskey. The exit is smoothed by creamy honey dotted with clove and cayenne heat.

title: 3 Howls Hop Flavored Whiskey
description: Light straw in the glass, this whiskey is scented with hops, honey and resin. The silky palate offers light pineapple and tropical fruit and a hint of almond, finishing brisk with hops and a suggestion of effervescence.

title: Rock Town Arkansas Whiskey/ Flavor Grain Series Barley
description: Made with Arkansas-grown unmalted barley (91%) and malted barley aged in new charred oak barrels for 15 months, this whiskey leads with a roasted, toasty aroma and a drying palate that features deep espresso, maple, cedar and chamomile. The finish is drying and relatively hot.

title: William Wolf Peach
description: This light-gold whiskey has a pleasing peachy flavor. Just the merest hint of vanilla whispers that this is whiskey, not peach-flavored vodka.

title: Highspire Whiskey
description: Made with 100% rye grain and aged a mere four months in used red wine barrels finished with oak staves. The end result is an amber hue and an aroma that leads with oak, followed by hints of tropical fruit and vanilla. The palate leads with oak and vanilla, fading to a light finish with a hint of espresso and blaze of cayenne heat. Made by winemaker Austin Hope of Hope Family Wines (CA), at Kentucky Artisan Distillery.

title: Wigle Straight Wheat Whiskey
description: Apples, pears and a hint of oak scent this whiskey. The silky palate shows oak and caramel up front, leading into baked apple and orange peel, and finishing with fiery clove.

title: Bib & Tucker Small Batch White Whiskey
description: Clear in the glass, with pronounced corn sweetness on the nose. The palate is moderately sweet, hinting at raspberry and honeysuckle, finishing with alcohol heat. Made with 72% corn, 28% “small grains” (malt and rye), and “minimally aged in white oak for one day.” Recommended for mixing.

title: Orphan Barrel Whoop & Holler
description: The latest release in Diageo's Orphan Barrel collection is a Tennessee whiskey aged a whopping 28 years. The aroma is surprisingly fresh for a longer-aged whiskey, showing cut apple and a hint of vanilla. The palate is light and apple-y up front, but a resin flavor and sharp dryness take over midpalate. Adding water releases a bit more fruit, coconut and oak, finishing with a drying feel.

title: Boondocks Cask Strength American Whiskey
description: Usually, the pleasure of cask-strength whiskies is that extra alcohol chases extra flavor. Here, there's plenty of alcohol wallop, but the flavor is thin, showing just a bit of almond and cinnamon. Aged 11 years.

title: William Wolf Apple
description: Light gold in the glass, this apple-flavored whiskey has a fake apple-candy note on the nose and palate. The flavor is relatively thin, with just a hint of vanilla and nutmeg on the finish.

title: Penna Dutch Malt Whiskey
description: The palate is overwhelmingly woody and drying, although adding water coaxes out a dry dark chocolate note and hints of chamomile, clove and cardamom.

title: Tatoosh Whiskey
description: This is a single malt whiskey made from Oregon-grown malted barley and aged two years. The end result is a cedar scent brushed with vanilla. Cedar also leads the palate, plus an herbaceous note and coconut-laced finish.

title: Belvedere Pomarañcza Orange Flavored Vodka
description: Initial nosings pick up delightfully fruity, delicate and semisweet aromas of orange rind and pulp. Palate entry taste is fine and astringent; at midpalate, the pulpy taste carries on gracefully. Ends in a strong, zesty manner as the orange peel oils take charge. What's so winning about this clean, refreshing vodka is its sense of minimalism.

title: Bushmills Black Bush Blended Irish Whiskey/Black Label
description: Possesses a high ratio (80%+) of malt whiskey. Black Bush's racy bouquet offers aromas of toffee, cotton candy, malt mash and cream highlight. Palate entry is deep, dark caramel-like and stunningly luscious. Simply, one of the greatest whiskeys from Ireland.

title: Black Maple Hill 11 Year Old Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey Cask #300
description: Initial sniffings don't discover much; aeration and swirling rouse subtle aromas of nougat, flax, crushed almond and linseed oil. Palate entry is astonishingly delicate and sweet; at midpalate the flavor does a slow burn on the tongue as ripe, fruity tastes of baked apple, road tar, grapefruit and buttered popcorn make it all worth it. Ends banana-like and prickly on the back of the tongue.

title: Whisky Galore Bowmore 1987 16-Year-Old Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisk
description:
The initial aroma includes scents of rubber band and parchment with elegant whiffs of oaky vanilla, dark toffee, marzipan and cherry wood in the later development. The palate entry is caramel-sweet; at midpalate the taste includes chocolate, black fruit (plums, black grapes) and honey. Ends with flavors of chocolate candy bar and honey. 
Best Buy.

title: Dogfish Head Aprihop IPA brewed with real apricots
description: The aroma from start to finish suggests peaches, apricots, untreated pine, and grassy hops. The taste is keenly refreshing, tart, a touch lemony, and even meringue-like. Ends in a flurry of fruity hops and ripe but astringent flavors.

title: Cognac Toulouse-Lautrec X.O. Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Smells of light caramel, candied walnuts, baked apple, honey and vanilla. The palate entry is medium-weighted, sweet, honeyed, and a touch buttery; the midpalate stage is round, sweet like dried red fruit, and pleasantly oaky. Ends up clean, toffee-like, and smooth.

title: Marie Duffau 1973 Bas Armagnac 30-Years-Old
description: The first nosing passes detect deep scents of paraffin, linseed oil, corn oil, and salted butter; further air contact adds aromas of grapes, baked pear, sautéed almond, and dark toffee. The palate entry is semisweet, cocoa- and black-tea-like; at midpalate tastes of honey, brown sugar, and old oak are added. Ends up semisweet, honeyed and nutty. A beauty.

title: Marquis de Montesquiou 1976 Bas Armagnac
description: The first few inhalations find notes of bacon fat and coffee grinds; aeration introduces dry aromas of saddle leather, unbuttered popcorn, flax/textiles, oak, and chicory. The palate entry is long, silky, semisweet, and toffee-like; at midpalate there's a rush of maple, vanilla extract, cola nut, sap, dark caramel, and pine. Ends up semisweet, medium-bodied, marshmallowy, honeyed, and cocoa-like.

title: Caffo Limoncino dell'Isola Infused Lemon Liqueur Calabria
description: Sharp aromas of lemon peel and lemon pulp. The palate entry is very tart, lemony and juicy; at midpalate the flavor turns sweeter, though not candied. Ends up deliciously tart, zesty, and pulpy. Best Buy

title: Alexander Platinum Aqua di Vita Grappa
description: Aroma at the pour is concentrated and grapy; following aeration the bouquet turns intensely pumice-like yet clean and fresh. Palate entry is pleasingly spirity, grapy and acidic; at midpalate the ripeness of the pumice emerges as the taste turns sweeter and marshmallow or cotton candy-like. Finishes cleanly, sweet and grapy.

title: Bortolo Nardini Mandorla Almond Flavored Grappa
description: First whiffs pick up scents of almonds, marshmallows and honey; later sniffings detect aromas that accent and isolate the almond element. Palate entry is medium-bodied in weight and moderately sweet, nutty and toasty in taste; at midpalate a moderately fiery flash of spirit makes an impression. Ends up zesty, nutty, mildly sweet and clean.

title: Hardy Noces d'Or 50 Year Old Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Deep amber-bronze in color. Opening nosings pick up distant, delicately fruity and viny aromas; time in the glass allows for more expressive aromas such as pine, honeysuckle and oak to come alive. In the mouth, the sweet flavors of dark caramel, honey, oloroso Sherry, candied walnuts and spiced pears make for intriguing and beguiling tasting from palate entry through midpalate. Closes beautifully, as rich, warming tastes of tea, cedar, tobacco and honey excite the taste buds.

title: François Voyer Extra 40 Year Old Grande Champagne Cognac
description: Brilliant, new-copper-penny color. This bouquet is biscuity, fruity and off-dry, but distant; aeration works miracles, as the aroma opens up with scents of nuts, hard candy, honey, cinnamon and oak. Palate entry is polite, intensely fruity, off-dry and lip-smacking; midpalate features delicious flavors of baked pear, nectarine, white raisins and oaky vanilla. Aftertaste is long, smoldering hot, biscuity again and semisweet. A luscious Cognac that takes time to evolve.

title: Baker's 7-Year-Old Small Batch Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey Batch No. B-90-001
description: Opening nosings detect concentrated, litchi nut, deep-roasted grain scents; aroma turns baked, buttery, oaky and almost brandy-like with aeration. Palate entry is integrated, sweet, and slightly peppery; at midpalate there's a sweet oak/vanilla rush that backs off prior to the finish, leaving behind taste traces of spirity heat, vanilla extract, cake frosting, butter cream and resin. Evokes thoughts of Cognac, in particular, from the Borderies district. Best Buy.

title: Darroze 1984 Domaine de Dupont Bas Armagnac
description: Nose is animated, potent, heady and nutty; air contact encourages the woody, resiny and nutty aromas to merge into a hearty butterscotch-like feast. Palate entry is maple-like; midpalate features caramel, toasted walnut, pepper and oak. Finish is long, sinewy and mature, considering that this Armagnac is less than 20 years old.

title: Laberdolive 1970 Pillon Bas Armagnac
description: Aromas of pear, pineapple, nectarine and tobacco meld in the glass; later scents of egg cream, vanilla and bacon fat come on board with aeration. Palate entry is biscuity, spicy, semisweet; at midpalate, intense tastes of butterscotch, light caramel, marzipan, nougat and cocoa bathe the taste buds. Aftertaste is long, tobacco-like and mapley; finish shows the early makings of rancio. A keeper.

title: Don Eduardo Reposado 100% Agave Tequila NOM 1110-CRT
description: Delicate opening perfume is softly herbal and peppery; aeration opens up the aroma to include scents of steamed asparagus, cocoa bean and light toffee. Luscious, structured palate entry; at midpalate the flavor explodes to feature flavors of dark chocolate, honey, tar and uncooked vegetables. Sophisticated yet borderline feral in the mouth. A superb reposado.

title: Wild Turkey Kentucky Straight Rye Whiskey
description: Initial aroma is acutely spicy, cereal-grain sweet and a touch citrusy; following aeration the aroma takes flight as fruity/resiny scents enchant the olfactory sense. The flavor at entry is laser beam-focused, snug and concentrated; at midpalate, the flavor profile goes deeply cereal-like, almost honeyed, Sherried and intense. Concludes a tad fiery (it's 101-proof, don't forget), zesty, toffee sweet and nougat-like.

title: Vincent Van Gogh Pineapple Vodka
description: Bouquet is like freshly cut pineapple. Palate entry is sweet and fruity; by the midpalate it's the viscous texture that's as attractive as the intense pineapple flavor. Finishes sweet and fruity.

title: Three Olives Orange Vodka
description: An elegant and subtle aroma of fresh orange pulp and juice. The palate entry is pleasantly sweet and juicy; at midpalate the taste highlights the sweetish fruit, downplaying the acidic side. Concludes more astringent and tart than the midpalate phase, thus restoring the balance. Best Buy.

title: Liefmans Goudenband
description: Deep brown, tawny hue; beige foam. Warm, grainy scents at first, then nuts, toasted bread aromas. The cleanness of it refreshes the palate as sweet, biscuity flavors of dried fruit and sugary bread impress the taste buds. Aftertaste is extended, elegant and nutty.

title: Scott's Selection Ardmore 1977 Sherry Wood Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: The first nosings unearth delicate scents of sawdust and cigar box; aeration stirs little further aromas. The palate entry is mildly honeyed; at midpalate the flavor really takes shape, offering lightly toasted tastes of honey wheat bread, toasted marshmallow, sap, oloroso Sherry and vanilla. Finishes a touch honey-like. Excellent taste and finish phases.

title: Duncan Taylor Tamdhu 1969 Speyside Single Malt Scotch Whisky
description: Medium amber color. In the first whiffs a floor polish/shoe polish twang and little else is found; more aeration doesn't bring about a change. Palate entry is sweet and large; at midpalate the honey sweetness accelerates, adding chunky tastes of nut paste, pork and baked banana. Concludes sweet, agreeably fiery and intensely honeyed.

title: Montenegro Amaro
description: Displays early botanical scents of orange peel, fresh not dried coriander, red cherry, pekoe tea and cucumber. Palate entry is sweet at first then it quickly turns mildly bitter and botanical; by midpalate, there's a slight sweetness of tangerine/mandarin peel. Aftertaste is moderately bittersweet and citrusy.

title: Super Punch Jannamico Liquore
description: Owns a pleasing aroma of licorice and bark. Palate entry is surprisingly sweet and syrupy; by midpalate there's all sorts of flavors bouncing in my mouth, including root beer, maple, dark caramel, ginger, road tar, tobacco leaf and orris root. Aftertaste is long, fat and chewy.

title: Fina Estampa Reposado 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1436 CRT
description: Lovely bouquet of black pepper, sea brine, fennel, mint and dill. The palate entry is sweet, almost fruity/grainy and ideally oily; at midpalate there's a velvety feel on thetongue that underpins the briny, off-dry, salty taste. Finishes elegantly, oily, and extremely pepper- and dill-like. A terrific new reposado.

title: Dartigalongue 1954/50 Year Old Bas Armagnac “Celebration Collection”
description: The initial aroma offers integrated woody/cocoa notes; following aeration mature, resiny, off-dry oaky scents are found – no trace of rancio here. At palate entry the dry to off-dry taste is chocolaty and cocoa-like; at midpalate there's a rush of oak that passes quickly, leaving behind lush flavors of prunes, walnut butter and honey. Finishes sweet, concentrated and oaky.

title: Wyborowa Single Estate Vodka
description: Produced from 100% rye that's cultivated on one estate. Delightful spicy, tar and asphalt-like, mineral-like aroma; air contact stimulates more buttery scents including almond paste and traditional rye bread. Palate entry is clean, spicy, stone-like and off-dry; at midpalate the intensely spicy-peppery quality of the rye is highlighted. Ends in a flurry of minerals, black pepper and off-dry cereal.

title: Charbay Tahitian Vanilla Bean Rum
description: Pale yellow color reminiscent of new vintage Muscadet from France's Loire Valley. Initial sniffings detect the plump, oily presence of vanilla extract; aeration adds hints of cocoa butter, egg cream and vanilla. Palate entry is a touch sharp, but creamy and buttery; midpalate, the cream thins out and the vanilla bean element becomes leaner. Finishes bittersweet, clean and vanilla-like.

title: Talisker 1981 Rare Edition 20 Year Old Isle of Skye Single Malt Whisky Natural Cask Strength
description: Bronze/topaz color. Initial sniffings find lightly toasted, lightly salted scents of sea breeze, malt and oak; six more minutes in the glass release additional fragrances, including honey, fried bread, roasted almonds and oil. Palate entry is warming, semisweet and almost fruity; by midpalate, the taste goes slightly briny, intensely oaky and flat-out sweet. Finish is hot-wired, lively to the point of being prickly on the tongue and luscious.

title: Courvoisier XO Imperial
description: This Cognac is best with a little time in the glass to coax out maximum aromas. Look for deep, rich crème brûlée and toffee sassed up with herbal hints of sarsaparilla and horehound, plus dried fig, date and allspice on the drying fade. Packaged in signature teardrop-shaped bottle.

title: Courvoisier Cognac VS
description: This crowd-pleasing Cognac has honey and vanilla aromas, plus a touch of violet. The palate is smooth, with luscious undercurrents of vanilla and butterscotch giving way to bold dried apricot and an echo of baking spice on the finish. Sip or mix.

title: Majeste L'Empereur Cognac XO
description: The bright, lightly sweet aroma laced with vanilla, coconut, almond and dried orange peel hints at what's to come. Some sweetness is evident on the palate too, showing vanilla, almond extract and amaretto cookies, brown sugar and dried figs, finishing spicy, with a flicker of alcohol heat. Packaged in a super-weighty hourglass-shaped bottle.

title: Cognac de Collection Jean Grosperrin VSOP
description: This honey-hued brandy smells like maple-drizzled fresh pears and shows the same on the palate plus touches of cedar and sandalwood and a zetz of alcohol heat before smoothing into a maple-brushed finish.

title: Cognac Jean Fillioux XO
description: Though it appears copper penny-bright, it's relatively dark and intense, showing bitter chocolate, espresso, oak and a fleeting blackberry note, closing with clove and a drying wallop of alcohol heat.

title: Cognac Park Carte Blanche VS
description: Made with a mix of brandies aged four to eight years, this spirit offers aromas of resin, cedar and tea underpinned with dried apricot. Silky on the palate, dried fruit and tropical fruit mingles with a resiny core, finishing brisk and slightly astringent.

title: Crown Royal Hand Selected Barrel
description: One of 50 component whiskies that go into the standard Crown Royal blend, this complex, delicious sipping whisky starts out with maple and vanilla aromas that then transition into enticing notes of tropical fruit and Sherry on the palate. It finishes long, warming and spicy.

title: Lot No. 40 Canadian Rye Whiskey
description: This full-bodied blended whisky hits all the right notes, starting with plenty of rich caramel and oak tones on the nose and palate, plus touches of butterscotch, spicy cinnamon and clove. It finishes long, slightly oily and mouthfilling. Sip it straight or add a splash of sweet vermouth.

title: Crown Royal Black
description: Aged in charred barrels, this robust, nut-brown sipper has rich cocoa, toffee and caramel aromatics. It's dry and complex on the palate, with notes of toffee, espresso, cigar wrapper and leather. It finishes bold and spicy, with a burst of alcohol heat that calls for a splash of branchwater.

title: Crown Royal Reserve
description: This blended whisky, complex enough to sip, has a deep amber hue and flavors reminiscent of pecan pie. A long, smooth trail of nutty vanilla and caramel dries to espresso and a flurry of baking spice.

title: Collingwood
description: Noted for an aging process that unusually includes maple wood, this light, easy-sipping whisky is distinctly sweet and mapley on the palate. Bold vanilla and brown sugar flavors are sprinkled with baking spice accents on the drying, lip-smacking finish.

title: Crown Royal Deluxe
description: Versatile and ideal for mixing, look for light fresh apple and vanilla aromas and plenty of vanilla, oak, maple and brown sugar flavors on the palate, finishing with a moderate amount of spice.

title: Caribou Crossing Single Barrel Canadian Whisky
description: Dark honey in the glass, this whisky boasts maple and cedar aromas in the bouquet. Expect lots of spice on the palate, including clove, cinnamon, nutmeg, cayenne and black pepper, all smoothed over by a ribbon of maple and honey. It finishes big, round, buttery and mouthwatering.

title: Crown Royal Northern Harvest Rye
description: Notably soft and plush, look for pleasing hints of vanilla and marzipan alongside fleeting fresh apple and pineapple notes. It mingles together into an oaky, spicy finish, with clove and cinnamon sparks. Sip or mix.

title: Alberta Rye Dark Batch Whisky
description: This Canadian whisky is blended with high-rye Bourbon and a touch of Sherry, yielding a deep amber hue and unusual notes of herbaceous, almost amaro-like sarsaparilla and allspice. The finish shows dark notes of toffee, spicy Mexican chocolate and crème brûlée, plus a brush of alcohol heat.

title: Dillon's The White Rye
description: Made with Canadian-grown rye but without wood aging, this clear spirit has a sweet, slightly floral fragrance and shows surprisingly delicate on the palate. Notes of pear and white flowers lead into spicy hints of ginger and white pepper spice on the finish. A nice change from often-rough “white dog,” mix this well-structured white whisky into citrusy drinks.

title: Bison Ridge Special Reserve 8 Years Old
description: Golden and bright, this mellow and mild whisky has a soft core of tropical fruit accented by hints of butterscotch, lemon cream and ginger. It finishes dry, with a touch of campfire smokiness and mouthwatering saline on the exit.

title: Black Velvet Reserve
description: This maple-hued, 8-year-old whisky has a light, fruity aroma and light feel on the palate, with notes of vanilla, oak, espresso and clove. A flicker of alcohol heat creeps in on the long, drying finish.

title: Crown Royal Regal Apple
description: Amber in the glass, this flavored whisky bursts with a bold, sweet green-apple scent. Though the faux-apple flavor overwhelms, it's still soft and sweet on the palate, showing some whisky backbone. Mix with ginger ale or club soda for an easy-sipping highball.

title: Canadian Club Dock No 57 Blackberry Whisky
description: This blackberry-flavored Canadian whisky has a bright golden color and a supersweet vanilla-fruit aroma. The ersatz flavor doesn't really suggest blackberry, though it does have a nicely buttery vanilla-spice finish. Mix with ginger ale.

title: G.E. Massenez Poire-Williams Prisonnière
description: Juicy and mouthwatering, with lots of bold fruit on the palate plus a subtle flick of vanilla, this Williams pear brandy would make a lovely dessert accompaniment or after-dinner sip. Gift-worthy presentation includes a pear-shaped bottle with a whole pear imprisoned inside.

title: G.E. Massenez Poire Williams Pear Brandy
description: Bright, fresh and delicate, this Williams pear eau-de-vie offers plenty of fresh-cut pear essence on the nose and palate, finishing long and lightly sweet, with a flicker of alcohol heat. The pear flavor is pure and beautifully expressed, making this ideal as an after-dinner palate cleanser.

title: KAS Krupnikas
description: Made in the U.S., this spiced honey liqueur is modeled on a spirit often home-brewed in Lithuania and Poland, according to the producer. It looks, smells and tastes like honey, viscous but not too sticky, and finishes long, with warming vanilla and clove. Versatile for mixing, particularly with darker spirits, or a pleasant sip straight up.

title: Wolfberger Fleur de Biere Eau-de-Vie
description: Complex and herbaceous, this unusual “beer flower” spirit shows lots of bold anise in the aroma. The palate is more subtle, with the anise woven in alongside caraway, white pepper and cayenne, all accenting a hoppy zing. Consider subbing for gin or aquavit in cocktails to play up those nuanced spice notes.

title: Wolfberger Litchi
description: Styled as an apéritif, the lovely pale-pink blush suggests a glass of rosé wine. The aroma is boldly floral, like rosewater. The palate is tart, bright and mouthwatering, fading to floral on the exit. Easy drinking and light, this would be ideal topped with sparkling wine.

title: Clear Creek Distillery Eau de Vie of Mirabelle
description: Made with local Mirabelle plums, this clear eau-de-vie mixes mouthwatering stone fruit and white floral notes on the nose and palate, finishing clean and brisk. Consider as a palate cleanser or nightcap after a big meal.

title: Wolfberger Kirsch
description: Hailing from Alsace, this harmonious cherry eau-de-vie offers bold, bright and dusty cherry aroma and flavor, plus a faint floral note on the finish and appropriately bracing alcohol heat.

title: Kinsman Handcrafted Premium Texas Rakia
description: This unusual small-batch apricot brandy is made in Texas. It has a bold, delicious apricot aroma. On the palate, the stone fruit flavor is more subdued, with almond richness taking center stage and finishing with a floral touch. Pair with almond or vanilla desserts.

title: Glaser Distillery Coffee Liqueur
description: Made with locally-roasted Ethiopian coffee beans, this is a coffee liqueur for those who prefer a light hand on the sweetness. Deep, nearly opaque brown in the glass, look for a rich, mocha-like aroma and an espresso-like sip, with just a hint of rich fudge up front.

title: Maraska Slivovica
description: Off-clear in the glass, the scent of this plum brandy suggests ripe blackberries and blueberries, plus a touch of anise. On the palate, look for robust berry and dark plum flavor, leading into sparks of anise and black pepper on the finish.

title: Glenmorangie 18 Year Old Northern Highlands Single Malt Whisky
description: The initial whiffs find layers of honey, flowers and light toffee; air contact stimulates aromas of pine needle, caramel, nougat, marzipan, chocolate orange and stewed apple. The palate entry is totally dry then turns bittersweet and pork rind-like; at midpalate tastes of burnt apple crisp, orange zest, fudge and candied nuts appear. Finishes as grandly and stately as it began.

title: Baron de Lustrac 1973 Domaine de Courros 100% Folle Blanche Bas Armagnac
description: Aromas of baked apple, sweet oak, vanilla, honey, green melon, nectarine and a trace of spice. On the palate, it's medium-rich, intensely honeyed, and fruity. The deep, multilayered midpalate is succulently sweet and woody. Finishes caramel-sweet, lush and full-bodied, with just a hint of spirity heat.

title: Shakers Rye Vodka
description: Initial aroma is grainy and reminiscent of rye bread; aeration reins in the bouquet as deeper scents of gun metal, rubber pencil eraser and rye crackers appear. Palate entry is sweet and compelling; midpalate the sweetness of the grain overrides all other taste elements. Concludes sweet, biscuity and kernel-like.

title: Café Boheme Liqueur
description: Overriding scent of black coffee in the opening inhalations; aeration releases additional aromas of cocoa butter, nuts and dark chocolate. Palate entry delights the taste buds with succulent, creamy and bittersweet tastes; the midpalate highlights the cream and coffee bean components. Finishes creamy, lush, balanced and delicious.

title: Jim Beam Black 8 Year Old Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey
description: Opening nosings detect sweet notes of light caramel, toffee and yellow fruit; aeration stimulates baked, dry aromas of tobacco leaf, oak resin and breakfast cereal. Palate entry is firm, semisweet and mildly grainy; by midpalate, there's a slight oiliness to the texture that I like while the taste becomes narrowly focused on the grain/wood interplay. Finishes elegantly, emitting more dry than sweet flavors of toasted grain and oak.

title: Murray McDavid Mission Range Glenlivet 1974 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: Yellow/gold appearance. Initial sniffings reveal incredibly soft yellow fruit and flower scents, with a trace of pencil eraser; more air contact stirs up delicate aromas of malt, wood chips and wet earth. Palate entry boasts a lovely oily texture and a taste of unsweetened breakfast cereal; at midpalate, the ultra-dry flavor profile leans heavily to the malt aspect while the texture turns creamy and silky smooth.

title: Amate Blanco 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1137
description: The spirity, peppery opening aroma is a knockout with the later stage aroma highlighting piquant agave pulp, green onion, licorice/fennel and pickling brine. Initial palate entry is sweet, distinctly herbal and peppery; midpalate, the taste turns creamier and more oily. Concludes on a sweet and buttery note.

title: Herencia de Plata Silver 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1124
description: Delightful herbal/spicy aroma with deeper fragrances of green olives, twine/hemp and almonds. Palate entry is focused, dry to off-dry and bean-like; midpalate shows bitter to semisweet tastes of citrus rind, broccoli and tobacco leaf. Finish is concentrated, full-bodied and intensely herbal. Best Buy.

title: Hine 1957 Grande Champagne Cognac
description: The opening aroma is somewhat steely and minerally; further time allows the bouquet to display scents of oak, pepper, walnut and crushed flowers. The palate entry comes alive with svelte, lean and biscuity flavors; at midpalate, the flavors expand to include almond paste, dried apricot, nougat and vanilla extract. Finishes gracefully, but with a sassy final kick of spirit. A sterling example of how majestic vintage Cognac can be.

title: The Glenlivet 2003 Cellar Collection Release French Oak Finish 1983 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: Opening aromas are biscuity, marshmallow-like, grainy and semisweet; further exposure to air adds scents of oak, very light peat, tea leaves and creamery butter. At midpalate, it tastes of candied nuts, light caramel, vanilla and pine nuts keep the taste buds occupied. Finishes with a burst of vanilla and oak. Plumper than one expects The Glenlivet to be.

title: Cruzan Junkanu! Citrus Rum
description: The wonderfully piquant bouquet of citrus pulp features lemon first, then orange pulp; aeration adds hints of lime and grapefruit. Palate entry is tart, intensely citrusy; by midpalate, the acidity subsides leaving behind juicy, tart flavors of orange and lemon. Finishes properly acidic and mouth-puckering. Another winner from the world's foremost flavored rum producer, Cruzan.

title: Grand Havana Rum Reserva Excelencia Batch No. 1106
description: The opening nosing pass offers stately, classic scents of brown sugar and molasses; aeration stimulates further fragrances including honey, light toffee and maple. Palate entry is deliciously sweet and honey-like but light and agile on the tongue; by midpalate, flavors of milk chocolate and caramel emerge. Aftertaste is medium-bodied and moderately sweet.

title: Illy Espresso Liqueur
description: Whiffs find an intensely bean-like aroma that's simultaneously bitter and cocoa-like. Palate entry is startlingly bitter and intense; at the midpalate, the espresso intensity fades slightly, but definitely picks up in the cocoa-like end. An ideal topper for vanilla ice cream.

title: Duc de Loussac XO Bas Armagnac
description: Bouquet offers tight, semisweet, toffee-covered apple and wood resin fragrances. Flavor is taut, sweet and moderately oily. Finish is long, pleasingly sour, oily and engagingly nut-like. A beauty.

title: AsomBroso El Platino (Silver) 100% Agave Tequila
description: Opening nose emits zesty scents of fennel, licorice, anise and dried herbs; aeration brings out off-dry elements of milk chocolate, agave juice, olive brine, rye bread and green olive. Palate entry is peppery and astringent, then at midpalate flavors of sweet pepper and ripe agave meld. Concludes toasty and mellow.

title: Level Vodka Spirit of Absolut
description: The aroma is bittersweet, concentrated, oily/fatty and kernel-like in the first inhalations; exposure to air sees the bean/oil/fat qualities blow off, leaving behind a totally dry, clean fragrance of dry cereal. Palate entry is rich and grainy sweet; at midpalate, the taste is enhanced by an oily, viscous texture. Flavor intensity fades in the finish. A superb unflavored vodka that's going to turn lots of heads.

title: Mazama Infused Pepper Flavored Vodka
description: Piquant, intense, jalapeño/serrano pepper-like bouquet sasses right from the first nanosecond; aeration adds complexity to the zip as the core aroma highlights hot serrano peppers. Ay carrumba. Palate entry is all sweet green pepper, then midway through the midpalate the hot peppers kick in with a burst of heat that warms but doesn't char the taste buds. Finishes warm, but not overly piquant.

title: Vincent Van Gogh Melon Vodka
description: Lovely, balanced, pleasantly ripe fragrance of melon; as with all Van Gogh flavored vodkas, the key aromatic element is the underlying balance and subtlety. Palate entry is plump, viscous and reeks of ripe melon; the midpalate displays a lovely oiliness and viscosity that underpins the flavor of freshly harvested and cut melon. Concludes sweetly and mildly.

title: Knappogue Castle 1951 36 Year Old Irish Whiskey/Bottled in 1987
description: Aromas of succulent, dried fruit, oaky vanillin, marzipan, candied almond and buttercream chocolates—an altogether enticing and mature bouquet. Thankfully, not a plump, warm and fuzzy Sherry-a-thon in the taste stage; the crisp spirit keeps the taste buds engaged as the flavor shifts to the moderately candied side of the ledger. Finishes refreshing, agile and clean.

title: Camus Joséphine Pour Femme
description: Bright bronze/honey color. Opening nosings detect notes of ripe grapes, yellow raisins and mild oak followed by scents of spice, forest/cedar, tropical fruits and peppery spice which merge into an elegant and seductive bouquet. Palate entry is dry yet fruity; at midpalate layers of caramel, old oak, vanilla extract, black pepper, paraffin and black raisins enchant the taste buds.

title: The Jewel of Russia Classic Vodka
description: Scents of lightly toasted grain. The palate entry is stunningly silky and grainy sweet; at midpalate the taste profile turns sap-like and creamy with undercurrents of burning matches or seared beefsteak. Finishes creamy and rich.

title: Marie Brizard Licor de Manzana Verde Green Apple Liqueur
description: The initial nosing pass discovers ripe but tart scents of green apple; further time in the glass brings about a gentle, delicate, almost cottony/flannel sweetness. Palate entry is juicy, tart and true to the source; at midpalate there's a pleasantly acidic core flavor perfectly balancing the fruity ripeness. Ends on a softly sweet and juicy note.

title: The Dalmore Stillman's Dram Limited Edition 28-Year-Old Northern Highlands
description: A timid bouquet of breakfast cereal and marshmallow with very delicate hints of saddle leather and oats. The palate entry is sweet and malty; at midpalate the flavor displays substantial, sweet tastes of dark caramel, cream and oloroso Sherry. Concludes malty, toffee sweet with an underlying bitterness that counters the candy-like core taste.

title: Tequila Tezon Blanco 100% Agave Tequila
description: The opening aromas are deeply dill-like and almost like pickle relish; further aeration adds some notes of cream and pepper. The palate entry is nicely creamy, bittersweet, and a bit metallic; at midpalate the dry to off-dry taste profile adds bittersweet flavors of black pepper, minerals, soot and potash. Finishes smooth, creamy, metallic-tasting and peppery.

title: Cognac Toulouse-Lautrec V.S. Grande Champagne Cognac
description: The opening aroma is fresh, fruity/grapy, and slightly acidic; later sniffings uncover delicate traces of oak, black pepper, and tea leaves. The palate entry is semisweet, with melded tastes of light toffee, butter cream, and sap; midpalate finds properly astringent, if paper thin, notes of fruit acid, ripe grapes, baked pear, and pine. Finishes gracefully, toffee-sweet, and elegant. Best Buy.

title: Bottega Limoncino Sicilian Lemons and Grappa Liqueur
description: The initial aroma is sweet and pleasantly lemony; following aeration the aroma turns candied and firmly sweet. The palate entry is juicy, tart, and pleasing; at midpalate the taste profile turns a touch mineral- and metal-like, but is still delightfully citrusy. Concludes properly tart. Serve ice cold or on the rocks.

title: Caffo Sambuca Secolare Aniseed Liqueur
description: An intense, sweet aniseed aroma. The palate entry is fat, oily, and concentrated; at midpalate the taste profile turns so intensely licorice-like that there's no room for anything else. Ends up sweet, generous, oily, and thick.

title: Opal Bianca White Sambuca Liqueur
description: A pleasantly vibrant, earthy, and not overly sweet aniseed and licorice aroma. The palate is soft, sweet, and ideally aniseed-and-licorice-like. The texture is very heavy and thick. Concludes elegantly and sweet. A skilled flavoring job here.

title: Barsol Pisco Traditional Peruvian Acholado Grape Brandy
description: The palate entry is delightfully crisp, acidic, and fruity; at midpalate the taste profile focuses tightly on the blueberry-like character of the grape. Concludes fresh, fruity, and off-dry.

title: Imoya V.S.O.P. Fine Cape Alambic Brandy
description: Toasty, almond-like scents greet the olfactory sense; aeration adds delicate notes of oak, vanilla and hard cheese. The palate entry offers satisfying tastes of dark toffee, cocoa, and oak resin; the midpalate stage finds well-defined flavors of dark bittersweet chocolate, chocolate-covered cherries, butter cream and honey. Ends up very sweet, silky and oily.

title: Johnnie Walker Red Label
description: This spirit needs some time to open up, and then mild raisin and burnt-orange aromas peek through. Caramel flavors give over to a lingering smoky finish. The distiller claims that this blend is the only one created for mixing; surely it would be nice served tall, with lots of ice and ginger ale.

title: Clan Denny from Speyside
description: Honey-colored and scented, with intriguingly delicate vanilla, wispy peat and floral notes. The flavor is surprisingly citrusy, with a strong alcohol sting on the finish. Although this whisky benefits from a splash of branchwater, keep a light hand. Too much dilution, and this Scotch loses its charm.

title: Cutty Sark
description: Outside of the green glass bottle, this Speyside blend is a soft, light gold. Toffee dominates the aroma, with a little smoke and citrus mixed in. On the palate, it's sweet, light, caramelly, with a whiff of smoke on the finish, reminiscent of some Irish whiskies. Very pleasant sipping.

title: Wemyss Malts Peat Chimney
description: A pleasant mix of peated and honeyed floral aromas. Brawny, smoky flavors come barreling in right away, but dissipate after a while, leaving a gentle honey and clove finish.

title: Lonach Blended Scotch 1973
description: At first, this golden whiskey's aroma translates as spicy and slightly mezcal-like, but with a splash of water, it morphs into beautiful caramel and almond notes. On the palate, it's reminiscent of Bourbon, with lots of caramel and no smoke. This Highlands chameleon would pair well with a sticky toffee dessert.

title: Clan Denny from Islay
description: For peat-lovers only: The aroma on this light gold spirit is heavily peated and briny, not unlike breathing in cigar smoke, and there's serious smoke on the palate too. Sure, there are some delicate heather-y notes underneath, but they are barely discernable beneath this overwhelming, traditional Islay smoke bomb.

title: Douglas XO
description: Honey colored and mild. Look for a touch of sweetness, then some smoky and astringent, citrusy notes. Hot on the finish, consider adding ice water.

title: King Robert II
description: Smoky, spicy, lightly vegetal aroma, although given time to open up, more caramel notes break through. A little sweetness, a little smoke, relatively dry and clean finish. Repeated sips coax out more caramel notes. Try this in a whiskey sour-type drink.

title: Chairman's Reserve Spiced
description: So this is what all the bartenders have been talking about. Bright copper-penny color and a mulled-wine aroma rich with cloves, cassia bark, and sweet dried fruit notes. The flavor is delicately balanced, sweet and spiced but not too much of either. Ginger, cinnamon, and allspice take the leading role, not vanilla, from the first sip through to the lingering, lightly spicy finish. One of the few spiced rums worth sipping straight.

title: Sailor Jerry Spiced Rum
description: The bad boy of the spiced rum category draws on tattoo culture (look for the cute hula-girl tattoo label) and high alcohol content (north of 80 proof). Despite the sweet, almost root beer-like caramel fragrance, the mahogany liquid is brawny and dry. Look for bitter cocoa up front, cinnamon and allspice notes. A good foil for drinks with sweeter ingredients.

title: Cruzan 9 Spiced Rum
description: Rich but restrained. The light amber spirit has a warm, luxurious caramel cream scent and a fleeting sweetness on the palate that recedes quickly into a dry finish with a flurry of dark chocolate, espresso, bitter almond, black pepper and ginger notes.

title: The Kraken Black Spiced Rum
description: “Bizarre and Fierce” it says on the label, referring to the octopus-like sea creature logo. But it accurately describes this unique “black spiced” rum, too. This dry-style rum smells like allspice and cola, and tastes dark and spicy, like overdone gingerbread, with loads of vanilla, plus ginger and pepper notes on the finish. Though too intense for sipping alone, tempered with mixers like ginger ale and lime juice, it has the potential to add rich spice and intrigue in all the right places.

title: Old New Orleans Cajun Spice Rum
description: Like it hot? Made with three-year-old amber rum, this “Cajun” rum is by far the spiciest in the category. Despite the mild aroma and initial flavor, the spice really explodes on the finish, with clove, ginger and cayenne-pepper fireworks.

title: Clément Créole Shrubb
description: Though this golden spirit is made with Martinique rum and infused with Créole spices, Clément identifies it as an orange liqueur. Granted, it's sweeter than the average spiced rum, thanks to the addition of pure sugar-cane syrup. But with its perfumy orange-blossom scent, light but lingering juicy orange flavor and faint cinnamon and clove glow on the finish, it works on the sweeter side of the spiced-rum spectrum too.

title: Castaway Cove Spiced Rum
description: Maple syrup color and sweet, pleasant scent of vanilla and caramel. But it's not so sweet on the palate—instead, it shows dry cocoa and leather notes and a cola-like finish with a surprising and refreshing black-pepper zing. Made with Barbados rum.

title: Seven Tiki Spiced Rum
description: Madagascar vanilla beans yield a warm, syrupy scent and lots of creamy vanilla sweetness. This Fiji rum has a soft, viscous feel and finishes with a pleasant bitter-almond note and spicy tingle.

title: Crusoe Organic Spiced Rum
description: One of the most aromatic spiced rums, almost like gingerbread in a glass, fairly exploding with pops of allspice, nutmeg and clove. The primary and somewhat overpowering allspice flavor in Crusoe makes it a top choice for tiki drinks, which often are mixed with allspice syrup. Works best combined with fruit juices, even lemonade, rather than for sipping straight up.

title: Captain Morgan Original Spiced Rum
description: It's become fashionable to hate on the Captain, but the original in the spiced-rum category has a pronounced vanilla scent accented with clove and allspice notes. The sweet caramel flavor is one-dimensional, but it's easy to see why it's endured all these years: Mixed with Coke (or other mixers) and lots of ice, it blends right in and becomes easy sipping.

title: Brinley Gold Shipwreck Spiced Rum
description: Some spiced rums are merely colored, not aged; but this nut-brown spirit is made from a base of rum aged for four years in oak barrels. With that context, the boozy and slightly Bourbon-like toffee aroma makes perfect sense. Needs a little time in the glass to open up the flavors, but the reward is a sweet, subtly clove- and ginger-spiced spirit with a bitter almond finish.

title: Rogue Spirits Hazelnut Spice Rum
description: This unusual artisan spiced rum has a light honey color and a pungently funky, nutty fragrance. On the tongue, this spirit is warm and earthy, with a bit of baking spice on the finish, and would benefit from a bit of sweetness to smooth over the nutty funk.

title: Kilo Kai Spiced Rum
description: A maple syrup-tinged spirit with a mild vanilla-floral scent. The liquid is deeply sweet, and has a lingering floral, almost soapy aftertaste, but could work mixed into a drink when a floral effect is desired.

title: Smugglers' Notch Distillery Vodka
description: This clean, neutral vodka made from winter wheat and corn is just the ticket for those who value absolute purity in their vodka. The scent is clean and citrusy, the flavor light and smooth, with just a hint of spicy tingle on the finish.

title: Skyy Vodka
description: This flavorful, reasonably priced vodka reads almost like a light gin, from the citrusy, juniper-like scent to the zingy anise and coriander notes. It's even better with ice, which coaxes out a little more sweetness and spice. Made with American grain.

title: Napa Vodka
description: A memorable vodka with lots of swagger and a hefty price tag to match. Made from Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc grapes, it's reminiscent of an eau-de-vie, right down to the fruity scent. The crisp, extremely smooth finish (it's filtered an astounding 10 times) makes it addictively sippable, especially when chilled. Wine lovers will want to try it, though cocktailians will think twice before mixing this pricey elixir into drinks. Pair with cheeses, seafood or caviar.

title: Brandon's Vodka
description: Very sweet, cookie dough scent precedes sweet flavors on the palate, with a brisk alcohol bite and a bold, bright lemony finish. Distilled from Arkansas soft red winter wheat. Excellent choice for vodka tonics.

title: Vision Vodka
description: The wheat-based spirit gets a thumbs-up, with its light, botanical scent and pronounced milky sweetness, fading into a fresh, citrusy finish. However, the bottle design gets a thumbs-down: The extended lip around the cap collects dust, which can wind up in your drink if you're not vigilant. Nice spirit for a vodka tonic, or anything else with a little carbonation.

title: Vermont White Vodka
description: Distilled from 100% milk sugar, this clear vodka has a rich, sweet flavor that wouldn't be out of place in a white Russian. However, the alcohol zing balances out this spirit, keeping it light and versatile and lending a gently spicy finish.

title: Hangar One Vodka
description: Although overall neutral and mild, this artisanal vodka is distinguished by a faint fruitiness and a touch of sweetness on the clean, crisp finish.

title: Vermont Gold Vodka
description: Instantly recognizable: Distilled from maple sap, this vodka has a light caramel aroma and a rich, sweet, lingering butterscotch flavor. However, it's not cloying; rather, the flavor is light and teasing, and balanced out by alcohol bite. A nice base for lightly sweet cocktails.

title: COMB Vodka
description: A newcomer to the vodka market, this honey-based spirit has a lush aroma of apples and honey and a vibrant, sweet fruity flavor with a lingering honey aftertaste and a faint cinnamon sizzle. Mouthwatering. Although it was sippable at room temperature, others will prefer this vodka served tall, with lots of ice and ginger ale.

title: Grand Marnier Cuvée du Cent Cinquantenaire Triple Orange Liqueur
description: The bouquet is intense but balanced; the triple orange is the ideal companion to the old Cognac. The palate entry tastes wonderfully of orange zest, tangerine and Cognac. Ends up remarkably mellow and textured.

title: Chocoviac Cognac with natural vanilla and chocolate flavors
description: The aroma features scents of cocoa powder, cocoa butter, and vanilla extract. The palate entry is moderately chocolatey; the flavor explodes at midpalate in waves of dark chocolate and cocoa with vanilla in the background. The finish is lovely, intensely

title: Darroze 1975 Domaine de Lassis Bas Armagnac
description: Nosing passes find herbal, mineral scents. Palate entry is creamy and luscious; the midpalate stage is nutty, candy bar- and nougat-like and richly delicious. The aftertaste is extended, semisweet and textured.

title: Darroze 1973 Domaine de Coquillon Bas Armagnac
description: An assertive, mature bouquet that features potent scents of egg yolk, dark caramel, baked pear and tobacco. The palate entry is medium-bodied, off-dry to semisweet, and woody; the midpalate turns lean, resiny and turns sweeter in the finish. An idiosyncra

title: Glen Breton (Glenora) Canadian Single Malt Whisky
description: The delightful aroma features scents of spice, dried banana, cinnamon/nutmeg; ginger, egg cream, and a hint of honey. The palate entry offers a zesty, spirity warmth; by midpalate the pleasing tingle is replaced by round tastes of honey coated cereal, sweet oak, and candied almond. Finishes elegantly, smoldering warm, and resiny bittersweet. A world-class malt whisky.

title: Hiram Walker Peach Schnapps
description: Luscious, yet understated bouquet smells of juice of ripe yellow peaches; softly perfumed and off-dry. The palate entry is pleasantly peach-like, with undertones of nectarine; midpalate is silky, ripe and sweet but not cloying. Finish is superb, with a ri

title: Bruichladdich 3D Second Edition "Moine Mhor" Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: Bouquet offers scents of lapsang souchong tea, kippers, smoldering bonfire, cigar ash, seared beef roast, moss and pungent iodine. The palate entry is amazingly sooty/ashy, yet oily and sweet; the midpalate has a seductive oiliness amidst the smoke and fi

title: Père Magloire XO Calvados
description: Sports a mature aroma of dried apple crisps, cinnamon, marshmallow, parchment and old honey. Tastes of nougat, nutmeg, pastry, apple butter and cinnamon. Concludes as gracefully as it begins. One of the best Calvados one can enjoy. Sublime and sensual.

title: Laird's 12-Year-Old Rare Apple Brandy Batch No. 7
description: Smells appealingly of baked apple, nutmeg, oak, and pine. Wonderful palate entry tastes of raisins, dates, apple pastry, pineapple and maple. Finishes gracefully and assertively tart.

title: El Diamante del Cielo Reposado 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1472-CRT
description: Briny and olive-like aromas leap from the glass; further aeration stirs up keenly peppery and pickle relish-like notes. The palate entry is pleasantly sweet and ripe; at midpalate there's a charge from the spirit that warms the throat. Ends up vegetal, sa

title: Agavero El Original Licor de Tequila
description: The bouquet smells enticingly of agave, flowers, and citrus rind. The palate entry features tastes of honey, Tequila, black pepper and citrus. Finishes cleanly, with delicately sweet notes of honey and sap.

title: Fina Estampa Blanco 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1436-CRT
description: The early aroma is gloriously intense and peppery, following aeration a graceful bouquet emerges that highlights ash, green olive, asparagus and chili pepper. The palate entry is peppery and a touch mineral-like; at midpalate there are quick bursts of wet

title: Grand Marnier Cordon Rouge Triple Orange Liqueur
description: The aroma is a sweet/sour, tangerine/Mandarin orange perfume that never stops enchanting. At the palate entry the orange zest's acidity mingles gracefully with the Cognac's alcohol, making for delicious drinking. Satiny finish.

title: Hiram Walker Peppermint Schnapps
description: The piquant aroma is concentrated, candied and appropriately peppermint-like. The palate entry tastes of gently sweet peppermint candy canes; the midpalate is more herbal/vegetal, reflecting the authentic pungent and oily flavor of crushed peppermint leav

title: Kirsberry Cherry Speciality Apple Wine with Molasses and Natural Flavors
description: Smells of tart cherry. The palate entry is nicely tart and pleasantly acidic; the midpalate features a solid fruit foundation flavor that supports the tartness and freshness. Finishes clean, medium-bodied, balanced and extremely palatable. Best Buy.

title: El Diamante del Cielo Blanco 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1472-CRT
description: The opening bouquet is vegetal and peppery; following aeration the aroma becomes fiber/cottony with traces of parchment and palm oil. The initial dry tastes at palate entry remind me of fiber; at midpalate the flavor turns sweeter and more peppery. The fi

title: Duncan Taylor Miltonduff 1966 Speyside Single Malt Whisky
description: A tight and focused bouquet of concentrated grainy/malty notes with fruity/flowery scents of jasmine, pear drops, and heather. The best aspects of this malt are in the flavor which owns a biscuity, fruity palate; the midpalate stage brims with ripe, fruity tastes, especially white raisins, plums, and nectarines. Concludes in a sweet, grainy manner, with deft touches of light caramel and honey.

title: Hiram Walker Sour Apple Flavored Schnapps
description: The nose is assertive, perfumed and similar to sweet/sour apple-flavored hard candy and freshly picked, tart green apples. The palate entry is mouth-puckeringly tart, clean, and intensely green apple-like; midpalate is strikingly like green apples; refres

title: Hiram Walker Fruja Mango Exotic Fruit Liqueur
description: Delicate bouquet with fruity notes of mango, banana and a touch of spice. Palate entry is clean and properly sweet; at midpalate the solid fruit core is underpinned by a crisp acidity that retains the natural freshness of the mango. Finish is satiny in th

title: Bruichladdich 15-Year-Old Second Edition Islay Single Malt Whisky
description: The aroma includes lovely scents of honeydew melon, candle wax and fiber with notes of sawdust, ginger and pencil eraser. The palate entry is prickly/spirity, delicately fruity and oily; at midpalate the flavor focuses on malt and the wood impact, giving

title: J. Dupont XO Grande Champagne Cognac
description: The oak element dominates the bouquet which also includes aromas of dried red fruits, butterscotch, and sautéed walnuts with lesser scents of tar, ash and tobacco. The palate entry highlights the resiny taste of wood; the midpalate stage offers flavors of

title: General John Stark Vodka
description: Made from New Hampshire apples. The nose picks up delicate scents that are fruity and ripe but not necessarily sweet. The mouth entry is viscous, nicely astringent on the tongue and tastes of fruit peel. The aftertaste is dry and cleansing.

title: Prichard's Crystal Rum
description: The initial aroma is reminiscent of old fashioned cream soda pop; following aeration the bouquet turns as sweet as vanilla Coke or cotton candy. The palate entry is intensely sugary, and beany; the midpalate flavor features vanilla bean and molasses. Concludes well and smooth. An extra-sweet white rum made from molasses.

title: Hirsch Selection 12-Year-Old Canadian Rye Whisky
description: Smells of solvent/pine cleanser in the very first sniffings; shows a bit more typical whisky odor in the later whiffs as scents of cedar, maple sap, and green vegetation abound. The palate entry is sweet and full-bodied; at midpalate the taste expands to include light toffee, oak resin, and unsweetened coconut. Finishes bittersweet, spirity warm, and biscuity/wafer-like.

title: Chambord Liqueur
description: The overripe aroma is concentrated, viny/seed-like and intensely raspberry jam-like in both stages. Tastes of cassis, red raspberry syrup or, better, raspberry compote. Long, ripe, intense berry aftertaste.

title: Père Magloire VSOP Calvados
description: Smells of baked apple, baked pear, light honey and has a keen orchard fruit acidity that keeps the bouquet clean and tidy. Tastes of vanilla bean, light oak, tart red apples, pears and honey. End well on an astringent note that cleanses the palate.

title: Laird's 7-1/2 Years Old Apple Brandy
description: The aroma consists of pleasingly tart, toasty, baked apple smells and tightly wound aromas of wood resin, cedar and apple pastry. The palate entry is appropriately astringent; at midpalate tastes of apple peel, pears, pepper and wood take charge. The fini

title: Vampire Vodka
description: The appearance is, what a surprise, blood red! A dry, breakfast cereal-like bouquet of minor consequence. The palate entry is actually quite nice as the grain mash taste remains clean and dry to off-dry; the midpalate shows a pleasant, zesty spirity quali

title: Chinaco Blanco 100% Agave Tequila NOM-1127-CRT
description: The first sniffings find very delicate scents of dill, sage, and olive brine; in later whiffs a fine creaminess is discerned. The palate entry is crisply astringent and vegetal; at midpalate there is a butteriness bordering on toffee/caramel. Ends up clean, spirity, briny, and astringent.

title: pXs Sweet Yellow Passion in Excess, Passion Fruit and Cognac Liqueur
description: A charming bouquet of fresh passion fruit which veils any evidence of cognac. The palate entry is properly tart, fruity, and refreshing; the midpalate phase features the passion fruit to the hilt. Ends on a pleasantly fruity, light-bodied note.

title: Chamucos Reposado Tequila
description: Look for a soft gold hue and jalapeño zing on the aroma. The drying palate opens with a savory flash, then the long fade layers vanilla, spearmint and cinnamon. Aged 6-7 months.

title: Milagro Select Barrel Reserve Reposado Tequila
description: Pineapple aromas lead the nose. The silky palate opens with vanilla and almond, drying to a long finish marked by mint, oregano, cayenne and clove. Aged in American and French oak barrels.

title: Espanita Reposado Tequila
description: The herbaceous, bright aroma suggests basil and mint warmed by the sun. The palate is herbaceous too, hinting at bell pepper and jalapeño before winding into a coconut finish, edged with citrus peel and cinnamon sparks. Aged six months.

title: Herradura Reposado Tequila
description: The perky aroma suggests vanilla and citrus, for a lemon cream pie-like effect. The palate starts out with vanilla, coconut and waxy honey, and is perked up by citrusy acidity and hints of lemon peel in the finish.

title: Milagro Reposado Tequila
description: The sweet scent suggests vanilla and tropical fruit, with a breeze of raspberry. Meanwhile, the flavor opens with spicy, peppery zest, finishing with just a hint of vanilla sweetness and renewed black pepper sizzle.

title: Gran Dovejo Reposado Tequila
description: Look for a pale straw hue and mild, herbaceous aroma. The soft palate opens with lychee and tropical fruit before drying to pepper, clove and cayenne on the mouthwatering finish.

title: Blue Nectar Reposado Special Craft Tequila
description: This reposado Tequila is infused with spiced essential oils and hint of agave nectar. Look for a sunny marigold hue and zesty jalapeño aroma. Fleeting sweetness on the palate gives way to verdant green pepper and fresh-snipped herbs, trailing off into an elongated finish brushed with coconut, maple, cinnamon and white pepper. Sip or mix.

title: Tapatio Reposado Tequila
description: Very pale in the glass, with almost no color at all, this offers a herbaceous scent of green bell pepper and fresh basil. The palate is very dry, with mineral notes and a wild hint of rubber leading into the peppery exhale. Aged eight months in used Jim Beam barrels.

title: Chinaco Reposado Tequila
description: The distinctly fruity aroma mixes cooked pear and pineapple, while black pepper tickles the nose. The palate is fruity and lightly sweet, evolving from fresh pear to a honeyed cooked fruit note on the exhale, plus cinnamon and spearmint tingle.

title: Patron Roca Reposado Tequila
description: A sweet, almost raspberry-like scent in the aroma is echoed on the palate, translating as delicate lychee and berry. Creamy vanilla and coconut tones smooth out the otherwise fiery, cinnamon-accented finish.

title: Cazadores Reposado Tequila
description: Floral, lightly honeyed aromas lead the way. The palate echoes that floral freshness, veering to a zesty midpalate with a hint of tomato, then finishing with light vanilla and black pepper tones.

title: Excellia Reposado Tequila
description: Burnished gold in the glass, look for a zesty, savory scent layered with vanilla sweetness. The palate opens with more vanilla, reserving the savory notes for the exit: bell pepper, oregano, black pepper. Aged six to 12 months in former Cognac and Grand Cru Sauternes barrels.

title: Pueblo Viejo Reposado Tequila
description: The rose-gold tinge and luscious vanilla scent entice on the nose. The palate is vanilla-forward, brushed with almond and coconut, then finishes with a lemony, gingery burst.

title: Lunazul Reposado Tequila
description: Dried herb aromas lead the way, edged with lemon and agave. The complex palate offers a vanilla tone that leads to a spicy finish embellished by cayenne, jalapeño and black pepper sparks.

title: Arta Reposado Tequila
description: A lightly sweet vanilla aroma entices. The palate feels very light, almost effervescent, and opens tart and citrusy, finishing with complex hints of bell pepper, graphite and a luxe wash of vanilla and almond. Aged 11 months.

title: Hornitos Cristalino Tequila
description: New to the U.S. market as of fall 2017, this is añejo Tequila with the color stripped out and sweetener added—a part of the growing Tequila sub-category popular in Mexico, but which hasn't really taken off in the U.S. yet. Clear in the glass, look for a mix of coconut and banana taffy sweetness, fading into a smooth, vanilla-accented finish warmed by a hint of white pepper.

title: Corazón Reposado Tequila
description: The honeyed aroma, which tilts toward caramel richness, suggests what is to come. The plush, robust palate delivers plenty of concentrated caramel and vanilla bean, finishing with a drying hint of espresso and clove. Aged 6–8 months.

title: Arette Clasica Reposado Tequila
description: This golden Tequila offers a slightly fruity aroma, which is echoed more boldly on the buttery palate as a burst of tropical fruit. The finish is drying and slightly funky, with flickers of ginger and white pepper.

title: Código 1530 Reposado
description: A mild whiff of tropical fruit leads the nose. The palate is light and mildly sweet with a trace of coconut, finishing peppery, crisp and a bit fiery. Aged for six months in former Napa Cabernet barrels.

title: El Tesoro Reposado Tequila
description: Pale straw in the glass, this reposado Tequila has a savory, herb-tinged aroma that suggests jalapeño, bell pepper and mint. The persistently peppery palate finishes with mint and basil freshness.

title: Bonollo Grappa of Amarone Barrique
description: This tawny grappa offers dried apricot and golden raisin aromas. The silky, complex palate echoes those dried-fruit notes, adding layers of Sherry, vanilla and spice, finishing long and enticing. Ideal as a post-prandial sipper. Distilled from the grapes used in Amarone and aged 18 months in small oak casks.

title: Bottega Grappa Fumé
description: Made from a base of grapes used in Prosecco, this golden brandy offers fresh pear, banana and almond aromas. Honey leads the palate, finishing feather-light with cinnamon spice and a teasing floral lilt. Palate-cleansing and pleasurable to sip.

title: Alexander Exquisite Grappa
description: Golden in the glass, this grappa shows aromas of waxy honey and fresh orchard fruit. Delicate flavors of sweet coconut lead to mellow honey and tropical fruit on the palate, perked up by a minty tingle on the finish. Valpolicella base.

title: Il Grigio da San Felice Grappa
description: A light vanilla scent is echoed on the palate along with gentle hints of banana, coconut and custard, developing into a clove- and cayenne-accented finish. Pair alongside a fruit dessert. Base pomace from Chianti Classico.

title: Gra'it Vera Grappa Italiana
description: Made from a blend of seven grappas, this is light straw in hue with aromas that hint at fresh pear. The silky palate opens on gentle vanilla and coconut flavors that are layered over white-flower and additional pear tones, finishing on a sweet cinnamon note.

title: Nardini Grappa Riserva
description: Mild aromas of tropical fruit lead the nose, while the soft palate shows mellow apple blossom lightly fading into sweet coconut and ginger.

title: Bottega Maestri Grappa Invecchiata da Prosecco
description: This grappa, aged for 12 months in oak barrels, has a honey hue and a distinctly sweet vanilla aroma. The buttery palate echoes that sweetness, combined with mild hints of fresh apple, leading to a cookie dough-like finish. This bottling is “Dedicated to the Masters of Arts and Culture” and is showcased in a perfume-like flask.

title: Grappa di Franciacorta Barricata
description: This burnished-gold grappa offers ripe, slightly funky pineapple, coconut and vanilla aromas. The palate shows waxy honey, ripe tropical fruit, banana taffy and lychee, while the finish is clean, with a fleeting clove note and a final brush of honey. Made from the grapes used to make Franciacorta sparkling wine—Pinot Nero, Chardonnay and Pinot Bianco—and aged for 1 year in former sherry casks.

title: Castello Banfi Poggio Alle Mura Grappa Riserva
description: Bright marigold in hue, the nose offers cedar, pear and butterscotch aromas. An initial raw quality recedes with time to open up and gives way to honey and tropical fruit on the slick palate. The finish is long, but a bit fiery, with a ginger tingle escalating into searing cayenne. Made from a Brunello di Montalcino base.

title: Po' di Poli Morbida Grappa
description: Made from a Moscato base, the nose mixes a distinctly fruity aroma that suggests fresh strawberries with a grassy note. The palate is mildly sweet and fruity, echoing the fresh-berry aromas, finishing with dusty cinnamon, cayenne and a burst of alcohol heat.

title: Goral Vodka
description: This is made from winter wheat distilled seven times, then filtered seven times through an elaborate line-up of materials including activated carbon and diamond. The result is a vodka with hints of chalk on the nose and citrusy palate, a slightly effervescent feel and a clean, brisk exit.

title: DSP 162 CA Vaccinium Macrocarpon Cranberry Flavored
description: A most unusual and complex flavored vodka, almost like a cocktail in a bottle, this evolves with every sip. The hue is bright, clear cranberry and the aroma is juicy and berry-like, with an oxidized herb note in the back reminiscent of some amaros. On the palate, it starts out as juicy and fruit-forward, but reveals a confusing cayenne spiciness midpalate, finishing dry and with a fleeting floral delicacy.

title: Duckworth Vodka
description: Distilled from sugarcane, this small-batch “sipping vodka” has a light scent that suggests almond extract. On the palate, the flavor leans toward vanilla, accented with anise and ginger heat. Made by winemaker Lee Foster Fuqua as a tribute to his grandfather H.E. Duckworth.

title: Vodka 80
description: From upstart craft distiller Marble Distilling, this is a small-batch, pot-distilled vodka made from a blend of Colorado soft white wheat and malted barley, filtered through crushed Yule marble. The result is a rounded, robust vodka with plenty of fruitiness. Look for lychee and dragonfruit notes, with a mild rosewater lilt and a black-pepper finish.

title: Voo Vodka
description: This grain-based vodka is brisk and robust. Neutral overall, it has just a hint of almond sweetness and a warming finish with nutmeg and baking-spice accents.

title: BleuStorm
description: This wheat-based vodka shows pronounced sweetness in the aroma and flavor, suggesting marshmallow and vanilla, with a long, languorous fade. It's packaged in a heavy, hourglass-shaped bottle.

title: Elation Hemp Flavored Vodka
description: This unique grain-based vodka is flavored with Swiss hemp blossoms and contains no THC. The aroma suggests cedar and grapefruit peel. These flavors are echoed on the palate, along with nutmeg and a lingering note reminiscent of hoppy beer. It finishes slightly woody and drying. It's an interesting novelty product sure to attract attention.

title: Blue Label Vodka
description: This grain-based spirit is mostly neutral, with a touch of sweetness and a mild saline note on the crisp finish.

title: Seattle Distilling Vodka
description: Described by the producer as “Old World Style,” this small-batch vodka, made with Washington-grown hard red winter wheat, is deliberately unfiltered. It has a slightly resiny scent, while the palate shows fleeting sweetness and light notes of banana and resin, finishing relatively smooth.

title: Frey Ranch Estate Distillery Vodka
description: Distilled from wheat, corn, rye and barley, this vodka has a mild anise fragrance and a savory tinge to the palate. The light-bodied spirit has a surprisingly herbal flavor, like dried basil, and segues from savory to anise sweetness on the finish, with a kick of alcohol heat on the end.

title: Praga Vodka
description: Made from winter wheat, this offers a neutral aroma and silky sweetness on the palate, rounding to an earthy, moderately hot finish.

title: Spike Vodka
